apologie romane church may ſeeme preface progreſſe thereof haue deſerued maieſties moſt fauorable acceptance diuerſe preface whereof maieſtie ſaluted thoſe due almoſt proper attribute epiſtle ahorum nonum omittant • index belg • ud iunium pag 164 named commanded ſuch like aſcriptions blotted publike peremptorineſſe theſe apologiſts may ſeeme ingenuous dealing checke controll except thought haue vttered voice temporum potiùs quàm hominum concerning progreſſe although apologie farre abſoluteneſſe publiſher thereof pretendeth iudgeth ſome thing demonſtratiuely vnanſwerable romaniſts likewiſe conceiue yet notwithſtanding whatſoeuer argument ſingular moment vſed volume romiſh doctours colourable accordance ſoeuer hath proceeded pen learned proteſtant appeared anie degree aduantagious vnto roman cauſe ſeemeth herein haue bene collected vrged reinforced againſt v ſingular choiſe matter ponderous weight cōſequence exact exquiſite method ſtyle together ſober temper ſpeech diligence iudgement wit art moderation could eaſily performe ſeene forthwith reuerend carefull religious metropolitane commanded certaine number diuines hand employ ſtudies perfecting ſatisfiable reply accordingly bene ſufficiently accompliſhed heate common ſickneſſe importunate occurrence hindered indeuours time burthen occaſions better ſorting yet choiſe chance fall vpon weakest vnworthieſt thoſe party aſsigned notwithſtanding due peruſall apologie length vndergo vpon preſumption ſingular dexterity ſelfe confidence god would enable hereunto minimis maximus often chooſing weake thing confound ſtrong ſo alſo vpon experience diuerſe romiſh doctor would hand ready lend herein beſt ſupport kind aſsiſtance learned aduerſaries apologiſts themſelues epiſtle dedicatory maieſtie haue layd downe greateſt reaſon ſatisfaction accordingly admit held excellent point phyſicke ex vipera theriacum turne poiſon antidote againſt poiſon god accounted high degree vengeance turne preſidence writing againſt ſome aduerſaries aug pſal 3 • although deuided bodie ſaith yet confeſsing one head chriſt let v deplore brother ceaſſe call brother whether ſo long ſay ovr father inuocation tenour letter followeth worſhipfull doctor morton deane gloceſter theſe deliuered ſpeed poſſible worſhipfull maiſter doctor haue met good chance booke ſend incloſed take another edition booke vnderſtand anſwering cauſe make ſo much ſpeed ſend leſt ſhould haue committed ſome ouerſights diſcouered may tend great diſgrace vſe due preuention ſeemeth eaſie matter ſatisfie iudicious reader author exact quoteth owne author extant cannot denied ſhould anſwer directly runne ſo pertinent diſcourſes feare credit • little ſtained wiſh well chiefe deſire truth may diſcouered ſuch important affaire theſe wherefore ſure helpe ſet forward elſe ſuppreſſe bookes impoſe ſilence ſelfe glad heare beſt reſolutions euer reſt louing friend roger brereley anſwer receiued letter without date brought maieſtie credible maiſter roger brereley ſhould onely chance happen vpon ſo famous apologie vntill almoſt yeare printed shall thinke could better correſpondence betweene theſe two brother informed ſelfe tell pray colour loyaltie denieth oath allegeance ſecond pag 18 indeed excuſed ſaying caluine king command thing god berea • e themſelues authoritie ſhewing meant thereby abſolutely king ſo far onely commanded thing againſt god ſuch caſe man god muſt obeyed ſay vnworthie morton iudgement learning ſtill ſtand former promiſe vtterly abandon caluine iudgement expoſition word euincible place idone • erant viſion • • tae cui reuelation • multas alias conformes adducit dionyſius carthuſianus dialogo de iudicio peculiart art 31 greg l 4 dial ca 36 bellarm lib 2 de purgat cap 7 § quantum bellarmine witneſſeth diſcouered infernall place wherein dwelt ſoules ſuffered paine c like ſtories vnto publiſhed dionyſius carthuſianus gregorie giuing credit vnto fancy theſe kindes whereupon ieſuits haue paſſed cenſure firſt cardinall non eſt improbabile talem aliquem locum repe • iri etſi enim ibi nulla ſit poena ſenſus eſt tamen poena damni poena autem non conuenit niſi animae quae nondum plene purgata eſt itaque erit locus ille mitiſsimum purgatorium carcer quaſi ſenatorius atque honoratus bellar ibid § videtur bellarmine improbable ſaith ſome ſuch pleaſant honourable priſon ieſuit hae reuelationes bedae carthuſiani niſi metaphoram aliquam contineant mihi non faciunt fidem suarez ieſ tom 4 thom diſp 46 § 4 num 9 § 1 num 12 13 suares except theſe reuelations beda carthuſian ſaith metaphorically interpreted cannot beleeue ſpea • eth ſtorie bede carthuſianus whereunto dialogue gregorie ſaith bellarmine conſonant nay whoſoeuer ſhall reade dialogue ſhall perceiue bellarmine honour iudgement gregorie repeating could diſhonour beleeuing certaine theſe reuelations aboue named author hiſtorically related wiſhed ieſuit metaphorically interpreted wherein may perceiue new doctrine concerning reſidence ſoules diſcouered intelligence walking ghoſts whereunto bede carthuſian gregory yeeld full aſſent notwithſtanding cardinall bellarmine dare beleeue onely probabilitie ieſuit dare beleeue literall ſence 35 apologiſts would reſolue vpon caſe may pertinently demaunded ſay vnto gregorie vnto ſucceſſor peter keyes priſons purgatorie committed therfore iudgement caſe ſoules muſt eſteemed infallible ſhall excuſe theſe owne doctor haue either fully beleeued elſe fully beleeued ſuch conceit ſhall iuſtifie theſe author may enuie proteſtants like libertie diſſenting opinion gregorie 36 laſtly principall cauſe romaniſts haue ſet vp fornace purgatorie fire cauſed burne furiouſly hell poena illa quae luenda reſtat poſt culpae remiſsionem eſt illa ipſa poena ſenſus quam peccator pati debuiſſet gehenna rem • • ſolum aeternitate bellarm lib 4 de poenit cap 1 § quod ſi except onely eternall tormenting ſeruants god catholica ſententia eſt purgatorium eſſe pro ijs tantùm qui cum venialibus culpis moriuntur pro ijs qui cum reatu poenae culpis tam remiſsis bellarm lib 2 de purgat cap 1 fine vel propter ſatisfactionem pro mortalibus remiſsis non plenè expletam ibid lib 1 cap 3 § hine veniall ſinne point lay thus ground doctrine wit catholici ſummo conſenſu docent poſt remiſſam culpam ſaepè manere reatum poenae temporalis bellarm fewell flame 37 theſe premiſes rightly pondered namely proofe doctrine diuine scripture haue bene tortured teſtimonies father peruerted amongſt romiſh doctrine obtained neither generalitie profeſſion certaintie faith laſt yea chiefeſt hold reuelations great motiue vnto gregory credo ſpirits dead ancient father haue bene iudged ſometimes damnable alwaies dangerous experience diuerſe romaniſts hath alſo cōfirmed ſome iudging gregory credulous ſuch fancy forbidding v follow ſuch reproouable ſpeculations laſtly himſelfe challenging v accord vnto fundamentall hold primitiue faith profeſſed ſaying nullus fuit indulgentiarum vſus roffe • ſan art 18 luther vſe primitiue church afterwards coeperunt indulgentiae po •• q • ad pa • gatorij cruciatus aliquandiu trepidatum eſt idem ibid feare purgatory hatched indulgence thirdly bonifacius oct •• u primus p • rgatorium extendit indulgentias agrippa de vanit scient cap 61 firſt extended indulgence vnto purgatory anno dom 1300 pope boniface eight fourthly ob 1 inſtitutum indulgentiarum • em nouam eſſe cuius neque scriptura neque veterum ſcriptis ante alexandrum tertium memoria extat id • ue quoſdam ſcholaſticos alios catholicos conſiteri quinimo neque gratianum decret neque sentent qui abhinc annis circiter 40 • ſcripſerunt mentionem indulgentiarum feciſſe reſpondeo • em q indulgentiarum • riptura veterum ſcriptis contineri vt oſtendimus quamuis non ita expreſſè ipſum indulgentiae nomen et quod non • ta apertè frequentèr ſpecie re etiam ipſa indulgentiarum à veteribus commemoretur cauſa fuit vſus poenitentiae ſeue • ioris quae temporibus illis mult • vigebat ita vt non eſſet magnopere neceſſarium beneficio indulgentiarum vti poſte • verò decreſcente illo • eruore poenitentiae illarum vſus increbeſcere coepit gratianus autem magiſter ſatis eſſe putârunt de ipſa authoritate remittendi peccata agere ad quam indulgentia tanquam vnus q particularis vſus • ius reuocatur prae • ertim cùm ante ipſorum tempora non fuerit e mil 22 agreeable auguſtine taught ſuffering redeemer herein diſtinguiſhed ſufferings others becauſe chriſt ſuffered without ſinne men ſuffer ſinne one ſentence agreeable vnto auguſtine ſaying chriſtus ſuſcipiendo poenam non ſuſcipiendo culpam culpam deleuit poenam ser 13 de verbis dom • 4 pag 1846 chriſt ſuſtaining puniſhment without guilt cancell guilt puniſhment able alone ouerthrow whole frame indulgence towards dead ſatisfactions liuing becauſe romiſh foundation doctrine onely thinke indulgentia eſt relaxatio poenae temporalis poſt remiſſam culpam debitae gregor valent ieſo god remitteth guilt ſuch purgatory yet exacteth temporall puniſhment thus much concerning one man ſatisfaction behalfe others 48 leſt obiectors may word satisfaction intend alſo satisfaction haue man confeſſion performe himſelfe vnto man chriſtians hold neceſſary vnto god therefore againe aduiſe gregorie indeed requireth man hath confeſſed ſinnes ſhould tertia ſpecies id eſt vindicta quaſi medicina neceſſaria eſt vt apoſtema reatus quod conuerſione compungitur confitendo purgetur afflictioniſue medicina ſanetur tum namque benè conuerſum peccatorem cernimus dum digna afflictionis auſteritate delere nititur quod loquendo confitetur greg l 6 15 cap 1 reg cap 24 282 take reuenge himſelfe penitentiall exerciſes comparing ſinfull condition man impoſtume cure whereof contrition ſorow firſt pricking lancing ſore confeſsion venting putrified corruption cleanſing wound laſtly reuenges taken vpon ſelues voluntary ſatisfactions weeping fasting prayer almes meanes onely intreating pardon eating dead fleſh finall perfect healing impoſtume breake forth confirme legall onely medicinall ſatisfaction whereby ſinner better diſpoſed repentance made capable grace meritorious cauſe thereof contrariwiſe cardinall poſſumus aliquo modo ex proptijs ad aequalitatem ac per hoc iuſtè ex cōdigno ſatisfacere bellar lib 4 de poenit cap 7 § illud tamen bellarmine thus defineth ſome ſort ſaith owne act whereby may ſatisfie according meaſure equalitie merit condignitie doctrine farre degenerate ancient faith gregorie iuſtus aduocatus noſter iuſtos no defendet iudicio quia noſmetipſos cognoſcimus accuſamus iniuſtos non ergo fletibus non actibus noſtris ſed aduocati noſtri allegatione confidamus greg ezec homil 7 fine profeſſed iuſt men defended iuſt aduocate chriſt ieſus becauſe accuſe themſelues confeſſe vniuſt therefore haue confidence owne teares act interceſsion christ conclude therefore although act repentance mortification may called satisfaction way complacency acceptance grace fauour god delighteth ſuch incenſe fruit repentāce yet ſo farre nature vertue condigne merite proper ſatisfaction onely owne see ſection num 47 lit b doctor louaine haue generally denied act man properly ſatisfactorie gregorie alſo hath iudged man beſt action daſ •• mulands ſunt quae exterius fauent reprimenda quae interius perſtrepunt declinanda quae quaſi neceſſaria inuoluunt paratiores ſiant greg moral lib 8 cap 23 fol 51 sanctus autem vir qui omne virtutis noſtrae meritum vitium eſſe conſpicit ſi ab interno abitro diſtrictè iudicetur rectè ſubiungit ſi voluerit aſcenſion sauiour heauen learned practiſed firſt conuerts vnto faith chriſtianitie duium eſſet id ludaei • praecipere occaſio daretur gentibus putandi ſibi exhibitos multos deos pro multitudine deorum quos relinquebant quantum ad verbo ore traditam doctrinam non eſt dubium quin eccleſijs apoſtoli eam tradiderint salmeron ieſ 1 tim 2 diſp 8 § poſtremò bene ſaith ieſuit offenſiue vnto iewes occaſion error vnto conuerted gentile yet euen time many ſoules bleſſed saint owne doctrine enter chriſt king glorie thoſe euerlaſting doores bleſſedneſſe need therefore greatly mooued contrarie doctrine gregorie owne doctor haue noted haue bene much addicted vnto ſuperſtitions neuertheleſſe finde verie rarely praier vnto saint ſo vnto virgin marie one may coniecture would haue pretermitted conſtantly belieued beſſed virgine according romane faith conſtituta eſt b virgo ſuper omnem creaturam quicunq • e leſu curuat genu matri quoque pronus ſupplicat filij gloriam cum matre non tam communē iudico gregorie herein reprehenſion gregorie vſed againſt serenus biſhop maſsilia breaking downe picture ſaw abuſed idolatrie perlatum eſt ad no quod inconſiderato zelo ſuccenſus sanctorū imago ſub hac quaſi excuſatione ne adorari debuiſlent confregeris et quidem q • ia ca adotari •• tui •• e omnino lauda •• mu • fregiſſe vero reprehendi •• aliud eſt enim picturam ador • aliud per picturae hiſtoriam quid ſit adorandum addiſcere nam quod legentibus scriptura hoc idiotis praeſtat pictura cernentibus greg lib 〈…〉 9 indi • • though well ſaith gregorie vnto biſhop forbidding adoration yet inconſiderate zeale breake downe thoſe hiſtoricall picture ſet vp onely inſtruction ignorant adoration ſee de pictutis quae fuctir men ſententia romanae • ccleſiae adhucaetate gregorij ſatis ex eius ſcriptis manifeſtum eſt videlicet ideò haben picturas non quidem vt colantur adorentur ſed vt imperitipicturis inſpiciendis haud aliter ac literis legendis rerum geſtarum admonerentur ad pietatem incitarentur caſſander lib conſult art 21 de cu • tu imag § de imaginibus pag 155 coloniae 15 • 7 church rome day gregorie learned caſſander witneſſeth gregorie owne see aboue letter 2 againe si quis facere imago voluerit minimè prohibe adorare verò imago omnibus modis deuit • sed hoc ſollicitè admoneas vt ex viſione rei geſtae ardorem compunctioni • percipiant adoratione ſolius trimtatis humiliter proſternatur id • ibid aliud eſt picturam adorare aliud per picturae hiſtoriam quid ſit adorandum addiſcere greg lib 9 epiſt cap 9 writing ſhew allow ſuch picture hiſtoricall monument whereby vnlearned might put remembrance thing done caſe ſuffered worſhip little differeth doctrine proteſtants owne learned opinio caluim eſt imago non eſſe ſimpliciter prohibitas ſed tantum luſtoricum vſum adni •• tit b • llar lib 2 de • ccleſ triumph cap 8 10 cardinal may witneſſe ſaying euen maſter caluine doth ſimply condemne hauing image admitteth onely hiſtoricall vſe end thereby repreſent act chriſt holy saint worſhip 52 neuertheleſſe ſuffering image broken ſo publike generall idolatry committed ſeemed vnto oſiander although direct yet occaſionable approouing idolatry rather cloaking thereof himſelfe account worſhip idolatrie hath appeared vtterly abhorred abhomination thereof howbeit bene requiſite kept rule ſucceſſor pope si nonnulli ex praedeceſſo • ibus noſtris fecerunt aliqua quae illo tempore potuerunt eſſe ſine culpa poſtea vertuntur errorem ſuperſtitionem ſine tarditate aliqua cum magna authoritate à poſteris deſtruantur stephan papa apud grat diſt 63 c • p quia ſancta stephen preſcribed ſuch like caſes humane inuentions wit anceſtors ſaith haue done thing afterwards turned ſuperſtition aboliſhed without delay alſo onely remedie ancient councell doctrine ancient schoole haue late qualified terme bellarm lib 2 de imag cap 21 22 imago chriſti sanctorum venerandae ſunt non ſolum per accider • impropriè ſed etiam perſe propriè ita vt iplae terminent venerationem vt ſe con ſide • antur non ſolùm vt vicem gerunt exemplaris improperly ſuch ſubtle ſort ſeeing learned ſcarce able vnfold myſterie people muſt need deeply plunged idolatrous conceit cauſe diuerſe owne doctor haue complained sunt benè multi rudiores qui imago colunt non vt ſigna ſed perindè quaſi ipſae ſenſum habeant magiſue eis fidunt quàm chriſto polydor virgil inuent lib 6 cap 13 verie many ruder ſort worſhip image idolatrouſly manifeſtius hoc eſt quám vt • ultis verbis explicari poſſit caſſander conſult art 21 matter notorious ſaith another denied dici non poteſt quantum ſuperſtitio ne dicam idololatria pencs rudem indoctam plebem alatur imaginibus conniuentibus ad iſta ſacerdotibus hinc non pa • uum lucri quaeſtum percipi • ntibus agrippa de vanit ſcient cap 57 • otherwiſe already ſaid ieſuite conſtans eſt theologorum ſententia imaginem eodem honore cultu honorari quo colitur id cuius eſt imago et idem vid ••• r ſignificare concilium tridentinum azorius ieſ inſtit mor lib 9 cap 6 § tota haec ſo great idolatrie ſaith third ſo ſtill nouriſhed image wonderfull ſay abuſe image true therefore ſhould reforme according vnto wiſedome ancient father reade imaginum cultum non modò noſtrae religionis expertes ſed teſte hieronymo omnes ferè veteres ſancti patres damnabant ob metum idololatriae quâ nullum execrabilius ſcelus eſſe poteſt polydor virgil lib 6 inuent cap 13 vice condemned worſhip image euen feare idolatrie moſt execrable vice nothing elſe verie iealouſie god ſhould deterre v cannot permit holy one ſo much incline vnto worſhip whereby may appeale vnto biſhop rome dioceſſe biſhops ouer ſet patriarke conſtitution de perſona stephani hoc attendendum eſt quia nec inuitus ad iudiciſ • trahi nec ab epiſcopis alieni concilij debuit iudicari ſicut nouellarſi traditio loquitur • enim c siautem à clerico aut laico quocunque aditio contra epiſcopum fiat propter quamcun que cauſam apud ſanctiſſimum eius metropolitanum ſecundùm ſanctas regulas noſtras leges cauſ • iudicetur et ſi quis iudicatis contradixer ad beatiſſ archiepiſcopum patriarcham dioeceſis illius cauſa referatur ille ſecundùm canones leges huic finem praebeat contra haec ſi dictum fuerit quod nec metropolitanum habuit nec patriarcham dicendū eſt quòd à ſede apoſtolica quae omnium eccleſiarum caput eſt cauſa audienda dirimenda eſt greg lib 11 epiſt 56 edit rom 1591 nouel iuſtinian praetere à ſiqui eiuſdem synodi religioſiſſimi epiſcopi aliquam intra ſe controuerſiam habeant ſiue de iure eccleſiaſtico ſiue de quibuſdam alijs rebus priús metropolitanus ipſorum cum alijs duobus de synodo epiſcopis rem diiudicato et niſi vtr aque par iudicatis inſiſtat tunc beatiſſ patriarcha illius dioeceſeos audientiam ipſis commodato illa definito quae eccleſiaſticis canonibus legibus concinunt neutrâ parte ſententiae eius contradicere queunte 2 sed et ſi á clerico aut quocunque alio contra epiſcopum quacunque de cauſa fiat interpellatio primùm religioſill metropolitanus ſecundùm canones ſacros noſtras leges cauſam dijudicato si quis iudicaus reclamet cauſa ad beatiſſ illius dioeceſeos archiepiſcopum patriarcham defertor ille ſecundùm canones leges huic finem adhibeto 3 quod ſi contra metropolitanum iſtiuſmodi interpellatio procedat ſiue ab epiſcopo ſiue à clerico aut quacunque alia perſona dioeceſeos illius patriarcha ſimili ratione rem diſcepta • nouel 123 § si qui gregory doth acknowledge allow whoſoeuer therefore reſpect either conſonancy ſtorie ſynceritie gregory muſt conclude owne learned cardinal cuſaenus booke written concord church confeſſeth without accedat authoritas concil tridentini seſſ 24 quo dicitur lex eccleſiaſtica valen ieſ quo ſup coelibatus iure apoſtolico annexus eſt sacerdotibus bellar quo ſuprà cap 19 lege planè apoſtolicâ valent quo ſupra cap 3 confuted owne old aquinas cardinall laſt councel concluding vow continency annexed vnto order prieſthood onely poſitiue law man owne iudgements mutable albeit vntruly terme apoſtolicall ancient gratian hath rightly diſcerned copuli sacerdotalis nec legals nec euangelicâ vel apoſtolicà authoritate prohibetur eccleſiaſticâ tamen lege interdicitur gratian cauſ 26 q 2 sors mariage prieſts prohibited either legall euangelicall yet apoſtolicall authoritie eccleſiaſticall onely learned iuſtifie contrarie cuſtom primitiue church wherein confeſſe multis annorum centenarijs poſt apoſtolos eccleſia primitiua defectu coelibum sacerdotes habuit maritos epiſcopus eſpenc com tit cap 1 many hundred yeares apostle reaſon want others priest married proue alſo example de maritis • eccleſiae miniſterium eligendis non tantoperè quidam reluctantur cùm ea re exemplum habeat priſcae eccleſiae • b • entanbus omnibus eccleſijs hucuſque ſeruetur cùm re pleriſque ita comparatae ſint primitiue church eſpecially eaſterne part thereof euen vntill day caſe ſo ſtanding oftentimes vt con • ugum p • arum conſortio non modò ad functiones eccleſiaſticas non impediantur ſed etiam ad earum procurationem adiuuentur ab ijs quemadmodum de gregorio patre matre monia gregorius nazianzenus teſtatur caſſander lib conſult art 23 non nocuit tibi progeny non obſtitit vxor legitimo coniuncta thoro c—baptiſta mantuan ſpeaking h • larie coniugall ſocietie might thought rather helpe hinderance vnto order romaniſt notwithſtanding thinketh ſtate matrimonie leſſe conuenient ſelfe yet doth confirme aſſertion negari non poteſt vtriuſque teſtamenti scripturam sacerdotibus vxores permitte • e conſtat apoſtolos ipſos pa • ci exceptis vxoratos fu • ſle nec reperiri quòd chriſtus poſt eorum vocationem eos ſeparati mandauerit—l • quet denique primitiua eccleſia coniugia sacerdotum tam orientali quàm occident • h eccleſia vſque ad tempus prohibitionis per pap calixtum factae vbique libera licitafuiſſe—e contrà tamen nomini dubium eſt matrimoniu • eiuſque vſum minus conuenre c • iber gallicus qui inſcribitur actes du conc de trente e • l • 1562 printed anno 1607 actano little paphnutius confeſſor magno ſuaſit concilio ne talem coelibatus legem poneret gra • em aſſ • rens eſſe cauſam quae au • ipſis clericis aut corum coniugibus occaſio fornicationis exiſteret▪ quam paphnutij ſententiam nicaena synodus vtique laudauit nihil ex hac parte ſanciuit ſed hoc vniuſcuiuſque voluntate non neceſſitate permiſit n • ſi tempore oblationis quo sacerdotibus à ſuarum complexu vxorum abſtinendum erat vt tempore vicis ſuae templo habitarent ne cum vxoribus ſuis ſub id tempus carnale exercerent conſortium ibid little after—teſtantur eccl • ſiaſt • cae hiſto • ae adam praesbyterum factum duxiſſe vxorem eccleſiae plu •• num profuiſſe eupſychium • ò caeſa • en • em presbyterum qui nuper vxorem duxerat adhuc ſponſus erat martyrio ſunctum eſſe ibid old new teſtament example apoſtles themſelues councell nice doth fully appeare eccleſiaſticall socrates lib 1 cap 8 • z lib 1 cap 22 hiſtories giuing liberty cleargie ordination enter ſtate certainty whereof romaniſts opinion ſcribit—de quibuſdam virginibus quae poſt • quàm ſe deo dicauerunt cum malcul • cubare repertae fuetant quod • le ex fide chriſto dicauerunt pudice caſte ſine vlla fabula perſeuerent ita fortes ſtabiles praemia virginitatis expectent ſi autem perſeuerarc nolunt vel non p •• lunt mcliu • eſt vt nubant quam vt ignem delictis ſuis cadant cyprian ſpeaking virgin votary ouertaken folly ſaith votum continentiae eun • erant quod quam vctuſtun ſit imò ab apoſtolorum aetate • ccleſia vſitatum deo fauente ibi demonſtrabi • u alludere autem mihi videtur ad locum pauli de fide prima qu • irritam feciſſe dicit quaſdam vidua 1 timoth 5 melius eſt nubant quam c atqui loqui cyprianum de ijs virginibus quae ſimplex vti loqu • tur votum caſt • tati emiſerant non de velatis quarum votum erat ſolenne de conc neocaeſar tom 1 thouſand yeares ago fornicating priest owne author obſerueth ſharply puniſhed entred contract marriage yet ſaith ſcarce one thouſand free former vice leauen old phariſaiſme tollet ieſ inſtruct sacerdot de voto azor ieſ inſtitut moral de voto part 1 bellar lib 2 de monach cap 34 moſt ieſuits grant contract mariage firme inuiolable ſay ſolemne publike vow made vnto church miſt errour maldonat • hath ſaid vow religious promiſe made vnto god reſpect god difference betweene ſimple ſolemne ſhould church make difference ſuch particular caſes wherein ſimple vow partie made knowne church cauſe ſame reſpect god doubtleſſe iudgement church behalfe god ſhou • ſame diſcernable abſolute reſtraint ſolemne vow god elſe could reuocation ſimple vow thought inuiolable error inuolued notorious obſeruer principle practiſes eſt regula generalis ex • u • e naturali diuino colle •• vt votum minoris boni relaxetur per votum ſpeaking de voto ſolenm maioris • oni quare cùm poſſit aliquando occurtere huiulmodi bonum multò marus quàm eſt ſeruare caſtitatem non dubium eſt quin tunc ipſa eccleſia aut nomine totius eccleſiae papa poſſit declarare eum hoc calu non teneri ad obſeruationem voti quod credendum eſt feciſle papam cum illo rege aragonum poloniae maldonat ieſ sum q 12 art 7 generall rule vow leſſe good may altered changed vow better good denying si alicui magi expediet ſtatus talis quám religio quia nimis eſt incontinens tunc votum obligaret quia illi materia eſt melior tollet ieſ inſtruct sacerd lib 4 cap 17 pag 4 • 9 although ſpo • en de voto ſimplici yet ſhould hold ſolenni ſeeing may thought moſt true followeth▪ viz vow marriage better good vnto partie incontinent solo iure eccleſiaſtico matrimonium irritum eſſe quod poſt votum ſolenne contrahitur vt tenent scotus paludan 4 sent diſt 38 caiet 2 2 q 88 art 7 omnis ſchola iuriſconſultorum vt refert panorinitan cap ku • ſus bellar lib 2 de mona • h cap 34 § scotus others adding vniuerſall conſent canoniſts matrimonie made euen ſolemne vow infringed broken law god onely law church fully confirmeth vnto v former poſition law god better votarie incontinent marrie burne match firme inuiolable conclude relaxation ſuch kind vowes owne pope haue ratified common nonnulli eccleſiaſtici iuris eccleſiaſtici interpretes docuerunt poſſe eccleſiam diſpenſare ijs qui fecerunt • olenne votum ca •• itatis vt contrahant matrimonia ſed qui hoc • cunt vid • ntu • mihi habere maiorem rationem exemplorum quorundam rom pontiſicum quàm scriptu • aeſacrae nam quae theologia diceret eccleſiam poſſe diſpenſare iure naturali diuino—nec papa nec tora eccleſia poteſt diſpentare—in voto ſolenni ſed per interpretationem aequi boni declaret eum qui fecerat votum non teneri voto maldonat ieſ sum q 12 art 7 interpretation may ſtop mouthes condemne ſuch marriage themſelues violable diſſolued hitherto haue proued impietie romiſh doctrine teſtimonies father owne contradictorie poſitions publike practiſes pope laſt queſtion remaineth whether ſtate proteſtants romaniſts ſafe doctrine libertie marriage clergie reſolued manifold grieuous complaint learned aduerſaries sect 36 77 poſition etiamſi c coſterus ieſ ſee aboue § 35 letter • although abrogation law marriage many ſacrilegious abuſes ſhould hindered yet therefore law diſanulled cometh due place confuted ordinarie guiſe reproach wedlocke band miniſters ſparing call church reſpect miſerū ſeculum vxora • theologi minerua innupta sacrob • ſ • aduerſ whittach de scrip •• ect pag 142 adde cum tamen whittakerus tam gratus minerua miſerable turca caſtimoniam à ſacris perſonis exigit diſt •• ct • ſſime myſtae caluiniſtarum turba protectiſſima libi line nec verentur ipſa adyta templorum ſtupris coinquina • e matrimonio ſuis againſt marriage miniſters finde booke cenſurae parſons conuerſions almoſt euery pamphlet deteſtable law god euen miniſters goſpell hath bene confeſſed hallowed honoured eſteeme common vncleane may ſeeme argument exceeding ſanctitie onely vnto ſuch know retained amongſt temedie auoide fornication deſperate diſeaſe euen po • lut onem deſiderare ad vitandas carnis tentationes quibus diu affligitur non eſlet peccatum ſecundum nauar cap 16 num 6 quae opinio magi mihi placet c tollet ieſ lib 5 inſtruct sacerd cap 13 § primo poſition ſo execrable tranſlated 78 howſoeuer clamour againſt v may eaſily repreſſed complaint owne ſober diuines againſt themſelues ſhall need pleade owne cauſe deprecation may ſerue iuſtification thus one fatendum eſt grauiter à poſteris peccatum eſſe qui coelibatus legem pro tempore vtilem multis laqueum verterunt cùm iuuenes nondùm ſibi exploratos temer • ad miniſterium eccleſiaſticum admiſerunt cum illi caſtitatis onus ſibi unpar eſſe ſen • rent illi potiùs impuros quoſdam concubitus diſſimulârunt quodammodo probarunt quàm vt permittendo conſtitutionis illius humanae grauam illis ſacerent qui eam ſine offenſione diuinae legis obſeruate non poterant—quare nimi • rigid huius conſtitutionis exactione abhominanda eccleſia ſcandala exti • ſſe videmus cùm tamen legis illius cau • ae non ſolu • n h • diè ceſlârunt ſed etiam contrarium conuerſae ſunt—cùm • n • fl • gitio feneſtra aperta eſſe videatur—vndè debet eccleſia facere ſicut bonus medicus vt ſi medicina experi •• tià decente magi obſit quám profit eam tollat—idue requirit eccleſiae ſtatus cùm plerique homines docti pij ad continentia obſeruationem aſtringere ſe nolunt infirn itatis ſuae conſcij—quo fit vt pau • iſſimi adoleſcentes pietatis indole praediti ad theologiae ſtudium ſe adiungant—quare ſi vnquam tempus fuit antiquae conſuetudinis immutandae cert • haec tempora immutationem aliquam efflagitare videntur—vt ſummum caſtitatis gradum aſcendere qui non poſſint ſecundo caſti con • ugij gradu conſiſtere permittantur caſſander conſult art 23 biſhops later time ſaith haue offended turning law ſingle life ſnare ſoules yong nouices rather willing conceale filthy commixtions alter humane conſtitutions rigorous exacting law haue occaſioned moſt abhominable ſcandals church wherefore euer certes theſe day change law may thought neceſſarie ſecond 〈◊〉 perpendat horum temporum ſtatum quàm innumeri ſint monachi public • inceſti impudici fortaſſis iudicabit magi expedire vt ti qui protſus non continent ius fiat public •• • imonij—sed etiam atque etiam vereor ne cenſus ecleſiaſti • caſtrent cle • co verius quàm pieta eraſm •• annot 1 tim 3 pag 533 ſhall conſider condition time innumerable monk ſame ſpeaketh alſo prieſts liue inceſt filthineſſe wil peraduenture thinke conuenient allow marriage third credo pro bono ſalute eſſe animarum quòd ſi eſlet ſalubre ſtatutum vt volentes poſſint contrahere quia experientià docente contrarius prorſus effectus • equitur ex illa lege continentiae cùm hodiè non viuant ſpiritualiter nec ſunt mundi ſed maculantur illicito co • tu cum eorum grauiſſimo peccato vbi cum propria vxore eſlet caſtitas panor de cl • ric con • ug cap cùm olim pa • ormitanus ſenſ • ſle videtur vtile eſle ſi coniugium sace • dotibus permittatur bellar lib 1 de cleric cap 19 § primus autem panormitane addeth deberet eccleſia facere ſicut bonus medicus vt ſi medicina experientia docente ponus officit q • àm profit eam tollat vtinam idem eſſet omnibus conſtitutionibus poſitis vt ſaltem obligarent quoad poenam non quoad culpam nam ita creu • runt ſtatuta poſitiua vt vix repetiantur aliqui qui non corruperint vitam ſuam panor •• ta • cap cum olim de cleric coniugat num 4 thinke behouefull ſaith ſoules many might permitted marrie becauſe find experience law ſingle life hath brought forth contrarie effect ſeeing theſe day defile themſelues ſinne might liue chaſtly owne wiues church ſhould diſcharge part good phyſitian experience findeth one medicine rather hurt help remoueth applieth another fourth cùm natura noſtra bodie fragilis ſit imitatrix vitiorū—pauciue reperiantur qui carnis ſtimulum non ſentiant igne poſiti non ardeant fit ue talis concupiſcentiae ignis ex deſcens vſque ad perditionem hinc eſt quod euſebius de dionyſio corintho epiſcopo ſenbit • empe quòd admonuent pymtum epiſcopum ne ille coelibatus onus tanquam neceſſanū fratribus unponeret ſed infirmitatis rationem haberet—quodſi eccleſia vnquam cauſam habuit permattendi clen •• ci ſecularibus coniugiū certe infoelici hoc noſtro carnali ſeculo neceſſitatem idipium expoſcere vtilitatem ſuadere videtur conſtat enim proh dolor inter quinquaginta plures catholicos etiam sacerdotes vix vnum reperin qui caſtum praeſter coelibatum ſed omnes ſ • rè neglectis • e • ecus ſaluberrimis ſacrorum conciliorum conſtitutionibus notorios eſſe ſcortatores—i • quia ſac •• reſtantur canones eccleſia • pro ſumma quà fungitur authoritate propter miniſtrorum defectum pleraue contra ſeuentatem canonum ſaep •• ndulli • le tolleraſle ſic enim vxorem liberos habentem epiſcopum syracuſanum • ununus ponti • ex •• olim confirmau • ſic honeſtos maritos ad ſacros maiores ordines eccleſia admiſit ſic bigamum ad diac▪ natum p • rmount qu •• e plen •• que viris ante haec noſtra tempora viſum eſt multis adhuc videtur pro praeſentis temporis iniquitate contine • tiae legem quoad clerum ſecularem ſatius eſſe diſpenſando relaxare quim eádé mordicus retentá impuriſſ • mo coelibatu • ſcor ••• om que co •• diuinum praeceptum feneſtram relinquere—nec dubium eſt q • ſi ni conce • neceſsitie sect 2 3 little aduerſaries gaine although ſhall granted proteſtants vſe ſame variable habit ceremony inuented gregory becauſe indeed ordinance man according wiſdome church variable changeable albeit romiſh church would preciſely bind church handmaid vnto ſame faſhion ceremonious attire ſhe ſelfe hath preſcribed yet reſponſione gregorij ad auguſtini interrogata reſp 3 vbi quaeritur cur cùm vn ſit fides ſint eccleſiarum diuerſae conſuetudines altera conſuetudo miſſarum ſancta rom eccleſia atque altera galliarum tenetur reſp nouit fraternitas tua eccleſiae romanae conſuetudinem qua ſe meminit nutritam ſed mihi placet vt ſiue romana ſiue gallicana ſiue qualibet eccleſia aliquid inueniſti quod omnipotenti deo plus poſſit placere ſollicitè eligas anglorum eccleſia quae adhuc ad fidem nouiter eſt inſtituta praecipua quae de multis eccleſijs colligere po • uiſti infundas reſp greg ad auguſt monachum vt eſt apud p diaconum ſame gregor epiſt lib 12 pag 1190 gregorie acknowledge vnitie faith among chriſtians notwithſtanding diſſent matter ceremonie therefore yeelded vnto auſten libertie chooſe whether church rome france elſewhere whatſoeuer ceremonie might ſeeme moſt acceptable vnto almightie god ordaine eſtabliſh ſuch rite church england liberty church england according gregorie moderation challengeth mercie god enioyeth notwithſtanding oppoſition romiſh church peremptorily reigne onely queene church ſhe permit others preferre ordinance church would haue compelled councell trent doth condemne bohemian schiſmaticks onely miniſtring cup preſent according firſt inſtitution chriſts expreſſe commandement drinke ye bloud new teſtament appeareth oration gaſpar councell trent reported firſt gallobelgicus bohemian preferre owne tradition chriſts ſecond degree abuſe multitude romiſh ceremony sect 3 4 romane church deluge ceremony one may diſcerne compare pentateuch moſes 1 sacrarum caeremoniarum romanae eccleſiae libri tres 2 pontificale romanum tres partes diſtinctum 3 miſſale romanum continens rubricas miſſalis 2 ritus celebrandi miſſam 3 defectus circa miſſam occurrentes romiſh miſſals ritual number rite farre exceed synagogue iewes faſts feſtiuals ſacrifices altar habit order veſtments canon beſides cenſings kneeling kiſſings croſſings whiſperings many like kind ſo manifeſtly importable many owne men haue preuented complaint ſaying alia ratio antiqui temporis alia moderni eo euim tempore non arctabantur fideles tot canonum decretorum praeceptis cenſuris aut poenis nec erant tune vt ita dixerim tot laquei legum ſeu conſtitutionum excommunicationum ſiue cenſurarum à quibus vix fideles etiam diligentiſſimi timorati praecauere poſſint non tot ieiunia indicta non vigiliae non diuturna pariter nocturna officia dietim ex praecepto dicenda non denique tot feſta calenda non tam crebra confeſsio corporis chriſti communicatio non tot obedientiarum praeſtationes ſicut modò fideles arctantur aut potitis inuoluuntur ita vt rectè de praelati • eccleſiae dici poſ •• illud chriſti alligant onera importabilia c rode • icu epiſcop samorenſ lib 2 spec cap 29 ancient time people god ſubiect ſo many decree precept puniſhments excommunication cenſures c moſt diligent hardly preuent ſo many faſts vigil feast wherewith faithfull continually intangled granting aetas hieronymi preter diē dominicum pauciſsima nouerat feſta nūc feriarum neque finis neque modus quae cùm primitùs ad pietatis vacationé paucae ſunt inſtitutae nunc ad ſceletum excluſionem tolli debeant niſi ſacerdotum auaritia ſuis rebus conſuleret potiùs quám verae religioni eraſmus math 11 pag 55 anno 1540 neither end meaſure multitude holydaies ſay turba feſtorum dierum quos vel epiſcopi multitudinis indulgentes affectibus vel rom pontifex cauſis non neceſſarijs inſtituebant c idem de amab concord biſhops pope inuented pamper affection people adding nobis chriſtianis diuerſis temporibus pontifex diuerſi diuerſos more praeſcripſerunt circa caeremonias cultum cibos ieiuniſi veſtitū pompas mitra huiuſmodi agrippa de vanit ſcient cap 56 diuerſe pope ſucceeded one another ſo increaſed rite worſhips meat habit denying lord field onera quae miniſtri aliqui imponunt humeris hominum ſunt importabilia non onus chriſti caiet comment matth 11 haec verba iugum meum ſuaue burthen ſome miniſters impoſe vpon men ſhoulders gregory vnderſtand thus much let put practiſe profeſſion borrowed auguſtine fat • mur catholici caeremonias non eſſe nimis multiplicandas ita vt ſua multitudine obruant quodammodo religionem cui ſetuire debent vt enim agricolae cupiunt vitibus praeter vuas etiam pampinos quibus ornentur adiuuentur vuae ſed ſi nimiùm pampini creſcant impediant potiùs quam iuuent ea reſecant ita faciendum eſſe 31 obſcuritie scripture argument hindering layman reading scripture yet sicubi terreni imperatoris ſcripta acciperes non quieſceres nec ſomnū oculis dare priuſquàm ſcripta illa agnouiſſes imperator vnum corpus eſt tota ſancta vniuerſalis eccleſia ſub chriſto ieſu capite ſuo conſtituta—chriſtus itaque cum tota ſua eccleſia ſiue quae adhuc verſatur terris ſ • ue quae cum eo iam regnat coelis vna ablution purging veniall ſinnes holywater together newly inuented see tradition ceremony hath bene confeſſed either number burthenſome ſignifications vaine friuolous exaction opinion neceſſitie iniurious vſe ſuperſluous laſtly owne nature ſuch haue bene miſſals verie blaſphemous concluſion sect 7 12 trauellers long weariſome courſes winding vp vnto top high hill taking breathing looke backe behind take full view paſſed trauels reader ſhall likewiſe affected conſtrainedly tedious diſcourſe may paſſages diſcerne inconſiderate importunitie aduerſaries apologiſts vndertaking apolog § 3 farther demonſtration ſignifying former proofes demonſtrations ſection • following demonstratiō romiſh religion conſonant vnto doctrine gregory onely ſome one two point euen throughout euery particular concluding commendation vertue learning neceſſarie beliefe found verie impotent weake diſputers whoſe maior propoſition viz ſuch commēdable conuerter throughly beleeued hath bene proued meere non ſequitur example aſſumption demonſtrate religion throughout euerie particular peremptorie preſumption becauſe either moſt doctrine propounded romiſh profeſſion many point romiſh profeſſion haue bene propounded therefore remaine chargeable recant firſt demonſtration apologie moſt particular chap vi concerning faith eualdi romish apologie vvith profeſsion whereof doubt likewiſe plaine mientis exicrunt sacramenta ſanguis ſcil aqua ex quibus conſtituta eſt eccleſia pſal 41 two whereon church founded nothing contradicteth title catholike church appropriated onely church viſible applying eccleſia ſancta vniuerſalis ex multis electorum perſonis aedi • icatur • ib 2 • tabernac cap 2 vna eſt eccleſia quia diuiſionem ſchiſ • atis non recipit vna eſt quia non alia ante lege • alia ſub lege alia ſub gratia alia de circumciſſione alia de praep • tio collect •• ſed ſicut vnus dominus vna fides vnum b • ptiſma vnus deu • pater omnium id eſt vna catholica electorum omnium • • ultitudo idem 〈◊〉 lib • cap 6 ex ditabus partibus vnitas eccleſiae congregatur corum viz qui peceare ne • ciunt corum qui peceare deſiſtunt luc lib 4 cap 11 contrary vnto bellar de pont coſterus • nchirid ſocietie elect onely nothing vndermineth whole foundation poperie take away romiſh ſence interpretation theſe word meta • horicè petro dictum eſt super hanc petram id eſt ſaluatorem quem confeſſus eſt aedificatur • ccleſia qui fideli confeſſon ſui nominis participi • •• uit matth 16 fundamen • quandò plutaliter ponuntur doctores ſignificant q • ando ſingularitèr doctorum docto • em theſſaly aduocate ſome particular firſt begin profeſſed romiſh primacie greeke church ſaith though neuer denied primacy order pope rome yet aſſumed predominance authoritie alwaies impugned viz iuriſdiction whereby euerie pope challengeth power calling generall councels determining cauſes owne diſcretion hereby tranſgreſsing decree antiq • itie practiſe example • lder godly pope finally proteſtants though inu • cate saint becauſe heare reaſon notandum eſt quod ante aduentum chriſti ancti qu • moriebantur non intrabant coelum nec deum videbant nec cognoſcere poterant ordinariè preces ſupplicantiu • ideo non •• iſle conſuetum veteri teſtamento vt diceretur sancte abraham os pro bellar lib 1 〈◊〉 beat sanct •• 19 ſufficient yet 〈2 page missing〉 grecian diſſent romiſh profeſſion coniugium sacérdotibus permittimus ante ordinationem patriarch reſp 1 cap 21 th • booke obiected apologiſts doctrine romaniſts condemne prohibeinus • itò concil trident graecorum error eſt oportere clericos antequam ſacros ordines ſuſcipiant vxores ducere bellar lib 1 de cleric cap 19 licuit eccleſia orient •• etiam poſt ordinationem contra ere matrimo •• um caiet card opuſe tr • ct 27 teſte greg valent ieſ tom 4 diſp 9 q 5 no quoque illis sacerdotibus qui ſe continere non poſſunt antequam conſecrati ſunt coniugium permittimus deus enim coniugium piaecepit nec ignor amus coniugio sacerdotibus interdicto impi • ab illis committi patriarch reſp 1 pag 129 mariage prieſts denying three degree greci—poſt ordines ſacros nullum ex minoribus ordinibus admittunt praeter lectorem alios autem viz oſtiarium exorciſtam acolythum inter ſacros ordines non numerant alphonſ lib 11 hareſ vlt ſacred order error graecorum eſt non miſcere vinum aqua euchariſtia alphonſ ibid lib 6 hareſ 7 • chryſostome thought confirme tranſubſtantiation protestant appeale sect 3 4 centuriſts ſay videtur chryſostomus chryſoſtome ſeemeth confirme tranſubſtantiation apologiſts tranſlate chryſoſtome thought ſeeming confirmation inferre iudiciall perſwaſion ſtraine violent either purpoſe centuriſts vſe ſame videtur often doubtfully may appeare whole centuries▪ note opinion ſelfe ſay aſterit affirmat tenet vendicat c centuriſts nature word inforce one may perceiue euery thing ſeemeth much place chryſoſtome ſaith nū vides panem num vinū num ſicut reliqui cibi ſeceſſum vadunt abſit▪ ne ſic cogites quemadmodum ſ • ceta igni adhibita illi aſſimilatur nihil ſubſtantiae remanet nihil ſuperfluit ſic hic puta myſteria conſumi corporis ſubſtantiâ propter quod accedentes ne putetis quòd accipiatis diuinum corpus ex homine ſed ex ipſis seraph forcipe ignem quem ſcil eſaias vidit vos accipere centur 5 pag 518 thinke thou ſeeſt bread wine meat go draught c theſe word may ſeeme confirme profect • perriegamus id que ā diuinis ſcri • •• omnino alienū dicimus dicit p martyr loqui cyrillū de coniunctione corporali quae nobis eſt cum chriſto per incarnationem quia natura noſtr • chriſto eſt audi verò quomodo cyrillus ſe exponat enim paulò infrà exponens quid ſit illa coniuntio ſic ait • ortaſſis putat ignotam nobis myſticae benedictionis virtutem eſſe quae cùm nobis ſit ne corporali • er quoque facit communicatione carnis▪ chriſts chriſtū nobis habitare • et infrà vnde conſide andum eſt non habitudine ſolúm quae pe • charitatem intelligitur chriſtum nobis eſſe verumetiam participatione naturali et infra non poterat enim aliter corruptibilis haec natura corporis ad incorruptibilitatem vitā traduci niſi naturali • vitae corpus ei coniungeretur non credis mihi haec dicenti chriſto obſecro te fidem praebe similia fuſé repetir lib 11 cap 26 bellar lib 2 de euchar cap 25 § verum falſam § et quia myſticall bleſsing sacrament haue coniunction chriſt according fleſh chriſt hereby communication fleſh dwelleth bodily v onely affection loue euen naturall participation without corruptible nature body neuer capable immortalitie incorruption whether ſay vnderſtandeth peter martyr conceiued corporall coniunction faithfull haue chriſt incarnation wherein chriſt become naturall man hypoſtaticall vnion godhead raiſe naturall men ingrafted incorporated member bodie corruption vnto glory immortality coniunction sacrament ratified vnto faithfull communicant whether romaniſts teach thereby meant orall corporall eating naturall bodie referred cardinall dominus diſcipulis porrigebat non effigie ſed natur • mutatus omnipotentiâ verbi factus eſt ca • ficut perſona chriſti humanitas vi ſebatur latebat diuinitas ita sacramento viſibili ineffabiliter diuina ſe effudit eſſentia vt eſſet religioni circa sacramenta deuotio ad veritatem cuius corpus ſanguis sacramenta ſunt ſincerior pateret aditus vſque ad participationem ſpiritus non vſque ad conſubſtantialitatem chriſti cyprian erm de coena • nullo modo myſterijs diuina ſe abſentat • eſtas ibid non dentes ad mordendum acuimus ſed fide ſincera panem ſanctum frangimus partimur dum quod protestant appeale sect 9 21 opinion tranſubſtantiation father verie ancient cannot confeſſe find theodoret maketh eraniſtes hereticall partie bolt therefore orthodoxally may ſo ſay proteſtantly meum bodie acceptum panem diſtributum diſcipulis ſuis chriſtus corpus ſuum ſecit dicendo hoc eſt corpus meum id eſt figura corporis c tertidu • rſus marcion lib 4 cap 40 bodie meant figure bodie therefore noted one aduerſaries haue fallen error putantium corpus chriſti euchariſtia tantum eſſe ſub figura iam olim condemnatus eſt viz berengario author admonitionis ad lectorem de quibuſdam tert dogmatis ante libros tertullian error afterward condemned meaning berengarius another anſwereth hoc eſt corpus ad eſt figura interpretation according true ſence chriſts word although meaning ſwarue truth harding iuel art 12 § thus interpretation tertullian according vnto true ſence anſwer cannot ſtand without great preiudice againſt grayheaded see sect following antiquitie follow teſtimonies euchariſt euerie kind terme 38 firſt cyrill ſaith thus cyril hieroſol • obiected tranſubſtantiation ſaying non conſideres panem nudum • vinum nudū denying nuda naked nature vſe myſtag 4 ſaith like baptiſme non tanquam aqua ſ •• pli •• ſtudeas huic • auacro ſed vt ſpirituali gratiae quae cum aqua datur idē catecheſ 3 holy oile sed vide ne ſuſpiceris illud vnguentum nudū eſſe quemadmod • enim panis euchariſtia per inuocationem spiritus ſancti non eſt deinceps nudus aut ſimplex panis ſed corpus chriſti ſic hoc ſanctum vnguentum non eſt poſtea nudum neque vt quis die commune propter inuocationem ſed chriſti donum praeſentiâ spiritus ſancti cyrill catecheſ 3 p 23 alſo looke vpon lauer baptiſme vpon bare water gregory nyſſen ne contemnas diuinum lauacrum neque id tanquam commune propter vſum aqua parui facia greg nyſſen de baptiſ gregory nyſſene thus contemne water though common chryſoſt aqua primatum tenet elementis ſed cum aqua elementum acceperit spiritum ſanctum fit sacramentum iam non erit aqua potationis ſed ſanctificationis non erit aqua communis ſed • ectionis chryſ • ſt pſal 22 vt reſert coccius verè lib 5 de bapt pag 529 chryſoſtome thus common water fit caro chriſti de sacram lib 4 cap 4 whereupon bellarmine thus quid potuit clarius yet ambroſe ſaith alſo element operatorius ſermo eſt vt ſint quae crant aliud commutentur elſe operentur ſame alſo chriſts bodie 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 id eſt qui manducat propter quodammodo miſc • tur mihi tranſelementatur theoph ioh 6 tranſelementated faithfull communicant ſay hilarius de trinit lib 8 quod autem nobis naturalis haec vnitas ſit ipſe ita teſtatus eſt qui edit meam carnem manet chriſti caro naturaliter nobis manet— permanet nobis carnaliter inſeparabiliter vnitis myſterium verae naturalis vnitatis ſit praedicandum hilar de trinit lib 8 chriſt sacrament naturally vnited vnto v like manner affirme non negamus rectum no fide charitate ue ſincera chriſto ſpiritualiter coniungi ſed nullam nobis coniunctionis rationem ſecundum carnem cum illo eſſe id profectò pernegamns—an fortaſſis putat ignotam nobis myſticae benedictionis virtutem eſſe quae cum nobis fiat nonne corporaliter quoque facit communicatione carnis chriſti chriſtum nobis ha itare cyril alex lib 10 c 13 fleſh chriſt aduerſaries allow proper ſence remaineth v naturally corporally inſeparably 49 cardinall alterum teſtimonium origenis eſt hom 5 diuerſa loca euangelij qua tractat de puero centurionis quando ſanctum cibum illudue incorruptum accipis epulum quando vitae pane poculo frueris manduca bibis corpus ſanguine • domini tunc dominus ſub tectum tuum ingreditur et tu ergo humilians teipſumimitare hunc centurionem dicito domine non ſum dignus vt tu intres ſub tectum meum vbi enim indignè ingreditur ibi ad iudicium ingreditur accipienti haec ille sanè iſta non poſlunt rectè dici niſi de vero corpore domini quod verè • corporis accipiatur nam fi loqueretur origenes de corpore domini per metonymiā id eſt de pane ſignificance corpus chriſti non vocaret cum paneni incorruptum epulum nec ei dici vellet domine non ſum dignus c si verò loqueretur de ipſo chriſto per panem ſignificato qui per fidem accipitur non diceret vbi indignè ingreditur ibi ad iudicium ingreditur accipienti nam ſecundum aduerſarios chriſtus per fidem non poteſt accipi ni • á pi • ad vitam bellarm lib 2 de euchariſt cap 8 § akerum col 417 bellarmine preſſeth much ſaying origen admoniſheth communicant receiuing euchariſt ſay centuriō lord worthy thou ſhouldeſt enter vnder roofe mouth vrging circumſtances proue cannot meant metonymically figuratiuely maruell man ſo ſharpe ſight could ſee word ſame origen immediatly preceded ſame ſentence ſaying intrat nunc dominus ſub tectum credentium duplici figurâ vel nunc enim quandò sancti deo acceptabil • eccleſiarum antiſtites ſub tectum tuum intrant tunc ibidem per co dominus ingreditur tu ſic exiſtime • tanquam dominum ſuſcipiens aliud quandò ſanctum cibum illudque c followeth place aboue ci • ed cardinall bellarmine reaſons frinolous firſt chriſt exhibited sacrament although without corporall preſence edulium incorruptum 2 secondly paſters church bring food life euery one may ſay non ſ • dignus thirdly wicked receiue chriſt ſacramentally miniſtred vnto albeit receiue faithfully ſo owne default guiltie body ex parte chriſti offered vnto ſaluation lord entreth vnder roofe beleeuers double figure manner godly paſtors church enter thy houſe doth lord enter ſo thinke thou though thou receiuedſt lord chriſt euidently ſignifying like manner receiuing chriſt verum argumē tum non eſt nam phantaſmata vel phantaſtica corpus qualia haeretici putabant corpus chriſti videntur eſſe corpus vera tamen reipſa non ſunt vera corpus chriſti eucha • iſtia ex catholico • ū ſententia non videnir oculis externis eſſe verum corpus tamen reipſa eſt bellar lib 3 de euchar cap 24 § calmnus quoque aduerſarie ſaith phantaſticall appeareth ſo hereticks called bodie chriſt phantasticall catholicks teach bodie chriſt truly meaning corporally although appeareth ſo thinke looſing doubling knot becauſe tranſubſtantiation propoundeth ſhew bread etiamſi panis nihil ſit tamē id quod ipſe conuerſus eſt non eſt nihil nec nullum nec nu • quam non enim dicitur annihilari quod manet ſe ſed quod terminatur nihil ita vt terminus actionis qua ipſum depixit eſſe nihil ſit alioqui aqua quae à domino verſa eſt vinſi annihilata fuiſſet nam poſt conuerſionē nihil fuit nulla fuit nuſquā fuit bellar ibid § ad alteram whereas ſay remaining ſubſta •• e bread moſt ſemblably vnto conſummationem ſeculi secundùm carnem ver • quam verbum aſſumpſit ſecundùm id quod de virgine natur eſt ſecund • mid quod à iudaeis prehenſus eſt quod ligno confixus quod de cruce depoſitus quod lin • magiſtri tam claram vt nemo vel •• tuſus ſtupidus poſſit dicere non intellexi de vnit eccleſ c 10 et nemo dubitet cùm iam chriſtus aſcenderit coelo • quamui • virtute ſpiritus nobi • adſit praeſentiá tried like analogie romiſh tranſubſtantiation euchariſt doth contradict doctrine chriſts true naturall bodie hath bene proued theodoret others appeare deſperatneſſe laſt euaſion aduerſaries driuen vnto anſwering chriſt euchariſt manner bodie circumſcription ſpirit determination excellently euen quod •• quis contendat eſſe loco tam circumſcriptiuè quàm definitiu • id requirere vt re nullo modo modo preſence word cardinall bellarmine manner god lo affinitie hath old hereſie fancied chriſts bodie altogether ſpirituall 〈1… page missing〉 concerning queſtion dedicated vnto pope sixtus quintus profeſſedly writing hereof ſaith thus day ſeuen different opiniōs concerning formall word conſecration firſt among defend forme conſiſt hoc eſt corpus meum c another rurſum alia agitatur inter scholaſticos quaeſtio verba chriſti materialiter • ò ſignificatiuè conſecrationis forma ſumantur hic iterum magna reperitur opinionum diuer •• ta bona par tenet quòd materialiter ſumantur ſed diuiſi hi inter ſe ſunt quis quidam dicunt quòd materialiter tantùm ſumantur alij verò quòd ſimul materialiter ſignificatiuè vt thomas ſui ſectatores alij quòd partim materialitè • partim ſignificatiuè sunt alij qui ea ſignificatiuè tantùm accipi aſſerunt vt marſil 4 inno centius autem tertius innocentius quartus gloſſa timorem de conſecr 2 tenent quòd materialiter tan •• ſumantur quos ſequuntur multi ex scholaſticis qui verò ea ſignificatiuè ſumi aſſerunt diuiſi ſunt tot varias opiniones vt vix ea numerare ſit certè guido brianzonis ſuper 4 sent numerat nouem ſuam adijcit quae decimam facit idem ibid verb • ſeqq great diuerſitie vnderſtand whether ſignificatiuely materially partly wholy onely alſo thoſe vnderſtand ſignificatiuely haue begot innumerable diuerſities finally require praiers theſe word hoc eſt corpus meum neceſſary conſecration ſo diſtracted ſaid eſt alia quaeſtio ſolis quatuor verbis hoc eſt corpus meum fieri conſecratio poſſit hic iterum duas ſunt diſſecti opiniones thomas illius opinionem ſequentes tenent quòd ſic scotus tenet oppoſitum dicens opus eſſe alijs verbis per quae chriſti verba ad materiam applicari declaretur scoti opinionem ſeq • untur multi qui aiunt verba quibus chriſti verba ad materiam applicari ſignificatur eſſe benedictionis eccleſiae verba quibus petit vt oblata munera panis vini fiant corpus ſanguis chriſti hanc opinionem ſequuti ſunt theologi colonienſes ſuo antididagmate contra lutherum lindanus epiſc ſua panoplia catharinus duobus de hac materia libellis romae ab eo editis colonienſes lindanus tenent cum angelo pelbarto quòd nihil omninò fieret ſi quis ſol • verborum prolatione ſine eccleſiaſtica prece conſecrare attentaret dominus epiſcopus ebroicenſis 7 de euchar repet lindanum colonicuſes contra kemo • tium defendit dicens quòd ideo preces dixerint cum baſilio magno ad conſecrationem eſſe neceſſarias quia ſine adiunctis precibus innoteſ • ere eccleſiae non poſſit chriſti verba ad conſecrationem faciendam admoueri—malè vt ingenuè fatear animum meum habuit iſta opinionum tanta tantiue momenti materia varietas dum theologiae operam dabam adeò vt horrori aliquando eſſet lectionibus illis intereſſe quas ſuper quaeſtionibus doctores praelectores noſtri habebant quae opinionum varietas magi ac magi mihi diſplicere coepit cùm poſt theologici ſtudij curſum per varias galliae ciuitates prouincias praedicandi gratia cundum mihi fuit eò quòd haeretici cùm nobis iſta doctorum noſtrorum ſuper vero verborum chriſti ſenſu diſſidia obijcerent pudefacerent neque illis licet fidei dogmatis eos conuenite aſſererem ſatisfacere poſſem imò nec doctis aliquot catholicis idem ibid verbis ſeqq pag 5 6 7 biſhop confeſſeth himſelfe enforced bluſh theſe ſo many diſcords obiected ptoteſtants concluding et omnibus conſideratis iſta accipite hoc eſt corpus meum verbum accipite praebitionem ſignificat verba hoc eſt corpus meum quid praeberet declarane haec ſola verba apud euangeliſtas paulum reperio quae chriſtum corpus ſuum praebere ſignificent idem ibid pag 14 scripture teſtimonie two haec omnia ſic ſeſe neceſſariò conſequuntur vt vnum ſine alio eſſe nequeat ex autem deiude ſequi video quòd chriſtus verbis hoc eſt corpus meum non benedixit panem coena quae fuit duorum ſummorum pontificum innocentij tertij innocentij quarti ſententia ac multorum antiquorum patrum ibid pag 15 pope conſequent nam benedictionem fieri per ſola verba quae natura ſunt poſteriora ipſa benedictione impoſſibile prorſus eſt ipſo enim eſt abſurdius abſurdo dicere idem ibid pag 19 abſurditie thoſe word hoc est corpus meum power benediction conſecration hath auouched dedicatorie epiſtle nuncupated pope 64 ſhall need ſpeake common opinion aſcribeth whole vertue conſecration vnto word chriſt bodie wherein one little word hoc wit haue bene nota catholicos etſi conueniunt • e tamen non conuenire modo explicandi quid propriè demonſtret illud pronomen hoc—sunt duae celebriores ſententiae 1 pro • omen hoc non demonſtrate id quod eſt ſed id quod erit viz corpus chriſti—si ita eſſet verba erun • ſpeculatiua non practica—eſt altera ſententia thomae necnon aliorum multorum qui cum ſequuntur quòd pronomen hoc non demonſtrat panem aut corpus ſed commune ſubſtantiam quae ſub illis ſpeciebus ſit vt ſenſus ſit ſub ſpeciebus eſt corpus meum bellarm lib 1 de euchariſt cap 11 § nota ſecundò greatly afflicted referring particle betokening bread ſome ſignifie chriſts bodie ſome imply neither know ſome non demonſtratur indiuiduum aliquod vagum ſed ſubſtantia indiuidua determinata contenta ſub illi • ſpeciebus non quidem ſecundùm propriam rationem panis ſed ſecundùm rationem ſubſtantiae communem indiuidu • vagè per ordinem ad illa accidentia greg valent ieſ lib 2 exam myſt caluin cap 1 § quarta obiectio common nature call indiuiduum vagum yet wonder metaphyſicall conceit indiuiduum vagè laſt ieſuits conſtruction call theſe word hoc eſt corpus meum verba ſunt operatiua practica officiunt enim quod ſignificant bellarm lib 1 de e • chariſt cap 11 § secundò verba non habent verba perfectā ſignificationem niſi vltimo inſtanti quo proſertur vo • vltima pendet enim intellectus donce ad ſiné ven • atur—in eodem autem vltimo inſtanti ponitur effectus verborum eſſe id eſt conuerſio panis corpus chriſti ibid § reſpondeo cùm practicall effectually working tranſubſtantiation verte inſtant time wherein laſt theſe word hoc est corpus meū vttered interpretation lay reſoluedly ſole ground tranſubſtantiation notwithſtanding according iudicious cenſure owne forecited vnus scotus auſus eſt dicere—chriſtum—dando conſecrâſſe dicendo hoc eſt corpus meum—si autem dando conſecrauit lutherani victoriam ferrent qui ſolo vſu ſcilicet dum datur accipitur corpus chriſti euchariſtia eſſe ſuſtinent—si autem cum dixit accipite manducate panem dabat ſicut dicendū eſſet ſi nondu • facta eſſet conſecratio ſequitur quod panem accipere edere iubebat quod apoſtoli qui chriſto obedierunt panem acceperint enderint ſimul cum corpore quod eſt articulum tranſubſtantiationis deſtruere archi • p • eſcopus c • ſarien tractatus varij diſp de neceſſ correct th •• log scholaſt lib 1 fol 5 quicquid dixerint ſemper eò cogendi ſunt vt dicant corpus panis oſtendatur ſingulari quia pronomen vice nominis proprij poſitum pro ſolo ſingulari ſumi poſſit—cum ſcriptura duarum tantum meminerit viz panis corporis ueſcio cur fingant tertiam aliquam quae nec panis ſit nec corpus quae tamen per pronomen demonſtretur quo magnam scripturae vim faciunt infarcientes illi ex ſuo cerebro cuius nullam habent mentionem quâ poſitâ propoſitio falſa eſſet ſi autem nullam tertiam reponero ſe dicant quae ſit alia à chriſti corpore cur nudam nobis rem non proponunt cur tot illam verborum inuolucris contegunt • terti • quaerere à pane corpore diſcretam vaniſſimus labor eſt abſurditate plenus idom ibid fol 17 biſhop tranſubſtantiation therby ouerthrowne therefore calleth new euaſion figment labour full abſur ditie notably confuteth fundamentall sic diſtinguit scotus practicam propoſitionem à ſpeculatiua speculat • ua inquit praeſupponit tem ita ſe habere atque ſignificat practica verò non praeſupponit rem ſed eam facit licet iſta diſtinctio •• ihi non placeat nam vtraqu • ſupponit rem ita ſe habere atque ſignificat ſpeculati • ſignificat rem eſſe practica rem fieri vna praeſupponit rem eſſe alt • r • fier • —sed miru quomodo poſtquam dixerunt eam eſſe practicam talia de •• de aſſerant ex quibus ſequatur eam non eſſe practicam atunt enim quia conuerſio panis ſit inſtanti eam non eſſe veram vſque ad vltimum inſtan • prolationis ipſius quod idem eſt dictu cum eo quod patres de illa dicunt viz eam non eſſe veram niſi prius ſit facta tranſubſtantiatio • piſ caeſari • n • id fol 19—ideo autem expectandum ait vltimum iſtud inſtans • quod ante conuerſionem non poſſet eſſe vera patres dicunt quia vera eſt▪ quando profertus ideo illam praeſupponere conuerſionem iam factam propterea ex cius veritate ſequi tranſubſtantiationem▪ quae ſi facta prius non eſſet eſſet propoſitio falſa idem ibid pauló poſt— • hoc tenet • otus—praeſupponit ergo ſecundùm cum iſta propoſitio ad ſui veritatem rem factam non rem fiendam vnde conſequent •• infertur quod ſit ſpeculatiua non practica maximè cùm nullum verbum habeat niſi ſolum verbum ſubſtantiuum quod nullam actionem • ut paſſionem ſed ſolam • ſubſtantiam deſignat oportet ergo vt cum patribus concilij de caetero idem ſentientes hanc propoſitionem fateamur non eſſe practicam ſed praeſupponer • vt ſit vera rem quam ſignificat pr •• eſſe factam quim proferatur quantas tenebras offudit horum verborum claritati nimius erga ſuam praeconceptam opinionem amor quo agente tam obſunato animo quidam ſuſtinent chriſtum per iſta verba eaue ſola benedixiſſe conſecraſſe panem ſola illa ſufficere ad dictam conſecrationem factendam idem ibid fol 19 20 diſtinction ſpeculatiue praiticall propoſition whoſe teſtimonie haue wrought vpon barre yron muſt need ſet teeth edge rather becauſe diuerſe theſe author confeſſed ſubuert doctrine tranſubſtantiation thoſe argument whereby others labour confirme theſe irreconciliable wrangle contradictorie doctor ſo preiudiciall doubtleſſe contradiction inuolued doctrine ſelfe proued testimony aduerſaries may ſerue fift argument ſecuritie sect 22 66 argument taken abſurdities queſtion manner chriſts preſence thought learned aduerſary intereà lutherani qui veritatem corporis chriſti cum pane ſubſiſtere volunt multos abſurdos ſenſus confingunt primò ipſum panem eſſe corpus chriſti deinde ſub pane eſſe corpus chriſti vbi re diſparatae de ſe inuicem praedicantur deinde ſub p • ne eſſe corpus chriſti quod non niſi figuram reſoluitur mox cum pane eſſe corpus chriſti vbi firſt thomas 4 diſt 44 q 2 art 2 quidam alij catholici exiſtimant non poſſe vnum corpus eſſe duobus locis localiter ſed tantùm ſacramentaliter—et rationem hanc reddunt quia vnum eſt illud quod eſt indiuiſum à ſe diuiſum à quocunque alio ex quibus conditionibus prior indiuiſum iſe eſſentialis inſeparabilis altera non aquinas beſides catholicks doctor ſometime eſteemed aduerſaries oracle romiſh schoole profound learning ſearch myſteries diuinitie ſirnamed seraphical argument contradiction concluſiuely reſolue abſolutely impoſſible one bodie ſame time locally many place whence muſt follow iudgement cardinall sed haec ratio pace tanti doctoris dixerim non eſt ſolida nam duplex eſt indiuiſio à ſe—vna reſpectu locus quae extrinſeca eſt plane accidentaria alia reſpectu rei ipſius quae eſt intrinſeca vel eſt de eſſentia vel certè proprietas quaedam vnitatis—cùm vnum corpus eſt diuerſis locis non tollitur indiuiſio intrinſeca ſed ſolùm extrinſeca reſpectu locus nam non diuiduntur principia intrinſeca quae corpus conſtituunt ſed ſolùm diuiduntur ſitus ſiue vbi illius corporis anſwer vnſufficient becauſe diuiſion doth reſpect diuerſa vbi ſame body diuers member diuers place ieſuits doctrine ſame bodie feined one altar ſecond yet place diſtance betweene conſiſteth diuiſion doth neceſſarily proue diuerſa vbitata diuerſa vbi come next confutation thomas quod ſi non poſſet eſſe vnum corpus localiter duobus locis quia diuideretur à ſeipſo thomas held profectò nec poſſit eſſe ſacramentaliter eadem ratione licet enim eſſe alicubi ſacramentaliter non dicat eſſe per locus occupationem tamen dicit eſſe per realem veram praeſentiam quae realis praeſentia tot hoſtijs ſiue altaribus non locis intermedijs non minus tollere videtur indiuiſionem rei quàm repletionem plutium poſſae omnibus locis per dei potentiam abſolutam neque obſtat quod patres ſancti ſenſiſſe videntur vbiquitatem eſſe dei propriam maximè cùm ex eo diuinitatem spiritus ſancti probant quòd ille ſit vbique—quia omnipraeſenti • ſuapte naturâ non alienâ virtute intelligunt—vt maximè humanitas chriſti poſſit diuinitùs poni vbique aſſertionem tamen eſſe haereticam quòd ea iam vbique ſit gregor valent eſſe poſſe infinitis locis ſimul immenſitatem requirit bellar lib 3 de chriſt • cap 18 § quod impoſsible euery inſtant sacrament either circumſcriptiuely definitiuely quod ſi quis dicat eſſe loco tam circumſcriptiuè quàm definitiuè id requirere vt re nullo modo ſit alibi dicere poſſumus dari tertium modum exiſtendi loco nimirum per ſolam praeſenti • quomodo deus eſt loco hoc modo eſſe loco ea corpo • quae per diuinam potentiam ſimul ſunt diuerſis locis bellar ibid cap 4 § alcero modo c manner god ſaid place onely preſence herein without light antiquitie imagining preſence without manner prefence except omnipreſence onely prerogatiue god himſelfe communicable vnto created nature 69 secondly allowed v vndoubted principle ob de eſſentia quantitat • eſt habere partem extra partem ergo vbi eſt vna par non eſt alia non ergo tota quantitas corpori • domini eadem hoſtiae particula eſſe poteſt reſp bellar lib 3 de euchariſt cap 7 § ad quartum quantitas non poteſt exiſtere niſi quantitatiuè quantum ad eſſentialem modum quia non poteſt exiſtere ſine extenſione partium diſtinctione ſe cometh anſwer point queſtion § ad octauum corpus habere partem extra partem ſi illud extra dicat habitud ad ſubiectum non autem ſi dieat habitud ad locum ibidem fatemur chriſti corpus vbicunque eſt habere ſuam formam ſiguram humanam partium ſitum diſpoſitionem ibid cap 7 § haec autem eſſentiall property euery thing hath quantitie ſo diſpoſed one part fame ſubiect diſtinct another whereupon may bold ob corpus chriſti cùm ſit organicum habet partes determinatè diſtant • eſt enim de ratione organici corpo • determinata diſtantia ſingularum partium ad inuicem ſicut oculus ab oculo oculus ab aure ergo non poteſt eſſe • otus chriſtus ſub quaſibet parte hoſtiae alia obiectio corpus chriſti ſemper retinet veram corporis naturam nec vnquam mutatur ſpiritum ſed eſt de ratione corporis vt ſit quantitas poſitionem habens ad rationem quantitatis pertinet vt diuerſae partes diuerſis partibus exiſtant ergo reſpondet adhaec talis diſtantia partium eſt quidem corpore chriſti vero ſed non ſecundum hanc diſtantiam comparatur ad hoc sacramentum ſed ſecundum modum ſubſtantiae thomas part 3 art 3 ad 2 3 rurſum obijcitur dicitur quod totum corpus chriſti continetur ſub qual bet parte hoſtiae conſecratae ſed nulla quantitas dimenſiua tota continetur qualibet parte totius eſt ergo impoſſ • bile vt quod tota quantitas dimenſiua corporis chriſti contineatur hoc sacramento reſpondet • argue ſeeing euery organicall bodie one part ſeuered another eye eare whole bodie chriſt euerie part hoſt force conſequent great aquinas could otherwiſe auoid helpe thicke miſt anſwering bodie chriſt hoſt nature bodie according nature quantitas dimenſiua corporis chriſti eſt hoc sacramento non ſecundùm proprium modum vt ſcilicet ſit totum toto ſingulae partes ſingulis partibus ſed ſecundùm modum ſubſtantiae cuius natura eſt tota toto tota qualibet ibidem art 4 ad 1 ſubſtance naturally wholy whole whole euerie part vtterly diſſolueth confeſſed eſſentiall propertie bodily ſubſtance hath whole conſiſting part really distinguiſhed one another ſuch ſubſtance either one part another whole euery part owne sed ſecundùm hoc videtur quia vbi par eſt ibi eſt totum ſecundùm hoc videtur quod pe naſus funt coniuncti quod ego non credo canoniſta decretis de coucil diſt 2 vbi par • gloſſa canoniſt ancient gloſſe excludeth non credo vnworthie faith 70 may inſiſt vpon ſuch like contradiction ſay bodie prima par • regulae ceruſſima eſt quia realis pr •• tentia corporis chriſti id caluine others ſee teſtimonie going synecdoche ſome lutheran caſſander ſaith figuratiuely whether metonymie non tamen identicam praedicationem ſpeaking lutheran aſſerunt neque e • loquutione tropum aſpernantur modò tropus praeſentiam carnis chriſti non tollat quam plerique synecdochen vocant qua ex parte totum intelligitur quamuis alij inuſita • praedicationem malint atque hanc propoſitionem panis eſt corpus chriſti huiuſmodi interpretatiu • explicant vt per eam intelligant pane ſub pane cum pane c quae forma loquendi apud veteres quoque repetitur caſſander conſult art 10 synecdoche contrariwiſe romaniſts affirme proptiè non figuratè explicanda eſſe illa verba hoc eſt corpus meum bellar lib 1 de euchar cap 9 proueth ſuch argument equally conclude word ſpoken concerning sacrament vnderſtood figuratiuely onely proper literall ſence example th • ſe word figuratiuely properly expounded becauſe pretend argumentum à materia inſtitutionis materia eſt pactum teſtamentum sacramentum quae omnia requirunt propriam non figuratam locutionem—secundum argumentum à perſonis quibuſcum loquebatur viz apoſtolis qui rudes ſimplices fuerunt quibus omnia clariſſimè proponebat vel obſcurius dictum continuò exponebat deinde loquebatur eo tempore quo minimè oportebat obſcur • loqui nimirum cum apoſtoli facti ſunt primo participes tanti sacramenti stapleton vſeth ſame reaſons addeth—quartò ratione sacramenti quod hic inſtitu • tur cuius verba sacramentalia propriè perſpicuè offerri debent non obſcurè figuratè stapleton prompt catholic ser 3 hebd ſancta § tertia pag 268 matter sacrament figuratiuely wherein romaniſts making themſelues aduerſaries vnto proteſtants almoſt point found greateſt aduerſaries themſelues 77 notwithſtanding former deniall trope figure caſe yet haue bene conſtrained note word chriſts inſtitution sacrament many figuratiue vnproper termes ſpeech thinke amongſt others doctor hic literalis ſenſus luculentiſſimè pater ex comparatione aliarum scripturarum quibus tale intelligitur ſubiectum quale deſcribitur à ſuo praedicato dicente adam gen 2 hoc nunc eſt • ex oſſibus mei hoc non innuit coſtam adae ſed ipſam multerem—et exod 16 de manna iſte eſt panis pronomen iſte ſignificat panem exod 24 hic eſt ſanguis teſtamenti hic deſign ipſum ſanguinem et matth 17 hic eſt filius meus hic perſonam filij demonſtrat sic praeſenti hoc eſt corpus meum pronomen hoc nihil aliud ſignificare poteſt quàm quod praedicatum enunciat erit hoc clarius ex textu hebraeo—in matthaeo hebraeo ſic legimus hoc quod eſt corpus meum stapleton prompt cath ser 3 hebd ſancta illa verba hoc eſt corpus meum stapleton theſe word bodie demonſtratiue particle ſignifie nothing pradicate bodie expoſition ſeemeth vnto si quis digito aliquid demonſtrat dum pronomen effert valdè abſurdum videtur dicere pronomine illo non demonſtrari rem praeſentem—pronomina demonſtratius mox indicant certum aliquid etiam antequam ſequantur caeterae voces—si pronomen demonſtret ſolum corpus verba erunt ſpeculatiua non practica ſecundùm catholicos ſunt practica quia ſemper verum erit demonſtrato chriſti corpore dicere hoc eſt corpus chriſti—at verba practica operatoria non ſunt vera antequam sacramentum meaning pronunciation laſt word meum efficiatur bellarm lib 1 de euchariſtia cap 11 § nota ſecundò cardinall bellarmine abſurd becauſe ſignifie chriſts bodie preſence bodie could defender interpretation excuſe themſelues without figure 78 cardinall reſolueth contrarily pronoune alter eſt ſententia thomae aliorum multorum dicentium quòd pronomen hoc non demonſtret praeciſe panem nec corpus ſed communi ſubſtantiam quae ſub illis ſpeciebus continetur ſic tamen vt demonſtratio propriè ad ſpecies per • ineat non quidem vt ſit ſenſus hoc id eſt hae ſpecies ſunt corpus chriſti ſed obliquo hoc modo hoc eſt corpus meum id eſt ſub ſpeciebus eſt corpus meſi—hoc modo omnia optimè cohaerent nam quià ſacramenta ſignificant id quod efficiunt non efficitut hoc ſacramento vt corpus chriſti fit corpus chriſti id enim ſemper 〈◊〉 neque vt panis ſit corpus chriſti id enim fieri nequit ſed efficitur vt ſub ſpeciebus illis ſit corpus chriſti ſub quibus ante à erat ſubſtantia panis ideò illud hoc non demonſtrat panem nec corpus ſed contentum ſub ſpeciebus ibid § eſt igitur eſ • et aptum exemplū ſi dominus quaedò mutauit aquam vinum oſtendiſſet hydrias aqua dixiſſet hoc eſt vinum illis verbis mutáſſet aquam • vinum neque enim poſſumus ità expo • ere iſtam ſententiam hoc eſt vinum id eſt haec aqua eſt vinum id enim falſum eſſet neque ita hoc id eſt vinum eſt vinum nam falſa fuiſſet demonſtratio non enim aderat vinum cùm diceretur hoc ſed hic eſt ſenſus hoc eſt vinum id eſt hoc vaſe eſt vinum ibid § sed thomas doth neither ſignifie bread bodie yet accidēts properly f quid propriè ſignificet hoc duae ſunt celebriores catholicorum ſententiae alter eſt vt pronomen hoc demonſtret corpus bellar lib 1 de euchar cap 1 § ſecunda ſaith vnder theſe accident bodie ſheweth example proueth ſo plainly figuratiue ſpeech man promiſing friend vſe purſe doth figuratiuely meane monie purſe 79 common expoſition call hoc ſignifie de indiuiduo vago non dicimus cum scoto hoc id eſt haec ſubſtantia vel hoc ens—qu • neceſſe eſt vt praeſen • ſit ſubſtantia illa quandò dicitur hoc tamen tunc non eſt illa praeſens— • ſic falſa redditur demonſtratio diſtinct ſubſtance cōfuſedly sed dicimus hoc id eſt ſubſtantia ſub ſpeciebus ſic non eſt neceſſe vt illa ſubſtantia ſit praeſens ſed ſatis eſt ſi praeſentes ſint ſpecies quae demonſtrantur pronomine id eſt ſub ſpeciebus ibid § ad panis eſt nec corpus quae tamen per pronomen demonſtretur quo magnam vim scripturae faciunt si autem nullam tertiam rem ponere ſe dicunt quae ſit alia à chriſti corpore cur non cam nudam proponunt ſed frangi manducari quia ſpecies franguntur ipſū chriſti corpus ſpiritualiter frangi manducari cùm fide ſumitur quiſque ſuam partem tra • • nam dominus dixit • ucae 22 hoc eſt corpus meum quod pro vobis frangitur salmeron ieſ com 1 cor 10 diſp 17 § sed ecce vnderſtood ſpiritually ieſuite maldonate ſaith sacramentalis locutio eſſet ſi corpus chriſti diceretur frangi dentibus teri quemadmodum chryſoſt locutus eſt haec enim non poſſunt niſi sacramento tenus intelligi quia non corpus propriè frangitur ſed sacramentum maldon ieſ com matth 26 immediatly 27 verſe ſacramentally plainly ieſuite valentia dicis ſpeaking herborandus proteſtant lacerari à nobis chriſtum cùm hoſtiam tres partes diuidimus reſp chriſtū ſic eſſe hoſtia vt nec frangi nec pati aliquid que greg valen ieſ lib 2 de sacriſ miſſae c 3 quia fractio ſignificat diuiſioné partiſi suarez ieſ tom 3 diſp 47 § 4 cannot taken properly interpretation cardinal bellarmine confeſſeth aliqui ſpeaking owne doctor volunt ea quae dicuntur chriſto ratione ſpecierum verè propriè dici eo modo quo dicerentur de pane ſi adeſ • et panis enim dicitur verè propriè videri tangi frangi ratione accidentium ſuorum—at ſententia communis theologorum contrarium docet ideo ſit regula ea verba quae ſignificant motum localem verè ac propriè dicuntur de corpore chriſti euchariſtia exiſtente ratione ſpecierum licet per accidens non per ſe caetera autem quae ſignificant alias mutationes vel act one dicuntur quidem de corpore chriſti ratione ſpecierum ſed impropriè figuratè verè ac propriè dicimus corpus chriſti attolli depont deferri collocari altari againe conſuting former opinion ſome papiſts secundum quod ſicut dicunt chriſtum verè ac propriè vide • tangi ità poſſent dicere eum calefieri frigefieri imò mucidum acidum fieri—at illa nemo planè enim dicere verebor figurae figura erat obſcurio • greg nazianz orat 2 paſch antitypon precioſi corporis orat 2 ad fu •• gorgon gregory nazianzene si quaſi carnales iſta ſuſcipitis laedunt vos non alunt eſt • teſtamento litera quae occidit eum qui non ſpiritualiter iſta quae dicuntus animaduerti • si enim ſecundum literam ſequamur hoc ipſum quod dictum eſt niſi manducaueritis carnem meam corporis chriſti corpus chriſti eſt sacramentum ſanguinis chriſti ſanguis chriſti eſt • ſacramentum fidei fides eſt paulò poſt sicut de ipſo baptiſmo apoſtolus ait conſepulti inquit ſumus rom 6 non euchariſt ſaying sacrament bodie chriſt meaning called body chriſt ſecondly baptiſme apostle ſaith ſaith buried therein ſaith ſignifie sepulcher flatly ſaith buried calling sacrament ſigne ſo great thing name thing ſelfe none may henceforth call hereticall expoſition proteſtants hold auguſtines iudgement may thought ſound catholicall doth furthermore hold locutio praeceptiua flagitium aut facinus vetan • aut vtilitatem aut bene ficentiam iubens non eſt figura • ſi autem flagitium aut facinus videtur iubere aut vtilitatem ac beneficentiam vetare figurata eſt niſi manducaueritis carnem catholicae eccleſiae fortaſſe etiam nec cypriani nam vt ſuprá diximus maior par • theo • ogorum •• aquam non eſſe de neceſſitate sacramenti bellar ib therefore vrge commonly onely neceſſitatem iſſued chriſts ſide ſaith confundantur armenij qui non admiſcent myſterijs aquam vin • non • nim • r • du •• vt videtur quod aqua ex latere egreſſaſit theophylact protestant appeale sect 3 5 firſt reaſon giue reader leaue wonder theſe men wit ſeeke ſuch odde obſeruations draw proteſtants within compaſſe hereſie armenian iudged hereticks mixing water wine euchariſt onely reaſon mixing hereticall greateſt aduerſary hath truly confeſſed non defuerunt qui ſolum vinum offerendum cenſerent ij fuerunt armeni vt patres trullani concilij affirmant 32 cauſam autem cur armeni • ſententiam deſc • derint reſert nicephorus lib 18—vbi ſcribit armenos non miſcere aquam vino ſacrificio ne ſignificare videantur vnionem duarum naturarum chriſto quam ipſi non credunt bella • lib 4 • euchar cap 10 § non defuerunt elſe let v ſuppoſe theophylact becauſe denied water iſſued chriſts ſide leſt thereby might ſeeme confeſſe vnion two nature christ neceſſary article chriſtian faith man ſhall refuſe take king manichee heretically celebrate euchariſt onely one kind bread wine allow becauſe imagined wine haue bene created euill ſpirit therefore anciently condemned hereticks would apologiſts hold conſcionable proteſtants accuſe romaniſts hereſie manichee becauſe diſtribute euchariſt element bread wine nay would rather reiect accuſation altogether iniurious ſaying manichee abſtinence wine reaſon forbearance iudged hereticall yet ſo friuolous vncircumſpect haue apologiſts bene cannot reckon proteſtants among armenian except wil likewiſe impound owne romaniſts among manichee might ſerue anſwer vnto next inſtance followeth romish apologie father ſixt councell concil 6 conſtantinop 32 ſaith • imu quod armenianorum regione vinum tantùm ſacra menſa offerunt aquam illi non miſcentes qui ſacrificium incruentum peragunt vſage councell condemneth ſaying againſt nam iacobus domini noſtri ieſu chriſti ſrater c ba • ilius caeſariae archiepiſcopus c myſtico nobis ſcripto tradito ſacrificio ita peragendum ſacro myſterio ex aqua vino ſacrum poculum ediderunt constantinople aboue thouſand yeares ſince alledged ibidem vt ſupra iames liturgie proofe foreſaid mixture protestant appeale sect 2 7 contemne ſo farre condemned pope damn • ſſe quidem honorium ſed ex falſa informatione ac promdè errâſſe bellarm lib 4 de pont • 11 § quodſi § ad tertium honorius hereſie againe greeke councell
