miniſterium concil conſtantinop 6 52 hunc canonem non obſeru eccleſia occidentalis niſi ſola paraſceue quando miſſa non con • icitur euchariſtia ſed ſumitur pridie eius diei conſecrata habent graeci inos quoſdam peculiares ritus plero • ue neutiquam probandos surius tom 2 conc fol 1048 cum canonem surius west meaning romane church doth obſerue becauſe grecian ſaith haue diuers peculiar rite allowable 8 againe ſame councell determineth thus quoniam intelleximus romanorum ciuita • e ſanctis quadragefimae ieiunijs eius sabbatis ieiunari praeter eccleſiaſticam trad • tam conſequentiam ſanctae synodo viſum eſt vt romanorum quoque eccleſia inconc • ſſè vires habeat canon qui di • si quis clericus inuentus fuerit ſancto dominico vel sabbato ieiunans praeter vnum ſolum deponatur ſin autem la • cu ſegregetur 55 becauſe vnderstand church rome vſe faſting vpon saturdayes iewes sabboth contrarie vnto eccleſiasticall order ſeemeth good vnto holy synode romane church alſo canon force c herein taking authority reforme church rome poſſible romaniſts ſhould accord vnto canon let one ſpeake fellowes canon ſaith hic quoque canon qui matrem omnium eccleſiarum romanam eccleſiam reprehendit non recipitut nam tametſi hic c • tatur canon apoſtolicus 65 margine concilij attamen certum eſt quemadmodum epiphanius quoque dicit poſſe ſancto propoſito omnibus diebus ieiunati eſt autem veriſin •• le apoſtolicum canonem p • r • nere ad marcioniſtas qui vt idem epiphanius teſtis eſt • die • eiun aba • inuidi • dei ſudaeorum qui sabbato ab omni ſuo opere quieuiſſet surius ibidem surius receiued v becauſe reprooueth romame church mother church indeed contemning councell reiect ſo much becauſe er • e leſt themſelues might ſeeme haue erred onely leſt church might ſeeme thing ſubiect reproofe church 9 obſeruation aduerſaries compaſſed within horne dilemma eſteeme canon councell inconcuſſible vndoubted authoritie deduction argument thence artificiall deluſion thinke authoritie councell inuiolable ſay apologiſts aboue binius tom 3 accounteth haue n • anno 608 thouſand yeares ſince make decree expreſſe reproofe reformation church rome yet ſhall diſclaime church therefore refuſing nihil addere minuere mutare liceat bellarm lib 1 de sacram ingenere cap 21 mutare materiam sacramentorum graue ſacrilegium eſt ibidem matter word euerie sacrament muſt inſtituted ordained god alterable man either addition diminution alſo cum non habeatur ex scriptura conijciatur tamen ex hoc quòd de latere eius exiuit ſanguis aqua bonauentura 4 sent diſt 11 part 2 dub 6 non legimus dominum poſuiſſe aquam richard 4 sent diſt 11 art 3 q 1 〈◊〉 1591 practiſe mixture water cannot read scripture found firſt inſtitution sacrament lay foundation building line direction yet becauſe aduerſaries commonly although indiſcreetly reiect ſuch argument taken negatiuely scripture muſt put mind ſame kind argument vſed like queſtion pope iulius therefore condemned diuerſe abuſes euchariſt viz vſing audiuimus quoſdam ſchiſmatica ambitione detentos contra diuinos ordines apoſtolicas inſtitutiones lac pro vino diuinis officijs dedicare alios autem intinctam euchariſtiam populo pro complemento communionis po •• igere quoſdam etiam expreſſum vinum sacramento dominici calicis offer • e alios verò pannum lineum muſto intinctū per totum annum reſeruare tempore ſacrificij partem eius aquâ lauare ſic offerre quod quám ſit euangeli •• apoſtolicae • itati contrarium conſuetudini eccleſiaſticae aduerſum non difficile ab ipſo fonte veritatis probabitu •• à quo—ordinata ipſa sacramentorum myſteria proceſſerunt cum enim magiſter veritatis verum ſalutis noſtrae ſacrificium ſuis commendaret diſcipulis nulli lac ſed panem tantùm calicem ſub hoc sacramento cognoſcimus dediſle legitur enim euangelica veritate accepit ieſus panem calicem benedicens dedit diſcipulis ſu •• ceſſet ergo lac ſacrificando offern quia manifeſtum euidens veritatis exemplum illuxit quia praeter panem vinum aliud offerri non licc • illud verò quod pro complemento communionis intinctam euchariſtiam tradunt populis nec hoc prolatum ex euangelio teſtimonium receperunt vbi corpus ſuum apoſtolis commendauit ſanguinem ſeorſim enim panis ſeorſim calicis commendatio memoratur apud gratianum de conſecrat diſt 2 cùm omne crimen milke ſtead wine wringing grape ſopping bread contrarie euangelical truth bread cup c manifeſt euident example truth neither find goſpel ſopped bread commended bread chalice ſeuerally vnto therefore muſt aduerſaries thinke proteſtants pardonable onely alſo commendable vſe ſame reaſon againſt mixture water pope iulius hath enforced againſt mingling bread euen becauſe agreeable vnto expreſſe forme firſt inſtitution deliuered goſpell 12 againe sacrament type ſigne chriſts obſerued viz ſingularitie perſon one man ſhortneſſe reigning three yeares halfe 2 two obſeruations • x hoc habemus ſecundum argumentum pontificem non eſſe antichriſtum ſi enim antichriſtus vna tantùm eſt perſona pontifex autem multi fuerunt erant eadem dignitate poteſtate praediti ceriè alibi quaerendus eſt antichriſtus quàm romana ſede bellar lib 3 de rom pont cap 3 fine quinta demonſtratio ſumitur duratione antichriſti antichriſtu • non regnabit niſi tres annos dimidium papa iam regnauit mille quinge • • annos nec poteſt vllus aſſignari qui regnauit praeciſe • re annos cum dimidio non igitur papa eſt antichriſtus bellarm ibid cap 8 princip cardinall hath vrged two argument proue pope yet hath bene antichrist ſame purpoſe haue apologiſts obiected caſe acknowledged teſtimonies father antiquis patribus cum ipſotertu pugnat c bellar lib 3 de rom pont cap 2 § non cardinall vnderſtood falſe prophet generall ſingular one expoſition repugnant vnto ancient father text ſelfe ſaid oppoſition ſhall come owne name betokening ſome ſingular one thus hath one cardinall ſometime ieſuite oppugned expoſition proteſtants yet another order high eſteeme euen maldonate notwithſtanding leont theophyl beda • uthym theodorus mopſ apollinar quod autem dicit si quis non eſt dubitantis ſed generaliter potiùs affirmantis quaſi dicat quiſquis alius nomine ſuo veniet • um recipietis adeò peruerſi eſtis iudicij quare magi conuenit vt non ſolùm de antichriſto ſed de omnibus falſis prophetis generaliter interpretemur qui currebant non mitterentur familiare enim erat iudaeis eos potiùs quàm veros reciper • prophetas sub chriſti tempore nonnullos veniſſe qui ſe meſſiam eſſe mentiti fuerint conſtat ex act 5 36 ex euſeb lib 4 hiſt 6 matth 24 5 23 qui veniebant nomine chriſti quia alius veniet nomine ſuo id eſt non agnoſcet deum aliquem bellar quo ſuprà nomine ſuo licet nomine chriſti c mald • n ieſ see immediatly order nomine ſuo quia reuera nullam habet diuinam virtutem ſed ibid staplet de dect▪ cap 3 5 theſe pronounes thou thee expreſſe ſay ſingular perſon peter onely true therefore summus pontifex cum totā eccleſiā docet quae ad fidem pertinent • ulla cauſa erra • e poteſt probatur ex promiſſione illa domini • uc 22 simon simon aui pro te vt nō deficiat fides tua▪ tu e petra c bellar l 4 de pent cap 3—secundū priuilegiú petri manauit ad ſucceſſores ibid ego pro te oraui c fine dubio aliquid chriſtus impetraba • petro vt patet ex deſignatione certae perſonae—q • od etiā ad papa ſucceſſores eius pertinet bellar li 4 de rom pont cap • § altera expoſitio therefore pope ſay cannot erre faith euident promiſe chriſt vnto peter ſaid peter haue praied thee c thou art rock expreſsing one certain perſon peter therefore doubtleſſe ſame priuiledges deſcend romam prima eſt cap 11 apoc vbi iohannes dicit henoc heliam pugnatu • o cum antichriſto hieruſalem lbi occidendos vbi dominus corum chriſtus occidendus eſt chitraeus qui vult hanc vibem eſſe romam praetermittit illa verba quaſi ad rem non pertinerent vel ipſe ea non intelligiſſet bellar lib 3 de pont cap 13 § venio anſwer eaſie chriſt ſaid crucified member ſpake saul ieruſalem muſt whether haue bene pope abundantly fulfilled may appeare abſolute profeſſion romiſh church wherin two pope challenge ecce duo gladij eccleſia ſcilicet cum apoſtoli loquetentur non reſpond • dominus mini eſt ſed ſatis eſt certè qui tempota • em gladium poteſtate petti eſſe negat mal • attendit verbum domini proferentis conuerte gladium tuum vaginam vterque ergo eſt poteſtate eccleſiae ſpiritualis ſcili • e • gladius materialis▪ ſed pro eccleſia ille verò ab eccleſia—nam veritate teſtante ſpiritualis poteſtas terrenam poteſtatem inſtituere habet iudicare ſi bona non fuerit sic de eccleſiaſtica poteſtate verificatur vaticinium ieremiae • ecce conſtitu • te bodie ſuper gens regna caetera quae ſequuntur ergo ſi deu • terrena poteſtas iudicabitur à ſpiritu • l • • deniat ſpiritualis minor à ſuo ſuperiori ſi verò ſuprema • ſolo deo non ab homine poſsit iudicari teſtante apoſtolo sp • ritualis homo omnia iudicat • nemine iudicatur bonifa • ius octau • extrauag c vnam ſanctam two ſwords viz ſuperflua • nam finis aduentus eius erat redemptio humani generis ad quam poteſtas regia non erat neceſſaria ſed ſola ſpiritualis bellarm lib 5 de r • pont • ap 4 poteſtatem pa • iendi re aduerſas chriſtus ſibi ac ſuis elegit—intimating pope poteſtatem faciendi re animoſe ſuſcepit sanderus lib 2 de clauib dauid cap 13 haue vndertaken regall power treadeth vnder feete neck monarch farre vnlike antichriſtianitie thought proper vnto 32 popedome degree ſpirituall perfection diſſoluing vow pouertie behold patterne hypocriſie otherwiſe could owne camera apoſtolica aſſimilatur mari quod intrant omnia flumina non exundat ſic iſtam portantur millia pondo auri attamen non impletur—in qua ſunt multae languiſugae quae dicunt affer affer theoder •••• niem vn ••• tract 6 cap 37 vt refert polanu • dan 11 pag 399 addeth fredericus gregorio nono excommunicatus centum millibus auri vncijs abſolutionem emit vt teſtatur onuphrius guicciardinus alexander lextus cardin • le aliquot ditiores vene • tollendos conſtituit vt eorum opibus ditatus profuſiſſimè largiretur vt teſtatur onuph alex 6 iohannes 22 moriens aerario reliquit viginti quinque aureorum ducatorum milliones vt ait franci • cu petrarcha bonifacius 9 centum millia florenorum ex vnius regni prouincia exiguo temporis ſpacio ex indulgentijs contrarit hactenus polanus noſter author haue compared chamber romane see vnto sea whereinto flouds gold flow noting among pope one haue taken abſolution hundred thouſand ounce gold another haue murthered diuerſe cardinal enrich himſelfe treaſures third haue left treaſurie fiue twenty thouſand million duckets fourth haue gathered forbeare haue mentioned tolles ſtewes indulgence hundred thouſand florens prouince one kingdome ſhort time fift able one time leeſe myter clemens quintus pompa coronationis carbunculum vnum precij ſex millium aur • orum à tia • ſua amiſit platina de eiu • vita paulus 2 publicè prodiens mitram gerebat qua multae opes erant coemptis omne genus pretioſis lapidibus inſpici ab hominibus voluit admiratione haberi platina de eius vita iewel worth ſixe thouſand crownes glorying myter beſet kind precious ſtones yet theſe accounted ſucceſſors pouerty 33 may ſuſpect pope themſelues pretend godlineſſe euē extreme wickedneſſe ſeeing gloſſers authorized record memory euery pope though neuer ſo graceleſſe iohn 12 deſcribed themſelues haue bene iohannes 12 erat venator lubricus incorrigibilis vict relect 2 prop 23 ab adoleſcentia omni turpitudine probris contaminatus—ſceletatiſſimus vel monſtrum potius platina de eius vita monſter wickedneſſe yet hic erat pontificum omnium ferè deterrimus bellarm lib 2 de r • pont cap 29 almost wickedest pope remembrance godlineſſe inſtiling euery one thus dudum bonae memoriae bonifacius papa octauus c extrauag lib 5 cap dudum thus benedict ninth inſt •• e boniface eight whereupon gloſſe driuen queſtion thus sed quaero quidam papa ex actionibus impijs ſimonijs turpiloquijs eccleſiam foedauit vt hic numquid propter • ctos actus dici poteſt malae memoriae reſolueth dico quòd non quia reſpici debet non ad id quod fecit ſed ad id quod facere decuit proueth • canon lawes vnde malus praelatus ſi non habeat diadema ſanctitatis habet tamen diadema dignitatis quae non de ſe peccauit licet perſona cui dignitas inerat malè egerit propter quod dignitas ſibi coniuncta infecta erat—item praelatus etſi non ſit bonus tamen pro bono ponitur againe followeth praelatus non dicitu • bonae memoriae ratione ſuppoſiti ſed ratione dignitatis quae non de ſe peccauit nec delictum perſonae redundat damnum eccleſiae gloſſa eum loc • authorized pope gregory 13 reaſon leroboam pilate iudas haue deſerued record bonae memoriae pope good godly memory becauſe ſay herein reſpect became haue done reaſon like honour bonae memoriae belongeth vnto ieroboam among king balaam among prophet iudas among apoſtles 34 concluſion imagine state world capable height like hypocriſie diſſimulation eſſe mentem à qua haud dubie emittuotur ſuauiſſ • mi incenſi odores vota inquam preces ex conſcientia puriore origen contra celſum lib 8 pag 756 et poſteà diſquirat igitur quicunque velit ara iſtos reproch impietie yea alſo cardinal bellarmine although vpon coniectur • confeſſeth meere ſuch teſtimonies bellarmine anſwere •• • acilis eſt ſolu •• nam illis temporibus chriſtiani diligenter cauebant theſe obiectors haue dealt vncōſcionably ſuggeſting vnto reader oppoſition doctrine betweene centuriſts thoſe father ſo great queſtion call sacrifice ſuch place wherein centuriſts haue profeſſed proued vndoubted accordance 8 teſtimonies following obiected thinke like art therefore deſerue like anſwer ſufficeth v know owne ieſuite cannot perceiue thing father ſo direct romiſh partie forced anſwer father purpoſely ſpake theſe thing obſcurely morem fuiſle patrum vt de rebut fidei cum nondum eſlent apertè ſatis controuerſiae ab haereticis morae ſecurius atque ſimplicius ſcriberent loquerentur quia putabant ſe non niſi catholicè ab omnibus intelligi ne myſ • erium ••• dendum infidelibus exponere • t▪ ſi ſermonibu • popularibus ſententiam ſuam nimis claris verbis explic • ſſen • cardinall bellarmine doth argue againſt proteſtants thus si patres exiſtimarent • uchariſtiam ſolum eſſe ſacramentum non etiam ſacrificium vt aduerſarij ſentiunt nulla eſſet cauſa cur aliter loquerentur de euchariſtia quàm de baptiſmo nuſquam autem patres baptiſmum vocant sacrificium nec dicunt baptiz eſſe ſacrificare vel immolare praeteres quae cauſa eſſet cur patres de sacramento al • ter loqu • rentur quàm aduerſarij noſtri loquuntur quomodo enim credibile erit veteres patres modo loquendi nobiſcum ſententia cum aduerſarijs conueniſſe bellar lib 1 de miſſa cap 15 § hic igitur father thought euchariſt sacrament onely alſo ſacrifice meaning properly could haue ſpoken otherwiſe eucharist baptiſme father ſaith neuer call baptiſme ſacrifice ſay baptize ſacrifice concludeth hereupon word ſacrifice vſed father proper literall ſence whereby doth obſcurely grant vſe word ſacrifice attributed ancient father vnto euchariſt might indeed interpreted taken metaphorically vnproperly could ſhewed ſame father applied ſame word ſacrifice vnto sacrament baptiſme otherwiſe leſuite suarez would ſo vrgently haue moued reader principally multis concilijs vt toletano brachorenſi laodicen vocatur incruentum ſacrificium—solum eſt obſeruandū propter haereticos qui hic etiā detorquent ad metaphoram nomen sacrificium sanctos patres nun quam vocáſſe miniſterium baptiſmi aut alterius sacramenti nomine sacrificij cum tamen sacrificium metaphoricè ſumptum • conueniat cùm ergo euchariſtiā frequentiſsimè abſolutiſsimè sacrificium vocant ſignum eſt co • propriè de ſacrificio loqui suarez ieſ tom 3 diſp 74 sect 2 pag 952 obſerue againſt hereticks ſo calleth proteſtants holy father ancient time neuer call miniſterie baptiſme name ſacrifice although metaphorically might ſo termed therefore ſaith ſigne often call eucharist ſacrifice name ſo properly 21 seeing therefore parallele baptiſme may giue aduerſaries demaunded ſatisfaction deſire firſt conſult auguſtine expounding place vnto heb 10 voluntariè peccantib nobis poſtquàm accepimus ſcientiam veritatis non adhuc relinquitur ſacrificium p • ope • catis— hebr cap 10 vnto ſinne voluntarily haue obtained knowledge truth remaineth hoſt ſacrifice ſinne ſaith illud ad hebraeos qui diligentiùs pertractant ſic intelligunt vt non de ſacrificio contribulati per poe ••• entiam cordis accipiendum ſit quod dictum eſt non adhuc pro peccatis relinquitur sacrificium ſed de ſacrificio de quo 〈◊〉 loquebatur apoſtolus id eſt holocauſto dominicae paſsionis quod eo tempore •• ert quiſque pro peccatis ſuis quo 〈◊〉 paſsionis fide dedicatur chriſtianorum fidelium nomine baptizatus imbuitur vt hoc ſignificaret apoſtolus non poſſe • inceps cum qui peccauerit iterum baptizando purgati— •• tamen illud ſacrificium de quo loquebatur id eſt h • l • canſtum domini quod tunc pro vnoquoque offertur quodammodo cum eius nomine baptizando ſignatur iterum ſi perm • nſerit offerri non poteſt non • elinquitur pro peccatis ſacrificium hoc eſt non poſ • • nuò baptizari nec tamen omnis qui non accipit per doctrinam ſcientiam veritatis debet arbitrari poſſe pro ſe illud oſterri ſacrificium ſi iam oblatum 〈◊〉 eſt ſi iam eiu • dem veritatis poſt baptiſmum sacramenta percepit non pot • ſt iterum baptizari auguſt • 4 expoſ ad •• pag 1185 vſque ad pag 1187 euerie one baptized faith chriſt doth therein offer vp interpretation furthermore end senſum hunc habere poſſunt non eſſe hoſtiam illam cruentam chriſti crucifixi •• quam pro baptizatis delin quentibus neque ſi •• ilem rurſus baptiſmum omninò renouantem hoſtiam appellauerint ideoque dixerint non ſupereſſe hoſtiam pro peccatis quia baptiſmus repeti non poteſt sanè quia baptiſmo commotimur per hoc sacramentum applicatur nobis hoſtia crucis ad plenam peccati remiſsionem hinc illi per baptiſma tranſlatitiè hoſtiam nuncupârunt poſt baptiſma ſemel acceptum nullam hoſtiam eſſe reliquam interpretati ſunt quia baptiſmus ſecundus non eſt melchior canu • would proue word hoc facite doth catalogue ancient father cite one find interpreteth facite ſacrificate neither indeed ſo enforced cardinall • ertur pronomen hoc non tantu • ad ſumptionem ed ad alia omnia quae mox chriſtus feciſſe dicitu • nen pe accipere p • nem grat • agere benedicere ac verbis ſuis conſecrate hoc eſt corpus meum frangere ſu •• ianſenius concord cap 131 〈…〉 ianſenius truly noteth pronoune hoc referred onely taking euchariſt vnto thoſe particular chriſt ſaid forthwith haue done namely taking bread giuing thanks bleſsing breaking c 34 reaſons taken theſe word giuen broken ſhed interprete ſignifie habemus alia tri • argumenta tribus verbis datur frangitur funditur quae ſunt tempo • prae • enti • q • ae non ſignificant da • aut effundi apoſtolis ad manducandum bibendum ſed dari effundi deo ſacrificium nam n •• ait dominus vobis datur frangitur effunditur ſed pro vobis dicit kemnitius haec referri ad crucem vt ſ • ſenſns hoc eſt c • rpu • meum quod poſt dabitur pro vobis ad mortem quod enim paulo poſt futurum eſt dicitur iam fieri vt vbi ſcri ••• r puer natus eſt agnus occiſus eſt c et ſunt aliae lectiones quae habent futuro effundetur reſpondeo canon miſſae▪ vulgata editio luc 22 cyprianus legunt effundetur—vtraque eſt vera giuing euchariſt becauſe ſaid giuen preſenttence ſo word must betoken way ſacrifice thought ſufficient collection vnto cardinall himſelfe without admittance nulla negari debet praeſertim prima quae eſt praeſenti quia non oportet negare ſimplicem literalem ſenſum ſine vrgen • iſſima ratione bellarm lib 1 〈…〉 cap 12 twofold ſence one text ancient cardinall ought rather preuaile ſaith • uangeliſtae voce praeſentis effunditur paulus frangit • r futuram cruce effuſionem carnis fractionem ſignificarunt—tempore praeſenti grammatico tempus effuſionis fractionis erat tunc praeſens quomam iam inchoatum erat tempur paſſionis ac per hoc ſicut inchoato die poteſt ſignificari praeſenti quicquid fit illo die—praeſens enim grammaticè non propitiatorie sect 14 54 queſtion doctor rapt faction whirlewind contradiction vtrum ſacrificium euchariſtiae conferat gratiam remiſſionem culpae mortalis per ſe ex ſua primaria inſtitutione—prima opinio tenet hoc ſacrificium immediatè ex opere operato conferre infuſionē gratiae habitualis— thinke ſacrifice doth immediatly procure first habituall grace secund • • ententia eſt extremè contraria—hae duae opiniones vt mihi videntur aut erràrunt vel obſcure indiſtinctè locutae ſunt suarez ieſ tom 3 diſp 79 sect 3 others thinke otherwiſe dico hoc sacrificium poſſe nobis impetrare gratiam priniam • iſt peccati mortalis impetrando nobis ſufficientem diſpoſitionem ad huiuſmodi effectum—sed ſupereſt exp • cand • qualis ſit haec impetratio infallibilis ideo dici poſſit ex opere operato non vtramque enim partem graues rationes coniecturae occurrunt ſome hold obtaining grace infallible quod enim haec impetratio incerta ſit cenſent durandus cano cordub • —aliorum verò ſententia eſt hunc effectum eſſe infallibilem aliqua ratione ex vi alicinus promiſſionis idē quo ſuprà pag 1010 ſome ſay vncertaine maintaine ſacrifice doth propitiate procure pardon prima opinio eſt vt oblatio ſacra culpas etiam mortales remittere poſſit atque adeò gratiam conferre melchior canus loc theol lib 12 § huni • paulo poſt mortall ſinnes others denie pretend haec prima vera non eſt niſi omnes theologi fallantur qui vno ore animoue diſſentiunt si enim culpae mortales per sacrificium ſoluerentur poenitentiae ſacramentum non eſt ad ſalutem neceſſarium vbi enim sece • • ca • emel oblato ſacrificio deleſſet non eſſet opus eiuſdem denuò culpas alio remedio extinguere—quid quod ita culpas mortales vniuerſas per hoc ſacrificium ſine confeſſione remitterent—ex quo ambroſij catharini deliratio patet peccata omnia poſt baptiſmum admiſſa per ſacrificium altar • remitti idem ibidem lib 12 § ha •• trium fol 432 common conſent attribute vnto power remiſſion alij ſentiunt valere ad remiſsionem etiam cu • parum ſed tantum venialium—venialia peccata vt gratia hominem non priuant ita ſine gratia remitti poſſe greg valent ieſ lib 1 de miſſa cap 5 onely veniall ſinnes euen ſuch ſay may pardoned without grace yet whether remit thoſe veniall ſinnes mediatly immediatly vtrum immediatè per ſe peccata venialia deleat ex opere operato ita vt ſacrificium miſſae pro oblatum nihil cogitante aut ſciente remitta • cu • pa omnes veniales abſque omni actu meo quo illas formaliter vel virtute deteſter ſed ſolùm quod obicem actualis vel virtualis complacentiae non ponam partem affirmatiuam docuit cano—quam dicit eſſe certiſ •• ententiam communi omnium patrum ac scholaſticorum authoritate probatam neminem tamen particulari reſert neque antiquis scriptoribus ego inuenio ita expreſſè declaratū quanquam recentiores ſuprà citati praeſertim soto cordub • id ſentire videntur— ſome affirme sic nuda opinio negat hoc ſacrificium remittere culpas veniales ex opere operato immediatè per ſe—neque enim repugnat deum remittere veniale peccatum ſine infuſione habitualis gratiae ſine actu peccatoris atque adeò ſine phyſica mutatione illius quia cum veniale peccatum non relinquat propriam maculam quae priuationem alicuius doni includat c suarez ieſ tom 3 diſp 79 sect 5 pag 1013 ſome gaineſay beſides third kind profeſſe auailable propitiation againſt ſinne gaine sunt porti • nem aliquam eff • ctus quem hoc ſacrificium habet ex opere operato pro arbitrio ſuo diſtribuendam—sed quo • ad hanc portionem à ſacerdote diſpenſandam attinet miſſam intentione peculiari vinculis ſoluta hinc exceſſerit protinus hilaré ad dominum ſu • conuolare beatitudinem que imaginatione percipere paulo poſt nunc • vitae mortis domine caeſarium ſuſcipe taquam primitias quaſdam noſtrae peregrinationis nazianan landē caeſarij nazianzene praying departed ſoule caeſarius ille quidem abijt ſibi regnu • quod non depoſuit ſed mutauit tabernacula chriſti iure pictatis aſcitus illam ſupremam hieruſalem vbi nunc poſitus dicit sicut audiuimus ita vidimus cruitate virtutum ciuitate dei noſtri little after▪ ipſe ad chriſti peruenit requiem manet lumine ſanctorum coetibus gloriatur 1 prayeth ſame place da requiem domine perfectam ſeruo tuo theodoſio requiem illam quam praeparaſti ſanctis tuis dilexi eum nec igitur eum deſeram donec fletu precibus inducam virum quò • ua merita vocant montem dei ſanctum ambroſ de obit theodoſ againe qui ſine baptiſmo mortuus eſt non dub • ta • u de meritis valentiniam credamus vel angelorū teſtimonijs quòd deterſâ labe peccati abſolutus aſcendit quam ſua fides lau • credamus quia aſc • ndit ab • ido inculto loco ad fl • rente delectationes vbi cum fratre coniunctus aeternae vitae fruit •• voluptate neuertheleſſe little vos viz two brother omnibus oblationibus frequentabo ambroſ de obit • val •• ambroſe praying two emperor theodoſius valentinian offering oblation ſoules notwithſtanding ſame father pronounced thoſe emperours alreadie haue beene poſſeſſours pleaſures life heauenly ieruſalem nunc pro peccatis meae matris deprecorte per medicinam vulnerum noſtrorum quae pependit ligno ſedens ad dextram tuam te interpellat pro nobis dimitte domine dimitte obſecro ne intres cum ea iudicium ſuperexultet miſe • icordia iudicium quoniam eloquia tua vera ſunt little repreſſing himſelfe et credo iam feceris quod rogo ſed voluntaria oris mei approba domine auguſt confeſſ lib 9 cap 13 auguſtine euen beleeued mother freed puniſhments yet ſent forth dimitte ſoule 4 beſides reade memento domine omnium dormientium del • uerit no ad ſua iuſtiſſima iudicia tranſtulerit cap 12 deinceps miniſtri promiſſis veris quae feruntur scripturis diuinis de noſtra ſacra reſurrectione recitatis ſanctè canunt cantus pſalmorum qui idem valent item tunc miniſtrorum primus catechumenos demittit ſancto ue qui iam dormierunt praedicant cum quibus pari laudatione dignum iudicat eum qui paulò ante exceſsit è vita hortaturue point romiſh praiers though preoccupation confuted ſuch conceit teacheth quod autem no à diuinis praeceptoribus noſtris de precatione quâ antiſtes eo qui mortuus eſt vtitur traditum accepi • u neceſſariò exponendum eſt diuinus antiſtes interpres diuinorū iudiciorū angelus enim domini eſt didicit ergo • scripturis c • ariſ • imá vitam pro dignitate ac meritis cuiuſque tribui diuina orare obſecra • non ignoro te reſponſurum vt defunctus requiem adipiſcatur propitium iudicem inueniat ergo de rebus flendum vlulandum arbitraris nonne vides quàm maximè tibi ipſe repugnas nam cum volabit etiamſi nemo obſequijs interueniat idem io • 〈◊〉 6▪ lamentation death 〈2 page missing〉 ſelfe maketh firmeſt footing quae ſunt iſta pec • ata quae impediunt ingreſſum regnum dei vt tamen sanctorum amicorum mer • ti impetrent indulgentiam di • ficillimū eſt inuenire ego ce •• è vſque ad hoc tempus cum inde ſatagerem ad eorū indaginem peruenire non potui auguſt l 21 de ciuit de cap 27 ſpeaking pain purgatory life ſaith thus vtrū ita ſit quaeri poteſt non tedarguo quòd forſitan • e • um ibid lib 21 cap 26 peraduenture rather ſubſcribe noli frater contra diuina tam multa tam clara tam indubitata teſtimonia colligere velle calumnias ex epiſcoporū ſcriptis ſiue noſtrorum ſicut hilarij ſiue antequàm par donati ſepararetur ipſius vnitatis ſicut cypriani agrippini 1 quia hoc genus literarum ab authoritate canonis diſtinguendum eſt non enim ſic loquuntur tanquá ita ex ijs teſt • moniū proferatur • contra ſentire non louse ſicubi fortè aliter ſapuerit quàm veritas poſtulat eo quippe numero ſumus vt non dedignemur etiam nobis • ctum ab apoſtolo accipere ſi quid aliter ſapitis id quoque deus reuelabit auguſt epiſt ad vincent giuing v liberty diſſent ſome caſes doth alſo thus patrum place wherin think ancient patriaiks prophet faithful detained chriſts death imagined limbus eſſe owne doctrine hath long ſince bene broken vp quartus eſt limbus patrū qui eſt ſuprema parte inferni quo ineſt tantùm poen damni temporalis nunc autem eſt vacuus bellarm lib 2 de purg cap 6 diſſolued neuertheleſſe ſeeing queſtion brought among chiefeſt controuerſies little concerne v trauerſe point methodically queſtioning firſt whether apologiſts haue dealt ſincerely witneſſes sect 2 2 may ſuffer reader miſguided name thaddaeus ignatius iohns ſcholer though doctrine ſo apoſtolically ancient ignatius ſpeaketh ſoules deliuered ſuppoſed hell verè non hominum opinione crucifi • u eſt mortuus vidétibus coeleſtibus vt angelis terreſtribus vt iudaeis romani infernis vt multitudine eorum qui cum domino reſurrexerunt multa enim inquit scriptura sanctorum corpus • ormientium reſurrexerunt monumentis patefactis deſcendit ad inferos ſolus aſcendit verò cum multitudine ſcidit maceriam quae à ſeculo erat medium parietem eius diſſoluit reſurrexit intra tres dy ignatiu • epiſt ad trallenſ body dead reſurrection chriſt raiſed vnto life ſhall raiſed laſt generall reſurrection iuſt chryſoſt luc 16 concluſione concionis 3 chryſoſtome name place scripture called abraham boſome place eam igitur regionem propter immenſam illam diſtantiam ſublimitatis profunditatis dico etſi non coeleſtem tamen altiorem inferis tertull l 4 aduerſus marcion cap 34 tertullian iudged haue bene heauen yet farre higher hell auguſtine leaueth place quod dixero fratres hoc ſi non vobis tanquam certus expoſuero ne ſuccenſeatis homo enim ſum quantum conceditur de scripturtis ſanctis tantum audeo dicere nihil ex infernum nec ego expertus ſum nec vos fortaſſis alia via erit non per infernum erit incerta ſunt enim haec auguſt pſal 85 doubtfull yet reſolueth sinus abrahae non aliquam partem inferni credendum eſſe ſatis opinor apparet ex illis magiſtri verbis inter no vos chaos magnum libertas cui non ſolùm coactio verumetiam neceſſitas repugnet illa dicuntur libera à neceſsitate quae pro arbitrio poſlumus velle non velle bellar lib 3 de lib arb cap 4 proteſtants ſay aduerſaries acknowledge man freedome coaction force freedome neceſsitie freedome conſisteth may liſt wheras libertatem à neceſſitate probamus per concilium tridentinum seſſ 6 cap 5 dicit hominem liberè conſentire diuinae inſpirationi quippe quam reijcere etiam poteſt et 4 dicit liberum arbitrium ſicut conſentire ita diſſentire poſſe—tunc tota quaeſtio erat de libertate neceſsitate quam ſolam negant haeretici c bellar ib cap 5 § ex definitione concilium tridentinum ad v • um libertatis requirit poteſtatem diſtentiendi repugnandi diuinae motioni suarez varia epuſc de au • il grat pag 463 tract breuis reſolutio c num 26 concilium tridentinum libertatem conſtituit indifferentia electionis quia ſcilice • liberum arbitrium immediatè ante electionem poſsit eligere aſſentire diſſentire ſummatim ſuum vltimum actum edere non edere benius de efficas grat cap 24 pag 443 councell trent hath defined man free ſelfe receiue reiect diuine inſpiration placing freedome indifference election able ſelfe chooſe refuſe diuine motion intelligimus ho haereticos meaning proteſtants non negare quin voluntas noſtra phyſic • operetur quando vult ſed quia phyſicà quadam efficacitate determinatur à deo vt velit per efficaciſsimam voluntatem quá eam praeuenit ideo aiunt noſtram voluntatem paſsiuè ſe habere ea motione vel quia non liberè agit vel certè quia vt morale philoſophi loquuntur non ſe agit ſed agitur à deo quamuis dum agitur ipſa etiam efficiat actum phyſicâ efficientiâ suarez ieſ lib 1 de concurſu cap 12 proteſtants ſay albeit confeſſe worke willeth yet doth ſelfe receiue god inſpiration vnto good acted determinately wrought moſt powerfull operation inſpiration god conſent vnto good 9 aduerſaries would haue reader vnderſtand queſtion concerneth wil man ſtandeth ſtate grace conuerted ſinne vnto repentance ſtate iuſtification cooperamur deo non ſolum vt aduerſarij volunt poſt iuſtificationem ſed etiam ipſa iuſtificatione initio fidei—non niſi cooperantibus nobis deus gratiam noſtram operatur bellar lib 6 de grat lib arbit cap 11 proteſtants ſaith cardinall grant man doth cooperate grace therefore ſumme briefe controuerſie may ioyne doctor stapletons teſtimonie vnto reſt quaeſtio eſt quomodo diuina gratia mentem voluntatem hominis ad ho motus excitet vtrùm ſua ſola operatione euam cooperatione voluntatis—ita vt •• cunque excitante grati • liberè tamen voluntas eam acceptare vel repudiate poſſit stap • et lib 4 de 〈◊〉 1 whether grace firſt moueth exciteth vnto good motion doth worke conſent alone whether haue ſelfe power freely conſent reſiſt euery ſuch motion romaniſts pleade power man proteſtants efficacie god grace according promiſe eſtabliſh doctrine ſuffragies voice learned romaniſts produce fiue confeſſed conſequences aduerſaries concluding againſt romiſh doctrine freewill firſt taken naturall facultie sect 5 10 quaeſtio tractari ſolet ſit ne officium lib arbit agere vel pati fiue quod idem eſt ſit ne voluntas humana potentia paſſiua actiua sunt de hac theologorum variae ſententiae sententia • iſſima eſt eſſe eam ſimpliciter actiuam bellarm lib 3 de lib arbit cap 10 queſtioned ſaith cardinall whether facultie actiue paſsiue reſolueth ſimply actiue si liberum arbitrium eſſet potentia paſſiua fal • diceretur liberum non enim eſt poteſtate patientis quid ipſo fiat ſed poteſtate agentis eſt quid alio faciat ibid § praeterea becauſe ſaith paſsiue could free shewing defending freedome councell trent found conſiſt indifferencie conſenting conſenting ſpirituall good neceſſarie nature acknowledged ſimply actiue paſſiue otherwiſe cannot iudged ſimply free many ancient profeſſors romiſh schooles namely tres ſunt de hac theologorum ſententiae prima eſt eorum qui humanam voluntatem paſtiuam potentiam eſſe volunt ac docent actum voluntatis produci actiuè à phantaſmate vel ab obiecto cognito vel certe ab ipſa mente apprehendence iudicante obiectum haec eſt ſententia gotrifridi aegidij altera eſt eorū qui volunt partim eſſe actiuū partim paſſ •• ū ita vt ad actionem voluntatis eliciendam cauſae duae concurrant partiales tum ipſa voluntas • etiam obiectum cognitum ſeu ratio proponens obiectum ita docent gregorius gabriel petrus paluda • • cedit caietanus qui ſcribit voluntatem moueri actiuè à ſe ipſa quoad exercitium ab intellectu autem quoad ſpecificationem bellar ibid § prima § altera may adde aquinas bellarmine would anſwer thomas 1 part q 82 art 4 de verit q 22 art 12 intelligimus à thoma vocatam eſſe voluntatem potentiam paſſiuam largo modo nam ipſum moueri ab obiecto per modum finis quoddam pati eſt ſi agere pati ſumantur proomni genere cauſae ibid c 11 § quar ••• argumentum c gottifridus aegidius gregorius gabriel paludanus caietan cardinall bellarmine witneſſeth hold facultie either partly wholy paſsiue therefore theſe doctor neceſſarily confeſſed conſequence ouerthrow romiſh doctrine man firſt conuerſion vnto grace 11 ſecond confeſſed conſequence whereby romiſh freedome ſubuerted taken efficacie god ſpirit determinating neceſſitating man si deus eſſet agens neceſſarium determinaret voluntatem humanam illa non liberè ſed neceſſariò ageret vt aduerſarij admittunt—nam ſi no admittamus ita determinari voluntatem humanam à deo vt non poſſit agere niſi id ad quod à deo determinatur tamen quia deus eam liberè determinat ipſa voluntariè cum pleno iudicio rationis agit contendamus hominem eſſe liberi arbitrij tota controuerſia inter no haereticos erit de nomine profectò labores tot hominum doctiſſimorum ipſius conc oecumenici pro aſſerenda arbitrij libertate conſcripti 〈◊〉 nobis perſuadent bellar lib 4 de lib arb cap 14 § deinde § quodſi ſaith cardinall bellarmine god doth determine man ſo moueth cannot follow inſpiration haue reaſon ſaith contend longer proteſtants concerning liberty man quo ſupra becauſe ſuch determination application god motion doth take away liberty ſo accordingly ieſuite suarez non video quomodo cum hac phyſica determinatione voluntatis libertatis vſus atque exercitiū poſſit conſiſtere suarez ieſ opuſ • tract br •• reſol •• tag 463 cannot ſee ſaith must ſo ij proteſtantes voluntatem efficacitate diuina neceſſitari affirmances arbitrij libertatem tollunt—non autem ſenſu compoſito hominem enim qua vult non poſſe non velle certum eſt qu • e qui praedeterminationē ſuam ſenſu diuiſo obtrudunt cum caluino apertè ſentiunt concilij tridentini decreto refelluntur benius lib de • ffic grat 〈◊〉 12 pag 231 et iſti impenſius adhuc libertatem euertunt quàm caluinus ibid pag 232 ſaith benius diuine padua whoſoeuer attributeth ſuch efficacie vnto diuine motion ouer doth agree protestant diſſent trident councell finally biſhop martinz ſaith power yeeld vnto god determining gratia efficax non differt •• ipſa ab excitante nulla autem gratia excitans habet ex ſe vim determinandi phyſicè voluntatem martinz de auxil grati • 〈◊〉 2 part 3 num 12 vt demonſtratur ex conc trident num 17 iſtiuſmodi determinatio idem prorſus eſt quod neceſſitas •• gendo ib part 4 nu 9 phyſica praedeterminatione poſitâ neceſſariò tollitur vſu • libertatis quod lutherus caluinus intellexerunt poſita gratia praedeterminante ibid num 21 part 7 num 6 reckoneth vp thirtie schoolemen aſſenting doth neceſſarily ouerthrow libertie 12 well confeſſed conſequence viz whoſoeuer doth acknowledge diuine act ſo working man cannot reſiſt power grace muſt neceſſarily obey doth therein denie libertie preſcribed councell trent abilitie indifferently obey obey cardinall bellarmine hath found elder schoole one tenet lacobus almainus moralib cap 1 2 deum ſuo concurſu determinare voluntatem bellarm quo ſupra § pſt igitur almainus suarez noteth illa qualitas vel motio aut entitas aut quouis alio nomine appelletur quam deus prius natura imprimi • voluntari ita illam aff • cit ad vnum inclinat vt ad illud vnum agendum voluntatem formaliter determinet ideò vſus obtit •• vt haec determinatio phyſica dicatur—quâ fit vt licet actus voluntatis fit effectiuè á voluntate tamen determinatio eius • fit actiuè ab illa ſed à deo tantùm voluntate autem fiat paſſiuè quia hac praeuia actione deus eſt agens atque hac ••• one volunt voluntatem conuerti quia ex illa praemotione actione ſolius dei neceſſariò conſequitur suarez op • ſc de 〈◊〉 ſu l 1 cap 5 num 4 hoc doctores nonnulli affirmant ibid moderni ſcriptores ib lib 2 cap 1 num 4 diuerſe doctor preſent age ſuſpecteth inſinuatu • hac obiection • qu • dam • cendi modus quorundam vt fertur louanienſium hom • em 〈◊〉 operari liberè quia exiſtimae ſe operari liberè non quia cùm vera indifferentia operetur ſed determinatus ab alio suar ib lib 1 c 12 nu 14 diuines lo • ame biſhop martinz doth alledge recentiores philoſophi atque etiam ologi ex ſchola thomae ex prioritate diuini concurſus pernicioſè inferunt deum creatas voluntates ad agendum determinare praeſertim actioni ••• ad ſalutē pertinentibus eaſque verbo tantū liberas faciunt autem ipſa neceſſarias martinz de effic grat diſp 2 part 1 nu 1 • schoole thomists benius adioyneth quoniam aduerſus phyſicam praedeterminationem quàm religioſiſſima dominic • norum • amilia • ctè complectutur ac tenet tam acrit • r decertaui beniue de effic grat cap 14 § verum religious order dominican confeſſions haue attributed vnto working grace power determinating applying neceſſarily embrace good ſome alſo vrging quon • authores ſunt qui praedeterm • nationem ſuam ex auguſtini iudicio tueri videntur tanquam opinionis ſuae authoris atque patroni martinz quo ſup diſp 2 part 5 princip nec curanda à nobis ſunt quae iuniores quidam theologi ex varijs ſocis namely father tumultu •• é inutiliter aggerant ibid part 6 princip scio non deeſſe aliquos qui ea quae ſuprà ex patribus proximè ex docto •• bus scholaſticis adduximus conentur eludere ad ſuam aptare opinionem c ibid part 7 num 12 father defence anſwering oppoſite obiestions 13 therefore apologiſts ſay argument drawne confeſsion aduerſaries ſtrong ſhall romaniſts breake threefold cord louaniſts thomiſts dominican together others haue concluſiuely defended ground diuine determination man conſequently bellarmine suarez benius martinz haue formerly argued ouerthrow kind liberty maintained romiſh church againſt doctrine protestant followeth confirmation last conſequence compariſon betweene confeſſed power reaſon grace determinating sect 6 14 cardinall bellarmine beſtoweth halfe chapter eſtabliſh reaſon conſent diuerſe schoolemen truth poſition viz probatur liberum arbitriū eſſe potentiam viz ipſam voluntatem eamque ſic eſſe liberam vt determinetur iudicio practicae rationis bellar lib 3 de lib arb cap 8 quia iudicium vltimum practicum eſt omninò determinatum dicit enim tunc ratio omnibus conſideratis hoc eſt faciendum igitur voluntas neceſſariò e •• get id quod vltimum iudicium determinauit eſſe eligendum nam fi iudicium eſt determinatum ipſa voluntas erit determinata ibid § sexta propoſitio probatur ab experientia quia nemo eſt qu ſ • q •• ratur cur aliquid agat quin reſpondeat quia iudicat eſſe faciendum et á bernardo lib de grat lib • b voluntas agit et •• non ſemper ex ratione tamen non abſque ratione—et ſi cum eſt iudicium determinatum voluntas aliud poſſit eligere aut illud non eligere cum nulla ratio reddi pote • cur voluntas aliud eligeret non iudicatum aut illud iam iudicatum • eligeret atque ita dabitur electio ſine iudicio actio ſine obiecto quod fieri non poſſe oſtendimus—voluntas beatorum eſt determinata onely quoad ſpecificationem etiam quoad exercitium determinata eſt ad vnum quoad ap ••• tum vltimi finis quia iud cium rationis determinatum eſt nec poteſt repraeſentare vltimum finem niſi ſub ratione bon • —accedae quodſi poſſet fieri vt quis aliquid eligeret contra dictamen practici iudicij poſſet etiam fieri vt eſſet volunt ••• peccatum abſque errore vel defectu ratione ſiue intelligentia—contrá illud salomonis prouerb 14 erra • qui operantur malum ibidem rurſu • etſi voluntas ſola ſit formaliter libera radix tamen eius libertatis ratione eſt—rat •• autem non eſt libera quia potentia cognoſcens non eſt capax libertatis—nam haec potentia à natura ſua pendet ab obiecto ab illo mutatur per ſpeciem quam ab illo accipit ibid § septima propoſitio voluntatem eſſe potentiam vnam pa • ticularem radicem eius libertatis eſſe ratione voluntatem pendere determinari à iudicio vltimo practicae ratio ••• ſententia eſt venſſima quam docent thomas 1 sum q 83 art 1 2 3 1 2 q 13 item richardus capreolus ca • ctanus conradus • orum qui thomam ſequi ſolent bellarm ibid cap 7 fine election doth neceſſarily depend vpon last iudgement reaſon neceſſarily determined thing conſidered end laſt act reaſon ſaying muſt done yeeldeth cannot conſent reſolue ſaying whereby hath vndermined whole foundation former defence drawing line determinated neceſſitie doth haue ſaid diſanull freedome reaſon confeſſed ſo ouerrule euerie deliberate action cannot reſiſt may thought deſtroy pretended libertie indeed cardinall bellarmine name challenged owne docet bellarminus vlt vt electio pende neceſſariò ab vltimo iudicio quia poſito iudicio voluntas neceſſariò eligat—et cap 9 lib 3 de grat lib arb vt reſponde obiectioni ſic diſſerebat voluntas eligendo libera eſt non quòd non determinetur neceſſariò à iudicio vltimo practico rationis ſed quòd iſtud ipſum iudicium vltimum practicum poteſtate voluntatis eſt vbi ſanc vt fatear haeſitantiam meam mei tar •• tatem ingenij vix aut ne vix quidem intelligo quo pact • non circulum incidat ratio ſi haec propoſitio cum ſuperiore conferatur nam ſuperiore ſtatutum eſt libertatem rad • cali • er eſſe iudicio practico rationis formaliter voluntate tamen praeſenti illud ipſum iudicium practicum rati • ni ponitur poteſtate voluntatis quod eſſet radicaliter poſitam eſſe voluntate libertatem sed videamus quomodo voluntis quae videri poterat neceſſitate obſtricta iamiam vindicetur libertatem sic igitur pergit cap 9 per hoc quod voluntas election ſiuit ſe mou • ri ab vna ratione propoſita fit vt men omiſſâ aliâ inquiſitione pergat concludat indicium particulate ad quod continuò ſequitur electio itaque libertas voluntatis eo propriè ſita eſſe videtur quòd propoſitis varijs rationibus non neceſſarijs ſinat ſe moueri ab vno non ab alia—sic author iſte ego verò quae eſt ingenij mei imbecillit non ſatis intelligere poſſum qu • cohereāt iſta cum ſuperioribus ſi enim electio voluntatis neceſſari • ſequitur iudicij determinationem ad vnum quomodo habet ſua poteſtate reſiſtere non reſiſtere vel ſinere ſe moueri aut non moueri benius lib de efficac dei auxilio cap 24 benius either recant opinion ſpecified elſe yeeld vnto proteſtants whole cauſe concerning freedome rather freedome man ſpirituall action grace 15 argument hath bene confeſſed act reaſon neceſſarily determinate act grace may equally neceſſitate diſanulleth indifferencie wherein church doth place liberty except ſhall yeeld power vnto reaſon act man natural ſpirit vnto omnipotent efficacie spirit god adde ſpeciall inducement relie vpon iudgement romiſh doctor among diuerſe patron freewill found aſſociates confeſſed heretikes sect 7 16 diuerſe aduerſaries defend freewill confeſſe neceſſitie grace god without beleeue cannot well preſume thereupon opinion gracious enough whether admit outward inward grace god neceſſarie conuerſion man ſin yet vnderſtand aduerſaries witneſſe pelagius non negauit priora auxilia praedicationis externae conſiliorum propoſitiomi imo diuinam reuelationem aſſeruit quòd exiſtimabat propoſit • ho • inem ſibi ſufficientē eſſe ad credendum operandum quicquid eſt ad ſalutem neceſſarium—quinetiam pelagius gratiam dei vtilem eſſe intelligebat etſi non neceſſariam ſimpliciter ad operandam iuſtitiá su • rez • ſ opuſc • au •• l hominis ſalua • ſed • n voluntate dei dantis auxilium neceſſarium eui velit▪ quod putabant propter noſira merita •• hic error damnatus conc aranſicano suarez ibid num 5 pelagian heretike acknowledge firſt semipelagian profeſſed therefore notwithſtanding acknowledgement neceſſitie grace may haue either conſanguinitie leaſt affinitie ancient hereſie 17 cardinall bellarmine might remoue catholikes ſuſpicion colour pelagianiſme ſaith kemnitius ſcribit catholicos ea eſſe ſententia vt liberum 〈…〉 gratiam excitatum excrat vires quas habebat etiam antequam excitaretur per illas ſuas vires vocationi diuinae conſentiat ita vt gratia prae • emens non tribuat vires libero arbit • io ſed excitet hoc non ſentiunt catholici ſed agnoſeunt quidem liberum arbitrium homine antequam gratia diuina praeueniat quia liberum arbitrium re naturalis eſt quae per peccatum non amit • itut sed tamen nec dicunt nec ſentiunt liberum arbitrium ex ſe habere potentiam vllam ſaltem proximam ad actus p • otatis ſed eam accipere à deo per gratiam praeuementem bellar lib 6 de lib arb cap 13 catholikes thinke man naturall power without inward exciting grace 〈2 page missing〉 cauſe ancient father councels ſpeaking hereof ſay worketh ineffable vnſpeakable manner alſo becauſe metaphoricall phraſes scripture intimate diuine motion proceedeth illumination inſpiration euidently euinceth doctrine ieſuite held defendeth 〈◊〉 gratiam 〈◊〉 conſenſum 〈◊〉 mediam non 〈◊〉 martinz diſp 1 part 1 〈◊〉 7 alone demaund concerning efficacie power hereof whether ſo worke morally determine apply conſent vnto godly motion denied biſhop efficacia gratiae non eſt pofita determinatione morali probatur idem diſp 3 part 1 num 7 part 4 num 10 martinz yet againe affirmed ieſuite non repugnat dari excitationem efficacem vt moraliter praedeterminet volunt atem vt ſaepè contingit actibus humanis quando habet homo • uidens iudicium rem ſibi expedire contrarium eſſe pernicioſum item poteſt daemon ita vehementer inducere hominem ſuafionibus ſuis ſuggeſtionibus vt niſi grati • dei iu • etur moralit • r non poſſit ſe continere quin conſentiat ergo multò magi deus gratiâ excitante c suarez ieſ lib 3 de anxil grat cap 10 num 5 suarez proued ſometime exciting grace effectuall ſo predeter mine morally cannot conſent thus aduerſaries contradiction haue gained confeſſion morall determination phyſicall efficacie working man god exciting grace 23 diſcuſſion firſt kind grace call exciting drawne diſputes examine difference ſecond part helping aſsisting grace deſcribe point wherein aduerſaries quid ſit gratia adiuuans cooperans 1 reipſa ab excitante diſtingui—ſed non eſt admittenda▪ 2 gratiam adi • uantem eſſe motionem quandam inter excitantem conſenſum liberi arbitrij mediam quâ deus hominem iu • tat vt conſenſum ipſum • liciat haec ſatis refellitur c 3 ipſos habitus ſupernaturales qui ipſo conuerſionis momento à deo infunduntur eſſe gratiam adiuuantem—at habitus infuſi non concurrunt efficient •• ad eos actus quibus peceator diſponitur ad eos habitus recipiendos 4 eſſe actiuum dei concurſum cum voluntate poc • atoris ad conuerſ • onem ſupplendo immediatè per ſe concurſum habitus infuſi—si concurſus nomine intelligat •• actus conſentiondi qu • tenus eſt à deo tum c 5 eſſe eandem gratiam excitantem quatenus eſt efficax martinz diſp 1 part 4 p • r 〈◊〉 fiuefold od helping cooperating grace may contented definition laſt place ſet beſt viz thinke concurrence god grace effectually mouing conſent intending proſecute three concedunt gratiam adiuuantem phyſica motione agere perfectum inducere conſenſum— •• go quidem idem non fat • modò verumetiam proſiteor—non omnes • odem modo alij vt phyſica illa motio flu • effectum alij vt • luat voluntatem effectum ſimul c benius cap 19 § et quod pag 342 andreas vega lib 6 conc trid cap 7 affirmat conuerſione peccatoris poſſe adiuuantem gratiam dari ſine excitante▪ idque ex ipſius gratiae ex libertatis noſtrae poteſtate confirmat vt ſubitò dolere de peccatit—in quo declinare videtur à concil trid sell 6 c 5 ca • 3 vbi definitu • non poſſe hominem diligere ſperare poenitere ſicut oportet abſque praeueniente spiritus ſancti inſpiratione martinz diſp 1 part 3 quidam ad eliciendos actus ſupernaturales mhil putant aliud requiri praeter habitum infuſum • neceſſariam eſſe gratiam adiuuantem ibidem curious queſtions hereabout onely point margent scholers obſerue wherein ſhall find nothing euen odde yea nay true falſe vve rather haſten vnto fift conſequence taken compariſon made betweene grace aduerſaries irreligiouſly equall grace ſometime preferre againſt confeſſed doctrine ancient father sect 10 24 euen verie compariſon grace god man gregorius capr • ••• 2 diſt 28 soar 3 p tom 1 diſp 3 sect 6 alij recentiores tum quia voluntas creata inferioris ordinis eſt proinde ſuapte vi improportionata ad actus tale viz ſupernatura tum quia c tum denique quia patres liberum arbitriū ſolent appellare inſtrumentum diuinae gratiae ſimpliciter negant eſſe agens principale negotin ſalutis effecting good cannot become odious vnto religious reader much hatefull ſhall ſeeme therein ſhall perceiue equalled yea preferred grace writing ſome romaniſts may appeare concerning equalitie reade although gregorius caprcolus soar ſome theſe day thought man inferiour nature incompetent vnfit applie ſelfe vnto ſpirituall action conſideration ſay father called inſtrument grace therefore iudged grace principall agent euerie action belonging vnto ſaluation yet biſhop martinz priuiledged aduance make • kind principall cauſe verùm haec ſententia non placet primò quia ratio merendi non videtur cadere poſſe agens inſtrumētale ſed tantùm principale title secti • • homo operibus bonis quae facit cum auxilio grat • ae ſuo ordine eſt cauſa principalis laboureth reconcile yet therein confeſſeth differunt autem quòd corum quidam dicunt ad rationem principalis cauſae requiri virtutem propriam proportionatam vel eminentioris ordinis quàm ſit effectos alij negaot id eſſe neceſſatium theſe ſo contrary premiſes concluſions muſt need contrary martinz ib num 7 c little deus comparatione operum ad quae opus eſt ſpeciali dei auxilio cauſa prima ſit principalis particulari • —homo etiam eſt illorum cauſa particularis ſuo ordine principalis idem ibid num 10 becauſe ſaith reaſon marke pride man pleade ſelfe meriting cannot belong cauſe principall like ſort doth cardinall bellarmine proceed match grace together comparing vnto duo ſerunt ingentem lapidem quem vnus ſerre non poſſit neuter enim alteri vires addit aut eum impellit vtrique liberum eſt onus relinquere—sic deus voluntas vt licet eodem prorſus momento agere incipiant tamen deus operatur quia voluntas operatur non contrà—neque tamen ſequitur deum pendere à creatura ſed ab aeterna ſua inſtitutione voluntate little quoniam ad hoc ſe liberè quodammodo obligabat quando naturam creabat bellar lib 4 de lib arb cap 15 two men carying one ſtone neither adding ſtrength vnto free caſt burthen 25 yet man freewill god grace go hand hand maketh doctrine ſeeme impious ſacrilegious appeare others ſhall giue man vpper hand kind ſuſpect martinz teſtifieth sunt qui putant gratiae efficaciam conſtituendam eſſe actu voluntatis conſentientis illam gratiam efficacem eſſe cui volunta • cooperatur qua volunt illam inefficacē eſſe cui voluntas ex ſuo arbitrio non vult cooperari▪ vndè ſecundùm illos efficacia gratiae à libero arbitrio pendet—ratio quia nulla eſt dei vocatio quam non poſſit homo pro libito acceptare▪ aut reijcere martinz diſp 3 part 2 num 1 thinke efficacie grace conſiſt act depend vpon liberty man becauſe remaineth alwaies indifferent abilitie receiue reiect grace ſpeech foreſaid learned biſhop sed efficacia gratiae non eſt conſtituenda cooperatione liberi arbitrij—quia rom 9 non eſt currentis 1 cor 4 quiste diſcernit sanè qui gratiam efficeret efficacem ſe ipſe diceretur decernere ibid num 4 7 comm • ni ſententia hoc tenet num 9 qui ſentiunt gratiam à voluntate pendere loquuntur de actuali efficacia actu ſecundo nec aliud volunt quàm dei auxilium ex • fac • conſenſum quia liberum arbitrium v • lt ei cooperari cùm oppoſitum poſſet facere qui volunt à ſolo deo pe • der • 〈◊〉 de efficacis 〈◊〉 primo quia à libero arbitrio non pendet vt deus conferat talem vocationis motionem ibid num 17 martinz allowing would gladly qualifie ſuch dependance grace vpon man might admitted god ſaith regenerate men without nothing ſo might euery man eſpecially reſpect acting conſent vnto good reioyne vnto god ſaying without thou canſt nothing 26 doubtleſſe ſentences romiſh doctor ſound vnto ſame effect wherin cooperation ioyntworking act conſent yeelded dico deum ſequi determinationem voluntatis quoni • ideo deus agit actum • llum quiá eum noſtra liberè vtitur ibid cap 16 § atque motion god vſeth effecting conſent ſtill power man ſelfe determining ſelfe doctrine cannot poſſibly make harmonic religious heart inſomuch benius may ſeeme haue abhorred laſt author hath written ſubiect otherwiſe zealous proctor freewil doth ſtep little aſide moued ſaith diuine ſcriptures sanè cùm diuinae literae clament deum omnia opera noſtra operatum eſſe ac ſigillatim operari omnia nobis—adde etiam deum operari nobis velle perficere negandum non eſt deum ad omnem noſtrum actum poſitiuum ſpecialiterue ad ſupernaturalem ad ipſam determinationem voluntatis noſtrae concurrere▪ quòd ſi concurrit cur non ipſe mecum determinare ſeu potius condeterminare dicetur certè diuina scriptura quae dicit vanum no aedificare niſi deus aedificet de ſpirituali aedificatione loquitur imprimis atque haec ſententia eſt etiam patribus conformis clemens conſt lib 7 dionyſius areopag de diuin nominib cap 4 athanaſ orat contra idola theoph lib 1 ad autol baſil hom 32 nyſſen lib de reſurrect anima damaſc lib 1 de fide orthod cap 3 theod ſerm de prouid auguſt lib 7 de geneſi c 9 11 15 23 l 8 c 13 de catechiz rudib c 35 lib 3 contra iulian 3 contra maxim non ſemel quaeſt l 83 quaeſt 26 epiſt 85 alibi ſaepè hilar pſal 146 anſelm lib de caſu diab cap 1 20 omnes actiones effectus ſiue motus deo tanquam principali immediato agenti tribuunt idque ſigillatim ne quis interim haereat quod iſtorum aliqui humanas actiones viſi ſunt excepiſſe de humanis praeter aug alios ex citatis multos docet chryſoſt hom • gen hieron epiſt ad cteſiphon lib 1 contra pelag vbi diſputant deum eſſe cauſam omnium bonarum hominis actionum nec poſſe no quicquam agere niſi cauſante deo quinetiam cum athan cyrillus nazianz chryſoſt theoph nyſſen horum loca recitaui multò ante addant huiuſmodi bonis actionibus animam moueri à deo tanquam inſtrumentum viuum tamen ſimul agens atque cooperans ſiue vt corpus ab anima quis talem noſtris ſupernaturalibus actibus dei cauſationem admittere poſſit quin diuinam condeterminationem tametſi propter coinſtantaneam liberi arbitrij cooperationem determinationem ſine vlla ipſius liberi arbitrij offenſione non cogatur agnoſcere confiteri benius 〈◊〉 gratia efficat cap 20 pag 356 proclaime god worke v yea wil good therefore may denied god eſpecially ſpirituall act doth concurre man euen determining 27 gregorie nazianzene cyrill ſome granting man ſoule moued god good action actiue inſtrument end although acknowledge god predetermine himſelfe reſtraine vnto neceſſarie conſent vnto good yet hath brought calleth condetermination thereof thus become halfe orthodoxall wiſh paul vnto others ſuch halfe altogether laſt place vſe ſixt conſequence maketh againſt romiſh doctrine freewill taken confeſſed instance whereby aduerſaries alſo doubt brought extreme exigence ſtraite sect 11 28 imagined aduerſaries two men conuerted example peter paul equally aſſiſted grace queſtion whether ſtate catholico theologo hac parte ignora • te quòd ſtante aequah auxilio dei petrus conuertatur non paulus nec verentur contrariam ſententiá temerariam pelagianam appellare alij verò theologi contrariam prout videt congruum atque aptum eſſe bellar lib 6 de lib arb cap 15 sententia 9 cardinall bellarmine eadem ratione cùm eodem ſeu aequali auxilio per modum principij ſtat vnum hominem conuerti aut conuertatur alter reſiſtat—quamuis hoc ra •• ù • accidat suarez quo ſupra num 8 although num 10 • e flie vnto congruam vocationem doth martinz ſaith suarez efficacia gratiae non reducitur aptitudinem aut complexionem peccatoris tanquam cauſam efficientem ſed vt materialem diſp 3 part 4 num 7 martinz anſwer reaſon conuerſion one rather proceedeth hence although motion grace eſſentially equall yet made fit vnto one party diſpoſition vnto others god ſingular fauour purpoſeth work effectually ſo mouing man findeth moſt agreeable conuenient anſwer confuted owne benius ſaying qui ſanè anthor c meaning bellarmine nameth etſi aſſentiri cupientem quidem tria magnopere haerentem habent—mutat ſtatum quaeſtionis illi enim cui ex ſe iſta gratia apta eſt vt perſuadeatur ſine dubio eſt gratia ita non erit gratia aequalis eadem naui eſt franciſcus suarez—cuius reſponſum pugnat cum conc tridentino dum enim docet synodus ita offerri gratiam vt poſſit recipi reſpui ſupponit eſſe ex ſe congruam opportunam benius cap 23 pag 411 deinceps owne anſwer poſito aequali auxilio gratiae aequali duobus hominibus affectione fieri non poteſt vt vnus conuertatur non alius—cum eſt affectio varia aliter poteſt fieri idem ibidem although could willingly aſſent vnto noting expreſly cardinal bellarmine author yet three eſpeciall reaſons hinder one becauſe changeth ſtate queſtion two party ſupported equall grace god perſwade one fit ſeaſonable maner reſpect grace maketh grace vnequall 30 thus may ſee bent theſe aduerſaries wit hath bene pleade liberty man themſelues ſo fettered owne argument anſwers onely euery paſſage one note anothers inſufficiency alſo like men maze much turning winding become ſo impotent know way trulie turne ſo theſe perplexed intricate ſubtelties ſo intoxicate end cardinall bellarmine driuen anſwer obiection concerning god predetermination ſecond cauſes ſaying si deus non omnia praedeterminaret ante praeuiſionem ſecundarum cauſarum non poſſet omnia certè praeſcire reſpondeo re omninò difficilis eſt fortaſſe hac vita incomprehenſibilis c bellar lib 4 de lib arb cap 15 verie hard point peraduenture life poſsible comprehended 31 likewiſe doctor weſton profeſſor doway taketh vpon deciſion principall point caeterùm ſupereſt adhuc quod mihi ſaepiùs negotiū faceſſit cuius apertam intelligentiam neminem v • deo adhuc ſatis expreſſiſſe aut eius explicationem animum intendiſſe eſt autem huiuſmodi briefe whereof quae ſit primordialis ratio habendi concurſum dei hanc determinatam partem opinion ſome concurſus dei magi propendet vnam partem quám aliam ad modum congruitatis genij cognitionem volentis—haec apertiſſima ratione pugnare exiſtimo cum libero arbitrio que vnius partis antecedentem neceſſitatem fatum inuchere—supereſt diſcutiendus ipſemet actus arbitrij—sed pro tenuitate ingenij mei ita clucidauimus controuerſiam alioqui obſenriſſimam cumprimis ſtudentes rem maximè probabilem pauciſue ſuccinctam medium proferre tametſi vt verum fatear neque iſtis inquiſitioni meae fecerim ſatis weſtonus de trip hom offic lib 3 cap 10 ſaith hath much troubled plaine meaning whereof haue found ſufficiently vnfolded point reaſon concurrance god grace man pretending hath explaned moſt obſcure queſtion yet confeſſeth therein hath ſatisfied himſelfe 32 laſtly others found de modo quo liberum arbitrium vel mouetur velſe mouet ad exercitium boni clamant alij rem nonpoſſe hac vita percipi ſed omnem ingenij humani captum ſuperare occham sà caietaous alij benius cap 20 pag 353 fine cry acknowledging manner god mouing paſſeth capacitie apprehenſion man wit vnderſtanding elſe aduerſaries writing ſo many huge volume vpon one argument freewill profeſſing learning ſubtiltie ſatisfie point point yet end enforced confeſſe matter impoſſible doth import loſt labour haue bene turning ixions wheele tumbling siſyphus ſtone nothing remaineth vnto theſe premiſes affixe concluſion way appeale sect 12 33 therefore importunitie apologiſts vpbraiding proteſtants oppoſition againſt ſome father queſtion freewill wherein ſame cenſure proteſtants hath bene iuſtified many learned § 1 ieſuits may conuince theſe obiectors romiſh author hath recorded haue bene verie deuout kind ambroſ ſerm 20 ſuper pſalm 118 verſ vide humilitatem meam nemo ſibi arroget nerro de meritis glorietur nerro de poteſtate ſe iactet ſed omnes bernard ſaith denying merit humilitie vpon vncertaintie proper grace ſo doth follow becauſe acknowledge imagination fighteth againſt expreſſe doctrine bernard owne vega hath alledged et bernardus noſtra ſi qua eſt humilis iuſtitia rectum forſitan ſed non pura niſi forſitan no inchores eſſe credimus quàm patres noſtros qui non minus veraciter quàm humiliter dixerunt omnes iuſtitiae noſtrae tanquam pannus menſtruatae mulieris vega lib 15 de iuſtif cap 13 pag 698 iustice v ſaith bernard peraduenture true yet impure except ſhall thinke ſelues better father leſſe truly humbly confeſſed iuſtice better menſtruous cloth cardinall doth ſuppoſe bernard confeſſed rather humilitie truth contrarie vnto bernard profeſſeth keepe footſteps forefather acknowledged vnworthineſſe leſſe truly humbly anſwer vncertaintie proper grace doth proue would denie merit doth confeſſe becauſe vncertaintie one doth imply vncertainty certaine bernard truly humble ſo humbly true acknowledging himſelfe merentur felicitatem de condigno bellarm lib 5 de iuſtif aagaine opera bona iuſtorum meritoria eſſe vitae aeternae ex condigno non ſolum ratione pacti acceptationis ſed etiá ratione operis ita vt opere bono ex gratia procedente ſit quaedam proportio aequalitas ad praemiū vitae aeternae bellarm ibid cap 17 § iam vero pererius ieſuit si bona iuſtorū opera ſpectentur penſitentur ea ratione vt proficiſcuntur à spiritu ſancto per gratiam iuſti hominis animam inhabitantem ea profect • conuenientem habent proportionem aequalitatis dignitatis cum praemio ipſo vitae aeternae comment rom 6 num 55 dicendum termin •• de condigno congruo— • uſti dicit apoſtolus non ſunt condignae paſſiones c—quid hoc iam vt ſic mereamur de congruo rep •• igitur ſaniorem theologum fideliorem catholicum scripturis ſacris magi concordem qui tale meritum ſimpliciter abnegat cum modificatione apoſtoli scripturatum concedit quia ſimpliciter quis non meretur regnum coelorum ſed ex gratia dei aut voluntate may innocated properly praied vnto contrarywiſe laſt romiſh councell hath decreed aſſertion mandat ſancta ſyno • u omnibus epiſcopis caeteris docendi munus ſuſtinentibus vt—doceant illos qui negant sanctos aeterna ſo • licitate coelo fruentes inuocandos eſſe—vt pro nobis ſingulis orent—vel pugnare cum verbo dei—impiè ſentire▪ concil trid seſſ 25 impious pope pius 4 bull made ratifying decree ſame councell intituled forme oath profeſsion faith hath bound romaniſts conſtanter teneo—sanctos cum chriſto regnantes vener andos atque inuocandos eſſe bulla pij 4 ſuper forma iuramenti profeſſionis senenſis bibl ſanct lib 4 cypriano nazianzene diuerſe others due examination might diſcouered neceſſarie abate account witneſſes ſucceeding age 4 secondly cardinall bellarmine framing queſtion de modo quo cognoſeunt preces noſtras—alij dicunt ſanctos vide • e deo omnia à principio ſuae atitudinis quae ad ipſos aliquo modo pertinent—alij ſolum tunc reuelari ij • à deo oratione • noſtras quum ea fundimus—prior eſt ſimpliciter probabilior quia ſi indigerent ſancti noua reuelatione eccleſia non diceret ita audacter orate pro nobis ſed peteret aliquando à deo vt ei • preces noſtras reuelaret—tamen poſterior ſententia eſt magi idonea ad conuincendos haereticos—sed dices—cur patribus limbo non reuelabantur preces viuentium ſi nunc reuelantur coelo reſpondeo tunc non fuiſſe ordinariè ijs reuelatum quid hic agebatur quia non erant beati bellar lib 1 de beat sanct cap 20 vbi notandum eſt quòd ante chriſti aduentum sancti qui moriebantur non intrabant coelum nec deum videbant nec cognoſcere poterant ordinarie prece • ſupplicantium ide • • conſuetum finſſe veteri teſtamento vt diceretur sancte abraham os pro c ſed ſolum oraban • eius temporis homines deum allegaba tinet—communio charitati • vnde chriſtus formam orationis praeſcripſit panem noſtrum non meſi cōmunio membrorum ſeu ſym pathiae ſiue dolendi gaudendi—communio donorſi ſpiritualium alij apoſtoli alij doctores— temporalium ſubueniendo egentibus catecluſm romanus ex decreto concil trid pij quinti ponti • icis iuſſu editus hunc articulum romane catechiſme publiſhed decree councell trent commaund pius quintus pope doth onely expound ſignifie communion militant viſible church hath ſpirit charitie sacrament viſible function ſympathie member thereof communion church ſpecified iohn ſaith may haue fellowſhip v fellowſhip may father sonne ſignifieth vnion one faith one spirit one head chriſt one hope complete euerlaſting bleſſedneſſe wherein faithfull haue bene alwaies linked together ſhall vnto ſanctiſſ—regina eſt omniſ • ſuper omnes—quis non rapiatur amorem eius quam deus ipſe de • mat quam vo • erantur angeli archangeli—quae humani generis eſt aduocata regina appellatur miſericordiae c et coccius doth acknowledge vſed diuerſe proteſtants others diſpute exceſſe worſhip much differing forenamed hereſie collyridians 41 know incidi hominem de ſchola caluini qui mihi alioqui perhumanus candidus videretur eoque vteret familiariter vt eum ſi quo mode poſſem ab illa inſania reuocarem—reſpondebat caulam praecipuam eſſ cur â communione eccleſiae diſceſſent quôd sanctos precibus inuocaremus quó • que eo modo diuinitatem illis affingeremus hae impoſturae mendaciaue impudentiſſima ſunt quis enim catholicorum vnquam vni vero deo vel martyrum vel apoſtolorum vel angelorum aut ita commen dandanè chriſti ſeruatoris honori aliquid derogetur neuè vt bonauenturae verbis vtar dum matris excellentia ampliat • r filij gloria minuatur ſic illo mater prouocetur quae magi vult filium extolli quàm ſeipſam vtpote creatorem creaturae et mox obijcientibus quòd honor matris referatur ad filium reſpondet idem bonauentura verum quidem eſſe non tamen ex co ſequi quòd omnis honor qui tribuitur filio tribuendus ſit matri quia hoc eſſet non filium honorare ſed potius filio contumeliam facere caſſander defenſ lib de offic pij viri contra caluinum correctiō ſome praiers leſt much remiſsion ſinne obiected againſt proteſtants aduerſaries thereunto wherein appeareth double ignorance firſt vnderſtanding generall doctrine proteſtants notwithſtanding greateſt aduerſarie hath thus acknowledged lutherus art 2 ait omnia peccata baptiſmo remitti caluinus omnium peccatorū reatus per baptiſmum deleri philippus melancthon peccatum baptiſmo remitti vt non imputetur bellarm lib 1 de baptiſ cap 13 kemnitius fatetur remitti baptiſmo omnia peccata quinetiam tolli ac deleri ſolùm reliquias quaſdam originalis peccati reſtare bellar ibid neither affirme bare remiſſion onely ſuch one doth alwayes imply regeneration alſo inchoatiue extinction originall concupiſcence ſinne therefore luther tit 3 baptiſmus eſt lauacrum regeneration non quo externus homo abluitur tantùm ſed quo tota natura mutetur aliam naturam id eſt quo prior natiuitas carnalis deſtruitur cum tota peccatorum perditionis natiuitate luther homil tit 3 peraduenture ſome particular one ſhould hold otherwiſe yet new teſtament may thinke conceiue hope child faith teſtaments ſame may imagine diuerſe neceſſitie sacrament becauſe cardinall caietane hath truly argued fides • ola veterum non fuit maioris virtutis apud veteres quàm apud nos—at tunc deficiente pa • uulis proprio ſalutis auxilio parentum fides pro illis ſola ſufficiebat ergo nunc quando paruulis deeſt baptiſmi remedium—and obiection sacrament new teſtament greater vertue neceſſitie anſwereth duobus exiſtentibus fide fidei sacramento▪ operanti apud veteres fidei adiunctum eſt noſtro tempore fidei ſacramentum ſub ratione poſſibilis intelligimus non vt virtutem fidei ſoluat ſed vt adimpleat caietan 3 part th • q 68 art 1 2 pergit confirmatur hoc à ſalute paruulorum • ui ante diem circumciſionis moriebantur nam tale ſecundum probabiliorem opinionem moriebantur incircumciſi vt patet de fratre salomonis tamen ſaluabantur c tilmannus sigebergenſis clypeo fidei—quis tam ſtipes eſt qui ignoret parentum ſolam fidem paruulis ſuccurriſſe ante circumciſionem morientibus conſequitur itaque paruulis c eliſius filij haebraeorum qui mori • bantur incircumciſi aut ſaluabantur aut non ſi ſaluabantur habeo intentum quia fides noſtra eſt multò melior ſi ſic ſequeretur quòd mare eſſent deteriores conditionis quim foeminae cùm ambo haberent originale pec • • um mare damnantur qui incircumciſi moriebantur foeminae non theſe cited caſſander hell ſit downe take vp lamentation matth 2 18 rachel weeping mourning child becauſe 12 thirdly romaniſts ground pretēded neceſſitie baptiſme vpon word sauiour ſaying ioh 3 5 except man borne againe water c yet notwithſtāding haue cōceiued another baptiſme perfecta conuerſio ac poenitentia rectè baptiſmus flaminis dicitur baptiſmum aqua ſaltem neceſſitate ſupplet—ſine dubio credendum eſt veram conuerſionem ſupplere baptiſmum aqua cùm non ex contemptu ſed ex neceſsitate aliqui ſine baptiſmo aqua decedunt bellar lib 1 de baptiſ cap 6 § secunda propoſitio flaminis ſaying catechumeni adulta aetate ante ſuſceptum baptiſma voto deſiderio ſumendi credunt inter eccleſiae membra numerantur ſaluantur quoque ſi nondum ſuſcepto fluminis baptiſmate deceſſerint quod vſuveniſſe valentiniano imperatori certiſsimū eſt de quo ambroſius audiui inquit vos dolere quòd non ſuſceperit sacramenta baptiſmatis dicite mihi quid aliud nobis eſt niſi voluntas niſi petitio atque etiam dudum hoc votum habuit c—quae autem ratio eſt vt baptiſmus flaminis magi locum habeat adultis quàm paru ••• fortè deum crudeliorem fore paruulis quàm adultis tilmannus apud caſſandrum quo ſuprà catechized perſons ſuch diſcretion contrition ſinne purpoſe baptized although die receiue outward baptiſme water yet ſtate ſaluation neceſsitie baptiſme water wanting ſupplied baptiſme spirit ieſuite lorinus doth proue auguſtine concluding alſo scripture ſuch caſe act 10 44 cecidit spiritus ſanctus ſuper omnes qui audiuerunt verbum monet auguſtinus q 84 leuit vt hinc intelligamus quod inuiſibilis ſanctificatio quibuſdam adfuerit atque profuerit poſsitue interdum adeſſe prodeſſe ſine viſibili sacramento vt deus non alligetur vt vulgati axiomate loquuntur ſuis sacramentis quando viz sacramentum l 4 de bapt c 24 vt baptiſtiſmum non contemptus religionis ſed neceſsitatis articulus excludat vt auguſtini verbis vtar lorinus ieſ comm act 2 • alſo bellarmine conuerſio ad deum licet baptiſma quoddam ſit non eſt tamen sacramentum bellar lib 1 de baptiſ cap 6 § quinta prop inuiſible grace ſanctification doth without viſible sacrament baptiſme profit thoſe faithfull neceſsitie contempt religion depriued baptiſme 13 hence forenamed author aſſume child faithfull dying without baptiſme may thought receiue baptiſme spirit well thoſe catechumeniſts ſpoken among father reckoned lbrum ambroſij de morte valentiniani legat aduertet ſine dubio ſanctum virum homini non baptizato mortuo fidenter de ſola fide ſalutē praeſumere tribuere indubitanter bonae voluntati quod defuit facultati bernard epiſt 77
