ſhall thinke ſay god merciful vnto men yeares vnto tender infant make men capable grace without vſe outward baptiſme deny childrē neceſſarie meanes ſaluation ſhould hinder ſaluation want baptiſme water could valentinian ſaued ſay becauſe want outward baptiſme water ſupplied inward baptiſme ſanctifying spirit know luc 1 iohn baptiſt yet vnbaptized vncircumciſed chriſtened ſpirit ſanctification euen mother wombe 14 romaniſts haue added yet third baptiſme terme ſanguinis bloud ſay acquitteth man neceſſarie debt baptiſme water martyrium rectè dicitur eſſe quoddam baptiſma—dans gratiam ex opere operato—probatur ex martyrio infantum conſtat enim infantes pro chriſto occiſos non ſolùm ſaluari ſed etiam haberi ab eccleſia numero martyrum c—infantes qui nihil poſſunt operari— probabiliſſimum eſt ferè certum eos non fuiſſe circumciſos inter quos non pauci erant gentile bellar lib 1 de bapt cap 6 § prima propoſitio c ſo aſwell vnbaptized child men ſlaine chriſt truly baptized ſay owne bloud therby onely ſaued alſo numbred among bleſſed martyr thinke confirmed example infant ſlaine birth chriſt whence owne author bold thus argue againſt viz baptiſmi vicem implere paſſionem probat cyprianus ab exemplo latronis—altera caietani ratio eſt quia ſtatus ille eſt capax baptiſmi ſanguinis si enim propter chriſtum infans 〈◊〉 occideretur martyr eſſet non minùs quàm innocentes—et hic eſt ſcopus omnium verborum quae habet caietanus infantes vtero ſunt capaces baptiſmi ſanguinis ergo flaminis tilmannus apud caſſandrum parte altera de baptiſmo inf •• fol 128 131 child vnbaptized may capable baptiſmi ſanguinis baptiſme bloud capable baptiſmi ſlaminis baptiſme spirit alſo euen wombes mother reaſon ſolid ſound becauſe neuer ſoule intereſted chriſt poſſeſſed ſanctifying spirit written rom 8 9 whoſoeuer chriſts haue receiued ſpirit chriſt theſe reaſons ſufficient adde confirmation ſame doctrine proteſtants argument learned aduerſaries sect 7 15 another generall principle practiſe romiſh church teach paruulos non credentes actu primo baptizari ſola fide eccleſiae concil trid seſſ 7 14 child wanting faith baptized faith church becauſe bellarmine anſwering argument anabaptiſts infantes non credunt ergo non ſunt baptizandi ſaith dico ſufficere ad baptiſmum fidem alienam ſicut eis obfuit peccatum alie • um bellarmin de baptiſm lib 1 cap 9 § quintum argumentum c rurſus duplex fides requiritur baptiſmo actualis vna quae praecedit vt diſpoſitio ca eſt quae exigitur à baptizatis dum iubentur reſpondere credant c altera quae ſequitur baptiſmū quae eſt par eſſentialis iuſtificationis non eſt actus ſed habitus ibid cap 11 § eſt autem another man ſinne originally cauſe damnation ſo men faith ſufficeth vnto baptiſme ſaluation hence owne author learnedly thus collect ait thomas 3 part q 68 q 69 6 ad 3 multis locis pueri baptizantur fide militantis eccleſiae quae ſi per impoſſibile deficeret ſuppleret eccleſia triumphans eliſius apud caſſandrum quo ſuprà pag 134 si itaque fides voluntas eccleſiae infantibus accomodata eos baptiſmo conſequendo idoneos reddit quid quaeſo cauſae eſt cur non etiam eos obtinendae ſanctificationi idoneos efficiat ſi externum baptiſmi ſignum iam voto praeſumptum neceſſitas quae vitari non poteſt iam ſola prohibeat—nam etiam ante baptiſmum ſuſceptum paruulos credentium numero aliquo modo haberi ex priſcae eccleſiae conſuetudine apparet quâ infantes ante lotionem de fide interrogantur credant c—quod etiā patet ex ordine romano quo feria 4 hebdom 3 quadrageſimae ſcrutinium quod vocatur etiam paruulis ab huiuſmodi interrogatione ſolenni profeſſione fidei per acolythum nomine infantium inchoabatur—quod niſi haec inani mendaci caeremonia fieri dicamus certè vel tunc infantes non prorſus à fide alieni habendi ſunt c—ergo non deeſt illis prorſus fides nec conuerſio cordis quae illis per dei benignitatem imputatur—praeſertim vbi voluntas namely offerer pro facto reputetur vbi factum excludit neceſsitas vt docet bernardus epiſtola ad hugonē de sancto victore vbi etiamfi neget infantes hanc fidem hoc eſt cordis ad deum conuerſionem habere prohibente aetate conſequenter ſalute priuari ſi abſque baptiſmi perceptione moriantur fatetur tamen eodem loco ipſos cùm baptizantur infantes fide omninò non carere ſine qua impoſsibile eſt vel ipſis infantibus placere deo ſed ſaluari ipſos per fidem non ſuam quidem ſed alienam caſſander ipſe ibid pag 140 seeing ſay according ancient cuſtome church yea romane order baptiſme child baptized ſolemnely asked whether beleeue whether deſire baptized anſwer made church name child beleeue deſire cannot denied child except confeſſe vaine lying ceremonie vſed church baptized ſome ſort partaker sacrament baptiſme euen faith church hath vowed hereunto caſe neceſſitie child leſſe excuſable vow faith church adulti held owne point haue cleared confirmed pertinent pregnant quid ſi quis paterfamilias inter barbaros firmiter ſtatuerit die craſtino familiam ſuam totam qua etiam infantes ſunt chriſto per baptiſmum conſecrare ipſe cum vniuerſa familia vel ſubita • ue vel aquarum dilu • io vel ignis incendio vel graſſatorū hoſtium ferro è vita tolleretur nemo credo dubitabit adultos omnes ſaluari qui ſe iam fide ad deum conuerterant baptiſmi ſacramentum voto perceperant baptiſmi gratiâ non priuari infantes ſolos damnatos dixerimus qui tamen vni cum adultis chriſto votó parentis addicti conſecrati fuerunt—bonauentura paruulos ad baptiſmum diſponi ait non quidem ſecundùm actum ſuum ſed ſecundùm actum alienum quia diuina miſericordia alienam voluntatem ipſis propriam reputat caſſander ibid fol 148 ſuppoſition proceed 16 fift argument may deriued ſtrange paradox thinke preſumed neceſſitie outward baptiſme hath begot namely equalize child faithfull parent ſeed eccleſia feſtinatur ad baptizandos paruulos ne filij fidelium ſine baptiſmo decedentes ſint apud inferos cum alijs filijs infidelium bellarm lib 4 de ami •• grat c 14 § certè infidel reſpect grace damnation allow licet infidelis non crederet ſe quicquam bonifacere cum irriſione fecerit c tollet ieſ lib 2 cap 20 pagane baptize although done ſcorne validus eſt baptiſmus datus amenti sà ieſ aphoriſm tit baptiſmus madde man baptized admit poteſt eſſe baptiſmus lixiuio brodio carnium vel piſcium quando non eſt notabilis mixtio vt aqua non ſit vel ex aqua è luto expreſſa vel aqua ſulphurea • c • non ſint iſta adhibenda niſi extremo neceſsitatis tempore tolet ieſ inſtruct sacerd lib 2 cap 18 lee broth puddlewater true element baptiſme finally paſſe ouer nota ſecundò debet eſſe actus ex ſe ordinatus ad ablutionem vnde qui puerum morientem proijcit puteum profundum vt baptizetur quantumuis ſuffocaretur quia non poteſt ab aqua extrahi iſte non baptizat ſed occidit peccatue mortaliter tolet ieſ inſtruct sacerd lib 2 cap 18 ſcruple draw matter vnto iſſue either contrarie doctrine owne schoole cùm enim pue • ventre matris periclitatur emiſit manum vel pedem poteſt baptizari ea parte hoc eſt probabilius licet aliqui dicant contrarium thomas 3 part q 68 art 11 tenet quod poteſt c tolet ibid veriſsimè dicit thomas quia donce vteris ſunt non habentur numero conuentu hominum tilmannus apud caſſandrum de bapt infant child may baptized mother wombe elſe contrarie practiſe church alioquin ſequitur vt cùm puer exiſtens vtero matris ſit maximo periculo mo • iendi nullo modo ſaluari poterit niſi baptizetur vt mater deberet teneretur de neceſsitate ſalutis permittere vt eius venter ſcindatur extrahatur inde puer viuus ne mo • iatur demnetur ſed hoc nunquam teaching ſame baptizatus ter mergebatur aqua ſimilitudinem mortis chriſti qui tres dy ſepultus fuit aquinas coloſſ 2 lect 3 hic ritus qui ab apoſtolica authoritate confirmatus per contrariam cauſe wherefore may ſcore vp obiection others note inſinceritie theſe apologiſts dare thus boldly accuſe others owne guilt ought haue acknowledged primitine forme baptiſme haue bene dipping agreeable vnto nature baptiſme one faith one baptiſme epheſ 4 5 one 23 baptiſme layman proceeding abouenamed doctrine neceſsitie baptiſme hath former diſcourſe receiued anſwer whereunto may added auguſtine ſtandeth moſt neceſsitie baptiſme doth abſolutely defend ſuch layminiſters thinketh ſo poſſibly guiltie therefore cannot called god ordinance ſome kind si nulla neceſsitas alieni muneris eſt vſurpatio ſi neceſsitas vrgeat aut nullum aut veniale delictum—sed etſi nulla neceſſitate vſurpetur à quolibet cuilibet detur quod datum eſt non poteſt dici non datū quamuis rectè dici poſsit illicitè datum auguſt contra literas parmen lib 2 cap 13 ſinne much leſſe would haue defended romiſh poſition teacheth tempore neceſsitatis pagano vel infideli licet baptizare tolet ieſ card lib 2 inſtruct cap 20 bellar lib 1 de sacram baptiſ cap 7 pagan infidel lawfull minister baptiſme ſeeing auguſtine thought non temerè aliquid inde affirmandum eſt ſine authoritate concilij tanti quantum tantae rei ſufficit auguſt loco citato raſhneſſe affirme without authoritie ſome great councell kind baptiſme pope gregory ſecond ſo farre condemne commaunded ſuch perſons quos à paganis baptizatos eſſe aſſeruiſti ſi ita habetur vt denuò baptizes nomine trinitatis mandamus de conſecrat diſt 4 c quos à paganis authoritie bellarmine anſwereth ſome defect forme thoſe pagan baptiſmes ſaith proueth whereas ſuch baptizers abſolutely excepted againſt ſufficient councell laici baptizare poſſunt modò ſint ipſi baptizati non bigami conc eliber 38 herein pagan baptiſme alſo contrary theſe weake ground father gaue tolleration lay chriſtian men baptiſme scimus etiam laicis licere baptizare vt enim accipit quis ita dare poteſt hieron contra luciferian cap 4 baptized againe promiſe hath chriſt euer made thoſe vndertakers holy thing 24 againe ancient father councels haue decreed without limitation caſes neceſſitie ne ipſi quidem ſanctiſsimae chriſti matri datum eſt vt baptizaret alioqui ipſa potiùs quàm iohannes baptizâſſet chriſtum epiphan haereſ 79 non permittitur mulie •• eccleſia loqui ſed nec docere nec tingere nec offerre tertull cap 9 de veland virg mulie • baptizare n • n praeſumat concil virgine ſhould preſume baptiſe cardinall bellarmine find antiquitie one authoritie alloweth caſe late councell concilio florentino habetur caſu neceſsitatis licere laico ſeu foeminae ſeu pagano baptizare modò adſint materia forma intentio debita bellarm ibid florence anſwer vnto obiected ceremony sect 10 25 abrenunciation proteſtation tertul lib de corona militis sub antitiſtis manu thoſe proteſtants reiected without ſome luſt vnneceſſarie contention except aduerſaries intend vrging vſe theſe ceremony intimate neceſſity anſwer although hath bene found among themſelues one biſhop hath defended baptiſme efficacy without ſigne croſſe yet common doctrine opinion iudged refellitur error claudij epiſcopi taurinenſis qui dixit baptiſma eſſe nullum niſi ſignum crucis fronti baptizati infigeretur hic autem manifeſtus eſt error conſtat enim cùm chriſtus inſtitueret baptiſma nunquam de ſigno crucis meminiſſe alphonſ de caſtro lib 3 haereſ tit baptiſmus manifestly erroneous euen becauſe chriſts inſtitution ment • croſsing argument equally ſufficient confute neceſſitie annointing learned alphonſe ſaith chriſtus baptiſma inſtituens nullum de chriſmate adhibendo dedit praeceptum alphonſus ibid inſtitution baptiſme commaunded chriſt 26 dionyſius apologiſts beleeue haue bene paul scholer find anciently vſed annoint chriſtians oyle meminiſſe autem decet quòd prima ad vitam ſpiritualem regeneratione ante baptiſmi ſuſceptionem ſit ipſi initiando poſitis omnibus veſtibus per totum corpusinunctio tanquam prima communicatio cognitionis fidei fine omnium oporationum vitae etiam defuncto infunditur oleū nunc autem e • equijs infuſum defuncto oleum ſignificat eundem illa peregiſſe certamina illis completis ſanctè eſſe conſummatum dionyſius de hierarch pag 102 pariſ 1519 death whereby doctine purgatorie threatning horrible torment promiſing preſent reſt may ſeeme receiue little preiudice romaniſts haue neglected yet ſpare impute iniquitie vnto proteſtants omitting former ſuch ancient ceremony may according vnto diuerſe condition time diſcretion ſeuerall church permit vſe change alwaies caueat neither altered ſpirit faction vſed ſuperſtitious opinion chap xiiii neareſt end thoſe firſter time cyprian tertullian vſed priuate confeſſion euen thought leſſer ſinnes ſame vide ibid commaunded thought neceſſarie protestant appeale ſtate question laid downe learned aduerſaries sect 1 queſtioned betweene v owne admittit caluinus generalem confeſſionem admittit etiam priuatam coram paſtore ſed addit hanc liberam eſſe debere nec ab omnibus exigendam nec cogendos ad enumeranda omnia peccata praecepto aliquo aut arte inducendos niſi quoad intereſſe ſua purabunt vt ſolidum conſolationis fructum referant bellar lib 3 de poe • cap 1 proteſtants agree doctrine ſheweth ſame place cardinall witneſſeth whether conuenient man burthened ſinne lay open conſcience priuate vnto miniſter god ſeeke hand counſell inſtruction comfort god pardon whether chriſts inſtitution ſuch erat à chriſto inſtitutum bellarm ibid lindanus panop tab 4 opinio contraria haeretica eſt maldonat ieſuita summ q 18 art 4 abſolute neceſsitie priuate confeſsion ſorts men euerie particular knowne ſinne ordinarie tranſgreſſion without remiſſion pardon hoped god principall difference betweene proteſtants romaniſts ſtand vpon two foot neceſſity poſſibility romiſh confeſsiō two whoſoeuer ſhall impugne ſentēce decree councell trent forthwith pronounced si quis dixerit ſacramento p •• itentiae ad remiſſ peccatorum neceſſariū non eſſe iure diuino omnia ſingula peccata mortalia quorum memoria cum debita praemeditatione habeatur—anathema ſit si quis dixerit confeſſionem omnium peccatorum qualem eccleſia ſeruat eſſe impoſſibilem—anathema ſit concil trid seſſ 14 anathema confirmation confeſſion apologiſts haue pretended iudgement practiſe antiquitie therefore firſt giue reader vnderſtand teſtimonies tertullian cyprian impertinently obiected sect 2 2 hath bene confeſſed proteſtants greatly approue vſe priuate voluntarie confeſſion man either ſuſpecteth vnlawfulneſſe action elſe groaneth vnder ſenſible guilt troubled ſoule ſhall deſire way curing diſeaſe comfortable pronuntiation god pardon mouth hath commiſſion thereof god hope aduerſaries diſlike obiect cyprianus didiſertè ait minoribus peccatis quae quidé non deum committuntur neceſſe eſt ad exomologeſin venire idque frequenter fieri iu • e • cyprian apologiſts eite cent 3 cap 6 col 127 centuriſts haue bene miſtaken word minora peccata c thinking ſignifie thoſe romaniſts call veniall followeth priuate confeſsion thought leſſer ſinnes commaunded cyprian neceſſarie men conclude thereupon neceſsitie priuate confeſsion vpon due enqui • ie truly anſwer cyprian lib 3 epiſt 16 et exomologeſis fiat inſpecta eius vi • qui agit poenitentiā nec ad communicationem venire quis poſſit niſ • prius ab epiſcopo clero manus fuerit impoſita quanto magi grauiſſimis extremis delictis cautè omnia moderate ſecundùm diſciplinam domini obſeruari oportet argumentum epiſtola eſt significatio ad plebem ſuper lapſis c lib 3 epiſt 14 lib 1 epiſt 3 exomologeſis criminis cyprian meaning thoſe minora delicta quae non deum committuntur greatly miſtaken becauſe cyprian doth compare publike ſinnes priuate publike ſinnes publike ſinnes becauſe leſſer ſinnes ſo great committers could admitted himſelfe ſpeaketh communion church without abſolution impoſition hand biſhop cleargie great ſinnes ſpoken leſſe lapſus tempore perſecutionis renouncing faith chriſt time perſecution polluting themſelues heatheniſh idolatrie apoſtaſie faith chriſt monſter ſinnes cyprian compareth ſcandalous ſinnes men ſubiect vnto end reſolue leſſer ſinnes abſolued without confeſsion muſt theſe extreme rebellion againſt god vndergo publike cenſure offender could receiued boſome church hereby plaine exomologeſis cyprian cannot ſignifie auricular confeſſion neither thoſe minor delicta leſſer ſinnes betoken venials doth mention ſins thought priuate tranſgreſsions ſuch poſſibly hainous themſelues ſcandalous vnto saint 3 ſecond teſtimony much miſconſtrued potrò non aliam ob cauſam complurium hic teſtimonijs vſi ſumns quàm ne quis admiretur tertullianum de clancularia iſta admiſtorum confeſſ • one nihil locutum quae quantum conijcimus nata eſt ex iſta exomologeſi per vltroneam hominum pietatem vt occultorum pecc • torum eſſet exomologe • occulta • nec enim vſquam praeceptum olim legimus beatus rhenanus praf argum tertul de p • nitent tertullian owne rhenanus vpon tertullian noteth ſpeaketh priuate publike confeſsion becauſe ſaith thoſe time priuate commanded let v ſecond place triall truth antiquitie beginne ordinance god philoſophers called primum verum profeſſe antiquitie truth truth antiquitie therfore diſabling defence romiſh doctrine confeſſion lay downe propoſition viz pretended romiſh confeſsion diuine institution doctrine faith proued testimony learned aduerſaries sect 3 4 councell trent decreed si quis dixerit—neceſſariam non eſſe iure diuino c concil trident seſſ 14 neceſſarie ordinance god haue ſo beleeued vnder cenſure anathema vpon euerie one ſhall contradict neceſſitie cardinall confeſſio figuralis neceſſaria erat iure diuino à de • inſtituta—non genere tantùm ſed etiā ſpecie num cap 5 bellarm lib 3 de poenit § tertia figura probo ex nouo teſtamento ibid cap 2 alphonſ de caſtro tit confeſſio bellarmine laboureth euince figure old teſtament preſcript new notwithſtanding owne author ingenuouſly grant contrarie pedagogie old teſtament cardinal tollet ſaith propoſitum confitendi non erat neceſſarium veteri lege toletus ieſuita inſtruct sacerd tract de confeſſ purpoſe confeſsing neceſſary lyra reacheth note higher ſaying veteri lege non omnia peccata particulari explicabant quia tum impoſſibile erat tum propter breuitatem temporis tum quia sacerdos non omnia peccata populi ſciebat ſed generali addit ſicut no facimus principio miſſae lyra leuit 16 21 prieſt heard particular confeſsions people bene impoſsible onely generall accordingly haue others pronounced concerning new teſtament ieſuite maldonate witneſſeth sunt etiam inter catholicos qui putant nullum eſſe praeceptum diuinum de confeſſione vt omnes decretorum interpretes inter scholaſticos sotus maldōnat ieſ sum q 18 art 4 although adde sed haec opinio aut iam declarata eſt ſatis tanquam haeriſis aut operaepretium faceret eccleſia ſi declararet eſſe haereſin c diuerſe catholicks among interpreter decree thinke diuine precept kind confeſsion opinion notwithſtanding emboldened call hereticall whereof owne gloſſator long ſince licenced affirme melius dicitur ab vniuerſalis eccleſiae traditione quàm noui aut veteris teſtamenti authoritate inſtituram fuiſſe gloſſator apud gratian behalfe ſome affirming eraſmus annot ad epiſt hieron annot c 19 act method theolog beatus rhenanus annot lib tertull de poenit docent confeſſionem ſecretam ſingulorum peccatorum non modò non eſſe iu • e diuino inſtitutam aut imperatam ſed neque vſu antiquae eccleſiae fuiſſe vt refert bellarm lib 3 de poenit cap 1 § noſtro ſeculo priuate confeſsion ordained god practiſed ancient church confeſſio longo tempore priſca eccleſia eſt olim publicè facta maldonatus ieſuita su •• q 20 art 1 primitiue church long time confeſsion vſed publike priuate confeſſion quae non apud graecos neceſſaria eſt ad quos non manauit traditio gloſſa gratian de poenit diſt 5 c poenitentia yet acknowledged greeke church accordingly proue auguſtino ambroſe chryſoſtome queſtion made vtrum ſolá cordis contritione ſecretâ ſatisfactione abſque omni confeſſione quis poſſit deo ſatis •• cere affirmeth ſome qui dicunt quamlibet 〈◊〉 veniam ſine confeſſione fact • eccleſſae sacerdotali iud • cio poſſe promereri purpoſe alledg • th ambroſe auguſtine chryſoſtome gloſſator apud gratian quo ſuprà ludgum 1572 haue bene held neceſſarie thoſe time 6 ſuch imperfection ſight romaniſts offended brightneſſe acknowledged truth commaund ſuch teſtimonies owne men quod ſcilicet adulto peccatū non remittitur ſine oris confeſſione quod tamen fal • um eſt c gratianus ibid deleantur haec • ba quod tamen falſum eſt index expurg • rt eſt • ud pappum collat cenſurae gloſſas pag 326 pag 329 see aboue § 3 lit • put confutation pretended neceſſitie thereof like euidence brought ancient hiſtorians recording fact patriarch nectarius vpon notorious treſpaſſe deacon abrogated manner priuate confeſſion aduerſaries namely two cardinal bellarmine baronius anſwer hereunto deale ſo homely two ancient eccleſiaſtical witneſſes sozomen socrates giue soluitur argumentum caluini de facto nectarij ex sozomeno socrate qui dixerunt c neque enim ignoramus sozomenum multa mentitum bellar lib 3 de poenit cap 14 bar • nius teſtimonie next following doth ſhew lie ſo ſay caluins argument anſwered taken fact nectarius may hereby diſcerne kinde diſputers apologiſts boaſt wit men aſſume vnto themſelues cenſorious authoritie branding ancient monument note lie make reproch old hiſtorians anſwer ſatisfaction notwithſtanding anſwer beſo reſpondent aliqui non eſſe adhibendam fidem huic narrationi qui • multa mentitus eſt sozomenus socrates quoque fidem non facit hac quia haereticus erat nouatianus et ita firm • reſpondet caeſar baronius sed non potuit facilè de tantâ tam publicâ manifeſtâ mendacium confingi aliqui ergo concedunt illum • uſtuliſſe vſum ſacramenti poenitentiae suarez ieſ thom part 3 tom 4 diſp 17 § 2 improbable owne learned ieſuite suarez ia • ſuprà adding aliqui alij vt nectarium excuſent dicunt eum abſtuliſſe vſum ſed tantùm ad tempus breue ad ſedandum ſcandalum obortum • amue ſuſpenſionem ad tempu • chryſoſtomi duraſſe suarez quo ſuprà proueth neceſſary suarez dare ſupport credit hiſtorians relation report laſt refuge anſwer nectarius abrogated ex occaſione eius poenitentiae opinione bellarmini publicae acciderat flagitium diaconi cum muliere inde tumultus contra clerum exortus erat abrogabat igitur confeſſionem publicam bellarmin quo ſuprà odioſum vt credibile eſt viſum sacerdotibus tanquam theatro audiente populi multitudine delicta pronuncia • e preſbyterorum itaque aliquem vitae integritate maximè ſpectatum ſecretorum omnium tenacem ſapientem huic officio praeficiebant cum accedentes qui peccârant acta vitae • uae confitebantur ille pro cuiuſque delicto quid aut ſingulosfacere aut luere opo • tebat interminatus abloluebat vt à ſe ipſi poenas commiſſorum exigerent sozom hiſt lib 7 cap 16 cited apologiſts 162 nectarius ſimpliciter confeſſionem abrogabat tho waldenſis tom 2 cap 141 publike confeſsion onely though take away ſcandall giuen deacō fornicating publike confeſsiō would permit priuate confeſſion wherin might haue greater ſhadow couert ſuch worke darkeneſſe 7 let aduerſaries bethinke themſelues inconſiderately haue anſwered onely vnto teſtimonies socrates sozomene vnto chryſoſtome alſo ſucceſſor nectarius ſtood againſt nunc aute • neceſſe non eſt praeſentibus teſtibus confiteri chryſoſt hom de poenit confeſſ sic quidē reſpondent gratianus baronius haec intelligenda eſſe de confeſſione publica sed plurimùm obſtant huic interpretationi nonnulla verba chryſoſtomi quibus videtur excludere miniſterium lingua dicere ſola cogitatione fieri debere confeſſionem vt hom 31 epiſt ad heb ante deum confitere peccata tua apud verum iudicem • um oratione delicta tua pronuncia non lingua ſed conſcientiae tuae memoria igitur haec expoſitio videtur mihi valdè probabilis loqui chryſoſt • mum de ſecreta confeſſione suarez ieſ thom part 3 tom 4 diſp 17 § 2 addit suarez quanquam non excludit eius neceſſitatem publike confeſsion baronius would haue ieſuite suarez confeſſeth againſt priuate thus much abſolute neceſſitie commaunded confeſſion followeth impoſsibilitie romiſh auricular confeſsion acknowledged owne doctor sect 5 8 man ſay command iuſtly impoſed law neceſsitie wherein ſtampe impoſsibilitie performance euerie ſuch law reigneth king tyrant kind doubt decree neceſſarie confeſsion appeare 9 doctrine proteſtants concerning priuate confeſſion particular ſins permit cardinall bellarmine report admittit etiā caluinus priuatam confeſſionē coram paſtore quando quis ita angitur afflictatur peccatorum ſenſu vt ſe explicare niſi alieno adiutorio nequeat ſed addit moderationem vt libera ſit ne • ab omnibus exigatur nec neceſſariò de omnibus etenim inquit melancthon connum eratio omnium impoſſibilis c vnto theſe adioyneth conſent kemnitius non neceſſariam eſſe ait omniſi proteſtantium bellarm lib 3 de poenit cap 1 caluin ſaith adioyneth vnto caluin proteſtants admitteth priuate confeſsion made vnto pastor whenſoeuer afflicted conſcience ſhall haue need anothers helpe yet moderation confeſsion free exacted ſecondly enioyne rehearſall particular ſinnes herein condemning romane church appeareth double error firſt opinion neceſſitie charge men vpon danger damnation confeſſe ſecret ſinnes ſecond exacting enumeration particular doctrine impoſſibilitie romiſh kind neceſſitie diuerſe see • ormer section vnto 〈◊〉 adde panormitanus gerſon eam non neceſſariam eſſe contenderunt gregor de valent ieſ de miſſa lib 2 cap 4 romaniſts haue already excepted againſt authoritie scripture father practiſe ancient church 10 point impoſſibilitie practiſe romiſh church ſo maruellouſly exorbitant degenerate cauſed owne rhenanus complaine chiefe schoolemen scotus aquinas haue deuteronomy new rule made forme priuate confeſſion aquinas scotus nimiùm arguti homimes talem confeſſionem reddiderunt vt grauis theologus ſaepè teſtatus ſit iuxta illorum deuteroſeis impoſſibile eſſe nobis confiteri beatus rhenanus argum tertull de poenit vnpoſsible obſerued equidem credo de hac controuerſiam nullam futuram ſi non haec ſalutaris confitendi medieina ab ignaris importunis medici multis inutilibus traditionibus infecta contaminata fuiſſet quibus conſcientijs quas extricare leuare debebant laqueos proued canon rule romiſh aduerſaries sect 6 11 councell trent hath preſcribed de mortalibus circumſtantiae quae n • tabiliter aggrauant peccatum confeſsione explitare eſt neceſſarium eius generis ſunt ſeptem quis quid propter quid quo modo quibus auxilijs vbi quando suarez ieſ • im 4 diſp 22 § 1 ieſuits haue proclaimed confeſsion mortall ſinnes materiall circumſtances ſuch ſinnes circumſtances ſeuen incident vnto action men wit end helpes done 12 reaſon hereof ieſuite maldonate hath thus expreſſed vnus finis confi • endi eſt vt obligaret homines ne ipſi iudices eſſent habeant peccatum illud fit mortale veniale quia plerumque imperiti ſunt ideoque cogendl ſunt exponere quicquid fecerunt sacerdoti vt iudicet peccarent nec • e vt peccatores vi clauſum obtinerent remiſsionem peccatorem quapropter sacerdos debet omnia remittere quia non poteſt remittere niſi qu • audit omnia debet audire maldon ieſ ſum q 18 art 8 art 3 4 becauſe men ſaith commonly competent iudges owne caſes able oftentimes ſay whether act ſinfull thinke infected ſinne yet deſcerne whether mortall veniall therefore compellable confeſſe vnto prieſt whatſoeuer haue done may obtaine remiſsion ſinne becauſe priest remit ſins ſuch heareth confeſſed muſt remit muſt first heare nec sacerdos remittit vllum peccatum niſi poenitens proferat quae debet omnia suarez ieſ tom 4 diſp 22 neither prieſt remit one ſinne ſaith ieſuite suarez except penitent confeſſe ought confeſſe 13 caſe plaine howſoeuer reliqua peccata quae diligenter cogitanti non occurrūt vniuerſum eadem confeſsi one incluſa intelliguntur concil trid seſſ 14 cap 5 wrap vp whole bundle forgotten ſins within thoſe confeſſed yet reaſon giue neceſſitie confeſſion ſheweth man obliged confeſſe ſo much becauſe iudgeth owne act ſinful may iudged whether hath ſinned becauſe ignorance may miſdeeme action taking good ſinne ſins think venial indeed mortal party confeſſing chargeable rule ieſuits concluſion reueale whatſoeuer hath done whatſoeuer might either word worke ſubiect vnto mortall ſin rather becauſe ieſuit coſterus truly obſerueth saepè quae leuia ſunt nobis grauia ſunt deo quod primo parentes ob culpam vt primo aſpectu apparet leuem de ſummo gradu dignitatis maximas miſerias cum vniuerſa poſteritate deturbabat coſterus ieſ enchirid tract de fide ſpeciali § admittitur may ſeeme light offence vnto man hainous god ſight exemplifieth firſt ſinne ſo may well ſeemed vnto offender gen 3 faire pleaſant veniall ſinne mortall yea immortal worme within call ſinne doth engender vnto death eternall bondage word work onely euen inward affection ſecret cogitation cauſed chriſt vpbraid phariſees matth 9 4 euill thought thought alſo howſoeuer free among men cannot diſcerne enter ballances god triall iudgement 14 briefe know remiſſion heart ſubiect vnto contagion ſinne muſt follow either manner confeſſion end neceſſarie elſe endleſſe impoſſible 15 secondly curioſitie art confeſſion ſearching ripping vp men ſores hath proued ſo loathſome biſhop tyardaeus doth greatly complaine ſome ieſuits iſti verò ſpeaking ieſuits ſancti ſcil pneumatici quibuſdam interrogationum formulis circa ſcrupuloſas peccatorum differentia obſcoena either ſearching moſt obſcene filthy circumſtances fault ſo farre hardly vttered confeſſed without ſhame prieſt without ſome diſhoneſt motion might peraduenture thought defect ſome reade generall inſtruction concerning caſe vnde ſi confeſſarius fortè dum audit confeſsiones tale incidit pollutiones non ob id tenetur non audire alios niſi ſit periculū complacentiae pollutione tollet ieſ condemning abſoluing amiſſe god diſcerner ſpirits iſa 22 22 ſhutteth man openeth openeth man ſhut whereby may happen innocent ſoule may ſtand bound inferiour court man iudgement yet grace acquitted notorious offender wherein ſhould proceed without partiality paul againſt 1 cor 5 inceſtuous cyprian againſt thoſe see aboue apoſtates duly executed according power giuen vnto thē might many wretched diſſolute ſinners drawn sathans bond allude vnto prophet dauids pſalme might ſing ſay pſal 23 4 thyrod thy ſhepheards ſtaffe hath comforted cannot wiſh vigour ancient diſcipline reuiued ſo haue aduerſaries cauſe boaſt practiſe thereof ieſuits willingly confeſſe quod non tam apertè frequenter ſpecie re etiam ipſa indulgentiarum à veteribus commemoretur cauſa fuit vſus ſeuerioris poenitentiae qu • temporibus illis multum vigebat ita vt non eſſet magnoperè neceſſarium beneficio indulgentiarum vti poſteà verò decreſcente feruore poenitentiae illarum indulgentiarum vſus inualeſcere coepit greg de val ieſ lib de indulg cap 4 paulò poſt initium quia tunc homines feruentiores erant bonis operibus minùs indigebant indulgentijs quàm no ergo non tam amplas remiſsiones habebant tollet ieſ inſtruct sacerd lib 6 ca 22 ſeueritie diſcipline vſed ſo feruently ancient time decreaſed ſo vſe indulgence increaſe effect much grant late doctrine practiſe romiſh indulgence bane ouerthrow ancient diſcipline luther know great probatur indulgentia ex bulla leonis 10 contra lutherū decretali quam ad caietanum legatū ſuum miſit germaniam greg valen tom 4 diſp 49 § 2 enemie vnto romiſh indulgence herein inclining ancient ſafer practiſe 18 concerning priuate ſinnes origen ſaith muſt purged vomit meaning orall confeſſion vnto church whereby ſurfets man heart vndiſgeſted gorge loathſome conſcience disburdened alſo hold good phiſicke verie ſoueraigne ſoule man may done either generall confeſſion ſinnes elſe diſtrict acknowledgement ſome particular 19 generall confeſſion need diſpute cardinall admittit caluinus lib 3 inſtit cap 4 generalem confeſſionem quam miniſter pro ſe populo eccleſia faciat bellarm lib 3 de poenit cap 1 bellarmine doth grant practized amongſt proteſtants onely queſtion kind vſe priuate confeſſion aduerſaries haue witneſſed acknowledged proteſtants double limitation reſtraint firſt foreſaid § 4 freedome conſciences ſecond § 5 § 6 poſsibilitie performance 20 conſiderations romiſh doctrine confeſſion may iudged leſſe ſafe becauſe preſcribed vnder damnation § 2 anathema held neceſſary poſsible hath bene confeſſed owne doctor § 3 haue bene ordained god § 4 practized primitiue church held § 4 neceſſarie greeke church vnto day haue bin transformed § 5 6 ſnare men conſciences impoſsibility due diſcharge abuſe wherof hath bene occaſion § 6 vnto cōfeſſors pollutiō alſo vnto many confeſſed grieuous ſacrilegious impi • tie experiēce wherof one diuines moued ridenda eſt theologi illius ſententia qui optimè conſultum iri indis dixit ſcripſit ſi confeſsionum obligatio tollereretur ne tot inquit tam grauia ſacrilegia perpetrare cogantu • ſtultam hominis vocem—ſi peruerſis remedio quouis abutentibus iſta eſt ratio medendi tolle matrimonia ne fiant adulteria—qui • potiùs apud rectè ſapienter aeſtimantem pluris eſt quòd pauci electi per medicinam ſanantur quà quod plurimi reprobi per eius abuſum deteriores fiant acoſta ieſ lib 6 de indorum ſalute cap 16 ſay write good ſpeaking romiſh maner cōfeſſing abuſed conuerts india taken away let v proceed chap xv penitentiall satisfaction romish apologie alſo penance centur 3 col queſtion sect 1 every proteſtant eaſily confeſſe satisfactio poenitentiae eſt peccatorum cauſas exſcindere nec earum ſuggeſtionibus aditum indulgere auguſt apud gratian diſt 3 c satisfactio quim magna deliquimus tam granditer defleamus alto vulneri diligens longa medicina non defit cyprian serm de lapſis cyprian ancient father enioyne vnto offender proportionable outward penance might properly medicinable helpe mortifying ſinne teſtifing inward remorſe together ſatisfying party offended eſpecially church god thereby procure church praiers miniſteriall abſolution pardon god onely queſtion concerning manner iniunctions whether ſomewhat reprehenſible better diſcharge point firſt declare farre theſe exception taken protestant iuſtifiable iudgement learned aduerſaries sect 2 2 taxation ancient father onely inconueniency nimis aſperè durè locuti ſunt non tamen concedam eo ſenſu dixiſſe quo accipiuntur à nouis ſatisfactionarijs vt probo ex chryſoſt auguſtino qui omnem ſatisfactionem referebant non ad expiationem delictorum praeteritorum ſed ad cautionem poſterum ſe peccatis abſtinendi caluinus loco à bellarmino citato lib 4 de notis eccleſ cap 9 heare caluine himſelfe ſpeake word ſubiect miſconſtructions omnes ferè veteres quorum libri extant hac parte lapſi ſunt vbi de ſatiſfaction • agitur nimis aſperè durè locuti ſunt sed non concedam eos ipſos adeò fuiſſe rudes imperitos vt eo ſenſu illa ſcripſerint quo à nouis ipſis ſatisfactionarijs leguntur chryſoſt enim ita ſcribit homil pſal 150 vbi miſericordia efflagitatur interiogatio ceſſat vbi miſericordia petitur poenae locus non eſt quae verba vtcunque torqueantur cum scholaſticis conciliari nunquam poterunt et auguſtinus poenitentiae ſatisfactio eſt cauſas peccatorum exſcindere nec ipſorum ſuggeſtionibus aditum indulgere quo apparet illis quoque ſeculis ir • iſam paſsim fuiſſ • ſatiſfactionis doctrinam quae pro delictis admiſsis rependi dicitur cùm omnem ſatisfactionem referant ad cautionem ſe poſterum à peccatis abſtinendi caluin lib 3 cap 4 § 38 c ſence poſitiue doctrine caluin himſelfe proueth expreſſe doctrine ſame father whoſe integritie acquitting father error doctrine apologiſts ought right haue acknowledged ſeeing name romaniſts ſo odious commaund supprimatur nomen caluini loco caluinus ponatur studioſus quidam index expurg belg pag 204 blotted euen ſentence iudgemēt greatly praiſworthy maruel ſhould thought leſſe gracious although otherwiſe ſelfe neuer ſo iuſtifiable may appeare obſeruation cardinall bellarmine bequeatheth vnto reader teaching vnderſtand satisfactio non offertur pro culpa ſed pro poena quòd ſi veteres patres interdum actionibus humanis tribuere id videntur vt pro expianda culpa ſatisfaciant interpretandi ſunt ex congruo non ex condigno bellar lib 4 de poenit cap 1 father attribute ſatisfaction vnto men action expiation ſinnes muſt interpreted vnderſtand ſatisfaction merit de congruo congruitie onely properly called merit de condigno equall ancient father might therefore haue behooued theſe romaniſts alſo centuriſts haue accorded aboue ſpecified wiſdome moderation caluine reprouing ſome hyperbolicall exceſsiue phraſes haue bene directed perſpicuous plaine teſtimonies wherby clearely manifeſt orthodoxall meaning whereof deliuer reader taſt ſhewing ancient father denie penitentiall work properly ſatisfactorie vnto god sect 3 4 although father ſometimes exceed phraſe ſpeech hath bene confeſſed terming penance onely medicinall correction allow euen alſo expiatorie price ſatisfaction god diuine iuſtice againſt guilt ſinne cardinall haue warily interpreted vnproper ſence yet ſame father caſt eies vpō ſome penitēts proudly conceited worthineſſe humilitie teach ſuch men chriſtus nobis propitiatio factus eſt ergo ipſo omninò poenitentiae ſacrificium miniſtratur agitur omne quod ex poenitentia quis conſequitur ad cum refertur heſychius leuit 7 lib 2 esteeme chriſt onely propitiation penance acknowledge cùm omnem vitam peccatis detriuerim ſi poenituerit fiámne ſaluus prorſus fies vnde hoc liquet ab ipſa domini tui benignitate non ex tua poenitentia mihi ſumo fiduciam poenitentia enim tua non valet tantam abſtergere malorum luem c chryſoſt de poenit homil 3 ſiue hypomuemat eſalam mercie onely penance purgeth leproſie ſinne therefore ergo agendam poenitentiam tribuendam veniam credere no conuenit vt veniam tamen tanquam ex fide ſperemus non tanquam ex debito ambroſ de penit lib 2 cap 8 penance hope pardon right promiſe faith becauſe sola ſecundi adami tribulatio purgat quos contaminauit offenſio ſola prioris non quòd propria cuiquam ſufficere poſsit ſatisfactio quid enim omnis poenitentia noſtra niſi quòd ſi non compatimur omninò non poſſumus corregnare bernard de verb lib iob ſex trib quibus labonbus quibus ieiunijs poſſumus noſtra lauare peccata ambroſ pſal 118 ſerm 20 penitentiall labour themſelues waſh wound etſi fratres pro fratribus moriamur tamen fratemorum peccatorum remiſſ nullius ſanguis martyris funditur quod fecit chriſtus pro nobis nec hoc quid imitemur ſed quid gratulemur contulit nobis auguſt ioh tract 84 martyr die others ſaid haue power imitating chriſt gaining remiſsion men ſinnes becauſe chriſt hath giuen v vertue imitation herein congratulation teſtifie ego teſtificor ac fide iubeo fore vt ſi quiſquam noſtrûm qui peccatis obnoxij ſumus recedens à priſtinis mali ex animo veréque promittat deo ſe poſtea nunquam ad illa rediturum nihil aliud deus requirat ad ſatisfactionem vlteriorem chryſoſt de beato philogonio non dixit ſi caſtigaremus noſipſos ſi ſupplicium de nobis ſumemus ſed ſi ſolùm velimus agnoſcere peccata ſi noſipſos condemnate liberaremur vtique ab huius futuri ſeculi ſupplicijs chryſoſtom 1 cor homil 28 god merit acceptance accepteth ſincere aduocatum habemus c auguſt contra 2 epiſt pelagian lib 3 cap 5 hope haue aduocate requiſite according order diſpute ſhew farre diſtance betweene romiſh church iudgement antiquitie point penitentiall ſatisfaction firſt want obſeruation due order sect 4 5 firſt aberration antiquitie doth appeare practiſe father enioyned ſinners performe ſome externall kind penance medicinable cure ſicke ſoule trial vnfained repentance euer abſolue reſtore peace church appeareth laſt obiected place cyprian confeſſion owne hoc intereſt inter actionem poenitentiae ſeu exomologeſin veteribus vſitatam eam quae nunc vſu recepta eſt quòd olim niſi operibus ab eccleſiae praefecto iniunctis ritè peractis abſolutio reconciliatio communionis ius per manus impoſitionem non concedebatur—quae quidem actiones ad remiſsionem impetrandam dei offenſam placandam valere putabantur non quòd eam dignitate ſua mere • entur ſed quòd eis animus hominis ad gratiae diuinae ſuſceptionem praepararetur—hodié verò à facta confeſsione manus poenitenti imponuntur ad communionis iu • admittitur poſt abſolutionem opera aliqua pietatis quae ad carnis caſtigationem reliquiarum peccati expurgationem faciant iniunguntur quod ipſum vtiliter fieri poteſt ſi periti miniſtri eccleſiae opera adhibeatur caſſand art 12 de confeſſione caſſander 6 contrarywiſe romaniſts likewiſe obſerueth firſt abſolue confeſsing penitent afterwards impoſe vpon ſatisfactory work note thinking work godly may wholſomly enioined pretender antiquity ſhould thus prepoſterous beſides ſecond aberration onely father euen owne profeſsion diuerſe ſtrange vnreaſonable manner diminiſhing diſſoluing penance sect 5 7 ieiunijs orationibus eleemoſynis vel alijs pietatis officijs no poſſe ſatiſfacere concil trident seſſ 14 13 glorie indeed much penitentiall act wit faſting praier almes work pietie yet ſo inſtruct prieſts vſe multis modis poteſt confeſſor diminuere poenitentiam—tertiò quando poenitens eſt ita imperfectus vt timor ſit ipſum non accepturū poenitentiam aut ſi accipit non impleturū many way diminiſhing men penance example may doubted penitent either wil receiue enioyned penance elſe performe penitent cannot offended may 8 willing haue ſuch penance enioyned taught vſe gentle plaiſter forme quintò quādo alià viâ iuuantur poenitentia ſatisfactio imponendo ei omnia quae facturus eſt bona quae paſſuru • eſt patienter niala loco poenitentiae—ſciendum eſt quòd opera alii deo debita—si à confeſſario imponantur ſatisfactionem valent vltra obligationem cui etiam ſatisfaciant quando autem confeſſarius abſolutè imponit poenitentiam intelligitur de opere aliàs indebito vt cùm dicit ieiuna duo dy non intelligit dy quibus eſt praeceptum •• iunium tollet ieſ inſtruct sacerd lib 3 cap 11 whatſoeuer good thou ſhalt whatſoeuer euill thou ſhalt patiently endure vnto thee ſtead thy penance penal matter commonly work commaunded god ſuch work theſe cal opera aliàs deo debita work euery chriſtian man euen without penance bound performe vnto god conſequently penance without penance 9 againe leſt penitent might proue refractarie wayward child haue prouided prieſt confeſſion may poteſt vnus pro altero reiunare vel bona opera facere ſed quod eſt meriti ſibi non alteri dari poteſt—poteſt igitur confeſſarius imponere poenitentiam poenitenti per ſe vel per alium implendam licet non debet facere niſi rationabili de cauſa idem ibid impoſe vpon partie penance performed either himſelfe another ſo may ſufficient get another man faſt heard phyſicke one ſhould receiue health another man diet diuinitie ſhall iudged according 2 corinth 5 owne work iuſtified roman 1 owne faith law iuſtice teacheth puniſhment galat 6 euerie one muſt beare owne burthen yet thus thought good prouide delicate penitentiary beating vpon men ſhoulders inflicting inſenſible puniſhments vpon kind tranſlation puniſhment ancient father dreamed would haue entertained laughter yet pittying men folly could haue permitted laugh third reuolt antiquitie diſſoluing doctrine penance new doctrine indulgence practiſing thereby kind impoſtureſhip sect 6 10 heare boaſt preſcript proculdubiò magnoperè à peccato reuocant quaſi fraeno quodam coercent poenae ſatisfactoriae concil trid seſſ 14 cap 8 ſatisfactorie puniſhments bridle curb repreſſe men ſinne yet haue found meanes looſe raines new art themſelues define per indulge • tia conceſſas ſatisfacit cū poenis impoſitis confeſſione vt ſi confeſſor impoſuit ei diſciplinam ieiuniū cleemoſynam vel ſimilia opera ſi indulgentiam conſequatur non tenetur ſubire poenas tollet ieſ lib 6 cap 23 indulgentia cùm abſoluto conceditur non apponendo illud periculum de iniunctis tunc valet quantum ad ea quae remiſſionem peccatorum iniunguntur confeſſore quae iniungenda eſſent vel confeſſione vel iuſto dei iudicio tollet ibid ca 23 § quartò indulgence pardon theſe penitentiall act enioyned ſinner confeſſor abſolution church become indulgent mother indeed one article three ſtrings bridle called ſatisfaction wit praiers faſtings almes wholy diſanulled granting vnto partie ſhould ſatisfie pardon ſo large ſometime ſome secundùm vſum sarum quicunque ſtatu gratiae exiſtens deuotè dixerit ſeptem orationes ſequentes cum ſeptem pater noſter ſeptem aue mariae ante imaginem pietatis merebitur 56 annorum millia indulgentias c ho • ae b mariae virg ſecundùm vſ •• sarum papa poteſt illam tot dierum annorum mille millium concedere qualis poſita reperitut diuerſis conceſſionibus ſummorum pontificum vel aliorum gerſon 2 p tract de indulg conſiderat 8 alias alphab 34 lit thouſand yeares ſo light ſaying vnknowne praiers yea cardin bellar see aboue lib 1 ca 2 § 21 leaſt cauſe obtaine ſometimes greateſt indulgence leſt might thinke pope father church could ſo farre doate old age lauiſh indulgence without reaſon ieſuite doth admoniſh diſciples gratian vbi euidenter non conſtiterit indulgentiam ſine legitima cauſa eſſe conceſſam contemnenda non eſt nec minoris efficaciae eſt reputanda quàm verba ſonant—ratio eſt quia superioris factum ſemper eſt praeſumendum eſſe legitimum validum praeſertim ſummo pontifice—de cuius iudicio dixit gratianus nemini licere diſputare § qui autem 17 q cuius ſententia praeſumitur iuſta quando non eſt euidenter iniuſta—hoc ſatis eſt vt nulla indulgentia eius quantumuis magna excedens appareat omninò contemnenda ſit licet fortaſſis non val • quoad totum effectum valebit quoad aliquem—vltimò quamuis aliquo caſu contingeret committi intollerabilem errorem manifeſtum quantitate vel cauſa indulgentiae nunquam eſt publicè ſpernenda aut liberè reprehendēda haec aſſertio magi ad prudentiam pertinet quàm ad doctrinam probatur tamen tum quia cauendum eſt ne cum haereticis verb • aut factus quae pontificis imminuere authoritatem videantur etiam apparenter conueniamus—tum etiam quia buiuſmodi zelus nec neceſſarius eſt neque vtilis suarez ieſ tom 4 diſp 56 § vlt hold lawfull diſpute pope iudgement preſume iuſt except contrarie euidently appeare although ſhould commit ſome intollerable error granting indulgence yet publikely deſpiſed freely reproued becauſe beware leſt either word deed agree heretikes ſuch thing wherein authoritie pope may ſeeme empaired alſo becauſe zeale neither neceſſarie profitable 11 wholſome counſell wel befitting child zealous truth owne victoria doctor chaire publike reader vniuerſitie salmanca spaine inſtiled among academiae salmanticenſis incomparabilis moderato • fronte libri incomparable moderator ſpared note pope prodigall diſpenſations decree church papa diſpenſando de decretis conciliorum poteſt grauiter errare vtinam liceret dubitare de hac concluſione—ſed videmus • curia romana quotidiè tam largas imo omninò tam diſſolutas diſpenſationes profectas vt orbis ferre non poſſit nec ſolùm ſcandalum puſillorum ſed etiam maiorum franciſ de victoria relect 4 〈…〉 ſee daily ſaith ſent court rome greater world ſuffer concluſion doubted pope erre alphabet 〉 euripides see indulgence aboue lib 1 cap 2 ſect 20 c called benignitie indeed nurſe impietie 13 secondly conſult concerning obliged penance giue almes vnto poore reſolue ſit melius dare argentum eleemolynam quim ſubſidium ad conſequendam indulgentiam—loquendo ex genere cenſeo melius eſſe ſubſidium facecere ad conſequendam indulgentiam suarez ieſ tom 4 diſp 49 § vlt pag 633 better beſtow money gaining pardon pope non eſt de neceſſitate indulgentiae vt ſub conditione alicuius pijoperis concedatur suarez ibid diſp 52 § 4 may ſometimes granted ſay without condition good worke well money paid ſhall haue doubt whether indulgentias per ſe non valere ad remiſſionem culpae venialis alij quae vt probabilior communior theologorum ſententia reſtringunt ad poenam temporalem suarez ieſ tom 4 diſp 50 § 1 num 10 11 remiſsion guilt veniall ſinnes onely temporall puniſhment temporall puniſhmēt cannot conſent quidam ſenſerunt iſtis non remitti reatum poenae apud deum ſed ſolùm obligationem exe quendi ſacramentalem poenitentiam quae opinio antiqua fuit propter formam indulg pro iniunctis poenitentijs alij valere ad remittendas quaſcunque poenas relictas ex peccatis remiſſ ibid § 3 whether onely puniſhments penance enioyned prieſts whatſoeuer remiſſion iuſtice requireth matter faith ſoules comfort man ſhould ſtand vpon ſome good ground aſſurance therfore pay plenum plenior ple • iſſima aliqui ad diſtinguenda membra ſupponunt indulgentiam plenam pleniorem non eſſe totales abſolutè ſed vel ordine ad mortalia tantum vel ordine ad peccata confeſſa vel ad poenitentias iniunctas—ſed veriſimile eſt vnam remiſſionem potuiſſe dici plenam c ibid § 4 pleniſsimam indulgentiam moſt full pardon reaſon ſome ſay ſuch pardon vnderſtood ſignifie totall abſolution pay two pardon ſenſible ſome teach vna indulgentia deſtruitur per aduentum alterius ita corduba ſed exiſtimo nunquam indulgentiam hoc modo • olli ibid diſp 57 § 2 one ſhall diſanull whatſoeuer effect may yet little ſecuritie traffick whileſt ſome aduerſaries defend either pope pardoner indulgentiam conceſſain à pontifice vt perpetuam ſemper durare eſſe tamen ſemper reuocationi obnoxiam ibid § 1 valet reuocatio ad nutum concedenus etiamſi ſine cauſ • ibid § 2 may reuoke euē without giuing notice cauſe vnto partie poſſit pontifex per ſolum actum contrariae voluntatis reuocare indulgentiam ibid contrarie act elſe indulgentijs • ibeſt conditio niſi chriſtus reprobet gerſon 2 p de indulg papa poſſit errare concedendis indulgenti • see confeſſed may deceiued giue pardon chriſt approue elſe promiſe pardon vertue non defuit eccleſia qui negauerit huiuſmodi eſſe ſaurum eccleſiae ſpiritualem qui per indulgentiam diſpenſari valet contraria videtur de ſide vel haec ſaltem erronea suarez quo ſuprà diſp 51 § 1 ex theologis praeter maironē • randus—auſus eſt negare ſaurum eccleſiae conſtantem ex meritis vel ſatisfactionibus aliorum praeter chriſtum—contraria certa eſt—id confirmat leo • cimus contra lutherum suarez ibid § 2 § 3 ſpirituall treaſurie ſaid conſist merit ſatisfactions chriſt saint laying ground faith truth indulgence notwithſtanding owne teacher haue bene ſo bold denie ſuch treaſure church 14 maruell see aboue lib 1 c 2 § 22 doctor day luther haue called indulgence godly deceit herein onely deceiued call godly common experience cauſed others church complaine extinguiſhed pietie exhauſted made vile keyes church ſhould ſuch pardoner haue need himſelfe many pardon luther iuſtly call pope bull bullam bubble reſpect vanitie whereof ſpeciall argument may nec scriptura nec ex dictis antiquorum doctorum ſed modernorum antonin summ part 1 tit 10 c 3 doctrine indulgence found either scripture tradition ancient father practiſe thereof cùm purgatorium tam ſcriò cognitum ac receptum eccleſiae fuerit vniuerſae quis iam de indulgentijs mirati poteſt quum principio naſcentis eccleſiae nullus fuerat earum vſus roffenſis aduerſus luther art 18 vſe primitiue church ante tempora lombardi gratiani qui ſcripſerunt ante annos 400 indulgentiarum vſus non erat frequens greg de valent ieſ de indulg cap 4 reaſon alledged vſus poenae ſeuerioris yet much requeſt day peter lombard liued 1200 yeares chriſt cannot well ſort pretence antiquitie followeth confutation romiſh doctrine satisfaction taken manifold doubt perplexity wherewith owne doctor entangled defence thereof according confeſsions learned aduerſaries sect 7 15 find wrangling queſtioning among themſeues concerning act satisfaction enioyned penance prima ſententia requirit opera quae praecepta non ſunt reckoning ſeuē doctor ratio—quia ſi opus eſt debitū ex praecepto non poteſt eodē ſolui debitum pro peccato—tertia ſententia eſt—etiam praecepta ad ſatisfaciendum valere accounting ſeuen others anſwering debitum praecepti eſt debitum obedientiae— meritorium—etſi poenale eſt ſatisfactorium eſſe poſſit suarez ieſ tom 4 diſp 37 § 4 whether worke precept commaundement god onely counſell perfection commaunded ſatisfactorie worke worke perfection yet whether muſt neceſſarily prima eſt opus ſatisfactorium eſſe per ſe etiamſi nihil poenale inſit citing foure author secunda eſt ſolum fieri per opus poenale quatenùs poenale eſt citing eleuen ibid § 6 penall haue nature puniſhment griefe penall yet wherein ſatisfactorie vertue conſiſteth •• ſunt extremae ſententiae prima ponit totum valorem ad ſatisfaciendum exteriori actu—ſecunda contraria eſt totum ponens interiori suarez ib § 5 whether onely inward outward act yet concerning perfection whether ſtand need god acceptation ſoeuer yet cōcerning effect whether quidam dicunt fieri ſatisfactionem pro temporali poena ſed non pro culpa—alij meliores theologi—dicunt ſatisfactiones verè propriè fieri pro culpa vega lib 13 cap 36 auaileable guilt temporall puniſhment onely either ſo ſo yet concerning neceſſitie whether ſatisfaction ſatisfactio ſit par eſſentialis vel tantùm integralis paluda • u eſſentialem huius ſacramenti alij integralem—quia perfici poteſt hoc ſacramentum nulla ſatisfactione impoſita suarez 〈◊〉 ſuprà diſp 38 § 1 num 18 ſo eſſentiall vnto sacramēt penance abſolution without may yet concerning part hereof whether per contritionem ipſam per confeſſionem homo ſatisfacit vnde interdum fi illa ſa ••• factio aequalis ſit non eſt alia neceſſaria quamuis contrarium ſenfit richardus suarez tom 4 diſp 38 § 3 contrition confeſsion ſometime ſerue ſatisfaction ſatisfaction ſelfe ſhal thought neceſſarie yet concerning quantitie aliqui doc ••• ſatisfactionem minimam nullum effectum habere—alij totum reatum poenae tollere idem ibid § 2 whether leaſt ſatisfaction ſufficient take away whole guilt puniſhment done yet concerning obligation poe • ten teneatur acceptare impoſitam ſatisfactionem alij noting eight negan • cum teneri—vera ſententia eſt obliga •• poſ • e vt teneat alledging ſixteene suarez ibid § 7 whether party confeſſed chargable conſcience vndergo performe penance ſatisfaction enioyned vna opinio ſatisfactionem hanc non indigere promiſſione aut acceptatione •• alia eſt totum negotium ſatisfactionis noſtrae poſitum eſſe diuina acceptatione beneuolentia ibid § 7 16 thus profeſſion caſe appeareth founded vpon reſolued principle vpon diſſolute coniectures knowing nature penitentiall work eſſentiall propertie sacrament validitie ſatisfaction neceſſitie thereof either prieſt enioyne penitent performe adioyne ſecond confutation romiſh satisfaction reſpect opinion merit derogatorie chriſt perſonall ſatisfaction confeſsions conſequences aduerſaries sect 8 17 contention whether penitentiall ought faſtings abſtainings euen ordinarie lawfull delight deteſtation ſin take iuſt reuenge vpon himſelfe 1 co • 7 11 vpon place caluine thou caeterùm quia peccata debemus vlciſci vbicunque ſint neque id modò ſed à nobis potiſ •• nùm incipere • atiùs patet quod hic dicit apoſtolus loquitur enim de ſignis poenitentiae hoc vnū eſt inſigne inter reliqua dum peccata vindicando dei iudicium quodammodo auertimus quemadmodum alibi docet 1 cor 11 si no iudicaremus non iudicaremur vtique à deo caluinus eum locum apoſtles doctrine according expoſition caluin whether publike offender ought make publike acknowledgement ſcandalous fault endure cenſure church ſatisfaction vnto god people make queſtion whether practiſe action holy deuotion habituating diſpoſing ſelues may capable reconciliation god whether theſe kind penance owne nature properly ſatisfie god iuſtice preuaile free men puniſhment due vnto ſinne 18 let point equally weighed theſe two ballances wit proteſtants obiection ſolution romaniſts ſhall reader eaſily diſcerne whether profeſſion weight obijcitur si applicatur nobis per opera noſtra chriſti ſatiſfactio vel duae ſunt ſatisfactiones ſimul • unctae vel vna tantùm ſi duae tum • punitur eadem culpa ſi vna vel chriſti eſt vel noſtra ſ • chriſti tunc no non ſatisfacimus vel noſtra rum aut chriſtum excludimus aut cum chriſto honorem diuidimus nam • le ſoluet pro culpa no pro poena reſp proteſtants obiect vnto v ſaith cardinall bellarmine ſatisfactorie work ſatisfaction chriſt applied vnto v either muſt two kind ſatisfactions ioyned together elſe one two ſame fault twice puniſhed ſo ſhould ſatisfie guilt one either chriſts chriſts ſatisfie deuide honour ſatisfaction chriſt heare aduerſaries anſwer alij reſpondent quòd ſint duae ſed vna ab altera pendens nam etiamſi vna ſuffi • eret tamen ad maiorem dei glotiam cui ſatisfacit maiorem bonorem hominis ſatisfacientis placuit chriſto con •• ngere noſtram ſatisfactionem ſuae quomodo etiam homo iuſtus adulrus duplici titulo • u • habet ad eandem gloriam vno ex meritis chriſti ſibi communicatis per gratiam altero ex meritis proprijs qui modus non videtur mihi improbabilis 〈◊〉 lib 1 de purg cap 14 § quarta ratio § secundus eſt § quartus v haue anſwered ſaith ſame cardinall two diuerſe ſatisfactions one depending though one ſatisfaction chriſt ſufficient yet greater glorie god ſatisfaction made honour man ſatisfying pleaſed chriſt ioyne ſatisfaction owne together man hath double title vnto eternall glorie one merit christ communicated vnto grace ſecond owne merit manner ſatisfaction improbable 19 doctrine ioyning honour chriſt man maruellous worke satisfaction themſelues affirme certaine owne eies onely improbable proteſtants iudge rather execrable according confeſſions owne doctor see aboue lib 1 cap 2 sect 23 louaine haue iudged paſsionall work men properly called ſati • faction therefore rather apply faith vnto bernard reſolution light ſhining darkneſſe ſuperſtition time diſſolution conflict sathan preſume owne ſatisfaction ioyned ſatisfaction christ contrarily thus commend ſoule vnto god see aboue confeſſe ſaith vnworthie owne merit cannot attaine kingdom heauen neuertheleſſe lord sauiour poſſeſſeth double right one natural inheritance merit paſsion contented firſt himſelfe vertue ſecond hath bequeathed vnto god grant euerie chriſtian whenſoeuer ſhall take laſt ſleepe may lay head pillow adde preoccupation preuention obiection vſually obtruded romaniſts imputing vnto proteſtants licentiouſneſſe religion confuted compariſon one article contrition sect 9 20 secundù • lutherum haec gratia non inf • mditur abſque magna animi concuſſione vehemens igitur animi concuſſio cum nequeat non fentiri dum adſit neque talem plerique ex qui confitentur vllam ſentiunt conſequitur vt non ſit impoſſibile confeſſum aliquando contritum non eſſe roffenſ epiſcopus art 12 aduerſus luther luther aduerſarie biſhop roffenſis noteth ſaith grace infuſed heart ſinner except ſo great affliction ſpirit cannot feele otherwiſe maketh confeſsion without contrition likewiſe proteſtants docet kemnitius contritionem acrem vehementem caluinus nullos niſi conſcientia vulneratos ſincerè dei miſericordiam implorare bellar lib 2 de poenit cap 10 § vt incipiamus partim cap ſeq kemnitius caluin teach cardinall obſerueth contrition muſt compungent vehement wounded conſcience ſhall obtaine grace mercie romaniſts perfection penance contented ad perfectionem poenitentiae ſecundo requiritur tenuis quidam dolor animi internus reſpondens delectatiom inchoatae quam percepimus cùm peccauimus maldonat ieſ summula qu 16 art 1 ſmall griefe mind ieſuite nam quòd abſolutionis beneficio dolor ille non vſquequaque perfectus qui à ple • iſque attritio à nonnullis imperfecta contritio vocatur valeat ad ſalutem primam iuſtificationis gratiam conſequendam tam mihi certum eſt vt inter catholica dogma propemodum numerandum putem neque obſcur • tridentini patres id docuiſſe videntur cùm etiam attritionem quae per ſe non ruſh • icat ad iuſtificationis gratiam sacramento poenitentiae impetrandam valere declararent trid word rocke sect 1 ovr aduerſaries haue length brought v vnto chiefe arch may ſo ſay higheſt pinnacle romiſh temple wit primarie plenarie iuriſdiction pope ouer biſhops ſeeke deriue pretended ſupremacie peter ouer apoſtles foundation hereof lay vpon expoſition word rocke laſt refuge diſputes therefore concerne maintaine hold endeuour eſpecially teſtimonies ſome father whereunto anſwerably appeale firſt concerning exception vſed proteſtants ſhewing notwithſtanding word rocke ſhall point peter according vnto expoſition ſome father yet doth ſo fully aduantage romiſh claime euen iudgement learned aduerſaries sect 2 2 romiſh purpoſe knowne intend word rocke ſhould betoken peter therupō preſently build monarchical palace call see sect 8 praeceptinam potestatem commandatory power iuriſdiction peter ouer apoſtles conſidering niſi fortè ſic excuſandurs fit cyprianus quod petruni non pro homine ſed pro typo accepit propemodum indicant quae ſequuntur vnus inquit pro omnibus loquens eccleſiae voce reſpō den ait domine quò ibimus itaque petrus ſaxeus eccleſiae ſedem repraeſentat eraſmus 〈◊〉 matth 16 eraſmus hath obſerued probable ſentence cyprian viz although chriſt called peter rock yet make peter imperiall top repreſentatiue type church anſwered name ſo euery one profeſſing ſame might petrus kinde accordingly cardinall etſi petrus per petram lapis fundamenti intelligi deberet 〈◊〉 ſecundùm ſanctum hieronymum ita ſimiliter alij apoſtoli •• erunt lapides eccleſiae vt apoc 11 〈◊〉 lapides cardin cuſanus lib 2 de conco •• e • cl • ſ cap 13 cuſanus hierome anſwereth although word rocke ſhould betoken peter foundationſtone yet ſo likewiſe apostle called ſtones church 3 laſtly primacy order degree primacie authority iuriſdiction firſt see hereafter § 7 hierome proteſtants eaſily aſcribe vnto peter iuriſdiction hardly proued aduerſaries proteſtants eaſily denied 4 true centuriſts haue taken exception vnto ſayings optatus arnobius therefore would know whether exception true optatus ſaid peter name cephas ſignifying caput head greeke word 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 thereupon calleth peter head apoſtles deſcant etſi petrum ſediſſe romae apoſlolorum omnium chriſ • u dicebat ego ſum paſtor bonus—quod ſanctum nomen ipſius nominis poteſtatem poſt reſurrectionem petro poenitenti conceſſit viz cum dixit paſce oues meas centuriſts reſell thus—nam petrus ipſe 〈…〉 cap 5 ad presbyteros eodem vtitur vocabulo cum ait paſcite gregem chriſti et paulus epheſ 4 alios poſuit paſtores c paſtor aduerſaries themſelues accordingly confute scripture father eight ninth section following fully manifeſt becauſe firſt contention ſincere expoſition word rocke orderly proceed proue chiefly pretended foundation popedome ruinous generall expoſitions ancient father teach rocke matth 16 chriſt ſignified peter sect 3 6 queſtion hath bene often debated whether rocke meant chriſt peter confeſſed ſaid thou art chriſt ſonne liuing god perſon peter himſelfe offer decided verduict ancient chryſoſtome ſaith thus chriſtus eſt fundamentum ipſe enim dicit petro tu e petrus ſuper hanc petram chryſoſt hom de cruce dom circa medium rurſu • super hanc petram dixit non ſuper hunc petrum non enim ſuper hominem ſed ſuper fidem aedificabat eccleſiam serm de pentecoſt paulò ante finem homil 55 matth chriſt ſaid ſuper hanc petram vpon rocke ſaid ſuper hunc petrum vpon peter chriſt built church vpon faith vpon man hilarie gregory nyſſene cyrill ſay thus vna haec eſt fidei petra petri ore confeſſa cùm dixit tu e filius dei hilar lib 2 de trinit cap 6 gregor nyſſen teſtimon vet teſtam de trinit •• ntra iude • cyril de trinit lib 4 rocke peter confeſſed ſaying chriſt thou art ſonne god theophylact likewiſe learned ieſuite witneſſeth ſaith thus hanc id eſt ſuper chriſtum quem • u confeſſus e theophylact comment matth 16 alſo emanuel sà ieſ annot matth 16 rocke meaning chriſt ambroſe thus id eſt hac fidei confeſſione ſtatuo fideles ad vitam 〈…〉 epiſt •• epheſ cap 2 vpon confeſsion peter euſebius emiſſenus thus super hanc petram quam tu petre modò fidei fundamentum poſuiſti▪ ſuper hanc fidē quam tu modò docuiſti dicens tu e chriſtus c huic enim ſententiae apoſtolus concordans ait aliud fundamentum nemo poteſt ponere c euſeb emiſſen de nati • petri emſerius confeſſed rocke chriſt beſides foundation none auguſtine thus super hanc petram dominus fundauit eccleſiam ab hac petra petrus ſortitus eſt nomen auguſt tract 124 ioh petra rocke whence peter name theodoret thus petra angularis chriſtus et dominus b petro ait super hanc petram c theodoret matth lib 1 cap 7 pſal 47 rurſu • hoc fundamentum iecit petrus vel potiùs ipſe dominus cùm enim dixiſſet petrus tu e chriſtus c dixit dominus super hanc c ne • o igitur denominate ab hominibus chriſtus enim eſt fundamentū ac ſi dicat non eſt aliud fundamentum quàm petra illa quam petrus poſuit fundamentum cùm diceret tu e chriſtus c idem 1 cor 3 euen chriſt peter lay foundation anſelme thus super hanc petram c id eſt ſuper quaſi dicat e tu petrus à petra tamen mihi reſeruetur fundamen • dignitas anſelmus matth 16 christ dignitie foundation doth belong againe super hanc petram c id eſt ſuper hanc petram quam confeſſus e quam cogno • iſti dicens tu e chriſtus filius dei viui ſuper hanc aedificabo eccleſiam meam ſuper aedificabo te non ſuper te auguſt de verb dom ſecundúm matth serm 13 rurſus petra erat chriſtus ſuper quam ipſe aedificatus eſt petrus tract 124 ioh auguſtine though differ ſometimes interpretation yet doctor stapleton confeſſeth auguſtinus hunc ſenſum procliuior erat stapleton doctr princip controu 2 lib 6 cap 3 inclined rather word rocke vnderſtand chriſt ſaying perſon chriſt peter build vpon thee peter thee vpon 7 may adde vnto synode father one apologiſts haue placed firſt chapter ſupreme patron faith ſitting ſeate call romane biſhopricke chaire peter euē gregory ſaith plainly thus apoſtolus dicit 1 cor 3 aliud fundamentum nemo poteſt ponere praeter id quod poſitum eſt quod eſt chriſtus ieſus ipſe dei atque hominum mediator qui ad ipſum apoſtolorum principem ait tu e petrus ſuper hanc petrā c ipſe enim eſt petra à qua nomen petrus accepit greg pſal poenitent illa verba initio tu domine christ named himſelf rocke therefore caluin iuſt cauſe ſay petro fundatam eſſe eccleſiam quia dictum eſt tu e petrus ſic aliqui patres—subiungit neque hic ideo patrum authoritatem repudio quia eorum teſtimonijs deſtituor ad probandum quod dico ſi citate libeat ſed quia tam clara diſceptans moleſtus eſſe lectoribus nolo caluinus inſtitut lib 4 cap 6 § 6 moſt teſtimonies produced father contrary expoſition vnderſtand rocke metonymicall implication rocke chriſt peter confeſſed refuſed teſtimonies antiquitie herein forlorne patronage feare wronging reader ſome tedious ſuperfluitie 8 theſe place vnknowne vnto aduerſaries neceſſarily ruinate principall foundation popedome labour ſeriouſly fortifie anſwering vnto ſuch obiected authority father ala ſo weakly though meant preuaricate cauſe readie ſhew anſwers moſt learned romaniſts make vnto alledged authority father apparently diſſonant diſſolute sect 4 9 chiefe leader commander amongſt romaniſts vnderſtanding great breach made vpon ſo many force theſe forecited authority ſeeke repaire art diſtinguiſhing manner sed no reſpondemus confeſſionem petri duobus modis conſiderari poſſe vno modo abſolutè ſecundùm ſe ſine relatione ad perſonam petri altero modo cum relatione ad petrum priore modo fides non eſt fundamentum bellar lib 1 de pont cap 10 § reſpondetur cùm dicunt patres confeſſionem abſtracto ſelfe teaching chriſt eternall sonne god rock ſufficient foundation chriſtian build faith vpon except beleeued perſonall reſpect vnto peter otherwiſe profeſſe faith confeſsion rocke peter faith peter confeſſion 10 father forecited teſtimonies ſo farre reſpecting peter expounding faith confeſsion chriſt rocke preciſely exempt ſeparate diſtinguiſhing therein betweene rocke peter betweene chriſt foundation ſelfe builder peter ſo ibid lit b anſelme betweene chriſt himſelfe ſo ibid lit l gregorie yea ſo expreſly ſay rocke peter chriſt ſo ibid lit • chryſoſtome ibid lit auguſtine vainly therefore haue aduerſaries ſought elude ſo plaine graue teſtimonies though father could haue poſſibly fancied peter faith confeſſed confeſſor foundation builder mee thee chriſt peter himſelfe let thought matter impertinent propound confirmation former ſence cleare demonstration sect 5 11 ſayings father peter confeſſed rocke peter confeſſe chriſt himſelfe ergo father meaning peter chriſt rocke truth ſame interpretation father may illuſtrated euinced plaine improbable ſuppoſition admitting ſome godly faithful men dayes sauiour haue beleeued according vnto peter confeſſion chriſt eternall ſonne god notwithſtanding neuer heard perſonall faith yet ſo much name peter may thus argue either ſuch beleeuers built vpon rocke ſo ſome ſanctified faithfull beleeuer chriſt ſhould built vpon rocke ſuch truly built vpon rocke neuer beleeued peter word rocke hath neceſſarie reference reſpect vnto peter 12 ſuppoſition may iudged friuolous ſeeing origen one moſt ancient father doubted ſay quod ſi no quoque loquuti fuerimus quod dixit petrus tu e chriſtus filius dei viui tanquā non accepta reuelatione à carne ſanguine ſed à luce corda noſtra illuceſcēte à patre qui c • x li eſt efficimur petrus nobis dicitur quod hunc ſermonem ſequitur tu e petrus quae ſequuntu • petrus enim eſt quiſquis chriſti diſcipulus origen tract 1 matth whatſoeuer chriſtian ſhall confeſſe peter ſaying sauiour thou art chriſt ſonne liuing god receiuing reuelation fleſh bloud diuine illumination ſame made peter vnto ſaid ſpoken vnto peter thou art peter ſo much contend receiue expoſition teſtimonies father may haue granted v confeſ • ion learned aduerſaries wherein word rocke expounded ſignifie chriſt peter sect 6 13 beſides iudgement ancient father learned romaniſts themſelues ſhall found ſubſcribe apoſtles muſt either taken ſome promiſe made vnto peter elſe ſome practiſe executed euidence holy writ either theſe reſpects 22 nicholaus cuſanus ſometime cardinall commended aduerſaries see catalogue auth •• ▪ booke name cuſanus man moſt skilfull diuine scripture prince diuines time moſt earnest vehement deſending pope eugenius title cardinall peter ad vincula ſo cannot iuſtly except againſt witneſſe though either could would aduance authoritie saint peter pope beſt reaſons yet concludeth vpon knowledge sed ſcimus quòd petrus nihil lu poteſtatis à chriſto accepit alijs apoſtolis 21 diſt notio 24 q 1 peter authoritie apoſtles proueth nihil enim dictum eſt ad petrum quod etiam alijs dictum non ſit nonne ſicut petro dictū eſt quodcunque ligaueris—ita alijs eſt dictum quemcunque ligaueritis— • quanquam petro dictum eſt tu e petrus—si petrus per petram lapis fundam • ti eccleſiae intelligi deberet tunc ſecundùm hieronymum ita ſimiliter alij apoſtoli • uerunt lapides apoc 21 〈◊〉 ſicut dictum eſt petro paſce oue • tamen iſta paſtura eſt verbo exemplo quae praecipitur alijs apoſtolis ite mundum vniuerſum c card cuſanus lib 2 concord cathol cap 13 inſtancing againſt promiſes aduerſaries obiect predominance peter 23 secondly practiſes peter haue alſo ſo little hold require ſhould ſhew act recorded holy writ wherin may appeare peter time exerciſe pretended dominion ouer one apoſtles ancient ieſuit salmeron brought ſtraite hold beſt euaſion anſwer petrus videbatu • quodammodo paſtoratum ſuum negligere inter eos tanquam aequ • lem non tanquam maiorem ſe ge • ere salmeron ieſ commen 1 pet 1 diſp 1 ſpeake authoritie ouer paſtors salmeron confuteth ouer apoſtles peter ſeemeth ſort haue neglected paſtorſhip impotent ſhift detracting peter faithfulneſſe notably preiudiciall owne cauſe 24 may conclude point iudiciouſly acceptably pen one doctor themſelues haue commended en theologiae praeceptorum ſummum quem hiſpania dei beneficio accepit canus loc theol lib 12 cap 1 intitio moſt excellent diuine spaine profeſſeth himſelfe ne quis ſuſpicetur velle quicqu • derogare praerogatiuae primatui petri—quem pro vi ••• deſendimus franciſcus de victoria relect 2 qu • ſt 2 concluſ 4 defend prerogatiue primacie peter power might ſo commendable ſo zealous doctor hath publiſhed concluſions mandate chriſt act deed apoſtles viz poteſtatem apoſtoli receperunt immediate chriſto—quod pro certo mihi videtur pronunciandum—haec eſt apertè ſententia cypriani epiſt de vnitate eccleſiae hoc erant caeteri apoſtoli quod petrus nec audienda eſt gloſſa dicens hoc non intelligi de poteſtatis plenitudine vt patet apud cyprianum—quod pro certo mihi videtur pronunciandum franciſcus de victoria rel • ct 2 q •• ſt 2 concluſ 3 4 apostle receiued power order iuriſdiction immediatly chriſt howſoeuer laboureth qualifie concluſions muſt ouerthrow doctrine motherhood church beſides ſtrength scripture confirmeth teſtimonie cyprian confuting alſo romiſh gloſſe zeale vnto peter corrupteth cyprian meaning intended equalize apoſtles peter called peruſall peter title vnto viſitation chaire romish apologie inſomuch whereas father doubted celebrate publikely yearely feſtiuall 26 cardinall viceſima praetogatiua eſt quòd ſolae illae eccleſie ſemper ſint habitae patriarchales primae quas petrus fundauerat ſiquidem apud veteres tres eccleſias tantùm propriè fuiſſe patriarchales romanam alexandrinam antiochenam caluinus non negat porrò hieroſolymitana 500 annos ferè poſt habita eſt patriar▪ ha • ſed nomine non id eſt honore non poteſtate—miratur caluinus nec immeritò cu • tam paucae c •• iſto ordine collocatae—sola cauſa iſtius numeri patriarchalium namely firſt three eſt dignitas petri ſolae coim illae eccleſiae habitae ſunt patriarchales proprie quibus petrus tanquam epiſcopus ſedit alexandriae ſedit pe • ſe niceph lib 14 cap 3 vel per diſcipulum ſuū marcum quem eò miſit ad ſundandam ſuo nomine eccleſiam vt docet greg lib 6 c piſt 37 antiochiae romae pe • ſeipſum ſedae—ratio aut • ordinis eſt quia cum omnes tres ſunt ſedes petri tamen romanam per ſe vſ que ad morte adminiſtrauit alexandriam per marcum euangeliſtam antiochenam per euodium sic ex quibus patet quód ſancti • antiqui roman pontifex non ita praeſumebant de ſua poteſtate▪ ſed ſuerunt humiles euam ſe purgando coram synodo ſua non vniuerſalis eccleſia▪—imò leo papa ſubmittit ſe omnibus poenis legibus contenus martiani ſi non ſeruauerit contra ſuam confirmationem ſicut ſcribit ipſe ad leonem auguſtum de ſua erga leges conſenſione ſi contrà quit pumtionum conditionibus ſubdo quas non ſolùm beatae memoriae principis martiani authoritas ſed etiam ego mea conſenſi • nt firma • ti cardin cuſ • nu concord eccleſ lib 2 cap 20 theſe example may appeare ſaith pope ancient time ſo much preſume vpon authoritie humble purge themſelues owne synod yea leo ſubmitted himſelfe vnto puniſhments contained lawes emperour martianus neither yet proteſtants haue bene obiected apologiſts make leo guiltie romiſh ambition conſiſteth vſurpation abſolute power making eccleſiaſticall lawes creating patriarch churchofficers receiuing appeales determining cauſes deciding matter faith diſpoſing temporall crownes diſpenſing indulgence pardon almoſt eaſily confuted propounded concluſion 8 knowing pope leo ſubiect vnto ambition § 1 himſelfe noteth haue bene ſome holy apoſtles indeed ambitious except free ſtaine ſhall condemne emperour theodoſius § 1 raſhneſſe § 2 ſixe hundred thirtie orthodoxall biſhops ſchiſmaticall preſumption yet leo predeceſſors differ much late ſucceſſors hath bene confeſſed humilitie differeth pride cannot therfore diſcerne apologiſts haue bene either carefull elſe careleſſe obiect yet continue ſtill like themſelues appeare next oppoſitions chap xix eccleſ • ae canone • egiſſe quòd illum ad concilium non voc • ſſent quippè cùm canon eccleſiaſticus vete • • e decreta abſque romani epiſcopi ſententia ſanciantur socrates lib 2 cap 13 called vnto councell without ſentence decree ſhould concluded right hereof pretendeth ſtand vpon authoritie eccleſiasticall canon queſtion farre challenge make primacie see rome apologiſts know haue propounded onely ſcope preſent diſpute therefore belongeth vnto v proue claime pope iulius made doth nothing leſſe proue papall primacie iuriſdiction euen confeſsion learned aduerſaries sect 2 2 schoole romaniſts eſpecially ieſuites hold power eſſe pontificis congregare synodum generalem primò demonſtrari poteſt à diuinis nam concilium legitimum congregari non poteſt niſi non ine chriſti • matth 18 20 quando duo aut tres congregantur nomine meo lbi nomine chriſti nihil videtur eſſe aliud quim authoritate chriſti congregari hoc eſt ab eo qui à chriſto habet congregandi authoritatem bellarm lib 1 de concil cap 12 § • ſſe autem calling councell peculiar prerogatiue pope contend proue scripture matth 18 20 two three gathered together name middest promiſe generall well reſpecting congregation aſſemblies faithfull prayer councels ſhall chriſtian men day pray name chriſt vnto god haue pope reall commaund aſſent haue bene conſtrained digreſſe returne point 3 iudge eſt concilium vniuerſale quod ab vniuerſali paſtore romano pontifice non indicitur concilij nomine indignum gre •• r valent ieſ analyſ fid pag 86 col 2 § primam councell worthy name occumenicall vniuerſall appointed pope yet might directed owne doctor firſt cardinall cuſanus others witneſſeth dicendum de viuerſalis eccleſiae concilio quòd 〈◊〉 authoritus non ita dependet à congregante quòd niſi per papam congregaretur tunc non fieret concilium quia tunc 〈◊〉 fuiſſent octo prima concilia omnia firma quoniam per imperatores congregabantur rom ponufex ad inſtar alio • pat •• archarum diuales ſacr iuſſiones pro veniendo aut initrendo ad concilia recepit cuſanus cardin concord cathol l •• 2 cap 25 authoritie councell doth depend vpon pope becauſe ſo ſhould diſanull authoritie eight firſt generall councels appointed epiſcopum hilarium diaconum ambaſiatores leonis papae notificando eis quomodo • poſt craſtino die concilium ſedere vellet rogando vt venire maturarent ipſi non venerunt tunc talaſius epiſcopus cae • • eae cappadociae dixit remorari no hac ciuitate multam laeſionem omnibus ſanctiſſimis religioſiſſimis epiſcopis • fferre non hoc ſolùm ſed pijſſimus arnicus chriſti imperator accelerari vult synodi 19 § ego ſuſpicor becauſe ſeemed vnto ancient pope ſaith thing inconuenient head ſo pope ſhould follow member ſpirit may ſauor old preacher ferus wil ſignifie membrum eſt vnum altero nobilius nihilominus tamen omnibus eſt commune quòd ſunt membra vnius corporis • hoc vnum non praeſtat alij vnum alteri non inuidet nec inferius contemnit sic eccleſia quodlibet membrum ſua operatione alijs inſeruit ferus comm act 8 although ſaith one member excellent another yet common vnto euery one member ſame bodie neither doth one either diſdaine enuie good another euery one ſeruiceable ſtrengthen time profeſſeth himſelfe see aboue cap 17 § 9 beſt defend peter prerogatiue audi quid iohannes de turrecremata cardinalis tenet aſſertor vehementiſſimus pontificiae dignitatis lib 3 cap 10 vbi ioquens de vtilitate conciliorum celebratio inquit conciliorum vtilis eſt ad refraenandū exorbitantias quorundam pontificum qui pontificatum ſuum aut extra patrum regulas pro voluntate ſua exercent aut simoniaca prauitate dehoneſtant aut vita ſcandaloſa confundunt hac de cauſa legitur congregatum fuiſſe concilium romae per imperatorem contra iohannem 12 papam qui venator lubricus incorrigibilis erat quod factum laudat turrecremata againe propter • uſtas diſpenſationes mandata inſolentia poſſint conuocari concilia generalia contra voluntatem papae hoc quoque tenet sylueſter cardinalis turrecremata
