greeke church euen hir owne late commendable practiſe adde concluſion sect 8 24 leiſure reckon gaine aduerſaries haue got obiecting vnto proteſtants practiſe § 1 pope iulius whence haue § 2 impertinently concluded pope primacie ordering councels oppoſition general councel wherin fame iulius legate haue found euidēt proofe pope § 3 4 ſubiectiō wheras vndertake defend papall iuriſdictiō reſpect ordering general councell haue bewraied manifold romiſh reuolts frō primitiue antiquity firſt § 5 teach pope ſole authority ſelfe ſufficient without helpe councell direct church infallibly neceſſarie truth aſſertion § 5 confeſſed impugne wiſdome ancient church maketh councels haue bene effect ſuperfluous 25 secondly councell muſt gathered § 2 appropriate power thereof vnto pope claime § 2 confeſſed contrarie vnto ancient practiſe church calling generall councels 26 thirdly councell called pope ordinarie want preſ • nce councels wherein claimeth preſidence § 6 confeſſed contradict practiſe firſt councell apoſtolicall allowing biſhops onely haue § 6 definitiue voice councell § 6 confeſſed decline common vſe councels euen later time preinſtructions wherewith preoccupateth biſhops limiteth ſhall ſay doth turne iudicium praeiudicium confeſſed ouerthrow ancient liberty voice wherein conſiſteth life ſoule councell preſumption power iudging without diligent inquiſition truth peremptorie concluſion commaund § 6 confeſſed condemned apoſtles practiſe firſt councell ieruſalem 27 fourthly councell hath enacted decree pope pretended power diſſoluing § 7 confeſſed falſe repugnant vnto profeſſion ancient pope 28 laſtly proclaimed iuriſdiction aboue councell § 7 confeſſed flatterie euen owne doctor notwithſtanding profeſſe defence papall primacie power romiſh challenge euery biſhop vicar chriſt hath equally full portion bound yeeld account vnto god 3 although next ſentences cyprian may ſeeme firſt view vnto vnexpert reader obſerue church rome grace eccleſia ſuper vocat cyprian epiſt ad quintum none v ſaith called biſhop biſhops cyprian onely aduerſarie surius ſheweth concilium carthaginenſe ſub cypriano epiſcopo principio neque quiſquam noſtrùm epiſcopū ſe epiſcoporum conſtituit aut tyrannico terrore ad obſequendi neceſſitatem collegas ſuos adigit quando habet omnis epiſcopus pro licentia libertatis poteſtatis ſuae arbitrium proprium tanquam iudicari ab alio non poſſit cùm nec ipſe poſſit alterum iudicare ſed expectemus vniuerſi iudicium domini noſtri ieſu chriſti qui ſolus habet poteſtatem de actu noſtro indicandi apud surium tom 1 conc conc carthag pag 242 whole councel carthage vnder cyprian profeſſe furthermore calling terror tyrannicall one biſhop impoſe vpon fellow biſhops neceſsitie obedience canon ſpecified eſpecially purpoſely intended biſhops pope defining contrariwiſe another councell beſides contum • ltouſly reuile biſhop rome himſelfe afterward crowned faithfull martyr although vt cyprianum stephanus à communione ſua quod ipſo erat repelleret— praeciperet vniuerſae fra • e ••• tati ne quis eius legatos domum reciperet caſſander lib conſult art 7 dented communion pope yet nec tamen eius retractatio vnquam • enitur bellar lib • de conc cap 5 neuer knowne haue recanted 9 ſurmiſe cyprian iudge chaire rome biſhop thereof abſolutely infallible himſelfe ſet councell againſt councel rome could beleeue romane see onely catholike mother feared die communion take infallible demonſtratiō cyprian iudgement teach v chaire rome ſuch new frame faſhion cyprian would neuer haue approued furthermore inſiſt fourth demonstration cyprian doctrine concerning mother church sect 6 10 eclipſe iudgement aduerſaries may yet viſibly appeare approach yet nearer motherhood church 11 find one ſentence cyprian much magnified aduer ſaries mouth almoſt euerie nouice wit non habet deum patrem inquit cyprianus qui non habet eccleſiam matrem coſterus ieſ apolog part 3 man haue god father hath church mother hence labour proue church rome abſolute onely catholike mother without ſaluation would think romaniſts often vrge ſentence beleeue haue bene ſpoken cyprian behalfe church rome boldneſſe ſame ſentence cyprian purpoſely applied againſt cauſe stephen pope rome vrged confeſſed haue cyprianus cum stephanus à ſua communione eum repelleret epiſcopos ab illo ex affrica legatos nec ad ſermoné communis colloquij admitteret praeciperet vniuerſae fraternitati ne quis • o domum ſuam reciperet ſed tectum hoſpitium negaretur cyprianum quoque pſeudochriſtum doloſum operarium diceret caſſander conſult art 7 denied cyprian communiō haue forbidden ſhould ſo much receiue meſſengers houſe inne pope cyprian word immediatly following alledged ſentēce doth accuſe cum natiuitas chriſtianorum baptiſmo ſit baptiſmi autem regeneratio ſanctificatio apud ſolam ſponſam chriſti ſit quae parere ſpiritualiter generare filios deo poſſiti vbi ex qua cui natus eſt qui filius ecclſiae non eſt vt habere quis poſſit deum patrem ante eccleſiam matrem cùm verò nulla omninò haereſis neque aliquod ſchiſma habere ſalutaris baptiſmi ſanctificationem foris poſſit cut tantum stephani fratris noſtri obſtinatio dura prorupit c cyprian epiſt ad pompeium pag 329 obſtinacie see laſt concluſion sect 7 12 let apologiſts deliberate anſwer owne obiection retorted vpon cyprian biſhop carthage liued 240 yeares christ himſelfe haue proued together foure ſcore eight haue ſhewed papall mind arrogancy sparke see sparke againſt iohn dabbines anſwer preface ante med ſee oſiander cent 2 pag 87 96 ſomewhat popelike haue receiued bound tooke vpon excommunicate biſhops eaſt whitaker alſo charging whitaker contra durçogonū l 7 pag 480 initio exerciſing iuriſdiction vpon former church protestant appeale hiſtoricall relation act pope victor containing ſufficient matter iuſtification former obiections sect 1 wiſh apologiſts followed equitie gouernour act 25 27 act behalfe paul relate exception ſhew reaſon would cleare matter throughly iuſtifie cauſe concerning victor folly ſtand vpon ſayings ſee doings becauſe aduerſaries much often obiect example victor though become victorious cauſe deſire tried euidence 2 hiſtorie large memorable neceſſarie reſolution queſtion whereof haue ſummarily compriſed moſt pertinent point according learned aduerſaries haue related thē euſebius digeſted late volume councels approued surius thus 3 euſeb lib 5 cap 22 de victore hunc modum ſcribit cùm quaeſtio erat de ſeruando paſchate epiſcopi eccleſiae aſianae ſeruandam magi à veteribus ſibi traditam conſuetudinem confirmabant quibus polycrates qui ijs primatum agere videbatur ego inquit ſecundùm traditionem omnium patrum meorum obſeruo eorum duntaxat quos ab initio ſecutus ſum ſeptem namque ex parentibus mei per ordinem fuerunt epiſcopi ego octauus qui omnes ita obſeruārunt hunc diem vnde ſexaginta quinque annos aetatis gerens nomine domini multorum orbis epiſcoporum notitiam pleniſſimè habens ſanctis scripturis intendens non perturbor ex quae terrorem proferuntur multitudo epiſcoporum nimia ſententiam meam confirmat sed ad haec victor romanae eccleſiae epiſcopus pertinaciùs agens paſſim totius aſiae vicinarum prouinciarum eccleſias à communionis ſocietate abſcindere nititur tanquam haereſin inclinantes literas mittit quibus omnes ſimul abſque diſcretione ab eccleſiaſtico foedere ſegregaret sed hoc non omnibus placebat epiſcopis quin potuis ècontrario ſcribentes ei iubebant vt magi quae pacis ſunt ageret concordiae vnitati ſtuderet denique extant epiſcoporum literae quibus aſperiùs obiurgant victorem velut inutiliter eccleſiae commodis conſulentem inter quos irenaeus victorem arguens quòd non rectè fecerit abſcindens à corporis vnitate tot tantas eccleſias dei quae morem ſibi antiquitus traditum cuſtodirent polycarpus inquit cùm ad vrbem romam veniſſet ſub anacleto ita egerunt de hac quaeſtione interſe vt pace coirent vtque non vnuſquiſque ſententiam ſuam obſtinata contentione defenderet neque enim aut anicetus polycarpo perſuadere poterat vt non obſeruaret ea quae nouerat iohanuem diſcipulum domini noſtri vel caeteros apoſtolos cum quibus ſemper fuit obſeruâſſe neque rurſus polycarpus anicetum perſuaſit vt morem maiorum ſuorum non obſeruaret haec apud surium tom 1 conc pag 194 queſtion aroſe betweene greeke latine church obſeruation day easter biſhops church aſia diſſented opinion victor biſhop rome amongſt polycrates write hereof manner polycrates threeſcore fiue yeares old ſucceſsiuely eight ſeuen biſhops greeke 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 kinne obſerued day eaſter cuſtome alſo forefather name lord obſerue ſame manner tradition receiued father full conſent multitude biſhops looking holy scripture •• diſſwaded diſmaied terrour namely excommunication victor moued againſt 4 notwithstanding victor goeth excommunicate biſhops aſia inclining hereſie vndiſcreetly ſeparate felowſhip communion bene amongst therefore diſliked biſhops commaunding victor ſeeke peace vnity church amongſt others irenaeus reproue becauſe diuided ſo many ſo worthy church vnity body obſeruing ancient tradition father euen iohn whereas time polycarpus greeke biſhop anicetus notwithſtanding could perſwade one another alteration diuerſe cuſtomes herein yes preſerue vnity togither vſe former relation taken due confeſsions learned aduerſaries sect 2 5 particular ſtorie euidently acknowledged aduerſaries theſe confeſſions 1 extant ipſae literae quibus aſperius obiurgāt victorem velut inutiliter eccleſiae commodis conſulentem bellarm de rom pont lib 2 cap 19 letter reproofe againſt victor publikely extant 2 aſiani concilio aſiatico putātes ſe euangelio maiorū traditiombus inhaerere á conſuetudine celebrandi paſchatis die 14 primo menſis recedendum non eſſe conſtituerunt idque per polyctatem ad victorem reſcripſerunt victor concilium reprobabat excommunicationem contra pertinaces executus eſt binius tom 1 conc fol 131 col 1 biſhops aſia councell decree maintaine ancient custome cauſe victor executed excommunication 3 victor pontifex omnes orientales auſtrales eccleſias ſimul à communione amputabat cui tunc inter caeteros excellentiſſimos viros reſtitit polycrates aſiae epiſcoput irenaeus victorem pontificem tanquam pacis turbatorem acriter obiurgabat agrippa de vanit ſcient cap 59 magna libertate victorem reprchendit irenaeus quòd praeter exemplum corum quibus ſucceſſerat tam facilis eſſet ad amputandas eccleſias non fide led ritibus diſſidentes eraſmus epiſt ad epiſcop trident de dedic irenaei victor alſo excommunicate ſome church weſt ſame cauſe reprehended irenaeus troubler church god 4 ſome biſhops aſia afterwards became holy irenaeus ad componendum eccleſiae diſſid •• romam mittitur martyrum literis mirificè commendatus euſeb lib 5 martyr christ ieſus laſtly ought found hiſtory quòd victor ſentent • ſuam mutanent nuſquam legimus bellar de rom pont lib 2 cap 19 excommunication victor neuer repealed 6 apologiſts taxe proteſtant author may iuſtified antiquitie reprehend victor arrogancy tranſgreſsing bound iuriſdiction excommunicating church aſia premiſes haue ſhewed euſebius noted pope victor offenſiue herein irenaeus reprehended troubler christendome beſides multitude biſhops councell could without diſclaime pretended papall iuriſdiction made decree ſentence victor yet men themſelues integritie life doctrine notwithſtanding oppoſition vnto pope victor haue euer church chriſt bene honoured memorie holy renouned martyr 7 neceſſarily euince primitiue antiquitie held catholike doctrine beleeue either ſubiection biſhops rome neceſſarie vnto ſaluation cathedrall ſentence infallible damnable ſtate chriſtian die excommunication church 8 neuertheleſſe anie proteſtants cenſure victor vſurping abſolute power ouer councels arrogating infallibilitie iudgement vnto himſelfe ſucceſſors haue bene inſpired ſpirit excommunication another church doth properly imply abſolute iuriſdiction ſo ſome biſhops eaſt excommunicated pope iulius cauſe athanaſius sozom lib 3 cap 11 7 menas patriarch conſtantinople excommunicate vigilius biſhop rome niceph hiſt lib 7 cap 26 iuſtly queſtion ſo therby challenge iuriſdiction ouer romane primacie romane church protestant appeale first ſatisfying obiected exception sect 1 ovr quod exemplaribus irenaei qualia nunc habemus extat l 3 c 3 nouitatem ſapere videtur ad eccleſiā romanā propter potentiorem principalitatem neceſſe eſt omnem conuenire ecclefiam praetermittunt nam ad romanam eccleſiam omnes alias eſſe alligatas epiſcocopum eius locus eſſe occumenicum qui errare non poſſit cui omnes neceſte eſt ſubeſſe neque ignatius neque alij huius aetatis ſcriptores habent centuriſts reprehend ancient father irenaeus ſuſpect ſentence obiected falſly fathered vpon proue light antiquitie whereunto owne learned ante nicaenum concilium non magnus reſpectus romae habebatur aeneas syluius author ſometime pope may ſeeme beare witneſſe therefore reproued cardinall quae ſententia scripturis argu • ntur accuſationem conuertuntur ipſarum scripturatum quaſi non certò habeant neque ſint ex authoritate quia variè ſunt dictae quia non poſſit ab inueniti veritas qui neſciunt traditionem non enim per liter traditam cam ſed per viuam vocé traditionem itaque apoſtolorum toto mundo manifeſtatam eccleſia adeſt perſpicere omnibus qui vera audire velint habemus coumerare eos qui ab apoſtolis inſtituti ſunt epiſcopi eccleſijs ſucceſſiones eorum vſque ad no quia nihil tale docuerunt quale ab deliratur sed quoniam valdè longum eſt hoc talus volumine omnium eccleſiarum enumerare ſucceſſiones maximae antiquiſſimae omnibus cognitae à glorioſiſſimis duobus apoſtolis petro paulo romae fundatae eccleſiae eam quam habet ab apoſtolis traditionem fidem per ſucceſſiones epiſcoporum peruenientem vſque ad no indicantes confundimus eos ad hanc enim eccleſiam propter potentiorem principalitatem neceſſe eſt omnem conuenire eccleſiam id eſt ſideles qua ſemper conſeruata eſt quae eſt ab apoſtolis traditio irenaeus lib 3 cap 2 3 ancient church ſucceſſiuely deſcended apoſtles inſtance ſake propoundeth vnto rome ſaith hath direct ſucceſsion apoſtles preſerued tradition viz scripture euen vnto time church clauſe ſentence apoſtolical tradition hath alwaies bene preſerued herein plainly acknowledging reſpect may vnto rome ſhall found haue kept canon scripture foundation catholike faith 4 rome hath violated ſame apoſtolicall tradition canon scripture ancient anno 160 irenaeus till many yeares profeſſed church chriſt cauſe yeare 400 auguſtine time preferred iudgement ad hebraeos ſatisfying obiected exception prouing faſt diuine inſtitution iudgement aduerſaries sect 1 faſt confeſſe great antiquitie although different degree generall vſe obſeruation ambroſe teacheth haue bene ordained hanc quadrageſimā dominus ſuo ieiunio conſec • auit p • uilo poſt—quiſquis ergo ch • iſtianus conſecratā ieiunando non impleuerit quadrageſimam praeuaricationis contumaciae tenebitur quod legem diuinitus datam prandē relcindit—ambroſ 34 36 coeleſti maieſtate praeceptum—praeceptum donum ibidem diuine inſtitution chriſt aliqui iuniores cenſent eſſe • diuino ſancitum id probant quia aliqui veteres eccleſiae patres videntur docuiſſe illud eſſe iutis diuini azorius ieſ inſtit moral part 1 lib 7 cap 12 alſo opinion ſome yonger romaniſts ieſuite azotius witneſſing thus much therefore thinke haue bene commaunded chriſt becauſe ſome ancient father ſeeme teach much 2 whether proteſtants might take exception againſt ſuch teſtimonies father ſo farre ſeeme affirme lentfaſt inſtituted chriſt whether thoſe aboueſaid yonger romaniſts haue bene ſuch teſtimonies deceiued may certified generall conſent aduerſaries communis opinto theologorum scholaſticorum eſt quadrageſimarium • uni • non eſſe iuris • uini azor ibid common opinion ſaith ieſuite schoolediuines lentfaſt appointed diuine ordinance therefore content de • iue sed docent apoſtolica traditione ſeu mandato celebrari—item alioq patres teſtantur hoc ieiunium eſſe ab apoſtolis inſtitutum idem ibidem apostolicall tradition iudgement ſay ancient father yet reſpect generalitie commaund onely statutum eſt ab eccleſia vt omnes ante paſcha iciunium quadrageſimâ obſeruarent paulò poſt—obſeruatio iſta ab ipſa apoſtolorum trad tione man • ſſe videtur quae erſi fortaſſe non à princi • io omnes expreſſè praecepto aſtringebat tamen omnibus ſeculis atque omnibas • bi partibus obſeruata c ianſenius cap 15 concord euang doubtfully 3 know vibicus fooliſhly contend neceſſitie saturday faſt confronted auguſtine ſaying ego apoſtolicis euangelicis literis totoue nouo teſtamento animo id reuoluens video praeceptum eſſe ieiunium quibus autem diebus non oporteat praecepto domini vel apoſtolorum non inuenio apostolicall writing new teſtament concluſion doth grant lent faſt tradition eccleſiaſticall auguſtine doth ſometime write fortie day faſt hath diuine authoritie meaneth authoritie precept example lib 5 cap 6 26 euſebius quadrageſimam qua populu • ieiunat alij ſex dierum ſeptimanas computant vt illyrij qui ad occidentem ſiti ſunt necnon vniuerſa lybia aegyptus cum palaeſtinis alij ſeptem vt sozom hiſt lib 7 cap 19 sozomene haue ſhewed manifold variety church obſeruation thereof whereupon quia nemo hac de poteſt oſtendere 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 mandatum ſcriptum manifeſtum eſt quòd writing doctrine cardinall concludit caietanus eccleſia primitiua libera fuiſſe ieiunia caietanus vt refert catharinus aduerſus caiet § de praecepto ieiunij hath bene proued antiquitie caietane cannot know vſed firſt freely diuine authoritie conſequently ſuch abſolute neceſſitie may altered haue promiſed proue confeſſion ſome romaniſt ſo god grace ſhall yea ſuch one ieſuite pererius himſelf moſt commendable among aduerſaries thus commendeth e man ſaith ſince great doctor hath taught myſteries scripture plainly fully melchior canus reputed moſt learned diuine councell trent myſteria ſacrarum literarum nullus c pererius ieſ com exod com dan lib 12 cap 6 7 melchior canus ſaith plainly fully alijs verò quae ſcilicet apoſtoli conſtituerunt tanquā eccleſiae paſtores poterit quidem ſummus pontifex vt caeteris eccleſiae legibus diſpenſare ſic enim ſchola loquitur poterit etiam contrarius populi mo inſtituta huius genetis abrogare vt trina immerſio—eiuſdem quoque ordinis eſt quadrageſi •• ae ieiunium melchior canus loc theol lib 3 cap 5 fol 102 pope hath power diſpenſe lentfaſt yea people may abrogate contrarie cuſtome therefore may thinke apologiſts aduerſaries inconſiderate diſputers whenſoeuer inſert tradition lentfaſt amongſt doctrine opinion neceſſarily appertaining vnto law faith contented heare ſo great aduerſarie haue confeſſed notwithſtanding obiected teſtimonies ancient father much proteſtants haue would deſire neuertheleſſe diſcharge adde difference lawfull tradition eccleſiaſticall vſing vſing iuſt cauſes diſſentions chriſtan church sect 3 8 teſtified iſti • raeci etiamſi obſeruantia paſchatis variârunt tamen nobiſcum pacifici ſemper fuerunt nec diſſonantia ieiunij fidei conſonantiam rupit irenaus vt ex euſebio surius tom 1 conc pag 195 surius irenaeus aduiſed pope victor behalfe greeke church differed church rome obſeruation eaſter difference faſt ſaith irenaeus doth diſſolue vnion faith wiſe diſcreet iudgement owne nobilis hiſpanus conſuluit hieronymum bethleem commorantem cui reſcripſit hieronymus tom 1 epiſt 28 traditiones eccleſiaſticas ita eſſe obſeruandas vt à maioribus traditae ſunt nec aliarum conſuetudmen altarum contrario ſubuerti idem auguſtinus epiſt 118 ad lanuar cùm romam venio ieruno sabbato cùm hic ſum non • iuno binius tom 1 concil annot conc elibert 26 binius noteth hierome auguſtine reſoluing diuerſity eccleſiasticall cuſtomes may cauſes diſtractions church elſewhere auguſtine hath elegantly compounded like contention sit igitur vna fides vniuerſ • quae vbique dilatatur eccleſiae tanquam intus membris etiamſi ipſa fidei vnitas diuerſis quibuſdam obſeruationibus celebratur quibus nullo modo quod fide verum eſt impeditur omnis enim filiae regis pulchritudo eſt intrinſecus pſal 44 illae autem obſeruationes quae variae celebrantur eius veſte intelliguntur vnde dicitur fimbrijs aureis circumamicts varietate sed ea quoque veſtis ita diuerſis celebrationibus varietur vt non contentiombus diſſipetur auguſt epiſt 86 king daughter ſaith ſaid glorious within rayment wrought needle worke diuers color ſo church one faith variety rite diuerſity obſeruations garment may beget contentious oppoſition indiſtinct member one bodie church howſoeuer reaſon aduerſaries accuſe others alteration themſelues altogether preciſe holding ancient limit may vnderſtand romane church hath altered ancient rite faſting confeſsion aduerſaries sect 4 9 aduerſaries readily confeſſe • non ieiunamus eo tempore quo chriſtus ieiuna • quia chriſtus • iunabat à ſex die ianuarij vſque ad 14 februarij no gregorio ſecundo ſed parum refert gregorius primus ſecundus eos adiecerit azor ieſ inſt moral lib 7 cap 12 part 1 added foure day vnto forty obſerued another pope hath per teleſphorum rom pontificem fifty diſtinction clergie neither haue ſpared leaue ieiunia quartae ſextae feria quadrageſima ab apoſtolis inſtituta fuerunt ieiunium quartae feria extra quadrageſimam latina eccleſia nunc tranſlatum indiſcretion choice mixed ſome apparence hypocriſie sect 5 10 haue deale politike faſt conſiſteth religious mortification rankneſſe fleſhly nature man make bodie temple holy ghoſt ſeaſonable diuine spirit comfortable owne regenerate ſoule dwell principall end alſo forme may ſo ſay verie ſoule euerie religious faſt true nature faſting muſt diſcerned falſe ſuperſtitious imputation indiſcretion romiſh faſts ariſeth conſideration time manner perſons immediate end faſts 11 firſt allow time ſet faſts non violat ientaculum veſpertinum pro ſumptum v • l ex cauſa ſ ••• ptum manè delato ad veſperam prandio nec oua aut lactieinia extra quadrageſimā eman sa aphoriſm de ieiunio ne ante meridiem cibum ſumat peltanus de tribus bonorum generibus cited pelargus ieſuitiſ loc 17 euening morning eating may call breakefaſt notwithſtanding know propriè eſſe ieiunium eſt nihil prorſus comedere nihil bibere maldon ieſ summula qu 22 art 2 properly fast nature endure eate drinke nothing preſcribed time faſt firſt deformitie viz ſeeme properly faſt eating 12 secondly matter meaſure faſt practiſe church maruellouſly exorbitāt preſcribing ſo cal quartum fuit magi delicatum ieiunium conſtans ex oleribus leguminibus pomis—quintum fuit veſci pultibus abſtinere à carnibus ouis lacte quicquid lacte fit à vino quod ad hunc vſque diem ſeruatur praeſertim quadrageſima praeterquàm quòd vinum bibitur maldonat ibid qu 23 art 2 delicate faſt wherin vſe eat variety root fruit beſides another wherein forbidden onely fleſh egs whatſoeuer cometh milke yet confeſſe aliquando prohibentur caro lacticinia non eſt ieiunium vt dominicis quadrageſimae tolet ieſ inſtruct sacerd lib 6 cap 3 § primo fleſh whitemeates forbidden notwithstanding faſt though would teach men faſt faſting againe thus dieting faſters fruit root many delicacy would doubt ſtill thought zealous affecters prime antiquity albeit muſt confeſſe mihi purio • chriſtianiſmi magiſue conſentaneum eſſe euangelicae apoſtolicae doctri • ae videatur ſi nullum certum cibi genus praeſcribatur eraſmus paraphr 1 cor 8 may thought faſt agreeable vnto aposticall doctrine wherein nothing preſcribed eaten bewraying mind willing follow antiquitie deſtitute antiquitie 13 yet faſts forbid eccleſia romana abſtinentiam praecipit carnium ouorum caſei non autem frigidioribus regionibus à vino bellarm lib 2 de bonis operibus cap 5 poſitum eſt vt diebus • eiuniorum piſcibus leguminibus fructibus vino ſimiliter vtamur azor ieſ inſtit moral lib 7 cap 10 part 1 fleſh egs quaeritur quibus diebus liceat veſci caſeo aut lacticinijs etiam veſci ſagimine ſiue lardo vt vocant gloſſa affirmat hoſtienſis vtuntur ſagimine cluniacenſes monachi azor ieſ ibid fine cap cheeſe yet commonly vſe drinke wine yea alſo ſome ſometime eate lard notwithſtanding ignorant certè negari non poteſt conſueta veterum chriſtianorum ieiunia carnium vſu vini potu c • ruiſſe veterum patrum quae attulimus teſtimonia docent azor ieſ ibid § certè ancient father faſts vſe abſtaine fleſh wine argueth delectum abſ que delectu indiſcretion choice forbidding cheeſe eating lard abandoning fleſh yet admitting wine vinū calefaciendo corpus incitat libidinē bellar lib 2 de bonis operib cap 5 yet ſaith ſo much fleſh ibid verſti • è dictū eſt à salomone luxurioſa re eſt vinū tumultuoſa ebrietas prou 20 perer ieſ com gen 9 themſelues affirme heateth bodie prouoketh vnto luſt cauſe salomon hath ſaid wine luxurious reſpect called verie ariſtophanes heathen 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 milk venus wheras faſt ordained phyſicke abate pride nature feuer luſt put wine wholſome ingredient may ſeeme ſet patient flame eſpecially done exceſſe whence haue enſued ſo many abuſes among faſters owne leiunia noſtra quae vini copia natant piſciū varietate carnis delicias ſuperant—veteribus omnibus nō modò fuiſſe incognita ſed intolerabilia adeóque abhominanda conſtat—vmbram ta • tùm priſci ieiunij apud pleroſque eccleſia catholica videamus—ieiunium quod non ante tertiam horam pomeridianam ſoluebatur ante meridiem interrumpitur •• nd enus panopl lib 3 cap 11 lindanus prosabbati ſiue ſextae feria ieiunium abſtinentiam carnium eſt conuerſum quomodò totius ferè quadrageſi • ae quae tamen abſtinentia inanem tantùm veri • eiunij vmbram retinet cùm apud pleroſque maiorem luxus profuſionem quam corporis laſciui refraenationem vllam habeat caſſander defenſ libelli de officio pij viri pag 119 caſtander leſſe loathe diuerſe fat foggie faſtings among deeming abhominable intollerable ſuch haue ſo much ſhadow faſts ancient time 14 thirdly perſons vnto enioyne faſting bewray ſome partialitie indulgence although pietie publike faſts ſpare multae ſunt cauſae à ieiunio eccleſiaſtico liberantes homines quae ad quatuor caput reuocantur id eſt infirmitas languoris vt ſebricitantes aut infirmitas complexionis vt qui vnico prandio neceſſarium victum accipere nequeunt ſed frequenti indigent cibatione vel aetatis cùm nondum vigeſimus primus annus completus eſt vel infirmitaris conditionis vt mulieres grauidae lactantes liberae ſunt à ieiunio ſed non à qualitate ciborum 2 paupertas qui oſtiatim vict • petunt 3 labor corporeus notabiliter defatigans corpus vt foſſores meſſores aratores ſeminatores fabri lignarij lapicidae curſores iter facientes pedites non ſutores c niſi proueniat labor ex officio vt qui iuuant ad muros conſtruendos aut incendium extinguendum c 4 pieta nempe officia ſpiritualia opera miſericordiae quae ieiunio eſſe non poſſunt vt concionari legere peregrinari qui non poteſt reddere debitum vxori tolet ieſ inſtruct sacerd cap 4 child woman ſucke woman great child beſides beggers weake perſons yet licence alſo youth vnder age one twenty yeares workman greatly laborious office employed ouerſight publike bodily worke preacher reader ſome kind husband eate time publike religious faſts thinke indulgence void ancient preſcription 15 fourthly one eccleſia ieiunium inſtituit quod eſt poenale tolet ieſ inſtruct sacerd de fine ieiunij end faſting ſhould degree ieſuite ſaith penall ſeruing puniſhment may called penall correctiue contend faſt sauiour matth 42 faſted hungrie doth teach v hunger wherein kind affliction indeed outward perfection religious faſt except bite ſalt cannot altogether ſo ſeaſonable aduerſaries muſt likewiſe confeſſe call exerciſe faſting truly penall 16 well let v compare preſcribed faſts end haue heard faſting breakfaſt nature delicate fast allowed eate varietie rootes fruit fiſhes whatſoeuer iunkets haue affinitie fleſh licenced drinke wine without exception yet ſo eate drinke dutie euery chriſtian euen banqueting without intemperate exceſſe thus whileſt aduerſaries define faſts penall preſcribe allow ſuch ſo pleaſantly delicate manner faſting void leaſt little leauē hypocriſy mouth almoſt child partaking delicate faſt many dayes longing former kind dainty cried mother ſaying good mother ſhall faſt againe babe may confute neuertheleſſe ſhew greater danger either occaſioned cauſed romiſh faſts vnto body ſoules men sect 6 17 beſides errours alreadie ſpecified two extremity deſerue reproofe whereby body ſoules men haue bene iniuried concerning bodily wrong heare one amongſt complaining gallia vt ſcribunt duo periclitantur non ob aliud niſi quia duobus quadrageſimae diebus comederunt carnes coacti morbo vide quid caeremoniae faciunt nimirum vt ob hominum conſtitutiones violemus praecepta dei •• uiùs ducentes parricidium quàm praeterire conſtitutionem pontificum quanquam hoc nullus pontifex vetuit ne aegrotus ea ſumat quae poſtulat valetudo atque haec impia perſuaſio nonnullarum prouinciarum ciuitatum gubernatoribus haeret qui per quadrageſimam totum macellum claudunt ſeueris edictis carnium venditionem prohibent hoc eſt inualidis qui ciuitatibus populoſis multi ſunt qui citra carnis eſum valetudinem vitam tueri non poſſunt piſcium eſu laeduntur inquam quantum ipſis eſt mortem vel ce • tè mo • bum indicunt inquiunt nemo aegrotos occultè veſci prohibet ridiculum quaſi non ſatis prohibeat veſci qui prohibet vendere—eraſmi reſponſum oppono tolerabilius arbitror vt ſexcenti veſcantur carnibus citr • neceſſitatem quàm vt vnus hac ſuperſtitione periclitetur de vita caſſander deſenſ lib de offici • pij viri pag 159 wicked opinion ſome magiſtrates forbid ſale fleſh time lent cauſing therby much lay either death diſeaſes many languiſhing people ſuperſtitious reſtraint 18 defect confeſſe proceeded rather ignorance ſuch magiſtrates imperfection law faſting would haue noted onely becauſe herein ſome apparence iniquitie wit publike magiſtrates tranſgreſſe law god endangering liues ſubiects cenſured church priuate men ſhall knowne haue tranſgreſſed man ordinance eating fleſh ſecretly without cauſe neceſſity forthwith publikely ſeuerely puniſhed leaue iniurie incident vnto bodie 19 ſoule farre precious ſo danger thereof much pernicious ſome men ſcrupulous conſciences two way incurre firſt nec probandi ſunt qui mente huius legis non animaduerſâ ad ſuperſtitioſam imò impiam proprij corporis debilitationem hoc eccleſiae ſtatutum detorquent dum nimiâ inediâ vel noxio cibo morbos ſibi nonnunquam mortemue accerſunt—non refe • inquit hieronymus vtrum magno vel paruo te interimas quia de rapina holocauſtum offert qui vel ciborum nimia egeſtate vel manducandi vel ſomni penuriá immoderatâ corpus affligit caſſander ibid pag 158 ignorāt law faſting ſaith caſſander ſtrict ſuperstitious obſeruation outward letter therof pine conſume themſelues faſting notwithſtanding hierome teacheth one man kill himſelfe eating little much ſuch faſter may ſaid offer vnto god sacrifice thing ſtolne immoderate faſting doth ſhorten owne life 20 danger ſoules ſuch ſuperſtitious faſters falleth vpon though intention law church yet peraduenture want due explication thereof rigorous exaction ſome cleargie men againſt find one publiſhing complaint imprimis autem illorum hominum imperita ſuperſtitio ſuperſtitioſa imperitia damnanda eſt execranda qui huius ſalubris conſtitutionis ad hominum ſalutem qui ſinis eſt legis latae ſententiam vim ignorantes eam ad tyrannicam conſcientiarum oppreſſionem hominum exitium diuinae legis trangreſſionem conuerterunt dum citrá diſcrimē quibuſuis intentata mortalis culpae poena eius rigidam exactam obſeruationem exegerunt multoſque hac ſuperſtitione implicatos ſumma incōmoda pericula corporis animae coniecerunt idem ibid pag 158 abhorre ſaith ſuperstitious ignorance ſome peruert law made man good vnto tyrannie ouer conſciences men breach charitie commanded law god rigid exact challenge obſeruation law fast 21 yet danger may poſſibly auoided repentance houre death ſecond perill ſoule contagious opinion condigne meriting grace glorie faſts good vnto tyrannie ſnare owne conſciences repoſing confidence obſeruation ſo farre whole religion hic grauiſſimi viri eraſmi verba aſcribere malo quidam inquit clamant quis neſcit caeremonijs paſchatis pentecoſtis natiuitatis domini communite ſeruaremus tamen vt caueamus ne ex • eiunijs no aliquid à deo promereri credamus eſt aliud ieiunium perpetuum potiſſimùm vt corpus tuum co •• ceas naturally delighted kinde fast knew verie well much vſed monaſteries againe omninò per ieiunium corporis caſtigatio • oderatio nobis commendatur ſed nequaquam eo animo ſuſcipiendum eſt quaſi aliquid ambroſe thoſe father ſinne faſt papiſts 32 thou notwithſtanding good reader mindfull ſaying god angell vnto sara ſeruant hagar brought backe vnto gen 16 behold ſaith ſhe thy hand thou willeſt ſo thou endued ſpirit god thou haſt thy bodie cōmitted vnto thy diſcretion chaſtiſe priuate faſting humble vnto thy chriſtian ſeruice publike according vnto godly diſcretion church wherein thou liueſt xxv vnwritten tradition romish apologie 12 twelfthly concerning vnwritten tradition ceremony firſt concerning vnwritten tradition confeſſed followeth protestant appeale shewing state queſtion vnfolded learned aduerſaries sect 1 argument tradition aduerſaries make metropolis preſumptions appeare aiery meteore ſtate controuerſie ſhall throughly laid open particular diſcuſſed incident thereunto importance hereof may craue extraordinary patience godly reader peruſing anſwer diligence examining proofes contend full ſufficiencie perfection oracle truth foundation chriſtian faith written word god thus 2 controuerſia inter no proteſtantes duobus conſiſtit primum eſt quòd no afferimus scripturis nō cōtineri expreſſè totam doctrinam ſiue de fide ſiue de moribus proinde praeter verbum dei ſcriptum diuinas apoſtolicas traditiones eſſe neceſſarias lutherus huic doctrinae dicit anathema omnes volunt omnia ad ſalutem neceſſaria ipſis scripturis contineri secundò diſſidemus quòd illi exiſtimant apoſtolos quaedam inſtituiſſe praeter scripturas quae ad ritus ordinem eccleſiae pertinent quae tamen non ſunt neceſſaria nec praecepta ſed libera no contrà bellar lib 4 de verbo dei cap 3 initio difference betweene proteſtants v ſay romaniſts concerning tradition conſiſteth two thing hold doctrine neceſſarily belonging vnto faith manner life expreſly non ob eum finem scripturae datae ſunt vt eſſent totius fidei regula ſufficientiſſima vel vt omnem veritatem complecterentur ant expreſſam aut ex proprijs principijs deducendam proteſtantes contrà stapleton doctrin princip lib 12 cap 3 eccleſia catholica ijs quae ſunt ſidei non eſt alligata ad scripturas tantùm ibid cap 4 way neceſſary conſequent contained scripture affirme beſides written word god diuine apoſtolicall vnwritten tradition neceſſarie proteſtants hold thing neceſſarie ſaluation contained written word deſenſio proteſtantium colloquio ratisbonenſi fuit hoc argumentum locum habere contra eos tantùm qui scripturae authoritatē non recipiunt non autem contra eos ſuch proteſsants apud quos praeſuppoſita eſt scripturae ſacrae authoritas tannerus ieſ aduerſus relat hunni cap 12 yet ſo queſtion haue place amongſt beleeue authority scripture bellarmine place alledged ſecond difference thinke indeed apoſtles ordained rite ceremony written scripture ſuch ſay decency left vnto liberty church vſed changed 2 confeſſe full true relation diſtinguiſhing aright article controuerſie theſe apologiſts aduerſaries obiecting teſtimonies father againſt proteſtants doctrine haue either ſubtilly ignorantly though beginning section diſtinguiſh word tradition ceremony yet allegation ſo confound reader cannot diſcerne father ſpeake tradition ceremony ſo may eaſily miſlead think • father writ tradition doctrine againſt ſufficiencie scripture confounded readie ſafe paſſage great ocean make firſt examen whether protestant confeſſe themſelues question concerning ſufficiency scripture destitute generall patronage ancient father sect 2 4 apologiſts may ſeeme intimate great iniurie againſt onely whoſe ſufficiencie adored see hereafter § 11 scripture see hereafter father alſo againſt iudicious fateor patres multa dè traditionibus commemorare ſed illorum teſtimonijs haec quatuor ſunt obſeruanda 1 traditionis nomen aliquando doctrinam ſcriptam ſignificare dogma aliquod quod firmo scripturae teſtimonio nititur 2 illas traditiones quas patres commemorant eſſe fere omnes liberas conſuetudines non neceſſaria dogma 3 aliquando patres fuiſſe deceptos quia • ter ſe diſſentiunt 4 abrogatas fuiſſe à papiſtis traditiones multàs quas patres commemorant aliqua ex quatuor obſeruationibus ſufficiet ad ſingula patrum teſtimonia ſoluenda w ••• tak • r booke alledged two leaues end booke de ſacrae scripturae perfectione huic accedat quòd patres ſufficientiam scripturarum praedicant omnia dogma religionis à scripturis eſſe petenda docent whitaker ſame place writer auouch whole ſtreame manner antiquitie doth clearely go doctor whittakers doctor reynolds verie obiected place affirming concerning points▪ neceſſarie ſaluation father one generall voice commend ſufficiency scripture demonſtrate yet firſt ſecond examen must trie whether aduerſaries rightly diſgeſt teſtimonies thoſe ancient doctrine tradition plainly ſubuerted sect 3 5 romaniſts yeeld vnto booke god due perfection leaue like ſicke man broken vnperfect halfe nuncupatiue halfe written except liſt againſt • uch teſtimonies antiquitie pleade prerogatiue holy writ cyprian alledged adhering vnto vnde iſta traditio ex dominica authoritate veniens de apoſtolorum mandatis atque epiſtolis veniens ea enim facienda eſſe quae ſcripta ſunt teſtatur deus cyprian epiſt 74 ad pompe •• written tradition truth reiect ſaying ad fontem recurramus id eſt apoſtolorum traditionem optimum eſt ſinc dubitatione faciendum traditum eſt enim nobis ſicut ipſe commemorat • b apoſtolis quòd fit vnus deus chriſtus vnus vna ſpes fides comparandus eſt acoſta ieſ de temp nouiſſ lib 2 cap 12 comparable learning ambroſe irenaeus father ieſuite eleganter ſanè author operis imperfecti matthaeum volentibus cognoſcere quae ſit vera eccleſia non eſt alius modus niſi tantummodò per scripturas salmeron ieſ com rom proem part 3 diſp 3 tit de falſis eccleſiae ſignis salmeron expoundeth part ſentence ſame author diſcerne true church onely • scripture extolleth reſt excellently well ſpoken notwithſtanding church bellarmine see aboue lit e telleth v hath purged left new edition ſauouring • ſie ſhall acknowledged chryſoſtome dealt conſtantinus magnus imperator euāgelici apoſtolici libri antiquorum prophetarum oracula planè no inſtruunt quid de diuinis ſentiendum eſt proinde hoſtili poſita diſcordia ex verbis diuinitus inſpiratis ſumamus quaeſtionum explicationes apud theodoret lib 1 cap 7 conſult onely thoſe heauenly inſpired scripture becauſe fully inſtruct v beleeue diuine thing whereunto cardinall bellarmine anſwereth thus reſpondeo conſtantinus magnus eccleſiae imperator non magnus doctor fuit bellar lib 4 de verbo dei cap 11 conſtantine indeed great emperour ſaith great doctor anſwer rather ſcorne doth onely touch conſtantine euſebius quidem dixit conſtantinum quaſi communem quendam epiſcopum diuinitus conſtitutum quae ad pacem dei faciunt vniuerſis diſpenſantem eſpencans epiſcopus comment 1 tim 3 manifeſta ſunt chryſoſt 2 theſſ 2 hom 3 thing ſaith neceſſary manifeſt yet againe plainly non oportet quicquam dicere ſine teſtibus • olâue animi cogitatione nam ſi quid dicitur abſque scriptura auditorum cogitatio claudicat c pſal 95 bellar reſp quo ſuprà hic prohibetur ne quid ex noſtra inuentione ſine scriptura dicatur falſe man ſhall ſay onely owne inuention diuine matter ſelfe ridiculous condemnable although cannot reproued scripture therefore calleth owne inuention warranted scripture man must ſay nothing ſaith priuate intention without teſtimonies scripture cauſe calleth ſacred scripture praeſertim cum habeamus omnium exactiſſimam trutinam gnomonem ac regulam diuinarum legum aſſertionem ideo abſecro oro omnes vo • vt relinquatis quidnam huic aut illi videatur déque à scripturis haec omnia inquirite homil 13 2 corinth bellarm reſp non loguitur de omnibus dogmatibus ſed de opinione carnalium qui anteponun • opes paupertati falſe chryſoſtome ſpeaketh generally 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 id eſt omnium exactiſſimam regulam habemus c addeth reaſon quomodo non abſurdum eſt propter pecunias alijs non credere ſed ipſas numerare ſupputare pro rebus autem amplioribus aliorum ſententiam ſequi ſimpliciter reaſon generally fitting matter belonging diuinitie followeth propounded praeſertim c moſt exact ballance ſquare rule diuine lawes wherein chryſoſtome partialis bellarm lib 4 de verbo non ſcripto cap 12 § dico ſecundò part rule faith 10 place epihanius formerly obiected obiect epiphan hareſ 55 nobis poſiti ſunt terminus fundamenta fidei apoſtolorum traditiones scripturae ſanctae c et hareſ 61 oportet traditione vti non enim omnia diuini • scripturis poſita ſunt bellar lib 4 cap 6 cardinall anſwer epiphanius ita delectatus erat traditionibus ex ſcripturis apocryphis vt chriſtā nō bethlē ſed ſpelunca quadā itinere natum aſſerat adamum ibi ſepultum vbi chriſtus eſt crucifixus quam hieronymus liberè reijcit quia ex scripturis non habet au • horitatem epiphan lib 3 tom 2 haereſ 80 conſtitutionibus apoſtolorū inquit diuina doctrina pilos barbae non eſſe ſecandos epiphan lib 2 tom 1 contra apoſtolicos peccatum eſſe poſt decretā virginitatem ad nuptias reuerti contrà hieron 1 cor 7 si quis ſtatu virginitatis adoleuerit ſi poſteà agnoſeat ſe duplici ſtatu virginitatis conſtitutum eſſe vt aut ſcortetur aut vxorem ducat faciat quod vult ſi vxorem duxerit non peccauit eodem modo cyprian lib 1 epiſt 11 epiphan ieiunium quartae ſextae feria haberi à traditione apoſtolorum contrà auguſt epiſt 86 cùm vtbicus vrgeret ex apoſtorum traditione neceſſitatem sabbato ieiunandi alij verò contrà dicerent non sabbato ſed ſexta feria ieiunandum reſpondet auguſt eſt quidem haec opinio plurimorum quamuis eam falſam eſſe perhibeant plerique romani—interminabilis eſt iſta contentio generans lites non finiens quaeſtiones ſit ergo vna fides vniuer • ae eccleſiae tametſi ipſa fidei vnitas quibuſdam diuerſis obſeruationibus celebretur et poſteà auguſt ego euangelicis apoſtolicis literis video praeceptum eſſe ieiunium quibus autem diebus non oporteat ielunare aut quibus oporteat praecepto domini aut apoſtolorum non inuenio definitum kemnitiue part 1 exam de tradit etſi dicat preccatum eſſe ſi quis poſt votum ducat vxorem haereſ 61 tamen ibidem melius eſſe dicit vt ſi quis curſu ceciderit ducat vxotem etiam poſt conſequences scripture 13 third place teſtimony obiect baſil de spir ſancte cap 7 quo loco plurimos enumerat ritus ab apoſtolis inſtitutos quaedam addit eſſentialia vt symbolum apoſtolicum vnctionem confirmat alia etiam commemorat quaelicet non ex ſe neceſſaria tamen poſtquam praecepta ſunt neceſſaria vt ſine peccato non omittantur bellar lib 4 de verbo dei cap 6 baſil obiected hath bene likewiſe ſatisfied anſwer primò dubitari poſſit vtrum haec vera genuina baſilij verba ſint neene eraſmus hunc librum dubium vocauit praef verſ baſil secundò ſi ſunt haec ipſa verba baſilij ſecùm ipſe pugnat quia docet neceſſaria omnia ad ſalutem reperiri scripturis tertiò zachariam illum matth 23 35 iohannis baptiſtae patrem fuiſſe ex veteri traditione docet ſed hieron docet apocryphum hoc eſſe proindè eadem facilitate reijci quâ aſtruitur et chryſoſt probat eum fuiſſe zachariam ichoidae filium de quo 2 paral 24 20 quartò cùm loquitur de ritibus ait euangelium ſine traditione ſcripta vim nullam habere ſed eſſe 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 videamus quales ſint ipſae traditiones ſint tanti precij inter alia conuerti no oportere ad orientem cùm precamur annon deus no etiam ad occaſum conuerſos exaudit eucherius antiquus pater lib 2 cap 58 comment reg piè docet non praecipi quemadmodum corpus diſponi debeat inter orandum dummodò animus praeſens ſit deo socrates ſcribit ant • ochenos ad occidentem ſpectare ſolitos precibus lib 5 cap 22 deinde baſilius hunc ritum defendit quia inquit antiquam patriam quaerimus paradiſum nempe horto eden ad orientem ſolis poſitum à deo no non terreſtrem ſed coeleſtem patriam quaerimus porrò baſilius benedicimus aquam baptiſmi nonne qualibet aqua elementari 〈◊〉 hac benedictione baptiſmus valebit chryſoſt hom 25 ioh praeclarè ſcribit chriſtum omnes aqua ſuo baptiſmo ſanctificâſſe quinta baſilij traditio ter mergendos eſſe baptizatos cypriantis lib 4 ep 7 • agis aſperfionem probat gregor lib 1 epiſt 41 nihil intereſſe ait vtrùm vna trina merſione vtamur concil toletanum 4 5 trinam immerſionem prohibet deinde no à paſchate ad pentecoſten ſtantes precari debere tribus ratiunculis defendit atque hoc decretum fuit concil 1 nicaeno aut neceſſariae ſunt iſtae baſilij traditiones aut non ſi ſunt neceſſariae cur ipſi pontificij ea omnes • obſeruant ſi non ſunt neceſſariae cur no baſilij authoritate premunt ait bellarm aequè no obligare atque ſcriptas traditiones licet non quo ad obſeruationem tamen quoad fidem ſic praecepta dei alia maiora dilige deum alia minora de verbo otioſo fugiendo matth 12 quae aequè no quoad fidem obligant ſed non quoad obſeruationem reſp papiſtas multas ex traditionibus tum quoad obſeruationem tum quoad fidem abrogâſſe ne minimum praeceptum scripturis traditum quoad obſeruationem eſt abrogandum ne illud quidem booke cannot proued haue bene baſils ſhould rather haue conſulted many plaine teſtimonies vndoubted work iudgeth infidelitatis argumentum eſt ſignum ſuperbiae certiſſimum ſi quis corū quae ſcripta ſunt▪ aliquid velit reijcere vel eorum quae non ſunt ſcripta introducere baſil serm de fidei confeſſ although confute priuate opinion yet doth vſe generall principle therefore addeth ſame place apoſtolus per humanum exemplum vehementer prohibet aliquid diuinis scripturis vel addere vel demere cùm dicit hominis teſtamentum nemo reprobat aut aliquid ei ſuperſtruit proinde quamcunque alienam à domini doctrina vocem ac mentem ita no ſemper nunc fugiendam cog nouimus indeed vſeth new word ſuch contained new doctrine ſaith non ſunt alienae à ſenſu scripturae argument infidelitie euident ſigne pride ſhall reiect either doctrine written bring written likewiſe another tract aduerſaries attributed vnto holdeth neceſſarium eſt conſonum vt ex ſacra quis scriptura quod neceſſe ſit diſeat ad pietatis plerophoriam tum ne humanis traditionibus aſſueſcat baſil reg contract q 95 si quicquid non eſt ex fide peccatum eſt vt vult apoſtolus fides verò ex auditu auditus autem per verbum deitergo quicquid extra scripturam diuinam eſt cùm ex fide non ſit peccatum eſt baſil ethic reg 80 c 22 neceſſarie euery one learne scripture neceſſarily learned full perſwaſion point godlineſſe alſo leſt caried away humane tradition 15 followeth euſebius whoſe ſentence fuſeb lib 1 demonſt euang c 8 caeterùm inquit moſes tabulis inanima • chriſtus autem mentibus vita praeditis perfecta noui teſtamenti documenta deſcripſit eius verò diſcipuli ad magiſtri ſui nutum auribus multorum doctrinam ſuam commendantes quaecunque quidem velnti vlt • habitum progreſſis à perfecto ipſorum magiſtro praecepra fuerant ea ijs qui capere poterant tradiderunt quae cunque verò ijs conuentre arbitrabantur qui anima adhue affectibus innoxias gererent curationiſue indigentes ea ipſi ad imbecillitatem multorum ſe dimittentes partum literis partim ſine litetis quaſi iure quodam non ſcripto ſeruanda commendarunt vt reſert bellar tom 1 lib 4 de verbo dci non ſcripto cap 7 § euſebius haue fully related paſſe ouer ait euſebius chriſtum non omnia omnibus tradidiſſe ſed excellentiora quaedam perfectis hominibus reſeruâſſe atque ſic etiam feciſſe apoſtolos longè aliter irenaeus lib 3 cap 15 deindè abſurdum eſt exiſtimare tam excellentes ac ſublimes eſſe illas traditiones quas papiſtae venditant vt ſint omnibus communicandae whittaker de ſacra scriptura q 6 cap 12 anſwers tradition vnwritten meant matter neceſſarily belonging vnto faith doth weaken cauſe defendeth see confeſſed aboue ſtate queſtion cardinall bellarmine doctrine neceſſary beleeued writtē scripture vnderſtand thereby doctrine neceſſarie euerie man beleeue clauſe euſebius ſaith people taught partly written tradition partly vnwritten cannot agree conſent aduerſaries affirming thing abſolutely neceſſary men ſaluation written scripture thus muſt romaniſts either grant teſtimony euſebius maketh againſt proteſtants elſe confeſſe maketh againſt themſelues cannot perſwaded euſebius writ booke commendation see aboue sect 3 num 7 conſtantine could diſſent confeſſed reſolution ſo greatly approued councell nice aduerſaries haue reiected returne vnto romish apologie thus much briefly concerning father greeke church concerning like confeſſed doctrine father latine church auoid tediouſneſſe auſten onely moſt gomarus ſpeculo verae eccleſiae c pag 96 ante medium ſaith auguſtinus patrum omnium communi ſententia puriſſimus habetur approued aduerſaries ſhall ſerue labouring proue thoſe baptized heretikes ſhould rebaptized ſaith auguſt de bapt contra donat lib 5 cap 23 apoſtles commaunded nothing hereof cuſtome oppoſed herein againſt cyprian beleeued proceed tradition many thing whole church holdeth therfore well beleeued commaunded apoſtles although written wherein see like ſaying auſtin epiſt 118 ad ianuarium like ſayings meaning ſo evident confeſſed cartwright ſpeaking thereof▪ ſaith see cartwright whitgifts defence c pag 103 ante medium allow auſtens ſaying bring poperie againe see cartwright word alledged vbi ſuprà auſtens iudgement good iudgement ſome thing commaunded god scripture thereupon ſufficient doctrine contained scripture protestant appeale sect 5 16 ſee reaſon may ſo farre admit augustine queſtion among latine father ſeeing aduerſaries ſo pleaſe alone may ſerue matter controuerſie indeed doctrinall queſtion wit whether thoſe haue bene baptized hereticks ought rebaptized cyprian held ought alledging except contrary vnde eſt haec traditio ex dominica authoritate deſcendens de apoſtolorum mandatis epiſtolis ea enim facienda eſſe quae ſcripta ſunt teſtatur dominus cypr epiſt 10 ad pomp tradition may proued scripture deſerueth credit auguſtine although maintaine contrary concluſiō vnto cyprian ſaying haue bene baptized may baptized againe yet doth hold cyprian caution viz neceſſity prouing doctrine scripture iudging aduerſaries call see pag 343 erroneous exception indeed quod cyprianus monet c see aboue pag 343 beſt courſe himſelfe preſently followeth confirming queſtion rebaptizing scripture epheſ 4 euincing ſame truth vſe owne word ne videar humanis argumentis agere ex euangelio profero certa documenta auguſt contra donat lib 1 cap 7 tom 7 ſure proofes goſpell againe perſpectis diſputationis rationibus scripturarum teſtimonijs poteſt dici quod veritas declarauit hoc ſequimur ibid lib 4 cap 7 teſtimonies scripture well wayed yet againe potetat iam ſufficere quòd tot repetitis teſtimonijs adiunctis etiam scripturarum documentis oſtendimus ibid lib 6 cap 1 see alſo de gen ad lit lib 10 cap 23 inſtance bellarm giueth confuted haue ſhewed ſaith scripture plainly make theſe perfection scripture aduerſarie cardinall bellarmine without si hae auguſtini coniecturae non valent niſi poſt concilij definitionem vt vult bellarminus cùm non valebant quando ijs auguſtinus pugnabat contra donatiſtas adhuc enim nihil de hac erat contra donatiſtas conc▪ aliquo definitum whitaker de ſacra script q 6 pag 457 fully ouerthroweth anſwer bellar vſed auguſtinum vſum fuiſſe coniecturis ex scriptura quae aliquid valent ad confirmandam veritatem poſt concilij definitionem ſed per ſe non ſufficiunt ibid errour cannot tell ſhift 17 ſecond like ſaying call auguſtine haue related obiect auguſt epiſt 118 illa quae non ſcripta ſed tradita cuſtodimus quae quidem toto terrarum orbe ſeruanturr dantur intelligi vel ab ipſis apoſtolis vel plenarijs concilijs quorum eſt eccleſia ſaluberrima authoritas commendata atque ſtatuta retineri ſicut quòd domini paſſio reſurrectio aſcenſio coelum aduentus de coelo spiritus ſancti anniuerſaria ſolennitate celebratur vt refert bellar lib 4 de verbo non ſcripto cap 7 § sed auguſtinus cardinall obiectors might haue bene ſatiſfied learned author haue produced anſwer hae traditiones non ita ſunt magni momenti nam ſine omnia poſſunt eſſe religione ſalua secundò auguſtinus neſcit num iſtorum dierum obſertiatio ab apoſtolis à plenarijs concilijs inſtituta fuerit▪ vocat quidem neceſſarias ſed quomodo ad ſalutē nullo modo ſed quòd neceſſe eſſe cuiuis illas ſeruare quocunque ſe conferret ad ſeruandam 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſcandala remouenda poſtremò socrates lib 5 cap 22 sozom lib 7 cap 19 auguſt epiſt 86 ſcribunt nihil omninò de feſtis diebus praeſcripfiſſe aut chriſtum aut apoſtolos whittaker de ſacra scriptura quaeſt 6 cap 12 ſheweth theſe queſtions ceremony doctrine faith thing neceſſarie kept time place feare ſcandall neceſſitie vnto ſaluation neither yet hath auguſtine defined theſe festiuals apoſtolicall tradition elſewhere according light eccleſiaſticall hiſtory confeſſeth neither chriſt apoſtles preſcribed certaine time faſting 18 conſequent vrge c altogether ſo concluſiue might well conceiue albeit contented auguſtine may ſerue latine father yet bound admit cartwright ſhall ſerue expoſitors auguſtine eſpecially knowing hath bene ſo learnedly confuted reuerend biſhop replie vnto obiection ſaying ſentence auguſtine euen ſence propounded ouerthrow popery becauſe romiſh article neuer proued due concurrance antiquitie concerning cartwright inference haue occaſion anſwer see hereafter hereafter returne vnto auguſtine inſiſt proue auguſtine queſtion tradition excellent patron proteſtants aſſertion defending ſufficiencie scripture sect 6 19 know little cauſe aduerſaries haue ſingle auguſtine ſerue ſhal need better witneſſe auguſtine himſelfe vltimò proferunt auguſtini teſtimonia ac primum lib 2 de doctr chriſt cap 9 quae apertè poſita ſunt scriptura inueniuntur illa omnia quae continent fidem moréſque viuendi etiam lib de bono viduit cap 1 sanctum enim scriptura noſtrae doctrinae regulam figit ne audeamus ſapere plus quàm oportet non eſt ergo mihi aliud te docere quàm verba tibi doctoris exponere etiam lib 2 de peccat merit remiſſ cap 36 vbi de obſeu • iſſima diſputatur non adiuuantibus diuinarum scripturarum certis clariſue documentis cohibere ſe debet humana praeſumptio nihil faciens alteram partem declinando bellarm lib 4 de verbo dei cap 11 § vltimò proferunt reſpondeo ad primum loquitur de doguiatibus quae neceſſaria ſunt omnibus ſimpliciter qualia ſunt quae symbolo apoſtolico decalogo continentur ad ſecundum contra co agit qui fingunt nouas doctrinas quae scripturis conſonae non ſunt ad tertium loquitur de quaeſtionibus obſeuriſſimis qualē eſſe putabat de origine animarum ad quas definiend non ſuppetunt vlla firma teſtimonia ſed ſolùm coniecturae quaedam ex diuinis literis bellar ibid amongst thoſe thing ſaith contained scripture thoſe thing may found concerne faith manner life holy scripture ſaith vnto v rule doctrine leſt ſhould wiſe aboue ought whenſoeuer question made ſaith caſe greateſt difficulty haue cleare proofes scripture concluſion ſo long muſt man preſumption keepe ſilence 20 theſe proofes verie perſpicuous pertinent wherunto aduerſaries cannot make anſwer greater firſt teſtimony lib 2 de doctr chriſt cap 9 omnibus libris timentes deū pietate menſueti quaerunt voluntatē dei followeth ijs enim c plainly ſhewing thoſe doctrine concerne onely generally men alſo euery one euen biſhops themſelues thing neceſſary secondly card bellarmine grant may conclude vnwritten tradition ſimply neceſſary men thirdly iudgement auguſtine scripture ſufficient direction moſt obſcure queſtions ſuch originall production ſoule certes much ſufficient muſt thought queſtions neceſſarie conſequence entanglement therefore conclude ſame father deum contra inſidioſos errores voluiſſe ponere fundamentum scripturis auguſt 2 tract ioh sanctum scriptura noſtrae doctrinae regulam figit ne audeamus plus ſapere quàm oporte • ſed ſapiamus ad temperantiam ſicut vnicuique deus partitus eſt menſuram fidei auguſt lib de bono viduit cap 1 word generall proofe one particular god hath ſet scripture foundation againſt ſeducement errour rule godlineſſe may wiſe vnto ſobriety 21 theſe infallible teſtimonies ſufficiency holy writ remaineth heare auguſtine pronounce proinde ſiue de chriſto ſiue de eccleſia ſiue de quacunque alia quae pertinet ad fidem vitamue noſtram non dicam ſi no nequaquaquam comparandi ei qui dixit licet ſi no ſed quod ſecutus adiecit si angelus de coelo vobis annunciauerit praeterquàm quod scripturis legalibus euangelicis accepiſtis anathema ſit auguſt contra lit petil lib 3 cap 6 legite haec nobis de lege de prophetis de pſalmis de ipſo euangelio de literis apoſtolicis credemus auguſt de vnitate eccleſ cap 6 non affetamus doloſas ſtateras vbi appendamus quod volumus pro arbitrio noſtro ſed ſtateram diuinam de scripturis ſanctis illis quid ſit grauius appendamus vel potiùs à domino appenſa recognoſcamus auguſt lib 2 de baptiſ cap 6 anathema vpon ſhall teach thing either chriſt church matter faith beſides receiued legall euangelicall scripture whereunto wiſh aduerſaries ex traditione refutandos eſſe bellar lib 4 de verbo dei cap 6 tertullian ſuch book anſwer lib de corona milit de veland virg written montaniſme adde pertinet ad montanicas deſtructiones quod tertull lib de exhort ad caſtitatem diſputat—obijcit ſibi ergonè prima nuptias deſtru • reſpondet nec immeritò quoni • ipſae ex eo conſtat quod eſt ſtuprum propter hanc ſtupri affinita • em optimum eſt mulierem non tangere diſputans contra primum ſecundum matrimonium allegat dictum sancti eſtote quom • ego ſanctus c tertull libro de leiunio narrat montaniſtas ob cauſas à catholicis reprehenſos argu • nt igitur no inquit quòd ieiunia propria cuſtodiamus quòd 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 obſeruemus lauacti quoque abſtinentiam • ouitatem nobis obiectan • —dicun ieiunandum eſſe ex arbitrio non ex imperio nouae diſciplinae pro temporibus cauſis vniuſcuiuſque sic apoſtolos obſe ruâſſe nullum aliud iugum imponentes certorum commune obeundorum • iuniorum— 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 • • um affectati officij nomen proximum ethnicae ſuperſtition • proi • de no à fide abſ •• dentes intendentes ſpiritibus mundi ſeductoribus qui ficut nubere probibeant ita iubeant à cibis abſtinere—dicunt duobus praecep •• charita •• tota lex pendet prophetae non pulmonum inteſtinorum inanitate c tertull lib de poenitentia à montano hábet vnicam tantùm eſſe poenitentiam poſt baptiſmum ke • nitius place obiected tertull cùm l • brum de corona militis ſcripſerat montaniſta erat dixit enim ſe habere illum paracletum quem chriſtus promiſerat fretu • huius paracleti authoritate mults 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 eccleſiam inuexit quanquam tertullianus de haere aptiſſima volumina ſcriplerit ſed conſequens error hominis detraxit ſcriptis probábilibus authoritatem ſic hilar • u comment matth cap 5—tertullianus eccleſiae homo non fuit hieron contra helnidium rurſ •• multa contra eccleſiam ſcripfit hieron catalogo abſurdum eſt tiu montanicas traditiones nobis obtrudere tertull catholici dogmatis parùm tena • vi • c lyrinenſ comment cap 24 impudenter faciunt papiſtae quòd ea nobis traditiones obijciunt ex tertulliano quas ipſi non retinent nec vllo modo retinendas iudicant ſunt enim traditiones iſtae tertull huiuſmodi baptizatos ter mergita • e baptizatis lac mel ſtati • deguſtandum porrigere ſumere euchariſtiam tempore victus nefas eſſe diebus dominicis à paſchate ad pentecoſten de geniculi • adorare locus tertull ex praeſcript obiectus aduerſarios noſtros vulo • rat grauiſſimè nam contrà haeret co agit qui negabant scripturas eſſe perfecta quique aichant apoſtolos non omnia omnibus ſed quaedam perfectis tradidiſſe ſi • • odie papiſtae tertullianus quidem prouocat à scriptutis ad eccleſiam non quidem ad doctrinam aliquam non ſcriptam ſed ad eius doctrine defenſionem propagationem whittaker place obiected author ſhew wereby profeſſedly written againſt catholike church whence reuolted vnto ſect montaniſts indeed aduerſaries haue much matter tradition kind muſt need defend proue catholikes becauſe tertullian montaniſt defended 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 preſcription ſet faſts law neceſſitie abſtinence certaine kind meates opiniō ſanctity eagerly inueighing againſt catholike church denying maner faſts drie meat calling ſuch kind rite noueltie mention condemning ſecond mariages himſelfe ſuch errours condemned hierome father aduerſary vnto catholike church tradition place alledged threefold merſion giuing hony milke vnto perſons baptized receiuing euchariſt time meate aduerſaries themſelues haue wiſdome reiected 25 might haue become apologiſts bene ſtudious truth haue left tertullian tertullian left true church peraduenture foreſee ſhould vrged conſult montaniſt catholike tertullian hold tradition would ſuffer breach tertullian booke preſcription written againſt heretikes doth doctor see teſtimonie going whitaker hath proued wound cauſe elſewhere diſputeth againſt heretike hermogenes negatiuely scripture thus profert 11 tertull qui lib contra hermog adoro inquit scripturae plenitudinem scriptum eſſe doceat hermogenis officina si non eſt ſcriptū timeat vae illud adijcientibus vel detrahentibus deſtinatum reſpondeo loquitur tertull de vno dogmate tantùm quòd ſcilicet deus creauerit omnia ex nihilo non ex praeiacente materia vt hermogenes ſomniabat etquoniam hoc dogma apertiſſimè continetur scripturis dicit tertullianusſe adorare scripturae plenitudinem quantum ad hoc dogma addit hermogenem qui addebat ad scripturam dogma contrarium repugnaus ipſi scripturae incidere ipſam male dictionem qua prohibemur nihil addere aut detrahere scripturae ita vt veritas eius immutetur bellar lib 4 de verbo dei non ſcripto cap 11 pag 182 anſwer verba tertulliani generalia ſunt diſputat enim tertull negatiuè ab authoritate scripturarum ſic hermogenes non poteſt docere hoc eſſe ſcriptum ergo vae c libro de reſurrectione carnis haereticos vocat lucifugas scripturarum lbi aufer haereticis quod cum ethnicis ſapiunt vt de ſolis scripturis opiniones ſuas ſiſtant ſtate non poſlunt quae papiſtis maximè conueniunt qui nec cogi volunt dogma ſua de ſolis scripturis ſiſtere no cupiunt omni diſputatione à scripturarum luce deducere et libro de carne chriſti si non probant quia nec ſcriptum eſt mox sed nihil de co conſtat quia scriptura non exhibet doctor whittaker place obiected thy doctrine written therefore due vnto woe denounced againſt adde vnto scripture wherein ſo confident profeſſe heretikes cannot preuaile ſhall compelled ſtand onely scripture againe argueth negatiuely thus proued ſaith becauſe written nothing make proofe ſufficiency perfection ſacred writ diſcharge expected anſwer vnto father alledged apologiſts sect 8 26 would feare onely matter tediouſneſſe euen kind torment vnto iudicious reader inſiſt v vpon obiected particular either repetition teſtimonies see aboue § 4 chryſoſtome see aboue § 4 epiphanius see aboue § 4 baſil see aboue § 6 auguſtine alreadie ſatisfied addition thing vnto ſatisfied teſtimonies clemens alexandrinus tertullian aggregation ſentences orig cap 6 epiſt ad rom eccleſia ab apoſtolis traditionem accepit etiam paruulis baptiſmum dare et hom 5 num enumerat multas traditiones non ſcriptas bellarmine obiecteth lib 4 de verbo dei cap 7 anſwer origenes inter dogma non ſcripta non recenſet articulos aliquos fidei ſed tantum ritus quoſdam benedictionem aqua baptiſ trinam merſionem—innumeras genuflexiones—is diſcipulus fuit clementis alexandrim cuius dogma hieron ad pammachium venenata • oca • kemnitius baptiſmus paruulorum eſt ſcripta traditio genu flectenda eſſe inter orandum laudabilis quidem traditio eſt ſed non neceſſaria vt baſilius lib de spir ſancto cap 27 affirmat chriſtianos diebus dominicis paſchate vſque ad pentecoſten non flexis genibus ſed erectos precari ſolitos eſſe scripſerunt contra cuin multi antiqui patres epiphanius theophilus hieronymus whittaker place obiected origen obiect cypr • lib 1 epiſt 12 traditionem profe • vnctionis baptiſmo mixtionem vini cum aqua bellar lib 4 de verbo dei cap 6 anſwer auguſt lib 2 contra creſcon cap 32 de quadam cypriani epiſtola verba faciens ego huius epiſtolae ait authoritate non teneor quia literas cypriani non quidem vt canonicas habeo ſed ea ex canonicis iudico quod eis diuinarum scripturarum authoritati congr •• cum laude eius accipio quod autem non congruit cum pace eius reſpuo cyprianus dicit vngi neceſſe eſt baptizatos qu • mobrē tandé vt incipiamus ſcil • eſſe vncti domini quàm hoc frigidè dicitur num ſine hoc vnguento non poſ • umus eſſe vnctos domini fateor apud antiquos mixtam fuiſle aquam vino moderatè temperatam quia illis locis vinum ita forte fuit haec mixtio licita eſt modò aqua vini naturam non tollat whittaker place obiected duobus conſiſtit sacramentum baptiſmi verbo elemento ideo etſi alia deſint quae ad decorem sacramenti inſtituta ſunt non id • minus verum eſſe sacramentum ſanctum ſi verbum ſit ibi elementum lombardus lib 4 diſt 3 cyprian ob ambroſius qui explicat ritus qui ab vniuerſa eccleſia ſeruantur baptiſmo qui non inueniuntur ſacri • literis ab alijs ad traditiones apoſtolicas referuntur traditionem etiam symboli apoſtolici quadrageſimae proponit bellarm lib 4 de verbo dei cap 6 anſwer vnto firſt owne p lombard hath ſatisfied concluding verbum elementum eſſence baptiſme see former obiection ambroſius aſſerit exempo chriſti nobis indictam quadrageſimam sed chry • oſtom homil 47 matth diſertè hoc negat chriſtus inquit non iubet vt ieiunium ſuum imitemur ſed inquit diſcite à quia mitis humilis ſum kemniti • cùm exemplum chriſti v • get traditionem ſcriptam defendit serm 37 qualis e chriſtianus cum domino • iunante tu prandes ergo pontificij boni chriſtiani qui prandent symbolum apoſtolicum scripturis reperitur whittaker ambroſe ob hieronymus ad marcellam voca • quadrageſimam legem apoſtolicam bellar lib 4 • verbo dei cap 6 anſwer conſuetudinem piam quis vnquam reprehendit ſed hae conſuetudines liberae ſunt non neceſſariae whittaker ierome ob innocentius leo damaſcen anſwer innocentij teſtimonium bellarminus omiſit 2 illae epiſtolae decretales nullius ſunt ſidei deinde errauiſſe innocentium traditionibus ſuis vt conſtat ex auguſtino lib 2 contra iulian 3 omninò friuolas eſſe vt vbi ait non audere ſe verba confirmationis proferre ne myſteria prodero videatur viz confirmo te ſigno crucis vngo chriſmate ſalutis nomine patris filij spiritus ſancti leonem erraſſe cum dicit apoſtolos ieiunia inſtituiſſe quae non ſunt ab illis inſtituta 2 dico non obſeruari iam à papiſtis illa ieiunia quae leo tradidit quartae ſextae feria damaſcenum non moramur vtp • te qui recens author quem papiſtae non audent omnibus defendere nam vnà cum canonicis scripturis canones apoſtolorum clementinos numerat whittaker lib de ſacra scriptura see theoph place obiected reſt margent author ſufficiently anſwered 27 ſumme tradition haue bene obiected may deduced scripture ſuch infantes poſſe baptizari deducitur euidenter ex scripturis bellar lib 1 de sacram baptiſ cap 9 baptiſme infant dico articulos fidei primarios de deo chriſto trinitate alijs praecipuis fidei noſtrae myſterijs propterea ſcriptos eſſe vt credantur mulhuſinus ieſ contra pareum de authorit script theſ 19 catechiſme trent proueth euery article scripture apoſtles creede confeſſed properly reckoned amongſt vnwritten tradition properly faſts feſtiuals diuerſe rite duobus conſiſſit sacramentum baptiſmi verbo elemento ideo etſi alia deſint quae ad decorem sacramenti inſtituta ſunt non ideo minus • um eſſe sacramentum ſanctum ſi verbum feast charitie vſed primitiue church long time cōtinued canon primus apoſtolicus epiſcopus ordinetur à duobus vel tribus epiſcopis tamen ob epiſcoporum raritatem aliamuè cauſam iuſtam per pont • ficis diſp • nſationem ſit vt cum vno epiſcopo ordina • te adſint duo aut plures abbates infulati qui vicem epiſcoporum gerant bellar lib 4 de eccleſ cap 8 vt binius conc tom 1 annot hunc canonem et tamen de hoc canone hic numeratur inter eos qui vt authentici recipiuntur ab eccleſia cap 3 diſt 16 binius ibid fol 14 col 1 diſpenſing apoſtolical canon concerning conſecration biſhops romana eccleſia quam ſecutae ſunt eccleſiae occidentales ex apoſtolica conſuetud • e conſueuit ſextâ feriâ sabbato ieiun • enim diebus ablatus erat à diſcipulis ſponſus veruntamen eccleſijs orientalibus aliter fieri poſitum • uit vt feriâ ſextâ quartâ • eiunaretur vt ex apoſt 68 lib conſt clementis cap 16 ex ignatio ad philippenſ ex epiphan athanaſ alijs conſtat binius tom 1 conc fol 247 sabbatum dominicum diē ieiunare quoniam ille eſt naturae conditae monumentum hic reſurrectionis conſt clementis rom ignat ad magueſ philip surius tom 1 conc pag 101 quartae ſextae feria ieiunium praecipitur quod diù manſit eccleſia nunc quod eſt dolendum lugendum cum alijs optimis maiorum inſtitutis de • u • tudinem abijt praecipitur quoque sabbati celeb • itas ſed cum diei diminici cultu mini •• è aequata etiam ſtatuebatur de vnius magni sabbati ieiunio agnoſco priſcum morem ſed eundem acceſſion • meliorum legum exoletum neglecting wedneſdaies saturday faſt nam romana eccleſia apoſtolicâ vtens poteſtate ſingula pro conditione temporum melius mutat non fuit contenta vnius sabbati ieiunio ſed inſtituit vt idem mo omnibus sabbatis ſeruaretur iohannes bouius epiſcopus oſt schol lib 7 conſt clementis c 24 vt eſt apud surium tom 1 conc pag 130 altering ſome ancient conſtitutions thus pretend inſtitution better rite apoſtolicall authoritie church rome ex quatuor octoginta apoſtolicis canonibus quos clemens rom pontifex • orundem apoſtolorum diſcipuli vnum coegit vix ſex aut octo latina eccleſia obſeruat michael medina lib 5 de ſacrorum hom continentia c 106 reinalds alledg • th theſ 5 obſeruing almoſt eight canon eight • e pope clemens ſuppoſed apoſtolicall 34 theſe heare nothing altering diſpenſing abrogating aboliſhing cuſtomes rite ceremony canon opinion generall ancient moſt part neceſſarie apoſtolicall done preſume iuſtly ſhall excuſe commend proteſtants like abrogation notwithſtanding therefore ordinarily charge intollerable contempt ſhall diſcreet reader diſcerne profeſſors ingenuouſly incline vnto ſimplicitie goſpell whether romaniſts diſanull abandon ſuch rite although iudgement ſeemed haue bene apoſtolicall proteſtants iudging moſt theſe apoſtolicall vncertaintie ſuch like tradition zealouſly affect eſpecially ſuch order perſwaded ſucceſſiuely ſuccesfully deſcend antiquitie admitting thoſe rite may neither oppreſſe church number nature corrupt
