foundation faith reproued heretiks accuſing scripture though truth may found ignorant tradition origen held neceſſe eſt scripturas ſanctas teſtimonium vocare ſenſus quippe noſtri ſine teſtibus non h • bent fidem origen hom 1 ierem againe neceſſarie bring teſtimonies scripture sicut omne aurum quod fuerit extra templum non eſt ſanctiſicatum ſic omnis qui fuerit extra diuinam scripturam quamuis admirabilis videatur quibuſdam non eſt ſanctus quia non continetur à ſenſu scripturae quae ſolet cum ſolum ſenſum ſanctificare quem habet •• ſe ſicut templum proprium aurum origen hom 25 matth firſt bellarmine anſwereth nothing purpoſe ſecond nothing againe vide qu • proximi periculis fiant hi qui exerceri diuinis literis negligunt—ex quibus ſolis huiuſmodi examinationis agnoſcenda diſcretio eſt origen cap 16 ad rom lib 10 cardinall bellarmine pretermitteth without deſerue credit like gold without temple vnhallowed athanaſius proclaimed scripturae 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſufficiunt ad veritatis inſtructionem athanaſ lib contra gens ſeu idola againe scripture ſufficient inſtruction truth verie diuinam scripturam certis libris comprehenſam eſſe anchoram ſuſtentaculum fidei noſtrae idem synop • sufficiant quae ijs repcrias documenta ad scrapionem anchor faith baſil pronounced infidelitatis argumentum eſt ſignum ſuperbiae ſi quis eorum quae ſcripta ſunt aliquid velit reijcere aut eorum quae non ſcripta introducere baſilius ſerm de fidei conſeſſ moſt certaine ſigne infidelity adde thing written therefore aduiſed euery one see aboue § 6 margent auoyding tradition admit nothing neceſſarie conſonant vnto scripture chryſoſtome taught see aboue § 6 margent whatſoeuer ſpoken without scripture doth lame vnderſtanding hearer called scripture reſpect ſufficiency thereof exact rule canon faith meritò oſtium scripturas appellat quoniam no ad deum ducunt eius nobis cognitionem aperiunt ipſae oues faciunt ipſae cuſtodiunt neque lupos erumpere permittunt tanquam enim oſtium firmiſſimum haereticos arcent tuto conſtituunt neque no etiamſi velimus aberrare ſinent c qui nō ſacr • vtitur scripturâ aliundè aſcendit id eſt non conceſſâ viâ fur eſt chryſoſtom homil 58 9 ioh medio tom 2 moſt firme doore keepe wolfe iudging theefe aſcendeth way epiphanius maintained see aboue § 5 may learne find euery queſtion conſequence scripture cyril alexandrinus defended non omnia quae dominus fecit conſcripta ſunt ſed quae ſcribentes tam ad more quàm ad dogma ſufficere putauerūt vt rectum fide operibus virtute rutilantes ad regnum coelorum perueniamus cyrill ioh lib 12 cap 68 againe duobus te •• amentis omne verbum requiri poſſe quod ad deum pe • tineat homil 5 leuit whether call author hereof cyril origen materiall thing writtē scripture holy writer thought ſufficient doctrine manner c tertullian adoro scripturae plenitudinem scriptum eſſe doceat hermogenis officina ſi non eſt ſcriptum timeat vae illud adijcientibus aut detrahentibus tertull lib contra hermog cap 22 aufer ab haereticis quod cum ethnicis ſentiunt vt de ſolis scripturis opiniones ſuas ſiſtant ſtare non poſſunt tertull lib de reſurrect carnis adored fulneſſe scripture hereupon pronounced woe vpon broached thing iuſtifiable scripture whereunto would haue hereticks compelled ſtand theophilus iudged property diabolici ſpiritus eſt aliquid extra diuinarum scripturarum authoritatem diuinum putare theoph alexand 2 paſchali diuelliſh ſpirit thinke thing diuine without authority scripture cyprian demaunded see § 4 adde non aliundè loquendum eſt de rebus fidei niſi ex literis fidei cyprian tradition whence cometh authoritie chriſt goſpell precept apoſtles epiſtles hath therefore bene reiected aduerſaries albeit hath bene auguſtine therin iuſtified commended hierome accounted teaching sine authoritate scripturarum garrulitas non habet fidem niſi viderentur peruerſam doctrinam diuinis eloquijs roborare hieron com 1 cap epiſt ad titum sed alia quae abſque authoritate aut teſtimonijs scripturarum quaſi traditione apoſtolica ſpoute reperiunt atque confingunt percutit gladius dei idem comment 1 cap haggaei anſwer bellarmine ſaying ſpoken againſt thoſe feine ſome thing themſelues would haue ſeeme apoſtolicall cannot helpe hierome ſpeaketh 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 id eſt humi dormitiones themſelues eſteeme ancient eccleſiam vrbes habere legis prophetarum euangeliorum epiſtolarum non egreſſam eſſe è finibus ſuis id eſt de scripturis ſanctis hieron 1 cap mich destitute authority scripture vaine babling ſuch ſtuffe worthy cut ſword god spirit ſufficiency scripture preached bound limit church god may paſſe ambroſe asked sanctis scripturis non loquentibus quis loquetur ego quid facere potuerit nunc praetermitto quid fecerit quod aperta scripturarum authoritate non didicit tanquam ſecretum praeterco ambroſ lib 3 hexam cap 3 lib 2 de vocat gent cap 3 ſhall ſpeake diuine scripture ſilent therein putting men ſilence preach doctrine faith without scripture vincentius lyrinenſis iudged non quia scripturarum canon ſolus non ſibi ad vniuerſa ſufficiat ſed c vinc lyrinenſ cap 41 canon scripture onely ſufficient vnto thing theodoret thought wiſdome non audeo dicere aliquid quod tacuit scriptura diuina theod 2 dial contra haeret dare ſay thing diuine scripture hath concealed damaſcene profeſſed ſought no ea omnia quae tradita ſunt per legem per prophetas per apoſtolos per euangeliſtas recipimus agnoſcimus colimus approbamus—sed nihil praeter haec aliud quaerentes damaſcen de orthodox fide lib 1 cap 1 nothing beſides scripture auguſtine apologiſts chooſe mouth latin father hath concluded see aboue § 6 againe alijs verò teſtibus vel teſtimonijs quibus credendum eſſe ſuadetur tibi credere vel non credere liceat quantum ea momenti ad faciendam fidem vel habere vel non habere perpenderis auguſt epiſt 112 ego ſolis scripturis canonicis debeo ſine recuſatione conſenſum lib de natura grat cap 61 thoſe thing plainly deliuered scripture contained thing concerne faith godly life c whatſoeuer confirmed scripture muſt beleeued witneſſes thou maist beleeue according thy diſcretiō purpoſe hath see aboue § 6 4 c called scripture foundation laid god entanglement errour fixt rule doctrine beyond ſobrietie wiſe diuine ballances wherein doctrine examined tried whether heauy light end pronounced euery one anathema teacheth doctrine contained scripture 36 hereunto agreeth forecited teſtimonie see aboue § 3 conſtantine great firſt chriſtian emperour ſo greatly honoured firſt moſt famous synode nice deſired diuine bookes prophet apoſtles might laid ſufficient inſtructions diuine cauſes vnto orthodoxall biſhops councell yeelded preſent aſſent see ibid hilary approued emperour conſtantius ſo farre forth account anathema antichriſtian one whoſoeuer ſhall gainſay come trie whether profeſsion romanists protestant ſafe ſecure chriſtian man reſolution decided conſequences learned aduerſaries sect 12 37 senate father come schooles romiſh aduerſaries wiſh true ſame queſtion concerneth thoſe queſtioniſt • aske ſhal know scripture word god tradition controuerſie onely betweene thoſe party doe acknowledge truth scripture accordance preſumed followeth point whether scripture haue receiued tradition n • ſufficient canon neceſſary matter faith precept holineſſe ſtate queſtion may remembred viz whether acknowledge truth canon scripture ought likewiſe profeſſe ſufficiency wit containe neceſſarie canon rule may concerne neceſſarie doctrine faith direction life proteſtants haue affirmed romaniſts haue denied theſe aduerſaries lay downe fundamental concluſion tertium fundamentum multa pertinere ad chriſtianorum doctrinam fidem quae nec apertè nec obſcurè ſacris literis continentur—sanctorum martyrum auxilium precibus eſſe implorandum eorum ue memorias celebrandas imago venerandas eſſe—ſacrae literae nuſquam fortè tradiderunt canus locis theol lib 3 cap 3 many thing belonging vnto doctrine faith chriſtianity neither expreſly obſcurely contained scripture tradition councell trent hath decreed worthily sacroſancta synodus—omnes libros tam veteris quàm noui teſtamenti cum vtriuſque deus vnus ſit author nec non traditiones ipſas tum ad fidem tum ad more pertinentes tanquam ore tenus vel à spiritu ſancto dictatas continui ſucceſſione eccleſia catholica conſeruatas pari pietatis affectu reuerentia ſuſcipit veneratur conc trid seſſ 4 decret de canonicis honoured equall affection deuotion due vnto bookes old new teſtament whereas proteſtants require ſuch catholike councel may animated ſpirit written word whence tradition concluſions neceſſary doctrine may taken aduerſaries iudge conditionem hanc proteſtantes exigunt vt concilijs ex ſola scriptura diuina ſententiae ferantur non ex traditionibus—reſpondeo eſt conditio iniqua bellar lib 1 de conc cap 21 § quarta conditio § quartò condition vniust scripture see aboue halfe rule faith doctrine leauen wiſh might purged end borrow ſome helpe conſequents confeſſions learned aduerſaries firſt conſequence 38 doctrine quaedam doctrina chriſtiana tam fidei quàm morum eſſe ſimpliciter omnibus neceſſaria ad ſalutem notitia articulorum symboli apoſtolici item cognitio decem praeceptorum nonnullorum sacramentorum bellarm lib 4 de verbo non ſcripto cap 11 § primum c little nota ſecundò ea quae ſunt ſimpliciter neceſſaria apoſtolos conſucuiſſe omnibus praedicare aliorum autem non omnia omnibus ſed quaedam omnibus quae nimirum erant omnibus vtili • c ibid § nota ſecundò dico illa omnia ſcripta eſſe ab apoſtolis quae ſunt omnibus neceſſaria quae ipſi pal • omnibus vulgò praedicauerunt idem ibid cardinall confeſſeth ſimply neceſſarie profitable men contained scripture neceſſitie conſequence doctrine purgatory inuocation saint worſhipping image indulgence auricular confeſsion prayer dead merit c many romiſh article see aboue euery particular treatiſe aduerſaries haue proued contained scripture muſt none thoſe doctrine neceſſarily beleeued chriſtiās paul hath ſaid epheſ 2 one god one faith one baptiſme therefore dreame different faith may diuerſe god 39 secondly aduerſaries argue thus nonne ad ſolas scripturas haeretici appellabant traditiones repudiabant stapleton lib 2 de author eccleſ cap 6 greg de valent ieſ lib 6 analyſ cap 8 tannerus ieſ colloq ratisb seſſ 8 hereticks ſay refuſe tradition appealed onely vnto scripture ergo scripture ſufficient rule doctrine life conſequence may contrarily reioyne viz ſeeing learned adurſaries wit omnes haeretici inquit auguſtin audacias figmentorum ſuorū quas maximè exhorret ſenſus humanus hac occaſione euangelicae ſententiae colorare conantur quaſi haec ipſa ſint quae tunc diſcipuli portare non poterant quis autem noſtrûm audeat eorum ſe dicere iam capacem quae illi capere non valebant aquinas catena aurea hunc locum aquinas irenaeus lib 1 ca 23 ſcribit de baſilidian quòd aſſerāt nō oportere eorum myſteria eff • ri ſed abſcondito continere per ſilentium cap 24 de carpocratianis tertull quoque lib de praeſcript ſolent dicere non omnia apoſtolos ſciſſe vel omnia quidem ſciſſe ſed non omnia omnibus tradidiſ • e confeſſed cardinall bellarmine lib 4 de verbo dei non ſcripto cap 12 ante finem cardinall bellarmine matthaeus fingitur eſſe author duorum librorum quorū alter de ortu mariae alter de infantia ſaluatoris inſcribitur qui valentinorum gnoſticorum commenta ſunt sixtus senenſ bibl lib 2 tit matthaeus pag 83 col 1 matthiae apoſtoli euangelium inter alia non canonica enumerat origenes eiuidem traditiones clemens lib 2 strom citat 7 libro ſcribit marcionem baſilidem ex harum authoritate haereſes ſuas firmâſſe senenſ ibid lib 3 tit matthiae alij fuerunt haeretici qui non omnes pauli epiſtolas reſpuere ſunt auſi ſed ea tantùm quas maximè ſuis dogmatibus infeſtas cognouerunt veluti encratitae seueriant marcionitae manicha • arriani aëriani anabaptiſtae pleri que alij haeretici senenſ bibl lib 7 § de epiſtolis pauli vniuerſali pag 600 arian • origenis libros dogmatis ſui defenſionem citabant idem ibid pag 601 ex libro hermetis ariani execrabilium dogmatum praeſidia ſumebant ibid lib 2 tit hermes senenſis ipſae haereſes inquit tertull ab ipſa philoſophia ſubornantur inde aeones formae neſcio quae apud valentinum cùm platonicus • rat inde marcionis deus melior à stoicis iuſtus 〈◊〉 aliàs baronius praeſcript aduerſ proteſt iuſtus baronius initio eccleſiae cerinthus falſas reuelationes finxit tale prophetiae ſectatorum marci magi tale prophetiſſarum ipſius montani tale archonticorum manetis quoque tale reuelationes del rio ieſ diſq magic tom 2 lib 4 ca 1 q 2 § 2 pag 134 falſas reuelationes finxerunt donatiſtae idem tom 2 lib 4 cap 1 q 2 § 2 pag 134 delrio valentinus platonicas fabulas inuexit quas ſecuti ſunt gnoſtici hermogenes stoicorum opinionem eſt ſequntus montaniſticum dogma de mátrimonio paracleto authore defendit beatus rhenanus argan tert aduerſus valent hermog▪ marc rhenanus lately phanatici anabaptiſtae cò venerant dementiae vt ſe vſque adeo diui • itus illuminatos iactitent vt neceſſe non habeant vel eccleſiae vel scripturarum vocem requirere ſcripturas è mortuis literis deſcriptas aiunt eccleſiam ablegant tanquant errantium hominum coe • um—de scriptur inquiunt quarum ſenteotia aliqua eſt omnem partem verſatilis parum laboramus edwardus weſton • de tr facti • aut mandatis c see aboue lib 1 becauſe ſuch point cānot proued written inſtitutions chriſt confirming pretended prerogatiues peter dictum eſt petro nulli praeterea apoſtolorum tu e petrus c euince manner concluſion 41 laſtly pretend tradition affirme written traditio non igitur dicitur non ſcripta doctrina quòd nuſquam ſcripta eſt ſed quòd non inuenitur ſcripta vllo libro apoſtolico booke proofe author th • ſe bookes ancient areopagita anſwer vnto theſe obiections▪ ſaith nonnullos alios eccleſiaſticos ſcriptores hieronymum praetermiſiſte vel quòd diligentiam eius fugerunt vel quòd vnus homo non potuit omnes nanciſci vel nouiſſe vel omnium ſemper meminiſſe c ſecond member could oppoſite vnto former could muſt argue negligence aduerſarie ieſuit ſo anſwereth may ſeeme accuſe bene extant 4 againe make gregory onely dixit gregorius fertur quoniam latino alloquebatur quibus authoritas librorum nondum latio donatorum ſatis adhuc cognita vel comperta non erat little gregorius ſatis clarè oſtendit ſe proniorem eſſe ſententiam affirmatiuam quandoquidem ex hoc libro doctrinam ſuam true ſee section following ribera confirmauit delrius ieſ vindic areopag cap 6 ſee aboue lit encline rather vnto opinion end may authorize worke excellency name dionyſius diſgrace ſucceeding church many age generally id nunc ſupereſt ambiguitatis vix enim quibuſdam credibile viſum eſt tot ſeculis b dionyſij areopagitae tam clari apoſtolici viri libros occultari potuiſſe cauſa prima eſt suidae c quia catholici obteſtatione dionyſij erant obſtricti ne imperitae multitudini ſed ſolis doctis ſua ſcripta quaſi multorum capacitatem excedentia reuelarent doctis autem paulatim deficientibus—for • etiam hieronymus excellentiſſimū areopagitam inter eccleſiaſticos ſeriptores▪ non commemorauit quia eius libros tanquam eminentes non putauit ad communem notitiam deputatos c aliam cauſam reddit anaſtaſius bibliothecarius cum teſtatur veram eſſe graecorum ſententiam prohibentium libros dionyſij per multa ſecula occultatos donec per quendam petrum romanum vt author maximus ex bibliotheca romanae eccleſiae quae fida ſemper cuſtos fuit exemplarium optimorum deprompti g • aeciam fuerunt aſportati quos p • iùs pauci graeci nouerant latini vix vlli delrio cap 8 ſo vnlearned ſay ignorant vncapable matter contained worke anſwer take better preuarication betraying cauſe would rather imitate negligence orator ſpeaketh like caſe ancient obſcure violent diligence theſe new deuiſers eſpecially ſeeing ſeeke delude reader fained teſtimonies rainolds noteth coniectures ſome romaniſts obiect gregory nazianzene origen athanaſius hee anſwereth▪ gregory nazianzene doth praiſe certaine author nameth none witneſſe origen alſo forged becauſe origen maketh mention arians manichee ariſe neare 200 yeares ancient origen rainolds conference hart pag 417 may added teſtimony sixtus senenſis concerning athanaſius gregory nazianzene origen liber vnus continens quaeſtiones 162 athanaſio tribuitur qui tamen athanaſij non videtur suſpicor hunc ex varij • fratrum ſcriptis collectum à ſtudioſo quopiam qui quaeſtione quarta theologiam myſticam dionyſij allegat athanaſij ſeculo priuſquam dimidium operis confeciſſet ac guſtum attentius cepiſſet ingenuè coram auditorio faſſus eſt verſo calculo ſibi non videri id opus dionyſij areopagitae fuiſſe eraſmus annot act 17 although firſt noted euery one impudencie ſhould dare denie proper writing dionyſius areopagita yet halfe finiſhed lecture confeſſed ingenuouſly auditorie thought work learned dionyſius leaue theſe time death rehnquentes no eloquia domini moſen reliquos prophetas qui veritatem pra con •• uerunt credere oportet nihil ſanum dicentibus inſtabilia autem delirantibus dicant nobis quae ſit rerum inuiſibilium natura ena • • numerum angelorū ordinē archangelorum demonſtrent thronorum sacramenta doceant diuerſit • • dominationum principat • um poteſtatum atque virtutum sed non habetis dicere irenaus lib 2 cap 55 irenaus accounteth matter dotage vndertake manifeſtation nature thing inuiſible number angel order arc • angel diuerſities domination power vertues kind preſumption auguſtine enchirid ad laurent cap 58 confeſſeth knoweth ſuch myſteries ſaying dicant qui poſlunt ſi modò probare poſſunt quod dicunt auguſtine ſeemeth note ſaith ſuch ſpeculators let tell ſuch thing yet ſo able proue tell 7 yet iudgement ſeeme fully controllable let conſult owne learned ieſuite ribera informe multieam ſententiam concerning office seraphins vnius authoritate dionyſij lequuntur verùm grauiſſimi patres graeci latini cum ſequi noluerunt—gregorius papa dionyſij authoritate noluit acquieſcere ne fortè ſacrae scripturae verbis videretur aduerſari ſi rem tam abſtrutam ratione noſtra meti • velimus ſaepè multumue aber • abimus si • utem principatus dicuntur quia c—quòd verò quidam exiſtimant dionyſium haec à paulo apoſtolo accepiſle nec ipſe vnquam dixit non taciturust antum authorem tam ſubti • obſcurà nec ipſi probant imò ità ſaepè loquuntur vt non certa ſed probabilia dicere ſe facilè iudicent ribera ieſ com heb 1 num 99 c albeit many carried opinion dionyſius doctrine namely concerning office seraphins yet ſaith many moſt graue father greek latin would accord vnto yea gregorie would rest herein leſt ſo might ſeeme diſſent holy scripture name angel ſaith dionyſius learned paul would haue concealed concludeth thereof matter doubtfull coniecturall truſt apologiſts hold v excuſable herein chooſe rather ſcholers gregorie beleeuing teſtimonies dionyſius fu • ther agree scripture praier dead liturg • e deliuereth expoundeth afterward ſupplication rather interpretation mercy god already performed vpon partie departed fulke annot 2 theſſ 2 pag 667 therefore apologiſts inſert without author see alſo proued aboue chap 8 sect 2 ſupplication receiue mercie interpretation acknowledgement mercie receiued 9 doubtleſſe either need prayer dead deliuered torment elſe power prayer aduance bliſſe bene taught dionyſius cardinall bellarmine bellarm lib 4 de verbo dei cap 7 laboureth authorize author citeth often cauſe permit would haue see whole diſpute de purgatorio doth pretermitted ſo neceſſarie witneſſe caſe 10 beſides place obiected anſwer ſelfe true dionyſius deſcribing order chriſtian funeral ſaith biſhop miniſter doth accedens diuinus antiſtes ipſi mortuo ſanctè precatur atque poſt precationem cum ipſe ſalutat ordine omnes qui adſunt precibus quidem à diuinâ benignitate contēdit vt omnia peccata quae humana fragilitate commiſſa ſunt ei qui exceſſit è vita remittat eum regionem viuorum educat—verùm fortaſſè dice cur id petat antiſtes—hoc ſtatuo cum ſcriptis diuinis sanctorum preces hac vita perutiles eſſe ſi quis bene animo conſtitutus adeat sanctum aliquem petat vt adiuuet—negligēte diuina humanitate pro benignitate ſua macula quas humana fragilitas contraxit anſwering queſtion—haec antiſtes ſcit promiſſa eſſe à ſcriptis diuinis quae vera ſunt petit autem vt ea eueniant dentur ijs qui rectè vixerunt ſancta praemia ita tamen vt ad dei imitationem bonitatis ſimilitudine formetur aliorum ue dona vt ſua beneficia poſcat vera promiſſa ſciat futura eiſque qui adſunt quaſi interpres exponat ea quae ipſe ex ſancto inſtituto repetat planè euentura eſſe ijs qui diuina vita hinc migrauerint paulò poſt—petit antiſtes quae à deo promiſſa ſunt planè concedenda quo animi ſui conſtitutionem quae bonitatis diuinae ſpeciem prae ſe fert deo cui boni chari ſunt declarat eis qui adſunt vt interpres munera bona quae ſanctis euentura ſunt exponit dionyſius areopag eccleſ hierarch § haec quidem pray remiſsion vnto dead eſcapes committed onely humane frailtie becauſe taught euery holy faithfull ſeruant god immediatly attaine vnto ioyes heauen moueth queſtion doth miniſter pray god helpe vſe ſuch prayer reſolution hereof firſt ſheweth god mercy doth according promiſe gracious bountie pardon ſuch infirmity end concludeth manner prayer miniſter doth nothing elſe regard god expreſſe affection charity vnto deare god ſight faith auouching truth god promiſe declaring certainly accept ſoule departed reſpect men preſent doth expound vnto certaintie hope may rather called proteſtation ſupplication circumſtances teſtimonie ſufficiently proue 11 may make queſtion queſtionleſſe obſerue dionyſius ſame contemplation doth according vnto scripture range ſoules departed two company wicked godly theſe later doth profeſſe qui verò ſancti vixerunt—dei vera certaque ſpe promiſſa dei ſpectantes diuinae laetitiae pleni ad mortis extremum tanquam ad finem certaminum proficiſcuntur—verùm deus prohibeat ne quis ſanctus vir huiuſmodi errores incidat ſed ſciant ſe totos iucundam gratam que requiem eſſe adepturos— diuina voluptate complentur propterea quòd mutationem peius iam non timeant ſed aeternorum bonorum quae adepti ſunt certò ſciant aeternam iam ſibi fore poſſeſſionem—propinqui eius qui mortuus eſt pro iure propinquitatis morum ſimilitudine beatum cum dicunt quòd ad victoriae finem peroptatò peruenerit victoriae authori gratias cum cantu agunt propterea ſibi ſimilem requiem optant dionyſ eccleſ hierarch perionio interprete § haec quidem compare theſe hath bene deliuered dionyſius aboue cap 8 § 2 dying filled diuine comfort aſſured certaine hope yeeld vp ghoſts ſhall fall worſe ſtate poſſeſſe eternall proper true sacrament romiſh doctrine coſterus hath defined ſaying sacramentum eſt diuinae inuiſibilis gratiae externum ſignum viſibile à chriſto inſtitutum vt per id quiſque dei gratiam accipiat atque ſanctificationem vi ipſius ſacramenti c • ſterus ieſ enchirid outward viſible ſigne ſome diuine inuiſible grace vertue sacrament receiuer obtaineth grace ſanctification number kind sacrament preiudice concluſion heare therefore romiſh number ſeuen proper sacrament abated confeſsion learned aduerſaries sect 5 19 let v remember ſpeake sacrament haue queſtion firſt talke sacrament properly require haue inſtitution chriſt power conferring ſanctifying grace vpon euery rightly conſtituted prepared receiuer kind haue propounded fully onely ſeuen beleeued vnder danger anathema curſe vpon euery ſoule ſhall except againſt one 20 let giue v leaue beleeue owne author ſhal eaſily manifeſt profeſſion concerning nū ber sacrament held catholicke church rome vntill thouſand yeares chriſt non temerè quemquam repeties ante petrum lombardum qui certū aliquem ac definitum numerū sacramentorum ſtatuerat et de ſeptem non omnes quidem scholaſtici • què propriè sacramenta vocabāt caſſander conſult▪ art 13 vntill day peter lombard liued yeare 1151 ſhal ſcarce find author ſaith caſſander ſet downe certaine definite number sacrament neither schoolemen call thoſe ſeuen proper sacrament may trie truth generall aſſertion three particular inſtances 21 firſt two ancient schoole wit confirmationem non eſſe à chriſto inſtitutam falſa opinio ſuit poſt eccleſiae declarationes planè eſt haeretica—alenſem eodē tempore refutauit albertus magous thomas greg valē ieſ de num sacr cap 3 § verum alenſis holcottus negat confirmationem eſſe propriè sacramentum caſſander quo ſupra holcot licenced time see aboue § 3 denie confirmation christ institution know councell trent hath truly defined onely christ inſtitute proper sacrament 22 secondy matrimonie numbred among ſeuen coūcel si quis dixerit c conc trid seſſ 24 1 trent hath diſcerned properly sacramēt inſtituted chriſt conferring grace neuertheleſſe profound doctor ex noſtris catholicis vnus eſt durandus qui matrimonium sacramentum non niſi aequiuocè dici poſſe diſputat bellar lib 1 de sacram cap 5 § quae etiam durand cardinall bellarmine teſtifieth iudged properly sacrament chiefe maſter romiſh schoole taught de matrimonio non modò petrus lombardus negauit eo conferri gratiam ſed longè poſt cum durandus diſert▪ inquit non eſſe matrimonium vniuocè sacramentum ſicut alia nouae legis sacramenta nam nec conferre gratiam non habenti non eſſe itaque propriè ſtrictè dictum sacramentum 4 diſt 26 q 3 caſſander conſult art 13 hath vertue conferring grace omit particular giue inſtance fundamentall ſtay aduerſaries faith 23 thirdly therfore extreme vnction queſtioned tridēt decree doth faſten curſe vpō euery one si quis dixerit extremam vnctionem non eſſe propriè sacramentum à chriſto inſtitutum à b iacobo cap 5 promulgatum anathema ſit conc trid seſſ 14 ſhal denie properly sacrament inſtituted christ beleeue inſtituted chriſt si non fuiſſet à chriſto inſtitutum ex hoc lequeretur non eſſe verum sacramentum suarez ieſ tom 4 diſp 39 sect 2 num 1 see coſterus aboue sect 3 becauſe ſay ordained chriſt cannot accounted properly sacrament profeſſe ſay sacramentum hoc fuiſſe à chriſto inſtitutūm ſemper fuit communior opinio scholaſticorum nunc eſt de fide definita conc trid seſſ 14 1 particulari de hoc sacramento gener seſſ 7 1 nam omnia sacramenta nouae legis ſunt à chriſto inſtituta suarez tom 4 diſp 39 sect 2 according vnto common opinion diuines late definition foreſaid councell trent notwithſtanding confeſſe ancient schoole cardinall hugo de ſancto victore excellency iudgement see catalogue author theſe bookes haue called auguſtine age peter lombard ſirnamed see catalogue author theſe bookes maſter schooles bonauenture exquiſite iudgement intituled see catalogue author theſe bookes seraphicalll doctor together alenſis altiſiodorus ſingular schoolman time theſe nonnulli negârunt hoc sacramentum fuiſſe á chriſto inſtitutum ex quo planè ſequebatur non eſſe verum sacramentum ipſi verò conſequens non admittunt qui putant poſſe eſſe sacramentum ab apoſtolis inſtitutum ita verò ſenſit hugo de ſancto victore lib 2 de sacram ca 2 quem ſecutus eſt magiſter 4 diſt 23 bonauentura ibid art 2 alenſis qaaeſt 8 membro 2 altiſiodorus l 4 sum tráct 7 cap 1 suarez quo ſupr thinke extreme vnction haue bene inſtituted christ conſequently although vnwittingly haue denied sacrament ſaith ieſuite suarez 24 neceſſarie therefore according definition laſt councell proue inſtitution thereof chriſt may preſumed right perfect sacrament firſt place scripture produce mark 6 13 apoſtles ſaid haue annointed many ſick healed place ieſuit et vngebant multos oleo ſanabant marc 6 13 vbi sacramentū éſt ſi hic non eſt enimuerò qui hîc de sacramento extremae vncti oni agi negat ad tollendum hoc sacramentum aut malignè ſi haereticus aut impudenter ſi catholicus eſt gradum facit maldon ieſ com marc 6 maldonate ſo confidently teacheth proue sacrament extreme vnction dare aske proued text alſo opinion hoc teſtimonio vtuntur ad hoc dogma comprobandum waldenſis tom 2 de sacram cap 163 caſtro contra haereſes verbo extrem vnct petrus à soto lect 1 de hoc sacram suarez ieſ tom 4 diſp 39 waldenſis alphonſus à caſtro soto defence ſame nunc autem non • ullos ex authoribus noſtris haereticorum caſtris recognoſcens timeo ne dum haereticos tela conijcio aliqu • fortè c • tholicum fe •• mitto illos paulò vetuſtiores quos prohibet reuerentia nominare quoſque ta nondum noua • experta haere • e excu • quid attinebat vigente iam lutheranorum haereſi catholicos doctoſue vi • o dice • e ſcriptiſu • 〈◊〉 dare—non hic de sacramento extremae vnctionis agi maldon ieſ com marc 6 13 maldonate ſaith oppugned diſclaimed diuerſe catholicks ſince doctrine proteſtants forbeareth ſmite leſt ſaith might hit owne fellowes among may reckon cardinall illud oleum marc 6 non erat hoc sacramentum extremae vnctionis quia apoſtoli hoc vtebantur illa vnctione aut ſolùm aut praecipuè ad curationem morbi corporalis bellar lib 1 de extrem vnct cap 2 nihilominus verius cenſeo illam vnctionem quá marc 6 vtebantur apoſtoli non • u • ſſe verum sacramentum extremae vnctionis proueth many argument suarez ieſ tom • diſp 39 § 1 n • 4 bellarmine ieſuite suarez ſay proue oyle ſpoken euangeliſt marke sacrament extreme vnction confirming iudgement conc trident expendens locum marci dicit sacramentum hoc ibi inſinuatum non • uiſle vt intelligamus etiam ex mente concilij non eſſe pa • em vim horum teſtimoniorum iac 5 marc 6 immeritóque citatos authores illa aequiparate suarez ieſ tom 4 diſp 30 § 1 num 9 councell trent call theſe see lit impudent 25 next place iames chap 5 wherein whoſoeuer ſhall confeſſe sacrament extreme vnction publiſhed ſame see aboue letter g councell made obnoxious ſubiect vnto curſe anathema yet councell learned ex hoc loco nec e • • bi nec ex effectibus colligitur extremum vnctio illa miraculoſa▪ quam chriſtus inſtituit ſanaudis aeg • otis—nam textus promi • tit alleuationem infirmi de remiſſione peccatorum non niſi conditionaliter loquitur vnctio extremum non niſi mortis articulo adhibetur directè tendit ad remiſſionem peccatorum c caiet iac 5 cardinall doubted publiſh bookes sacrament extreme vnction cannot proued text either word effect vnction properly concerne healing bodily diſeaſes may confirmed olim haec vnctio non vt hod • è ferè fit ad extremum vſque vitae periculum valetudinem iam deploratam differebatur—a little olim—haec forma verborum adhiberi ſolet vngo te oleo ſancto c obſecrās fugatis omnibus doloribus incommoditatibus corporis tui recuperetur te virtu ſalus quatenùs per huiuſmodi operationem myſterij—priſtinam ſanitate • recipere mereare ex qua forma conſtat hanc vnctionem non modò ad remiſſionem peccatorum animi corroborationem ſed etiam ad morbi corporalis leuationem pertinere id quod forma benedictionis olei ambroſiana romana ſignificat qua inter caetera oratur vt proſit febribus paralyticis c caſſander conſult art 22 corporall cure antiquitie • euardentius com iac 5 deliuereth many example tertull ad 5 cap hieron vita hilar conſtitutions clemens pope rome confeſſed practiſe antiquity appeareth forme neceſſarie ſhew may faith hermes booke apologiſts contend proue haue bene church canonicall yet leaſt eccleſiaſticall authority hath bene ought eſtimation hereof apologiſts might haue learned iudgement scultetus proteſtants alledged account libri vt venuſti ita fabuloſi ſunt c scultetus place cited apologiſts fine fabulous yet cenſure owne beſt approued doctor 2 firſt sixtus senenſis examining credit booke hermes aliâs paſtor ſaith hoc opus olim publicè quibuſdam graeciae eccleſijs legebatur ad inſtitutionem eorum qui primis ad fidei inſtitut inſtruebantur clementis multiue veteres patres eius teſtimonijs ad dogmatum confirmationem vſi ſunt poſt quo • um tempora authoritas huius libri paulatim defecit à gelaſio demum inter scripturas dubiae fidei reiecta eſt vt arbitror ad haereticorum ſubuerſionem qui inde execrabilium dogmatum praeſidia aſſumebant sixtus senenſis bibl lib 2 tit hermes authority hereof decayed accounted pope gelaſius among author ſuſpected credit gelaſius thinke ſaith senenſis ſubuerſion thoſe hereticks booke gather ſtrength maintenance execrable opinion 3 secondly cardinall liber herm ſeu hermetis qui inſcriptus eſt paſtor quibu • dam antiquis optimè notus ac probatus fuit—nouit eum atque frequenter citat origenes qui tam • n eum à nonnullis contemni tradit vt planè appareat hand integram ſolidamue fidem apud omnes meruiſſe n 4 quod autem ad latino pertinet ſic eis liber innotuit vt tamen eum ipſi inter eorum apocryphorum genus adnumerarint quae legi eccleſia poſſint non tamen citari deb • ad fidem catholicam aſtruendam hac enim cenſura à maioribus fuiſſe notatum tertullianus affirmat ipſe autem poſteà ipſum reſpuit quòd reciperet moechi poenitentiam contra pleudoparacleti doctrinam ait enim sed cred • rem tibi ſi scriptura paſtoris quae ſola moechos amat diuino inſt umento meruiſſet incidi ſi non ab omni concilio eccleſiarum etiam veſtrarum inter apocrypha falſa iudicaretur adultera ipſa indè patrona ſociorum haec tertullianus planè ſignificans paſtorem librum extra claſlem diuinorum librorum eſſe reiectū quòd plus aequo quidam illi fauiſſent—de codem agens ruffinus haec ait haec legi quidem eccleſijs voluerunt non tamen proferri ad authoritatem ex fidei confirmandam haec ruffinus eadem quoque ratione idem liber ſancto proſpe • aduerſus collatorem agente qui eius authoritate errorem ſuum tueri conatus fuit nullius planè authoritatis eſt iudicatus sed gelaſio aequè inter apocrypha recenſetur vſos eo quoque fuiſſe arianos ad ſuam haereſin confirmandam teſtatur athanaſius c cardinalis baronius anno chriſti 159 num 5 6 baronius ſaith ſame booke origen indeed cited confeſſeth alſo contemned ſome time latine father reckoned number thoſe apocryphall bookes read inſtructions maners confirmation matter faith tertullian afterwards abhorre calling adulterous proſper diſpute one thereby would haue confirmed error eſteeme authority arrian hereticks witneſſeth athanaſius confirme hereſies 4 third witneſſe cardinal vox apocryphus graeca eſt rem occultam reconditam ſignificat—porrò eccleſiaſtici ſcriptores non ſemper hanc vocem eodem modo vſurpant interdum vocant apocrypha ſcripturas ea quas non eſt certum ſint • anonicae diuinae etiamfi ſatis conſtet nullos ijs errores inueniri ſic hieronymus galeato c interdum vocant apocryphos eos libros qui errores admixtos habent ſic vtitur hae voce origen hieron auguſt quam ſignificationem ſequutus gelaſius decreto de libtis eccleſiaſticis eos libros vocat apocryphos qui ſunt editi ab authoribus haereticis vel certè ſuſpectis—nec minus apocryphus cenſendus eſt liber hermetis qui inſcribitur paſtor tametſi enim eum diuinitus inſpiratum putauerit origenes ex eo teſtimonia proferant tertull alij tamen diſertis verbis eum à canone reijcit gelaſius decreto de libris eccleſiaſticis bellar lib 1 de verbo dei cap 20 § igitur vox § nec minus librum hermetis qui inſ •• bitur paſtor diſertis ver bi à canone reijcit gelaſius— athanaſius— idem etiam athanaſius libro de decretis nicaenae synodi theodoretus arianos qui ex hoc libro teſtimonia petebant dicunt ex libro non canonico teſtimonia petijſ • e bellar lib 1 de verbo dei cap 20 bellarmine teſtifieth whereas word apocrypha hath double ſence either ſignify book fully diuine canonicall albeit contained error elſe ſuch bookes wherein admixture error ſence gelaſius decree cōcerning book eccleſiaſtical call book apocryphall author whereof either iudged haue bene heretiks leaſt ſuſpected among nūbreth hermes decree ſelfe made quae ab haereticis ſiue ſchiſmaticis conſcripta vel praedicata ſunt nulla tenu • r • cipit eccleſia catholica romana nam è quibus pauca quae ad memoriam venerunt quae à catholicis vitāda ſunt credimus eſſe ſubdenda imprimis c—item libet paſtoris apocryphus libri omnes quos fecit lenticius diſcipulus diabolt apocryphi c gelaſius concludeth decree concerning theſe bookes thus haec omnia ſimilia c non ſolum repudiata verumetiam ab omni romana eccleſia eliminata que cum ſuis authoribus ſequacibus cum anathematis indiſſolubili vinculo confitemur eſſe damnata gelaſius papa apud gratian diſt 15 cap 3 gelaſius againſt doth fully diſcouer end concluding thus ſuch like confeſſe refuſed romane church alſo cast abandoned finally author allowers vnſeparable curſe anathema vtterly condemned 5 thus ſee farre theſe apologiſts haue bene tranſported preiudice nource errours might draw proteſtants ſuſpition contumacy reiecting authority author intituled hermes paſtor haue honoured opinion paul ſcholer haue approued authority leaſt eccleſiaſticall neuer regarding either exact iudgement proteſtants refuſing elſe confeſſions owne moſt authorized doctor commending wiſdome ſome ancient haue contemned falſe adulterous notwithſtanding neuertheleſſe bookes hermes put bibliotheke holy father particular found ſo much greateſt bellarmine theſe ſeuerall controuerſies ſeeketh proue theſe particular freewill c although cite dionyſius areopagita votum continentiae yet authoritie hermes pretermitteth theſe queſtions aduerſary would haue euery part poperie ſeeme moſt abſolute yet hath confirmed almoſt one point teſtimonie hermes epiſtle ad ianuarium deliuereth rule concerning onely rite ceremony church whereof ſome vſed vniuerſally chriſtian church namely ſolemne yearly celebration day chriſts paſsion reſurrection aſcenſion c kind cuſtome giueth axiome illa autem quae non ſcripta ſunt ſed tradita cuſtodimus quae quidem toto terrarum orbe obſeruantur dantur intelligi vel ab ipſis apoſtolis vel plenarijs concilijs quorum eſt eccleſia celebetrima authoritas commendata atque ſtatuta retineri ſicut quòd dominici paſſio reſurrectio aſcenſio coelum aduentus de coelo spiritus ſancti anniuerſaria ſolennitate celebrantur ſi quid aliud quod ſeruatur ab vniuerſa quacunque ſe diffundit eccleſia auguſt epiſt 118 ad ianuar cap 1 paulò poſt cap 5 similiter enamſi quod horum tota per orbem frequentat eccleſia nam hoc quin ita faciendum ſit inſolentiſſimae eſt inſaniae ibidem whatſoeuer written deliuered tradition obſerued church throughout world vnderſtood haue bene ordained either apoſtles elſe generall councels moſt renowmed authoritie church 3 beſides theſe vniuerſall tradition alia verò quae per loca terrarum regioneſue variantur ſicuti eſt quòd alij ieiunant sabbato alij verò non alij quotidiè communicant corpori dominico alij certis diebus accipiunt—totum hoc genus liberas habet obſeruationes nec vlla alia diſciplina melior eſt graui prudentiue chriſtiano quàm vt eo modo agar quo agere viderit eccleſiam ad quamcunque deuenerit quod enim neque contra fidem neque contra bonos more iniungitur indifferenter eſt habendum pro eorum inter quos viuitur ſocietate eſt ſeruandum—ambroſius reſpondet cùm inquit romam venio ieiuno sabbato▪ cùm bic ſum non ieiuno ſic tu ad quamcunque fortè eccleſiam veneris eius mor • ſerua ſi cuiquam non vi eſſe ſcandalo nec quenquam tibi ibid cap 2 cuſtomes ceremony ſaith particularly obſerued ſome particular country ſomewhere faſt sabboth otherwhere otherwiſe concerning theſe hath another rule wit whenſoeuer man ſhall come particular church country cuſtome ceremonie enioyned contrarie either vnto ſaith good manner ought wiſdome obſerue rite vſed thereby auoid double ſcandall himſelfe vnto others others vnto himſelfe theſe golden rule auguſtine preſcribeth chriſtian man direction caſe ceremony firſt theſe rule apologiſts haue choſen oppoſe againſt v let v repeate argument archbiſhop whitgiſt hath vſed vrged taken augustine rule sect 3 4 apolog foraſmuch ſaith originall beginning theſe name metropolitane archbiſhop c ſuch antiquitie cannot found ſo farre haue read ſuppoſed haue originall apostle themſelues 5 ſhall need diſpute applied vnto rule theſe church concluſions ſo farre beleeued depend vpon authenticall premiſſes euen ſacred scripture haue proued auguſtine father perfect treaſurie fundamentall principle faith 6 secondly depth ſame poſition rightly ſounded found truth b whitgift others ſtrong probability onely abſolute infallibility may ſeeme intimated word ſuppoſed vſed learned archbiſhop alſo confeſſion ieſuits grant name metropolitane archbiſhop apoſtolicall apoſtolicae traditiones ſunt quadrag • ſimae ieiunium c—eccleſiaſticae traditiones ſunt more conſuetudines quas obſerua eccleſia nimirùm illa conſecrat altaria—diſtinxit epiſcopos archiepiſcopos primate metropolitanos patriarchas conſtitutiones ſancit azorius ieſ inſtit moral part 1 lib 8 cap 4 quod verò quaeſitum eſt cur non meminit petrus hierarchiae eccleſiaſticae quae tot habet gradus epiſcoporum archiepiſcoporum patriarcharum c hoc ideo factum eſt quia inſtitutione eccleſiaſtica canonica conſtat ſi autem hic enumerarentur poſſent hinc putari iuris diuini exiſtere quod falſum eſſet enamſi legimus apud clementem epiſtola ad iacobum aut apud anacletum epiſtola domini iuſſu mandato gradus illosfuiſſe inſtitutos illi gradus enumerati nihil aliud ſunt quàm epiſcopatus qui maiorem aut minorem habent iuriſdictionem non autem maiorem poteſtatem ordinis salmeron ieſ com 1 pet 5 diſp 8 § quòd verò cardinall cuſanus doth ſpecifie original vbi erat metropolis ciuitas metropolitani erant qui de tribus aut quatuor ciuitatibus intra illam prouinciam qui matri prouinciarum praeſidehant vnde iſti aliquando metropolitani aliquando archiepiſcopi nomniantur vbi minores ciuitates habuerunt tantùm flamen vel comites epiſcopi ſunt conſtituti c cuſanus de con •• cathol lib 1 cap 7 eccleſiaſticall tradition howſoeuer collection found altogether importable either cartwright apologiſts haue deduced firſt manifeſt inference made cartwright vpon former argument infirme sect 4 7 rule ſaith window opened bring popery euidence inference aduentureth appeale vnto iudgement men herein hath bewraied double defect iudgement himſelfe rule auguſtine implieth onely matter ceremoniall eccleſiaſticall conſtitutions enforce popery ſtandeth vpon many doctrinall point faith leſſe errour true ſcholerſhip particular propoſition inferre vniuerſall concluſion see hereafter new romiſh inuentions fully diſcouered whereas indeed contrariwiſe graue iudicious archbiſhop hath well truly replied archb whitgift place alledged apolog rule auguſtine ſo farre authorizing poperie rather quite ouerthroweth ſame confuted supremacy pope ouer church hath neither ben alwaies place hath bene alſo proued see aboue cap 18 may confirmed onely matter eccleſiaſticall rite order euen queſtions concerne ſoule religion 8 held ſufficient ſpeaking poperie ſtrike onely head thereof inſtancing primacie pope ſo true auguſtine himſelfe author rule may iuſtifier application caſe appiarius wicked prieſt excommunicated owne biſhops ſought ſacrarū script coū cell obiected denying appeales vnto rome preferreth authoritie prouinciall councell authority biſhop rome councell carthage conſisting cranzius 214 biſhops among augustine one withſtand appeales africke vnto see rome preferring iudgement prouinciall synode command iuriſdiction pope could papal primacy head popery receiue deeper wound wherof may iudge better plaiſter cardinall bellarmine hath prepared way anſwer ſatisfaction niſi fortè ſaith councell quiſquam eſt qui credat vnicuilibet deū poſſe examinis inſpir iuſtitiam innumerabilibus congregatis concilium sacerdotibus denegare reſpondeo—non neceſſariò tenemur credere quidquid ea epiſtola epiſcopi illi dicant praeſertim cum ſatis appareat co commotos ſceleribus appiarij qui ad rom pontificem confugerat modum verbis non nihil exceſſiſſe bellarm lib 4 de rom pont cap 7 § quarta ratio c anſwer ſaith bound beleene whatſoeuer biſhops councell writ epiſtle eſpecially knowing much moued miſchiefes wrought intent ſtand herein thrice reproucable may worthily exemplifie parable sauiour goſpell vnwiſe man ſaid build whole houſe vpon matth 7 26 ſands end apologiſts obiections anſwers concerning iudgement prouidentiâ papae quarti ſuper forma iuramenti profeſſionis fidei pius epiſcopus sernus ſeruorum dei ad perpetuam rei memoriam cùm iuxta tridentini concilij diſpoſitionem omnes quos deinceps cathedralibus ſuperioribus eccleſijs praefici vel quibus de earum dignitatibus canonicatibus alijs quibuſcunque beneficijs eccleſiaſticis curam animarum habentibus prouideri continget publicam orthodoxae fidei profeſſionem facere ſeue romanae eccleſiae obedientiâ permanſuros ſpondere iurare teneantur no volentes vt etiam per quoſcunque quibus de monaſterijs conuentibus domibus alijs quibuſcunque locis regularium quorumcunque ordinū etiam militiarū quocunque nomine vel titulo prouidebitur idem ſeruari iuxta hanc non aliam formam profeſſionem praedictam ſolenniter fieri king circumgeſtation euchariſt proceſſion contrarie practiſe ancient church end anſwereth non obſtat quòd circumgeſtatio euchariſtiae videtur re noua quia valet ad deuotionem excitandam ſed chriſtus aiunt aduerſarij hoc sacramento cibus eſt vt ſumatur non vt oſten tetur circumferatur sed non ſunt audiendi qui circa dei sacramentorū cultum omnia reduci volunt ad vetuſtū morem • ō enim ſemper • § et primum § nec poteſt celeberrima pariſiorum acaden •• nullus magiſtri theologia titulo dignus habetur qui priùs iuriſiurandi religione non ſe adſtrinxe • ad hoc virginis priu • iegium tuendum propugnandum ibid diſp 51 § deinde illis ſay doth ſomewhat concerne faith receiued church approued pope grace indulgence vnto embraced confirmed reuelations miracle priuiledge virgine although thomas aquinas denied derogatory dignitie chriſt becauſe hereby ſhe equalled yet take degree profeſsion diuinitie vniuerſity paris firſt ſweare defend prerogatiue bleſſed virgine ſtrong ſtrange antipathie 11 againe ieſuite salmeron doth anſwer ſaying argumenta petunt ex eo quòd non ſit veriſim •• vt ſui deuoti amici familiari religione diuam virginem complectentes vt bernardus bonauentura thomas alij h ••• cius piaerogatiuam ignorauerint—reſpondemus imprimis totam deuotionem • rga dei genitricem non conſiſtere 〈◊〉 bernardo bonauentura alijs patribus multos habuit illa adhuc habet ſibi magi quàm mundo notos quibus haec noſtra ſententia magi placet quàm contraria salmeron ibid § secundò deuotion e sancti namque omnes qui eius rer mentionem incidêre vno ore aſſe • erârunt beatam virginem peccato mortali conceptam fuiſſe—infirmum tamen ex omnium authoritate argumētumd▪ citur—en argumentum achillicum quo eraſmus omnium patrum teſtimonio non le exiſtimat obruendum canu • l •• theol lib 7 cap 1 anſwereth cap 3 hanc quaeſtionem minimè ad ſidem pertinere—non mihi fateor ingenuè 〈◊〉 via patu • ad eraſmi argumentum eludendum yet next word contradicting himſelfe would make father 〈◊〉 held opinion notwithſtanding ieſuite salme ron reporting iudgement ſome romaniſts ſaith quidam illore • computant ducentos patres alij vt bandellus 300 caietanus quindecim illos quidem vt ait irrefragabiles salmeron ieſ rom 5 diſp 51 princip belonging vnto honour virgine mother lord doth conſist bernard bonauenture thomas father end concludeth tertiò argumenta petunt à doctorum antiquitate cui ſemper maior honor eſt habitus quàm nouitatibus • pondet • r quamlibet aetatē antiquitati ſemper multū detuliſſe quilibet ſen • x vt quidam poeta dixit laudator tempori • acti sed illud aſſerimus quò iuniores eò perſpicaciores eſſe doctores salmeron ibidem § tertiò yonger diuines apprehenſiue truth ancient doctor cenſure thinke could paſſe eſpecially matter generally profeſſed church worthy opinion approbation pope confirmation reuelations miracle ratification oath without kind checke ſcorne reuerend antiquitie 12 fourthly another queſtion neceſſarie moment conuenit internos aduerſarios praecepta leuitica non obligare chriſtianos quatenus ſunt propriè leuitica—ſed quatenus naturalia sed tota controuerſia eſt omnia illa praecepta quae habentur leuitico de gradibus cognationis ſint naturalia verò aliqua vel omnia iudicialia aduerſarij omnia naturalia eſſe volunt propterei indiſpenſabilia no contrà bellarm lib 1 de matrimon cap 27 initio cap whether leuiticall law concerning degree forbidden marriage belong vnto chriſtians whereby proteſtants authoritie ancient father proue church rome patroneſſe inceſt diſpenſing marriage prohibited god another aduerſarie licenced anſwer thus maneat ſanè patribus ſuus honos ſua • eſtas ſint vt merentur ſumma veneratione ac pretio—inſuper audeo dicere recentiores multis locis patribus preſſiores excuſſiores diligentiores vigilantiores èſſe apologia tumultuaria pro diſpe • ſatione matrimonij regis henr 8 cum vxore fratris ſui defuncti § poſtre • ò illud reſeruation ſaith due honour vnto ancient father yonger diuines many place vigilant iudicious meaning diſce • ning ſence scripture thoſe ancient theſe kinde anſwers bewray aduerſaries diſpoſitions manifeſt third obſeruation romaniſts ſometime contradict interpretation father ſo much direction reaſon distraction affection sect 3 13 affection diſtorted whenſoeuer partially tranſported whether vpon good ſiniſter intent kind aduerſaries diſcouer themſelues one profeſſing fault interprete scripture beyond meaning bernardum putant aliqui ſacras scripturas promptè magi atque inexpeditò ſaepenumero quàm appoſite citare nulla quidem impietate aut scripturarum iniuriâ non enim poteſt honeſta ad pietatem docendi aliqua eſſe inhoneſta ratio tumult apologia fol 34 § primum igitur bewraieth owne intent caſe queſtion wrongeth bernard others ſo long done confirme godlineſſe iudge profane licentious doctrine becauſe impoſſible scripture god truth ſhould allow alying gloſſe example siculus andrae cognom • nto ba • batius—vt beſſarione antiſtite —cardinale gratiam iniret de eare commentariolum priùs edidit—occurrit inquit 1 reg cap 2 domini enim ſunt cardines terrae poſuit ſuper eos orbem quam authoritatem hoſtienſis doctor excelſus figurauit ad cardinales ſicut enim oſtium regitur cardine ita eccleſia romana regitur conſilio cardinalium haec ille— lawyer win fauour order cardinal alledged scripture 1 sam 2 8 godly woman praying vnto god ſaid pillar latine cardines earth lord hath ſet world vpon glozingly writ figured cardinal becauſe doore hinge cardine ſo romane church ruled cardinal kind expoſitors vnfitly compared vide non ſecus iſti iuri • conſulti aliquoties detorquent ſacras literas quò volunt vt ſutores ſordidis ſolent dentibus extendere pelles polydor virgil lib 4 cap 9 inuent rerum lugduni 1558 whoſe laſt ſentence commanded index expurg belg purged polydore ſo wreſt scripture euen shoomakers vſe ſtreth leather ſordid teeth ſhew one father thus dreamed cardinal 14 ſiniſter affection lieth open vnto reader profeſſe conſent vnto father intent may manifeſt greater diſſent doctrine proteſtants thus doth ieſuite maldonate demeane himſelfe propounding interpretation scripture whereof ſaith author nō nego huius interpretationis authorem neminem habere ſed hanc eò magi probo quàm illam alteram auguſtini caeterarum que alioqui probabiliſſimā quòd haec cum caluiniſtarum ſenſu magi pugnet quod mihi mag num eſt probabilitati • argumentum maldonat ieſ comm ioh 6 62 yet notwithſtanding ſaith approue expoſition rather augustine elſe others although probable becauſe doth moſt diſſent interpretation caluiniſts likewiſe cardinall bellarmine examining whether duae ſcripturae proferuntur vna ex cap 6 marci altera iac 5 de priore non omnes conueniunt cum apoſtoli vngebant olco infirmos curabant illa fuerit vnctio sacramentalis—an ſolùm adumbratio eius qui tuentur priorem ſent • ntiam vt tho waldenſis alphonſus à caſtro • ratione ducuntur quòd beda theoph oecumen cōmentarijs marci iacobi videantur dicere eſſe eandem vnctionem cuius fit mentio vtro que loco sed probabilior eſt ſententia ruardi • anſenij dominici à soto mibi etiam eo certè nomine gratior quòd video lutherum caluinum kemnitium priore opinione exiſtimant enim illi eandem vnctionem eſſe mare 6 iao 5 bellarm lib 1 de extrem vnct cap 2 initis ſame kind vnction ſignified mark 6 iac 5 point ſome ſpeciall conſequent refuſeth iudgement beda theophylact oecumenius preferreth opinion father euen three doctor owne profeſſion ſaith better welcome becauſe find luther caluine embrace opinion namely beda theophylact oecumenius vnto may adde v iudgement see aboue cardinall caietane 15 beſides late romaniſt doth boaſt himſelfe another columbus diſcouered new country ſo doth man glory finding new conſtructions manner quemadmodum chriſtophorus columbus—cum praeter omnem expectationem vaſto illo oceano nouum orbem aperuiſſet aurum rariores lapides terrae opulentae index hiſpaniam reduxit ſic ego—cum aliam scripturam tanquam terram nouam ſub hac vulgari trita iacentem deprae henderim—in veritatis argumentum lectiones quaſdā veluti—ſapientiae admirabilis atque incognitae gemma vobis exhibeo paulò poſt et ne quis praeiudicio ſuo indulgens vt huius rei veritatem eleuet totum hoc tanquam figmentū ingenio maeo imputet iam anticipata fidei meae ſponſione promitto quòd cam ſapientiae diuinae demonſtrationem hoc libro viſurus ſit quae ingenij humani adeoque intellectus creati operam excedat—deinde poſt si quis adhuc vel de rei magnitudine vel humilitate mea diffidens quaerat quomodo iam queat inueſtigari quod tot aetates clam fuit—quodſi deus vt potentiam ſuam teſtatam faciat eccleſiae catholicae ſeu quondam sarae ſeneſcenti intellectus vterum foecundet— nouam cupidinem homine boreali id eſt hebe • ad intelligentiae diuinae conceptum accenderit merito dixerit eccleſia riſum mihi fecit deus c guliem alabaſter anglus apparatu reuelat ieſu chriſti praef ad lectorē antuerp anno dom 1607 interpretation scripture aske could find hath lien hid ſo many age licenſed anſwer god ſhew power catholicke church ſhall make barren wombe oſ sara fruitfull old age may church ſay sara god hath cauſed laugh laugh true catholicks rather grieue perceiue man wit ſo ſeriouſly idle endeuour vnclaſpe whole booke reuelation analyticall indeed cabaliſticall manner expoſition hath ſelfe art intendeth ſhortly auouch truth romiſh church proue proteſtants doctrine antichriſtian 17 hereby hath moued pitie euen aduerſaries know affectation ſuch interpretation muſt redound vnto sacrum vetuſtatis authoritate profanae nouitatis cenſe remus audaciam vinc lyrinenſis prophanation ſacred word god abuſed old hereticks called gnoſticks valentinians euen like kind ſpeculations epiphan lib 1 aduerſus haereſ epiphanius obſerueth therefore may argument vnto reader man ſodainly gone ſunſhine darke houſe clearely ſaw leſſe ſee followeth fourth obſeruation cunning practized aduerſaries wronging testimony antiquitie sect 4 18 father make clearely againſt ſome poſſibly follow example allen sander difficultate oppreſſus alanus copus sanderus reſpō dent verba illa non eſſe epiphanij ſed ſuppoſititia—id quod cōmune frequens effugium eſſe ſolet ijs qui teſtimonijs conciliorum aut patrum aliqua controuerſia nimis premuntur—mihi verò haec reſponſio non placet—porrò verba illa recitata eſſe ipſius epiphanij nec ſuppoſititia inde conſtabit c—vaſquez ieſ lib 2 de adorat diſp 5 cap 3 num 140 141 owne ieſuite vaſquez witneſſeth oppreſſed difficulty anſwering ſaid word alledged father epiphanius counterfeit although indeed ſaith ſame ieſuite may appeare proueth good demonſtration certainly proper word father 19 eſcape preuented publike regiſters ſuch bookes councell ieſuite vaſquez hath giuen example recentiores aliqui pondere h ••• concilij elibertini quaſi oppreſſi tanquā optimum effugium elegerūt authoritatem concilij negate quòd prouinciale fuerit—nec à pontifice confirmatum—et ſanè ſi aliâ viâ concilio ſatisfieri non poſſit hoc nobis effugium ſufficiat vaſquez ieſ lib 2 de adorat diſp 5 cap 2 initio cap baronius tom 2 anno 305—exiſtimat hanc synodum legitimam fuiſſe binius de conc com 36 concilij elibert ſome late ſaith oppreſſed authority prouinciall councell eliberis condemned worſhip image held beſt refuge denie authoritie councell onely prouinciall confirmed pope doubtleſſe ſaith euaſion may ſerue turne better anſwer cannot found councell ancient euen 1300 yeares ago according vnto binius wherein conſent father definitiue ſentence gratiâ ab ijs qui omnia magnorum authorum ſcripta ſpurcis ſuis manibus contaminabant lodouicus viues lib 22 de ciuitate dei cap 8 pag 693 lugduni 1560 viues may ſeeme note owne men betake themſelues commodum eis ſenſum affingamus dum opponuntur diſputationibus index expurg belg veteres meant father appeareth gretzer quid piaculi fecit index cum—pro bertramo agens cam illi gratiam fieri cupit quae aduanceth ſufficiency ſacred scripture vnperfect worke hath long paſſed vnder name chryſoſtome ſo either may hereafter practiſe like tyranny againſt writing father eſpecially ſeeing challenge authority herein vpon pretence secundò dum prohibetur bertramus nego prohiberi patrem nam eccleſiae pater ille eſt qui ſalutari doctrinâ eccleſiam alit paſcit—ſi pro tritico lolium admiſcuerit eatenus non pater eſt ſed vitricus non doctor ſed ſeductor—quartò inſuetum non eſt vt veteres damnentur errores ſi nocendo fiant noui—exemplum habemu • gelaſio pontifice qui tertullianum origenem alios etſi valdè antiquos lege lata ex orthodoxorum manibus vſu excuſſ • ius hoc ſemper fuit penis eccleſiam—etſi integrum librum proſcribere fa eſt fa etiam erit proſcribere partem ſeu paruam ſeu magnam eum per totum merit sacrifice tranſubstantiation satisfaction romiſh doctrine wherein hath bene owne confeſſions proued haue giuen v ſhels ſtead kernel word father againſt meaning elſe aduerſaries ignorant ſome father ſometimes haue bypath regard romaniſts themſelues admoniſh reader oportet matura conſideratione expendere occaſiones non paucas ob quas priſci illi eccleſiarum magiſtri interdum à veritatis ſcopo aberrarunt primùm quia abſque praeuio ductore intentatum ante à iter aggreſſi ſunt—deindè cùm innumera penè pro temporum locorum ac perſonarum oportunitate dixerunt—in multiloquio non deeſt peccatum—praetere à dum ardebant veteres illi tanto ſincerae pietatis—ardore vt dum vnum errorem omni conatu deſtruere annituntur ſaepè alterum oppoſitum errorem vel deciderint vel decidiſſe videantur—porrò libris ſanctorum doctorum quos authenticè legit eccleſia nonnunquam inueniuntur quaedam praua vel haeretica senenſ biblioth lib 5 praefat pag 328 329 coloniae 1586 weigh foure occaſions whereby thoſe ancient maſters made ſometime miſſe aime erre truth adding thoſe book church doth reade authentical ſome thing found indeed falſe erroneous etſi ſacri patres multa praeclara omni fide digniſſima ſcripſerint quae meritò tribuenda ſunt spiritui ſancto qui illa eis ſuggeſſit ſunt tamen interdum nonnulla minùs certae conſtantis veritatis quaedam verò probabilia interdum grauiores lapſus de rebus quae eccleſia ſuo tempore definitae non erant ideo ad authoritatis pondus faſtigium quale obtinent scripturae non pertingunt ita vt biblia ſacra ſola digna ſint vt abſolutè demonstration romiſh faith proſecuted fully iodocus coccius late huge volume entituled theſaurus catholic • quo controuerſiae fidei— catholick treaſure controuerſies faith worke commended vnto world opus—omnibus verae fidei pietatis chriſtianae antiquitatis amantibus ſummè neceſſarium— eſpecially neceſſarie louers ancient chriſtian truth authorized cum priuilegio caeſareae maieſtatis coloniae 1599 priuiledge caeſar 2 argument iewiſh faith albeit ſeeme vnto ignorant call demonstration faith yet proue vnto iudicious demonſtration rather folly ariſing principle deluſion may euinced examination particular whereunto orderly proceed romish apologie example praier dead admitting booke macchabees true hiſtorie protestant appeale concerning canonical scripture old teſtament herein conuincing theſe apologiſts raſhneſſe church obſtinacie erring euen vniuerſall iudgement ancient iewes confeſsions learned aduerſaries sect 2 3 may remember challenge entituled catholicke apologie firſt allegation laſt point taken booke macchabees admitting ſay booke true hiſtorie implying onely true humane hiſtories diuine scripture authentically infallibly true like producing booke eccleſiaſticus ſaid see hereafter initio cap 4 apolog though ſhould time ſuppoſe canonicall scripture intimating moſt certainly canonicall hath bene decreed councell trent si quis librum heſter danielis baruch eccleſiaſtici sapientiae iudith tobiae duorum machabaeorum danielis libros integros cum omnibus ſuis partibus prout veteri vulgata latina editione habentur pro ſacris canonicis non ſuſceperit—anathema ſit conc trid seſſ 4 bookes macchabees eccleſiaſticus tobie iudith baruch wiſdome ſome apocryphall part heſter daniel impoſition curſe anathema vpon euerie one ſhall confeſſe theſe canonicall scripture proteſtants aduerſaries therefore condemne ſacrilegiouſly proteſtantes illud ipſum verbum quod ſolum reſtiterat exſectis è toto corpore tam multis partibus delumbarunt campianus ieſ rat 1 poſſeuin ieſ diuini verbi pag 26 bellarm lib 1 de verbo dei cap 7 ſeqq mayming rending aſunder word god 4 principall controuerſie concerneth integritie holy scripture principle faith wherein appeale vnto iudgement ancient hebrewes ij libri veteris teſtamenti—in canone hebraeorum non habentur coſterus ieſ enchirid cap 1 de ſacra scriptura § de numero librorum ſol ob 1 2 hij ſex libri ſimul omnes reijciuntur ab hebraeis vt b hieron teſtatur prologo galeato de • nde haebraeorum ſententiam ſequuntur haeretici proteſtantes huius temporis ferè omnes bellarm lib 1 de verbo dei cap 10 initio aduerſaries themſelues confeſſe reiect thoſe ſixe bookes canonicall excluded proteſtants yet prerogatiue iewes mentioned apoſtle rom 3 2 haue oracle god committed vnto ſaith cardinall id eſt oracula vſque ad vltimū vibis ſecundae excidium hierome acknowledged witneſſe ſaying thoſe tradition condemned chriſt 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſecond constitution bene taught rabbi sammai rabbi hillel whoſe ſchoole rabbi akibas rabbi mayer ioannan ſonne zachai eliezer ioſeph laſtly ioſue ſucceeded vntill laſt deſtruction ieruſalem whereunto e aquinas aſſenteth ſaying iewiſh thalmud ſo many edict pope hath bene condemned burned whereby iewes day moſt gouerned partly collected old maiſters iewes ſuch hillel akiba ioſeph others verified alſo cardinall reſpondeo chriſtum apoſtolos reprehendere—traditiones quas à quibuſdam recentior bus acceperant quarum aliquae inartes aliquae pernicioſae erant contra scripturas—vt docet irenaeus lib 4 cap 25 26—epiphanius haereſ ptolomaei—por chriſt whence fountaine deriued tradition contained thalmud 6 wherefore conſidering theſe apologiſts call ancient old rabbines condemned chriſt accounted reſpect true orthodoxall rabbines among iewes time yong cannot otherwiſe perſwaded apologiſts intended deceiue reader old rabbines ſometime ioſh 9 gibeonites iſrael moulded bread old ſhooes v thinke iewes ſince chriſt ſtronger witneſſes vnto truth former one thinke blindneſſe come vpon iſrael rom 11 25 blinder men better ſee 7 furthermore work iews leſſe defiled ſuperſtition ſuch targum chaldie paraphraſe made rabbi aquila rabbi ionathas vzielis ioſeph blind ſeeing confeſſed • thomas aquinas comm vtriuſque epiſt ad tim ſemel atque iterum aſſe • erat nomine traditionum ſignificari ingens ac vaſtum illud opus iudaicarum traditionum à iudaeis thalmud hoc eſt diſciplinationem appellatum quo collecta ſunt decreta omnia praedictorum magiſtrorum sammai hillel akiba ioſeph filiorum aſamonaei vnà cum alijs innumeris rabbinorum ſtatutis ſententijs tam diuinarum quàm humanarum legum expoſitionibus quibus nunc tota iudaeorum natio regitur sixtus senenſis biblioth ſanct lib 2 tit traditiones ſeniorum pag 122 124 cardinall paraphraſin chaldaeam ipſi targum vocant pentateuchum tranſtuliſſe ſertur r aquila qui chaldaicè onkelus dicitur—prophetas r ionathan vzielis filius—pſalmos c ioſeph caecus quae tranſlationes apud hebraeos magnae ſunt authoritatis iccirco nobis etia vtiles vt ex ijs conuincamus hebraeos alioqui ab eccleſia non v • que adeò magni fiunt neque ex ijs argumentum firmum duci poteſt siquidem—iudaicis fabulis thalmudiſtarum nugis conſpe • ſae ſunt bellar lib 2 de verbo dei cap 3 initio bellarmine eſteemed church profitable confute iewes ſo great authoritie among chriſtians make ſound argument becauſe thalmudicall fouleneſſe wherwith defiled thrice vainely hath galatinus coccius apologiſts endeuored draw theſe puddle demonſtration inuincible argument confirmation romiſh faith againſt proteſtants vanitie appeareth yet ſo much vaine becauſe ieſuite rabbini hebraeorum qui vel diuinam scripturam expoſuerunt vel paraphraſes eidem adhibuerunt vel thalmud plaeraque congeſſerunt à patribus vix vnquam citantur poſſeuinus apparat ſacr part 2 tit rabbini poſſeuinus obſerueth iewiſh rabbins haue either expounded scripture compiled thalmud ſcarce cited ancient father ſo much againſt iewes themſelues muſt ſuch bolt taken iewes thus faſtened vpon chriſtians haue broken impoſtume ſwelling demonſtration anſwer vnto prayer vſed dead 8 symeon ben iohai bewrayeth himſelfe title booke reuelatio doctor reiect truth scripture aſſume vnto themſelues cardinall bellarmine accounteth iewiſh fondneſſe thinke rabbi salomon cap 9 gen vult eſſe reum homicidij qui non dat operam liberis r dauid kimchi cap 58 eſa ait eſſe ſententiam iudaeorum eos qui non relinquunt filium eſſe tanquam excommunicatos à deo bellar lib 2 de monachis cap 6 ſhould murtherer apply himſelfe vnto procreation child although rabbi salomon taught thus much contemne doctrine ſaith excommunicate god leaueth malechild ſucceed death albeit opinion rabbi dauid kimchi attributed vnto ancient iewes chap iiii limbus patrum romish apologie secondly concerning limbus patrum booke entituled eccleſiaſticus though ſhould time ſuppoſe canonicall scripture yet collected penned chriſts time ſuch author prologue booke eccleſiaſticus lower part earth looke vpon ſuch aſleepe lighten truſt lord ſaying ſo direct piercing lower part earth lighten thoſe aſleep truſted lord argueth plainly thoſe faithfull ſo aſleepe dead heauen lower falſe c protestant appeale noting apologist two notable ouerſights sect 2 2 whitaker hath ſaid word obiected ecleſ 24 37 pierce greek anſwere ſay apologiſts notoriouſly falſe notwithſtanding ſo manifeſtly true onely see complutenſ bible vatablus septuagint baſileae anno 1545 greeke copy beare witneſſe hereunto cardinall bellarmine alſo doth confeſſe theſe word eccleſ 24 penetrabo c hic locus non cōuincit haereticos tum quia ipſi non recipiunt hunc librū tum etiam quia haec verba deſunt graeco textu tamen apud catholicos ſuam habent authoritatem bellar lib 4 de chriſto cap 12 § secūdus locus greeke text peraduenture cauſe coccius laboured prooue point coccius tom 1 lib 2 art 7 aſſerunt ſacrae scripturae c scripture pretermitted text reſpect impertinent therfore falſification vſed romiſh apologiſts notorious themſelues falſifie euen accuſing aduerſarie notorious falſhood 3 notwithſtanding marginall note pretend reaſon taxation taken engliſh tranſlation bible ſo thereby deluſion becometh groſſe place engliſh bible alledged apologiſts commonly called geneua bible title firſt page ſaith bible scripture contained old new teſtament tranſlated according vnto hebrew greeke doth akiba capitulis patrum ſaith et poteſtas data eſt bono mundus iudicatur paulus f • gius hunc locum ſaith hebraei hanc ſententiam ſic explicant c vt cuiuis hommi poteſtas tradita ſit vel bene vel male deſcribed senenſis haue bene hic vir fuit pvthagoricae platonicae ariſtotelicae philoſophiae peritiâ omnibus ſuae memoriae hominibus facilè ſuperior—vnde etiam ab ipſis graecis plato iudaeus dictas philoſophie greek philoſophical skill raiſed prouerbe viz either doth philo play plato part elſe plato doth act perſon philo knoweth blindneſſe naturall philoſophie ſo great eſpecially iudging property ſoule tertullian obſerued cardinall de origine animae—ex errore stoicorum natus eſt error manichaei priſcilliani • ex errore platonis error origenis ex errore ariſtotells vel certè ex ariſtotelis ſententia non benè perceptâ error apolli • aris vt • ure tertullianus lib aduerſus hermogenem philoſophos patriarchas haereticorum nominandos cenſuerit bellar l 4 de amiſſ grat c 11 initio bellarmine doubt call philoſophers patriarks hereticks 4 dangerous matter chriſtians ſuffer philoſophie vſher diuinity whereas ought handmaid therunto therefore often ſhe ſhall wander wilderneſſe error ought ſent home vnto diuine learning agar bondmaid gen 16 commanded returne vnto sarah miſtreſſe otherwiſe ſhall man eaſily miſled philo alledged doth make non enim e •• ſe humana men • eligit bonum ſed ſecundum proſpi • ientiam dei donantio optimum el qui digni ſunt philo iudae •• l 4 allegor coccius tom • theſaur cath lib 1 art 5 fine man worthineſſe go god prouidence electing good preferring nature grace hath bene confeſſed aduerſaries hereſie see aboue lib 2 cap 10 pelagians ſomewhat worſe howbeit ſentence vſed philo may ſeeme rather ouerthrow queſtioned freewill philo iudaeus lib 4 allegoriarum elige vitam vt viuas beata re eſt quod cùm vtrumque author poſuerit quod melius eſt anima poteſt ſuſcipere beatius verò eſt quòd non ipſa ex ſe eligat ſed auctor eam adducat meliorem ſ • ciat non enim ex ſe humana men eligit bonum ſed ſecundùm proſpicientiam dei donantis optimum eis qui digni ſunt duo ſunt enim apud legiſlatorem caput alterum eſt deum non humano omnia moderari alterum humano caſtigare punire quia hoc poſterius probat id eſt humano caſtigare nunc quod noſtrae libertatis eſt ſic introducit quaſi ſufficientes ſimus ad cognoſcendum volendum eligendum cùm verò illud prius poſterus probat omnia ſcilicet deum regere non humano tum omnes vites cauſas deo aſſignat vt cùm ait numeris nouit deus ſuos ſanctos ſuos adduxit ad ſe si autem eligere bonum eſt non eligere malum propriè ab vna cauſa proficiſcitur quid legiſlator quaſi poteſtatis eligendi compotem vt vitam non mortem eligam hortaris reſpondebit inquit dictum eſſe haec eis qui nondum magna myſteri • de principatu poteſtate dei de nimia infirmitate creaturae didicerunt hactenus philo vt refert coccius tom 2 theſauri lib 1 de natura hominis pag 73 yeeld power ſtrength good vnto god 5 briefe doctor fulks ſentence apologiſts done iuſtice haue repeated right would haue appeared iuſtifiable ſelfe againſt later iewes iewiſh rabbins ſaith patron freewill ignorant grace god erre place iudgement conſcience neither doth caluin denie permiſſion ieſuits themſelues admit onely permiſſion act induration wicked man heart firſt tentationes quae adueniunt non ſunt fortuitae nec satanae voluntate permotae ſine permiſſione dei milites à iuda inſtructi permiſſione patris filium comprehenderunt diabolus exercet tyrannidem mundo permiſſione dei iudaeos non potuiſſe dominum morti tradere niſi deus permiſiſſet caluinus com matth cap 4 8 26 27 temptation ſaith caluin permiſsion god god permiſsion diuell exerciſeth tyrannie amongst men againe laudo veterum modeſtiam quòd caecitatem obſtinationem improborum ad ſolam permiſſionem diuinam non ad operationem retulerunt vt nullam occaſionem relinquerent de operibus dei malè ſentiendi idem inſtitut cap 4 § 3 non reijcimus vocem permiſſionis conceſſionis nunquam nobis mentem venit dicere deum operari meaning ſinne impijs beza aphoriſ 29 commend ſaith modeſtie ancient father attributed act obduration wicked onely vnto god permiſsion rather giue occaſion vnto men ſiniſterly conceit god authour ſinne though calum c aug lib 5 con pelag cap 3 doth religiouſly abhorre yet notwithſtanding proceedeth permiſſion vnder conduct auguſtine rather spirit god scripture ſaying ſinnes onely act god patience alſo power thereby puniſhing ſinne manner inexplicable whereby ineffably iuſt 2 doctrine ſeemeth aduerſaries immodeſt impious paſſeth caluins quill deliuered owne ieſuits would peraduenture deſerue approbation thus pererius suarez two learned ieſuits deus facit multa intra cum hominem qui obduratur quibus vitio ſuo fit deterior excitat eo varios affectus vel motus ſpei fiduciae cupiditatis vel • tae varias imaginationes cogitationes ſomnia quibus ille nimio plus credulus incitatur ac praecipitatur malum—et auguſt lib 5 contra • ulian diſputat deum scriptura dici quo • dam indurare excaecare tradere reprobum ſenſum non ſolum per patientiam pe • mi • onem ſed per quandam potentiam quaſi actionem—ex occulta dei prouidentia iuſtiſſimâ plan • ſapientiſſim • percrius ieſuita com exod ca 11 de indur diſp 8 ſame determination suarez see letter f following god worketh many thing hardned whereby wicked man made worſe owne fault onely ſaith auguſtine permitting certaine power action ſecret yet moſt iuſt wiſe prouidence 3 doctrine caluin proteſtants ſo conſonant due acknowledgement owne ieſuits wonder mind obiection eaſily aſſoiled diſtinction owne schoole wherin ieſuite suarez hath determined operatur deus actum peccati non autem malriam eius suarez ieſ varijs opuſc relect de libert volunt diuin diſp 1 § 2 num 14 moguntiae 1600 god obdurating men worketh act malice thereof plainly canus deus eſt naturalis cauſa etiam peccatorum non autem moralis hoc eſt non ſuadet non approbat canus loc theol lib 2 cap 4 god worketh onely cauſe naturall cauſe morall vega hath well illuſtrated ſimilitude quem •• modum vinum scripturae exaratae ab optimo ſcriba malum calamum reijcimus vega de exp conc trident lib 5 cap 15 expert ſcribe ſaith writing euill pen doth make blot blot imputed vnto vnskilfulneſſe ſcribe naughtineſſe pen yet wil ſcribe offended pen ſometime anger throw fire ezech 18 way equall ſaith god way vnequall 4 proteſtants ſtand acquitted obiected blaſphemie euen ſentence owne learned ieſuite suarez affirmeth denie god inclineth men vnto formall act ſinne point need bene might haue bene iuſtified many see articulatly diſcuſſed latine apologia catholica part 1 lib 1 cap 25 witneſſes de ergo actibus quoad formale non eſt controuerſia inter catholicos sit ergo defi • e certum deum non praedeterminare voluntatē neque v • lo modo illam inclinare ad formale peccati—quin potius neq • e haere • ic • hoc negant benè enim nôrunt nec deum poſſe intendere formale peccati nec inclinare voluntatem hominis • illum intend suarez ieſ opuſc lib 2 de concurſu dei c cap 2 num 5 pag 111 chap vii inuocation angel saint romish apologie 5 fiftly concerning angel saint booke toby written ſo many age chriſt ſ • toby 5 5 12 12 12 15 18 plaine v concerning patronage interceſſion angel whitaker doth therefore accordingly confeſſe ſay thereof whittaker reſponſ ad rationes campiani rat 1 pag 15 ante med illam verò tobiae raphaelem c little regard example raphael angell mentioned tobie neither acknowledge thoſe like number ſeuē angel whittaker ſo miſliketh ſee reuel 1 4 5 • ſeuen angel whereof ſpeaketh different canonicall scripture ſauoreth know ſuperſtition protestant appeale sect 1 boldneſſe hath ſaid whitaker therefore regard example raphael becauſe place ſo plaine patronage interceſsion angel whereas ſinceritie would haue acknowledged whitaker ſaid plainly patrocinium quoddam angelis minimè denegamus—sed aliud tu patrocinium augelorum defendis eoſue à nobis colendos inuocandos eſſe ſtatuis quod quidem scriptura diſertiſſimè prohibet whittakerus reſp ad camp rat 1 pag 17 gainſay patronage angel ſpeaking vnto ieſuite campian defend whereby drawne inuocate ſhould diſcretion haue diſtinguiſhed patronage tuition miniſtration interceſſion whereby men induced performe vnto worſhip inuocation whereof ſyllable proofe whole booke tobie iudgement learned doctor plainly diſlike doctrine inuocation angel becauſe owne word contrarie vnto scripture alſo reiect authoritie booke becauſe ſome romaniſts confeſſe see aboue cap 1 neither iewes see plentifully proued hereafter laſt booke yet primitiue chriſtian church hold canonicall 2 alſo would require anſwer know part ſtorie conſiſt wherein angell gabriel doth report himſelfe haue bene tob 5 12 kindred azarias brother tobias mortal generation yet end doth affirme tob 12 15 raphael one ſeuen angel immortall without generation cardinall bellar lib 1 de verbo dei ca 11 bellarmine senenſ bibl l 8 de libro tobiae senenſis thought haue bene reconciliable would doubtleſſe haue ſhewne much eſpecially thoſe treatiſes wherein vndertooke defence booke tobie iuſtifie canonicall yet greateſt exception • e high prieſt ſlaine see 2 macchab 3 33 4 34 holding vp hand towards heauen praying people appearrd another man aged c onias ſpake ſaid louer brother praieth much people whole citie wit ieremias prophet god place ſo direct interceſsion saint vvhitaker p whittaker reſponſ ad rationes campiani pag 16 circa medium ſaith illud iudae de onia ſomnium quod 2 macchab 15 legimus vt ſomnium praetermitto ſed pa • um refert mortuorum ſiue interceſſionem ſiue ſacrificium intelligas vtrumque tuum eſt vtrumque eſt falſum doth therefore contemne protestant appeale sect 2 3 may called contempt booke contemned reſpect canonicall scripture may thought diſgrace man abaſed whē ſtandeth compariſon god euidence place proteſtant ſhould therefore contemne foundation viſion macchabaus dreame wherein ſeemed ſee 2 macchab 15 12 ver 15 16 ieremias prophet holding right hand giuing vnto iudas ſword gold gaue ſpake thus take ſword gift god wherewith thou ſhalt wound thy aduerſaries 4 aduerſaries ſay haue ſoules defuncti port paradiſi voluptatis reſerate illi et libro precationum iudaicarum ſaid angeli miſericordes miniſtri dei altiſſimi placate quaeſo faciem dei optimum deprecatione c time protestant appeale sect 3 5 argument taken ſpeech byſtanders ſaying calleth vpon elia let v ſee elia helpe concluding thereupon bene vſuall familiar practiſe among iewes call vpon prophet holy saint departed obſerued apologiſts verie probable collection ieſuite ex quo colligimus motis fuiſſe ludzorū vt tubulatione poſiti non ſolùm ad deū ſed etiam ad ſanctos prophetas accurrerent salmeron ieſ tom 10 tract 43 salmeron alſo doth little approue although indeed farre ioynt 6 becauſe yeeld vnto moderation doctor ſaid chriſt called vpon elia helpe either gentile romane ſoldiers iewes gentils communiter traduntur fuiſſe romani vt putat hieron—alij ſentiunt illos potiús ſuiſſe hebraeos qui cruci aſſiſtebant que illi erant vel ex impetitis idiotis vel ſi erant ex peritis lege doctis verba domini iudibrij gra •• inuerterunt corrupetunt salmeron ieſ ibid paulè aente hierom held ſaith salmerō common opinion whereunto ieſuite quidam illic aſtantes c ophylactus exiſtimat fuiſſe ludaeos non illos quidem sacerdotes sctibas phariſaeos qui scripturaruni ſcientiam aut habebane autprofitebanturiſed imperitum vulgus quod cum scripturas literas ignoraret eliam chriſto vocari exiſtimauit—hieron beda sttabus euthymius exiſtimane co fuiſſe romanos •• lites ſiue ignoratione hebraicae lingua ſiue irridendi liccntiâ diverunt • liam vocat quo animo id ſecerint iudicare non audeo affirmare fuiſle romanos milites audeo quia matthaeus marcus co ipſos qui dixerunt eliam vocat aut aliquem ex illis acetum ſtatim obtuliſle indicant lucas verò cap 23 36 ioh 19 29 co qui acetum chriſto porrexerunt milites fuiſſe dicunt maldonat ieſ com matth 27 47 maldonate biſhop ho hieronymus arbitratur fuiſſe milites romanos qui quoniaem non intellexerunt hebraici ſermonis proprietatem—id eo magi probabile quòd acetum ab vno corum qui iſtud dicebant porrectum lucas milites obtuliſle dicit—si quis iudaeos intelliget hieronymus exiſtimat illos • cciſle ſibiſolito vt dominum becillitatis infamarent qui elae auxilium deprecetur card anſen concord euang c 142 eumlocum ianſenius good proofes conſent foreſaid argument heatheniſh heathen know inuocate many god 7 admit iewes muſt haue bene either vulgar ſort elſe literate skilfull law vulgar ranke may thinke erred reaſon maldonate noteth see aboue letter c ignorance scripture ſo argument vnreaſonable hath better patronage ignorance 8 obiect ſpeech
