traditam nominant que hanc poſtremam 〈◊〉 quodam ordine per moſen ad poſteros derinatam affirmant paulus fagius protestant appeale sect 3 3 paulus fagius doth indeed confeſſe owne coccius hath cited per moſem apol followeth fagius sic vt cam primus omnium ioſua à moſe acceperit quam poſtea ſenioribus illi deinceps prophetis prioribus prophetae priores poſtremis—hi tradiderunt viris synagogae magnae qui ſcilicet fuerunt eſdras cum ſuo ſodalitio—ab illis acceperunt ſuccedentes ſapientes ſuccedentibus generationibus atque iſtam geminam legis expoſitionem quam hodiè adhuc apud ſapientes ſuos inuenir • gloriantur iudaei alio nomine cabalam vocant cited coccius theſaur cath tom 1 lib 6 art 6 pag 780 opinion iewes moſes receiue two lawes god mount sinai one written vnwritten later haue bene cōmended word mouth without writing moſes vnto ioſhua vnto elder iſrael vnto prophet vnto maſters great synagogue vnder eſdras wiſe men following ſucceſſiuely receiue double manner expoſition law iewes day glorie among call cabala 4 hath learned fagius confeſſed ancient iewes affirme vnwritten law romiſh apologiſts pretend relateth opinion iewes day thinke cabala reception vnwritten tradition deriued continuall ſucceſſion moſes vnto chachamin late wizzards may confirmed confeſſion owne petrus galatinus principall doctor conductor queſtion thus neque vllam eius viz cabalae particulam scripturae mandari licebat vnde praeter ea quae à rabbi symeon filio ioai tradita aſſeruntur alia à veteribus ſcripta vel pauca vel nulla comperiuntur—cabalam quod receptio latin • interpretatur vocitarunt recentiorum autem iudaeorum doctores ne patemum illud dogma euaneſceret de huiuſmodi facultate aliquid ſcripto lucem ediderunt ſparſim tamen ac nonnullis velaminibus obumbratum galatinus arcan fid lib 1 cap 6 quocirca neque mirum eſt ſi nomen hoc cabala ſiue facultas eo nomine deſignata rarò hucuſque sanctorum caeterorumue ſapientum ore habita ſit ſi de ipſa veteres non noſtri meminerint ex iunioribus tamen quidam linguam hebraicam callentes—de ipſa multa ſcripſerunt nam iohannes quidem picus primus de ea quaſi de longinquo aliqua ſuſpicari coepit galatinus lib 1 cap 6 verſus finem cabala receit might lawfully committed writing later iewiſh doctor haue publiſhed writing approach triall firſt ſhewing church iewes day moſes receiued vnwritten tradition god confeſsion learned aduerſaries sect 4 5 non deſunt aliqui catholicorum qui negant vllam fuiſſe tradition • non ſcriptam apud iudaeos bellarm lib 4 de verbo non ſcripto cap 8 § adde catholicks ſaith cardinall bellarmine haue denied iewes vnwritten tradition committed vnto may affirmed catholikely biſhop ianſenius warrant v affirmeth quòd vni iudaeorum populo per moſem diligenter ſatis perſcripta eſſent quaecunque ad religionem pertinerent iuſtitiam inter homines ſeruandam ianſenius concird euang cap 120 haec verba quaecunque dixerint facite moſes deliuered vnto people iewes thoſe thing concerned either religion towards god iuſtice towards men might eaſily euinced anſwering obiections aduerſaries vſually make ſeeing truth ſhewing ſelfe doth diſcouer vntruth therefore proceed make knowne tradition profeſſed iewes obiected humane figment condemned christ proued confeſsion romiſh aduerſaries sect 5 6 sauiour chriſtus mat 15 traditiones ea reprehendit quas iudaei acceperant á quibuſdam recentioribus quarum aliquae inanes aliquae pernicioſae erant contra scripturas bellar lib 4 de verbo dei cap 10 § argumen 3 chriſt cardinall bellarmine ſaith reprehended thoſe tradition iewes receiued yonger rabbins yet thoſe yonger maſters apologiſts called see aboue c 3 § 2 anciēt iewes old rabbins chriſt whoſe traditiōs whether way corrupt expounding scripture ordaining new doctrine 17—has vt praediximus traditiones 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 quaſi ſecundas aut ſecundarias earumque authores 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 quaſi ſecundarios doctores—cùm alij tum hieronymus paſſim vocat flagellat naturae legem contra ipſam diuinae celſitudinis maieſtatem senenſis bibl lib 2 § index errorum pag 128 fraught innumerable blaſphemies againſt god chriſt sauiour impiety againſt law moſes beſides infinite foolery execration ſuffer v mention blaſphemies philoſopher ſaid dead carcaſſes ſtinch doth enforce v burie impiety ſuperſtitious fancy may ſafely report ſparingly much kind cannot loathſome lawfull chriſtus tempore ſuo ſic ratiocinatus eſt quod ſi vobis permiſſum eſſe putatis die sabbatino pecus aliquod è foſlâ vt iſtud vita conſeruetur eximere quanto magi homo quàm p • cu multo pluris aeſtimandus eſt matth 11 draw beaſt pit sabboth day new maſters hold tranſgreſſion remoue either iudaei thalmud tract de sabb cap 5 quodſi pecus aliquod foſſam prolabatur—non niſi decurſo sabbato extrahendum buxdorfius beast man vpon day reade munſterus hiſt saxonica narrat de iudaeo quodam qui die sabbati locū ſecretum ceciderat—in quo per sabbatum relictus cibo ſuſtentatus eſt—epiſcopus iſtius locus ſeuerè iudaeis edixit ne illum die dominico chriſtianis ſolenniter ſeſtiuo indidem extraherent quare ibi per biduum manere oportuit ibid cap 11 iew fell loathſome place reuerence vnto sabboth would remooue thence day biſhop saxony vnderstood commanded ſhould kept alſo next day following honour ſake sabboth christian 10 deſire know traditionall law malice rabbins teach rabbinum qui non oderit hoſtem ſuum vſque ad mortem vindictam aduerſus cum non quaeſierit indignum eſſe nomine rabbini senenſis quo ſuprà iew vnworthy name rabbin ſhall hate enemie vnto death likewiſe inſtruct diſciples alwaies eating porrum caldaicè grate deriuatum eſt à radice quadam abſcindere ſignificante hinc vbi porrum manderunt tum aiunt abſcindantur omnes inimici noſtri buxdorf synag iudaic cap 19 leek yea statuimus vt quilibet iudaeus ter di • blaſphemet omnem chriſtianorum gentem deum precetur vt ipſam confundat—praecipitur ijs vt chriſtianos omnes loco brutorum habeant—si quis dum vult occidere chriſtianum fortè fortuna iudaeum occiderit abſolutione dignus eſt senenſis quo ſupra euerie day thrice curſe profeſſors chriſtianitie accounting matter merit kill chriſtian 11 semblable hereunto fondneſſe policy namely si quem par iudicum maior ad mortem damnauerit mori debet ſi verò omnes nullo excepto eius damnatione conſenſerint abſoluatur senenſ quo ſuprà put death man condemned greater part voice iudgement notwithstanding ſaue ſhall condemned conſent 12 notable ſuperſtition viz habiting thēſelues ſtringing ſhoes preferre quodſi quis calceamenta habeat quae corrigijs annuliſ que vel circulis careant ad excipiendas corrigias neceſſarijs ſiniſtrum prius dextrum poſterius pedi adaptabit rabbi ioeamin docuit ac praecipit buxdorfius cap 4 left foot right diet nihil comedi debet numero pari ſed impari eate thing odde number praier si quis orauerit facie ad meridiem conuerſa ſapientiam conſequetur ad ſeptentrionem verò diuitias senenſis quo ſuprà wiſedome turne face ad coitum fiant—fieri putant vt infantes hac nocte concepti vulgo fortunati fiant buxdorf c 10 obſerue eſpecially night sabboth feaſt sabboth pulicem hincinde veſtibus ſaltantem capere nonlicet qui ſi frequentant fruſtrà ſibi co blandiri quoniam chriſtus dixit date eleemoſynam—idem auguſtinus ſicut beda strabus eleemoſynam pro omni ſpecie miſericordiae charitatis exponunt cuius prima par eſt vt noſtri miſereamur iuxta illud eccleſ 30 24 miſerere animae • ae placen • deo quod facimus cùm credimus cumue eaetera facimus quae praecipiuntur nobis à deo—paulò poſt man ſay giuing almes auaile purgation ſinne without faith chriſt onely author ſaluation doctrine proteſtants know diſlike 4 secondly queſtion almes ſaid purge ſinne whereunto foreſaid ieſuite anſwereth sed adhuc qu • ſtio eſt quomodo eleemoſyna animam mundet quod facere profectò non poteſt niſi omnia peccata remittat rectè beda bonauentura hoc loco dicunt eleemoſynam peccata remittere quia ad remiſſionem peccatorum diſponit maldon ieſ com luc 1 • 41 addeth proteſtants cannot abide expoſition inferreth text aboue cited obiected expoſition may eaſily admit true ſence god diſpoſeth man vnto faith charitie man ſufficere ex iniuſtis bonis partam—praeſupponit eam debere debité fieri • reliqua neceſſaria eſſe coniungenda— quemadmodum cum dicit si remiſeritis peccata alijs dimittet vobis deus peccata veſtra—baſilius ait—hoc inquam modo peccata purgantur non ipſo per ſeipſum ſufficiente ad purgation̄ verùm agente primordialiter miſcricordia dei ſanguine chriſti quo etiam aliorum omnium habemus confuted iudgement learned aduerſaries sect 3 9 queſtion concerning merit whereof aduerſaries thus diſtinguiſh meritum eſt actio libera acceptata ad aliquod praemiū—quale duplex communiter ponitur à theologis alterum de condigno—cui de iuſtitia ex lege condignitate opetis debetur aliquod praemium alterum de congruo—appellatur opus quod ex gratia congruitate quadam acceptatur ad aliquod praemiū quod neque ex condignitate operis ſibi debeba▪ vega ieſ opuſ • de fide operibus quaeſt 4 pag 781 merit condignitie whereunto reward due god iuſtice euen worthineſſe worke called merit congruitie whereunto reward due though iuſtice yet grace acceptance haue throughly diſcuſſed former member merit de condigno examine ſecond de congruo 10 requireth exact triall may know wherein allow merit whether men pure natural deſtitute gift grace hereof vbicunque auguſtinus dimicat cum pelagianis dicentibus gratiam dei dari propter eorum merita hanc potiſſimùm eos tanquam validiſſimum telum vibrat pauli ſententiam quòd homo iuſtificatur gratis non ex operibus pererius ieſ rom cap 3 diſp 16 nu 79 concil trident meritū de congruo reijcit quod attinet ad opera quae fiunt ex ſolis viribus naturae bellar l 1 de iuſtif c 21 § huc addi aduerſaries confeſſe authoritie auguſtine councell trent leſſe thē pelagtaniſme defend ſuch merit vtcunque igitur vel olim scholaſtici aliqui vel circa initium hodierni ſchiſmatis ſcriptores aliqui catholici de hac preparatione hominis ante gratiam conſequenter de viribus humanae naturae nondū ſanatae imprudentiùs ſcripſerunt non eſt illud hodie ab aliquo ſcriptore catholico ampliùs defenſum ſed iuxta conc trid c stapl lib 2 de iuſtif orig peccat cap 4 § meritum autē stapletō noteth ſome romaniſt beginning luther oppoſition defended doctrine sanè etſi ego non eis aut faueo aut vllo modo aſſentior qui—ſuadere nituntur poſſe hominem aliquid efficere vnde vocationē atque adeò gratiam primam mereatur imò cum bonum morale proportionem nullam habeat ad gratiam cenſeo bona moralia neque diſpoſitiones dic • poſſe ad ſidem cum praeſertim non operibus ad fidem—ſed fide ad opera veniatur benius de eſſic dei auxilio cap 17 pa 294 § venio ad non poteſt homo ſpeaking de infideli ante quam diuinâ gratiâ excitetur ſe diſponere ad gratiam nedum mereti gratiam idque quia gratia eſt ordinis ſupernaturalis diuini ad quam non poſſunt vires naturales ibidem pag 300 § tota igitur benius obſerueth others among thē day ſame opiniō learnedly confuteth thē therein enemy vnto grace apologiſts rhemiſts ſtand altogether vpright haue obiected proof merit two example kind one nabuchodonoſor pagane fettered ſin therfore prophet admoniſheth breake ſin oppreſſiō • ontrarie act iuſtice would proue power meritoriouſly redeeme ſinnes almes ſecond phariſees may appeare chriſts often denunciation woe againſt farre wobegon deſtitute grace notwithſtanding apologiſts ſuppoſe able almes meritoriouſly make ſelues cleane 11 leſt may thinke deale violently eſpecially firſt reſpect merit ſtate men wholy forlorne grace enter vpon ſecond conſideration merit de congruo expreſſed ieſuite pererius patres conc trid intelligendi ſunt de merito propriè dicto quod eſt de condigno nam ſi loquamur de merito amplè ſumpto vt nunc appellatur meritum de congruo non videtur eſſe negandum per fidem alia opera praeparatoria promereri aliquo modo iuſtificationis gratiam hoc enim frequenter repetire licet apud patres dicere ſolitos peccatorem per lachrymas—eleemoſynas caeteraue opera miſericordiae promereri veniam remiſſ peccatorum pererius ieſ rom cap 3 diſp 17 num 85 ſpeake ſaith merit congruitie may ſeeme matter denied man act faith almes teares ſuch like work preparation doth merit deſerue grace remiſsion ſinne ſaith cardinall si de ſecundogenere operum loquatur kemnitius—vix enim eſt vllus inter veteres qui non agnoſcat meritum aliquod operibus poenitentiae quae per dei gratiam fiunt bellar lib 1 de iuſtif cap 21 § si loquitur bellarmine ſcarce ancient meaning schoolman denie himſelfe defendeth guarded pretendeth conſent alij ijue plurimi—meritum de congruo iuſtificationis eſſe volunt eiuſmodi actus—vt magiſter sent 2 diſt 27 albertus bonauentura scotus durandus gabriel vega bellar lib 2 de poenit cap 12 § theologi no intelligere ce • tè non poſſumus cur non hoc tempore vtendum ſit nomine meriti praeſertim cum additione illa de congruo cum agitur de operibus quae fiunt ex gratia praeueniente bellar lib 1 de iuſtif cap 21 § iam verò moſt part schoolmē among reckoneth thomas albert bonauenture scotus vega others alſo adde ro • tenſis art 1 contra luther non abhorret ab hac ſententia ſpeaking de merito cong • ui vega de iuſtif lib 8 cap 8 pag 188 col 2 see aboue roffenſis schoolemen together ieſuit suarez may adioyne rhemiſts apologiſts haue contended proue merit remiſsion purgation ſin almes preparatiue work conuerſion repentance albeit opinion kind merit congruitie ſo vntrue cardinal theologi scholaſtici nonnulli volunt actum poenitentiae vt etiam actum fidei dilectionis eſſe diſpoſitionem ad remiſſionem peccatorum ſed non meritum neque de condigno neque de congruo—vt lohannes capreolus 2 ſent diſt 40 quaeſt 1 dominicus à soto lib 2 de natura gratia cap 4 bellar lib 2 de poenit cap 12 § theologi bellarmine noteth diuerſe catholicks haue acknowledged ſuch action diſpoſitiōs vnto grace denied thē • ritorious cauſes therof although congruitte foreſaid doctrine merit quia tamen doctiſſimos quoſdam pientiſſimos viros adhuc video—eò propendere vt eccleſia hoc meritum quod aiunt congrui repellat vt recens inuentum c vega ieſ lib 8 de iuſtif cap 8 § quia haec propoſitio ſolet à pleriſque doctis viris exiſtimari eſſe contra authoritatem doctorum ſanctorum vega opuſc de meritis q 7 pag 816 § quarta propoſitio many moſt godly learned catholicks ſaith vega thinke contrarie vnto authoritie godly doctor meaning anciēt father patres agnouerunt rem ſpeaking diſtinction congrui condigni licet non vſi fuerint terminis vega de iuſtif lib 8 c 11 § quanquam idem author ſpeaking vega ſecutus scotum etiam operibus bonis ante gratiam omnem iuſtificationem congruitatem tribuit ſecundù •• quam talia opera mereantur de congruo primam gratiam ſeu iuſtificationem—verè nullum eſt meritum de congruo reſpectu primae gratiae stapleton de iuſtif lib 10 cap 2 pag 351 neuer vſed diſtinction merit de congruo de condigno diſtinctiō learned mihi haec ſententia ſpeaking ieſuite suarez lib 3 de auxil grat cap 2 num 5 qua dicit peccatorem ex priori auxilio mereri ſubſequens omninò per fidem mereti remiſſ peccatorum magnam facit dubitationem—si tale aliquod meritum eſſet ex parte noſtrûm—non debuiſſet à conc trid reticeri quid plura gratis iuſtificari ideo dicimur inquit conc seſſ 6 cap 8 quia nihil eorum quae iuſtificationem praecedunt ſiue fides ſine opera ipſam iuſtificationis gratiam promeretur—non video quomodo meritum de congruo dum meriti nomine planè aſtruitur non euertatur—quodſi auguſtinus alicubi dixit fidem poſſe impetrare remiſſ peccatorum—ego ſané poſſem ab auguſtino ad eundem auguſtinum ſexcentis locis prouocare lib de ſpir lit cap 30 epiſt 105—lib 1 retract cap 23 qui liber eſt vltimae eius voluntatis teſtificatio—nam admitten dum eſt fidem impetrare remiſſ imitatiuè vt ita dicam per modum alicuius diſpoſitionis benius de effic dei auxil cap 18 pag 307 308 312 313 314 benius againſt ieſuit suarez others doth profeſſedly confute contrarie vnto scripture alſo vnto canon councel conc trid cap 8 gratis iuſtificari ideo dicimur quia nihil eorum quae iuſtificationem praecedunt ſiue fides ſiue opera ipſam iuſtificationis gratiam promeretur benius quo iam iam ſuprà trent wherin determined act goeth iuſtification whether faith work doth merit iuſtification finally ieſuite valentia diuing bottome myſterie doth profoundly iudge nec probamus ſententiam eorum qu • tametſi—ex congruitate dicunt no primam gratiam promereri per actus illos quibus no vltimò ad illam diſpominus non eſt ita—cum igitur diſpoſitiones vltimae ſint ab ipſa gratia habituals—neque propriè compenſentur per illam ſed tantùm gratia tum detur cum ſimul eae actiones ab ipſa gratia libero arbitrio effluunt ſequitur hominem neque ex iuſtitia neque ex congruitate gratiam propriè per illas promereri illud profecto longè probabiliùs diceretur pet opera bona moralia quibus aliquis ante acceptam gratiam faceret quod moraliter poſſet eatenus primam gratiam ex congruo illum met • ri litle calleth pelagij errotem quatenus conueniens congruum eſt vt cum talis facit quantum illo ſtatu moraliter poteſt deus etiam praeſtet id quod ſuarum eſt partium hoc eſt ei homini auxilia actualia augeat quibus adiutus poſſit faciliùs gratiam conſequi atque adeò conſequatur ſi ſibi non deſit gregorius de valent ieſ lib de grat diuin part 4 cap vlt paulò ante finem farre probable morall work done grace ſhall merit grace de congruo laſt diſpoſitions namely contrition feare loue faith repentant ſhould haue ſame meritorious power remiſſion ſinnes 12 vvherefore cloſe vp ſentence iudicious idcirco fides crit tantummodò quaedam diſpoſitio—quae nihil prohibet meritum ad iuſtificationem interuenite nullum hoc eſt nec de condigno nec de congruo ac proinde no iuſtificari penitús gratis—diſpoſitiones interuenite profitemur vt dei timorem informem ſpem charitatem peceati deteſtationem nouae vitae propoſitum—quae non impediunt quo minùs impius gratis omninò iuſtificetur benius quo ſuprà pag 315 316 quia ante iuſtificationem ſumus filij irae ibid cap 18 pag 322 benius profeſſing go iuſtification diſpoſitions feare vnformed hope faith loue deteſtation ſinne purpoſe amendment life yet ſo without merit conuert iuſtified freely grace nothing remaineth onely concluſion way appeale sect 4 13 thus haue anſwered vnto obiected scripture confeſſion aduerſaries argue § 1 almes praiers teares hope faith loue done penitent ſoule neceſſarie diſpoſitions § 1 merit man obtaining remiſsion purgation ſinnes becauſe ſo farre redeeming purging men ſinnes owne force reaſon corruption themſelues haue need purgation christ bloud haue heard apologiſts promiſing giue demonſtration particular faith teſtimonies iewiſh rabbins yet herein obiect § 2 none 14 demonſtrateth nullitie demonſtration rottenneſſe foundation merit viz § 3 diſtinction merit de congruo de condigno congruitie condignitie though poſſible conceiue merit deſert without reſpect condignitie worthineſſe vnto reward ſhall deſerue therefore haue called blind diſtinction rather becauſe contrary vnto cardinall bellarmine • ſuite pererius peremptorie conceit merit congruity many doctor romiſh schoole iudgement aduerſaries moſt godly learned haue reiected kind merit new figment contrarie vnto meaning ancient father truth romiſh aduerſaries proteſtants time ſum wherof see aboue lib 2 cap 11 sect 8 lit diuine doth accord iudgement antiquitie truth scripture abſolutely denieth merit wholy acknowledgeth good grace fauour sect 1 ſame article monaſticall life coccius theſaurus tom 2 lib 4 card bellarm lib 2 de monach cap 5 romaniſts ſeeke confirme ſame example ſame eſſaei approch examined require age apologiſts haue anſwered ancient iewes ancient plinie iudged haue bene verum quod pertinet ad horum antiquitatem dum dicunt eosper multa ſeculorum millia extitiſſe ancient euen many thouſand yeares chriſt cardinall certè non e • qua ſunt dictum facilitate probantur nam nec ij qui re iudaicas ſunt protecuti tam antiquam originem eſſaeis tribuunt exiſtimamus enim plinium quia nouiſſet genus iudae orum vetuſtiſſimum exiſtimâſſe eſſaenorum quoque iudaeorum ſectam illis fuiſſe congenitam potius autem ſtandum eſſe gentilibus ſcriptoribus de rebus iudaicis quàm proprijs nemo dixerit—si enim tam nobile propè diuinum viuendi genus ahte tot ſecula vigebat quae ratio eſt quòd nec veteri inſtrumento nec nouo vlla de eo habita eſt mentio 〈◊〉 ioſephus de horum inſtituto namely chriſt tacuit— ethnici ſenptores qui ante chriſtum vixerunt c cardin baronius anno 64 num 6 8 baronius confuteth prouing diuine humane ſtories hardly proued haue bene coming chriſt greateſt antiquitie yeeldeth vnto time verùm nec contentioſum funem trahimus vt negemus ante chriſtum fuiſſe eſſaenos demus nihilominùs ioſepho ſiue alijs vt eſſaenos dicamus fuiſſe iudaeis eoſdemue etiam ante chriſtum herodis maioris tempore claruiſſe nulla enim antiquior apud ioſephum de eis habetur memoria ac ijſdem quos ait vitae inſtitutionibus claruiſſe quis prohibet dicere eoſdem praedicatione apoſtolorum conuer • o fuiſſe c baronius ibidem num 9 king herod great vnder whoſe reigne lord ieſus borne king king theſe eſſaei indeed noueliſts reſpect ancient iewes becauſe many erroneous ſects ancient ſtand ſo much vpon time vpon truth ſhewne 2 cardinall bellarmine profeſſeth multa tribuuntur eſſaenis à ioſepho quae manifeſtè erronea ſuperſtitioſa ſunt quorum nihil tribuit philo ſuis therapeutis bellarm lib 2 de monach cap 5 § reſpondeo duas many thing attributed ioſephus vnto theſe eſſaei manifeſtly erroneous ſuperſtitious biſhop stratonicus cumarum epiſcopus collectaneis ſuis autumat haſce traditiones fuiſſe ieſuite azorius proueth ſame text man may bind himſelfe god performance god hath bound diſcharge matrimonie one promiſeth chaſtitie afterward doth violate nihil impedit quo minus quis ſe denuò voti religione obſtringat ad quod alioqui faciendum lege praecepto compellitur—deus enim no ſibi ſuis legibus deuinxit no ipſos ei pariter voti nexu vinculoue obligamus vt iacob gen 28 vouit domino ſe eum 2 vendebant poſſeſſiones c aduerte quòd nulla fit mentio de voto paupe • tati ſed tantummodo quòd erant illis omnia communia caret com act 2—nonne venundatus tua erat poteſtate act 5 hinc clarè apparet quòd non voti neceſſitate chriſtiani omnes omnia tunc habebant communia ſed libera perfectione charitatis idem com act cap 5 caietan doth giue v vnderſtand ſame scripture matter apparent christian thing common neceſsitie vowes free perfection charitie ſupplying vnto euerie one according euerie man need 5 may grant thoſe chriſtians vow haue relinquiſhed propertie dominion thoſe poſſeſsions haue yeelded vnto common vſe saint yet occaſion hereof extraordinary proper time whileſt act 2 45 poſſeſſiones ſubſtantias vendebant diuidebant illa omnibus prout cuique opus erat singularis dei prouidentia fuit vt propter mox futuram perſecutionem diſpergendis ſuppeteret vtcunque ex diſtractis poſſeſſionibus ſubſtantijs vnde viuerent atque fa • il • ùs ipſarum perſonarum cōclude perpetuall doctrine practiſe extraordinary better learned doctor hath called patched alſo preiudiciall conſequence theſe forenamed chriſtians ſold poſſeſsions brought price publike communion tenthly concerning confeſsion ſinnes galatinus de arcanis catholicae veritatis lib 10 cap 3 petrus galatinus giueth example ſeuerall teſtimonies libro sanhedrin hieroſolymitano capite quod nigmar haddin id eſt definitum eſt iudicium ſaid omnis conſitens habet partem inſeculo futuro sic enim achan reperimus quòd dixit ei lehoſuas fili mi da obſe • r • honorem domino deo iſrael da confeſſionem indica mihi quaeſo quid feceru necceles à c libro ioma id eſt dierum capite iom hakippurim id eſt dy propitiationum ſaid dixit r hurma omnis qui tranſgreſſione tranſgreſſus eſt neceſſe eſt vt ſingulatim exprimat peccatum c ancient iewes protestant appeale sect 1 hinge queſtion hath bene see aboue lib 2 cap 14 sect 1 confeſſed concerning confeſsion ſinnes generall vnto miniſter particular ſinnes neither whether may whether ought neceſſarily purpoſe manifestation euerie knowne mortall ſinne grieuous circumstance thereof must otherwiſe ſtand hopeleſſe remiſsion ſins ſent vnto iewiſh galatinus iudgement hoc loco tacere non poſſum quod à chaldaeo verſum eſt ho praeterquam quod audierant tantam iobi calamitatem inſuper etiam motos vt venirent ad inuiſendum iob quòd id • ſſent hotrenda portenta ſui • hortis atbores aruiſſe panem ſuarum epularum carnem c • udam conuerſum vinum ſuum ſanguinem male à galatino detorqueri ad probandam tranſubſtant quam appellant vt alia hebraeorum dictum cap 6 7 eiuſdem libri ad probandum ſacrificium pan • vini eò perperam contorqu • malè enim ille chaldaeo paraphraſte hoc loco intelligit ho ſocios iob merito horum portentorum praecipuè conuerſionis panis vinum vini ſanguinem ereptos fuiſſe à gehenna quae illis praeparata erat—at ex talibus nugis hebraeorum caput fidei noſtrae confi • manda non erant ſed ea ipſa potiùs scriptura sane chaldaeus hic paraphraſtes fuit r ioſeph caecus qui multis annis poſt chriſtum • uit hoſtis fuit chriſtiani nominis nihil minus vnquam cogitauit quàm quod putat galatinus c thus iudgement therof ſay law ſo farre according vnto law paul taught reprehenſion ananias thus act 23 3 thou ſitteſt iudge according vnto law ſuffereſt thou ſtriken cōtrary law obediēce due vnto iudgement muſt needes proportionable hath limited abſolute neceſſitie obedience appeareth obiected place deut 17 11 thou ſhalt according law ſhall teach 4 doctrine ought familiar vnto aduerſaries ſeeing ordinarie nota quòd non dicitur tibi vt obedias niſi • uxta legem docuennt vnde matth 23 sedent ſuper cathedram moſis gloſſa ordinaria hunc locum gloſſe doth directly affirme much otherwiſe iſraelites might haue ſacrificed vpon aaron made golden calfe exod 32 4 aarō made altar proclaimed ſaying morrow ſhal holyday lord verſ 5 altar aaron made calfe haue caried idolatrous cenſers ez • ch 8 10 ſeuentie ancient haue worſhipped sunne ibid verſ 16 fiue twentie neare altar haue ſacrificed vpon idolatrous altar 2 reg 16 16 high prieſt temple ieruſalem appeareth 2 reg 16 2 acknowledged ſo haue bene genebrard chrō anno mundi 3440 vrias pontifex inflectens ſe ad voluntatem apoſtatae achaz 2 reg 16 see lyranus vpon ſame place vrias haue ioyned ierem 26 8 11 prieſts prophet people ſentēcing ieremie die ſhould haue eſcaped guilt bloud innocent yea innocencie ſelfe sauiour chriſt ieſus prophet prophet conſenting vnto blaſphemous voice high prieſt councell iewes adiudging vnto death lord life 5 therefore forecited proteſtants could acknowledge neceſſitie ſome ſupreme court iudgement eccleſiaſticall ciuill ſeuerall church kingdomes prouinces euen vnder goſpell finall determiner contention yet neuer thinke either iudgemēt ſuch tribunal ſo infallible could erre obedience ſubiects ſo neceſſarie ſometime might diſſent opinion 6 let hooker ſpeake hooker eccleſiaſticall policie pref pag 29 iudge ſaith allowable men obſerue thoſe lawes heart ſtedfastly perſwaded againſt law god little argument neceſſarie demonſtratiue ſuch propoſed vnto man vnderstood mind cannot chooſe inwardly aſſent ſuch reaſon diſchargeth grant conſcience ſetteth full libertie ſuch caſe according auguſt auguſtine councel aut faciendum aut patiendum either muſt man perſwade practiſe truth elſe willingly ſuffer truth man ſentence according vnto text deuteronomie may inflict death hath infallible power damnation thus much example iewiſh tribunal proceed vnto application application ſupreme iudge law moſes romish apologie ſo much occaſion haue controuerſies ended great old testament doubt religion many moe danger error leſſe grieuous whether therefore may thought hebr 8 6 teſtament eſtabliſhed better promiſes wanting priuiledge ſo thereby eccleſiaſticall policie moſes time preferred herein ſucceeded chriſt onely laſt reaſon puritanes doubt penrie ſupplication ye high court parliament p 21 fine ſaith forme gouernment maketh sauiour chriſt inferiour vnto moſes impious vngodly vnlawfull gouernment contrary word c see pag 22 23 peruſe occaſion circumſtance reaſon appeare hold much ſtrong point vrgeth preſſe proteſtant brother matter much ſmaller importance protestant appeale shewing errour romaniſts miſapplying example iewiſh gouernment proofe papall monarchie sect 2 7 obiected argument import euerie chriſtian eaſily grant wit greater impietie violate frame gouernment chriſt would haue perpetuall church haue tranſgreſſed ordinance deliuered mouth moſes eſtabliſhed old teſtament notwithſtanding theſis poſition penrie ſaying ſame forme gouernment inſtituted chriſt cannot without impietie abrogated true ſo hypotheſis application aſſuming forme fancied ordained chriſt fully erroneous 8 failed proofe manner presbyterie ſo aduerſa • e confirming ſpirituall monarchie whereas ab orbe condito vſque ad annum praeſentem ſemper fuiſſe vnum eccleſiae praeſidem monarcham adam seth enos—noah sem—inter patriarchas leui—moſes aaron—ita vſque ad chriſtum—adueniente chriſto quarta monarchia inſtituebatur quae coepit à petro principe apoſtolorum durauit eius ſucceſſoribus vſque ad haec tempora durabit vſque ad conſummationem mundi catalogum pontiſicum multi referunt coccius theſaur cathol tom 1 lib 7 art 3 initio c coccius laboureth euince neceſſity monarchical iuriſdictiō church example god people law adam vnto iacob vnder law moſes aaron vnto laſt deſtruction ieruſalem laſtly law peter ſucceſſiuely vnto pope vnto cardinal vltimum iudicium ſummi eſt pontiſicis bell • rm lib 4 de rom pont cap 1 § sed nec summus pontifex abſolute eſt ſuper eccleſiam vniuerſam ſuper concil generale ita vt nullum terris ſuper ſe iudicem agnoſcat idem lib 2 de concil cap 17 bellarmine yeeldeth laſt higheſt iudgement church yea euen aboue generall councell ſhew application vſe analogie old teſtament new vtterly infirme becauſe iewiſh kingdome well one chiefe ciuill deut 17 text obiected iudge one ſpirituall high prieſt 9 would thinke nonſequitur v reaſon thus one tēporall iudge iſrael ergo ought one vniuerſal monarch ciuil ſtate chriſtendome ſo muſt confeſſe lame conſequence owne argument wherby one high prieſt ordained particular kingdome iewes contend inferre ſupreme iuriſdiction one vniuerſall biſhop ouer chriſtians world contrarie vnto ordinance chriſt hath bene see aboue lib 2 cap 17 confeſſed chooſe one twelue apoſtles equall iuriſdiction among themſelues thus much firſt point application namely ſingularitie perſon propound vniuerſall iudge enter vpon next ſhewing ſecond point application viz infallibilitie truth one iudge pope vainly pretended example high prieſt old teſtament proued compariſon iewiſh romiſh doctrine proceed • pirit god becauſe pope vtter ſo much biſhop roffenſis doth herein triumph inſult vpon aduerſarie ſaying mirum eſt luthere cùm haec non ignores—quòd tam parum tribuis pontifici romano cùm vel dicunt pontifi • ē conciliū erràſſe▪ quantum ad errorem propriae mentis non tamen errâſſe ſententia quam protulit vere enim ieſus erat reus mortis quia peccata noſtra ſeipſo purganda ſuſceperat verè expediebat eum mori pro populo quare ioh 11 dicit ca • pham prophetaſſe lieet verba caiphae bonum ſenſum recipiant non tamen omnia cum enim ait de chriſto bloſpemauit quid adhuc egenius teſtimonijs certè tunc non prophetauit led blaſphemauit bellar lib 2 de conc cap 8 § alij dicunt although thoſe word caiphas ſaid one muſt die people c good ſence yet time prieſts proceeded againſt chriſt iudgement ſame caiphas ſaying ſpeaking chriſt hath blaſphemed need witneſſes himſelfe prophecie blaſpheme ſee •• uble ſelues ſhallow vnto common obiection ſo preciſely noted e • angeliſt text annum incideret quo anno de chriſto mo • n tradendo agendum erat vt per eum diuinum expleretur decretum quo conſtitutum à patre erat vt pro omnibus chriſtus moreretur maldonat ieſuita comment ioh 11 51 may thinke whole cauſe euangeliſts note ieſuite allow partly reaſon thereof inſtance learned wittie aduerſaries haue bene eſtabliſh opinion infallible iudge example iudge blaſphemouſly erroneous iudgement thereupon erect romane caiphas 14 defence iudgement see cardinall bellarmine proceedeth ſo farre affirme pontificem ſolum vel cum ſuo particulari concilio aliquod dubia ſtatuentem ſiue errare poſſit ſiue non eſſe ab omnibus ſidelibus obedienter audie ndū bellarm lib 4 de rom pont cap 2 § deinde whenſoeuer pope albeit himſelfe ſhall determine doubtfull doctrine muſt obeied faithfull although poſsible erre therein may iudge high ſtep vnto great apoſtaſie faith eſpecially ſeeing pope see hereafter confeſſed haue taught confidently defended hereſie acquaintance theſe kind romiſh poſitions may ſeeme haue ſuperſtitious rabbiniſh doctrine hebrew gloſſe tell v 15 text hath bene obiected point queſtion people iewes commanded hearken vnto ſentence iudge declining either vnto right hand left whereupon iewiſh nec declinabis ad dexteram nec ad ſiniſtrā hic dicit gloſſa hebraica si dixerit tibi quod dextra ſit ſiniſtra vel ſiniſtrá dextra talis ſententia eſt tenenda gloſſe hath thus commented iudge ſhall tell thee right hand left affirme left right thou muſt beleeue therefore lyranus doth condemne abſurditie quod patet manifeſtè falſum quia ſententia nullius hominis cuiuſcunque ſit authoritatis eſt tenenda ſi contineat manifeſtè falſitatem vel •• rorem hoc patet per hoc quod praemittitur textu et docuerint te iuxta legem lyranus hu •• locum deut 17 becauſe ſaith proctor apologiſts haue choſen cauſe queſtion ſupreme iudgement hold meete ſhew vnmateriall defence rabbiniſh authoritie owne doctrine related proteſtant author 17 regula catholica ſcriptis rabbinicis eſt hizzaher c id eſt memento potius ſermonis scribarum quàm ſermonis legis moſis buxdorfius synag iud cap 1 generall rule among iewiſh rabbins ſaith teach men mindfull word scribe law moſes among sic tractatu eorum thalmudico rabbi iochanan vnicuique sabbatum ſic vt decet iuſue eius ordinatio requirunt obſeruanti peceata condonantur ita vt id ſanctificando idololatriam ſimul exercere non vereretur ibid cap 11 rabbi iochanan taught man obſeruing sabboth ought obtaineth remiſsion ſinnes yea although ſanctiſying thereof ſhal commit idolatrie one ſet example many confeſſed paradox defended rabbins notwithſtanding authorizing owne tradition decreed regula rabbinica eſt—quicunque tranſgreditur quodcunque sapientes noſtri locu • ſuerunt • ſuppl • cio mortis obnoxius eſt pe • inde vt ſcriptum eſt diſſ • pan ſepem momordebit cum ſerpens—et admonitio rabb fil • mi memineris quòd ſermonum scribarum cura multo maior habenda eſt quàm ſermonum ſiue legis ipſius buxdorf ibid cap 2 whoſoeuer ſhall tranſgreſſe againſt wiſemen meaning rabbins themſelues haue decreed ſhall guiltie death leſt aduerſaries might poſſibly regeſt yet ſupreme iudge ſo preuented chriſt whoſe vicar cannot poſſibly depart ſyncere faith therefore exhibite demonstration fallibilitie papall iudgement referre hareſies vnto proper place example contradiction pope confeſsion learned aduerſaries sect 4 18 eraſmus witneſſe aduerſaries haue called haue appropriated vnto romane partie diſcouering myſterie romiſh doctrine doth annihilate pretence thereof ſaying porrò ſi verum eſt quod quidam aſſeuerant rom pontificem errore iudic • ali non poſſe vnquam c •• • e quid opus generalibus concilijs quid opus concilium accerſere iuriſs • ſultos ac theologos eruditos ſi pronuncians labi non poſſit curdatus eſt appellationi locus vel ad synodum vel ad eundem rectiùs edoctū poſteaquam ſemel de cauſa pronunciauit pontifex quorſùm attinet tot academia tractandis fidei quaeſtionibus diſtorqueri cùm ex vno pontifice quod vetum eſt audire liceat true ſome affirme pope cannot erre publiſheth thing iudgement need hath church general councels help vniuerſities c 19 obiection might cannot poſſibly aſſoiled yet aduerſaries anſwer imò qui fit vt pontificis huius decreta cum illius pugnent decretis— pope contradict one another iudgement whereof eraſmus hath affoorded reader many example namely nonne papa iohannes 22 nicolaus dec • etis totis inter ſe pugnant idue quae videntur ad fidei negotium pe • tinere quorum alter pronunciauit iudicialiter vt illorum loquar▪ chriſtum apoſtolos nihil habuiſſe commune nec priuatim▪ alter contrà pronunciat habuiſſe id ex ipſorum extrauag licebit cognoſcere sed propius ad id quod hic agimus facit quod innocentius 3 ac celeſtinus de matrimonio dirimendo prorſus pugnantia definiuerunt quorum hic ius facit alteri coniugum iterare matrimonium ſi alter fuerit haereſin prolapſus innocentius negat vt legimus decret 4 tit de diuortijs cap quanto nec illic diſſimulat innocentius quendam praedeceſſorem ſuum ſecus ſtatu • ſſe celeſtinum indicans vt aperit gloſſema declarans celeſtin • ſuper hâc conſtitutionem olim ex 〈…〉 ſſe decret l 3 tit de conuerſ infidelium praetereà pelagius vt extat decret diſt 31 cap ante triennium conſtituerat vt hypodiaconi siciliae ab vxoribus abſtinerent quas ante conſtitutionem legitimè duxetant id decretum velut iniquum cum euangelio pugnans praecepto retractat abrogat greg 1 qui pelagio ſucceſſit ſtatuens vt poſterum nemini ad eum ordinem pateret aditus niſi vouiſſet caſtitatem caeterùm durum iniquum eſſe vt ad caſtitatem cogatur qui non vouerit caſtitatem nec vllâ culpà commer •• vt eò debuerit compelli quod hic iniquum videtur gregorio non viſum eſt innocentio 3 loco citato qui ita reſpondet ijs qui ob praeter aequum videri coniugem relictum ſuo iure priuati ſine c • lpa praeſertim cum contumelioſior ſit chriſtum qui baptizatus recidit haereſin aut pagani • inun • quàm qui natus ethnicus recuſat ad chriſti profeſſionem conuerti ad haec ſeculi • aliquot hanc ſententiam complexa eſt eccleſia mutinenſis vt qui contrax •• ſſet cum barbara verbis legitimis ex animo • ed non intercedente coitu poſteà contraheret cum cornelia coitum adiungeret cogeretur priore relicta poſteriori conuiuere id palam reſcindit innocentius ex diametro quod aiunt diuerſam pronuncians ſententiam viz priorem eſſe legitimam vxorem quod cum poſteriore ſit actum adulterium eſſe non matrimonium vt proditum eſt lib decret epiſt 4 • 4 cap tuas dudum eiuſdem tit cap licet alexander 3 indicat ſuo reſcripto fuiſſe ſtatutum ac definitum aliquando à praedeceſſoribus ſuis quod mutinenſi eccleſia damnat innocentius quanto id periculoſius qu • cau • diuortij tamen hic decretū pon •• ficuim mutauit rom pontifex vt non commemorem interim quòd cauſa fidei ſchola pariſienſis aliquando publici •• improbauit rom pontificis ſententiam eumue ad palinodiam compulerit ſi qua fides hiſtorijs niſi torte fabulam vanam putamus quod refert gerlon ſerm quodam palch de iohanne pontifice 22 qui decernebat ante diem iudicij non eſſe puniendas anima impiorum nec dici poteſt hunc errorem priuatum fuiſſe pontificis publicum fuiſſe oportet ſcripto aut etiam decreto vulgatum quum re adeò commouerit galliae regnum hac omnia huiuſmodi plura eraſmus annot 1 cor 7 pag 373 374 baſilea anno domini 1522 pope iohn 22 pope nicholas queſtion whether christ thing either proper common one affirming iudicially denying next queſtion diuorce caſe hereſie pope celeſtine defendeth pope innocentius 3 gainſaieth beſides pelagius commanded subdeacon ſhould put away wiues lawfully married decree ſeemed vniuſt vnto gregory first next ſucceſſor vnto pelagius ſo alſo pope alexander 3 iudged marriage haue bene held lawfull ſome predeceſſors pope innocentius condemned adulterous laſtly iohn 22 matter • aith concerning ſoules departed found ſo contradictorie vnto himſelfe forced iudgement vniuerſitie paris recant former opinion know doctrine infallibility iudgement haue foundation vpon ſuch iudges found ſpirit manifold contradiction feare tediouſneſſe therefore draw vnto determination cauſe concerning queſtion viſible iudge taken example chaire moſes sect 5 20 iudgement proteſtants concerning outward iudge church hath bene see aboue alreadie manifeſted onely diſcouer looſeneſſe romiſh inſtance taken pretended matth 23 2 priuiledge iewiſh eccleſiaſticall regiment labour euince ſentence sauiour chriſt authorizing iuriſdiction iewiſh prieſthood ſaying math 23 ſit moſes chaire thing therefore ſhall ſay vnto obſerue ye common obiection aduerſaries proofe • allible bellarm lib 3 de verbo cap 3 propoundeth queſtion de iudice controu • rſiarum cap 5 ſeq produceth place new teſtament proofe thereof alſo stapletō c • ſterus others controuerſies iudge wherupon alſo rhemiſts thus collect god preſerueth truth religion apoſtolicke see rome new law anſwer able vnto chaire moſes notwithſtanding biſhops therein neuer ſo wicked life ieſuits ſtrike vpon ſame ſtring expounding chaire moſes ſignifie doctrine moſes cathedra moſis ſignificat infallibilem authoritatem interpretandi—scripturam definiendi omnes controuerſias vel ſummo sacerdote cathedrā moyſis—tenente vel de pontifice ſimul cum legitimè congregato sacerdotum concilio gretzerus defenſ bellar cited learned lubbertus replicat pag 367 373 infallible authoritie prieſthood old law expounding scripture deciding controuerſies applie type infallibilitie per cathedram moyſis ſignificatur authoritas docendi praecipiendi • ic petri cathedra dicitur romanae eccleſiae authoritas sà ieſ annot eum locum pag 414 iudgement church rome 21 wherein chooſe rather directed owne moderate doctor eraſmus complaineth hune locum quidam eò torquent quaſi parendum ſit omnibus quae praecipiunt epiſcopi aut praepoſiti etiam impij ob muneris authoritatem cùm chriſtus de ijs loquatur qui rectè docerentlegem moſaicam non qui ſuis conſtitutiunculis illaquearent homines—quis ferat co aduerſus chriſti doctrinam fixis reſixis legibus meram tyra • nidem exercentes ſuo quaeſtu maieſtate omnia metientes—non ſedent cathedra euangelica ſed cathedra simonis magi aut caiphae eraſmus annot hunc lecum detort place scripture proue obey whatſoeuer biſhops gouernours church although wicked one ſhall preſcribe chriſt ſpeaketh rightly teach moſes law inſnaring men owne conſtitutions ſome ſeeking owne honour profit ſit chaire caiphas 22 witneſſe ſeeme ſhrewd therefore ſhall hardly eſcape buffeting wherefore contented admit others firſt preacher sedent ſuper cathedram moyſis cùm bona docebant hoc eſt ea quae moyſes praedixerat docuerat audiendi erant—sed à falſa doctrina phariſaeorum cauendum eſt stella luc 12 tom 2 pag 72 stella ſit chaire moſes ſaith ſo farre forth teach moſes taught must heard otherwiſe beware non eſſe illis obediendum fi quid malè praecipiant aut doceant nam ſi eis obediendum eſt quoniam cathedra ſedent moyſis non eſt ergo eis obediendum quando aliquid contra eam cathedram docent aut praecipiunt anſen concord mat 23 2 cap 120 pag 819 ought obey becauſe ſit chaire moſes followeth ſaith biſhop ianſenius may obeyed command thing contrarie vnto chaire author reconcileth two scripture one chriſt willed men beware leauen phariſees commandeth ſay matth 16 6 cauete de fermento phariſaeorum si huiuſmodi phariſaeorum doctrina hic per fermentum cauenda ſignificatur quomodo poſt dicit dominus sedent ſuper cathedrā moyſis quod dixerint facite proinde ad literam dominus non quamlibet phariſaeorum doctrinam ſignificare voluit ſed eam quâ docebāt quae verè ipſorum erant mandata hominum aut inutilia planè aut mandatis dei aduerſa ianſen concord eum locum matth cap 64 ſaith reiect doctrine ſuch contrarte vnto law moſes plainly ieſuite maldonate dominus per cathedram moſis non de phariſaeorum doctrina intelligit ſed de doctrina legis ac moſis loquitur perinde enim eſt acfi dixerit omnia quae lex ac moſes vobis dixerint maldonat ieſ comment hunc locum matth chriſt ſaith chaire moſes vnderſtand doctrine phariſees doctrine law moſes 23 chaire thoſe aduerſaries ſit aduantaging papal authority vnderſtand moſes chaire infallibility iudgement phariſees prieſts law may coniecture therof ieſuite salmeron confeſſing chriſt ſpeaketh non erant audiendi quando chriſtum negabant eſſe meſſiam vel chriſtum quia haec non de cathedra docebant salmeron ieſ tom 4 part 3 tract 32 § obijcies pag 609 obeied denied christ meſsias ſpeake chaire yet know denied chriſt authoritie see aboue c 15 § 3 councell ſheweth chaire moſes muſt ſignifie ſucceſſion true doctrine without reference vnto authoritie men perſons 24 let aria montanus make vp concluſion ſame chapter verſ 13 w • e vnto scribe phariſees ſhut kingdome god men neither ſelues go thither neither ſuffer others enter multa erant scripturis myſteria ad regnum coelorum pertinentia—ſed phariſaei neque attendebant neque alto ad haec inſtruebant aut inſtrui patiebantur ſed toti illis erant vt nudarum caeremoniarùm obſeruationem ſine explicatione ſignificationum ipſarum inculcarent—neque permittebant vt quiſquam de ſ • • scripturis vol cogitarent nedum diceret quicquam niſi ſe conſultis ex ſuarum interpretationum praeſcripto ita illi claudebant regnum dei ante homin • neque enim hominibus id eſt caeteris à ſe licebat de scripturis agere ſie enim dic • bant caeco illi reſtituto peccatis natus e totus vi docere no et ſequitur neque ipſi intrabant vt patet ex hoc teſtimonio quòd nollent vt quiſquam de chriſto vel quam veriſſima illis afferret aria montanus matth 23 pag 80 illa verba quia clauditis many myſteries scripture ſaith cō cerning way vnto god kingdome phariſees neglected either themſelues others ſhould know wholy bent authorizing owne naked conſtitutions deliuered void expoſitions ſuffering man thinke much leſſe ſpeake thing scripture without aduice preſcript expoſitions appeareth ſaying blind man thou art borne ſinne doeſt thou teach v 25 affoordeth v theſe due conſiderations firſt thoſe profeſſors moſt doubtfully rather deſperately erroneous make chaire authoritie infallible argument truth doctrine contrarywiſe apparance doctrine scripture chaire wherein men conſciences may take laſt reſt reſolution becauſe auguſtine ſaith sedem eccleſiaſticam inquit auguſtinus ſana doctrina conſtituit staple • antidot matth 23 pag 194 ſound doctrine conſtituteth chaire 26 secondly chriſt commanded men obey thoſe phariſees quatenus ſo farre onely doctrine neceſſarily belonging vnto kingdome god truly proceeded moſes chaire ſignifieth written law moſes iuſtified profeſſion thinke ſuch caſes authoritie man law written ſupreme iudge men conſciences 27 thirdly thoſe profeſſors vpon prieſtly authoritie iewiſh synagogue idolatrouſly blaſphemouſly erred truth would reare vp opinion infallibility iudgement pope aduerſaries haue confeſſed haue bene poſſeſſed contradiction see hereafter acknowledged plunged hereſies cauſeth v feare pretended chaire truth tranſlated forme chaire apoſtaſie 28 laſtly authoritie externall viſible iudge councell deciding doubtfull point controuerſies wherein direct law god onely man peremptorie fancie made chaire proteſtants willingly see aboue acknowledge aduerſaries indeed draw neare iewiſh preſumption buxdorfius hath related whereby viz iewes profeſſe rabbi iſaac abhuhabh anno chriſti 1493 ſcribit libro menoras hammaor omni quodcunque rabbini noſtri concionibus myſticis aut allegoricis explicationibus docuerunt loquuti ſunt no non minus firmiter atque bene quàm legi moſis fidem adiungere tenemur quo ſi quid inueniatur quod nobis hyperbolicum vel naturae prorſus contrarium videtur—nos culpam illam intellectui noſtro defectuoſo non autem verbis ipſorum aſcribere debemus buxdorfius lib synag iudaic cap 1 pag 62 bound giue great beliefe vnto myſticall allegorical expoſitions rabbins vnto law moſes wherein thing ſay deliuered may ſeeme repugnant vnto nature muſt impute vnto defect vnderſtanding vnto word doctor would aske romaniſts whether thinke thing profeſſion iews greater barre hinder cōuerſion vnto faith chriſt thraldome ſoules beleeuing light scripture may teach iudgement preiudice doth foreſtall haue iudgement teacher cloudie allegory darken dimme light scripture granted none denie application hereof like preſumption confuted religion better fortified eſtabliſhed chap xvi concerning concluſion apologiſts demonſtration romiſh faith faith iewiſh rabbins romish apologie ſo many foreſaid example catholike faith thus affirmed ancient iewes liued chriſts coming made probable religion new lately deuiſed moſt ancient vndoubtedly apoſtolike point made yet much cleare hereafter see hereafter tract 1 ſect 7 8 alledged concerning romane church conuerted apoſtles time ſit hence changed religion protestant appeale irrefutable argument conuincing groſſe ſophiſtrie apologist demonſtration ancient iewes demonſtration faith ancient religious iewes confeſsions learned aduerſaries many principall point belonging firſt vnto morall duty concerning man sect 1 argument apologiſts haue taken faith ancient iewes confirmation ſay catholicke faith haue entituled demonstration whereby ſignified reaſon ſo euident infallible euerie diſcreete reader muſt thereunto forthwith yeeld aſſent hereupon haue founded concluſion beleeue romane religion moſt ancient vndoubtedly apoſtolicke argument hath bene found rather ſuch demonſtration want iudgement galatinus coccius theſe apologiſts though ſtudied profeſſed make themſelues notoriouſly vaine becauſe foundation almoſt proofes iewiſh thalmud cabala aduerſaries confeſſe better two muddie lake ſinkes see aboue cap • sect 6 fabulous blaſphemous tradition 2 let ſet vpon argument edge ſteele ſharper vehemently ſt • ike proteſtants therewith deadly wound themſelues iuſt retorſion ſhall turned owne bowel appeare comparing opinion iewes romaniſts together 3 true iuſtifying faith deſcribed paul galat 5 6 worketh loue loue iohn haue diſcerned ioh 15 10 keeping god commandements commādements chriſt often preſſing scripture doth ſignifie written old teſtament wherein reade luit 18 non reuelabis turpitudinem leuit 18 degres kindred wherein mariage forbidden theſe lawes eſt imprimis obſeruandum inter no aduerſarios conuenire praecepta leuitici non obligare chriſtianos quatenus propriè leuitica id eſt poſitiua iudicialia ſunt ſed tantùm quatenùs naturalia sed tota quaeſtio eſt omnia illa praecepta quae habent •• • euitico de grad • bus cognationis ſint naturalia aliqua vel omnia iudicialia et quidem aduerſarij volunt omnia eſſe naturalia ac proinde indiſpenſabilia per eccleſiam proteſtants interprete iſſue law nature ſaith cardinall bellarmine indiſpenſable no autem docemus non eſſe omnia naturalia ideò quibuſdam poſſe per eccleſiam diſpenſari vt conc trid affirmat eſſ 24 3 bellar lib 1 de matrim cap 27 poſt principium ſaith hold ſome thoſe lawes naturall iudiciall therefore may diſpenſed according vnto decree councell trent wherein held better anathema ſhall beleeue beliefe notwithſtanding iewes neuer conceiue knowne haue kept theſe lawes inuiolable queſtion moment becauſe appeareth apoſtle pure virgine church ſhall approoue iuſtifie act 1 cor 5 inceſt 4 pope aduerſaries beleeue papa rebus morum definiendis vel declarandis errare non poteſt azorius ieſ part 2 lib 5 cap 3 § vltimo cannot erre determining morall point doctrine hath diſpenſed diuerſe degree mariage forbidden leuiticus namely witneſſing owne ieſuit rarius conceſſerit rom pont vt matrimoniū contraheretur inter amitam vel materteram conſobrinum quàm inter patruum vel auunculum conſobrinum—inter henricum octanum vxorem fratris ſui defuncti idem ibid § tertiò quae • itur § quarta c allowing ant marry nephew king ioyne wedlocke brother wife kind match ſo fully inceſtuous ambroſe epiſt ad paternum conſulentem liceret neptem ex filià filio ſuo coniungi—ita reſeribit ego autem prohibitum iure diuino aſſero quia cum leuiora interdicta ſint de patruelibu • fratribus multo magi hoc quod eſt • ctioris neceſſitudinis interdictum arbit • or—haec alia ambroſiu • conſtanter affirmans per huiuſmodi concubitus diu • num naturae ius violari—b gregorius pluribus locis iſta coniugia deteſtátur— ad auguſtinum angliae epiſcopum cùm nouerca inquit admiſceri graue facinus eſt qu • lege ſcriptū eſt turpitudinem patris tui non reuelabis paulò antè auguſtinus quis inquit dubitet honeſtiùs hoc tempore etiam conſobrinarum prohibita eſſe coniugia non ſolùm propter multiplicandas affinitates ſed neſcio quia quomodo ineſt humanae • ecundiae naturale quiddam atque laudabile vt cui debet cauſa propinquitatis honorem—hieronymus heluidium ſuper geneſin tam nefanda eſſe haec putat vt dixerit scripturam p • opter aurium ſanctitatem maluiſſe haec intelligi quàm ex • rimere—et aliquantò poſt quatuor igitur praecipu • eccleſiae doctores hanc doctrinam profanam acertimè inuecti ſunt—ad haec multorum pontificum canones ſacra concilia vbi non ſolùm habentur illicita q • ia prohibita ſunt ſed prohibita quia ex ſe nefaria deteſtanda naturali diuino dure pro diſpenſ matrim henr 8 cum catharina pag 4 § et vt inſuper audeo dicere recentiores multis locis patribus preſſiores excuſſiores diligentiores vigilantiores eſſe ibid pag 38 b § igitur iudgement yonger diuines 5 secondly romiſh profeſſion ſoueraignty ouer king depoſe made onely viſible vnto v bookes buls palpable alſo practiſe ſuffer ancient iewiſh rabbins iudges allow moſes prophet god firſt proclaimer god written law one ancient rabbins let heare owne ieſuit salmeron witneſſing caſe confeſſing miſſa poteſtate ſpirituali legis naturae vel moyſi quae minor erat regia poteſtate veteri teſtamento ideo etiam ſummi sacerdotes regibus ſubdebantur ſicut etiamapud gentile de poteſtate eccleſiaſtica diſſerendum salmeron ieſ comment tom 12 tract 63 § sed nunc pag 428 et paulò ante longè tamen eminet poteſtas ſpir • tualis noui teſtamenti § quod autem vnder moſes old teſtament regall law preheminēce high prieſts ſubiect vnto king becauſe romaniſts refuſe iewiſh point apoſtles haue preſcribed vnto chriſtians condemnation iuſt 6 thirdly romaniſts admit none vnto ſacred order without ſolemne vow ſingle life happē entring ſtate matrimonie ſhall breake vow marriage commanded diſſolued briefe proteſtant miniſters married therefore called carnall vncleane albeit prieſts mariage aduerſaries haue see aboue cap 2 § 33 confeſſed forbidden either old new teſtament monaſticall vow bene anciently iewiſh would coccius theſaur cath tom 2 lib 4 art 2 fine coccius proofe thereof haue bene contented example eſſaei see aboue cap 10 § 2 laſt ſect among iewes chriſt haue commanded v honour phyſitian ſhould romaniſts ſo much 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 contemne phyſicke chriſt preſcribeth apoſtle 1 cor 7 2 auoiding fornication haue wife howſoeuer iewiſh church ſo farre pure romiſh much hath bene see aboue lib 1 cap 2 § 36 confeſſed alloweth ſtewes ſecond confutation point concerning god worſhip sect 2 7 firſt god knowne exod 20 5 iealous god argueth faith church ſounder doth ſincerely affect integritie god worſhip whereof ſeeke indifferent triall firſt proteſtants romaniſts double od image one repreſenting worſhipping image ieſuite vaſquez doth obſerue maior de imagine ipſius dei ſecundùm ſe non vt incarnati controuerſia eſt • ſcilicet liceat •• depingere qua cum haereticis pugnandum eſt eo tamen difficilior cū eis erit congreſſus quòd ſuae partis viros catholicos propugnatores habeāt—paulò poſt opinio quamuis non adeò certa eſt vt tanquam fidei dogma ſit amplectenda multo tamen verior mihi videtur quae ſine temeritate contra communem eccleſiae vſum negari non poteſt ea verò vniuerſum aſſerit trinitatē depingere ex natura rei licitū eſſe reckoneth defender opinion palud caiet wald cathar didac payua sander tu •• ian vaſquez ieſ lib 2 de adorat diſp 3 cap 3 initio § tertia ergo common vſe church haue picture god trinitie yet confeſſeth church god among iewes ego verò aliter exiſtimo reſpondendum pri • ùm exod 20 deut 4 non ſolùm puto prohiberi imaginem dei primo illo modo ne ſcilicet populus e • rore deceptus veilet ei effigiem aliquam exprimere quâ putaret ad vi • um deitatem ipſam repraeſentari ſed quamcunque imaginem ipſi • dei •• ò cuiuſcunque alterius ob periculum cui populus ille ſubiacebat vt ſeq▪ diſputatione patebit ob id tamen non eſt dicendum ex natura rei illicitum eſſe deum depingere ſed iuſtis de cauſis à deo veteri teſtamento fuiſſe prohibitum vaſquez quo ſuprà cap 4 § ego verò forbidden make picture god noteth doctrine alſo see teſtimonie vaſquez letter • proteſtants alſo teſtifieth diuerſe romiſh schoole secunda ſententia eſt henrici quodlib 10 qu 6 abulen cap 4 deut q 5 durand 3 diſt 9 q 2 ad 4 martini de ayala de tra lit 3 p •• de imag cap de earum antiq quam ſecutus quoque fuerat iohannes wiclef vt teſtatur waldenſ tom 3 cap 155 principio et tandem caluinus lib 5 inſtit cap 11 qui omnes affi • mant non licere vllo modo trinitati ſed ſolùm deo humanitate quam aſſumpſit imaginem effingere vaſquez quo ſupra cap 3 § secunda conſent iudgement ancient father haue ſo vtterly condemned figuring god ſame ieſuite glad laſt refuge grant secundò obijciunt nobis patres compl • re qui dicunt nephas eſſe ſimulacl • rum imaginem deo collocare sic lactant lib 2 diuin inſtit cap 2 auguſt de fide ſymb c 7 origen l 3 contra celſu • lib 7 contra eundem fine clem alex l 6 strom dama • cen l 4 de fi • e cap 1 • orat 1 de imag germanus patriarcha epiſt ad ioh quae recit • tur 7 synod act 4 theodorus epiſt ſynod quae eſt act 13 idem habetur eadem ſeptima synod act 5 vt cap ſeq referemus imò thomas 3 p qu 25 art 3 ad 1 idem docuit reſpondetur eos locutos de imagine pr • mo illo modo quo pacto ca • etanus interpretatur thomam damaſcenum quodſi abſolutè ipſi loquantur intelligendi ſunt illicitam exiſtimaſſe dei picturam imaginem non ex ſe ſed ratione periculi imperitae multitudinis quo ceſſante vt admonuit concil trident diligenti ſolicitudine doctrinâ paſtorum manifeſtum eſt ea imago iure damnari non poſſe idem ibid cap 4 § secundo obijciunt father thinke ſuch imagerie vnlawfull although ſaith ſelfe yet becauſe danger idolatrie rude multitude 8 difference ſecond queſtion concerning worſhipping chriſt image leſſe former whereof ieſuite gretzerus auoweth calling nunc explicandum quo genere cultus colenda ſit non modò prima illa crux chriſti ſed omnes imago ſigna crucis aſſerimus cum ſententia communiori ſcholis magi trita crucem colendam eſſe latri • hoc eſt cultu diuino non quidem per ſe ſed per aliud non abſolute ſed cum habitudine reſpectu ad prototypum gretzerus ieſ lib 1 de cruce cap 49 • tio common iudgement croſſe chriſt worſhipped although improperly latria honour properly due vnto god profeſſion ancient people god among iewes ieſuite vaſquez doth tell v permulti enim affirmant nunquam nec lege veteri imaginum picturam aut ſculpturam ſtatuarum imò nec ipſarum debitum cultum ſed ſolùm idololatriae adorationem fuiſſe pohibitam ne ſcilicet ea populus cultu diuino ſicut gert le ſua idola proſequeretur citeth defender opinion beda ionas aurelianenſis thomas burgenſis waldenſis caietanus alanus copus sanderus alphonſus de caſtro fr turrian pāmelius vaſquez ieſ quo ſuprà lib 2 diſp 4 cap 1 diuerſe romiſh doctor among mentioneth caietan sander turrian pammelius thinke ſaith god prohibite vnto thoſe people adoration image onely worſhip idolatrous yet doth reckō vp romaniſts non pauciores nec inferioris notae authores oppoſitam opinionem quae mihi multo probabilior vi • eſt amplectuntur iudaeis nimirùm non ſol • adorationem illam gentilium quae naturali iure prohibita eſt verumetiam q • emlibet vſum imaginum ſtatuarum praecepto dei poſitiuo exod 20 fuiſſe interdictum sententia eſt richardi alexandri alberti bonauentura palud • ni henrici catharini martini de ayala fr horantij alani copi clictouaei vaſquez ibid cap 2 initio ſaith either fewer number inferiour eſtimation held contrarie ieſuite himſelfe doth iudge probable opinion indeed probable euident ioſephus ieſuite gretzerus proueth ioſephus lib 15 cap 11 nihil iudaeis tam moleſtum fuit quám trophaea qui cum putarent armis contectas imago quarum vſus interdictus eſt noſtris legibus indigniſſimè ea ferebant gretzer de cruce l 1 c 44 pag 121 iewes hate verie image men heatheniſh trophees forbidden god 9 secondly faithfull worſhipper muſt take heed honoureth god ſo muſt beware vnto commendeth praiers mouth thought leſt attribute vnto ſoule departed inuocating power vnderſtanding caſes men world haply ſhould pray vnto one propertie whereby ancient father diſcerned deitie holy ghoſt romaniſts teach vniuerſall inuocation communicable vnto euerie saint departed calling proteſtants see aboue lib 2 cap 12 sect 1 impious denying notwithſtanding themſelues confeſſed see ibid sect 3 inuocation ſoules departed haue bene vſe among iewes ſtate old teſtament feare idolatry yet taught vnto new teſtament firſt conuerſion vnto faith chriſt becauſe ſay aduerſaries thoſe iewes would haue thought hard matter commanded pray vnto saint departed ſo meerely ſtrangers thoſe true iewes vnto romiſh article inuocation 10 thirdly true praier breath true faith faith alwaies feare offer vnto god eccleſ 5 2 ſacrifice fooles kind opinion proteſtants thoſe praiers men capacitie vnderſtanding offer tongue vnderſtand romiſh councell trent hath eccleſia noſtra prohibet ne diuina officia praeſertim affirme contrarie albeit rabbin aben ezra dehortatur ne quis talibus vtatur orationibus quibus non intelligitur quid oratur ſaith mercerus com eccleſiaſten 5 2 pag 113 aben ezra doth dehort men vſing praiers vnderſtand cannot denied church iewes god ordinance vnder moſes publike ſeruice hebrew mother tongue 11 fourthly faith inſtrument maketh rom 10 10 heart beleeue vnto iuſtification mouth confeſſe vnto ſaluation therefore deſireth enioy prerogatiue hath chriſt although vnto god onely vnfeined confeſſion expect grace remiſsion ſinnes contrarywiſe romaniſts teach ſuch see aboue lib 2 cap 14 sect 3 neceſsitie auricular confeſſion vnto prieſt without dependance either act vow purpoſe man may hope pardon god hand apologiſts ſuffer ſtate true iudaiſme example see ibid among iewes lyra cardinall tolet haue witneſſed confeſsion particular ſinnes vnto prieſt neceſſarie 12 fiftly faith faſteneth vpon promiſe god made onely vnto ſelfe euen vnto ſeed alſo ſo farre offſpring ſhal reiect couenant god concerning point romaniſts haue taught see aboue lib 2 cap 13 sect 1 child born chriſtian parēts dying without baptiſme inherit life notwithſtā ding old teſtament hath bene confeſſed see ibid sect 6 circumciſio • sacrament remiſsion originall ſinne child dying vncircumciſed excluded frō grace aduerſaries peraduenture obiect ſtate new teſtament perfect therfore sacrament therof neceſſarie let obiection conſider whether grace god hereby commended iſſueth immediatly vpon ſeed faithfull abſolute neceſſitie vnto element whether grace greater danger child damnation leſſe may ſtand vnto analogie betweene ſeales couenants circumciſion old baptiſme new infantulos aegrotantes die octauo non circumcidunt ſed circumciſionem differunt vſque eò dum valetudinem recuperarint buxdorſius gloſſe thalmud buxdorſius synag iud cap 2 iewes circumciſe child eight day god commanded ſicke time deferred vntill child gathered ſtrength ſhall ſay contemptuous religious delay baptiſme intent sacrament may ſolemnly performed held damnable among chriſtians article principle faith church euen holy scripture held proteſtants confirmed expoſition ancient iewes conſeſsion learned aduerſaries sect 3 13 diuine scripture common principle foundation faith eyeth eſpecially three point integritie communitie ſufficiencie firſt integritie proteſtants require two thing perfect canon scripture old teſtament tranſlation immediatly deriued hebrew text canon bookes old law romiſh councell trent hath thus defined bellarm others see aboue cap sect 2 co • cius theſaur bookes tobie iudith wiſdome eccleſiaſticus baruch maccabees canonicall notwithſtanding iewes haue hath bene confeſſed see ibid reiected theſe bookes vnto iudgement iewes moſt see hereafter ancient chriſtian church wholy ſubſcribe ſhould alſo 14 concerning integritie tranſlation without doubt muſt held pure agreeth firſt originall aduerſa • y repr • hend proteſtants aſcribing nimium tribuunt ſpeaking proteſtants hebraeae editioni—quam non ſemel puriſſimum fontem appellant bellarm lib 2 de verbo dei cap 2 initio much vnto hebrew copy calling pureſt fountaines moſt pure great neceſſarie controuerſie wherein contend conduit pure water fountaine life many romaniſts ſeeking may ſeeme preiudice iudgement proteſtants tranſlating hebrew bible vulgar latine haue accuſed iewiſh rabbins ſacrilegious malice hebraici codex rabbinorum aliorum eccleſiae hoſtiū fraude ſaepè potuerunt deprausri gregor valent ieſ analyſ lib 8 cap 5 § neque verò pintus com dan 7 § lit tradentur pag 179 dan 13 initio sacroboſcus ieſuita deſenſ decret concil trid part 1 cap 3 pag 20 non omninò dubito ſaith quin rabbini ex mala fide odio ac muidia ſenſum prophetarum rebus maximis mutarint adding neque enim hi fontes cum primis exemplanbus conueniunt ibid cap 4 pag 35 alſo iacobus epiſcopus chriſtinopolitanus senenſis bibl lib 3 pag 153 deinceps lib 8 pag 630 dicitur hoc à recentiotibus lorinus ieſ com act 7 51 idem docet canus loc theol lib 2 cap 13 teſte bellarm lib 2 de pont cap 2 § praetere • corrupting thoſe ſacred ſountains enuie christ accuſers appeare romiſh schoole pintus christinopolitanus canus beſides yonger diuines alſo gregory valentia sacroboſcus ieſuits 15 iewes want aduocates euen romane schoole pleade affirming prouing alſo integritie iewes point firſt cui ſententiae ne aſſentiar prohibet hieronymi tranſlatio quae locis de quibus inter no iudaeos controuerſia eſt ſemper ferè cum hac hebraeo • um punctuaria expoſitione maximè conſentit—huc accedit auguſtini perſuaſio quòd nullus vnqua • ſanae mentis credere poterit iudaeos quantum lib • • alos peruerſos codicibus tam mu • ti • tam longè latèque diſperſis vnum conueniſſe odio chriſtianorum corruptionem ſuorum voluminum con • pir • ſſe senenſis bibliot lib 3 pag 153 deinc • p lib 8 pag 630 see • ſo pererius ieſ com gen 8 7 § aſt ego senenſis profeſſeth plainly cannot beleeue thoſe accuſations induced hereunto himſelfe ſaith authoritie hierome augustine held note madneſſe one ſhould imagine iewes conſpire together corruption scripture 16 reaſons omit witneſſes cardinall bellarmine ſatisfie produceth argument origen hierome alij zelo quidem bono ſed neſcio ſecundù • ſcientiam omnin • contendunt iudaeos odium chriſtianae fidei ſtudioſè deprauâſſe corrupiſſe multa loca scripturarum—pugnant autem aduerſus hanc ſententiam grauiſſima argumenta primúm origen lib 8 eſ vt hieron ref • rt eſa 6 qui hunc modum ratiocinatur▪ ſi scripturas hebraei aliquando corruperunt vel id fecerunt ante chriſti aduentum vel poſteà ſi ante quare chriſtus apoſtoli nunquam eos de tam inſigni crimine reprehenderunt praeſertim cum leuiora non tacuerint quare dominus ait iohan 5 scruta ••• scripturas matth 23 sedent ſuper cathedram c cui credibile eſt ad corruptas scripturas legendas ſine v • la praemonitione homines inuitaſſe sin autem poſt chriſti aduentum id factum eſt quo pacto teſtimonia quae à chriſto apoſtols citantur omnia ferè nunc inueniuntur moſe prophetis hoc hieronymi origenis argumentum eſt— iewes ſay corrupted scripture muſt haue done either coming chriſt would chriſt apoſtles haue reproued ſo great crime ſeeing reprehended leſser fault would chriſt haue inuited read scripture without premoniſhing take heed reading scripture corrupted bene offence ſhall ſay corrupted ſince cometh paſſe almost scripture cited chriſt apoſtles yet found bible iewes 17 another argument taken auguſtine ſaith alterum argumentum eſt ex auguſtino lib 15 de ciuit c 13 vbi probat quòd non videtur vllo modo credibile iudaeos voluiſſe ſuis codicibus eripere veritatem vt noſtris detraherent authoritatem etiamſi voluiſſent non ſit veriſimile potuiſſe— iewes neither could would corrupt leſt might ſuſpect ſince thoſe time hierome auguſtine haue bene violated foreſaid cardinall doth vndertake defence ſaying dicet aliquis generalem hanc deprauationem heb codicum poſt hieron auguſtini tempora acc • diſſe—at auguſtini rationes omni tempore locum habent— argument vſed father w • l pleade time come time paſt confirmeth fr • tertium argumentum ſumi poteſt ab incredibili religione iudaeorum erga ſacros libros ſcribit philo lib de egreſſ ex aegypto vt citatur ab fuſeb 8 2 praep euang—quemlibet iudaeum centies potius moriturū quàm vt pater • tur legem aliquo immutari— religious zeale elder iewes philo reporteth would chooſe rather die hundred death ſuffer scripture altered thing alſo later iewes de ſuperſtitione autem recentio •• iudaeorum qui legem ferè vt numen adorant ſi aliquando terram ceciderit ieiuniū publicum indicunt hactenis bellar lib 2 de verbo dei c 2 § igitur omiſſis deinceps ſo much adore booke law happen fall vpon earth denounce publike faſt way penance 18 briefe ieſuite acoſta addeth another argument prouing although iewes bene bent abuſe holy writ yet could haue effected ſuch miſchiefe hebraicā eſſe authenticā dubitare non poſſun u quamu • iudaica perfidia que inuidia conata ſit—fontē ipſum ſermonē dei inficere tamen nullo modo credendū eſt eis licuiſſe quicquid lubuit neque defuere eccleſia docti viri quorū ſtudio cōſeruati ſunt codex hebraici ex quibus tutò poteſt catholicus doctor ſacros ſenſus elicere diuina dogma confirmare iudaeos ipſos conuincere acoſta ieſ l 2 de chriſto c 16 p 104 becauſe neuer wanting church learned men whoſe ſtudie care ſacred scripture would haue b •• preſerued therefore doth ſame author doubt call hebrew edition authenticall 19 quarrell driedo ſome others tooke againſt becauſe point rabbins added better vnderſtanding text anſwered cardinall driedo dicit irrepſiſſe errores ignorantiâ rabbinorum qui addiderunt puncta—caeterùm non tanti momenti ſunt eiuſmodi errores vt eis quae ad fidem bonos more pertinent ſacrae scripturae integritas deſideretur—puncta enim illa extrinſecus addita ſunt nec textum mutant itaque poſſumus ſi volumus puncta detrahere bellar lib 2 de verbo dei cap 2 § caeterum fine thoſe errours ſo great may detract integritie hebrew scripture thoſe thing concerne either faith godlineſſe yet thoſe point alter text 20 confeſſed integritie hebrew bible queſtion whether proteſtants tranſlations profeſſedly following hebrew originall like perfect romiſh vulgar latine tranſlation sacroſancta synodus—ſtatuit vt haec ipſa vetus vulgata editio quae longo tot ſeculorū vſ • ipſa eccleſia probata eſt—pro authentica habeatur conc trid seſſ 4 councell trent hath decreed authenticall none eſpecially ſeeing confeſſed firſt owne senenſis etiam sanctes pagninus praedicatorij ordinis concionator apoſtolicus vir diuinis scripturis apprimè eruditus—ſed hebraeae potiſſimùm peritiſſimus cum animaduertiſſet celebrem illam hieronymi verſionem temporum iniuriâ hominum incuriâ vel magna ex parte intercidiſſe vel magna ex parte fuiſſe corruptam—leone decimo pont hortante collatis inter ſe probatiſſimis hebraeorum exemplaribus quantâ valuit fide induſtria omne vetus teſtamentum ex hebraica veritate latinitate donauit—quam editionem peritiſſimi rabbini omnibus quae nunc extant tranſlationibus praeferunt sixtus senenſis bibl lib 4 tit sanctes pagninus pag 101 sanctes pagninus ſunt momenti quantum attinet ad fidem religionem ſaepè codex hebraei magi iudaeos vexant quim graeci aut latini may argument ſaith iewes would depraue scripture hatred chriſtians would haue razed diſciplinam ne iraſcatur dominus ex quo nihil apertè contra iudaeos deduci poteſt hebraeo oſculamini filium ne iraſcatur—qui locus eſt inuictiſſimus contra iudaeos— ſecond pſalme latine hath receiue diſcipline leſt lord angrie latine ariſeth euident argument fit confute iewes hebrew text inuincibly ſtrong againſt ſecond place item eſa 53 vbi no habemus et no putaùimus eum quaſi—percuſſum à deo eccleſ cap 14 § veniamus nunc § denique nullum ſeculum nullaue aetas miraculis caruit coſterus ieſ apolog part 3 cap 9 pag 555 eccleſia catholica ſemper fuerunt poſſeuinus de notis verbi dei fol 31 power working miracle hath bene perpetually church rome alſo euident note truth thereof vpon preſumption proceed exact proteſtants teſtimonie miracle caluin ſaith ſaith cardinall bellarmine may expected inaſmuch profeſſe ſame doctrine apostle beginning ſufficiently confirmed apoſtolicall miracle thus cardinall hath acknowledged true ſtate controuerſie truth contradiction may euinced teſtimonies antiquitie cleare confeſſions learned aduerſaries firſt antiquitie ſhew b caluinus reſpondit—nos illis iniuriam facere quod miracula ab illis exigimus cum ipſi doctrinam antiquam innumeris miraculis ab apoſtolis martyribus confirmatam praedicent bellar lib 4 de notis eccleſ cap 14 § reſpondet caluiniani nullis ſe miraculis à deo miſſos docent maldon ieſ com ioh 2 18 catechumenus miraculum expectabit à caluiniſta quod vel ipſe praeſtet vel patratum à ſuis veraci hiſtoria confirmet hoc vnum poſtulatum illi o obſtruet cum enim omnia luſtrauerit non poſſit ob oculos ſiſtere vel vnum canem cuius fracta tibia caluiniſtae alicuius precibus hucuſque fuerit reſtituta weſtonus anglus profeſſor duaci lib de triplici hominis officio c 25 confidence miracle later age world preiudiciall vnto chriſtian faith proued teſtimonies ancient father sect 3 3 numquidnam fratres mei quia iſta ſigna non • acitis minimè creditis • ed haec neceſſaria exordio eccleſiae fuerunt vt enim ad fidem creſceret multitudo credentiū miraculis fuerat nutrienda quia no cum arbuſta plantamus tamdiù eis aquam infundimus quouſque ea terra • coalu • ſſe v • deamus ſi ſemel radicem fixerunt irrigatio ceſſabit greg magnu • hom 29 •• ang antè med vſe water yong plant ſaith gregorie new ſet watering ceaſeth haue taken roote ſo miracle neceſſarie firſt ſeedplot church ſound rooting multitude faith made hierome take exception vnto heretikes euen time vanted obſeruandum eſt etiam quòd virtutes dicuntur operari qui non tenent • uangelij veritatem ſicut illis qui dominum non ſequentes nomine eius ſigna faciebant marc 9 hoc aduerſus haereticos qui probationem ſidei ſuae ex eo ſi ſignum aliquod ſecerint arbit • antur hieronym▪ epiſt ad galat cap 3 tom 9 miracle conſidering ſaith power may permitted vnto profeſſe truth goſpell 4 partly replie auguſtine againſt donatist others ſaying moreouer owne time quod dixi nec miracula illa noſtra tempora durare permiſſa ſunt ne anima ſemper viſibilia quaereret eorum conſuetudine frigeſceret genus humanum quorum nouitate flagrauit verum eſt quidem non enim nunc vſque cum manus imponitur baptizatis ſic accipiunt spiritum ſanctum vt loquantur linguis omnium gentium aut nunc vſque ad vmbram tranſcuntium praedicatorum chriſti ſanantur infirmi ſi qua talia tunc facta ſunt quae poſte à ceſſâſſe manifeſtum eſt sed non ſic accipiendum eſt quod dixi▪ vt nunc chriſtinomine miracula nulla credantur auguſt tom 1 retract lib 1 c 13 ſome miracle ſuffered wrought leſt ſoule man ſhould beleeue eye theſe time wherein nemo itaque dicat iſta modò non facere miracula dominum propter hoc praeſentibus eccleſiae temporibus priora praeponere quodam quippe loco ipſe dominus videntibus ideo credentibus ioh 20 praeponit co qui non vident credunt auguſt tom 10 de verb dom ser 18 ſub initiū thoſe must preferred iohn 20 beleeue ſee quiſquis adhuc prodigia vt credat inquirit magnum eſt ipſe prodigiū aug lib 22 de ciuit dei c 8 whoſoeuer ſhall deſire wonder ſhall make himſelfe wonder monſter noting laſtly therefore contra iſtos mirabiliarios cautum fecit deus meus dicens marc 13 nouiſſimis temporibus exurgent pſeudoprophetae qui ſigna facient—ecce praedixi vobis ergo cautos no fecit ſponſus quia non debemus miraculis decipi auguſt tom 9 tract 13 ioh cap 3 chriſt gaue v warning theſe worker maruels mark 13 taught v ſuch falſe prophet worker ſignes ſhould come take heed deceiued 5 quaſi nec hoc ſcriptum ſit venturos eſſe qui maximas virtutes ediderint ad fa • laciam muniendam corruptae praedicationis tertull praeſcript ad finem though written againſt hereticks pretending power miracle ſaith tertullian ſuch worker ſhall come corrupting truth like ſalfe prophet iterum praemonet chriſtus inſtruit ne quis à pſeudoprophetis pſeudochriſtis nomine ſuo facilè fallatur multi inquit venient nomine meo dicentes ego ſum chriſtus multos fallent poſtea addidit dicens vos autem cauete ecce praedixi vobis vnde apparet non ea ſtatim ſuſcipienda aſſumenda quae iactantur nomine chriſti ſed quae geruntur chriſti veritate cyprian ad iubaianum de heret rebaptiz deceiuing many ſaith cyprian wherefore chriſt hath giuen v caueat take heed admit thing done name chriſt ſuch onely done truth chriſt vſe remedie giuen chriſt remembred theodoret viz inſtruimur non credere quando qui talia edit contraria pretati docet theod deut beleeue worke miracle teach vngodlineſſe wherefore need feare chryſoſtome conclude dicit chryſoſtomus non ergo ſides iam—ſatis fundata miraculis nouis indiget confirmari quin potius vtilius eſſe aſſerit ſignis nunc carere quoniam maioris meriti ſit acoſta ieſ lib 2 de procur ſalut indorum cap 9 pag 223 profitable v want miracle matter worthineſſe beleeue thē reaſon alledged author antea per ſigna cognoſcebantur qui erant veri qui falſi chriſtiani—nunc verò tantummodo per scripturas chryſoſt opere imperf • n matth hom 49 et huic aſſentitur salmeron ieſ com epiſt b pauli genere part 3 diſp 3 quid dicis non e iuſtus quia non facis miracula poſſis auri dicere quia non vides non e de corpor • dice fac tu quod petrus fecit sed petrus mihi fecit quia eo ſum corpore quo petrus fecit auguſt tom 8 pſal 130 vnperfect worke paſſeth c non dicat quis ideò verum eſt—quia illa illa mirabilia fac • donatus auguſt de vnit eccleſ cap 16 tom 7 remoueantur iſta vel figmenta mendacium hominum vel portenta fallacium ſpirituum aut enim non ſunt vera quae dicuntur aut ſi h • reticorum mira aliqua facta ſunt magi cauere debemus auguſt ibid vnder name former time ſaith true chriſtians diſcerned
