marginall note engliſh bible printed anno 1576 yeare firſt impreſſion newer editiō although older engliſh bible printed ſame yeare hath ſuch annotation hath bene thus expounded edition namely anno 1601 viz approuing vertue chriſt included within owne perſon ſpread body whole church point perpetuitie vſe miracle confirmation faith maine point difference ought haue bene confirmed apologiſts better proofe one onely obſcure note knew afterward explanation corr • cted apologiſts obiection know generall ſecure defence signa fallere poſſunt verbum dei non poſſit ergo aduerſus antichriſti miracula chriſtus no cautos reddidit praecepit autem nobis deus hunc chriſtum audire luther enarrat matth 7 pag 92 caluinus cap 13 deut si propheta verum praedixerit ad falſum cultum perſuaſerit audiendus non eſt ergo doctrinae profeſſio eſt certiſſima nota eccleſiae caluinus tremelius deut cap 13 confeſſed part bellarm lib 4 de notis eccleſ cap 14 proteſtants ſhall corroborate eſtabliſh truth thereof plaine ſuffrages conſent diuerſe learned aduerſaries make enquirie whether miracle neceſrie among chriſtians biſhop eſpencaeus anſwereth iam cum nullus ſit infidelis faciendorum miraculorum nulla eſt nunc neceſſitas eſpencaeus com 2 tim 3 pag 94 e neceſſarie infidel aske reaſon hereof ieſuite delrio doth well ſatisfie ſaying quod dicit c pauciorum miraculorum hodiè cauſam eſſe inconſtantiam fidei teporē ea quidem vna eſt ſed melior alia quia ſtabilita iam ſemel fide minor vel nulla eſt neceſſitas eorum del rio ieſ diſquiſ magic tom 2 lib 4 cap 4 q 5 sect 2 pag 254 e beſides nowinconſtancie weakneſſe men faith cauſe miracle ſo ſcarce principall reaſon faith establiſhed either litle neceſsitie leſt may thinke therefore hand god ſhortned learned biſhop confeſſeth cauſe muſt directed god cum plurimi ſunt qui fidem eandem cum priſcis fidelibus habeant qui miracula non faciunt non tamen inanis eſt promiſſio quam noluit effectum habere perpetuum ſed pro tempore naſcentis adoleſcentis eccleſiae roffenſis epiſcopus captiu babyl contra luther cap 10 part 4 § caeterùm vt would miracle ſhould haue perpetuall effect proper onely vnto nonage church whereunto iudgement ieſuite acoſta doth accord diligently obſerueth religio chriſtiana vbi humana praeſidia prorſus aberant diuinis eſt fundata miraculis noſtrorum temporum longè alia eſt ratio—quid magnorum ſignorum confirmatione eſt opus—vnū illud potētiſſimū ad fidem efficaciſſimum ac penè ſingulare miraculum more cum fide coniungere acoſta ieſ lib 2 de indorum ſalute cap 9 pag 222 223 diuerſe reſpect herein betweene primitiue church faith founded miracle theſe time wherein ſuch neceſsitie 9 haue furthermore affirmed opinion vſe miracle alſo dangerous owne learned preacher hath taught ſpeaking vſe miracle among chriſtians whether catholicks hereticks ſaith dice nonne rationi conſentaneum eſſet conueniens vt nunc aliq •• fierent miracula—vt magi fides confirmaretur non vtique nam miracula nobis nunc damnum potiús afferrent quám commodum—etiamſi tempore naſcentis eccleſiae fuerint neceſſaria puer enim quando ambulare incipit adiuuatur vehiculo—quod homini adulto eſt impedimento stella luc 11 pag 64 tom 2 miracle would conuenient confirmation faith child weakneſſe wheeleſtoole enabled walke vſe whereof would hinderance vnto cometh perfect age ſo infancie church miracle neceſſary ſtrengthning faith theſe day would inconuenient danger ſenſible vnto v ſhal haue proued next aſſertion viz proteſtants doctrine beleeuing miracle latter time requiſite doctrine beliefe proued publicke confeſsions learned aduerſaries sect 5 10 man exerciſed word truth ignorant prophecied latter time profeſſion miracle ſhal principall meanes apoſtaſie truth sauiour plainly prefining matth 24 24 latter time falſe prophet ſhall ariſe working great ſigns wonder able deceiue poſsible euen verie elect antichriſt 2 theſſ 2 9 man ſinne ſhall come whoſe coming ſhall effectuall working sathan power ſignes lying wonder deceiueableneſſe vnrighteouſneſſe among periſh becauſe receiued loue truth might ſaued therefore god ſhall ſend ſtrong deluſions beleeue lie ſo terrible ſtorme ſafeſt maner beliefe haue learned chriſts word matth 24 beleeue conſtant profeſſion non eſt miraculis fidendum quae fieri aut mentiuntur aut verè praedicant ſed ſoli doctrinae chriſti apoſtolorum apoſtoli enim ſigna ediderunt tantùm ad euangelij praedicationem poſtquā verò latè propagatum eſt euangelium vniuerſo mū promulgatum non eſt opus porrò miracula facere luther dom 2 aduent ex ep ad rom 15 haec verba vnanimes c luther 11 contrarie hereunto generall doctrine romiſh church defending haue heard see aboue sect 2 vſe miracle perpetuall note character church notwithſtanding certaine euen acknowledgement learned ieſuits firſt miracle day antichriſt ſhall ſo great thefalſe ſhal hardly diſcerned true hu • uſmodi magorum ſigna facientium exemplo voluit deus fideles ſuos admonitos eſſe cautos ne turbarentur aut ſcandalizentur ſignis prodigijs impiorum hominum quaſi illa eſſent miracula diuinae virtutis teſtimonia hinc enim apertè cognoſcitur multa videri miracula quae non ſunt proprium eſſe diaboli transfigurare ſe angelum lucis ad circumueniendos mortales ſimulare prophetiam miracula alia quae ſunt dona dei ſupernaturalia pereri •• ieſ com exod 7 diſp 11 pag 404 admoniſhed ſcandalized becauſe ſuch ſubtelty power sathā transfigure himſelfe angell light nay b difficile erit ſpeaking dayes antichriſt diſcerenere vera ſigna á falſis vbi multa magna erunt veris ipſis omninò ſimillima acoſta ieſ lib 2 de temp nouiſſ cap 19 fine ieſuite salmeron ſaith viz etſi vera ſunt miracula antichriſts dicuntur tamen mendacia quia falſum erit id ad quod perſu • dendum inducuntur ſicut falſum conficitur argumentum dialectica quod interdum conſtat ex veris propoſitionibus salmeron ieſ com 2 theſſal 2 diſp 3 § addit paulus though miracle antichriſt ſuppoſed true action yet aiming confirmation error moſt falſe intention euen sophiſtrie true premiſes doth inferre falſe concluſion 12 laſtly theſe ſo great creek error enquire moſt ſafeſt harbour ieſuite acoſta confeſſeth monet chriſtus ecce praedixi vobis matth 24 et dabunt pſeudochriſti ſigna quibus errotem introducantur ſi fieri poſſit electi huic ergo tam horribili procellae opponitur rupes fortiſſma verbi dei quocirca videte diligenter quantum ſint scripturae diuinae praeſidia quae omnem miraculorum vim ſuperant nihil eſt enim verbi diuini authoritate robuſtius c acoſta ieſ conc 1 donun 24 poſt pentecoſt pag 6 ſtrongeſt hold holy scripture ſtrength miracle omnino nulla alia re aduerſus omnes antichriſti praeſtigias truculentiſſimam tyrannidē athletas chriſti perinde armabit atque coeleſtis doctrinae inuictiſſima authoritas meritò autem vbi ſuprema omnium eſt futura tentaio vberiora praeclariora diuinarum scripturarum remedia oppoſita ſunt acoſta ieſ lib 1 de temp nou • ſſ cap 10 ad finem et rurſus paulus quidem ita cenſuit gal 1 si angelus de coelo aluid c quid petius 2 pet 1 habemus ſirmiotem propheticum ſermonem primaeua eccleſia miraculis abundauit cùm eſſent infideles vocandi ad fidem vltima eccleſia cum fideles iam vocati ſint plus scriptura quàm miraculis nit • tur idem quo ſuprà con 1 • 24 poſt pentecoſt verbi • ſeqq ſoldiers chriſt cannot hold ſtronger fort reſiſtance goa fol 14 b found body onely vnconſumed alſo yeelding forth fragrātſmels frō whence caried goa placed church paul yet day ſaith conmentary remaineth free frō corruption witneſſe whereof ſaith heathen nation among country foreſaid conuerſion auſten holdeth leaſt place like manner greatly confirmed vndoubted miracle lately feined ſo credibly teſtified lawfull wri • er thoſe time ſithence acknowledged certaine true learned proteſtants themſelues end doth bede owne chronicle witneſſe auſten beda hiſt l 2 c 2 ante medium ſaith allatus eſt quidam de genere anglorum oculorum luce priuatus c tandem auguſtinus iuſta neceſſitate compulſus ſtectit genu ſua c deprecans vt viſum caeco quem amiſerat reſtitueret per illuminationem vniushominis corporalem plurimorum cordibus fidelium ſpiritualis gratiae lucem accenderet nec mora illuminatur caecus ac verus ſummae lucis praeco ab omnibus praedicatur auguſtinus tum britones confitentur intellexiſſe ſe veram eſſe viam iuſtitiae quam praedicaret auguſtinus ſee hollinſheads chronicle laſt edition volum 1 l 5 c 21 pag 102 b line 51 proue opinion good wrought miracle reſtoring ſight vnto one blind kind miracle hemnigius hemnigius protestant writer auſten perſwaded king religion beda hiſt l 1 c 26 circa med ſaith king miraculorū multorum oſtenſione credens baptizatus eſt hollinſhead vbi ſuprà p 100 b line 60 foxe act monument printed 1576 p 117 prope finē diuerſe miracle ſhewed thoſe time ſo certainly knowne bede reporteth beda hiſt l 2 c 3 fine written epitaph vpon tombe suffultus à deo miraculorum operatione beda hiſt l 2 c 1 verſus finē ſaith quibus verbis b gregorius declarat quod ſanctus auguſt ſocij eius coeleſtiū oſtenſione ſignorū gentem anglorū ad cognitionē veritatis perducebant gregory himſelf l 7 ep 30 indict 1 reporteth herof eulogius atchb alexandria ſaying know whereas engliſh nation c remained hitherto infidelitie helpe prayer c ſend vnto nation auſtine monke monaſtery preach c letter come v health worke hath hand ſurely either ſent ouer worke ſo many miracle nation may ſeeme therein imitate power miracle apoſtles themſelues gregory himſelfe onely affirmeth thoſe miracle alſo hollinſhead onely owne author witneſſe 3 notwithſtanding ſhall conſult owne men ſhall find ſo firme ground crediting ſuch report firſt becauſe owne learned profeſſor franciſcus de victoria diſcuſſing queſtion miracle among indian day xauerius could ſo perſwaded miracula ſigna nulla audio nec exempla vitae adeò religio a—vt teneantur ind • religioni chriſtianae acquieſcere • ran • iſ • u de 〈◊〉 profeſſor regius academ salmanticenſi hiſpaniae relect 5 sect 2 pag 241 ſufficiency thinke indian thereby conuicted bound yeeld aſſent chriſtian faith secondly xauerius himſelfe writ many bookes epiſtles india concerning proceeding cauſe religion whereof directed ſome ignatius loyola father ſocietie ieſuits others familiar ſparing vpon occaſion report wonder hac inſula amboino rem vidi incredibilem ante hoc tempus inauditam—caprum lacte ſuo haedos alentem paruos—ego ipſe rem perſpexi oculis neque enim aliter vt crederem adduci potuiſſem xauerius ieſ lib 2 de rebus indicis epiſt 3 pag 97 nature yet doth make mention healing deafe dumbe lame dead worke could truly deſerue name miraculous power grace thirdly albeit verie inclinable beleeue conuerſion infidel vnto faith god might vouchſafe make viſible vnto thoſe act 2 11 magnalia dei notwithſtanding beſides learned alreadie common date miracle long ſince expired owne learned ieſuite acoſta lately weſt indie laboured abundantly conuerſion paganes vnto chriſt doth confeſſe ſaying quae eſt praedicatio noſtra quae ſiducia ſigna certè non edimus acoſta ieſ lib 4 de indorum ſalute cap 4 pag 365 prodigia nulla producimus neque verò eſt opus ibid cap 12 pag 397 alibi paſſim worke wonder effect miraculous worke neither ſaith neceſſarie 4 therefore produced v preiudice power god grace farre height blaſphemie v may vnderſtand truth god proceeding hath neither need miracle conuerſion infidel lie confirmation faithfull 5 may furthermore informed herein ſame ieſuite acoſta diſcuſſing multos inter haec quaerere illud admi • ari non temerè ſolete animaduerti quid ſit quòd noſtra aetate praedicatione euangelij apud nouas gens miraculorum illa vi non cernatur quam chriſtus ſuis promiſit quaeque ad confirmanda ſuperhumana dogma ſingulariter efficax eſt—argumento eſt mirabilis illa inaudita peregrinatio terra florida vbi—quatuor illi homines militares atque profani diuinitús gratiâ ſanationum donati opera apoſtolica perpetrantes—propter ſanitatum operationes vitaeue innocentiam tantum gloriae admirationis inter barbaros conſequuti ſunt vt propemodum pro dijs adorarentur—cur ergo putamus excelſi dertram ſe continere neque quod poteſt gratiâ miraculorum tot populos ad ſidem trahere—legimus hiſtorijs anglorum quot quàm magna per auguſtinum iuſtum mellitum miracula chriſtus ediderit—cur ergo noſtra tempora deſerta ſunt quibus tanta orbis portio innotuit vt cum ea anglia vniuerſa ſi conſeratur vix domus exigua ad ingentem v • bem ſutura ſit multos vt dixi ad hunc modum ſecum cogitantes pia haec neque indocta quaeſtio tenet queſtion many make age cōuerſion indian appeareth power miracle well terra florida foure men profeſsion ſoldiers hauing miraculous gift healing leading ſanctified life ſo admired barbarian almoſt honoured god ſhall god withdraw omnipotent hand extended vpon engliſh conuerſion ſeeing england ſcarce accounted one houſe great citie compared part world hath bene lately diſcouered 6 anſwereth firſt auguſtine mihi verò illud auguſtini opportunè occurrit qui cùm commemorâſſet paulò antè diuinam vocationem interdum externis ſignis aliquando interno pulſu fieri mox adiungit haec autem vocatio quae ſiue ſingulis hominibus ſiue populis atque ipſo genere humano per temporum oportunitates operatur altae proſundae operationis eſt—cui rei non diſſimile mihi videtur quòd eccleſiam ſuam olim ipſis euangelij cunabulis multorum ſignorum variorum chariſmatum copia congregauerit eandem modò de gentibus non minus mirab • liter mirabilium parcitate colligit diuerſa tempora ſecundùm diuerſas ſuas leges ſapientiae diuerſis rationibus adminiſtrans— god conuerteth men ſometimes outward ſignes ſometimes inward inſpirations conuert either theſe meanes ſtandeth vnſearchable wiſedome god ordinance church cradle call men mighty miracle faith goſpell doth leſſe maruellouſly conuert men without multitude miracle gouerning diuerſe time diuerſe lawes wiſedome 7 secondly giueth reaſon difference mihi quidem aliquoties iſta animo repetenti tam perſpicuae diuerſitatis poteſtate ſignorum illa occurrere cauſa ſolet quòd priſcis temporibus omninò neceſſaria fuerint noſtris non item etenim ſides myſteriorum ſublimium omnem humanam rationem ſuperantium aſtruenda tunc erat apud homines maximè ratione ſua cuncta metientes ad ſolitos calculos reuocantes graecos inquam atque romanos caeteroſue illa aetate ſapientiâ huius ſeculi florentes quomodo per homines paucos ignobiles illiteratos perſuaderi poſſit—niſi diuina quaedam atque incluctabilis euiciſſet autoritas conteſtante deo ſignis prod • gijs varijs chariſmatibus quod etiam paulus apoſtolus ſaepè commendat 1 cor 2 sermo meus inquit non erat perſuaſibilibus humanae ſapientiae verbis ſed oſtentatione ſpiritus virtutis vt fides veſt • non ſit ſapientia hominum ſed virtute dei—ita chriſtiana religio vbi humana praeſidia prorſus aberant diuinis eſt fundata miraculis noſtrorum temporum alia eſt ratio nam ij quibus fides annunciatur omnibus rebus inferiores ſunt ratione cultu authoritate ij qui annunciant antiquitate religionis ſuae multitudine ſuorum ingenio elegantia caeteriſ que copijs ad perſuadendum ſuperiores ſunt abundant— grecian romanes ſaith men learned humane wiſdome ſtood vpon termes naturall reaſon brought vnto chriſt ſeemed vnto almightie god thing conuenient conuerters ſimple vnlearned men ſhould furniſhed diuine power working miracle exceeded naturall meanes paul ſignifieth himſelfe like reaſon ſuch wonderous work among theſe people euery way inferiour vnto conuerters wit iudgement naturall endowment whatſoeuer outward facultie may auatle perſwaſion therefore concluſion wiſheth chriſtian conuerters denique quid magnorum ſignorum confirmatione opus eſt vbi potius deſideratur acutior intelligentia quae altitudinem noſt • ae doctrinae aliqua curioſitate diſquireret vnum illud de gentibus huic nouo orbi potentiſſimum ad • idem efficaciſſimum penè ſingulare miraculum neceſſarium eſt more cum ſide congruentes hoc abundè ſufficit omnibus conceſſum eſt modò velint hactenus ioſephus acoſta ieſ lib 2 de ſalute iudorum cap 9 conformity godly life christian faith ſaith would ſelfe indeed moſt ſingular miracle moſt powerfull ſuccesfull conuerting infidel vnto faith 8 ſo thoſe part india wherein acoſta hath bene ſo long conuerſant ſee reaſon ſhould ſo great difference part india mentioned forbidden scripture ſay 3 reg 20 28 god god vallies mountaines ſo may ſeeme inconſonant men attribute ſo much power miraculous grace vnto eaſt ſo little weſt although experience god working muſt confound reaſoning man yet ſeeing credit man hath thereunto doth depend vpon fidelitie man reporter requiſite euerie ſuch report containe ſelfe within compaſſe due intelligence 9 howſoeuer argument miracle wrought among infidel doth inferre vndoubted difference chriſtian profeſſors amongſt themſelues becauſe chryſoſtomus hieronymus euthymius theophylactus probant multis exemplis etiam per homines inſideles vera miracula facta eſſe—et ex hoc loco matth 7 22 facilè colligitur falſos iſtos prophetas de quibus chriſtus loquitur vera miracula facturos verè prophetâſſe verè daemonia eieciſſe nec enim reſpondit chriſtus mentiri eos ſed quamuis ita fecerint ſe eos non nôſſe maldonat ieſ c • matth 7 22 gift working miracle father owne ieſuite maldonate reſolue neceſſary argument true church except ordinarie alſo becauſe god doth grant gift miracle obſerued ieſuite si obijcias à mali quoque perperam de fide ſentientibus nonnunquam miracula edita fuiſſe ideo miracula non debere cenſeri efficacem fidei probationem occurram ſolere deum aliquando h • nc gratiam gratuitò etiam talibus largiri ſed id verae fidei probationem vt quando dedit prophetiam balaamo ca • phae falſae fidei confirmationem nec dediſſe vnquam nec dare poſſe non magi enim mendacij confirmationem poteſt deus miraculis comprobare quàm poteſt ipſa veritas mentiri delrio ieſuita diſquit magic lib 2 qu 7 tom 1 delrio cardinall ad miraculum nouatiani reſpondeo miraculum factum eſſe non confirmationem fidei nouatiani ſed catholici baptiſmi id enim pro miraculo ſcribit socrates quòd cum ad paulum epiſcopum nou sanctus malchus praeceptor malachiae ſurdo auditum reſtituit quo mi • abile quiddam confeſſus eſt quòd cum ſanctus vtrique auricula hinc inde digitos immiſiſſet duo quaſi porcellos ex ipſis exire ſenſerit another malchus malachias facta oratione tangens digito linguam mutae foeminae ſputum miſit o eius loquentem dimiſit another vir honorabilis venit ad malachiam queſtus de ſterilitate animae ſuae ſupplicans vt ſibi obtineret ab omnipotente deo gratiam lachrymarum ſubridens malachias quòd gratum haberet homine ſeculari deſiderium ſpirituale ſuam maxillam maxilla illius quaſi blandiendo coniungens fiat inquit tibi ſicut petijſti another vrbe eboracenſi acceſſit ad eum prior kirkeham regularium fratrum— aduertens malachiam epiſcopum miniſtros multos habere equos paucos—obtulit ei ſuum quo ipſe vehebatur hoc ſolum dolere ſe▪ inquiens quòd eſſet runcinus reſtie iade durè portans lubentius inquit dediſſem ſi melior fuiſſet—cui epiſcopus non poteſt eſſe vile quod tam precioſa voluntas obtulerit accipit epiſcopus equum ſibi ſterni iuſſit—aſcendit primò quidem durum ſenſ • paulò poſt mira mutatione valdè commodum ſua • iter ambulantem inuenit—factus optimus pretioſus palefridus and▪ much ſort bernard de vita malachiae malachias lazie palfrey may draw iudicious reader doubt whether either malachias could haue bene worker bernard reporter vnlike vnto another tale better metled horſe regiſtred thoſe gothorum tempore cum iohannes vir beatiſſimus huius rom eccleſiae pontifex ad iuſtinianum ſeniorem principem pergeret corinthi partibus aduenit cui neceſſe fuit vt itinere ad ſedendum equus requiri debuiſſet quod illic vir quidam nobilis audiens equum quem pro magna manſuetudine eius coniux ſedere conſueuerat ita ei obtulit vt eo ad loca alia perueniente cum alius equus potuiſſet inueniri deberet ille quē dede • propter ſuam coniugē retranſmitti factumue eſt vſque ad certum locum praedictus vir equo eodem ſubuchente perductus eſt qui mox vt alium reperit illum quem acceperat retranſmiſit cumque cum praedicti nobilis viri vxor ſedere ex voluiſſet vltrà non valuit quia poſt ſeſſionem tanti pontificis mulierem ferre recuſauit coepit namque immenſo flatu fremitu atque inceſſanti totius corporis motu quaſi deſpiciendo prodere quia poſt membra pontificis mulierem ferre non poſſet quod vir eius prudenter intuitus hunc ad eundem venerabilem virum protinus remiſit magnis precibus petens vt equum ipſe poſſideret quem iuri ſuo ſedendo dedicaſſet gregorius dial lib 3 cap 2 yet ſame publiſhed laſt edition councels binius tom 2 fol 376 dialogue paſſe vnder vehement oppoſition againſt luther held paradoxe affirme ſaying docent euangelia chriſtum eieciſſe daemones illumin • ſſe caecos aegrotos ſanâſſe ecce factum apoſtolis inſuper mand • ſſe quatenùs ipſi facerent eadem opera luc 9—aduerte ſimul promiſſionem viz factam effectus ſequuturi cunctis qui eſſent credituri chriſtum—quam certè diebus effectum nullum ſortiri dilucidè cernimus nemo enim eſt qui iam corporaliter daemones eijcit aut ſanat morbos nec tamen ambigimus qum plurimi ſint qui fidem habeant—nec tamen inanis promiſſio quam chriſtus noluit efficaciam habere perpetuam ſed pro tempore naſcentis adol • ſcentis eccleſiae roffenſis epiſcop contra captiu babyl cap 11 part 4 promiſe chriſt gaue vnto diſciples concerning healing ſicke giuing ſight vnto blind diſpoſſeſsing diuels ſuch like ſuch effect theſe day wherein ſee man caſt diuels men body heale diſeaſes ſhall new author deſerue credit make ordinary cure image giue ſtrength vnto lame ſight vnto blind alſo talke nobilis mulier è gallia à ſeptem daemonibus obſeſſa liberatur per stephanum francigenam canonicum auximagnum ante b mariae effigiem anno domini 1589 turſellin ieſ hiſt • auret lib 2 cap 7 alexander garliadinus campo fuit non ignobilis clariſſimam habebat filiam à quatuor teterrimis diabolis vexatam miſeris modis hanc magnâ fiduciâ lauretanae virginis tutelae commendat paulò poſt excuſſis infeſtis illis vexatoribus liberam incolumem filiam recepit ibid lib 4 cap 9 caecis duobus facultas redditur cap 10 caecis duobus lumen oculorum reſtituitur lib 3 cap 25 lipſius virgo hallenſis aſpricollis others non deſunt qui daemonia de corporibus expellant ad quod exorciſtarum ordo inſitus eſt salmeron ieſ comment 1 cor 11 diſp 20 § octauo dubio diſpoſſeſsing one foure another ſeuen vgly terrible diuels 6 fiftly patriarke tharaſius latter councell nice defended worſhipping image therefore condemned councell videtur mihi francofurdienſi concilio verè reprobatam fuiſſe nicaenam ſecundam bellar lib 2 de concil cap 8 § videtur frankford could iuſtly confeſſe preſence biſhops councell tharaſius ſanctiſſimus patriarcha dixit sed quiſpiam dixerit cur miracula à noſtris imaginibus non eduntur cui ſanè ita ſit ab apoſtolo reſponſum miracula non credentibus data ſunt ſed ijs qui incredulitate verſantur hi igitur qui imaginem ita tractabant infideles erant 1 cor 14 qua de cauſa ſignum illis datum eſt à deo per imaginem vt ea ratione ad fidem noſtram chriſtianam traherentur matth 12 generatio adultera quae • ſignum ſignum non dabitur ei conc nicen 2 apud surium tom 3 conc act 4 pag 100 margent cur hodiè imago non edant miracula miracle wrought image amongſt profeſſe christian faith ſtand modeſtie aduerſaries want miracle wrought perſonally men betake themſelues wholy vnto miracle wrought image turſellin hiſt de • de lauret turſellinus lipſius de virg hallenſ aſpricoll lipſius coſterus apolog cap 9 pag 561 coſterus haue done 7 sixtly ieſuite maldonate haue well determined neceſſariò ſequitur cam qua • requentia quaſi ordinaria miracula fiant veram eſſe eccleſiam—nulli hominum ſocietati niſi eccleſiae ſuae ordinariam poteſtatem faciendi miracula conceſſit maldonat ieſ comm matth 7 22 haec verba virtutes multas working miracle cannot neceſſarie argument true church ordinarie ſhall common challenge preuaile whereby ſeeke demonſtrate romane church gift miracle prophecie true note church profeſſing ſauing faith eſpecially ſeeing ieſuite salmeron granteth non deſunt—qui gratiâ polleant ſanationum etſi non frequenter vnde reges galliae angliae peculiari chariſmate ad ſanandum morbum qui collum hominis inuadit nempe ſtrumas praediti ſunt ex omnibus locis ad co • concurritur ad huius doni effectum obtinendum salmero • ieſ com 1 cor 11 diſp 20 § octauo dubio grace healing frequent ordinarie amongſt therfore vphold miraculous power doth alledge onely grace giuen vnto king france england healing ſwelling necke theſe king ſuch healing abſolutely intend miraculous worke ordinary effect whereof cure perfectly inſtant onely power ſpeech touching prayer commend diſeaſed party vnto ordinary meanes god ordinance euen cure phyſitions cannot called work properly miraculous 8 finally ſhall demonſtrate church prophecie make perpetual duodecima nota eccleſiae eſt lumen propheticum—donum certè maximum bellar lib 4 de eccleſ milit cap 15 note true profeſſion text beatus petrus affirmat ioelis prophetiam eccleſia impletam prophetabunt inqui • ioel 2 act 2 filij veſtri ſiliae veſtrae ſeniores veſtri ſomnia ſomniabunt hoc prophetiae donum nullo ſeculo de •••• eccleſiae coſter ieſ apol part 3 cap 10 pag 590 scripture ieſuite hieron theod caeteriue ferè expoſitores tum etiam iuſtinus maetyr dial cum tryphone hilar lib 8 trin chryſoſt hom 4 act homil 1 epheſ oecumen 2 act alij omni •• de hoc viz apoſtles tempore interpretantur nec vnquam alterius temporis meminere—sed quid ego ſanctos patres commemoto cum iudaei nonnulli haec ad tempora meſſiae referant—intelligimus plené impletam eſſe hanc prophetiam ex act 21 poſt domini aſcenſionem varia varijs spiritus ſancti dona extitiſle quidam enim prophetaban • vt agabus filiae philippi nonnulli ex corinthijs 1 cor 14 et act 13 erant antiochiae prophetae atque doctores quidam viſiones videbant vt ioh apoc paulus act 9 petrus act 10 ribera ieſ com ioel cap 2 pag 205 206 cardin bellar lib 4 de notis eccleſ ca 14 proue gift miracle deſcendeth age age cometh vnto seculum decimum tertium wherein liued francis ſaith ſtep lower decimo quarto yet degree lower decimo quinto ſeculo laſt denique hoc noſtro ſeculo prouing gift prophecying proceedeth beyond francis liued thirteenth age hath bene ſhowne doth mention particular prophet neither haue prophecied called prophet ribera proueth father falſly applied ſeeing cōtend proue note agree vnto church innumerable profeſſors mention one particuler ſpace two hundred yeares could rightly deſerue name prophet theſe confeſſions pretence duly compared giue v cauſe thinke nothing ſo maruellous theſe often great oſtentations maruels next reueale ſecond argument taken apparent proneneſſe romaniſts haue ſuggeſting beleeuing ſtrong deluſions eſpecially two kind apparition feined miracle firſt apparition sect 2 9 firſt kind infatuation proceedeth ghoſtly apparition proteſtants dare beleeue whereunto aduerſaries yeeld ſo great confidence make ſpeciall ground defence doctrine quarta ratio qua purgatorium probamus ſumitur ab apparitionibus animarum quae ſe purgatorio eſ • e renunciauerunt opem à viuis implorârunt bellar lib 1 de purg c 7 § 4 greg valent de purg cap 6 purgatorie power tertia ratio quoniam animae c bellar lib 1 de indulg cap 14 pag • 8 indulgence ſome praier dead notwithſtanding viz anima mortuorum vnquam apparere cur fieri non conueniat multas afferunt rationes quòd ea re multorum errorum cauſa eſſe poſ • et—vult chriſtu • viuos scripturarum teſtimonijs contentos eſſe nec à mortuis quid altera geratur vita audire velle maldon ieſuita com luc 16 27 denie ſoules dead appeare vnto liuing yeelding many reaſons thereof eſpecially ſuch apparition cauſes ſeducing error curioſitate viſionum ſignorum salmeron ieſ comm 1 iob 3 ſp 25 § cauendum reioyced maruellouſly deliuered frō curioſity viſions chryſoſt auguſtinus simu • ant • aemones inquiunt anima defunctorum quo faciliùs animis hominum errores gentilium inſerant ad eos decipiendos namque homines animabus defunctorum vel parentum vel cognatorum vel amicorum ſuorum quos diligunt à quibus ſe diligi non dubitant libentiùs promptiùs credunt quàm daemoni quem naturaliter horrent pererius ieſ de magia lib 1 cap 11 affirming moſt eaſie way diuell ghoſtly enemie deceiue v taking vpon reſemblance deareſt friend 10 howbeit ſuch miſt ſuperſtition moſt romaniſts cannot hit high way ancient wiſdome ieſuite salmeron doth preſſe vpon reader hiſtorie maruellous apparition confirmed traiani animam liberatam fuiſſe precibus gregorij ab inferno conſtat— per teſtimonium damaſceni iohannis diaconi anno 870 qui libris de vita greg conſcriptis ad iob 4 pontiſicem lib 2 cap 44 apud eccleſiam anglorum hoc miraculum de traiani ab inferni cruciatibus liberatione orationibus gregorij recenſet fuiſſe celebratum atque illud vt geſtum fuerat lato ſermone perſequitur—hugo aetherianus conſcripſit ad piſanum cle • um qui eum de quaeſtione de chriſtianorum defunctorum ſuffragijs conſulerat vbi cap 15 num ignoratis c habetur bibliotheca patrum 18 circa medium theſe word th • note margent quartus teſtis eſt vincentius bellouacenſis—quintus sigebertus monachus gemblacenſis chron— • extus teſtis eſt b brigitta— b thomas bonauentura reliqui omnes ad vnum ſcriptores scholaſtici qui de eiuſmodi miraculo diſ • eruerunt salmeron ieſ com 1 cor 15 diſp 27 § de • nde cuius etiam rei extat inſigne romae monumentum lapidi antiquiſſimo inſcriptum aede ſacra ipſius gregorij romam ibid ſaith authority damſcene celebrated long ſince church england regiſtred bibliotheke holy father witneſſed sigebertus briget beleeued iuſtified schoolemen honoured ancient excellent monument church rome dedicated vnto gregorie viz gregorie praying ſoule trajane emperour died infidell preuailed god redemption hell damned gregorius pro pagano precatus atque exauditus eſt optione data vt aut eius anima purgatorio per biduum puniretur aut perpetua corpo • aegritudine dum viueret affligeretur atque hoc ſecundum gregorium acceptaſle vnde acuto ſtomachi dolore atque podagra perpetuò laborabat ibid § quiuto vpon condition gregorie himſelfe would contented endure either torment purgatorie two day ſpace elſe ſome bodily affliction day life gregorie choſe latter ſo vexed gout life long 11 perceiue ſuggeſted ſtory ſo calleth miraculous deliuerance yet notwithſtanding theſe authority proofe publike monument memorie thereof credulitie engliſh church romiſh ſchooles gaue vnto biſhop epiſcopus abulenſis q 57 4 reg dicit magnum non eſſe inconueniens hanc totam traiani ſuſcitati hiſtoriam negare salmeron ibid § deinde abulenſis ieſuite verius tamen eſt non eſſe illam hiſtoriam probatae fidei—quia incredibile eſt gregorium oraſſe pro traiano imperatore cum ipſe lib 34 moral cap 13 doceat non eſſe orandum pro damnatis suarez ieſ tom 2 q 52 sect 3 § ad alia suarez cardinal bellarmine forbeare doubt yea ſome iudge magi propendeo ſententiam melchioris cani qui lib 11 de loc c 2 ſimpliciter improbat hanc hiſtoriam vt confictam dominici à soto bellar lib 2 de purg cap 8 § reſpondeo forged ſtorie incredible 12 omit narrat beda viſionem vald • probab • lem cui ipſe fidem adhibere non dubitauit qua oſtenſum fuit cuidam animae—praeter infernum purgatorium regnum coelorum quoddam quaſi pratum florentiſſimum iucidiſſimum amoenum quo degebant animae quae nihil patiebantur—quod •• hi non improbabile videtur bell • r lib 2 de purg cap 7 reuelations new intacke hell call faire medow furſet beleeued literall ſence non poſſum dare fidem illi viſioni apud bedam vt ſonat nec tamen dicam fuiſſe confictam vel mendacem ſed vel non eſſe ad literam intelligendam vel ſub aliqua metaphora suarez ieſ tom 4 thom diſp 46 sect 1 num 12 13 deinde ipſamet deſcriptio illius locus amoeni prae ſe ferre videtur abſurditatem nam c ibid diſliked among themſelues briget catharine alſo hath bene plura ſimilia legi poſſunt apparitionibus brigittae c—reſpondent magdeburgi fabulas eſſe bellar lib 1 de purg cap 7 brigittae gettrudis aliarum ue reuelationes haeretici pro ſomnijs reijciunt coſterus ieſ enchirid tit de eccleſia pag 104 obiected henricus de haſſia syb • llanus ambo catholici ſed vt verum dicam nonnihil audaces volunt reuclationes brigittae—non debere haberi pro indubitanter veris—certitudine morali del rio diſq magic lib 4 cap 1 q 3 sect 4 reiected containing themſelues ſome iohannes franciſcus picus dicit harum ſanctarum ſcil brigittae catharinae senenſis reuelationes contradictorias eſſe quare alterā earū falſitatis neceſſariò conuinci quia catharina ſibi reuelatum prodijt deiperam virginem cum originali peccato conceptam fuiſſe brigitta contrà eam ab huius macula aſperſione ab initio liberam extitiſſe—sunt qui reſpondent catharinam deceptam fuiſſe—alij volunt hanc catharinae reuelationem poſteà à defenſoribus illius ſententiae confictam fuiſſe—s antoninus ſcribit ſi quis obijciat hanc reuelationem brigittae ſciendum eſt alias ſanctas miraculis claras contrariam reuelationem habuiſſe delrio ieſ quo ſuprà contradiction kind fancy confeſſed diuerſe see aboue heretickes ſome ex reuelatione priſcillae deluſus tertullianus probare volebat animam eſſe corpoream salmeron ieſ com 1 ioh 3 diſp 25 § videndum secundello diacono nocte apparuit tentator ſpecic domini dicens ego ſum chriſtus c delrio quo ſuprà lib 4 c 1 q 3 sect 5 catholicks haue bene deceiued inſomuch one among hath doubted iudge hieronymus magius—ſcribit nunquam quae circa mortuorum ſepulchra conſpiciantur ſimulachra eſſe anima mortuorum ſed daemones aut malos genios hominum deceptores—idem cenſuit tiraquella delrio ibid lib 2 q 26 § 1 wandring ghoſts ſepulchers dead nothing elſe transfigured diuels another admoniſheth men vſe diligence expel viſions praier faſting bonauentura ſcribit toto conatu repellandam eſſe viſionem vel reuelationem orationibus corporis macerationibus salmeron ieſ com 1 ioh 3 diſp 25 § si igitur ſecond argument taken aduerſaries proneneſſe beleeuing feined miracle partly proued partly confeſſed sect 3 13 houſe ladie lauretta eadem illa domus qua annnnciatio angelica facta eſt aue maria c miniſterio angelorum primùm ill ricum poſteà italiam tranſlata eſt vſque praeſentem diem perſeuerat lauretana eccleſi • appellatur ſumma religione habetur suarez ieſuita thom part 3 q 30 art 1 sect 5 ſuppoſe wherein bleſſed virgin receiued angelicall ſalutation haile mary full grace c magnified romaniſts day inſcription minimè fabuloſa hiſtoria cuius eſt haec inſcriptio hic tabernaculum dei cum hominibus coſterus ieſ apolog part 1 cap 14 turſellin ieſ initio hiſt hath god tabernacle men whereunto iuſtus baronius reporteth eſt hîc non ſtato die quod plinius de fano ſuo gloriatur ſed toto anno maximus vniuerſo ex orbe hominum confluxus maximum ex gallijs germania hiſpanijs indijs ac remotiſſ • tiam populis principibus ac regibu • anathemata quotidiana ſanationum miracula plurimae re aguntur plurima vota ſuſcipiuntur plurima redduntur quae • emnia oculis noſtris vidimus pic mirati veneratique ſumus et paulò poſt facio haec maximi faciunt mecum tot religioſi millenorum peregrinorum animi qui quotannis magno ardore magno numero ad hanc ſacram aedem tanquam ad veriſſima ſaluatoris incunabula conuolant iuſtus baronius epiſt lib 3 ep 14 suarez ieſuita thom part 3 q 30 art 1 turſellinus ieſ throughtout hi • whole booke vpon ſubiect daily concourſe ſort people part world reaſon continuall miracle wrought thereat houſe ladie lauretta extoll verùm inter omnes b virginis aedes omni genere vna eminet lauretana quae fama orbis terrarum omnium terram impleuit turſellinus epiſt dedic ad hiſt lauret excelling houſes ladie throughout whole world eſt autem hoc praecipuum ac proprium templi lauretani vt eius religio ſanctitas quotidiè magi effloreſcat id adeò vel ex celeberrimarum aedium b virginis aliorumque diuorum facilè apparet turſellinus praefat hiſt lauret hauing peculiar gift aboue houſes ladie saint deuotion giuen vnto doth daily increaſe 14 ſhall need enquire miracle wrought ſeeing greateſt miracle ſelfe beleeue baronius anno chriſti 9 num 1 cardinall baronius lib 3 epiſt 14 iuſtus baronius together ieſuits suarez thom 3 q 30 art 1 suarez coſterus ap • l part 1 cap 14 coſterus turſellin hiſt de domo lauret turſellinus laſt may ſpeake reſt eſpecially ſeeing hath bene commended haue ſet forth hiſtorie thereof haec omnia elegantiſſimè ſunt à turſellino libris quinque explicata iuſtus baronius quo ſuprà moſt elegantly therein priuiledged late pope clemens octauus title clemens papa octauus ad futuram rei memoriam cùm ſicut accepimus dilectus filius horatius turſellinus c frontiſpicio hiſt de domo lauret beloued child 15 houſe lauretto therefore ieſuite turſellinus writeth anno virgin partu 1291 natalem deiparae domum galilaea ſitam interualla locorum denia itinera telis barbarorum infeſta haudquaquam aduenarum religioni opportunam faciebāt quae cauſa admirandi poſt hominum memoriam ad eum diem inauditi miraculi fuit turſellinus ieſ hiſt lauret lib 1 c 1 amiſſo cultu galilaea diuinitùs aſportatur dalmatiam—vt illyrici annales perhibent ann flum apud hieron angel ibid cap 2 haec fundamentis ai • ulſa atque haud • bio angelorum miniſterio inde vſque à gallilaea mirum dictu audituque per ingentes terrarum mari tractus dalmatiam tranſlata quippe id ſpacium patet amplius vicies centena paſſuum millia turſell ibid ex eodem hieron ang houſe wherein virgin marie borne ſeated galily yeare chriſt 1291 poſſeſſed barbarian depriued ancient worſhip giuen vnto tranſlated hand angel galily dalmatia contained diſtance two thouſand mile caeterùm q • adriennio non toto decrant quippe menſes quinque interiecto ſancta aedes ex dalmatarum finibus ceſſit cauſa incer • eſt—ibid cap 5 ex ann hieron ang et coeleſte hoc donum mira oportunitate tranſmiſſum italiae eſt anno 1294 qua tempeſtate funeſtis guelforum gibillinorumue factionibus diuiſa odijs belliſue ciuilibus tota ſlagrabat ex authore hieron ang virgo deipara pacem ſalutemue italiae ferens piſeno ſuae domi ſedem optauit—conſedit recinetenſis agri ſylua mille circiter paſſus à mari—cui ſyluae à matrona eius domina lauretae nomen fuit—inde lauretana aedes appellata ibidem cap 6 hence within ſpace full foure yeares departed ſlitted ouer ſea itali • time italy diuided hote faction guelphes gibillines ſeated region picenum wood lauretto whence name called lady houſe lauretto tenet fama nec vana fides venienti deiparae domicilio • bore obuias velut venerabundas inclin iſle ſe ac deinde pronas perſtitiſle quoad aeuo ventis ferro procumberent ibid cap 6 erat b mariae ſacellum loco deuio frequenti ſylua proceriſue arbaribus ſepta—eò plerique inermes ibant ſatis ſibi praeſidij virgine locus praeſide reponentes—breui totus ille ſaltus latrocinijs caedibuſ que infeſtus atque infamis abſterritis aduenis ſolitudinē eſt redactus iamque indie obſoleſcente c • ltu ſacroſancta aedes euaneſcebat—ſublimis aufertur ab angelis collis ſiſtitur vertice mille ferè paſſus à priore loco—poſſidebant cum collem communiter frat • e germani duo recinetenſes ex hieron angel concordibus animis ibid ca 7 approaching houſe mother lord tree forreſt bow vnto continued ſo bent vntill either blowen downe wind cut downe ax fell downe owne corruption wood proued harbour multitude theeues robbed ſlew many deuout pilgrim ſuch came honour vnto holy houſe cauſed houſe remoue thence taken vp hand angel placed diſtance mile vpon little hill belonged vnto two brother great concord betweene themſelues ex ſratrum colle ob corum auaritiam qui ſacro auro inhiabant diſcordiamque demigrat—conſtat enim ex h •• ron ang nondum vertente anno poſt eius italiam aduentum co colle vbi nunc viſitur conſediſſe turſellin ibid lib 1 cap 8 poſtrema haec migratio contigit anno 1295 ibid cap 10 yet ere yeare came end reaſon diſſention couetouſneſſe ſharing ſacred offering kindle betweene cauſed forſake hill chooſe another hard euer ſince hath continued indeed miracle true worthie pen fift euangeliſt falſe vnworthie monument verie pagan re quamuis admirabilis antea inaudita vſque eò tamen certa iam explorataue habetur vt de ea ambigere dubitare ſit nefas quippe ſumma fide à maioribus velut per manus accepta deinceps traditur poſteris nec illyricis recinetenſibuſue monumentis ſolùm ſed hiſtoricorum pontiſicum authoritate nixa eſt turſellin • ſ praeſ • hiſt although matter wonderfull vnheard ſaith turſelline yet ſo certaine tried impietie doubt thereof becauſe receiued faithfull tradition forefather deliuered vnto poſteritie recorded hiſtories illyrian italian placuit praetori dalmatiae certos homiues galilaeam mittere totam rem intentius inſpecturos—nazarethum galilaeae vrbem pergunt—cernunt • eam vbi domus ſteterat dimenſi longitudinem ac latitudinem areae fundamentorum craſſitiem reperiunt omnia prorſus conuenire idem lib 1 cap 4 wherein find firſt remoue thereof dalmatia people illyria ſent meſſengers galilie trie place foundation iuſt proportion found agreeable beatae mariae monitu per ſomnum eremita cuius nomen non proditur qui obteſtabatur b virginem vt quid tandem facelli eſſet vnde eſſet certo aliquo indicio declararet picentes ex eodem authore hieron ang ad rem explorandam impellit c turſellin lib 1 cap 12 deuout eremite whoſe name reuealed came worſhip lauretto praied vnto bleſſed virgin concerning houſe beſeeching manifeſt ſome euidence whence ſhe ouercome prater admoniſhed dreame moue people picenum ſend meſſengers dalmatia galilie inquire truth matter fifteene meſſengers ſent auouched true 17 ſumme ſtory concerning diuerſe miraculous ſtations houſe made progreſſes galily vnto little hill italy ſtands ſee proued eyewitneſſes demand witneſſes theſe witneſſes meane ancient hiſtories haue recorded truth ſo admirable miracle turſellinus promiſed make infallible record illyricum recinetum euidences yet maketh hieronymus angelita author nec dubia re author eſt hieronymus angelita virginis lauretanae hiſtoria quam clementi pontifici max dicauit eo ipſo tempore cum hoc viſentibus miraculo erat turſellinus lib 1 hiſt • auret cap 9 onely author ſee euery teſtimony ſaith turſellinus dedicated hiſtory vnto pope clement ſeuenth proueth due poſtrema anno 1295 turſell lib 1 cap 10 clemens 7 vixit anno 1523 coſterus ante enchirid catalogo hieronymus niger refert cum renunciatum anno 1523 maſſonus vita clementis 7 computation author angelita liued 228 year time theſe ſuppoſed euents turſellinus coming 90 yeares angelita dare aſſure v truth yet complaineth dcinde maiorum noſtrorum talibus rebus memoriae prodendis incuria bonam partem ſubtrahebat materiae idem turſellinus praef hiſt ſ • an paulò poſt initium negligence anceſtors preſeruing memorie ſuch thing hath depriued v ſaith good part matter concerning ſtorie 18 wherefore although iudge impietie doubt truth much diſpute againſt yet haue report giuē v cauſe ſhall perſwaded houſe would make choiſe countrie italie whole nation rent two moſt extreme faction ſeeing could endure ſtay vpon little hill becauſe diſſention two brother thinke would forſake wood becauſe harbour theeues yet ſtill remaine italy patroneſſe ſtewes triall eyewitneſſes ſhould able diſcerne whether whole sunt qui non tam domum quim cubiculum putent à caetera ſeiunctum domo quidem haud poenitet eotum ſententiae eſſe quibus ſimul cubiculum virginis domum fuiſle placet c turſellinus lib 1 cap 2 houſe chamber notwithſtanding diuell called laurctano quod iulius 3 pp approbabat italicè ſcripto tranſlated latine nephew lodouic 1562 booke profeſſedly written ſubiect intituled de idolo laurctano wherein theſe aduertiſements among many others verie conſiderable 20 firſt cum attentè perquaeſierim quo anno contigerint iſta miranda quae narrant animaduerti ea anno 1296 vt dicunt contigiſſe petrarcha vixit anno 1304 qui ſcripſit librum de rebus memorandis prodigia prodididit quae eo tempore contingebant—boccacius anno 1314 libr • ſcripſit decameronem vel principem galeotum quo centum partim fabulas partim hiſtorias narrat—antomus anno 1459 archiepi • copus florentiae ex ſecta dominicana ſcriptor ſuperſtitioſ • ſſimus itidem diligentiſſimus c • onicon ſcripſit deſcribens ea quae ducentis ann ante ſe contingerant centum folijs deſcribit ea quae dominico acciderunt dcindè aggreditur thomam aquinatem vincentium iordanum monachos eorum miracula franciſci ſtigmata—eodem tempore vincentius monachus hiſpanus quem ſanctum appellant qui aliquot ſermones de ſanctis qui hiſpania gallia italia ſunt impreſſi magno honore precio habentur à ſuis co ſermone qui eſt de aſſumptione virginis ita ſcribit homines mulieres peregrinando frangunt ſibi collum efficiuntur peiores quia aliquando vadunt caſtae redeunt meretrices ideò ſpiritualiter fiat peregrinatio ſicut dicit paulus ſpiritu viuamus ſpiritu ambulemus hodie athanaſius concerning sermo b patris noſtri athanaſij alexandrini epiſcopi de imagine noſtri ieſu chriſti de miraculo ciuitate beryto prodito—ex qua cùm iudaei cam contumelioſè tractâſſent expuendo vtilitatis attuliſſe tum incommodationis plurimum—iuſtiſſima eſt ludouici querela de hiſtorijs quibuſdam eccleſia confictis prudenter ille ſanè ac grauiter eos arguit qui pietatis loco duxerint mendacia pro religione fingere id quod maximè periculoſum eſt minimé neceſſarium mendaci quippe homini ne verum quidem credere ſolemus quamobrem qui falſis atque mendacibus ſcriptis mentes mortalium maximam —quoad corpus imaginautis plurimum poſſe docetur id ratione experientia ratione quia imaginatio dum retractat rerum obiectarum ſenſu perceptarum ſimulachra excitat potentiam appetitiuam vel ad timorem vel ad pudorem vel ad iram vel ad triſtitiam hae verò affectiones hominem ſic afficiunt vt calore vel frigore alteretur vt pall • ſcat vel rubeſcat quaſi exiliat ſeu efferatur vel torpeſcat ſeu deijciatur delrio ieſ diſq lib 1 cap 3 q 3 initio imaginatiue vertue mirandulanus toſtatus medina ieſuit delrio others confeſſe moſt effectuall like caſes laſtly becauſe aduerſaries haue v obſerue truly miracle diſeaſe sciendum eſt quodſi habitum ex toto homini ade • erit eam nullâ ſibi naturali poteſtate quant • cun • ue ſ • poſſe reſtituere ſecus eſt ſi ex parte tantùm laeſerit aut vitiarit nam tunc ſanitatem reddere poterit ne que tamen perfectè sunt enim ſanationes diaboli imperſectae quemadmodum fatentur omnes qui à magi sagis aut sortilegis ſanati ſunt anaſtaſius cochhelet paleſt concluſion thinke haue bene miraculous c • auing pardon ſerious confutation ſo ſtrawiſh childiſh intoxication whereunto incredulitie ſome manner enforced draw concluſion greateſt ſecuritie chriſtian hominum vt arethas notauit—deinde licet vera ſunt ratione formae quia interdum re veras operabit • r▪ ſed quae non ſuperabunt vires totius naturae ideo non vera miracula erunt formaliter quae à ſolo haue heart heart eies deſire miraculous ſtudie truly vertuous si talis vita noſtra eſſet qualē scripturae inſtituunt multo magi de nobis qu • de ſigna facientibus gentile admirarētur signa enim non verè ſed phantaſticè nonnunquam apparuiſſe ſuſpicati ſunt à daemonibus fieri credita quamuis noſtra ſemper veriſſima fuerint vita verò integra nullam vnquam patitur ſuſpicionem ſed omnium hominum qui detrahunt os facilè obſtruit virtutis poſſeſſio—extermina ab te omne delictum—magnus enim daemon • eccatum eſt maior tu eris mihi crede quàm qui daemonia eijciunt—si ex inhumanitate miſericordiam tranſieris ſicca • • ancam manum recuperâſti ſi theatralibus ludis relictis eccleſiam petieris claudicantis pedem incolumitati reſtituiſti ſi ocu • o à meretricio aſpectu reuocaueris coecum illumin • backſlide void excuſe pretence ſimplicitie hereunto auguſtine doth accord writing vnto donatiſts ſaith qui ſententiā ſuam quamuis falſam que peruerſam nulla animoſitate aut pertinacia defen lunt praeſertim quam non audacia ſuae praeſumptionis pepererunt▪ ſed à ſeductis errorem lapſis parentibus acceperunt▪ quaerunt autem cauta ſolicit • dine veritatem corrigi parati cùm inuenerint nequa quam ſunt inter haeretic • deputandi—quanquam ipſum haereticum quamlibet odioſa ſuperbia tumidum peruicacia malae contentionis inſanum ſicut vitandum monemus ne fallat paruulos ita non abnuimus quibu • cun que modis poſtumus corrigendū vnde factum eſt vt ad nonnullos donatiſtarū primarios ſcriberemus non cōmunicatorias literas c auguſt initio epiſt 162 gloris eluſio donatiſts intituling theſe fratres defend falſe doctrine without obſtinate boldneſſe eſpecially ſuch haue bene author thoſe error either receiued parent • r ſ • duced others carefully ſeeke truth readie refermed ſoone ſhall ſee wandrings ſuch men ſay ſaith eſteemed heretikes 7 yet farre v ſo preſume ſimple rather ſottiſhignorance ieſuite tolet hath done booke inſtructions prieſts teacheth rurſus ſi ruſticus circa articulos rurall man ignorant article ſaith ſhall beleeue hereticall doctrine biſhop ſhall teach ſaith tolet doth merit thus beleeuing becauſe bound beleeue vntill perceiue contrary vnto church neuer doctrine rurall ſimplicitie taught ancient father thinke follower preſent time one bound beleeue man preaching heriticall doctrine • law apoſtle ſaith galat 1 8 although angell heauen ſhall preach vnto otherwiſe haue preached vnto let accurſed ſheweth man conſcience bound beleeue onely truth although taught diuell perſon preaching hereſie although ſhould angell heauen alſo ſuch beleeuer hereſie ſhould merit god erroneous faith ſeemeth exceed boūds chriſtian instruction ſo ſimplicitie e • ring ſhould excuſed onely à tanto à toto onely euen iuſtified alſo approued call meritorious good ſay corrupt life worſhipper cannot defile worſhip god himſelfe hath ordained ſanctified 10 secondly euerie corrupt cuſtome vſed publike worſhip god doth immediatly enforce ſeparation church except cuſtome ſelfe idolatrous reade deut 12 high place groues expreſly forbidden god yet excelſa era • alti colles quibus contra legem dei ſed tamen patiente deo ſub frondoſis arboribus ſacrificârunt ac primùm deut 12 deus ea prohibuit subuertite omnia loca luco • comburite—deinde iudicum tempore ad ea ſacrificari permiſit primò gedeon iudg 6— saul 1 reg 9 salomō 1 paral 2 3 reg 3 dilexit autem salomō dominum excepto quòd excelſis immolabat— sigonius obſerueth vſed holy men vntill building temple gedeon salomon concerning vſe auguſtine ſaith de hoc inſtituto ſic auguſtinus librum iudicum deus conſuetudinem populi ſui qua praeter eius tabernaculum tamen non dijs alienis offerebant ſed domino ſuo ſuſtinebat potiù • quàm vetabat etiam ſic audiens offerentes vt refert carolus sigonius de repub heb lib 2 cap 4 god beholding cuſtome people offering ſacrifice without tabernacle yet god himſelfe ſuffer rather forbid graciouſly heard thoſe offered 11 thirdly corruption doctrinall may conſidered either vniuerſally held either leſſe common expoſition ſecond reſpect iuſt cauſe diuiſion abouenamed example see aboue sect 2 church iewes corinth galatia epheſus thiatyra sardis warrant v treatiſes whence forenamed teſtimonies haue bene borrowed proofe ſome dying vnitie church may ſaued ſhall find proteſt againſt doctrine worſhip commonly profeſſed practized therein iudgement idolatrous antichriſtian holding damnation themſelues conſent thereunto yet daring cloſe armes chriſt ſtretched vpon croſſe embrace without obſtinate blindneſſe error point faith purpoſe continuance knowne ſinne ſhall thomas touch faith print ſides haue conſciences dyed precious bloud haue conceiued ought ſaluation ſuch onely romiſh erroneous church taught vtterly deſpaire ſoule doth deſpaire mercie god chriſt ſhall faith woman bloudie iſſue matth 9 touch hemme veſtment▪ knoweth great vertue may iſſue hath coloſſ 2 9 fulneſſe godhead dwelling bodily 13 ſo much leſſe may deſpaire ſome vnto wherein true baptiſme profeſſion chiefeſt principle faith hereunto annexe ſixt poſition viz church rome properly catholike particular church therefore church ſubiect vnto errour sect 6 15 heare ſide bellar lib • • r • pont cap 4 initio church rome cannot erre see sect following faith probable ground priuiledge leſuite valentia alledgeth quaeſtio eſt vtrum petri ſucceſſor vniuerſali eccleſiae cu • â ſit qui rom pontifex ex quo iure—verum ex diuino iure chriſtus voluerit vt hic ſucceſſor eſſet petro rom epiſcopus—an ſold •• humano—re • ert non parum hocſcire nam ſi tantùm iure eccleſiaſtico poſſit fieri vt vniuerſalis paſtor eccleſiae ſit—non romanus ſed antiochenus vel nullius particularis determinatè—atque etiam ex hac quaeſt • one pendet vt poſtea patebit quomodo illud eccleſiae romanae priuilegium intelligendum ſit cum ab ea dici ſole • rectum atque apoſtolica ſides non poſſit deſicere ſicut • exempli cauſa eccleſia conſtantinopolitana—suppoſing chriſts inſtitution quâ quidem ex ſequitur n • nqurn nuinò • uturum vt ij à rectum fide deſciſcant qui fidem ſequentur eius qui legitimus erit atque permanebit epiſcopus dioeceſis romanae ſiue illius dioeceſis loco maneat ſiue alibi c greg valent ieſ analyſ lib 7 cap 12 per totum adding proofe ſeate rome ex inſtitutione chriſti opinionem cam driedoms turrecrem ſucceſſor peter vniuerſall biſhop church ordinance chriſt appointed biſhop rome humane authority yeelding effect conſequence viz poſſible papall authoritie might tranſlated vnto ſome dioceſſe vnto antioch elſewhere could church rome pretend priuiledge neuer erring true faith quòd epiſcopus romanus quia romanus eſt ſit petri ſucceſſor ex facto petri • tum habuit non ex prima inſtitutione chriſti nam potuiſſet petrus nullam ſedem particularem ſibi vnquam eligere bellar lib 2 de rom pont cap 12 § verò senten tia eſt dominici de soto rationem dominicae ſucceſſionis iure eccleſiaſtico tantùm ann • xam eſſe epiſcopatui romano valenti ieſ quo ſuprà biſhop rome ſaith cardinall bellarmine appointed chriſt ſucceſſor peter biſhop rome whence due inference follow therfore romane church romane church hath ſpeciall prerogatiue ſhall neuer apoſtate faith doth ſame epiſtle boniface proofe ſame rectè pro officio ſecetunt rom pontifice • malè autem africani qui etiam tunc vt teſtatur bonifacius 11 epiſt ad eulalaum meditari vide bantur detectionem à romana de ſuo magno malo vt qui pauſò poſt vandalorum arianorum poteſtatem vene • nt non ſubſcripſie autem accrbis illis literis b auguſtimus qui ſummaſemper vene • atione apoſtoheam ſedem romanam coluit coſterus ieſuita e •• hirid de summ pontif ob 10 pag 159 coſteru • would gladly exempt auguſtine act ſubſcribing vnto decree councell 〈◊〉 without witneſſe defection ſchiſme thoſe africanes ſubiection pope others lindanus doth herein moſt buſily beſtirre himſelfe caeterùm hanc bonitacij 11 epiſtolam eſſe genuinam minim ſuppoſititiam ſatis ſuper ue arguit quod ante annos 500 tal • indubitatò credebatur ex ca enim gratianus capitulum recitat non exiguum antoninus quoque florentinus veterum rerum ſtudioſus perueſtigator nobis atteſtator rem hanc longé veriſſimam sub hoc pont inquit bomfacio 11 venit romam relatio ab africanis epiſcopis qui de vnanimi voluntate atque concilio deliberauetunt atque conſtituerunt vt carthag menſis epiſcopas omnia conſtitueret que faceret de concilio romanae apoſtolieae ſedis cuius ex africanae conſtitutionis vi eula • ium carthaginenſem videre eſt compulſum vt rom eccleſiae ſeu capiti reconciliaretur à quo per annos circiter centum ſacrilega illa ſub aurelio carthaginenſi detectione • e • e ſubdux • rant—quare qui hanc africanae feeleſiae reconciliationem hac bonifacij epiſtol • • ulalij carthagmenſis ſupplicatione antonimue hiſtoria conteſtatam ſeu ſictitiam rident quid quaeſo nobis imò ſibi relinquent ſaluum ex omni eccleſiaſti • ae antiquitatis hiſtoria quo re pridem eccleſiae negotijs geſt noſtri ſecul • academic • probent atque corroborent 〈◊〉 panopl euang lib 4 cap 89 ſine certè cùm paulò poſteà omnes afrorū eccleſiae ab artianis qui totā alatico duce occupârant africā poſtiderentur quae aut donati deſciuerant ſchiſma ad 400 iam ipſo auguſtino adhuc ſuperſtite aut profectò á recto declinarant non mirum eſt totam africam per ominem illam vandalorum captiuitatem fuiſſe ſcluſmancam atque à toto chriſti corpore eccleſia nobilis vniuerſo reliquo chriſti comungeret corpori • danu thid ſtorie ſaith confirmed epiſtle pope boniface ancient record called queſtion haue eccleſiaſticall antiquitie certaine vnquestionable confirmation matter cencerneth ſtate church 23 ſpirit contradiction hath thus poſſeſſed principall doctor romiſh church reader wil preſently obſerue epiſtle falſe ſuch like papall eccleſiaſticall confeſſors martyr muſt called martyr ſchiſmaticks iudged cùm praeſertim certum exploratumue ſit nullam eſſe poſſe ſchiſmaticorum coronam praemiū quae non—niſi dentur eccleſia catholica—cum ſi eius bonifacij ſtare poſſet epiſtola corruere neceſſe eſſet ex ca parte dei illam ſtructuram quae tot martyrum confeſſorum viuis eſſet aucta lapidibus baronius quo ſuprà num 93 crowned bliſſe damned hell many age died greeke church anciently preſent diuided romane iuriſdiction aduerſaries called ſchiſmaticks euen day yet ſome affirme alij verò opinantur graecos ſolùm eſſe ſchiſmaticos non haereticos schiſmaticos quidem quia à rom pontificis iuriſdictione poteſtate ſe ſubtrahunt haereticos non item quontam praedictis fidei articulis potiùs nomine quim à rom eccleſiae ſenſu diſſentiunt maine point dicunt spir à patre per • iluim procedere ab omni aeternitate afterward ieſu • te himſelfe hath reckoned ſeemed erroneous greeke church paſſeth deeper cenſure vpō peraduenture hereticks quicquid fit de hi • ce fidei articulis quibus multi graeci alij orientales fortâſſe malè fide errant proinde haeretici ſunt azor ieſ • iſt moral part 1 lib 8 c 20 § decimò quaeritur onely ſchiſmaticks hereticks ſchiſmaticks onely becauſe ſaith aduerſarie acknowledge pope iuriſdiction ouer 27 like might ſaid remote church aſſyria elſewhere wherein innumberable profeſſors beleeue chriſt sonne god field 3 booke church one hath ſhewne keepe true foundation chriſtian faith muſt euerie one theſe likewiſe periſh want dependance vpon romane sea rather theſe example church number ſo many ſome time ſo ancient ſo large extent moſt memory ſo famous gracefull plainely tell v credo c sanctam catholicam apoſtolicam romanam eccleſiam omnium eccleſiarum matrem magiſtram agnoſco romanoue pontifici beati petri annexa conc trid beleeue church rome catholike church biſhop thereof ordained chriſt chiefe paſtor ouer ſoule vnto vpon paine damnation owe ſubiection neuer entred creed 28 may doubt france may cenſured whoſe king account better councell trent rex chriſtianiſſimus negabat ſe habere hunc conſeſſum viz conc trident pro oecumenica legitimè congregau synodo ſed magi pro conuentu priuato thuanus ſafetie one romane church peremptorily onely exclude church proteſtants france germany england scotland polonia denmarke heluetia hungarie sueuia place hope life alſo ſame conſequence aſian church watered bloud glorious martyr beſides many orthodoxall ſoules church haue bene time innumerable haue ſubiected themſelues vnto romane papacie 30 referre caſe vnto wiſedome chriſtian reader iudge profeſſors ſtand abſolute catholike vnion chriſtians whether proteſtants diſcerning betweene men erros perſons ſo farre communicate hope chriſtians liuing godly life fundamentally profeſſe faith chriſt romaniſts aduancement one church deliuer vp vnto sathan vnto deſperation chriſtian church profeſſors world conſideration hath begotten eight poſition viz foreſaid pretence neceſſarie vnion romane head church proue either ſame romane head elſe romane church ſchiſmaticall sect 8 31 cometh conflict wherein find romane bodie head councell pope like vnto iacob eſau ſtriuing birthright preeminencie no defendimus ſummum pontificem ſimpliciter abſolutè eſſe ſupra eccleſiam vniuerſam ſupra conc • lium generale ita vt nullum ſupra ſe iudicem agnoſcat bellar lib 2 de conc author cap 17 principio defend ſaith cardinall bellarmine pope abſolutely aboue vniuerſall church generall councell acknowledging iudge ouer haec quamuis nullo decreto publico definita eſt tacito tamen doctorum conſenſu vt aliae quaeſtiones eccleſia olim ortae non paucae plané definita eſt vix vno ampliùs doctiore theologo aliam de hac ſententiam tenente—quàm papam concilio veluti caput corpori praeeſſe stapl doctr princip lib 13 cap 15 § dixeram tertiò pope aboue councell ſaith stapleton defined ſecret conſent diuines ſcarce one holding contrarie ſhould preferre authoritie councell iuriſdiction pope qui concilium vniuerſale pontifice ſuperius faciunt pugnant illi reuera licet non aduertentes cum certiſſima fide de petri ac rom pontificis eccleſia primatu gregorius de valent analyſ lib 8 cap 7 § atque hinc pag 87 col 2 ſaith ieſuite valentia thereby oppugne vndoubted faith primacie pope 31 doubt doctrine ſo vniuerſall church proue pope defendant ſchiſmaticall councell baſil caſe thus collected hierome auguſtine two ancient pope viz neceſſarie probatur authoritatibus papam ſubeſſe concilio si authoritas quaetitur inquit hieron orbis maior eſt vrbe—ex hinc ſi mater omnium fidelium eſt eccleſia romanum etiam pontificem ſilium habet aliâs verò ſicut beatiſt auguſtinus praedicat nunquam habebit deum patrem qui eccleſiam noluerit recognoſcere matrem quod anacletus intelligens vniuerſalem eccleſiam canoniſtae ſciunt matrem ſuam appellac cali • tus ſicut ſilius ait ſe venire implere voluntatem matris noſtrae quae eſt eccleſia vnde apparet tanto ſuperiorem eſſe eccleſiam pontifice romano quanto eſt matre inferior filius—paulò poſt maximè rom▪ pontificem ſubiectum eſſe eccleſiae chriſti verba oſtendunt cum petrum futurum papam ad eccleſiam • emittit—quam ſi pontifex non audiat—tanquam ethnicus publicanus haberi debeat brugenſis epiſcopus conc baſil aenae syluius de geſt conc baſil lib 1 § multis ſol 5 pope ſhould ſubiect vnto councell church mother muſt pope acknowledge himſelfe ſonne otherwiſe ſhall haue god father sauiour ſhewed ſaid vnto peter tell church authoritie pope ſhall contemne ought accounted ethnicke publican argument cardinall cuſanus doth proſecute another ſentence auguſtine wherein requireth poteſtas concilij eſt ſupra papam—vnd • auguſtinus epiſt▪ ad glorium el • ſium cauſa caeciliam de miltiade papa dicit—si iudices tuos •• o fuiſſe putemus qui romae iudicarunt reſtat conc pleparium vbi cum ipſis iudicibus cauſa • git • ti poilit card cuſanus concord cathol lib 2 cap 17 pag 737 iudgement councell determining caſe pope deliuered aduerſaries anſwer concilium baſilienſe licet à du • bus pont▪ ficibus martino 5 eugenio 4 indictū initio multa legitimè piè ſanxerit tamen quia poſtea ab eugenio ferrariā primū dei • • florentiam tranſlatum obtemperate noluit nec • raecorum diſſidijs componendis cum caeteris latinis • piſcopis vnan • miter incumhere—ex hac ſane poſteriori parte non conc legitimum ſed conciliabulum iniquum cenſendum eſt stapleton▪ doctrin princip lib 13 cap 15 § dixeram 4 although synode appointed two pope ſo beginning therof may held lawfull councell yet latter part accounted better wicked conuenticle becauſe refuſed obey pope tranſlating synod baſil vnto ferrara vnto florence anſwer calumnious ſame councell recited surius pope eugenius recorded haue reſponſio synod • li ad fundamenta rationes 1 2▪ seſſionum conuenticuli fe • rarienſis oſtendens quòd papa erigendo ipſum conuenticulum introduxerit ſchiſma eccleſiā dei c • ncil baſil▪ epiſt synodal apud surium tom 4 conc pag 177 paulò poſt epiſt—octauâ seſſ declaratum eſt ſi rom pontifex aliud concilium erigeret durante iſto non fore concilium ſed ſchiſmaticorum conuenticulum—inſuper praecepit ſancta synodus per praefatum decret 12 • ſſionis vt diſſolutionem synodi baſilienſis per eum attentatam reuocaret hoc ſacrum baſilienſe co •• legitimè inchoatum declararet à tempore huiuſmodi inchoationis continuatum fuiſſe eſſe proſecutionem ſemper habuiſſe ac habere debere quod ni faceret infra terminum 60 dictum extunc eſſet ab omni adminiſtratione papali ſuſpenſus tandem monitioni paruit—hoc declaramus per ſuas literas rom curia bullatas de conſilio aſſenſu cardinalium c—sed heu dolor rurſum vniuerſam pertu • bat eccleſiam c ibid▪ pag 179 promiſed vnto synod publicke bull would diſſolue tranſlate councell baſil vnto place councell alſo embraced concilium baſilienſe ita per doctiſſ▪ atque optimos academiae pariſienſis doctores laudatur ita extollitur ita omnibus chriſti ſidelibus imitandum proponitur ita demùm id quidem vero verius apertò approbatur▪ ac confirmatur • nihil fermè ſuprà c—qui legit appellationem eminentiſſ vniuerſitatis pariſ contra leonem 10 inueniet ſanctiſſ concilium baſilienſe orthuinu • gratius prae • ad lectorem ante app • llat faſcic rerum expetend ſol 34 vniuerſitie paris right worthie ſacred foreſaid • cree accord vnto canon councell conſtance wherein defined • primò quòd ipſa • caeteros eius regionis epiſcopos stephan • ſcripſit non eſſe communicandum ijs qui ad haereticos tranſeuntes rebaptizant cyprianus tamen illo ſententiarum diſſidio pacis vnitatis vincu •• conſtantiſſim • retinebat cauſamue ſuā ſumma cum animi moderatione defend • bat—et paulinus quoque nolanus epiſcopus vir religioſiſſ cum de clericorum rom eccleſiae ſe inuidia odio vrbici papae ſuperbia quereretur qui eum à ſuo conſor • io ſegregare dicebantur—quoniam inquit oderunt gratis quod ad pertinet • um ijs • tiam qui oderunt pacem meam mente paciſicus ſum—horum modeſtiam manſuetud • nem ſi qui hodie quoque •• tarentur etiamſi ab eccleſiae ſocietate ſecluſi viderentur aliquo errore per ignorantiam verſar • ntur non putarem • amen ab interna illa eccleſiae ſocietate quam animo voluntate colerent alienos eſſe habendos caſſander quo ſupra pag 49 50 5 • yet ſaith muſt diſſolue bond vnitie vniuerſall church deſire affect vnion thereof cyprian pope stephen much lay remoued vnto truth chriſt 38 well romaniſts deſerued oppoſition foreſaid caſſander witneſſe non negarem tamen multos initio pio ſt • dio ad acriorem reprehenſionem quorundam manifeſtorum abuſuum imp • lſos fuiſſe praecipuam cauſam hunis calamitatis diſtractionis eccleſiae illis aſſignandum qui inani qnodam faſtu eccleſiaſticae poteſtatis inſtati r • ctè modeſtè admonentes ſuperbè faſtidioſè contempſerunt repulerunt quare nullam eccleſiae firmam pacem ſperandam puto niſi ab ijs initium fiat qui diſtractionis cauſam dederunt hoc eſt ij qui eccleſiaſticae gubernationi praeſunt de nimio illo rigore aliquid remittant eccleſiae paci aliquid concedant ac multorum piotū votis ac monitis obſequentes manifeſtos abuſus ad regulam diuinarum literarum veteris eccleſiae à qua deflexerunt corrigant proudly diſdainfully contemned thoſe modeſtly truly admoniſh neither hope true ſolid vnion vntill haue giuen c • uſe diſſention begin remit rigorouſneſſe contented manifeſt abuſes church reformed auderem • lega • o ad franciſeum toletanum remittit à quo varijs ludificatiombus extracto tempore dum intern c • iam argentinenſes à guil • ictauio pari arte clud • ntur nihil co anno ab ijs impetrari potuit thuanus tom 1 lib 6 anno 1551 pag 610 mandatorum haec ſumma erat theologis qui ad concilium venturi erant non ſatis idoneè cautum eſſe atque iccireo mauritium adhuc • eminem miſiſie caeterùm decreuiſſe viros bonos mittere pacis ac concordiae imprimis ſtudioſos qui iam itinere ſint interim petere vt ad baſilienſis synodi formulam ijs caueatur qui venturi ſint ſicut olim boenits cautum fuit dum illi veniant omnis actio intermittatur vtque cum venerint anteacta omnia retractentur dieſue conſc ſſui deſtinatus prorogetur ita verò concilium celebretur vt omnes nationes ac populi ad illud conueniant nec praeſidis authoritatem pontifex rom ſibi arroget ſed concilio ſe ſubijciat quò libera ſint omnium ſuffragia minimè praeiudicatae ſententiae cum illi aduentu ipſorum laetari vt ad patres relaturos ſe dicerent thuanus ibid anno 1552 pag 719 paulus pontifex—c •• dinales cubiculum accerſi iubet —poſtremò vt ſanctiſſimum ſic illud vocabat inquiſitionis officium quo vno s authoritatem niti generall inuaſion vice ſuch one glorious may well challenge title saint 3 maine queſtion concerneth doctrine bernard see aboue may ſtiled lampe moone giue light darkneſſe infatuation time sunne wanted blemiſh ſhadow occaſioned prouerbe bernardus non videt omnia prouoked apologizer taxe diſtorting see aboue lib 2 cap 29 scripture moued alphonſus de caſtro albeit called bernard haereſis ſexta docet nullam animam ante diem iudicij eſſe beatam huius erroris patroni lienaeus— beatus bernardus nec mira • quiſquam deb •• quod tanti viri tam peſtiferum errorem ſunt lapſi quoniam vt b iacobus dicit qui non • fendit vno vir perfectus eſt alphonſus de caſtro aduerſus haereſ lib 3 tit beatitudo fol 76 bleſſed yet charge hereſie alſo pestiferous againe bernard ſhall little impeach power church ſticke contemne ſaying see aboue say bernard liſt 4 indeed aduerſaries cannot claime full intereſt bernard faith thought part doctor church liberally rebuke worldly inter hae • tu paſtor procedis deauratus tam multa circumdatus varietate oues quid capiunt ſi auderem dicere • aemonū magi quàm ouium palcua haec ſcil ſic factitabat petrus ſic ludebat paulus et paulò puſt paſtorem te populo huic aut nega aut exhibe non negabis ne cuius ſedem tenes te neges haeredem petrus hic eſt qui neſcitur proceſſiſſe aliquando vel gemmis ornatus vel ſericis non tectus auro non vectus equo albo nec ſtipatus milite nec circumſt • epentibus vectus miniſtris abſque tamen credidit fatis poſſe impleri ſalutare mandatum si amas paſce oues meas ſucceſſiſti non petro ſed conſtantino bernardus lib 4 de c • nſiderat ad eugen cap 2 3 pompouſneſſe pope accounting meere mockerie practiſe thereof paſture fitter diuels ſheepe committed ſuch reproofes vnto writing direction poſterity aduiſe v see aboue l 2 c 29 § 2 publikely freely reproue pope although ſhall commit ſome error intollerable example granting indulgence 5 held doctrine pure conception bleſſed virgine wombe mother feſtiuity day quo chriſto excepto de caetero vniuerſos reſpexit ex adam nato quod vnus humiliter de ſemetipſo ac veraciter conſiteretur iniquitatibus inquiens conceptus ſum peccatis concepit mater mea cum haec ita ſe habeant quaenam iam erit feſtiuae ratio conceptionis quo pacto inquam aut ſanctus aſſeretur conceptus qui de spiritu ſancto non eſt ne dicam de peccato eſt aut feſſus habebitur qui minime ſanctus eſt libenter whereunto lampe bernard giue great light three principall point firſt againſt romiſh doctrine freewil aſcribeth whole original power good conſent vnto non quod vel ipſe conſenſus ab ipſo ſit—facit volentem hoc eſt volunt • ti ſuae conſentientem—non partim g • atia partim liberum arbitrium ſed torum quidem hoc totum illa ſed vt totum illo ſic totum ex illa bernard de grat lib arb ſentences booke grace ſecondly whē preached neceſſitie good work king high way vnto life euerlaſting yet diſclaime confidence owne fateor non ſum dignus nec proprijs meritis poſſum regnum obtinere coelorum caeterùm teacheth euery penitent haue si credis peccata tua non poſſe deleri niſi ab eo c—ſed adde adhue vt credas quia per ipſum tibi peccata donantur hoc eſt teſtimonium quod perhibet corde noſtro spiritus ſanctus dicen • dimiſ • ſunt tibi peccata tua bern serm 1 de annunciatione b mariae ſinnes remitted vnto theſe abouementioned reſpects although proteſtants might hold bernard worthie foreſaid denomination without great preiudice vnto cauſe prouocation conſtrained deliuer another poſition viz proteſtants liues haue deſerued name ſanctitie tried cenſures romiſh aduerſaries sect 2 10 cardinall bellarmine wonderfull cenſorious eccleſia catholica ſunt plurimi mali ex haereticis ſpeaking proteſtants nullus eſt bonus bellar lib 4 de eccleſ milit cap 13 § quod verò many wicked among v catholicks ſaith among proteſtants one good ſhall appeare firſt ieſuite maldonate confeſſeth outward practiſe caluiniſtae ouinâ pelle induti nihil enim eorum ore niſi pater noſter coeleſtis niſi chriſtus niſi fides iuramentum inauditum nihil eorum factis apparebat niſi eleemoſynae niſi temperantia niſi modeſtia addeth ex fructibus homines cognouerunt non natiuam hanc ſed appoſititiam▪ fuiſſe pellem ſheweth maldonat▪ ieſ matth 7 15 praying almes temperance modestie abſtaining oathes among proteſtants able proue calleth ſheeps skin wolues couering 11 secondly ieſuite coſter teſtifieth edunt illi quidem nonnunquam bona mo • alia largiuntur eleemoſynas xenodochia erigunt moderanter quidam eorum viuunt á conuiuijs • uram • ntis ſeſe abſlinent—haec ſunt externa officia coſterus ieſ enchirid cap 2 de eccleſia pag 101 giue almes build hoſpitals liue moderately c ſaith outward office alſo chriſtian duty 12 thirdly ieſuite salmeron obiecting himſelfe doubt habent ſpeaking proteſtants began renoiece romiſh ſuperſtitions multos ſequaces qui eorum diſciplinam amplectuntur tam exiguo tē poris interuallo dei ergo opus eſſe videtur qui non permitteret tam multos haereſi deceptos interire reſpō demus—neque mirum eſt multos eorū caſſes incide • e quia peccata noſtra daemonis poteſtas adulationes omnibus omnium hominum etiam peccatorum generibus adhibitae magnâ vi eloquentiae praetextu scripturae cauſa ſunt vt quibuſdam perſuadeant quia induti veſtes onium malam noſtram vitam cernentes eoram alijs vrgentes ſucceſſionem primitiuae eccleſiae ſibi affingentes multum poſſunt ad perſuaſionem apud eos qui scripturas ſanctos patres non legunt aut non diligenter inſpiciunt salmeron ieſ comm epiſt b paul • lib 1 part 3 diſp 10 pag 235 ſhall religion proteſtants thought god ſeeing ſo many profeſſors ſo ſhort time doth anſwer maruell alledging among reaſons becauſe ſaith couer themſelues ſheeps cloathing behold wickedneſſe liues cannot argue leaſt outward holineſſe therefore demaund cardinall haue man iudged ſight men inward ſoules ſhal neuer able proue man without miracle saint examination outward behauiours ſufficient argument pronounce among proteſtants one good yet acknowledge ſo many outward work godlineſſe among luther obſerued eraſmus haue bene ſo great luther • vita omnium horum conſenſu probatur id non leue praeiudicium eſt tantam eſſe morum integritatem vt nec hoſtes reperiant quod calumnientur eraſmus epiſt ad thomam epiſc eborac integritie life enemy could take exception againſt hierome prague burnt time councell conſtance commended orator poggius anabaptiſts fundamentally hereticall heretiks may obtaine thus threede broken haue ſo curiouſly artificially ſpunne yet becauſe great confidence ſixe vpon ſpeculation owe ſecond ſatisfaction owne principle 4 cardinall tolet thinketh matter probable ſome caſe b baptiſmi miniſter neceſſitatis—poteſt eſſe homo cuiuſcunque vitae ſiue iudaeus ſiue paganus ſiue alius quiuis infidelis c—tamen omnibus eſt neceſſaria intentio debita faciendi id quod facit eccleſia vti diximus vnde licet infidelis non crederet ſe quicquam boni facere cum irriſione faceret ſi tamen ad petitionem baptizandi baptizaret intendens facere id quod facit eccleſia chriſtiana—verè baptizaret tolet ieſ inſtruct sacerd lib 2 cap 20 pag 377 378 praeciſus qualis eſt haereticus aut ſchiſmaticus poſſit abſoluere articulo mortis si caſus accideret quòd non eſſet periculum deſperationis aut ſeductionis non eſt improbabile quod affirmant—poſſe nempe abſolui ab haeretico aut ſchiſmatico quando ſcandalum non eſſet communis tamen opinio eſt contrarium tolet ieſ inſtruct sacerd lib 1 ca 15 § sextò non hereticke ſchiſmaticke may giue abſolution ſay pagane infidell abſolue ſinner ſee pa • tie abſolued receiueth grace remiſſion ſinne yet abſoluer heretike doth ſtill perſiſt ſtate damnation demaund whence abſolution becometh ſo effectuall abſolued onely power owne faith outward forme word abſolution made pagane ſhould haue bene effectual performed heretike muſt therefore confeſſe ſome abilitie heretike heretik chriſtian vertue wherof abſolution made ſoueraigne vnto receiueth conſequently grant man may cauſe ſauing health vnto another faith reaſon admixture hereſie damnable vnto himſelfe 5 ſhall ſay another principle generall church viz caſe neceſsitie pagane ſhall baptize one perfect baptiſme although done ſcorne alwaies prouided baptizing haue intention chriſtian church doth marke caſe neceſſity behalfe ſoule child pagan held ſufficiēt miniſter ſacramēt yet ſo haue chriſtiā intent doth fully contradict apologiſts conſequence doctrine intēt pagan auailable working ſauing grace vnto baptized intent pagan damnable himſelfe 6 common experience eſpecially nation doth tell v man infranchiſed naturalized ſubiect ſhall runne headlong actuall rebellion tranſgreſſion ſhall beget ſonne child vertue father firſt naturalization ſhall enioy benefit ſubiect inherit father land wherein may obſerue councell nice arguing equitie thereof common rule experience prudentiſſimè enim c pag 591 c • l 1 becauſe ſay ſuch matter may diſcreetly indifferently ordered prouinces begū leſt might obiect ſupremacy pope thus preoccupate epiſtle vnto pope niſi • tè quiſquam eſt qui credat vincui • ibet poſſe deum examinis inſpirare iuſtitiam innumerabilibus sacerdotibus concilium congregatis denegare pag 591 col 1 except ſhal peraduenture thinke ſay god wil inſpire ſome one ſpirit wiſedome iuſtice denie grace vnto many aſſembled together one synode determination ſuch cauſes concluſion iudge aut
