appeale 24 let v adde hereunto canon councell sardice ſtand vſually alledged aduerſaries may ſeeme impaire romiſh challenge appeales becauſe define priuiledge appeales de iure vnto pope onely de facto allow arbitrarie oſius epiſcopus dixit illud quoque neceſſariò adijeiendum eſt vt epiſcopi de ſua prouincia ad aliam prouinciam qua non ſunt epiſcopi non tranſeant niſi fortè à f • atribus ſuis inuitati ne videamur ianuam claudere charitatis illud quoque prouidendum eſ • ſi aliqua prouincia aliquis epiſcopus contra fratrem ſuum epiſcopum litem habuerit ne vnus è duobus ex alia prouincia aduocet epiſcopum cognitorem quodſi aliquis epiſcopus iudicatus fuerit aliqua cauſa putat ſe bonam cauſam habere vt iterum concilium renouetur ſi vobis placet petri apoſtoli memoriam honoremus vt ſcribatur ab qui cauſam examinarunt iulio rom epiſcopo ſi iudicauerit renouandum eſſe iudici • renouetur det iudices si autem probauerit talem cauſam eſſe vt non refricentur ea quae acta ſunt quae decreuerit confirmata erunt ſi hoc omnibus placet synodus reſpondet placet conc sardicenſ cap 3 apud surium tom 1 oſius epiſcopus dixit placuit autem vt ſi epiſcopus accu • ••• fuerit iudicauerint congregati epiſcopi regionis ipſius de gradu ſuo cum deiecerint ſi appellauerit qui deiectus eſt confugerit ad • piſcopum rom▪ eccleſiae voluerit ſe •• diri ſi iuſtum putauerit vt renouetur iudicium vel diſc • ſſionis examen ſcribere epiſcopis dignetur qui finitima propinqua prouincia ſunt vt ipſi diligenter omninò requirant iuxta fidem veritatis definiant quod ſi qui • ogat cauſam ſuam iterum audiri deprecatione ſua mouerit epiſcopum rom vt è latere ſuo presbyterum mittat erit poteſtate epiſcopi quod velit quod aeſtimet • tſi decreuerit mittendos eſſe q • praeſentes cum epiſcopis iudicent habentes cius authoritatem à quo deſtinati ſunt erit ſuo arbitrio si verò crediderit epiſcopos ſufficere vt negotio terminum imponant faciet quod ſapientiſſimo conſ • lio ſuo iudicaue • idem conc sardic ca 7 ſi vobis omnibus placet alſo preſcribe vnto manner proceeding pe • emptorily ouerrule ſuch matter himſelfe alone vſe conſent biſhops 25 canuaſſe ſo important caſe viz appeales vnto rome day made eſſentiall prerogatiue popedome cannot obſerue thoſe ancient time acknowledged due vnto pope either diuine lawe ordinance eccleſiaſticall appertained vnto lawe chriſt would either pope haue conceited thoſe affricane biſhops denied right appealing vnto pretend ſucceſſor peter vicar chriſt ſupreme iudge whole church vniuerſal conſtitution eccleſiaſticall eſtabliſhed would ſo reuerend ancient famous councell ſo inquiſitiue act councell nice haue conſpired generall conſent decree ſo ſolemnly ſo ſeuerely reſolutely againſt doubtleſſe thoſe pope could haue pleaded goſpell would haue mentioned leaſt one text scripture proofe priuiledge generall councell acknowledged auguſtine africane biſhops would haue refuſed card bellarm anſwer ſaying queſtion liceret ſed expediret confuted proceeding • f synod ſhew lawfull becauſe expedient aduerſaries ſay expedient vſ • ordinance chriſt particular church affricke may preſcribe vnto pope lawes expediencie chhp ix romiſh change impoſing abſolute law continencie vpon clergie pope syricius romish apologie 3 thirdly whitaker giueth example pope syritius ſaying whitaker contra duraeum lib 7 page 480 ante medium syritius firſt annexed perpetuall chaſtitie miniſters word whereto anſwer firſt whitaker alledgeth proofe syritius firſt neither doth name catholicke writer time ſo reporting protestant appeale sect 1 maiſter whitaker directly ouer place obiected note pope qui verbi miniſtris perpetuū coelibatum primus iniecit syricius pontifex fuit loco citato alledging margent diſt 82 c propoſuiſti decree gratian diſt 82 romiſh gloſſe ancient edition produceth hic dicit hug quod apoſtoli non inſtituerunt de non vtendo iam contracto quia ſi apoſtoli hoc inſtituiſſent orientales hoc admiſiſſent alij verò intelligunt ea de contracto quod dicit 1 etiam ab vxoribus dicunt ante legitimè ſibi copulatis aut de facto nam dicunt quod iſta cap facta fuerunt ante tempus gregorij qui introduxit continentiam miniſtris 31 diſt ante triennium subdiaconis presbyteris verò diaconis syricius introduxit imò dicunt quod olim sacerdotes poterant contrahere ante syricium vnde moyſes contraxit exponunt ergo apoſtoli docuerunt exemplo opere admonitione ſecundum h non inſtitutione vel conſtitutione ſecundum alios paulò poſt antiquitas tempore syricij hoc vocat antiquitatem 82 diſtinct plurimos gloſſa decret gratian part 1 diſt 84 c cum praeterito hugo ſaying apoſtles ordaine ſpeaking prieſts deacon ſhould haue vſe wedlocke contracted ordination alſo romiſh gloſſe ſaith ſome affirme syricius haue brought law continencie prieſts deacon whereas text decree nameth antiquitie proofe law continencie ſaith gloſſe time syricius ſeemed alſo vnto polydore ſufficient proofe hereupō occidentalibus paulatim eſt connubium abrogatum syricius enim primus sacerdotibus diaconis vt ait gratian diſt 82 coniugio interdixit qui circiter annum ſalutis humanae 387 ſedere coepit polydor virgil de inuent lib 5 cap 4 pag 319 syricius firſt ſaith gratian ſaith yeare 387 forbid marriage prieſts gloſſe hath bene allowed laſt corrected edition pope editio greg 13 gregorie thirteenth could modeſtie apologiſts contrarily affirme whitaker alledged proofe muſt next place ſee free syricius guilt innouation romish apologie secondly alledge moſt plainely contrarie hierome liued time damaſus predeceſſor syritius ſaith hereof hierom apolog ad pamach c 3 ſame doctrine doth affirme c 1 ad titum married men like let angrie holy scripture biſhops prieſts deacon know cannot offer sacrifice vſe act marriage opinion firſt begunne contrarie ſo vniuerſall hierome affirmeth generall doctrine practiſe hierom contra vigilant c 1 ſaith quid faciunt orient eccleſiae quid egypti ſedis apoſtolicae quae aut virgines clericos accipiunt aut continentes aut ſi vxores habuerint mariti eſſe • ſinunt church eaſt egipt see apoſtolick like manner marriage prieſts long theſe time ſo plainly impugned euen greeke church epiphanius haer 59 plaine word hereof ſaith dice mihi quibuſdam locis adhuc liberos gignere presbyteros diaconos hipodiaconos hoc non eſt iuxta canonem c plainly doth acknowledge hereby former canon epiphanius origen numer hom 23 ſaith certum eſt quia impeditur ſacrificium indeſinens ijs qui coniugalibus neceſſitatibus ſeruiunt vnde videtur mihi quod illius eſt ſolius offerre ſacrificium indeſinens qui indeſin • nti perpetuae ſe deuouerit caſtitati et vide origen leuit hom 4 l 8 contra celſum origen protestant appeale shewing great ouerſight apologiſts vrging theſe teſtimonies father sect 2 2 haue two anſwers vnto apologiſts wit like vnskilfull markmen haue ſhot ſhort alſo ouer marke short ignorance thinke difference betweene condition de matrimonio contrahendo de matrimonio contracto contracting matrimonie matrimonie contracted inſtitution perpetuall continencie imputed vnto syricius romiſh gloſſe noted doctor whitaker plainly see aboue sect 1 b expreſſeth although prieſt bene contracted matrimonie yet syricius enioyne ſeparation meanes preſerue perpetual continencie clergy inſtances obiect father intreate matrimonie contracted thus apologiſts haue bene occupied onely beating ayre yet syricius may go innouator abſolute decree perpetuall continencie vnto perſons eccleſiaſticall 3 next fault ouerſhooting ſhew orderly ſeuerall teſtimonies firſt former ſentence hierome much depraued ſhould haue bene expreſſed thus married men like let angrie scripture biſhops prieſts deacon followeth apologiſts haue learnedly omitted yea order leuiticall knew apologiſts haue changed know could offer sacrifice vſed marriagebed place hierome proueth onely excellencie virginitie reſpect marriage opera legis nuptiae ſunt vnde maledicuntur eae quae non habent filios quae ſi conceduntur etiam euangelio aliud tamen eſt indulgentiam infirmitati tribuere aliud eſt virtutibus praemia polliceri ecce perſpicuè diximus nuptias concedi euangelio ſed tamen coſdem ſuo officio permanentes praemia caſtitatis capere non poſſe quod ſi indignè accipiunt mariti non mihi iraſcantur ſed scripturis ſacris imò epiſcopis presbyteris diaconis vniuerſo cho • sacerdota • leuitico qui ſe nouerunt hoſtias offerre non poſſe ſi operi ſeruiant coniugali hieron loco citato tom 2 pag 104 behold ſaith haue plainly confeſſed goſpell doth allow marriage ſo married party deſire reward virgin doth touch neceſſitie perpetual continencie prieſts place ſelfe doth proue two ſufficient argument 4 firſt let angrie ſaith scripture reprouing onely reproueable scripture see aboue ieſuites themſelues haue confeſſed euen ſentence councell trent marriage prieſts forbidden scripture secondly vſeth example leuiticall priest although commanded containe courſe ſacrificing proueth excellency virginitie yet married clauſe leſt might appeare apologiſts artificially diſcard though bene directly ſpoken biſhops prieſts deacon new teſtament change tence verbe knew know againe elſewhere conſequences ſtrong proue laitie may married becauſe apoſtle ſaith supra eadem apologia sed qui ſemel duxit vxorem niſi ex conſenſu ſe non valet abſtinere—reddat coniugi debitum quia ſponte ſe alligauit vt regete cogeretur pag 102 similiter viri cohabitantes iuxta ſcientiam—vt 〈◊〉 cohibeantur orationes ib p 21 et paulò poſt vt vacetis orationi iterum reuertimini ad idipſum—quod dixit ſecundùm indulgentiam non ſecundùm imperium pag 22 separate ſelues prayer time 5 next teſtimonies hieroms 2 teſtimonie aut ſi vxores habuerint mariti eſſe deſinūt doth exact neceſſitie law liberty conſent • ſome caſes laitie see aboue hierome epiphanius canon concerneth maried syricius caſe epiphanius within compaſſe queſtion onely concerneth syricius 6 word origen ſeeme firſt view giue vpſhot aimeth alſo wrong marke mentioning orig hom 23 ſpeaking euery chriſtian agnoſcat quiſquis vult eſſe perſectus ſanctus—quod ſemper indeſinenter iuſtus debet facere diem feſtum—sacrificium indeſinens eſt ſi ſine intermiſſione oremus—certum eſt qui peccat diem peccati agit agere non poteſt diem feſtum ideo diebus quibus pecat non poteſt offerre indeſinens ſacrificium followeth nolite fraudare vox inuicem niſi ex conſenſu ad tempus vt vacetis orationi iterum idipſum ſitis place obiected certum eſt quia impeditur indeſinens ſacrificium ijs qui c perpetuall ſacrifice praier doth directly apply ſpeech vnto euerie one pray vnto god doth well proue chriſtian man may married doth euince vnlawfulneſſe marriage prieſts 7 yet leſt anſwers may ſeeme aduerſaries leſſe perſwaſible referre vnto owne biſhop eſpencaeus expoundeth ſentence vnto place origen obiected vides de perpetuo omnium feſto non de proprio sacerdotum ſacrificio ſermonem eſſe although addeth quem tamen ſtatim poſt ſed cunctanter timidè—ad continentiam • raxit onely prieſts little origenes nunquam non audiuit vt nimis tum caſtus tum allegoricus c • ſpencaeus lib 1 de continent cap 13 pag 123 authoritie origen well warranted literally caſtrate themſelues admit neceſſary law continencie origen like sed maioris eſt negotij ſimile ambroſij hieronymi aliorum collectionem examinare cùm aiunt veteri lege sac • rdotes quo tempore offerebant ab vxoribus ſecubarent noua fideles etiam laici niſi ad inuicem ex • tuo conſenſu ſeſe fraud intes orare nequcant eccleſiaſticis quibus ſemper eſt orandum offerendum ſemper item erit continendum—sed ſide oratione loquuntur quotidiana—quae laicis clericis ſine intermiſſione praecipitur ita • igbo potu alijſ que actionibus ac ne ſomno quidem impeditur cum hieronymo teſtante sanctis etiam ſomnus ſit oratio proinde nec legitimo vſu coniugij interrumpitur quem vocat apoſtolus immaculatum heb 13 sic enim vt rectè colligit anſelmus cum ſemper orandum ſit nunquam eſſe coniugio ſermendum—sin de oratione grauiore quae ſit cum ie • unio ferè scripturis coniun • ſolita intelligunt—sic cibo potuque delicatiore alijſue negotijs ceſtare—non sacerdotibus ſolùm ſed laicis exod 19 • oel 2 traditum eſt—verùm preces ſolennes huiuſmodi feria perpetuae non ſunt nec ambroſio teſte omni • rre die sacerdotes neceſſe eſt nihil olim omnes etiam latino prohibebat graecos hodie nihil prohibet ſtatis quibus vacant ſacrificio temporibus conſuetudinem cum voxribus habere q • iſquis olim dijudicaret miniſtros coldem ue maritos quaſi nu • tiarum occaſione offerre non deberent talium oblatione abſtinerent cum • • e percuſſum concilio gangrenſi prius audiuimus—multi nunc ſunt qui non ter anno ſacrificant—quod autem pauli locum ne ſe defraudent—niſi ex conſenſione propter orationem ambroſius exiſtimat paulum de euchariſtia ſumenda ſentire—idque optare magi quàm exigere eſpencaeus ibidem pag 123 124 paulò poſt ambroſius negat ſuo tempore quotidiè offerri ſolitum pag 125 teſtimonies ambroſe hierome learnedly confuteth fancy ſome think marriage miniſterie cannot conſort together whereof produceth example hilary thē vſe ſay biſhops prieſts primitiuely maried yet coniugall vſe wiues meminit autem canon epiſcoporum coniugij vt quod eis tunc leg • timum eſſet vides hunc de coniugum vſu 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 inquit non tantùm de victu intellexiſiſe et zonarà anterior chryſoſtomus paulum ad titum enarrans hom 2 cum ait intendere haereticis os prorſus obſtruere nuptias damnantibus oſtendentem rem eſſe culp à carentem imò pretioſam cum qua quis poſſit ad epiſcopatus ſolium ſubuehi atqui cum haeretici nuptias ſine vſu hoc eſt vt ſic loquar non nuptias non improbaſſent nihil contra eos facerent paulum graeci orthodoxi enarrantes ſi ſentirent chriſti quod iſti contendunt apoſtolorum ſcripta ordinatione connubij vſum cum miniſterij vſu prorſus pugnare eſpencaeus de continent lib 1 cap 4 pag 30 concludeth nec enim synodus ſexta quae ſe addere apoſtolico canoni fatetur voluit vxores ab epiſcopis inhumaniter cijci vt eis liberis familiae non prouiderent ſed carnali co commercio priuauit proinde clictouaeus propug de continent sacerd cap 6—cundem accepit non de domeſtica tantùm c • tâ ſed de coniugali debito quod illius conſtitutionis tempore sacerdos vxori ante conſecrationem ductae expoſcenti debuit exhibere idem 〈…〉 pag 31 et noſter quidem clictouaeus cap 7 non obſcurè deprehendit gangrenſem de miniſtris ante ſuſceptos • dmes coniugatis coniugio poſt vtentibus hoc eſt de matrimonij officio nedum vinculo intelligendum val dum inde argumentum ſumit tum ſacerdotibus licuiſſe matrimonijs antea contractis vti tum quia haeretici à patribus ibi damnati nuptijs ob actum praeſertim coniugalem quem ſemper eſſe peceatum contendebant inſenſi erant idem ibidem pag 32 oppoſeth apoſtolicall canon zonaras chryſoſtome councell owne clitouaeus beſides reaſon taken synode gangrenſis impregnable yet inſiſt vpon ſtorie concerning paphnutius queſtion whether married teſtimonies hereof plaine termes reſt vpon church doctrine time protestant appeale concerning ſtorie paphnutius councell nice whether doth fauour proteſtants romaniſts sect 3 8 eccleſiaſticall hiſtorians muſt required ſpeake socrates sozomen concurreth ſaith viſum erat epiſcopis legem nouam eccleſiam introducere vt qui eſſent ſacris initiati ſieut epiſcopi presbyteri diaconi cum vxoribus quas cùm erant laici matrimoniū duxiſſent minimè dormirent—surrexit paphnutius vehementer vocife • • u eſt non graue • agum ceruicibus illorum imponendum eſſe qui erant ſacris initiati honorabile eſſe coniugium inter omnes torom im • aculatum—i • lud ſatis eſſe vt qui clerum antè aſcripti erant quàm duxiſſent vxores • ſecundùm veterem • ccleſiae traditionem dcinceps à nuptijs ſe abſtinerent non tamen quenquam ab illa quam iampridem cùm laicus erat vxorem duxiſſet ſ •• ungi debere iſtam epiſcoporum conuentu orationem habuit paphnutius cùm ipſe non modò nuptras non expertus eſſet—itaque cùm totus epiſcoporum presbyterorum diaconorum conuentus verbis paphnutij aſſenſiſſet c socrates hiſt eccleſiaſt lib 1 cap 8 councell nice bene intended forbid thoſe biſhops prieſts deacon vſe wiues married ordination socrates calleth bringing new law aroſe vp paphnutius himſelfe neuer bene married vehemently reſiſted calling kind conſtitution heauie yoake reaſoned scripture 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 c marriage honourable among men vnmarried ordination ſhould ſo continue according vnto old tradition end whole synode conſented vnto iudgement paphnutius ſtorie 9 enquire whether romaniſts proteſtants haue cauſe allow diſlike decree councell ſide croſſed aduantaged hereby councell alloweth men married ordained continue ſame ſtate wedlocke part decree proteſtants apprehend ſame councell reſtraineth marriage vnmarried entred order part romaniſts leſſe vehemently vrge inculcate od herein obſeruable 10 vnderſtand therefore abſolute forbidding marriage prieſts called councell new law reſtraint marriage ordination termed old tradition may part ſeeme euen new law syricius defend contrarie vnto wiſedome councell paphnutius proue repugnant vnto scripture called old tradition whereunto proteſtants take exception aduerſaries witneſſing thus much commanded scripture ordained onely eccleſiaſticall conſtitutions ſo syricius defender ſtand guiltie breach diuine law proteſtants onely tranſgreſſe ordinance man 11 secondly compare tradition tradition▪ licence marriage prieſts ancient audi quid clemens ad • erſus ho ſcrupuloſos ſanctos qui nuptias ſpernunt ſcribit apoſtolos improbant petrus enim philippus vxores habuerunt hunc apoſtolicum ritum diu ſeruatum conſtat poſtea adſtricta eſt vt sacer dotibus diaconis liceret virg habere vxorem polydor virgil lib 5 inuent cap 4 pag 317 318 apostle originall nonmarriage latter inuention therefore compariſon newly old 12 need maruell cardinall bellarmine partly reiect argumentum quintum vitimum caluini ſumitur ex hiſtoria socratis l r c 8 sozom l 1 c 22 vbi dicunt quòd cùm nicaenum conc legem ferre vellet ne liceret clericis cum vxoribus luis dormite ſurrexit paphnutius confeſſor contradixit synodus tota eius ſententiam iuit continentiam ab vxote arbitrio cuiuſque reliquit et paulò poſt neque pro grae corum errore magnum eſt praeſidium hoc teſtimonio socratis sozomeni nam vel totū eſt falſum quod iſti de paphnutio tradunt vel certè quod magi credo tale aliqui l tunc accidit ſed non benè ab iſtis narratum eſt fortaſſe voluerunt patres concilij grauiores poenas conſtituere cleticos inconti •• ute c bellarm lib 1 de clericu cap 20 § argumentum quintum ſtorie paphnutius thus repeated socrates sozomen obiected againſt caluine owe credit vnto thoſe eccleſiaſticall hiſtoriographers confirme teſtimonie owne forenamed learned sic repeating former ſtoriè concerning pap • n • tiu ſaith eccleſiaſticae hiſtoriae caſſiodori epiphanij tripartit l 2 c 14 socr l▪ 1 c 11 sozom l 1 c 22 〈…〉 c 19 vnde clitouaeus aptè colligit necdum vlla lege lata vtentium antea moribus approbata coniugij vſum omninò sa • erdotibus ademptum quid enim legem vel patres perferre molirentur vel nouam vocarent hiſtorici quae iampudem robur vigorem obtinuiſſet eadem hoc anno 1564 ſcripſit cronierus breui atque docta de hoc ad orichoueum ex presbytero male coniugem commentatione de presbyteris ait ac diaconis non eadem eſt omnium ſententia diuerſi ſunt ac olim ſuerunt populorum temporumue more liberum ijs eſſe apud graecos ruſſos coniugij vſum prout olu • ſuit apud nonnullas alias quoque gens nec ante nicaenam synodum vſque oriente duntaxat id vlla lege vetitum fu • ſſe conſtat é socrate sozom niceph eſpencaus de continent lib 1 cap 4 pag 33 sozomenum certè tritemius facit ſecularium literarum cultorem egregium diuinis scripturis ſatis eruditum socratem quoque virum doctum claquentem hiſtoriographum inſignem magná rerum experientiâ praeclarum biſhop eſpencaeus auoucheth truth thereof tripartite ſtorie epiphanius nicephorus owne doctor clitouaeus cromerus adding ſingular commendation former hiſtorians sozomen socrates teſtimonie trithemius much doth fortifie equitie cauſe againſt conſtrained ſingle life many idem • ilentio praetermiſerunt scriptores alij maioris tum fidei tum diligentiae ſiluerint ſane ſed tam multi alij hoc de paphnutio fragmentum ſuum fecerunt vt praeter anteà citatos suidas paulò poſt magni conſtantini tempora ſcriptor lipomano ad ſinem tom 4 vitarum patrum boni apud omnes nominis grauis pius ſobrius sed paphnutio longè prior dionyſitis corinthius epiſc pinytum gnoſium ante quoque idem monuerat ne graue ſeruandae imò compulſae caſtitatis onus ac neceſſitatem fratrum ac diſcipulorum ceruicibus imponeret aut indiceret quo multorum periclitaretur infirmitas eius magi rationem haberet ſuorum imbecillitati ſe attemperaret quod concilium vt melius laudauit amplexus eſt pinytus vt eſt apud euſeb hiſt l 4 c 23 niceph l 4 c 8 eſpencaeus quo ſuprà pag 34 35 et hanc libertatem à ſanctis illis patribus relictam orientis praeſertim eccleſijs fuiſſe ſeruatam praeter dictum dicendaue ijdem socrat l 5 c 22 tripart l 9 c 38 niceph l 12 c 34 de variantibus apud veteres eccleſiarum cum vna tamen ſide ritibus ita teſtantur theſſalia ſiquis clericus cum vxore legitimè ducta dormierit ac mixtus fuerit abdicatur ordine mouetur cum omnes oriente praeclari etiam epiſcopi contineant ſponte ac pro • bitrio nec vlla legis neceſſitate coacti vxorum congreſſum declinent ſed ſi voluerint hoc faciant multi enim epiſcopali munere fungentes epiſcopalibus aedibus epiſcopatus etiam tempore liberos ex coniugibus legiumo ante ſibi matrimonio coniunctis ſuſceperunt eſ • encaeus ibidem pag 36 proofes greater antiquity apologiſts ſay romish apologie likewiſe father concil 2 carth 2 ſaith omnibus placet vt epiſcopi presbyteri diaconi c ab vxoribus ſe abſtineant reaſon ſet downe vt quod apoſtoli docuerunt ipſa ſeruauit antiquitas no cuſtodiamus carthage councell doubt like manner ground point vpon antiquity apoſtles doctrine protestant appeale sect 4 13 ſee apologiſts ſeeke owne ſatisfaction anſwerers vexation otherwiſe might haue contented themſelues anſwer giuen whitaker perſonally oppugne wherein wiſhed aduerſaries carthaginenſe 2 concilium syricij huius • ē pore habitum eſt huius synodi interpretationē pete ex ſexta synodo whitaker booke obiected pag 514 conſider time ſecond councell carthage ſence thereof 14 concerning time know ancient syricius himſelfe conuinceth ſophiſtrie aduerſaries contend proue syricius firſt author cōſtrained perpetuall continencie becauſe forſooth councell carthage like councell beleeue owne notae concil carthag nomine ſecūdum ordine temporis inter ea quae poſt nicaenum collecta extant verius poſtremum ſub celeſhno pont celebratum—hoc conc verè poſt omnia carthaginenſia celebratum fuiſſe non modo ex canonibus verumetiam epiſcoporum praeſentium nominibus euidentiſſimè probatur—haec ex baronij appendice ad tom 5 anno 391 binius part 1 pag 542 col 2 ſee vpon thu canon syricius liued anno 363 laſt councell carthage time boniface firſt surius conc tom 1 pag 570 anno 420 coſterus catalog▪ ante enchirid binius 58 yeares day syricius 15 next queſtion ſence canon knowledge whereof whitaker referred informed see aboue lit ſixt councell trullo expounded sed hoc conſtitutum eſt à patribus ſextae quae dicitur synodi dicentibus 12 canone non repugnantes ijs quae ab apoſtolis conſtituta ſunt hoc • cimus ſed ſalutis ad meliora progreſſionis populorum curam gerentes ne detur occaſio reprehendendi synoda • em conſtitutionem eadem •• tem synodus 13 praeſertim canonem interpretatur dicens presbyteris diaco • vel subdiacon • vt à proprijs vxoribus abſtineant exigi tempore contrectationis ſanctorum myſteriorum ſubiunge •• quod ſi quis auſus faerit pre • byteros vel diaconos vel subdiaconos legitim â vxoris coniunctione ſocietate pri • deponatur canon quoque 70 praeſentis synodi conuincit latino de hac malè ſentire dicit enim placuit vt presbyten diaconi epiſcopi proprijs terminis etiam à ſuis vxoribus abſtineant vt ex hoc oſtendatur presbyteros diaconos epiſcopos cum mulieribus vixiſ • e nec prohibuit eis synodus cum ipſis conſuetudine mſi proprijs tern inis id eſt pr • ſtitutis vniuſcuſuſque vicis diebus balſamon antioch patriarcha synod carthag 4 diſt 31 ex interpret gentiam h •• uet simus autem ſicut qui carthagine conuenerunt miniſtrorum grauitatis honeſtatiſue curam gerentes dixerunt ••• subdiaconi qui ſacra myſteria contrectant diaconi presbyteri proprijs terminis à conſortibus abſtineant vt quod per apoſtolos traditum eſt ab ip • vſque antiquitate ſeruatum no quoque ſimiliter ſeruemus tempus omni ſcientes maximè ieiunio oratione synod 6 trullo 13 diſt 31 balſamon greeke er • auit eccleſia primitiua quae sacerdotibus permiſit vxores nec errat moderna quae ſubtrahit •• aliquanto poſt nec no ad omnia tenemur quae eccleſia primitiua patres egerunt illis vxores fuerunt bellarmine though ſaying vtterly vntrue notwithſtāding biſhop eureux late conference doth ſeeme rather iuſtifie scotus addit pro eodem propoſito à card bellarmino reprehendi scotum quod putauerit tranſubſtant non fuiſſe articulum fidei ante concilium lateranenſe id verum eſt non erat articulus fidei formaliter id eſt non erat articulus fidei quoad formalitatem publicae profeſſionis quoad prohibitionem ne quis hoc ignorans excu • aretur non plus quam proceſſion • spiritus ſancti eſſe etiam ex filio aliaue ſimilia ante idē conc lateranenſe pro articulis fidei publicè profitendis maſſonius blondus polydore affirme obtinuit tamen à phoca vt rom ſedes omninò abſolutè prima diceretur idue pauli diaconi ſyncero teſtimonio firmare licet qui illa ferè tempora attigit hoc enim ab church ſhould obediēt vnto see rome onely polydore erre verùm cùm poſteà bonifacius tertius ab imperatore phoca impetrâſſet vt omnes epiſcopos praerogatiuam haberet omniumue caput perpetuò foret vti infrà ſubtilius dicetur c polyd virgil lib 4 inuent rerum cap 9 pag 271 ſame boniface himſelfe ſhould head biſhops haue prerogatiue aboue 5 neither point extrauagant demand cauſe phoca ſo gracious vnto boniface expreſſed large cardinall baronius • briefe whereof qui bonifacius vſque ad gregorij obitum conſtantinopoli degens eundem ſibi phocam demeruit eius ſe inſinuans amicitiam—cuius rei cauſa phocas—in odium cyriaci conſtantinop patriarchae profeſſus ſit ſolum rom pontificem eſſe dicendum occumenicum nen pe vniuerſalem epiſcopum et id quidem bonifacium ab eo obtinuiſſe teſtatur anaſtaſius obtinuit apud phocam principem vt ſedes apoſtolica b petri apoſto • caput eſſet omnium eccleſiarum id eſt romana eccleſia—quòd autem interceſſiſſent inimicitiae quaedam odiorum fomenta inter phocam ipſum cyriacum patriarcham eius odium fauiſſe videtur ipſe imperator rom pontifici praeter morem ſuorum praedeceſſorum—quae verò ſimultatis occaſ • hoc anno exorta fuerit—ex graecorum annalibus expreſſum habes anno imperij phocae 4 conſtantina domina auguſta coniux mauritij imperatoris cum tribus filijs ad magnam eccleſiam confugit—at verò tyrannus phoca ad mulieres abſtrahendum ab eccleſia deſtinabat—cyriacus tyranno reſtitit quod igitur cyriaci opera expetita praeda è manibus eſſet elapſa ex quo fomenta ſubminiſtra • videret noui creandi imperatoris cyriacum vt dictum eſt phoca exacerbatus ipſum quod valuit tunc expleuit bar • niu • anno chriſti 606 num 1 2 3 4 pope boniface day gregory merit inſinuated fauour phoca time cyriacus patriarch conſtantinople became hatefull vnto vpon hatred phoca profeſſed biſhop rome ſhould accounted head church phoca ſo ordained may ſeeme hatred patriarch cyriacus cauſe hate conſtantina wife mauritius emperor fled refuge vnto great church three ſonnes tyrant phoca ſent men apprehend meanes cyriacus diſtreſſed one deliuered wherefore tyrant grieued loſſe ſo great prey whereby ſaw occaſion miniſtred creating new emperour therefore enraged againſt cyriacus whatſoeuer could againſt 6 obſeruable point confeſſion reader eaſily diſcerne viz phoca traiterous vſurper bloudie tyrant emperour whoſe friendſhip pope boniface inſinuateth himſelfe become petitioner vniuerſall primacie aduerſarie cyriacus patriarch conſtantinople growne hatred diſgrace becauſe abhorred tyrannie ſame phoca therefore contrarie cuſtome predeceſſors eſtabliſhed boniface new chaire vniuerſalitie terme head boniface apprehended peraduenture granted vnto viz preheminence degree onely alſo dominiō ouer al chriſtian church ſee firſt iſſued perſon wretched tyrant hatred patriarch abhorring tyrannie forthwith conferred vpon pope louing fauoured argueth noueltie grant contrarie cuſtome predeceſſors ſee doctor hath bene indeed partly refelled termes termes onely yet fully iuſtified truth aſſertion notwithſtanding concerning gregory haue anſwered epiſtles vigilius • force epiſtles attributed vnto pope old time weakened much ſuſpition aduerſaries themſelues obiections chap xii praier dead romish apologie 6 sixtly whitaker giueth example gregory great ſaying whitaker contra duraeum l 7 p 480 firſt deliuered purgatorie certaine doctrine gregory great whereto gregory full diſcharge innouation point anſwer auſten long gregorie deliuereth doctrine thereof certaine ſaying aug de verbis apoſt ſerm 34 ſaith orati • nibus vero ſanctae eccleſiae ſacrificio ſalutari eleemoſynis quae pro corum ſpiritibus erogantur non eſt dubitandum mortuos adiuuari vt cum ii miſericordius agatur à domino quàm eorum pe • cata meruerunt hoc enim à patribus tra • itum vniuerſa obſeruat eccleſia booke de cura pro mortuis c 1 ſaith prayer dead non parua eſt vniuerſae • ccleſiae quae hac conſuetudine claret authoritas doubted dead holpen praiers holy church healthfull ſacrifice almes imployed ſoules god deale mercifully ſinnes deſerued doth vniuerſall church obſerue deliuered forefather elſewhere ſaith leſſe certainly augu enchirid c 110 ſaith neque negandum eſt defunctorum anima pictate ſuorum viuentium releuari cum pro illis ſacrificium mediatoris offertur may denied ſouls deceaſſed relieued pietie liuing friend offered ſacrifice mediator c ſo much latine church doubted auguſt▪ haer 35 ſaith aërius▪ fertur quoque propria dogma addidiſſe nonnulla dicens orare vel offerre pro mortuis oblationem non oportere cenſure aerius hereticke denial doctrine alſo epiphanius greeke church condemneth aerius like ſort ſaying againſt defence praier oblation dead epiphan haer 75 ibidem verſus finem ſaith eccleſia neceſſariò hoc perficit traditione à patribus accepta church hath receiued wide world agreed vpon aerius w •• ▪ hence • fulke confeſſeth ſaith fulke anſwer counterfet catholick pag 44 finem aerius taught pra • er dead vnprofitable witneſſe epiphanius auguſtine count error protestant appeale inquiring point prayer dead moſt truly catholike sect 1 praier dead according diuers reſpects leſſe anciēt caſſander obſerueth quamuis de ſtatu illo animarum quibus haec prodeſſent non ſatis conſtaret nec inter omnes conueniret omnes tamen hoc officium vt teſtimonium charitatis erga defunctos vt profeſſionem fidei de immortalitate animarum futura reſurrectione deo g • atum eccleſiae vtile iudicârunt caſſander conſult art 24 pag 225 agree ſtate man ſoule might haue benefit praiers liuing diuerſity methodically handle 2 conſidered caſe men ſoules departed either ſtate damnation elſe ſtate ſaluation latter double reſpect firſt miſerie ſubiect vnto temporall griefe ſome father thought eaſed relieued praiers ſecondly enioyeth reſt reſt hath bene conceiued ſome father loco refrigerij place eaſe refreſhing call common receptacle ſoules elect without court heauen continue vntill general reſurrection others beleeued high pallace heauen fruition preſence god lambe chriſt ieſus theſe different conſiderations reade ſome father diuerſe maners praying ſoules therefore enquire punctually amongſt theſe true apoſtolicke catholicke doctrine 3 firſt kind praiers applied ſome father behalfe verè lachrymis digm lunt—fruſtni vixerunt imò non fruſtrà ſed • alum de illis tempeſtruè • ce • ctur vtile 〈◊〉 illis ſi non f •• ſſſent nati— • hic quantum vitae fruſtrà inſumplit neque vaum diem vixit ſibi ſed voluptati luxuriae • aritiae peccato • abolo hoc igitur non plorabimus dic oro non tentabimus no ab periculis vniuerſall religious action catholike church 7 againe aërius offended vulgar opinion thoſe time thought si vero ommnò preces corum qui hic ſunt proſunt illis qui iſthic ſunt igitur nemo fit pius qui boni quicquam faciat ſed acquirat amicos quoſdam per quem vult modum aut per pecumas perſuadens aut amicis id obitu demandans orent pro ipſo vt ne quid illic patiatur neque immedicabilia peccata ab ipſo perpetrata requirantur epiphan haereſ 75 ante medium although man liued neuer ſo wickedly yet could procure ſome men either money friendſhip howſoeuer pray death might freed puniſhment due vnto ſinnes death opinion falſly calumniouſly imputed vnto church thereupon queſtioned whether praiers liuing 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 altogether profite dead vnto queſtion epiphanius returneth anſwer ſignifying mentioning name dead profit gained viz poſteà verò quae proferantur nomina vita defunctorum quid hoc magi fuerit vtile quid hoc commodius magi admiratione dignum quod credunt praeſentes quod hi qui praeceſſerunt viuunt non ſunt nulh ſed ſunt vmunt apud dominum vt pientiſſ praedicationem recenſeam quod ſpes eſt orantibu • pro frat • ibus velut qui peregrinatione ſunt proſunt autem preces pro ipſis factae etiamſi totam culpam non abſcu • dant epiphanius ibid ante fi • 〈◊〉 noteth epiphanius docet orationes quae fiunt pro delunctis prodeſſe ſed non dicit prodeſſe defunctis—quia per ea id quod eſt perfectius ſignificatur c thereby beleeue ſoules departed liue lord ſecond profit reſpect thoſe ſoules vniuſt intreating pardon 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 altogether queſtion epiphanius dimittc domine dimitte obſecro ne intres cum ea iudicium sed credo quòd iam feceris quod te rogo ſed voluntaria oris mei approba domine aug lib 9 confeſſ cap 13 bele • ue lord thou haſt alreadie done ſententum vſque ad illa impiorum tormenta protendere ſaltem ſic intelligant vt manente eis ira dei quae aeterno eſt praenunciata ſupplicio non contine deus hac ira ſua miſerationes ſuas faciat eos non tantâ quantà digni ſunt poenarum atrocitate cruciari non vt ea poenas vel nunquam ſubeant vel vt aliquando finiant ſed vt ea mitiores quàm merita ſunt corum leuioreſue patiantur—quod quidem non ideò confirmo quia non reſiſto auguſt de ciuit dei lib 21 c 24 condemned greg dial lib 4 c 44 non enim omnibus proſunt et quare non omnibus proſunt niſi propter diſterentia • vitae quam quiſque geſſit chryſoſtome ſaith themſelues allow praiers yeeld die mihi quae ſpes eſſe po • uerit illis qui cum peccatis ſuis eò hinc abſcedunt vbi peccata exuere non licet—digreſſi infernum vbi nihil prodeſle qu • 〈◊〉 pſal 6 inſerno quis confitebitur tibi quomodo digni non ſunt quideplorentur defleamus eos qui hoc pacto hinc abeunt non prohibco—defleto eos qui nihil ab infidelibus differunt—digni ſunt lamentationibus qui 〈…〉 condemnatis ſunt—deplorato co qui diuitijs mortui ſunt—cum poteſtatem ablucndorum pe catorum habuiſ • ent noluerunt—hos defleamus non vnū aut alterum diem ſed omnem vitam noſtram non ſunt abſurdi affectus hae lachtyn ae ſed magni amoris—quando ex timore dei naſcuntur—iuuemus co pro viribus procuren u illis ali u • auxlij • odici quidem attamen iuuemus eos—adhortemur alios vt pro illis orent pauperibuſue indeſine •• ter pro illis 〈…〉 denius habet re iſta non nihil conſolationis chryſoſt philip cap 1 serm 3 tom 4 eaſe vnto damned hell purgatorie fire quite chriſtians wept immoderatly dead quid ſibi volunt iſtae lampades tam ſplendidae nonne ſicut ath • e • mo • tuos comitamur quid etiam hymni nonnè vt deum glorificcmus ei gratias agamus quòd • coronauit diſcedentem quòd à laboribus liberauit quòd à timore liberatum apud ſe habet—sed ploto inquis tunc conſuetudmem • equiro verum illud quidem verè conſuetudinem quaerent um eſt hoc autem de reſurrectione delperantium cogita quid p • allas illo tempore reuert •• e inquis anima mea requiem • ā quia dominus benefecit tibi—dic mihi dicis dominum benefcciſſe tibi lachrymari • nonne ſcena ſunt iſta nonne hypocriſis si enim verè credis • bi quae dicis ſuperuacu • luge ſi autem ludis fingis fabulas eſſe putas quare pſallis ad te venientes quare non repellis pſallentes chryſ • ſi h • 4 epiſt ad heb tom 4 ſol • 69 70 ad • op antioch bethinke thy ſelfe thou ſingeſt returne ſoule thy reſt wherewith lord hath bleſſed thee tell canst thou ſay lord hath done bountifully thee doſt thou weepe better diſsimulation hypocritical ſtageplay c earneſt vrge would haue allowed doctrine religioſorum omniū corpus qui diuina vocatione ab hac vita recedūt cū pſalmistātūmodo pſallentiū tertullus ſideliſſimus frater—ſignificet mihi dy quibas carcere beati fratres •• h • ſaid neque enim virtu eorū aut honor minor eſt quo minus ipſi quoque inter beatos martyres aggregentur noſtri ad immortalitatem glorioſae mortis exitu tranſeunt celebrentur hîc à nobis oblationes ſacrificia ob commemorationes eorum cyprian lib 3 epiſt 6 theſe oblation sportularum contributiones lib 1 ep 9 oblation almes poore cyprian noteth haue beene vſed remembrance bleſſed saint ad refrigerium iuſti vocantur ad ſupplicium rapiuntur iniuſti symeon laetus itaque de morte iam proxima de vicina accerſione ſecurus accepit manibus puerum benedicens deum exclamauit nunc dimittis ſeruum tuum domine ſecundùm verbum tuum pace quoniam viderunt oculus mei ſalutare tuum probans ſcilicet conteſtans tunc eſſe ſeruis dei pacem tunc liberam tranquillam quietem quando de iſtis mundi turbinibus extracti ſedis ſecuritatis aeternae portum petimus quando expuncta hac morte ad immortalitatem venimus—si dilexiſſetis gauderctis quoniam ad patrem vado ioh 14 docens oſtendens cùm chari quos diligimus de ſeculo exeunt gaudendum potius quàm dolendum cuius rei memor b apoſtolus paulus epiſt ſua ponit dicit mihi viuere chriſtus eſt mori lucrum lucrum maximum computans iam ſeculi laqueis non teneri iam nullis peccatis vitijs carnis obnoxium fieri exemplum preſſuris augentibus venenatis diaboli faucibus liberatum ad laetitiam ſalutis aeternae chriſto vocante proficilci cyprtanus serm 4 de immortal commemoration alſo ſheweth owne teſtimonie purgation ſinne concluſion iuſt called refreſhing wicked beda—quae clarè indicant aliquos iam defunct • although eaſed prayer ſaith vſque ad diem iudicij manſuros purgatorio— eccleſia anniuerſaria ſacra offert orat p • eis quos conſtat ducentos iam annos argument firſt naturall ſhamefaſtneſſe ſecond light hiſtorie third authority ancient father 2 firſt conſtrained maruell confeſsion ſecret ſinnes ſhould ſeeme ſo ſingularly ſtrange compulſarie vnto hath true ſence owne ſinne though altogether repugnant vnto naturall man found practiſe among infidel themſelues illud meritò mi ari quiſqua poſſit confeſſionem peccatorum etiam occu • torum grauium celebri vſu apud hoſce barbaros longè ante chriſti euangelium auditum frequentatam erant sacerdotes non pauci huic ipſi muneri aſſignati qui plebis audiendi • confeſſionibus vacarent—at illud non admirationem ſed ſtuporem mihi propemodum affert valuiſſe tantum diaboli hominumue mendacium apud homines vt non ſolùm occulta crimina proderent ſed ſaeus etiam poenas ſibi pro eis iniungi aequo animo paterentur iubebantur ſaepè expiandi adulterij aut alicuius ſceleris cauſa duriſſimo ſaxo ad ſcapulas tundi fortiter interdum à iuuenibus diu virgis caedi non ra • ò ſi ſceleris magnitudo aliquid poſtulare videretur acerbius excelſam atque omni genere ſolatij deſtituram rupem ſecedre longum aeuum ibi ferarum traducere—quod viti ſide digni oſtenderunt c acoſta ieſ lib 6 de indorum ſalute cap 12 among indian paganes ſaith ieſuite acoſta without wondring auricular confeſsion vſe wherein heathen laid open prieſts ſecret heinous crime alſo inflict puniſhment vpon themſelues expiation ſinnes ſuffering themſelues whipped yong men rod vglineſſe fault required ſo much betake themſelues deſert place manner beaſts ſpent whole life within hole rockes 3 neither yet wondred diſtinguiſh neceſſity either part elſe abſolute phyſick may recouer health partly neceſſarie abſolutely neceſſarie without cannot healed former proteſtants haue ſome caſes acknowledged requiſite catharinus lib 5 cont caiet ca • etam fiduciam nimiam repr • dat cum cōmento huius locus iam recitaui • nens contrariam ſententiam eam proculdubio aſſeuerat equidem ter • eor tam n • ultorum de hoc loco pro pri • ata ſacramentali confeſſione iudicio ne definitè aliquid iudicem non auſim tamen etiam hoc ipſo iudicio illud ca • e • ani pr • culd • b • vſurpare vt nec ſ • ntientis contrarium baronij certum eſt nam excipere quiſpiam poſſet ſe • monem non eſte de iam baptizatis ſed de catechumenis iam vel animo voluntate pro▪ enſis ad doctrinam pauli chriſtianā religionem vt non ra • ò ſuperiore hac hiſtoria tota c 4 4 c 5 14 c 8 12 13 c 11 21 c 16 31 34 qua ante baptiſmum quidam credidiſſe dicuntur vel credentes conuerſi eſſe ad dominum quamuis non ignorem abſolutum nomen credentium ſicut • id • lium de conſummatè chriſtianis hoc eſt baptizatis intelligi po •• ren • ò baſilius cuius penitus authoritas dep • imeret ſallor niſi contrarium indicat ait enim actis • aberi apoſtolis peccata confeſſos à quibus baptizabantur cuncti id • n▪ verbis ipſiſſ docet anaſtaſius nica nu quaeſt 6 script non vrgeo multitudinem apoſto • orum poteſt eſſe namque enallage • umers baptiſmus non conferebatur ordinane à paulo 1 cor 1 17 nec forſan ab alijs apoſtolis niſi dicamus ab ijs quia eorum iuſſu per illos quibus myſteriorum diſpenſationem tradidiſſent conſtat samaritanos baptizatos á philippo diacono act 8 12 illud quod ſcribit baſilius quibus etiam baptizabantur cuncti non minus accipi poteſt poſt confeſſionem quim ante • ò vt reſpondeat alteri exemplo corum qui lohanni con • itebantur melius antè baptizabat ſiquidem iohannes iam confeſſos accedit quod nullus ex antiquioribus theologis probat hoc ex loco ſacramentalem confeſſionem neque vel concilium vel catechiſnius conc tridentini neque ex recentioribus nonnulli qui hoc tamen accuratè argumentum ſunt proſecuti vt suarez 3 part marianus victor hiſt de ſacram confeſt imò vt poſteà dicam aliqui negant hic agi de illa • gratianns ca voluiſſent de poenit diſt 1 vtitur tantum illo ad probandam neceſſitatem poenitentiae ſicut alijs qui de sacramentali nullo pacto concludunt michael de platio 4 diſt 17 diſp 5 apertè docet confeſſionem auricularem nec hinc colligi nec ex citato baſilij teſtimonio atque hoc nomine catharinum arguit quod caietanum id negantem reprehenderet andieas vega l 13 de • uſtif c 28 verba inquit ex actibus refe • ri poſſunt ad confeſſionem quandam genere quae ſicut tempore iohannis ante baptiſmum ipſius ita tempore quoque apoſtolorum à ſuſcipientibus chriſti fidem fiebat antequam daretur eis baptiſmus chriſti euſebius l 3 demonſt c 8 planè ſupponit ho illos qui libros magnos combuſſerunt immediatè prius fuiſſe gentile non chriſtianos quia • ò confeſſi ſunt hoc ideò feciſſe quod erationis vi apoſtolus intimam auditorum conſcientiam attingeret adeò vt nemo amplius occultare poſſet ſed ſe quodammodo prodere cogeretur auguſtinus pſal 61 idem ſignificat arator autem diſertè ita ſentit aitue hoc miraculo veniſſe ad baptiſmum illos qui combuſſerant libros id feciſſe vt impetrarent baptiſmum aſt alij magicis ponunt incendia libris vt mercantur aqua vitent ignibus nicholas protestant appeale sect 1 queſtion tranſubſtantiation replie hath met anſwer ſufficiently referre vnto reader cenſure come examine phraſe ſpeech 2 forme recantation preſcribed vnto berengarius theſe word ego berengarius c—conſentio autem ſanctae rom eccleſiae apoſtolicae ſedi orc corde conſiteor de sacramentis dominicae men ſae endem ſidem tencre quam dominus venerabilis papa nicolaus haec ſancta synodus authoritate euangelica apoſtolica tenendam tradidit mihiue firmauit ſcilicet panem vinum quae altari ponuntur poſt conſecrationem non ſolùm sacramentum ſed etiam verum corpus ſanguinem domini noſtri ieſu chriſti eſſe ſenſualiter non ſolum sacramentum ſed veritate manibus sacerdotum tractari frangi ſidelium dentibus atteri surius conc tom 3 pag 600 berengarius profeſſe hold ſame faith venerable pope nicholas holy synode doth preſcribe beleeued wit bread wine ſet altar conſecration onely sacrament alſo bodie bloud chriſt ſenſibly handled broken hand prieſts torne teeth faithfull communicant tenour reconciliation aduerſaries haue ſhewed haue bin approued hanc confeſſionem ſuae fidei de corpore ſanguine domini noſtri ieſu chriſti à berengario romae coram 114 epiſcopis factam miſit papa nicolaus per vibe italiae germaniae galliae ad quaecunque loca fama prauitatis eius pervenire ante potuit vt eccleſiae quae prius doluerant de aue • ſo peruerſo poſtea gaudeant de reuerſo atque conuerſo decret 3 part de conſecrat diſt 2 ego berengarius binius tom 3 pag 1286 pope nicholas ſent throughout coast italy germany france manifestation berengarius conuerſion albeit forme hereof ſuch owne romiſh gloſſe feared cenſure thus thou cautelouſly vnderſtand theſe word thou ſhalt fall greater hereſie berengarius condēned gladly therefore would vnderſtand true expoſition hereof 3 apologiſts ſatisfactiō bring chryſoſtom ſpeaking receiuing chriſt euchariſt ſaying ipſum vides c thou ſeeſt chriſt herein thou feeleſt eateſt ſuffereth thy teeth fixed fleſh might haue added frō ſame father see aboue lib 2 cap 2 sect 17 lit tongs made red dentibus niſi ſanc̄ intelligas verba berengarij meaning forme recantation • orem incides haereſin quàm ipſe fuerit imò omnia referes ad ſpecies ipſas nam de chriſti corpore partes non facimus gloſſa decret 3 part de conſecrat diſt 2 ego berengarius bloud demand theſe ſpeeches vnderſtood literally properly improperly figuratiuely properly call verbal obiectiō improperly haue aduerſaries obiected theſe literall ſpeeches chryſoſtome proofe ibid tranſubſlantiation gloſſe cenſure forme ſpeech approued pope nicholas according literall ſence thereof better hereticall 4 much apologiſts haue thus fauourably qualified theſe term • muſt ſuffer themſelues inſtructed thoſe teſtimonies haue bene produced father preſſed rigor phraſe haue bene much better verball obiections 5 ſhal ſaid behalfe doctor concerning pope nicholas idiome ſpeech proofe tranſubſtantiation authorized phraſe tearing fleſh chriſt teeth shall thought excuſable ſayings chryſoſtome deemed nothing verball obiections difference great aduerſaries themſelues haue v marke animaduertere debemus diligenter diſtinguere lectione patrum quae ab illis contentioſè id eſt occaſione praeſentis certaminis quo eorum diſputatio vertatur ad aliam longè diuerſam materiā per tinentia proferuntur quae autem dogmatic • id eſt cum ſtud • propoſito docendi ab illis aſleruntur—nam priore genere liberum eſt lectori cordato perito iudicium non autem iſto poſteriori stapleton • trin princip contr • •• r 3 lib • cap 16 pag 267 obſerue diligently whē father teſtimonies ſaith satis conſtat occidentalem ſeu romanam mille à chriſto annis ſolenni ordinaria huius sacramenti diſpenſatione vt • amque panis vini ſpeciem omnibus eccleſiae membris exhibuiſſe▪ id quod ex innumeris veteribus tam graecorum quàm latinorum teſtimonijs manifeſtum eſt atque ita facere inductos fuiſſe inſtituto exemplo chriſti—qui mo hucuſque per graeciam armeniam obtinet—quare non temerè eſt quòd optimi quique catholici eccleſiaſticorum ſcriptorum lectione verſati—ſummo deſiderio potiundi dominici calicis incenduntur vt sacramentum iuxta conſuetudinem veterem multis ſeculis perpetuatam vniuerſalis eccleſiae reducatur caſſander conſult art 22 pag 168 innumerable ancient well greeke latine ſpace thouſand yeares chriſt came altered eſtue hoc diligenter notandum alterius ſpeciei communionem non tam epiſcoporum mandato quàm popul • vſu facto conniuentibus tamen praeſulibus irrepſiſſe populus enim ob varia incommoda paulatim à calice abſtin • bant epiſcopi propter varia effuſionis ſanguinis aliaue pericula tacendo hanc abſtinentiam comprobabant quae abſtinentia à calice cum tempore conſtantienſis conc ferè per europam vniuerſalis eſſet non erat damnanda ſed contra haereticos inſu • gens defendenda coſter ieſ enchirid tract de commun ſub vtraque ſpecie pag 359 diligently obſerued ſaith ieſuite coſterus vſing one kind wit bread onely euchariſt taken vp veritati poſ •• •• tatem mendacitati deputandam—primò bonum ſemen ſeminatum matth 13 poſtea à diabolo lolium tert praeſcript yeelding principalitie vnto truth ſaith tertullian poſteritie vnto lying ſo muſt need becauſe muſt firſt iron ruſt cankereth iron ſo muſt virgine truth error nothing elſe adulteration thereof primum verum primarie antiquitie truth inſeparable twin begot bred ſame inſtant yet firſt ſeduction mankind ſhortly follow integrity firſt creation ſo ſometime difference betweene error truth reſpect time hath bene wheate day tare ſame night made cyprian ſay vetuſtas erroris tertullian noteth ſome hereſies haue bene tertul praeſcript coaetaneas apoſtolorum broached apoſtles time yet ſtill ſo truth might alwaies challenge birthright 11 sauiour chriſt reforming corrupt doctrine diuorce ancienter moſes ancient conſtitution euen matth 19 ab initio beginning teach v wiſely diſtinguiſh antiquity one primitiue hereditary adoptiue inuention concerning theſe two ancient herein generally approued father haue giuen v preſcriptions 12 conſider si haec ita ſunt conſtat proinde omnem doctrinam quae cum illis eccleſijs apoſtolicis matricibus originalibus fidei conſpiret veritati deputandā ſine dubio tenentes quod eccleſiae ab apoſtolis apoſtoli à chriſto chriſtus à deo ſuſcepit reliquam verò omnem doctrinam de mendacio praeiudicandam quae ſapiat contra veritatem eccleſiarum apoſtolorum chriſti dei tertullian de praeſcript paulò ante medium primitiue antiquitie proceeded ab apoſtolis holy apoſtles preſerued à viris apoſtolicis next ſucceſſors apoſtles hold doctrine preiudicial vnto faith apoſtles one paſtor church ſhall aſſume himſelfe power preſcribe new doctrine vnto church one choaketh romiſh preſumption concerning infallibility iudgement one pope ouer whole church eſteemed ſentence lirinenſis et ne quis forſitan praetermiſſis caeteris ſe ſolùm audiri ſibi ſoli credi arrogaret paulò poſt ait 1 cor 14 á vobis inquit verbum dei proceſſit aut vos ſolos deuenit et ne hoc quaſi perfunctoriè acciperetur adiecit ſiquis inquit videtur propheta eſſe aut ſpiritualis id eſt ſpiritualium rerum magiſter ſummo ſtudio aequalitatis vnitatis cultor exiſtat vt ſcil neque opiniones ſuas caeteris praeferat ab vniuerſorum ſenſibus non recedat vincentius lirinenſ contra haereſ cap 40 arrogant noueller yea tell v noueltie apoſtle exhorted timothie 1 tim 6 20 keepe committed vnto take heede profane nouelties effect inſtruct depoſitum • quit cuſtodi quid eſt depoſitum id eſt quod tibi creditum eſt non quod à te inuentum quod accepiſti non quod excogitâſti rem ad te perductam non à te prolatam qua non author debes eſſe ſed cuſtos non inſtitutor ſed ſectator non ducens ſed ſequens depoſitum inquit cuſtodi lirinenſis ibid cap 27 preſerue doctrine receiued ſuggeſt doctrine newly conceiued ſaith lirinenſis accounteth according vnto salmeron deſcription whoriſh • icke call ancient beaten way ſay deuita prophanas vocum nouitates—si vitanda eſt nouitas tenenda eſt antiquitas little nonne haec verba ſunt illius meretricis quae apud salomonis prouerbia vocat ad ſe praetercuntes viam qui eſt inquit prou 9 veſtrùm inſipientiſſ diuertat ad idem ibid cap 26 come vnto new doctrine ſhall ſeeme infect whole church ſhall direction ſuch caſe taught reſpect preſent vniuerſalitie quid ſi nouella aliqua contagio non iam portiunculam tantùm ſed totam pariter eccleſiam commaculare conetur tunc prouidebit vt antiquitati adhaereat quae prorſus iam non poteſt ab vlla nouitatis ſraude ſeduci ibid cap 4 adhere vnto former apoſtolicall antiquitie 13 yet may demanded ſome particular church cannot peraduenture deriue doctrine defendeth lineall deſcent paſtors ſhall notwithſtanding profeſſe altogether apoſtles doctrine whether ſhal called new church euery ſuch church ad hanc formam prouocabuntur ab illis eccleſijs quae licet nullum ex apoſtolis vel apoſtolicis authorem ſuum proferant vt multò poſteriores quae denique quotidiè inſtituuntur tamen eadem fide conſpirantes non minùs apoſtolicae deputantur pro conſanguinitate doctrinae tert praeſcript called primitiue apoſtolicall euen ſaith tertullian conſanguinitieſake hath doctrine neceſſe eſt itaque tot ac tantae eccleſiae vnam eſſe illam ab apoſtolicis primam ex quâ omnes sic omnes primae omnes apoſtolicae dum vnam omnes probant vnitatem tertul praeſcript apoſtles whereupon followeth thoſe church muſt eſteemed vnde autem extranei inimici apoſtolis haeretici niſi ex diuerſitate doctrinae quam vnuſquiſque de ſuo arbitrio aduerſus apoſtolos aut protulit aut recepit idem ibid ſtrangers true faith teach definitionibus prouocatae à nobis reuictae haereſes omnes ſiue quâ poſterae ſiue quâ coaetaneae apoſtolorum dummodo diuerſae et paulò poſt quod ab apoſtolis non damnatur imò defenditur hoc erit iudicium proprietatis quam enim damnant quaſi extraneam quamque non damnauerunt ſuam oſtendunt ideoque defendunt ibidem contrarie vnto apoſtles tradition 14 notwithſtanding proteſtants diſquiſition truth abſolutely bound name antiquity within compaſſe firſt centurie yeares content allow longer extent therefore doctrine truly called catholike 1 reſpect original apoſtolical 2 extēt vniuerſally receiued firſt church 3 vſe neceſſary either faith maners refuſe tried teſtimonies ancient father firſt dicunt proteſtantes poſt quingentos annos coepiſſe valdè inualeſcere hanc ſectam viz new romiſh religion bellarm lib 4 de notis eccleſ cap 5 § tertio c sexcentis annis sacroboſcus ieſ defenſ bellar part 3 c 2 § sed fortè fiue hundred yeares chriſt time following vnderſtand doctrine becauſe conſanguinitie apostolicall doctrine bleſſing god happily enioy profeſſe proofe whereof proceede vnto diſcouerie chap xvii manifold notorious confeſſed innouations romiſh church doctrine cuſtomes firſt worſt new doctrine tranſgreſsing onely law diſcerning true antiquitie doctrine sect 1 maine queſtion diſcerning true bookes holy writ proteſtants appeale romiſh concil trid seſſ 4 anathema vnto iudgemēt primitiue church attributing vnto right authoritie aſſigning determining perfect canon scripture doctrine impugned stapleton ſaying quod ad iudicium determinationem approbationem scripturarum canonicarum attinet eius authoritatem penis praeſentem eccleſiam eſſe non ſecùs quàm penis apoſtolos fuit stapleton doctrin princip lib 9 cap 12 leſſe authority preſent church meaning rome determining approuing true bookes bible apoſtles themſelues 2 poſition granted gap preſently opened legion profane nouelties inuade ſurprize church god like determination truth ſhal ſufficient ſay defined church equall authoritie primitiue church matter prepoſterous indeed ridiculous proteſtants according former preſcriptions ſet downe tertullian vincentius lirinenſis appeale vnto iudgement antiquitie pleade truth euidence primitiue church 3 ſhall let reader perceiue diſſimulated vant antiquity vnmasked diſcouering noueltie profaneneſſe one new poſition whereby law antiquitie ſo notably obſcured buried deſtitute teſtimonies ancient doctor euen romiſh schoole ſuch eccleſia primiti • propter coll • gium apeſtolorum ad tradendam ſidei doctrinam matoris erat grati • matoris authoritatis quàm eccleſia quae nunc eſt driedo de varijs dogma • lib 4 cap 4 driedo apoſtolorum eccleſia haec noſtra vna eadem indiuidua eccleſia eſt ſicut idem indiuiduus homo eſt puer ſenex quare quod olim fecerunt apoſtoli fecit eccleſia ouae nunc eſt illis sed alto pro ſacris aut canonicis approbare non poteſt qu im quos illa approbauit exempli gratiâ thomae euangelium recipere ne ſanè videretur licere papae concilio ſuperaddere scriptur ſine fine waldenſis doctr ſid tom 1 lib 2 art 2 cap 20 21 waldenſis credimus scripturam eſſe à deo inſpiratam quia eccleſia quae regitu • à spiritu ſancto hoc approbat—vnde aug cont fundamentum manichaei ſic non crederem euangelio niſi crederem eccleſiae approbanti—hoc autem quod dictum eſt de approbatione scripturae per eccleſiam intelligitur ſolùm de eccleſia quae fuit tempore apoſtolorum qui fuerunt repleti spiritu ſancto durand lib 3 sent diſt 24 qu 1 num 8 9 lugduni 1563 vnto theſe teſtimonies ſhewing v church hath power approue scripture canonicall ſo acknowledged apoſtles time doctor stapleton doth oppoſe anſwer catholicorum quorundam ſententijs ſecùs opinantium corumue argumentis enumeratis reſpondetur doctr princip lib 9 c 13 14 durandus stapleton laboureth confute held although primitiue ſucceeding church one euen one indiuiduall man whether old yong ſame man yet primitiue authority deliuering vnto v doctrine faith conſideration ſay moued augustine ſay beleeued scripture except church god moued vnderſtanding church ancient catholicke church first preached goſpell thing learned chancellor maior erat primitiuae eccleſiae authoritas quoad praedicta quàm nunc eſt non • nim poteſtate papae aut concilij aut eccleſiae eſt immutare traditiones data ab euangeliſtis à paulo ſicut quidam delirant nec habent quoad hoc▪ quod eſt facere aliquid eſſe purè de fide parem authoritatis firmitatem—et hinc aperitur modus intelligendi illud auguſtini euangelio non crederem niſi authoritas eccleſiae compuliſſet ibi enim eccleſia ſumitur pro primitiua congregatione fidelium qui chriſtum viderunt audiuerunt ſui teſtes extiterunt gerſon de vita ſpirit animae lect 2 coral 7 gerſon doth alſo expreſly obſerue muſt vnto v poleſtarre direction turbulent contention antiquitie chap xviii ſecond confeſſed romiſh innouation aſſuming new canon scripture old teſtament thereby profaning chiefe principle chriſtian ſaith sect 1 lindanus ieſuits salmeron acoſta proue councell laodicaea nazianzene hierome himſelfe 4 nothing preiudice defence third councell carthage whence concil carthag 3—l • omnes libri nominati ſunt coſterus antiquitie canon old teſtament may ſatisfied either doubtfulneſſe canon ſelfe may collected teſtimonie cardinall rurſum verò de recenſitis ſub eodem concilio viz carthag 3 quinquaginta canonibus haud omnes hac synodo ſanciti probantur ſed diuerſis alijs concilij • carthaginenſibus vt inter alios▪ ille quo ſacrorum librorum certus numerus definitur nam ex eiuſdem canonis verbis ſatis exploratum redditur decretum eſſe illud conc carthag tempore bonifacij papae habito baronius anno chriſti 3 • 7 num 26 could ſhewin canon councell ſame decree euer extant alſo proued binius canones quinquaginta quorum tituli hic aſſignantur non omnes hac synod • ſed diuerſis alijs conc carthaginenſibus ſanciti probantur inter alios 19 30 47 laſt canon queſtion alijs synodis editos fuiſſle • tà dicemus binius annot conc carthag 3 pag 548 col 2 baronius • veteris teſtamenti p • imo ominū moyſi c reciting controuerted new teſtament addeth haec ſunt quae patros intra canonē concluſerunt ex quibus fidei noſtrae aſſertiones conſtate volu • runt immediatly sciendum eſt quòd alij libri ſunt non canoni • ſed eccleſiaſtici à maroribus appellati vt sapientia c ruffinan symbol • apud cypr hierome quomodo viginti duo elementa c controuerted yet former quicquid extra h • eſt intra apocrypha eſſe ponendum—igitur sapientia iudith c non ſunt canone hieron praef libros regum prologo gal • ato tom 3 binius certainly decreed councell elſe expoſition cardinall caietane inſtructeth reader diſtinguiſh word canonicall viz ſeruing either ne turberes nouitie ſiquando inuenies ho libros inter canonicos ſupputari vel ſacris conc vel doctoribus non enim canonici ſunt id eſt regulares ad firmanda ea quae ſunt fidei ſed quoad canonem morum leguntur card caietan fine com veteris teſtamenti idem quod gratianus diſt 16 ca 1 gloſſ rule faith manner firſt kinde ſuch scripture properly called canonicall vndoubted oracle god ſecond degree doth compriſe ſufficient authoritie eſtabliſ • ing point faith confeſſed example gregory choiſe approued doctor hath bene ſenſibly confirmed whereby greenneſſe firſt great innouation doth bewray itſelfe confeſſed romiſh change vulgar tranſlation scripture sect 2 9 common aduerſaries grace vulgar latine tranſlation name vulgar author whileſt ordinarily call hieromes bible vulgatam verſionem hieronymi eſſe contendit eugubinus alij nonnul • therefore reproued bellar lib 2 de verbo dei cap 9 initio ſome doctor affirmed ſay euerie part ſo vnlearnedly dicumus pſalterium noſtrum non eſſe illud quod b hieron 〈◊〉 ex hebr • • 〈◊〉 et probabile eſt libros • ap eccleſiaſtici macchab 〈◊〉 non habere ex verſione 〈◊〉 quos bitrabatur eſſe apocryphos bellar • id dicimus § tertia prop cardinall bellarmine thinke hierome haue bene author tranſlation either pſalmes macchabees ſuch bookes iudged apochrypha albeit doth entitle hierome tranſlator reliqua omnia ex hieronymi verſione ex hebraeo habemus nam vetus teſtam ex hebraeo latinum tranſtulit nonum ex veteri latina emendauit idem ibid ſparſim cap 8 § nouum autem part old teſtament corrector old tranſlation new teſtament accordingly ieſuite hieronymus noſtram emendans verſionem moniut c quae re argumento eſt nouū teſtamentū ab eo conuerſum non eſſe ſed veterē tantùm eius verſionem multis locis emendatam maldonat ieſ com luc 16 1 alſo sacrob • ſ ieſ defenſ decret part 1 cap 3 pag 29 azor ieſ inſtit moral part 1 lib 8 cap 3 maldonate hath done contradicted iudgement lindanus exactly thus interpretis latini ſiue pſalmorum ſiue nom teſtamenti nomen nobis quidem compertum eſt minimè non ſum neſcius quoſdam varijs ductos coniecturis varios diuinare interpretes—saepè multumue de noſtrae latinae editionis interprete cogitans plurima videre videor quae ad •• picandum inuitant vt non latium hominem ſed graeculum • uiſſe exiſtimem ſiquidem illa priſca aetas ante annos 1500 hac verſione vſa haud ita potuit à romanae lingua puritate tantillum degenerate lindanus lib 3 de opt genere interp c 6 haue certaine knowledge tranſlator vulgar latine either pſalmes new teſtament ſee many reaſons ſaith make ſuſpect ſome ſmatterer greeke tongue author hereof bene ſo ancient argument confeſſe full grammaticall fault teſte azor ieſ inſtit moral part 1 lib 8 cap 3 wil ſufficiently proue part tranſlation ſo anciēt pretended could haue ſo much degenerated puritie latine tongue reaſon ſome others edito à conc tridentino 4 regula conſtituta ſic h • bet—cum experientiâ manifeſtum eſt ſacra biblia vulgari lingua paſſim ſine diſcrimine permittantur plus indè ob hominum temeritatem detrimenti quàm vtilitatis • iri hac reiudicio epiſcopi aut inquiſitoris—vt bibliorum à catholicis authoribus verſotum lectionem vulgari lingua eis concedere poſſint quos intellexerint inde fidei atque pietatis capere poſſe—qui autem abſque huiuſmodi facultate legere praeſumpſerit c—regulares verò non niſi facultate à praelatis ſuis habita ea legere aut em • poſſint councell trent publiſhed rule forbidding euery one common people yea regular reade retaine vulgar tranſlation without licence biſhops inquiſitor ſo commanded vpon pretence common vſe scripture experiēce found rather hurtfull profitable leſt firſt rule licence official kind might make bible common et indice recens edito iuſſu clementis 8 circa praedictam 4 reg—nullam per hanc impreſſionem editionem de nouo tribui facultatem epi • copis vel inquiſitoribus aut regularium ſuperioribus concedendi licentiam legendi biblia vulgari lingua edita cum hactenus mandato vſu r e vniuer • ali inquiſitionis ſublata eis fuerit facultas concedendi huiuſmodi licentias azor ieſ inſtit moral part 1 lib 8 cap 26 § tertio quaeritur § quaeres pope clement eight would giue new faculty either vnto biſhops inquiſitors ſuperiors ouer regular grant licence reading bible knowne tongue though greater miſt spaine rome telleth v hiſpania tamen indice librorum prohibitorum ibi edito • thoritate generalis illis prouincijs inquiſitotis reg 6 ſic habet prohibentur biblia vulgari lingua cum omnibus ſu • p • rt bus acſi •• biblia corum partes indice recenti edito iuſſu n clement obſ • ruat circa 4 praedictam reg indicis editi iuſſu pij 4 ſic habetur sublata eis ſuerit viz epiſcopis inquiſitoribus regularium ſuperioribus facultas concedendi licentiam legendi▪ vel retinendi biblia vulgaria aut alias • acrae scripturae tam noui quàm veteris teſtam pa • te quam • vulgari lingua editas azorius ieſuita inſi • tut moral quo ſupra pag 714 bible part printed vulgar language permitted spaine ſo farre giuing allowance vnto ſuch tranſlations bible quaeres inſuper permittantur ſcripti vulgari lingua precationum horariarum libelli quibus continentur pſalmi cantica ex biblijs excepta indice hiſp reg 6 7 omnes huiuſmodi lingua vernacula conſe ipti compendia etiam hiſtorica eorundem bibliorum ſeu librorum ſacrae scripturae quocunque vulgari idiomate conſcripta quae quidem inuiolatè praecipitur ſeruandum idem azorius ibidem permit reade thoſe temporis • udaei ſcripſere—caeteri verò noui teſtam libri graecè ſunt conſcripti quia ortentalium gentium quae rom imperio ditione viuebant erat propria lingua eccleſia latina ſacri diuim libri latinè coeperunt proinde linguis editae ac traditae fuêre quae tunc vſu erant apud gentium nationes azorius ieſ ibid anſwer ſaith scripture thoſe time publiſhed nation therefore made common thoſe three docentes commonentes vos inuicem vbi scholia hieronymo primaſio inſcripta et hic oſtenditur laicos verbum domini non ſolùm ſufficientèr ſed etiam abundantèr habe • e debere ſe mutuo docere ac monere c equidem patribus orthodoxis non omninò nec indiligentèr per dei gratiam verſatus ſum quàm non potui non co ſemper mirari quibus hodi • tam peſtilens tam capitale videtur quod veteres contrà vt adeo etiam de scriptura ſacra quia v •• l • eſt animae prodeſt eti • mſi ſenſus noſter ad praeſens intelligentiam non capit quoniam vt diximus bonae virtutes quae nobis ad • unt reſiciuntur ſermonibus paſcuntur contrariae torpeſcunt med • tationibus eſtugantur—non iſta de cauſa haec diximus nec excuſantes no iſta protulimus ſed vt oſtenderemus scripturis ſacris eſſe vim quandam quae legenti etiam populus ad monte scripturarum ibiue inueniet monte moyſen ieſum filium naue monte prophetas mont • noui teſtamerti apoſtolos eu • ngeliſtas cum ad tale monte confuger • huiuſmodi montium fuerit lib 2 de verbo dei ca 16 § obijcies ſpirituall conſolation duplex eſt fructus deuotionis alius eſt ſpiritualis conſolatio deuotio concepta ex oratione et quan tum ad fructum ſpiritualis deuotionis priuatur qui non attendit ad ea quae orat ſen non intelligit aquinas c • man 1 cor 14 fol 100 deuotion thus much ſeuerally confeſſed cardinall caietan cardinall bellarmine aquinas chiefe doctor romiſh schoole euer antiquitie thinke theſe three neceſſarily cheriſhed foſtered god people vitall part holy worſhip quod ſi populus intelligit orationem ſeu bene dictionem ſacerdotis melius reducitur deum deuotius reſpondet amen • yra 1 cor 14 people ſaith lyra vnderſtand prayer prieſt better reduced vnto god praying vnto ſaying amen 37 regard apoſtles doctrine concerning common prayer church certaine wil haue congregation ſay amen yeeld open expreſſe conſent vnto publike prayer ignorant language prayer ſaith 1 cor 14 ſhall ſay amen thy giuing thanks aquinas doth paraphraſe quomodo enim dicet amē cum quid orat ne • cit quià non poteſt intelligere quid boni dicas niſi quod benedicas tantùm aquinas com cum locum 1 cor 14 ſhall ſay amen prayeth knoweth becauſe vnderſtandeth quid boni dicas onely quòd benedicas therefore optandum videtur vt iuxtà apoſtolicum mandatum priſcum eccleſiae morem publicis eccleſiae precibus cantionibus lectionibus quae populi causâ ſuſcipiuntur populi ratio habeatur neque totum ac perpetuò ab omni communione precum arceatur manifeſta ſunt verba apoſtoli cum qui ob imperitiam quod dicitur non intelligit fieri non poſſe vt ad alterius gratiarum actionem amen reſpondeat caſſander defenſ offic pij viri contra caluinum pag 141 cannot poſſibly ſaith caſſander ſay amen vnto giuing thanks made wiſh according vnto apoſtles command cuſtome primitiue church faithfull people god may better reſpected ſeemeth reaſonable vnto faber complaining ſaith maximum par hominum cùm nunc orat neſcio ſi ſpiritu tamen mente non orat nam lingua orat quam non intelligit paulus maximè probat vt fideles paritèr ſpiritu orent mente faber 1 cor 14 fol 13 b greateſt number people day pray vnderſtanding paul ſaith haue men pray vnderſtanding alſo 38 laſtly conſider glorie conceſſiſſe dicitur vt patri • lingu • ſacris operandis vteretur • • omnes gens pertinere videtur omnis ſpi • itus laudet deum caſſander quo ſupra verbisſeq pope cardinal deliberation whether ſhould yeeld vnto requeſt sclauonians deſired haue praiers countrey language moued conſent hearing oracle anſwering let euery ſpirit praiſe lord voice caſſander hath well noted doth well command liberty people acknowledged poperties knowne praiers wit edification conſolation deuotion worſhippers god conſequently auaile vnto better worſhipping god ſpirit truth ſhall romane church iudged innouator hath himſel • e therefore ſhall proue euen aduerſaries confeſſions pope magnified romiſh profeſſion onely innouator euen innouation ſelfe regard ſpirituall temporall ſtate many nouell notorious abuſes 2 firſt aſſuming vnicus cardinall bellarmine cannot denie eccleſia eſt vna eadē omni tempore non debet igitur mutari forma regiminis bell lib 2 de pont ca 12 § secūdò ex church one ſhould time keepe one ſame forme gouernment ſo doth confeſſe fuit enim illis eccleſiae primordijs neceſſarium ad fidem toto orbe terrarum celeritèr diſſeminandam vt primis praedicatoribus eccleſiarum fundatoribus ſumma cōmunicated vnto chiefe builder yet ſaith ſoone apoſtles dead apoſtolicall authority abide onely ſucceſſor peter meaning pope many one common proper another without alteration 3 secondly pope vnicus marcelli nonnulli demum ad pontiani ſeculum idem ibidem § ſeqq ſay ſaith ieſuit pope gregory firſt ſome sylueſter ſome marcellus kind doubtfull brood called terraefilius permit polydore blazon sanè hi marcellum aiunt quinque viginti dioeceſes conſtituiſſe ad vſum baptiſmi ſepulturae illi verò ſcribunt eundem pont quindecim feciſſe cardinales qui baptizandi • ante atque humandi mortuos curam ſuſtinerent atque haec verae cardinalium ordinis origo eſt nou ſuitue ab initio aliud cardinalium nomen niſi excellentioris epitheti notatio—non fuit item aliqu • ndiu deinde aliud eſſe cardinalem decreta conciliorum faciliter paſſim di • penſare ſed tanquam oracula diuina obſeruabant paulatim—ad hunc ſtatum deuentum eſt vbi nec mala noſtra nec remedia pati poſſumus • r victoria relect 4 § si quis pag 182 sozimus papa anno 407 dicit contra ſtatuta patrum aliquid condere aut mutare nec huiuſmodi sedis poteſt authoritas—leo papa anno 440 conc 8 de canonibus nicaenis loquens neceſſe eſt quarta dominica poſt feſtum pentecoſt eodem anno 63 petrus quidam marcutius theologus extitit qui feſtiuam aduerſus cu • iae romanae abuſus concionem habuit aiebat enim abuſus eccleſia rom facilè tolli poſſe ſi duae voculae è medio tollerentur bullis pontificijs expungerentur putà non obſtantibus ſed romanum pont hac parte ad noſtras infirmitates tam proxim▪ accedere vt paſſim quotidiè antiquos canones infringat adiectione clauſula • um derogatoriarum quas non obſtantias vocitant teſte gentillet exam conc trid lib 4 seſſ 22 num 29 § quarta non obſtante whereby althought vſed alterum ſpeaketh order rhodes erat vitium sodomiticum quaeſtio erat quomodo propt quorundam peccata totus ordo damnaretur ideò papa clemens bulla ſua condemnatoria ordinis adiecit hanc clauſulam quanquam de doctiſſimis vin • —omnium malorum ſeminarium eſſe ſummum viz pontificem concilio vniuerſali obedire nolle orthunius gratius epiſt ad lect fine faſcic rerum expetend § adde huc ſeminary euill 13 fiftly hath bene late yeares ſtood vpon mannaging peculiar caſes conſcience conſiſtorie pope notwithſtanding hoc enim loco cyprianus peculiares epiſcopos inuicem comparat qui parem poteſtatem habebant circa ſua ouilia nec enim tunc erant caſus peculiares conſcientiae ipſi pontifici reſeruati proinde quiſque poterat quae alij ſua dioeceſi ob eam cauſam partem ſui epiſcopatus ſolidum tenebat salmeron ieſ 1 pet 5 diſp 8 § et dicendo day cyprian liued anno 240 peculiar caſes conſcience reſerued vnto iudgement pope rome ieſuite salmeron confeſſeth proueth teſtimony cyprian haue heard pope claime appeales temporall ſtate emperor king sect 4 14 hitherto haue ſpoken pope ſpirituall ſword temporall ſword alſo challengeth brought vnto teſt muſt tried iudgement aduerſaries mettall made time hammered framed 15 haue ſeene throughout treatiſe romiſh claime challenge ouer temporall power ſuperioritie place ſo alſo ſoueraigntie dominion temporall caſes leaſt indirectly albeit ignorant might proued many example beſt antiquitie owne biſhop hath ſummarily confeſſed scripture written rom 13 1 let euery ſoule ſubiect higher power c viz omnis anima chryſoſtomus enarr etiam ſi ſiue apoſtolus ſis ſiue euangeliſta ſiue propheta ſiue sacerdos ſiue monachus quē illie ſequuntur theodoretus theophylactus oecumenius qui non graeci • gregorius 1 idem magnus ingenuè agnoſcebat imperatori à deo cō ceſſum non militibus ſolùm ſed sacerdotibus quoque dominati lib 2 epiſt 64 vtroque tanto poſſerior betnardus ad henricum senonenſem • chiepiſcopū epiſt 42 ſ • c colligit si omnis anima veſtra c eſpen • aeus epiſc epiſt ad titim cap 3 pag 513 chryſoſtome theodoret theoplylact greeke doctor latine church gregory bernard hence teach euery apoſtle prophet prieſt commanded acknowledge ſubiection vnto emperours 16 manifold haue bene papall preuarications tranſgreſſions claime 1 pope doth impeach emperours authority calling general councell proprium eſt man pontificis bellar lib 1 de conc see f aboue lib 2 cap 20 appropriating vnto himſelfe although muſt confeſſed octo prima concilia vniuerſalia per imperatores congregata leguntur romanus pontifex ad inſtar al • orum pat • iarcharum diuales ſacras iuſſiones pro veniendo aut inittendo ad concilium recepiſſe card cuſanus concord cathol lib 2 cap 25 firſt generall councels called chriſtian emperours command 17 secondly verumtamen quacunque ratione ad pantificatum pateret ingreſſus nemo apoſtolicae cymbae gubernacula capeſcebat ni prius autho • itas imperatoris interceſſi • let vt cap hadrianus synodo 63 diſt mo enim apud veteres inualuerat longo annorum decu • ſu obſeruatus vt clerus populuſue rom pontificem eligeret▪ quo deſignato imperatoris manu erat electionem iſtam raram • ritamvè habere cap agatho diſt 63 vt collubitum fuit aut illum admittere comprobareue aut illo reiecto atque exploſo alterum ſurrogare perdurauitue mo vſque ad hadrianum anno ſalutis • 15 qui tanti animi • uit vt initio pontificatus ſui ad ſenatum populumue rom retulerit ne creando pontifice imperatoris poteſtas expectaretur vtque libera eſſent cleri populique rom ſuffragia sed huic edicto minimè fuit obtemperatum permanſitue vetus illa conſuetudo pontificis ab imperatore conſirmandi verba platinae ſunt vita greg 9 anno 1227 quando gregor 9 gratiam cum henrico imperatore redijt qui cum pont rom confirmauit vt tunc temporis mo erat hieron balbus epiſc de coronat pag 29 30 former time ſaith biſhop balbus election pope confirmed christian emperours vntill yeare 815 time pope adrian interrupted cuſtome albeit afterward recouer former ſtrength appeareth election pope gregory ninth anno 1227 election confirmed fauour henry emperour vnde tam noua rerum facies eruperit tantaue labentis imperij facta ſit immutatio queſtion section ſheweth vnde euenerit vt mutato vetere inſtituto imperator confirmetur à pontifice balbus ibid pag 30 ſaith new face faſhion thing whileſt emperour hath nothing approbation pope election c • ntra • iwiſe pope doth confirme election emperour although among ciuilium legum interpretes non deſinunt cauſantur aſtu potius doloue quàm ex aequo bono tam ce • ta diuturnáque priu • legia cae • are amiſiſſe vt inquiunt bal albe ex longa imperij vacatione atque interregno nec non potentiâ atque prudentiá ſummorum pontificum atque aliorum rom eccleſiae praeſidum eſſe ademptum sed hi mea quidem ſententiâ rectum ſemita declinarunt—then pretendeth three cauſes imperatores primlegia illa à ſe abdicàſſe vel ex abuſu perdidiſſe vel ceſſante cauſa priuilegiorum priuilegium euanuiſſe balbus quo ſupra pag 30 31 aduerſaries ſome impute cauſe change vnto ind • lgences emperours policie pope others vnto abuſe priuiledge emperours coniectures yet liberally confeſſe anſwereth queſtion herein immutation change 18 thirdly right tribute accordingly grant hoc confecto demendus eſt ſcrupulus ex animo quorundam q • anxiè percunctantur cùm primaeuo ritu chriſtian á que inſtitutione omnes • erè vectigales eſſent eccleſiae penderent que annuum imperatori tributum vt eccleſ rom c tributum c magnum 9 q 1 qua ratione factae ſint immune quis ea talus iugo eximere potuerit balbus • id pag 31 docere videtur illi ipſi decreti huius authores vnquam docuerunt quorum exemplo alij ad docendum aliaue munera ſua facienda excitarentur certè ex noſtratibus epiſcopis qui tridenti ac bononiae par aliquota fuerūt nemo per ſe quod quidem audiuerim docet ludimuſ ne adeò ſeria potius hâc decretorum ſpecie reformationem poſcentibus illudimus quid emēdationis ſperari poteſt á nobis noſtra tam recens edita non obſeruantibus noui epiſcopos etiam graecé peritos qui ſe vt ad iſtam docendi ſeruitutem demittant ad iſtas ſordes deſcendant generoſi ſcil excelſi viri teneri praefractè negant quòd cum epiſcopatus aſſe cuti ſunt mo non eſſet quaſi contra perpetuā dei legem vlla hominum praeualuit deſuetudo magi quám conſuetudo quos cum omnis omnium temporum natura scriptura eccleſia concilia commanding euery married prieſt put awav wife clergie decretum etiam tale fuit presbyteri vxores non habeant habentes ver • aut dimitrant aut deponantur nec quiſquam omnino ad ſacerdotium admittatur qui non perpetuam continentiam vitamue coelibem profiteatur • ambertus seaffuneburg anno 1079 aduerſus hoc decretum • remuit tota factio clericorum hommem plan • haereticum viz greg papam veſam dogmatis eſſe clamitans qui oblitus ſermonis domini qui poteſt eapere captati apoſtoh qui ſe non continet nubat melius eſt enim nubere quàm vri violentâ coactione homines viuere cogeret ritu angelorum dum conſaltum curſum naturae negaret fornicationi libidini fraena relaxaret idem anno 1074 italy made reſistance calling command hereticall eodem anno nempe anno 110▪ anſelmus archiepiſcopus concilium tenuit apud londinum quo prohibuit vxores sacerdotibus anglorum ante non prohibitas quod quibuſdam mundiſſimum viſum eſt quibudam periculoſum nè dum munditias maiores viribus appeterent immunditias
