contrariae de ca ſunt ſententiae nam alexander hale bonauentura docent sacramentum hoc ſpeaking confirmation neque à chriſto neque ab apoſtolis inſtitutum ſed ab eccleſia cōc meldenſi contrà quidam doctores aſſerunt hoc sacramentum inſtitutū miniſtratum ab apoſtolis teſte noſtro gomaro spec eccleſ pag 146 ſaid gabriel bonauenture ſame hugo lombard bonauēture alenſis altiſiodorus haue see aboue lib 2 cap 26 sect 5 affirmed extreme vnctiō ibidem primitiue church iudgemēt caſſander ſo extreme matrimony alſo held see aboue ibid durand proper sacrament ſo accounted imò haud ſcio hoc sacramentum ſep • mum à veteribus fuerit cognitum primùm quod dionyſius enumer an nominatim ſingula ſingulorum vires ritus ac caeremonias explicans de coniugio nullam facit mentionem nam quod cauſantur quidam comprehendi ſub sacramento ordinis id tale eſt vt efficiat ne nihil reſpondiſſe videaris cùm omninò nolueris obtumeſcere eraſmus annot 1 cor 7 pag 37 • eraſmus ſuſpecteth opinion antiquitie like iudgement et de quoque ſeptem sacramentis certum eſt ne ipſos quidem scholaſticos exiſtimâſſe omnia ea • què propriè sacramenta vocari nam de confirmatione quidam ſcripſerunt gratiam confirmationis non eſſe vniuocè gratiam cum illa vt quae ideò tantùm inſtituta ſit vt habitum fidei fortiorem reddat non autem vt habentem digniorem reddat vitâ aeterná de matrimonio verò non modò p lombardus negauit eo gratiam conferri ſed longè poſt cum durandus diſerte inquit non eſſe matrimonium vniuocè sacramentum ſicut alia sacramenta nouae legis nam nec conferre gratiam non haben • non eſſe itaque sacramentum propriè ſtrictè dictum caſſander lib conſult art 13 fine schoolemen concerning matrimonie confirmation therfore notwithſtanding colour antiquitie aduerſaries ſhall caſt vpon naked name sacrament giuen father vnto ſcore ſuch like figuratiue reſemblances theſe confeſſions telling v inſtituted chriſt onely hath bene acknowledged haue power ordaine sacrament warrant iuſt exception againſt pretence antiquitie ſaying chriſt beginning ſo 2 may ſay much manner abſolution videatur fortaſſe cuipiam ante de abſolutione agendū fore quem admodum nunc temporis vſus eccleſiaſticus habet verùm ipſum rerum ductum atque ordinem naturalē tum propter ſui perſpicuitatem • um lucem quam rebus alioqui obſcurioribus •• undit libentèr inſequimur adde quod apud veteres abſolutio niſi ſatisfactione purgatis ferè non impartiebatur 〈◊〉 pano •• lib 4 cap 70 pag 387 see 〈…〉 aboue lib 2 cap 15 sect 4 wherof acknowledge contrary vnto ancient common cuſtome giue abſolution penitent haue made ſatisfaction courſe prepoſterous truly eſteeme oyle vſed confirmation neceſſary eſſentiall part sacrament knowing vnctio autem abſque dubio eſt neceſſaria neceſſitate sacramenti licet apoſtoli ex diuina diſpenſatione ſola manuum impoſitione confirmabant huius sacramenti forma eſt iſta conſigno te ſigno crucis confirmo te chriſmate ſalutis nomine patris filij spiritus ſancti amen tolet cardin inſtruct sacerd lib 2 ca • 24 pag 386 conceit diſpenſation priuate fancie vſed apoſtles neither may thought ſparing inuenting sacramentall rite propriè ordines ab epiſcopo ordinati qui ad certum miniſterium ſacrificio diuino miniſtrandum referuntur—ſeptem numerantur sacerdos presbyter subdiaconus bellar lib 1 de cler cap 11 ordained ſacred order subdeaconſhip de subdiaconis confeſſions aduerſaries haue may appeare borne witneſſe vnto fiue innouations foure ſuppoſed sacrament may ſuſpected haue innouated doctrine chriſt teſtator haue made bold thus adde vnto ſeales vnproper sacrament proceed vnto moſt proper one euchariſt ſhewing example chap xxii confeſſed romiſh innouations doctrine tranſubſtantiation witholding cup people breaking bread reſtraining men taking hand sect 1 svperſtition hagarine naturally fruitfull truly eſpouſed religious profeſſion may diſcerned point worſhip eſpecially doth diſcouer ſelfe sacrament euchariſt firſt point hath bene mentioned new romiſh tranſubſtantiation founded opinion vpon thoſe word chriſt bodie scotus lib 4 sent diſt 11 q 3 apertè docet neque ex scripturae neque ex patrum ſententijs no adigi vt tranſubſtantiationem ſtatuamus—immò ingenuè scotus hanc fidem— ſence ſaith scotus cannot brought beleeue either plaine place scripture ſentence ancient father need yet scripture ſo little fauourable vnto expoſition ex ſolo rom eccleſiae decreto cui hac reſtare oporteat eſſe introductam— scotus caietanus 3 thom q 75 art 14 ſatetur praeſentiam illam sacramento quam tenet eccleſia romana ex ipſis verbis chriſti hoc eſt corpus meum non poſſe demonſtrari niſi etiam acceſſerit rom eccleſiae interpretatio ſiquidem optimo iure alium ſenſum admittere poſſint non ſecus ac haec verba apoſtoli petra erat chriſtus caietane durandus quoque fatetur non poſſe obiectionibus quae ſiunt contra illam ſatisfieri niſi ad eccleſiae rom determinationem confugiatur— durand aſtipulatur biel lect 41 miſſae iſtum difficilem intellectum verborum chriſti de tranſubſt tenendum eſſe dicit propter ſolam eccleſiae determinationem non obſtante quòd scripturae poſſunt exponi ſecundum intellectum faciliorem teſte hoſpimano lib 4 de sacrament cap 9 pag 410 ille modus qui ponit ſubſtantiam panis remanere nec repugnat rationi nec authoritati bibliae ait petrus aliacenſis 4 sent q 6 hoſpin ibid pag 411 biel profeſſe except bene hanc doctrinam de cōuerſione hâc ſeu de tranſubſtantiatione non admodum antiquum eſſe dixerunt inter quos ſunt scotus 10 q 1 § quantum ergo ad iſtud argumentum et diſt 11 q 3 et gabriel lect 41 3 innumerable ancient writer greeke latine practized adminiſtration euchariſt bread wine vnto people among inducement hereunto alledge tùm quia sacramēto ſanguinis peculiarem quandam virtutem gratiam hoc vini ſymbolo ſignificatam eſſe credebant tùm obrationes myſticas huius inſtituti quae à veteribus variè adducuntur viz ad repraeſentādum memoriam paſſionis chriſti oblatione corporis eſtuſione little councell conſtance ieſuits see ibid coſterus coepit autem ea conſuetudo eccleſia latina eſſe generalis non multò ante tempora concilij conſtantienſis quo tandem p • lege ab omnibus eam conſuetudinem eſſe habendam decretum eſt quod rurſus eſt conſtitutum conc baſilienſi tridentino greg de valent de legit vſu sacr euch cap 10 § coepit autem valentia author vt vtraque ſpecie communio non prorſus abolita ſit—vſque ad annum amplius 1300 donec haec conſuetudo altera ſpecie communicandi populi totam eccleſiam latinam penè inuaſit—quae conſuetudo cum eam nonnulli vt netarram condemnarent • conc conſtantienſi baſilienſi probata ſancita fuit—his qua ſ • prà diximus ration incitati catholic ſummodeſiderio potiundi dominici calicis incenduntur omnibuſue modis contendunt vt hoc ſalutare sacramentam ſanguinis chriſti vni cum sacramento corporis iuxta veterem multis ſeculis perpetuatam vniuerſalis eccleſiae conſuetudinem redu • atur caſſander conſult art 22 pag 168 caſſander haue affirmed thus haue continuance cuſtome pleade ſpace 1000 yeares require notable innouation 4 notwithſtanding may furthermore diſcerne little grace primitiue antiquitie find among aduerſaries onely require deliuer meaning ſhall cited anſwer firſt biſhops councell conſtance oppoſing latter cuſtome vnto former licet primitiua eccleſia huiuſmodi sacramentum reciperetur á fidelibus ſub vtiaque ſpecie poſteà à conficientibus ſub vtraque á lacis tantummodo ſub ſpecie panis ſuſcipiatur—c opp • ſing contrarie cuſtome vnde huiuſmodi conſuetudo ab eccleſia ſanctis patribus rationabiliter introducta diutiſſime ob • etuata ſit habenda pro lege quam non licet reprobare aut ſine eccleſiae authoritate pro libito mutare—sub poena exommunicationis vt effectualiter puniant eos qui communicando populum ſub vtraque ſpecie panis vini exho • tati fuerint ſic faciendum eſſe docuerint conc conſtant seſſ 13 although ſay kind receiued primitiue church yet afterwards cuſtome onely one kind came kept law vpon paine excommunication ſhall teach practiſe contrarie father councell trent etſi chriſtus dominus vltima coena venerabile hoc sacramentum panis vini ſpeciebus inſtituit apoſtolis tradidit non tamen illa inſtitutio traditio eò tendunt vt omnes chriſti fideles ſtatuto domini ad vtramque ſpeciem accipiendam aſtringantur conc trid seſſ 21 cap 1 pag 122 although ſay chriſt deliuered kind vnto diſciples yet giue commandement faithfull ſhould likewiſe partaker si quis dixe • ſanctam eccleſiam catholicam non iuſtis cauſis rationibus adductam fuiſſe vt laicos atque etiam clericos non proficientes ſub panis tantummodo ſpecie communicaret aut eo errâſſe anathema ſit ibid seſſ 21 cap 2 ſhall ſay catholike meaning romane church hath altered cuſtome vpon iuſt cauſes let anathema 5 shall ſo bold aduerſaries make knowne iust cauſes one pretend chriſtus inſtitui quidē ſub duplici ſpecie ſed non iuſſit da • omnibus ſub duplici eccleſia vetus miniſtrabat ſub duplici ſpecie quando chriſtiani erant pauci praetetea non omnes accipiebant vtramque ſpeciem—ereſcente autem multitudine magi ac magi apparuit incommodum ac paulatim deſijt vſus ſub vtraque bellar lib 4 de euch cap 24 § neque becauſe ancient church chriſtians many number profeſſors increaſe ſo experience inconuemences ancient cuſtome little little decreaſe ſecond mouit quidem vehementer irreuerentia profanationes tanti sacramenti quae vix euitari poſſent tanta multitudine c bellar ibid cap 28 fine primitiua eccleſia ſub duplici ſpecie dabatur modò ſub vnica propter periculum effuſionis ſanguinis lyranu • 1 cor 11 becauſe reuerence leſt ſpilling ſomething sacrament might profaned third tertium incom modum eſt quòd multi abho • rēt à vino bellar quo ſuprà cap 24 § tertiū becauſe many deteſt wine fourth quartum eſt penuria vini ſiquidem multis reg • onibus vinū non creſcit ibid § quartum becauſe many place want wine fift mouit vniformitas concordia populi chriſti • ni—nam q • vinum non ferunt vt abſtemij aut alij q • comparare vinum non poſſunt cogerentur nunquam aut ratiſſimè communicare bellar ibid cap 28 § tertio becauſe begetteth vniformitie church perſons abſtemious thoſe want wine ſixt eſſet periculum falſae credulitatis inductione—primò quod tanta eſſet dignitas laicorum circa ſumptionem corporis chriſti ſicut sacerd • tum gerſon contra haereſ com ſub vtraqueſp tom 1 num 17 apud hoſpinian becauſe otherwiſe laity partaking kind might ſeeme equalled dignity clergy ſeuenth quia videret eam ab haereticis ex errore oppugnari—qui negabant concomitantiam bellar quo ſupra § secundò becauſe opinion concomitancie maintained 8 theſe two laſt ſerue rather maintaining cuſtom altered ratio ſumi poteſt ex conſenſu teſtimonio eccleſiae poſteriotis nam conſtat ab annis plus gentium ibid cap 28 § iam becauſe cōtinuance cuſtome one kind diuerſe church ſpace 800 yeares 9 deinde ſi latam legem quam plurimis retrò annis conſuetudo iucundiſſimam effecerat nulla euidenti neceſſitate conuellatis patres ſuſpica • multis mentem veniet aut vos illam temere nullo conſilio tuliſſe olim ſuſcepiſſeue aut ſuſceptam cum ratione ſeruatam diutiſſ •• è chriſtiana republ nullâ vel place many thouſand mile diſtāce ſhould differ theſe latter age natural taſt vſe wine ſixt though chriſtian cōmunion reſpect perſons god eſteeme clergy worthy herein thā laity anciēt father admit eſt autem vbi nihil differt sacerdos à ſubdito vt quando fruendum eſt horrendis myſterijs ſimiliter enim omnes vt illa percipiamus digni habemur non ſicut veteri lege partem quidem sacerdos comedebat partem autem populus non licebat populo participem eſſe eorum quorum particeps erat sacerdos ſed nunc non ſic verùm omnibus vnum corpu • proponitur poculum vnum chryſoſtom homil 18 2 cor 8 tom 4 manichee heretically beleeue euill ſpirit wine therefore abſtaine receiuing cup pope leo anno 450 noted practiſe sanguinem redemptionis noſtrae omninò haurire declinant • eo ſerm quadrag 4 ſpeaking againſt hereſie mani • hees ſacrilegious pope gelaſius condemning ſuch communicant ſaid comperimus quo • • umpto tantùm corporis ſacri portione à calice ſacrati cruoris abſtineant qui proculdubio quoniam neſcio qua ſuperſtitione docentur aſtringi aut integra sacramenta ac • ipiant aut ab integris arceantur quia diuiſio vnius eiuſdem myſterij ſine grandi ſacrilegio non poteſt pertienire gelaſius de conſecrat 2 c comperinius wherein condemned onely prieſts alſo • th • r communicant may colle • ted bellarm lib 4 de euch cap 26 either let take whole perfect sacramēts let thē receiue part without great ſacriledge cannot deuided 9 yea schoolemen ſpare ſay primitiua eccleſia omnes qui celebrationi miſſarum intererant ſingulis diebus communicare ſolebant eò quod apoſtoli omnes de cali • e biberunt domino dicente bibite ex hoc omnes durandus ration lib 4 cap 53 pag 381 primitiue church preſent communion participate cup becauſe firſt inſtitution apoſtles ſo commandement chriſt ſaying drinke vſe practiſed aſſemblies vnder apoſtles omnes ſine diſtinctione act 10 verita • e comperi quia non eſt acceptor perſonarum deus brel lect 52 apud hoſpinian without distinction becauſe reſpect perſons god qui ſolam hoſtiam recipit non plenum ſacramentalitèr recipit sacramentum—etſi enim hoſtia conſecrata chriſti ſanguis fit non tamen eſt ibi ſacramental ter eò quod panis corpus non ſanguinem vinum ſanguinem ſignificat non corpus durandus lib 4 cap 55 teſte hoſpinian hiſt sacrament lib 4 pag 374 licet inquit illa ſumptio quae eſt accipiendo ſub vna ſpecie ſufficiat illa tamen quae ſub duabus eſt maioris meriti tum ratione augmentationis tum ratione fidei dilatatioris octualis tum ratione ſumptionis completiotis alex alenſ q 53 teſte hoſpin ibid pag 457 § scholaſtici etiam albertus magnus 4 sent diſt 8 art 13 ait duplicem eſſe hoc sacramento perfectionem chriſti ipſius sacramenti ſecundùm quod veniat vſum fidelium priore modo dicit verum eſſe chriſtum eſſe perfectum ſub vtraque ſpecie ſecundo modo videri ſibi falſum quia non perfect • ſignetur cauſetur vſus fidelium vnitas corporis myſtici niſi duplici ſigno ideo virtute sacramenti oportere vtrumque habere ex hoſpin ibid receiuing one kind onely wanteth perfection ſacramentall receiuing wherein chriſts bloud ſacramentally taken leſſe worthineſſe regard faith manner receiuing ſeeming ſo requiſite vnto bohemian teſtatur alexander de hale quoſdam religioſos peti • ſſe inſtitiſſe vt ſub vtraque ſpecie ſumeretur sacramentum 4 sent q 53 teſte hoſpin quo ſuprà pag 374 religious men yeare 1230 inſtantly deſiere councell conſtance alexander halenſis obijt anno 1245 poſſeuinus ieſ apparat anno 1414 bohemian ſpared beſt bloud defence sacrament chriſt bloud councell trent yeare 1562 countenanced dum maior eruditorum epiſcoporum eaque potior par eam ſententiam conans pe • ibus iret vt laicis calicem concedendum eſſe iudicaret alij magna contentione reſiſterent ne quid incommodi tantus diſſertationum ardor coeptis de morum opinionum reformatione rebus afferret caſſander epiſi praeſixa tract de commun ſub vtraque ſpecie apud hoſpinianum greater part biſhops councell greatly neque verò mirum eſt ſi rudis imperita multitudo cum erro • em induci potuit vt ſine magno conſcientiae ſcrupulo à calice ab •• inere ſe non oſſe perſuaſum habeat cum etiam peritiſſ • mo maximè pios ac catholicos viros eam ſententiam multis rationibus tue • videamus vt ſub vtraque qu • cum alterutra tantùm ſpecie cōmunicantes • orem conſequi gratiam arbitrantur veſtr à iſti miſericordiâ digni ſunt patres ſanctiſſimi ex inconueniences patronizing confeſſed innouation change 11 haue yet reſerued laſt place one memorable anſwer cardinall cuſanus thereby ſhew deſperateneſſe cauſe vrged commandement chriſt defence ancient neceſſarie vſe kind doth thus euade dicesfortaſſis eccleſia hodierna non ita ambulat ritu cō munionis ſicut ante iſta tempora quando ſanctiſſimi viri vtriuſque ſpeciei sacramentū neceſſarium eſſe vi p • aecepti chriſti verbo opere aſtruebant potuit ne • nc eccleſia errare certè non quodſi non quomodo id hodiè verum non eſt quod tunc omnium opinione affirmabatur cum non ſit alia eccleſia iſta quim illa cert • hoc te non moueat quòd diuerſis temporibus alius ali • ritus sacrific • orum etiam sacramentorum ſtante veritate inuenitur scipturaſue eſſe ad tem pu adaptatas variè intellectas ita vt vno tempore ſecun dum currentem vniuerſalem ritum exponerentur mutato ritu iterum ſententia mutaretur card cuſanus epiſt 2 de vſu commun ad bohemos pag 833 scripture ſaith according vnto diuerſe occaſions time admit diuerſe conſtructions though later time could countermaund primitiue noueltie ſelfe could ſpeake would deſire better patronage kind innouations wherunto ſufficient time oppoſe iudgement owne lorichius zeale commandement chriſt ſaying drinke doth call ge • • dus lorichius ſuae factionis acerrimus tranſubſtant primatus papae miſſae propugnator libro de miſſa publica proroganda ſit ſcribit sunt pſeudocatholici qui reformationem eccleſiae quoquo modo remorari non verentur hi ne laicis altera ſpecies reſtituatur nullis pa • cunt blaſphemijs dicunt enim chriſtum ſolis apoſtolis dixiſſe bibite ex eo omnes atqui verba canonis habent accipite manducate ex hoc omnes hîc dicant • • nùm hoc dictum fit ad ſolos apoſtolos • rgo laicis à ſpecie panis eſt abſtinendum quod dicere eſt haereſis blaſphemia peſtilens execrabilis conſequitur ergo vtrumque verbum dictum eſſe ad omnem eccleſiam haec noſter hoſpinian lib 5 pag 459 pſeudocatholicks falſe catholicks falſe gloſſe hinder reformation church herein 12 againe church vſed primitiuely decr • ta zephy • ini papae ex lib pontificali damaſi papae anno domini 203 et fecit conſtitutum de eccleſia vt patina vitre ex auro omninò ex argento aut ſaltem ſtanneum fie • et binius tom 1 decret zeph papae ex baroni • zachary changed golden ſiluer tin one ſo likewiſe et puto chriſtum non tradidiſſe proprijs manibus os 24 art 2 chriſt ſaith inſtitute communion ſo wont practized another inprimis haec precatio ſolennis potiſſimum miſſae qua eſt conuentus populi collecta aliqua panem vinum oſferentium conuenit quem antiquiſſ eccleſiae fuiſſe morem nouſſimum eſt caſſander conſult art 24 de iteratione pag 223 ioynt communion people ſaith notoriouſly knowne haue bene moſt ancient third liued 500 yeares ago vnde oddo cameracenſis ſcribit miſſas ſolitarias antiquitus vſu eccleſiae non fuiſſe—et alius quidam eccleſiaſticarum rerum periuſſimus ſcriptor antè annos 500 ita ſcriptum reliquit sciendum iuxta antiquos patres quod ſoli communicantes diuinis myſterijs intereſſe conſueue • unt vnde ante oblationem iubebantur exire catechumeni▪ alij qui nondum ſe praeparauerunt ad communicandum—nec propriè communio dici poteſt niſi plures • eodem ſacrificio participent teſte caſſandro conſu • art 24 pag 216 217 onely ſaith preſent maſſe communicate otherwiſe called communion fourth • hunc • uiſſe antiquum eccleſiae romanae morem doctiſſin • quique agnoſcunt—itaque hac noſtra aetate reuerendus pater vit doct •• iohannes hoffmeiſterus verbis ſuam ſententiam declarauit re inquit clamat tam graeca quàm latina • ccleſia non ſolum sacerdorem ſacrificantem ſed reliquos presbyteros diaconos nec non reliquam plebem aut ſaltem pl • bi aliquam partem communicáſſe quod quomodo ceſſauerit mirandum eſt vt bonus ille vſus eccleſiam reuocetur laborandum teſte eod • verbis ſeqq thing ſelfe ſpeaketh onely prieſts deacon common people vſed anciently communicate together greeke latine church ceaſſed ſaith maruelled ſhould maruell hereat cochlaeus doth tell v cochlaeus de sacrificio miſſae quod inquit olim tam frequentes non fuerint miſae inde accidiſſe arbitror quod olim omnes tum sacerdotes tum laici quicunque intererant ſacrificio miſſae peracta oblatione cum ſacrificante communicabant ſicut ex apoſt ex libris atque epiſt antiquiſſimorum eccleſiae doctorum perſpicuè cognoſcitur—tum adiungit nunc verò poſtquam communionis ordo à nobis obſeruari deſijt idque propter negligentiam atque ſocordiam tam plebis quàm sacerdotum spiritus ſanctus miſſas priuatas celebrando pium remedium huic defectui haue doubted iudge proteſtant cuſtome gene • aliter eſt dicendum quod illa eſt legitima miſſa qua ſunt sacerdos reſpondens • rens atque communicans ſicut ipſa precum compoſitio euidenti ratione rome mind errour herein dubium non eſt quin vnà cum ipſo sacerdote aliqui adfue •• nt qui haec ſacrificia laudis offerebant sacramentum participa •• ant id enim canonis verba manifeſtè ſignificant vt cùm dicitur quotquot ex hac altaris participatione ſacroſanctum corpus ſanguinem filij tui ſumpſerimus item proſint nobis domine sacramenta quae ſumpſimus certè ex tota canoms compoſitione manifeſtè apparet totam illam myſticam qua canon adhibebatur actionem vel publicam vel certè inter plures ſemper celebratam fuiſſe quod ſi hodiè quoque impetrari impetrari queat facilè verus eius intellectus reſtitui poſſit—caſſander conſult art 24 § de iteratione pag 223 ex canone quodam concilij naneten ſis saccerdos ſolus miſſam celebrate vetatur abſu • dum enim eſt vt dicat dominus vobiſcum sur • um corda gratias agamus deo domino noſtro cum nullus ſit qui reſpondeat—aut oremus cum nullus ſit qui ſecum • et itaque concludit ridiculoſam ſuperſtitionem illam maximè à monaſterijs monachorum exterminandam eſſe—et huic concil nanetenſis decreto ſimile reperitur conc papienſi cap 132 vt nullus presbyter ſolus miſſam celebrate praeſumat caſſander ibid § de ſolitarijs miſſis pag 215 word canon manifeſt ſaith learned conſulter ſaid prieſt quotquot c many v haue bene partaker c againe bleſſe lord theſe sacrament vnto v haue receiued afterwards alledgeth canon councell forbidding prieſt ſhould ſay maſſe alone becauſe abſurdity prieſt ſay thus lord let v giue thankes vnto thee ô lord none make anſwer ſo cur autem canon noſter alijs ſuperſtitionem alijs contemptum adductus ſit cauſa potiſſimum eſt mutatio priſci ritus ad quem nonnullis locis canonis verba alludunt quapropter vt ab vtroque hoc eſt ſuperſtitione contēp • u vindicetur opus eſt vt quaedā ad priſcū morē ex ipſius canonis praeſeripto • euocentur vel certè ad priſcum morem referendum eſſe nonnulla verba canonis intelligantur caſſander conſult art 24 pag 222 alteration ancient order hath cauſed ſome contemue romiſh canon maſſe 5 againe importunate challenge romiſh apologiſts becometh ridiculous whileſt exact change matter moment demonſtration certaine time author reſiſters ſuch innouations elſe haue euen romiſh faſhion si quis dixerit ritum romanae eccleſiae qua ſubmiſſa voce—veiba conſecrationis profe • untur damnandum eſſe—anathema ſit conc trid seſſ 22 cap 9 9 reciting word conſecration ſecret vnaudible voice cuſtome late councel trent wil haue reproued vpon danger anathematization without iuſt cauſe zealous imitator antiquity rather thā ſuperſtitious innouators inuenters nouelties cardinall bellarmine howſoeuer ſeeke paraphraſe vpon point yet doth grant reſpondeo chriſti c contented grant chriſtus ita loquebatur vt ab apoſtolis audiretur bellar lib 2 de • ſſa ca 12 § reſpondeo chriſts chriſt vttered word conſecration audible voice ieſuit salmerō granteth certè ſi liturgias • raeco • um conſulas inuenies tam miſſa • acobi apoſtoli clementis rom quàm illis quae aeditae ſunt à baſilio chry • oſtomo▪ quòd vbi sacerdos protuliſſet alta voce verba conſecrationis tam poſt panis quàm poſt vini conſecrationem populus acclamabat dicendo amen idem etiam confirmatur ex leone auguſtino ambroſio alijs multis patribus salmeron ieſ com 1 cor 14 diſp 22 § igitur miſſals iames clement baſil ſhall ſuppoſe theſe haue bene author ſuch miſſals iudgement pope leo auguſtine ambroſe father word conſecration ſpoken loud voice 7 conſent antiquitie may wel warrant v neglect romiſh anathema rather ſubmit ſelues vnto equitie imperiall law iuſtini • n iubemus vt omnes epiſcopi presbyteri non tacito modo ſed clara voce quae à populo exaudiatur ſacram oblationem celebrent quò maiori deuotione depromendis domini dei laudibus audientium animi eſterantur et paulò poſt—scituris religioſiſſimis sacerdotibus quòd ſi quid horum neglexerint horrendo iudicio magni • ſeruatoris noſtri ieſu chriſti de rationem reddent neque no haec cognoſcentes conquieſcemus relinquemuſ que lib 3 hiſt sacram pag 287 ex sigeberto anno 870 adding pontifex lothariū imperatorē lodouici ſilium inuitat ad conteſtandam innocentiam ſuam pope nicholas vrged emperour lotharius receiue sacrament end viz might teſtifie innocencie thereby ſo free himſelfe imputation adulterie ordained monaſteries queſtion theft saepè contingit vt monaſterijs monachor • furta perpetrentu • idcirco ſtatuimus vt cum fratres de • alibus expurgare ſe dicunt miſſa ab abbate celebretur— ſic explet • miſſà omnes cōmunicentur haec • ba corpus domini ſit tibi hodiè probationē decret nicolai apud grat cauſ 2 q 5 c •• pè contingit euery mouth ſhould receiue sacrament purgation forme vnto thee thy triall afterwards dicendum eſt quòd decreta illa ſunt abrogata per contraria decreta rom pontificum aquinas part 3 q 80 art 6 ad 3 arg thoſe decree ſaith aquinas abrogated pope 9 romiſh apologiſts may obſeruea pope innouating matter diuine nature notoriouſly replie notorious innouation found notable reſiſtance ſay moſt true reſiſted contrarie decree owne pope decree ſhew vntill long argueth friuolouſneſſe obiection see aboue reſiſtance yet ſhall think profaneneſſe fully aboliſhed whileſt diſciples take sacrament remembrance chriſt bloudie paſſion death man redemption hell vſe pledge bond vnto themſelues bloudie conſpirators powder treaſon anno domini 1605 menſ nouemb 5 deſignements conſpiring attempting death prince people 10 beſides romiſh purpoſe reſeruation manner circumgestation hoaſt proceſſion hath bene confeſſed see aboue lib 2 cap 3 late inuention contrarie vnto inſtitution chriſt one schoolemen hath obſerued gabriel biel lect 36—manducatio inquit potio huius sacramenti eſt vſus hinc volens diſcipulos ſuos fructus huius sacramenti participes fieri poſtquam corpus ſuum conſecrauit non ſiſ • ebat conſecratione neque dedit diſcipulis vt ipſum honorificè conſeruarent ſed dedit ſui vſum dicens accipite manducate et quoniam per vſum manducatio tranſit conſumitur dedit eis quoties vellent conſecrandi poteſtatem dum addit hoc facite meam commemorationem vt ita nunquam fructu vſum sacramenti conſequente priuarentur propter sacramenti carentiam defectum teſte hoſpiniano lib 4 hiſt sacram pag 471 eating drinking sacrament vſe thereof therefore chriſt conſecrated furthermore giue vnto diſciples ſhould honourably reſerue ſhould eating made partaker fruite thereof proceed ſpeake confeſſed innouations romiſh maſſe reuolted ſignification name maſſe ancient forme yet retained infected ſoule impiety sect 2 11 name maſſe hath ſought antiquitie hebrew roote see aboue lib 1 cap 2 sect 3 confeſſed haue growne latine word alſo later plant ſignification betokeneth sed hîc operae erit pretium verba gregorij ex caſſandro referre praef de vtraque ſp—propter hoc certè ait dicitur miſſa quoniam mittendi ſunt foras per diaconum qui non participant sacrificio vel communione ſancta proindè cùm chriſtus ſit dei iuſtitia eccleſia autem iuſtitiae norma vtpotè ſuper chriſtum fundata verùm enimuero iuſtitia dicitur qua cuique ſua tribuuntur cum hoc inquam ita ſit quomodo miſſa erit niſi quod ſuum eſt ei permiſſum fuerit ſcil vt diaconus faciat exire quos non oportet ſacris myſterijs intereſſe item omne quod pro aliqua agitur tamdiu imperfectum probatur quamdiu de eſt illi hoc propter quod agitur ſed miſſa pro eo dicitur quòd qui diuinis sacramentis intereſſe non debent exire iubentur idem eſt exire quod mitti igitur niſi ad vocem diaconi maiorum non communicantes exire praecipiantur officium quod vſitato nomine miſſa dicitur ritè non perficitur caſſander teſte hoſpin hiſt sacram lib 2 pag 182 diſmiſsion noncommunicants ſuffering preſent celebration theſe sacrament ſo diſmiſsion exception indeed found romiſh maſſe ſaith owne author call maſſe ſo rightly performed deſerue proper name maſſe 12 neither doth beſeeme romaniſts exact v remonſtrance definite beginning change demanded expreſſe author diuerſe alteration canon maſſe beginning quis verò fuerit author huius canonis vel praecepti recitandi illum ab authoribus diligenter inqui • itur haeretici verò vt canonis authoritat • eleuent dicunt authorem cius fuiſſe scholaſticum quendam c • ius mentioné facit greg lib 7 epiſt 63—dicendum verò eſt non poſſe vnum certum authorem huius canonis deſignari suarez ieſ tom 3 q 83 art 4 diſp 83 sect 2 pag 1104 cannot ſatisfie v herein 13 much ado iacobus de vorag legenda 46 de greg adrian 1 anno dom 790 conuocauit synodum—omnium patrum haec ſententia vna fuit vt miſſale ambroſianum gregorianum ſuper altare b petri apoſtoli pone • ent fore •• cleſiae optimè clauderentur ac plurimorum epiſcoporum ſigillis diligentiſſimè munirentur ipſiue tota nocte orationi inſiſterent vt dominus per ſignum aliquod reue • aret quodnam horum ab eccleſijs magi ſerua • vellet ſicue per omnia vt ordinauerāt facientes manè ianuas eccleſiae aperuerunt vtrū que miſſale ſuper tare apertum inuenerunt vel vt alij aſſerunt miſſ • le gregorianum penitus diſſolutum huc illucue diſperſum inuenerunt ambroſianum autem ſolummodo apertum ſuper altare eodem loco quem poſuerant repererunt quo ſigno diuinitus ſunt edocti vt gregorianum officium deberet per mundum totum diſpergi ambroſianum autem tantùm ſua eccleſia obſeruati sicue ſancti patres vt diuinitus edocti fuerant ſtatuerunt ſic vſque hodie obſeruatur adrianus 1 papa circa annum 790 teſte integritie man nature indeed freeborne naturall abilitie ſelfe conſent vnto good firſt fall one man whoſe loynes mankind tooke hereditary limpe rebellious diſpoſition became bondſlaue ſinne c ibid sect 5 lit 0 diuell reſpect perfect good altogether dead creature quibus argumentis infideles ad certam eccleſiae notitiam induci poſſint primum eſt eam congregationem eccleſiae nomen mereri quae plus attingit dei cognitionem immaculatiorem cultum praeſtat quae ſuperbam elatam naturam hominis magi deprim • ad ſui ipſius perfectiorem cognitionem perducit vt hac ratione minus ſibi tribuere vel viribus ſuis nullo modo confidere homo cogatur secundum lex illa quae excellentiora opera charitatis proximo impendere iubet magi eſt digna nomine eccleſiae salmeron ieſ ep pauli genere diſp 2 § sed credis non poſſe niſi per mortem chriſti ſaluari reſp infirmus etiam tum illi dicitur age ergo dum ſupereſt te anima hac ſola morte fiduciam tuam conſtitue nulla alia fiduciam tuam habe huic morti te totum committe hac ſola te totum contege totum immi • ce te hac morte totum confige hac morte totum inuolue et ſi dominus deus voluerit te iudicate die domine mortem noſtri ieſu chriſti obijcio inter non eſt à graecis creditū quis tamen niſi haereticus haec negare audebit quia apud priſcos authores haec ſub talibus nominibus non commemorantur eccleſia enim quotidiè proſicit membris ſuis deo cam quotidiè magi illuſtrante quapropter eccleſia comparatur aurora quae eſt iſta inquit quae progreditur quaſi aurora aurora ſuo • • remiſſum habet lumen quod temporis progreſſu augetur sic eccleſia vnde non dubito quin etiam multa ſint à poſteris clarius apertius inuenienda quae nobis ſunt prorſus nunc ignota quid ergo mirum ſi ad hunc modum contigerit de indulgentijs vt apud priſcos nulla ſit de eis mentio praecipuè quòd tunc magi feruebat chriſtanorum charitas vt parū effect opus indulgentijs—adde quod non eſt tam recens indulgentiarū vſus quantum iſti hae tetici exprobrāt nam ap • romanos illic habentur ſcitu neceſa • ia surius tem 4 conc baſil seſſ 36 pag 105 〈◊〉 opinion pope sixtus fourth ſeemed hold whoſe iudgement councell trent afterwards follow albeit bernard liued anno 1140 called doctrine plaine termes see aboue booke cap 3 noueltie feaſt ſignifie integrity naturall conception iudged neither ſacred ſelfe yet conſonant vnto • ient rite church feaſt firſt receiued latine church ſaith ieſuit suarez accedit ab eccleſia feſtum conceptionis celebrari qui nios eccleſia 〈…〉 mille annos eſt orſus vt galatinus refert—in latina verò introduci coepit ante 500 ſerè annos vt ex epiſtolis 〈◊〉 conſtat—tandem verò eccleſia rom ante 200 annos celebritatem hanc generaliter amplexa cultoribus • ius • ingul •• e indulgentias impertit vnde quodammodo videtur conceptionem virginis canoniz àſſe non eſt ergo pium credere eccleſiam retanta tamque graui decipi aut falſo fundamento niti suarez tom 2 3 thom q 27 art 2 diſp 3 sect 5 pag 24 ſome 400 yeares ago two hundred yeares ſince vſu recepto firmiter conſtanterue aſſerimus profite ••• r ipſam ſanctiſſ dei genetricem mariam vnà cum corpore quo impertita eſt deo carnem coelum eſſe receptam 〈◊〉 48 num 24 feſtum aſſumptionis b mariae eſt antiquiſſimum nam eius meminit gregorius antiph ante gregorium andreas cretenſis orat de feſto bellar lib 3 de cultu sanct cap 16 rhemiſts annot act 1 14 conſtantly profeſſe bleſſed virgine bodie ſoule aſſumed heauen matter proued moſt true tradition 4 haue thought aduerſaries diſtinguiſhing ſo themſelues haue affirmed▪ tradition frō word written vnderſtood traditiō doctrine recorded leaſt writing ſome anciēts yet cōcerning aſſumption confeſſe sed iam caetera quae ad rei geſtae hiſtoriam pertinent proſequamur quae quidem cum neque ex canonicis scr • pturis neque ex patrum antiquorum teſtimonijs roborentur non omnia quae eo genere ſunt ſcripta recitabimus baron ibid num 9 cōfirmed either canonical scripture writing ancient father wherof auguſt ſerm 35 de sanctis—virgo maria quo ordine hinc ad ſuprema tranſierit nulla catholica na •• hiſtoria non ſolùm autem reſpuere apocrypha verumetium ignorare dicitur haec eccleſia ſiquidem ſunt nonnulla ſine authoris non ••• de cius aſſumptione conſcripta quae vt dixi ita cauentur vt ad confirmandam rei veritatem • inim • legi permittantur hinc ſanc pulſantur nonnulli quia nec corpus eius reperitur terra nec aſſumptio eius cum carne vt apocrypha legitur catholica reperitur hiſtoria sed dignum non eſt de corporis eius notitia ſollicitum quempiam eſſe quam non dubitat ſuper coelo • elatam cum chriſto regnare ſed nec inuenitur apud latino aliquis tractatorum de eius morte quippiam dixiſſe apertè et quid de loquor cum nec ipſe qui hanc accepit ante crucem domini ſua id eſt iohannes euangeliſta de hoc poſteris aliquid ſcriptis reunendum mandauer nullus enim hoc fideliús narrare potuit ſi illud deus manifeſtari voluiſſet reſtat ergo vt homo mendacitèr non fingat apertum quod deus voluit manere occultum vt reſert sixtus senenſ • ibl lib 2 pag 82 tit mariae tranſitus auguſtine writing point concludeth let man feine manifeſt god himſelfe would haue ſecret hierome elſe sophronius vnder name hieronymus ſiue hieronymi come sophronius serm de aſſumpt virginis libri huius mentionem faciens ita ſcribit—haec ideirco dixerim quia multi noſtrorū dubitant vtrùm aſſumpta fuerit ſimul cum corpore abierit relicto corpore quomodo autē vel quo tempore aut à quibus perſonis ſanctiſſ corpus eius indé ablatum fuerit vel vbi tranſpoſitum vtrumnè reſurrexerit neſcitur quamuis nonnulli aſtruere velint eam iam reſuſcitatam beata cum chriſto immortalitate coeleſtibus veſtiri veruntamen quod ho • um verius cenſeatur ambigimus melius tamen deo totum cui nihil impoſſibile eſt committimus quam vt aliquid temerè definire velimus authoritate noſtra sed vtrùm redierit puluerem terrae certum non habemus ex senenſi ibid know ſaith affirme hereof leaue vnto god finally ſome sed quaeres qua certitudine haec veritas tenenda ſit—albulenſis ſolùm dicit eſſe probabiliorem opinionem caietan dicit piā eſſe ſententiā ferè idem docet sotus canus verò addit eſſe petulantem temeritatem hoc negare quem ſecutus eſt corduba catharinus autem contra caieranum opuſe▪ de conceptione contendit eſſe de fide sed reuerà non eſt quia neque eſt ab eccleſia definita nec eſt teſtimonium scripturae aut ſufficiens traditio quae infall • bilem faciat fidem eſt igitur iam nunc recepta haec ſententia vt à nullo pio catholico poſſit dubium reuocari • ut ſine temeritate negari atque adeò videtur habere cum gradum certitudinis quem habet alia veritas ſuprà tractata de ſanctificatione virginis vtero matris suarez ieſ tom 2 qu 37 art 4 sect 2 § sed quaeres pag 200 romiſh doctor themſelues dare go thinke probable therefore thinketh ſalue allowing ſuch image either altero modo ad hiſtoriam aliquam oculis exhibendam quomodo ſi quis pingere vellet expulſionem adami de paradiſo pingere deberet deū forma huma na ambulantem—hoc modo poteſt deus pingi hiſtoricall elſe tettiò poteſt aliquid pingi extra hiſtorram ad expheandam naturam rei non per immediatam propriam ſimlitudinem ſed per analogiam ſiue metaphoricas mvſticaſue ſignificationes quem admodum pingimus angelos—hoc modo pingimus deum patrem cùm eum extra hiſtoriam pingimus human • • ormà bellarabid § tertiò poteſt analogicall myſticall vt verum ſit dicere non col • no culru latriae crucem aut imaginem chriſti ſed cruce aut imagine ipſum chriſtum cuius ſimilitudinem crux vel imago refert neque huius ſententiae authores inficiantur haec opinio nobis non probatur tùm propter argumenta facta contra iudaeos tumetiam quià iren tertull cyprian auguſt docent omne praeceptum excepto sabbato legem eſſe naturalem bellar lib 2 de imag cap 7 § saed haec bellarmine reiecteth contradicting iudgement irenaeus tertulliam cyprian auguſtine foure memorable witneſſes antiquitie 5 foraſmuch aduerſaries haue v thinke law iewiſh antiquitie date exprimentes aut sactorum virorum viuas effigy referentes caſſander conſult art 21 pag 149 firſt preaching goſpell day clement arnobius yeares 65 290 publike vſe image church de illorum cultu iam agamus quem non modò noſtrae religionis expertes ſed teſte hieron omnes fermè veteres ſancti patres damnabant ob metum odololatriae qua nullum execrabilius ſcelus eſſe poteſt polydor virgil lib 6 inuent cap 13 voyce index expurg hath put ſilence worſhip hierome doth witneſſe condemned almost ancient father q • antum autem veteres initio eccleſiae ab omni veneratione imaginum abhorruerunt declarat vnus origenes aduerſus celſum lib 7—impoſſibile eſſe vt qui deum nouit fiat ſupplex ſtatuis nec hoc tantùm ſtultum eſſe ſi quis preces ſimulachris offerat ſed etiam cum id aliquis ſimulat vulgi opinionibus ſe attemperans nil enim adulterum debet eſſe anima hominis verè pij erga deum no verò ideò quoque non honoramus ſimulachra quia quantum poſſumus cauemus ne quando incidamus eam credulitatem vt ijs tribuamus diuinitatis aliquid caſſander conſult art 21 pag 153 appeareth alſo origen anno 230 eſteeming fooliſh adulterous profanation euen outwardly ſeeme worſhip ſtatue kind worſhips ratio cur prouinciale conc elibertinum hiſpania imago templis eius prouinciae pingi vetuerit nempè vt idololatriam hoc remedio extingueret nam etſi patres illius synodi ſcirent ſacrarum imaginum cultum eccleſiae iam adultae vt litatem maximam conferre tamen cum animaduertillent gens illas nuper ab idolorum ſuperſtione ad chriſtum venientes adhuc ad priſtinam idololatriam inclinari diuinos honores imaginibus eccleſijs chriſtianorum depictis impendere acſi illis ineſſet aliquod diuinitatis iudicarunt praeſenti morbo non poſſe aliter mederi quàm imaginum interdictione sixtus senenſ biblioth lib 5 annot 〈◊〉 pag 420 councell eliberis forbid anno 305 feare people idolatrie epiphanius alſo anno 390 chancing ſee image epiphanius—velum quoddam ſcidit quod pendere videbat foribus cuiuſdam eccleſiae eò quod habebat imaginem chriſti aut alicuius hominis ſancti—dicitue contra authoritatem scripturarum eccleſia 〈◊〉 hominis imaginem pendere ecce ad quae tempora hunc enim paganis quoque adf • rri ſolebat vt apud arnobium non inquiunt materias—ſed eos colimus eolue veneramur quos dedicatio • er • •• cra • apud lactantium non ipſa inquiunt ſimulachra timemus ſed ſimulachrorum vſum eccleſijs n • n fuiſſe ex quae ſcripſit pſal 114 ad verſ illum simulachra gentium c caſſander ibid pag 151 auguſtine anno 400 acknowledge thē law full publike vſe although euen thoſe time paganiſme rooted chriſtianitie confirmed men heart tandem v •• ò qu • ndo exoleto propemodum paganiſmo—animis chriſtianorum ſyncero dei cultu ſatis inſtitutis confirmatis picturae templis receptae ſunt idque iam tum aetate ambroſij c idem ibid pag 155 began receiued publicke church thinke emblematicall hiſtoricall vſe yet anno 600 see aboue lib 1 cap 2 sect 25 26 iudgement church rome manifest hath bene confeſſed epiſtle gregory taught allowing hiſtoricall ſacred monument forbad worſhipping 7 apologiſts cannot blame v make period demonſtration antiquitie deſcent began aſcend pretence ancient hold doth ſufficiētly bewray innouation publike worſhip church might proue pernicious nature hath bene new prodigious birth taske book proue ill old euery ſuch baſtard onely reader deſire ſee deformitie hereof may haue recourſe vnto firſt lib 1 cap 2 sect 26 booke romiſh doctor commiſerate andd complaine viſible impietie wherein alſo many romiſh worſhippers found haue bene damnably idolatrous 8 ſupplie yet ſupplie may neceſſarie produce teſtimonies ho ſequi videtur pereſius—primùm con tendit fallò dici ſigni ac rei ſignificatae cogitationem ſeu notitiam eandem eſle cùm ſint duae quae à ſe inuicem diſtinguantur primū quippe apprehenditur hoc vel illud ſignum eſſe deinde tem intuemur quam ſignificat haec ſiunt ſimul quidem tempore ſed natura ratione vnum eorum alterum praecedit deinde quamuis lapis marmora aut metallum ſiant ſignum non tamen iccirco naturam ſuam commutant neque limitem ſuperant inſenſibil • um rerum neque dignitatem rationalis creaturae attingunt vel habent ſecum comunctam rem quam ſignificant regem quidem adoramus purpura ſua quae ſi ab imperatore ſeiungatur ne quicquam illi regis honorem exhiberemus auguſt hom 58 de verbis dom chriſti humanitatem latria ſcribit adorandam quia coniunctam habet diuinitatem quae ſi ſeiungetur quod tamen faciendum non eſt latria non adoraretur quantò ergo minus crux quae reuera ſeparata eſt à chriſto latria coli non debet— pereſius gabriel quoque brel lect 49 eorum ſententiam vt ſaniorem probat qui dicunt quòd imago neque vt conſideratur ſe ſecundum quod lignum eſt lapis aut metallum neque vt conſideratur ſecundum rationem ſigni imaginis ſit adoranda qualitercunque enim conſideretur inquit eſt re inſenſibilis creatura cui adoratio 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 minimè eſt exhibenda hinc patet quorundam hominum ſtolidus error qui adeò ad imago afficiuntur vt ipſis credant eſſe aliquod numinis gratiae vel ſanctitatis quibus potentes ſint facere miracula praeſtare ſanitates ex hoc aſſurgentes ad corum venerationem vt promiſſorum aliquid conſequantur arguitur inqui • ex codem nonnullorum indocta ſimplicitas indiſcretio quâ reuerentiùs adorant imago pulchras quàm turpes nouas quàm vetuſtas aut contra ornatas venuſtio • auro vel purpura quàm nuda credentes ea ſanctiores quo pretioſiores vt bernardus ait offerentes libentius auro tectis vbi magi cernitur diuitia • um cumulus arguitur aliorum rudis leuitas qui improuidè vota emittunt ad pereg • inandum ſe obligant nunc ad illam nunc ad aliam eccleſiam intuitu certarum imaginum credentes illas maio • illa quam ſimiles alijs fulgere à virtutibus clarere miraculis maiore fulciri poteſtate haec omnia vanam tranſeunt ſuperſtitionem quam non inciderent ſi rationem adorationis ac veri cultus attenderent aut ſi ignorant informationem humiliter acciperent hactenus g • briel biel biel hac de prudentèr etiam gerſon declarat defect eccleſ inquiens • udicate ſi • anta imaginū picturarum eccleſijs varietas expediat plures ſimplices nonnunquam ad idololatriam peruertant haec ex hoſpiniano de origine templorum pag 70 gerſon ſubtle folly defence worſhip image see little letter ſ u confuted giddineſſe ſomekinde worſhippers condemned eſpecially see letter beleeuing infuſed image kind diuine power ſanctitie ſeeing parcellguilt conceit excuſes yeeld greater honour vnto new image vnto old vnto trimme one vnto meane commending vowes vnto image making pilgrimage vnto picture ſame saint rather one place another notable character note ſuperſtition conclude let new conceitedneſſe controule wiſedome ancient primitiuely condemned feare idolatry ſinne moſt execrable chap xxviii confeſſed romiſh innouations ceremoniall matter ſome particular alſo burthenſome oppreſsing multitude romane church sect 1 firſt praiers vpon bead firſt deuiſed eſt modus orandi poſtremò inuentus per calculos vt ita dicam ligneos quos vulgus modò preculas modo paternoſtros appellat ij namero quinquaginta quinque ita ordine diſtinguuntur vt poſt denos ſinguli maiuſeuli affigantur filo ſunt enim perforati—eius rei autor fertur petrus eremita homo gallus ciuis ambiauenſis qui abhinc annis 430 hoc eſt circiter annum ſalutis 1090 ſanctitate floruit polydor virg inuent rerum lib 5 c 9 pag 344 345 petrus french eremite anno 1090 may well ſent againe deſert firſt hatched becauſe contented pray number whileſt moſt height ſtupidity know pray verie bead daie iudgement muſt ſerue memorandum recount ſo often matth 6 7 battologies vaine bablings sauiour chriſt hath condemned 2 secondly ſhall go viſit temple herein many ceremony haue bene altered ſome confeſſe alterable namely faſhion praying towards east ancient afterwards changed becauſe manichaei cū haereſin ſuam periurio diſſim • larent qui ſolem veluti numen ſuperſtitio • ▪ ad orientem conuerſi adorabant conſtituit •• eo 1 quò catholici ab haereticis diſcerni poſlent qui antea piè ſancté verſus orientem deum orabant nunc ad occiden tē conuerſi deū colerent ne quid fideli populo cum haereticis commune eſſet ſed potius hoc indicio diſcernerentur apertiſſimè binius tom 1 fol 935 vita leonis baron anno 443 nū 5 abuſe manichee ſuperſtitiouſly worſhipped sunne riſing eaſt yet afterwards reuiued againe sacerdos altari diuinis officijs debet ex inſtitutione vigilij papae verſus orientem orare durant de rit •• li • • ca 2 nū 57 pope vigilius yeare 537 3 thirdly albeit cardinall bellarmine haue v eſt autem hoc loco ob • e • uandam olim non tam raſu • quàm tonſuram vſ • fuiſſe—vt apparet ex clem alex paedagog lib 3 ca 11 pili inquit tondendi ſunt non nouaculâ ſed tonſo •• forcipibus item ex optato mileuit lib 2 contra parmen qui donatiſtas arguit quòd catholicis sace • dotibus per vim caput raſ •• int doce • e inquit vbi vobis mandatum ſit radere caput sacerdotibus cum è contrario tot ſint exempla propoſita itē ex hieron 44 • zech vbi dicit non l • cere sacerdotibus comā alere nec tamen radi ſed ita tondere vt cutis tecta maneat c bellar lib 2 de monach cap 40 § eſt autē vnus eſt anacetus papa qui raſurae memini • ſed non eſt indubitata epiſtola anacleti nec tamen reprehendimus vſū monach clericoiū quia nunquā prohibitū fuit radi id • belle 5 fiftly goodly temple ſpecious church inſtruments ornament religion vſed vnto deuotion oſtentation much leſſe iewes ſaying templum domini vnto exptobration though true religion could time conſiſt without conceit doth commonly poſſeſſe vulgar romaniſts auentinus informe time auentinus etiam de veteribus germanis ſcribens maiores inquit noſtri religioſiſſimi mortales viua dei ſimulachra templa no eſſe exiſtim • runt pro vero habuerunt mentes noſtras penetralia pectora ſacraria corda ara eſſe ſpiritus coeleſtis illa non auro picturâ aut pecuniâ rebus nimirum profanis ac quibus vera ſacra pollui ſolent ſed iuſtiti • modeſtiâ benignitate liberalitate pauperes pietateue excoluerunt certiue hac vita nequaquam ſe habitare ſed peregrinari duntaxat non ſumptuoſas aut munificas aedes nec ſibi nec ſuperis conſtruxerunt peranguſtis delub • domibus quae iniuriam coeli arcerent contentos fuiſſe compertum habeo nihil pompae datum eſt pietatem magnificè coluerunt nihil voluptati oculorum indulſere paupertatis amatores non luxus aut diuitiarum admiratores anceſtors ſaith addict themſelues vnto kind pompouſneſſe cauſe walfridus lib de offic ac ritibus cap 14 de extructione templorum agens dicit videndum eſſe vt ex iuſtè partis extruantur id que moderatè multis inculcat longè ſatius eſſe pauperibus ſubuenire quàm paries templorum ornate citat quoque exemplum gregorij quem dicit non templorum extructione exornatione vt alios papa labor • ſſe ſed doctrini eleemoſynis walfridus requireth moderation euen example gregory conſideration whereof moued cardinall petrus rome reprehending article indulgence concerning reſiſtance leo decimus anno ſalutis 1517 habuit germani • procuratores indulgentiarum—quas illi praedicarent valere non ſolùm ad ſalutem viuorū verumetiam mortuorum anima ſubleuandas quae purgatorio eſſent tum praeſtò fuit lutherus auguſtinianus monachus homo theologia apud ſuam gentem primatius qui illud improbarit procuratores eà revaldè commoti primo quoque tempore nomē lutheri romā ad magiſtratus deferunt continuò vt deorū contemptor accuſatur citatur cauſa agitur ſed quia ad diē dictam non adfuit romae praeſens vt relponderet paulò poſt declaratur haereticus polyd virgil lib 8 invent cap 4 pag 492 purged romiſh index pope leo tenth ſaith polydore ſent proctor germany preached article indulgence affirming powerfull good liuing alſo eaſe ſoules tormented purgatory luther roſe vp diſproue therefore preſently cited rome accuſed becauſe appeare day aſsigned anſwer accuſation made againſt forthwith pronoūced hereticke ſee luther reſiſting pope pope reſiſting luther matter doctrine indulgence hath bene confeſted romaniſts themſelues see aboue lib 1 cap 2 sect 20 booke cap 12 sect 1 expreſly deliuered either scripture writing ancient father vſe primitiue church hath bene termed owne author doctrine godly deceit indeed palpable noueltie caſe plaine pope reſiſtance doth proue innouation luther doctrine inuouation pope doctrine doth iuſtifie luther reſiſtance 9 waldo vvickliffe luther giue leaue thus farre digreſſe brought though author three different religion aduerſaries guiſe whenſoeuer happen vpon mention theſe name whereas ſhall willing conferre owne thuanus may otherwiſe directed ſheweth thoſe commonly called igitur p valdus corum anteſignanus patriâ relictâ belgium venit atque picardia quam hodiè vocant multos ſectatores nactus cum inde 〈◊〉 tranſijſſet per vandalicas ciuitates diu verſatus eſt ac poſtremò bohemia conſedit vbi etiam hodiè ij qui cam doct inam amplectuntur picardi ea de cauſa appellantur habuerat valdus c—albij haeſit vnde albigei—quanq •• n alijs libris cathari dicuntur quibus reſpondent qui hodi • anglia puriorem doctrinam prae ſe ferunt—ita ab 〈…〉 aut fautoribus illi cogno ninati à loco verò pauperes lugdunenſes albigei diuerſis regionibus ob diuerſas c •• la paſſageni patareni lollardi turelupini ac denique • ynici dicti ſu • thuanus inſt tom 1 anno 1550 pag 457 albic ••• ipſos perempturus iſi repentino morbo correptus mox deceſſiſlet cum hùc illùc ab eo tempore diſperſi vbique exag •• atentur tamen extitere ſemper per interuallum qui eo • um doctrinam intermo • tuam renouarent lo wicleuus anglia bohemia lo huſſus hieron pragenſis noſtra verò tate poſtquam lutheri doctrina obuio tam multorum fauore accepta eſt reliquiae illorum vbique ſpa •• ae colligi creſcente lutheri nomine vires anthoritatem ſumere coeperunt praecipuè • n regionibus alpinis prouincijs alpibus vicinis igitur cum merindoliani caprarienſes ad famam corum quae ge reperiebat valdenles qui dicuntur homines eſſe qui 〈◊〉 abhinc anuis alperum incultum ſolum vectigale à dominis acceperint ibid pag 463 caprarienſes qui 〈…〉 comitatu ſunt codem tempore ab auenionen • mittunt qui vt erat pro miti ingenio perbenigne ſupplices accipit quae vltra ca caput libro comprehe • ſa de ipſis ſpargantur ad inuidiam conſicta meras nugas eſſe ingenuè declarat id enim quaeſtiombus ſupra ea habitis ſibi certò con • tare caeterum oblat • libello videri multa ineſſe quae partim integ • ſententia melius mutari pa •• im acerbiùs pontiſicem praeſules dictum temper • traditiones vetereſue eligendo ſum mo pent ſice conſu • tudines ſac • iue ritus priſtinus vſus prorſus extincti sic vendicauerat omnia ſibi libido ſeculari potentia freta inſaniens oeſtro percita dominandi dormiebat tunc planè alto vt apparet ſopore chriſtus naui cum hiſce ſtantibus validis ventis nauis ipſa fluctibus operiretur dormiebat inquam qui iſta non videre diſſimulans ſineret ſic ſieri dum non exurgeret vindex et quod deterius videbatur •• rant qui domiuum ſic • mientem clamoribus excitarent diſcipuli ſtertentibus omnibus qualeſ • teris delectos ab hiſce monſtris presbyteros draconos cardinales fuiſſe • utandum cùm nihil tam natu • ae inſitum ſit quà • vnum quenique ſibi ſimilem generare quos omnibus ijs quibus delecti fuerint conſenſiſſe dubitare quis poterit imitatoſue recepta ab omnibus ideò clemens papa quintus innouauit illam conſtitutionem illam praecepit ab omnibuster • ari g • ſſa •• clement cap vnicum tit de reliq venerat foraſmuch thus gloſſe ſpeaketh collegit aſſurgit ad 16000 dierum indulgentias hoſpinian hiſt sacram lib 4 pag 387 indulgence pope multiply vpon honoured feaſt preſence church amount vnto ſixteene thouſand day pardon 17 need much diſpute inſtitution becauſe owne conſulter hath ſufficiently diſplaied innouation quare videtur hic circumgeſtationis vſus citra graue eccleſiae damnum imò cum ipſius lucro ſi modo id prudenter fiat omitti poſſe cum recens ſit diu ſine iſta cir cumgeſtatione ſacramento ſuus honos conſtiterit hodie conſtare poſſit deinde cum hodie plerumque non deuotioni populi ſed pompae magi oſtentationi ſerutat itaque vir ſummi iudicij albertus cranzius ſua metropoli nicolaum cuſanum legatum per germaniam laudat qui abuſum sacramenti euch • riſtiae nimis frequenti eius pet ſingulas feria circumgeſt atione ſuſtulerit conſtituit vt niſi inter octauas feſti sacramento dedicati publicum non defe • tetur addit que idem albertus memorabilem cauſam quia inquit eius ſacramenti vſus à coeleſti magiſtro inſtitutus eſt ad vſum non oſtentationem de ipſo verò feſto certum eſt illud ab vrbano non ad circumgeſtationem inſtitutum ſed ad celebriorem conuentum▪ vt homines per pietatis opera ita ſe praeparent quo huius pretioſi sacramenti eo die participes fieri atque ipſum reuerenter ſu • cipere mereantur ita enim habent verba decreti ad quod inſtitutum ſi redeatur niſ puto fore abſurdi caſſander de conſult art 22 § de circumgeſtatione pag 174 cuſtome circumgeſtation hoaſt ſaith may left wiſely laid downe greater profit vnto church becauſe new inuention alſo becauſe ſerueth rather pompous oſtentation godly deuotion ſo albertus cranzius ſaith contrarie vnto chriſt inſtitution 18 iudgement antiquitie concerning adoration cannot learne vntill take forth firſt leſſon vnderſtanding phraſes ſanguinis domini quae vnuſquiſque cùm percipit quò referantur imbutus agnoſeit vt ea non carnali ſeruiture ſed ſpirituali potius libertate veneretur aug de doct chriſt lib 3 cap 9 worſhipping baptiſme incircumſcriptae diuinitati aequare vbique corpus item prorſus impoſſibile eſſe contrarias ſubſtantiales differentia ſicut eſt viſibile inuiſibile palpabile impalpabile circumſcriptum incircumſcriptum eſſe ſimul corpo • e chriſti humana natura coexiſtere vt refert hoſpiman hiſi sacram lib 3 cap 7 pag 256 impoſsible two contrarie eſſentiall difference ſuch viſible inuiſible palpable palpable circumſcribed place circumſcribed conſiſt together humane nature chriſt ſaying ſelfe ſufficient ouerthrowall conceit tranſubſtantiation ſentence may admit adoration former ſence ſpeaketh himſelfe worſhip croſſe yet may vrgently preſſevs authority becauſe without compaſſe due antiquitie eſpecially noted romaniſts haue bene theophylacti opimonem spiritum à filio non procedere damaſcenus alij recentiores graeci approbant sixtus senenſ bibl lib 6 annot 187 ſol 505 much cùm audiuiſſet damaſcenus ac credidiſſet tra • ani animam gregorij magni precibus ex inferno liberatam fuiſſe id quidem bona fide vir ſanctus retulit commentum falſiſſimum ſuir quod putabatur eſſe hiſtoria poſſ • uinus ieſ apparat ſacr tit ioh damaſcenus little credulitie 20 howſoeuer much aduerſaries dare allow direct adoration chriſt euchariſt vpon preſumption ob si ideò sacramentum euchariſtiae adorandum ſit quia chriſtus ibi eſt igitur omnis creatura adoranda eſt quia omni creatura deus eſt reſpondeo longè aliter chriſtus eſt euchariſtia alijs rebus deus nam euchariſtia tanquam vnum tantùm ſuppoſitum eſt idque diuinum caetera omnia ad illud pertinent cum illo vnum quid faciunt licet non eodem modo • deò rectè totum illud adoratur ſimul vt ante diximus de chriſto veſtito alijs rebus deus quidem eſt ſed non eſt vnum ſuppoſitum cum illis neque dici poſſunt vnum quid deus creatura qua eſt deus bellarm lib 4 de euchariſt cap 30 § quartò perſonally onely myſtically therein see aboue lib 2 cap 2 former confutation perſonall corporall sacrament ſtand ſecure free aſſault holding ſafeſt v adore chriſt perſon sacrament yet incluſiuely ſignificatiuely repreſentatiuely contained therein liturgie teacheth ſurſum corda lifting vp thought vnto heauen proper onely reall royall place manſion vntill coming againe vnto iudgement according letter creed ſhewing ſelues hereby chryſoſtome ſpeaketh one place dawes chryſoſtome ſpeaketh vbi enim inquit cadauer illic aquilae cadauer domini corpus—aquilas ſeeing hereſies church detected reſuſted firſt birth rome ô rome ſhould ſeeme erre without open reſiſtance yet ſo little would preiudice plea againſt may ſeeme rather fortified therby becauſe long ſithence departed ſyncerity ancient faith haue ſhewed like decay rome alſo many maruellous aberration ſhould aduerſaries acknowledge rome onely poſſibilitie euen ordinarie lamentable experience ô rome apoſtaſie ſincere faith chap xxx romish apologie catholickes able proue contrarie euen teſtimonies learned proteſtants § 8 although proofe romane church ſuppoſed change religion lying aduerſaries tediouſneſſe confeſſed heretofore tract 1 sect 2 margent letter 1 alſo marke improper needleſſe mani • eſtly affirmed collected eccleſiaſticall writer euery age aduerſaries century writer euery ſeuerall century gregory liued ſomewhat within firſt 600 yeares chriſt ſo hauing hereby alreadie proued continued profeſſion romane church taught catholicke faith theſe laſt thouſand yeares fulke anſwer counterfet catholick pag 27 circa med ſpeaking boniface third biſhop rome ſecond yeare death gregory great teſte anaſtaſio • de vitio pontificū ſaith pope boniface third ill blaſphemous hereticks antichriſts affirmeth ſame con • utation purgatory pag 344 poſt med likewiſe affirmeth boniface third antichriſt vnder papiſts religion preuailed foreſaid anſwer counterfet catholick pag 36 confutation purgatory pag 194 paulò poſt med vide whitakerum lib de eccleſia pag 260 fine 261 protestant appeale▪ shewing apologiſts errour concerning gregory sect 1 surpluſſage demonſtration call great vntruth hath bene abundantly see aboue lib 1 cap 2 proued yet vaſt vntruth laid downe maine point iſſue preſent controuerſie foundation ſo ſandie prognoſticateth ruine whole ſtructure building concerning celebration ordinary ſetfasts ordinarily idem docent faciunt lutherani caluiniſtae ferè omnes bellar ibid see alſo feuardent dialog durans cont whitach obiected aduerſaries vnto anſwer may acceptable firſt propound aduertiſememt owne cardinall tolet giueth concerning ſtate god church vnder old law aduettendum eſt huius leiunij declarationem olim veteri lege frequentiſſimum fuiſſe vſum ieiunandi vt conſtat ex tota scriptura lege prophetis hiſtorijs nullū tamen tempus ieiunij indictum fuit à lege nec tale p • aeceptum ea fuit ſed ieiunia aut ſponte poemtentiam peccatorum aut carnis mortificationē aut ad • dei placandam aſſumebantur aut aliquandò ab ipſis maioribus iudaeorum iniungebantur maximè temporibus anguſtiae tribulationis aut alijs de cauſis sic ieiunabant diſcipuli iohannis—at verò eccleſia noſtra habemus ie •• niorum praec • pta tempora form • eo • ū praeſcriptam nā obſeruamus ex praeſcripto eccleſiae ieiunia multa vigilias quatuor tempora quadrageſ • mam quae ab apoſtolis ipſis ottum habet haec ieiunia chriſtus eo tempore quo cùm ſuis diſcipulis conuerſatus eſt non indixit eis nec ipſi ieiunia obſe • uabant toletus ieſ card com • uc 5 annot 70 pag 374 wherein although ſaith frequent vſe faſting yet appointed ſetfaſt faſts vndertaken either voluntarily priuate men mortifying fleſh c elſe commanded elder time ſome great publike extremitie vpon ſome ſpeciall cauſes haue church ſaith preſcribed vnto v time formes faſts chriſt day ordaine ſuch •• vigil foure ember lentfaſt 4 next place doctrine proteſtants would examined ieiunium commune ad diſciplinam de qua nunc tractamus pertinet quoties de aliqua magna deo ſupplicandum eſt ieiunium vnà cùm oratione indicere expediret vt scripturae oſtendunt act 13 nehem 1 hoc alacriores ad pre • andū reddimur imminente aut graſſante vllâ calamitate paſtorum officium eſt ho • tari ad ieiunium eccleſiam quo ſimpliciter • dei deprecentur hoc dei gloriae publicae aedificationis intereſt tùm etiam nobis ipſis vtile ſaluta • e caluinus inſtitut lib 4 cap 12 § 19 common publike faſt ſaith caluine ioyned praiers behooffull church whereunto paſtor exhort whenſoeuer ſpeciall cauſe offer ſupplication vnto god example danger ſome great calamitie becauſe hereby praiers may become feruent ſoules humbled wrath god eaſily pacified haue heard doctrine luther allowed see aboue lib 2 cap 24 ſect 7 priuate faſts taming inſolencie fleſh publike alſo whether politicke good commonwealth ſpirituall either vpon extraordinary occaſiōs elſe ſet time feaſts eaſter pentecoſt day lord natiuitie briefe owne caſſander reporteth proteſtants generall opinion confeſsion saxonie confeſſione saxonica—in tertio genere collocantur eae traditiones de rebus indifferentibus quibus accedit opinio cultus meriti aut neceſſitatis quae opinio accedens ex adiaphoris faciat impias quare illas eſſe violandas vt opinio illa corrigatur ità à philippo rom 14 exempla ponuntur delectus ciborum ſtatuta ieiunia c—quid qu • lutherus bucerus proteſtantium princi • e ape • tè ſcribunt ſe publicae pacis cauſà huiuſmodi caeremonias traditiones communiter obſeruare velle conditionibus vt doctrina euangelij de iuſtificatione gratuitâ per fidem chriſti ſyncerè tradatur nec illarum traditionum obſeruatione iuſtitia fiducia ſalutis collocetur caſſander conſult art 15 pag 104 111 wherein publikely ſhewed willingneſſe obſerue ſetfaſts ſuch like tradition yet ſo place opinion merit ſuch obſeruances obſcure thereby doctrine free iuſtification faith chriſt ieſus acknowledged ieſuite philippus melancthon non negat ieiunij rerum indifferentium obſeruationem poſſe homini prodeſſe conducere ad cultum dei non tamen inquit immediatè ſed mediatè facit enim ieiunium vt homo ſit aptior ad fundendas preces quibus eſt cultus dei tererius ieſ comm rom cap 14 diſp 3 num 20 pererius haue bene alſo doctrine melancthon 5 faſts either priuate publike queſtion publike either eccleſiaſticall politicke obiection intendeth onely eccleſiaſticall theſe appointed either vpon extraordinarie occaſions caſe common danger extremitie vpon ordinary courſe therfore aerians thought church might diſanull ſet fast preferre occaſionall faſts herein could called hereticks becauſe many ſuch like tradition aduerſaries iudgement apoſtolical haue bene see aboue lib 2 cap 25 ſect 10 aboliſhed romaniſts themſelues alſo example church god vnder law hath commended vnto v excellency fast occaſionally appointed see aboue lib 2 cap 24 ſect 5 6 6 aërians abhorred ſuch circular ſetfaſts ſo thinke appointment hereticall vſe impious taking occaſion thereby make ſchiſme church proteſtants hath bene proued aërians condemning neceſſarie vſe ſuch faſts romaniſts proteſtants auoiding accidental abuſes among many muſt neceſſarily fall vpon reprehenſion ieſuite pererius quartum genus abſtinentiae hodiè colunt multi peruersâ ratione—quippè vel errore opinionis exiſtimant ſummam perfectionis chriſtianae vnius abſtinentiae cultu exercitatione continen vel hominum laudem aucupantur—vt incautis ſimplicibus falſa ſua dogma perſuadeant vel denique cùm deficiat illos prudentia ſine modo abſtinentiam tractant ſcilicet magno rerum v • iliorum meliorum impedimento ac detrimento perer ••• • omm dan c 1 lib 1 pag 28 kinde abſtinence ſaith many affect vpon peruerſe reſpect either placing chiefe degree christian perfection kind worſhip thereby ſeeking praiſe men elſe ſo exceeding iuſt meaſure faſts become hinderance vnto profitable exerciſes chap ii two romiſh article inuocation saint worſhipping relickes romish apologie ſame faſtened proteſtants laſtly accuſers enforced romaniſts theſe foure duly examined giue v cauſe miſlike apologiſts fourefold defect 2 firſt vigilantius challenged hierome one ſyllable article inuocation saint onely ſaying dicis libello tuo quòd dùm viuimus mutuo pro nobis orare poſſumus poſ • quam autem mortui fuerimus nullius ſit pro alio exaudienda oratio praeſertim cùm martyres vltionē ſui ſanguinis obſecrantes impetra • e non quiuerint hieron tom 2 lib 2 aduerſus vigilant againe si apoſtoli martyres adhuc corpore conſtituti poſſunt orare pro caeteris quandò pro ſe adhuc debēt eſſe ſolliciti quanto magi poſt corona victoria triumphos ibid verbis ſeqq prayer saint make liuing heard god cardinall acknowledgeth finding mention inuocation hierom exception againſt vigilantius glad ſtraine force docuit vigilantius orationes mortuorum pro alijs non exaudiri ex quo ſequitur eos fruſtrà inuocari bellar lib 4 de • eccleſ c 9 § 13 vigilantius conſequence doth proue vigilantius thought saint inuocated doth proue hierome reprehended denying inuocation hierome himſelfe defended inuocation saint conſequence lameneſſe called flat non ſequitur argueth firſt defect ignorance exception taken againſt vigilantius 3 secondly hierome proue saint departed pray liuing doth firſt endeuour ſhew know ſtate liuing manifeſt knowledge affirmeth conuerſant men reaſoning thus tu apoſtolis vincula inijeis vt vſque ad diē iudicij teneantur cuſtodià nec ſint cum domino ſuo de quibus ſcriptū eſt sequuntur agnum quocunque vadit si agnus vbique ergo hi qui cū agno ſunt vbique eſſe credendi ſunt cùm diabolus daemones toto vagentur orbe celeritate nimia vbique praeſentes ſunt c hieron aduerſ vigilant loco ſuprà citato lambe chriſt ieſus euerywhere ſaid follow lambe whereſoeuer goeth thought alſo euerywhere property euerywhere eſſentiall vnto diuine nature hieronymus aduerſ vigilant dicit angelos propter celeritatem naturae quodammodò eſſe vbique—sed ad cognoſcendas preces quae codem tempore fiunt diuerſiſſimis locis non ſufficit celeritas ſed requiritur vera vbiquitas quam nec angelorum nec hominum ſpiritibus conuenire credimus bellar lib 1 de beat sanct cap 20 § alij dicunt obſerue word quodammodo hierome cannot incident cardinall bellarmine truly teſtifieth vnto angel vnto created ſpirit wherefore former aſſertion ierome aduerſaries allow without ſome qualification cardinall applieth adding quodammodo ieſuit hieronymus aduerſus vigilant ſic si agnus vbique ergo hi qui cum agno ſunt vbique eſſe credendi ſunt delrio ieſ diſquiſ magic 10 praecept quid aliu • ſunt sancti quā guttae roris cincinnis ſponſi et reſp ad louanienſ non negaui vnquam c et oecolam pad adſer chryſoſt de inuentio max non deſinūt pro nobis intercedere et melanchthon loc com manlij helias moſes loquebantur cū chriſto de rebus futuris ergo non dubium eſt c bucerus diſp ratisb chytraeus ad cap matth 25 certò nobis perſuaſum eſt c et confeſſ wittenberg quam rationem inijcit b auguſtinus et relation angel ſaith cardinall although auguſtine intimate becauſe angel themſelues capable praiers men thought alij dicunt sanctorum anima ſicut etiam angelos mirà quadam celeritate naturae quodam modo eſſe vbique per ſe audire preces ſupplicantium quam rationem videtur habere b hieron lib cōtrà vigilant sed neutra eſt ſufficiens—et ad cognoſcē da preces c b • llar lib 1 de beat sanct cap 20 § alij dicūt see § vlt lit owne preſence pray muſt euery propertie onely belonging vnto god yet manner vnderſtanding preſence onely kind acknowledged hierome 7 ſeeing muſt teach either viſion alij dicunt sanctos videre deo omnia à principio ſuae beatitudinis quae ad ipſos aliquo modo pertinent proindè etiam orationes noſtras ad ſe directas ita docent greg thomas cai • tan eſtue probabilis haec ſententia— god himſelfe glaſſe elſe alij poſtremò dicunt sanctos non videre verbo orationes noſtras à principio ſuae beatitudinis ſed ſolum tunc reuelari • à deo orationes noſtras quandò • fundimus bellar ibid § alij dicunt reuelation god firſt defended ſome romaniſts see l • tter • probable see letter • denied others vntrue ſecond proued atque ex duabus prior videtur ſimplicitèr probabilior leſſe probable owne cardinall quià ſi indigerent sancti nou • reuelatione eccleſia non diceret à audactèr omnibus sanctis orate pro nobis ſed peteret aliquandò à deo vt eis •• laret preces noſtras deinde non poſſet reddiratio tàm facilè cur sancti muocentur • te aduentum chriſti non inuocarentur—etiamſi sancti non viderent deum adhue poſſent eis reuelari preces noſtrae ſicut hic ter • reuelabantu • bellar quo ſuprà § atque ex becauſe saint receiued knowledge new reuelations god church could ſay ſo boldly vnto pray v ſhe ſhould pray vnto god reueale vigilantius charged hierome wiſh relicks saint dolet martyrum reliquias precioſo ope • iri velamine non vel pannis vel cilicio colligari vel proijci ſterquilinium againe qui reliquias martyrum aſſeris calcandas eſſe hieron aduerſ vigilant lib 2 caſt vpon dunghill troden vnder foote ſuſpecting bene idolatrouſly quid neceſſe eſt te word vigilantius tanto honore non ſolùm honorare verumetiam adorare illud neſcio quid quod modico vaſculo linteamine circumdatum adorando oſcularis hierome anſwereth adored therefore called quis ô inſanum caput martyres aliquandò adorauit hieron quo ſuprà madbraine notwithſtanding aduerſaries haue bene anſwered concerning point fulke againſt rhemes teſtament ſuper act 19 12 vigilantius condemned hereſie church although hierome write ſo bitterly write alſo againſt auguſtine ruffinus yet counted good catholicks vigilantius neither epiphanius philaſtrius auguſtine theodoret iſidorus damaſcenus antiochus ancient writer gathered catalogue hereticks hereſies time touched opinion immoderate eſtimation relicks condemned 10 hierome hath incurred cenſure requireth vigilantius ſcripſit librum quo docebat non eſſe ſic adorandas martyrum reliquias nec ad horum ſepulchra vigilandum quod id temporis magnâ religione fiebat à chriſtianis hunc ita conuitijs debacchatur hieronymus vt pluſ culū eo modeſtiae cogar deſiderare vtinā argumentis duntaxat egiſſet iſraelites prieſts becauſe ſaith cardinall people iſrael prone idolatrie feared among christian though chriſtians bene alwaies free witcherie see hereafter collyridians condemned epiphanius ſacrifi • ſunt eis ſacrilega celebrare c bellar l 2 de imag c 4 § gaudentius addit itaque fo • taſſ • pauci quidam mortuis ſacrificabant qui etiam meritò reprehenduntui ſed non proptereà omnes ſacrarum r • muliercularum quarundam ſuperſtitionem quae quod • im phylact •• ijs faciebant phariſaei id tum faciebant paruulis euangelijs crucis ligno alijſque rebus huinſmodi quae habent inquit zelum dei ſed non ſecundum ſe • entiam culicem liquantes camelum glutientes si vir ſanctiſſ hac ſentit • ••• lierculis quarum infirmitati par erat nonnihil condonare quid dicturus ſit ſi videat hodiè paſſim ad quaeſtum oſtentari lac mariae quod honore propemodum aequat corpori chriſti conſecrato prodigioſum oleum fragm • ntula ligni ci • ci tàm multa vt ſi aceruum redigant vix vna nauis oneraria vehat hic oſtentari • inciſci cucullam illic intimam veſt • mariae virginis alibi pectinem annae alibi caligam ioſeph alibi calceum thomae cantuarienſis alibi chriſti praeputiu • • uod cum ſit re incerta religioſiùs adorant quàm totum chriſtum ne que verò haec ità proferunt tanquam ferenda pl •• ecu • ae donanda affectibus verùm huc fer • ſumma religionis vocatur auaritia sacerdotum monachorum quo • undam hypocriſ • quos alit populi ſtultitia eraſmus annot matth cap 23 pag 80 hierome ſaith ſo reproue ſimple woman certaine ſuperſtitions whoſe infirmitie ſexe might haue deſerued ſome pardon would ſay aboliſhing religious banquet vſed monument martyr preuention auguſt lib 8 de ciuit cap 27 quicunque epulas ſuas eò deferunt quod quidem à chriſtianis melioribus non fit pleriſque terrarum nulla eſt talis conſuetudo—tamen non ſunt ſacrificia martyrum—nos martyres noſtros nec diuinis honoribus nec humanis criminibus colimus vpon place viues thus hic mo epularum praecipuè valuit africa ſicut aug 6 confeſſ teſtatur matrem que ſuam refert ad memorias sanctorum attuliſſe mediolam pultes panem merum dediſſe que oſtiario sed haec ambroſius fieri vetuit nè vlla occaſio daretur ebrioſis ſe ingurgitandi quia illa quaſi • arentalia ſuperſtitionem gentihum eſſent ſimillima viues aug de ciuit dei lib 8 cap 27 • iot drunkenneſſe thus haue heard iuſtly vniuſtly vigilantius miſliked hierome nicephorus hiſt eccleſ l 16 cap 27 ſaith xenayas iſte primus ô audacem • nimam • impudens vo • em illam euontuit chriſti eorum qui illi placuere imago venerandas non eſſe ſee alſo hereof cedrenus compendio hiſtor xenayas protestant appeale firſt concerning witneſſe produced againſt xenayas sect 1 perſwade v ſuch heretike one xenayas ſpoken againſt worſhipping image cauſe iudged heretike requireth witneſſe beyond exception firſt onely witneſſe xenaias perſa pa • àm aſſeruit chriſti sā ctorum imago non eſſe venerandas teſtis eſt nicephorus lib 16 cap 27 bellar lib 4 de •• eccleſ cap 9 § 18 cardinall produce nicephorus alſo apologiſts aſſume ſeeke proue worſhipping image haue bene ancient hereſie onely nicephorus owne cardinall baronius hath admoniſhed reader take heede becauſe sic nicephorus quod planè falſum eſt de tempore matth euang baronius tom 1 anno 41 num 16 rurſus de apolonio sic inter alios nicephorus—temporis ratio eos mendacij redarguit anno 189 num 2 rurſus de 〈◊〉 communis salmeron tom 5 tract 5 ante finem renouncing dominion poſſeſsion propertie good yet communitie enioying vſe ſuch common ſort monk ſecond forſaking propertie vſe rich theſe called mendicant begging frier 12 concerning former por • ò monachis non fuiſſe interdictam • um ſuarum poſſeſſionem vel auguſtinus eſt teſtis lib de haereſ ad quodvult deum ha • 40 cuius haec ſunt verba apoſtolici inquit qui ſe iſto • omine arrogantiſſi • è vocauerunt • ò quòd ſuam c • mmunionem non reciperent vt •• te coniugibus resprop •• poſſ • dentes quales habet catholica eccleſia monachos clericos pl •• booke hereſies ſheweth monk clergiemen enioyed poſſeſsions wiues know platoes commonwealth community ſtate pouertie neither romiſh monaſteries ſo poore paſtures old prouerbe may ſtill paſſe currant deſperatio facit monachum ſome men feare pouertie deſire profeſſion monaſticall pouertie therein ſeeke thereby carnall eaſe ſecuritie may compared vnto aſſe ſtood chriſt onely diſpoſitiō feed cratch againe ſome make profeſſion monaſticall meanes vnto higher preferment herein feining himſelfe dead foxe thereby may eaſily catch prey ſecond confeſſed errour profeſſed romiſh pouertie peculiar vnto order begging frier sect 5 14 much leſſe meanes haue mendicant couer deformed nakedneſſe vnlawfulneſſe ſect call religious profeſſion want poore yet proud eccleſ 6 1 euil vnder sunne ſeeking worſe quaerendo auertat ita quaerere vt ijs ſeruire velimus non enim poſſumus duobus dominis ſerui • e verſ 24 quaerere autem ſecundo loco propter regnum dei non vetuit ſed docuit nam oratione dominica praecepit dicere adueniat regnum tuum praecepit etiam dicere panem noſtrum quotidianum da c maldonat ieſ hunc locum commanding v ſeeke firſt kingdome god altogether forbid v ſeeking thing ſaith aduerſaries exacting proofe romiſh declination open reſiſtance happen reſiſtance ſhewne againſt nouelties proteſtants want ſuch proofe condemned heretiks reſiſtance diſcouered forthwith called heretikes reſiſt partialitie laſt place vnfolded romiſh error defence perfection iſſuing owne contradiction sect 6 18 firſt degree monaſticall pouertie profeſſed hauing vſe thing common whereupon ariſeth queſtion whether ſtate biſhops poſſeſſe land good enioy proprietie rather monk depriue themſelues hereof perfect whereof aduerſaries haue thus determined tertius gradus eſt diligere deum—quā tum poteſt creatura mortalis quae à ſe remouit omnia diuini amoris impedimenta totam ſe dei obſequio conſecrauit qui hoc gradu verſantur imperfecti ſunt reſpectu beatorum ſed perfecti reſpectu altorum hominum etiam luſtorum piorum et haec eſt perfectio de qua loquuntur theologi cùm dicunt ſtarum epiſcoporum eſſe ſtatum perfectionis adeptae ſtatum religioforum eſſe ſtatum perfectionis acqu • endae hoc enim intereſt inter epiſcopos religioſos quòd religioſi non tenentur continuò eſſe perfecti ſed tantùm 〈◊〉 ad perfectionem verſantur enim exercitatione virtutis remotione impedimentorum epiſcopi debent eſſe perfect • id eſt ad eum gradum charitatis perue • iſſe ad quem religioſi per ſua vota exercitia tendunt propte • eà definitione diximus religionem eſſe ſtatum hominum ad perfectionem tendentium bellar lib 2 de monach cap 2 § tertius gradus ſtate biſhops ſay perfect becauſe perfection alreadie atchieued ſtate religious monk leſſe perfect becauſe contending vnto perfection thus whileſt haue defined perfection conſiſt voluntarie pouertie see aboue sect 4 alienation proprietie worldly good yet preferre ſtate biſhops poſſeſſing wealth ſome alſo poſſeſſed thereof doe effect contend place perfection perfection 19 secondly imprimis gregorius nonus anno dom 1238 conſtitutionem edidit quâ omnibus eccleſiarum praefectis praecepit vt mendicantes rem diuinam facere conciones habere ac ſacras peccatorum confeſſ one audire liberè permittant—eandemue conſtitutionem innouanit innocent 4 anno 1245 qui tamen poſteà prohibuit ab omnibus miniſterijs mendicantes azor ieſ inſtit reaſon mendicant worke begge becauſe vſe preach contradictorily reaſon ieſuits prouided beg becauſe ordained preach begging hinderance vnto preaching mendicant begge voluntarie begge • hinderance vnto function euen furtherance vnto perfection ieſuites begge finally begging order haue ſo great plentie find yet perfection pouertie begging ſect vnlawfull pouertie perfection 21 onely point merit remaineth de ſecunda quaeſtione nicholaus 4 qui cap exijt de verborum ſignif ſexto ſentit illam paupertatem eſſe ſanctam meritoriam negat iohannes et quanquam melius nicholaus ſentit tamen nec
