apologie deniall power prieſts remit ſinnes see hereafter tract 3 sect 1 margent tho letter x nouatian • protestant appeale teſtimonies romiſh aduerſaries sect 1 ovr aduerſaries haue diuerſly interpreted hereſie nouatians firſt expoſition taught tertia haereſis omnem poenitentiae virtutem tollit dicens eos qui ſemel lapſi ſunt nunquam poſteà conſequi remiſſionem quantum libet poſteà poeniteant huius author fuit nouatus c alphonſ de caſtro aduer hereſ li 12 tit de poenitentia § tertia haereſis whole diſcourſe proue taketh god power forgiueneſſe ſinne ſuch caſes omne peccatum lethale poſt baptiſmum commiſſum irremiſſible cenſuerunt vega lib 13 de iuſtif cap 2 § secundò pag 486 origenes tract matth 35 haec verba ediſſerens videtur aſtruere quòd impoſſible ſ • eos qui poſt ſuſceptam euangelicae praedicationis gratiam fidem abnegauerunt chriſtum rurſum ad poenitentiam reuerti veniam delicti impetrare qui error nouatianis damnatus eſt senenſ bibl l 6 annot 119 initio man committing mortal ſinne baptiſme could poſsibly obtaine pardon god hand although became neuer ſo penitent caſtro vega senenſis conceiue cardinall bellarmine doth thinke ſo blinde neque vt nonnulli falſo exiſtimant poenitentiae ſpem veniae à deo obtinendae haeretici meaning nouatians tollebantè medio bellar lib 1 de paenit cap 9 initio denie hope pardon god neither ſeeme ſo malicious impute errour vnto proteſtants 2 ſecond vnderſtanding nouatian hereſie cardinall baronius deliuereth cyprianus pluribus docet nouatianum eius fuiſſe ſententiae vt negaret ſemel lapſos ampliùs eccleſiam eſſe admittendos ſed eſſe dei iudicio relinquendos nec vllum lapſorum habendum eſſe diſe imen criminumvè diſtincti •••• 1—porrò quòd nouatianus de cuius haereſi ſermo eſt—negaret quod eſt apoſtolico symbolo remiſſionem peccatorum eccleſia reperiri sed ex neceſſaria quoque aſſumptione haereſis eiuſmodi deduci concluſio videbatur vt à chriſto data eccleſiae claues procacitèr negaretur—in quos auguſtinus de agon chriſti cap 31—noluit credere data eccleſiae claues regni coelorum ipſi ea de mambus amiſerunt card baron anno 254 num 104 107 deniall power keyes church admitting ſinneth baptiſme remiſsion ſinne although repent ieſuit ioh 5 4 dixit chriſtus noli amplius peccare c ex quo loco probat pacianus epiſt 3 contra nouatianos non negandum eſſe poenitentibus veniam nec enim dixiflo chriſtum iam noli peccare quia non ſanaberis iterum ſed nè deterius aliquid tibi contingat maldonat ieſ comment ioh 5 14 maldonate confirmeth pacianus addeth ſame abutebantur hoc loco matth 9 6 nouatiani vt probarent non poſſe sacerdotes remittere peccata quemadmodum hodiè corum haeredes caluiniani cundem errorem abutuntur idem comment matth cap 9 verſ 6 col 225 hereſie hereditarie caluiniſts apologiſts likewiſe inſinuate 3 truly haue related hereſie nouatians ſo vntruly haue intituled protestant hereſie euen caluin himſelfe expreſſe confutation catharists nouatians catechizeth reader theſe tria igitur hic nobis obſeruanda margent noted refutatio catharorum primùm neminem hoc mortali corpore ſine peccatorum remiſſ one conſiſtere poſſe corā deo deindè hoc ben • ficium eſt celeſiae proprium vt non aliter fruamur quàm ſi permaneamus illius communione 3 per eccleſiae miniſtros hoc diſpenſari vel praedicatione euang • lij vel ſacramentorum adminiſtratione atque hác parte maximè en • inere clauiū poteſtatem quam dominus fidelium ſocietati contulit—nouatiani olim hoc dogmate eccleſiam exagitarunt calum inſtit l 4 cap 1 nu 23 three point firſt euery one long lodgeth mortall bodie hath need remiſsion ſinne secondly remiſsion muſt church thirdly performed power keyes chriſt hath giuen vnto euerie faithfull congregation although caluine bene ſilent yet god able heart hard towards ſtones raiſe vp witneſſes behalfe behold greateſt aduerſarie cardinall bellarmine teſtifieth hanc antiquiſſimā haereſin iam olim damnatam iterum excitare conatus eſt lutherus qui poſt eū ſurrexerunt falſi prophetae zuinglius caluinus caeteri nam etiamſi recōciliationē quandā lapſorū poſt baptiſmū agnoſcunt quo videntur diſcrepare nouatianis tamen veram iudiciariam poteſtatem peccata ren ittendi non minùs sacerdotibus negant lutherani quàm olim nouatiani bellar lib 1 de poenit cap 9 § hanc luther zuinglius caluine others acknowledge certaine reconciliation ſinnes baptiſme non probant proteſtantes quòd ijdem nouatiam eos qui poenitentiam agerent nolebant abſoluere ad communionem admittere coccius theſaur cath tom 1 lib 8 art 3 wherein ſaith coccius proteſtants diſſent nouatians 4 cardinall leſſe calumnious meant ſubtle accuſers therefore intendeth draw proteſtants within compaſſe hereſie nouatians third manner interpretation thereof firſt non negant aduerſarij dari eccleſiae poteſtatem ſoluendi ligandi aut retinendi ſed hanc poteſtatem interpretantur miniſterium praed • candi annunciandi poenitentibus remiſſionem peccatorum impoemtentibus itam—id • ircò nobis probandum eſt datam eſſe veram poteſtatem ex authoritate ab oluendi ac per hoc ſacerdotes iud ce eſſe cauſis peccatorum vice chriſts bellar lib 3 de poenitent cap 2 § et quoniam although proteſtants ſaith acknowledge power reconciliation towards ſinners yet account power remiſſion ſinnes iudiciall onely way preaching declaring ſinnes remitted haue nouatian hereſie ſhall proue neither hereſie nouatians yet hereſie 5 ſhew doctrine nouatians dare appeale vnto iudgement cardinall see aboue c baronius see aboue c maldonate ought doth appeare vnto whole schoole ieſuits without queſtioning whether forme reconciliation denied indicatiue indicatiue iudge onely hereſie euen abſolute deniall church power promiſe reconciliation remiſsion repentant ſinners tranſgreſſed baptiſme admit againe communion according vnto conſonant teſtimonies negant oportere reddi communionem qui praeuaricatione lapſi ſunt ambroſ lib 1 de poenit c 1 tom 1 ambroſe nouatianus nolens apoſtatas ſuſcipere poenitentes hieron catalog script tit nouatianus ierome 6 ſecond point concerneth truth doctrine haue aduocate chiefe maſter romiſh ſchoole worſe premiſſes teſtimonies ancient father concludeth ecce quàm varia à doctoribus traduntur ſ • per ijs hac • nta va • ierate quid tenendum hoc ſanè dicere ac ſentire poſſumus quòd ſolus deus dimittit peccata retinet▪ tamen • ccleſiae contulit poteſtatem ligandi ſoluendi ſed alitèr ipſe ſoluit vel ligat alitèr eccleſia ipſe enim per ſe tantùm 〈◊〉 peccatum quia animam mundat ab interiori macula à debito aeternae mortis ſoluit—non autem hoc sacerdotibus conceſſit quibus tamen tribuit poteſtatem ſoluendi ligandi id eſt oſtendendi homines ligatos vel ſolutos vnde dominus leproſum ſanitati priùs per ſe reſtituit deindè ad sacerdotes miſit quorum iudicio oſtender • tur mundatus magiſter sent lib 4 diſt 18 fol 108 109 god bindeth looſeth otherwiſe doth church inwardly purging ſoule ſpot ſinne freeing debt eternall death cannot church ſaith hath power binding looſing declaring ſinners either looſed bound declaratiue maner abſolution late franciſcane preacher publikely profeſſe quorum remiſeritis c likewiſe vpon cap 11 venite ad omnes non quòd homo propriè remittat peccatum ſed quòd oſten dat ac certificet à deo remiſſū neque enim aliud eſt abſolutio quam ab homine accipis quàm ſi dicat en ſili certifico te tibi remiſſa eſſe peccata annuncio tibi te habere propitium deum quaecunque chriſtus baptiſmo euangelio nobis promiſit tibi nunc per annunciat promittit ferus lib 2 com ioan 20 verba quorum • iſeritis c onely abſolution biſhop petrus pariſiorum epiſcopus hieronymi verba clariùs explicans l 4 sent 18 ſic fatur varia à doctoribus traduntur ſuper hac tanta varietate hoc ſanè dicere ac ſentire poſſumus quòd ſolus deus dimittit peccata retinet tamen eccleſiae contulit poteſtatem ligandi c • ſte sixto senenſ bibl lib 6 annot 71 § petrus petrus pariſius varieth one crochet firſt note principall maſter ſelfe moſt conſonant vnto ancient see magiſter sent lib 4 diſt 18 iudgement church • power church iudiciall whoſoeuer bound church ſhould inſallibly bound heauen aduerſaries acknowledge clauem errantem church may erre excommunication reconciliation iudicial god alwayes infallible yet obſerue denie iudiciall ſpeake againſt ext • rnall ritua • manner abſolution cardinall bellarmine doth confèſſe vſed alm • ſt proteſtants thus de hac igitur poenitentia quae ſignis externis proditur quaeſtio eſt sacramentum dici debeat—abſolutionis autem ritum aliquem ſerè omnes agnoſcunt licet de vi efficacia abſolutionis de miniſtro qui eam pronunciat deue alijs multis rebus ad abſolution • pertinentibus multae ſunt inter no aduerſarios quaeſtiones bellar tom 2 de poenit l 1 • 8 § de hac vnto truth ſelfe 7 ſee aduerſaries proteſtants diuided like accuſers suzanna betweene greeke 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 holme lentiske tree firſt ſort make proteſtants guiltie ſaid nouatians denied power reconciliation church baptiſme cardinall anſwereth behalfe proteſtants ſaying ſo afterwards accuſeth onely forme abſolution reconciliation contendeth iudiciall iudgement collegues hereſie nouatians concluſion maſter others hereſie ſound orthodoxall truth calumniation sect 2 8 neuertheleſſe reſolued condemne caluine nouatianorū error praecipuus erat non eſſe eccleſia poteſtatem reconciliandi homines deo niſi per baptiſmum bellar l 4 de notis eccleſ cap 9 § 6 nouatianorum quae ſententia expreſſè caluiniſtarum eſt nam caluin l 4 inſtit cap 19 § 17 ſic ait nullum eſſe poenitentiae ſacramentum praeter baptiſmum quòd ver • hieron ait poenitentiam eſſe ſecundam tabulam poſt naufragium planè impium eſt excuſari non poteſt ibid § quae ſententia nouatianiſme hath ſaid forſooth becauſe held derogation vnto vertue baptiſme eſteeme penance properly ſecond table ſhipwracke ementitum hoc ſacramentum ornârunt quo decebat elogio ſecundam eſſe tabulam poſt naufragium quia ſi quis veſtem innocentiae baptiſmo perceptam peccando corruperit per poenitentiam reparare poteſt sed dictum eſt hieronymi cuiuſcunque ſit quum planè impium ſit excuſari nequit ſi ex eorum ſenſu exponitur quaſi verò per peccatum deleatur baptiſmus non potius memoriam reuocandus ſit peccatori quoties de peccati remiſſione cogitat vt • lic ſeſe colligat animumue recipiat fidem confirmet peccatorum remiſſionem ſe impetraturum quae ſibi baptiſmo promiſſa ſit quòd autem durè impropriè hieron dixit poenitentia reparari baptiſmum à quo excidunt qui excommunicari ab eccleſia merentur boni iſti interpretes ad ſuam impietatem trahunt caluin inſtit lib 4 c 19 num 17 § ne tamen caluine thinketh hierome vſed ſaying vnproper romaniſts held impious ſence namely ſo baptiſme vtterly broken ſinne contrarywiſe teacheth remiſsion ſinne perſon baptized reference vnto couenant caluinus non vult opus eſſe nouo poenitentiae ſacramento quo coeleſti patri reconciliemur cuius inquit vi bapt ſmo viget ideoue baptiſmi memoriā eſſe repetendā lindanus panop lib 4 c 57 fol 349 baptiſme may confirmed ſaying auguſtine auguſtinus quoque exp epiſt ad rom inchoata circa finē eos inquit qui iam baptizati fuerunt curari melius dicimus per poenitentiā non tenouari quia renouatio baptiſmo eſt vbi quidem operatur poenitentia ſed tanquā fundamento manente itaque fundamento recurai aedificiū poteſt ſi autem fundamentum iterare quis voluerit aedificium ſubuertat neceſſe eſt auguſt teſte salmer ieſ •• 15 heb 6 diſp 14 pag 717 although cured ſaith repentance yet renewed baptiſme irreiterable foundation penance regard theodoret noteth one baptiſme chriſtian haec autem dixit diuinus apoſtolus dicens iudaeos qui crediderunt ne exiſtimarent ſanctiſſ baptiſmū eſſe ſimilem baptiſmis iudaicis • illi enim non ſoluebant peccata ſed corporis ſordes quae videbantur purgabant qua de cauſa multa frequenter adhibebantur hic autem vnus eſt vt qui ſalutaris paſſionis reſurrectionis typum habeat futuram reſurrectionem antè deſcribat • doritus tom 2 cited salmeron ibid pag 715 differ iewiſh waſhings becauſe ſaith purging onely filth fleſh often applied purifying ſoule one healthfull type death illuminated ſimilitude altogether incongruous woman deprehended follie ſhall afterward reconciled vnto husband ſhe doth enter new contract mariage onely taketh vpon new reſolution relation vnto firſt couenant so—but preſume reader make vp compariſon 10 theſe three interpretation haue diſcerned three iniuries firſt againſt nouatians make hereſie greater ſecond againſt proteſtants hath bene confeſſed falſe application nouatian hereſie third againſt principall romaniſts hold third ſence hereſie trie affinitie romaniſts themſelues haue foreſaid nouatians sect 3 11 catholici omnesſumma conſenſione contrarium docent fatentur enim primo legem dei iuſtis hominibus abſolutè eſſe poſſibilem non quidem per ſolas vires liberi arbitrij—secundò opera iuſtorum ſimpliciter abſolutè iuſta ſuo etiam modo eſſe perfecta bellar lib 4 de iuſtif cap 10 § kemnitius iust men may poſsibly fulfill law god work holy men abſolutely iuſt affirmed cardinal doctrine catholicks notwithſtanding apud veteres ſaepenumero ſit obuiam nouatianis qui ſeſe ob arrogantiſſ pu • itatis ſanctimoniae opinionem apud populum inctitabāt catharos id eſt puros vt olim sadducaei apud hebraeos ſu • venditabant ſteps want long tum acetio imperator aceſi pone ſcalam ſi potes ſolus aſcende ad coelum hiſt tripart lib 2 cap 13 ladder nouatian aceſius ſhew v full difference betweene thoſe catharists ſome pelagianos fine ſaith manichaeorum eſt hominum damnare naturam liberum auferre arbitrium dei adiutorium ſee hierome explan symb ad damaſum auſtine de fide contra manich c 9 ſaith aduerſus haec ſolita caecitaete manichaei latrant cum con •• ncuntur naturam non eſſe malum ſed poteſtate eſſe hominis facere bene aut male dicunt non eſſe animae liberam voluntatem non vident caecitatem ſuam c et vide ibidem cap 10 actis cum eaelice manichaeo lib 2 cap 4 chryſoſtom iohn hom 45 prope initium ſaith chriſt ſaid man come except father ſent draw hereat manichee riſe vp contending teſtimony ſcripture nothing ſelues c taketh away freewill ſheweth need god helpe concerning point touching baptiſme whitaker l 10 contra duraeum pag 883 confeſſeth ſame ſaying no baptiſmo peccata remitti grati • conferri credimus ac docemus quod negare ſoliti ſunt manichaei ergo no manichaeis alieni ſumus et vide sarcerium loc commun tom 1 de baptiſmo fol 232 b poſt medium manichee protestant appeale sect 1 freewill conſidered adam tranſgreſſion adam offſpring taken diſmall fall manichee ſpeaking onely firſt manichaeus docuit quòd creaturae ſunt malae ex ſe generatione ſua quia ex malo deo creatae ſunt alphonſus de caſtro lib 4 tit creatura haereſ 2 manichaei docuerunt diabolum ex ſua natura malum eſſe nec poſſe eſſe bonum ibid lib 5 tit diabolus haereſ 1 taught ſaith alphonſus compiler hereſies creature naturally euill ſentence hierome obiected see margent apologiſts ſheweth much viz manichee condemned man nature doth manichaeorū inquit hieron eſt hominum condemnate naturam liberum auferre arbitrium aug haereſ c 46 peccatorū originē inquit non tribuunt manichaei libero arbitrio idem apertè sectarij omnes lutherus art 36 dicit liberum arbitrium eſſe rem de ſolo titulo— caluinus l 2 inſtit c 2 3 4 non permittit homini liberam electionem vlla bellar l 4 de notis eccleſ cap 9 § 8 manichaeorum cardinall charge caluine proteſtants ieſuite noluerunt minus ingenioſi videri caluiniſtae nam ipſi nunc cum manichaeis liberum tollunt arbit • ium hoc etiam ſubtiliùs quòd illi vtramque pariter partem hi bonum non malum tollunt non videntes homines errore ſuo caeci non ſolùm malam arborem bonos ſed nec bonam malos fructus facere poſſe—non ſolùm malum ſed etiam bonum liberum habemus arbitrium contra quàm caluiniſtae non aequaliter vtrumque ſed malum ſatis fortè bonum niſi dei gratia adiuuetur infirmum contraquàm pelagiani ſentiebant maldon ieſ com matth 7 18 pag 189 190 maldonate proſecuteth accuſation full 2 caluine himſelfe deſireth heard ſpeake dicimus ergo naturali hominem vitioſitate corruptum ſed quae à natura non fluxerit natura fluxiſſe negamus vt ſignificemus aduentitiam magi eſſe qualitatem quae homini acciderit quàm ſubſtantialem proprietatem quae ab initio indita fuerit—non etiam ineptè dicetur naturaliter prauus vitioſus quemadmodum non veretur auguſtinus ratione corruptae naturae naturalia dicere peccata quae carne noſtra neceſſariò regnant vbi abeſt dei gratia ita euaneſcat ſtultum manichaeorum nugamentum qui cùm ſubſtantialem homine malitiam imaginarentur alterum illi conditorem affingere auſi ſunt ne iuſto deo viderentur mali cauſam principium aſſignare caluinus inſtit l 2 c 1 § 11 ſay ſaith vicious corruption man came nature away foolery manichee imagine ſubſtantiall wickedneſſe man nature call againe accuſers ſee effectually diſcharge firſt caluinus concedit primum hominem ante lapſum libero arbitrio praeditum fuiſſe—ſed nunc co carere l 1 inſtit c 15 § 8 l 2 c 5 § 18 bellarm lib 4 de grat arbit c 7 § poſtremò caluine ſaith confeſſeth man freewill fall liſten vnto ſecond accuſer see teſtimonie maldonate aboue letter manichee tooke away wils freedome well reſpect good euill caluiniſts ſaith denie man namely fall hath freedome vnto good grant free vnto euill 3 well firſt appeareth manichee denied freewill man perfect created nature proteſtants denie freedome onely reſpect man nature tainted corrupted ſecond vnderſtand manichee held man euen fall free neither vnto good euill proteſtants teach man firſt ſinne free vnto euill vnto good manichee proteſtants leſſe differēce point freewill betweene man ſtanding man fallen sect 11 ſome alliance haue ſhould doubt call hereticks point ſay aduerſaries one obiection thrice indiſcreet 2 firſt conſidering ſame ſentence may hereticall orthodoxall according vnto different polycrates holy martyr greeke church held time eaſter time obſerued iewes time alſo blaſtus heretike preciſely keepe theſe contrarie profeſſors diſtinguiſhed one action difference intention blaſtiās held iewiſhly thinking leuitical law neceſſary martyr kept ſame time eaſter chriſtianly opinion indifferencie vntil length time obſeruatiō changed end iewiſh chriſtian profeſſors might better diſtinguiſhed many hundred like example might produced catholike ſpeeches cuſtomes haue bene heretically profeſſed gaue father occaſion call diuell god ape becauſe ſo ſorteth hereſies may carie might eate certaine ſorts meat becauſe thought made good god euill cauſe condemned councels abſtinence certaine meat appointed church ſay rhemiſts chaſtiſing bodie penance hereby according vnto v alwaies quid quo ſame action diuerſe principle intention action diſtinguiſh truth hereſie 5 finally betweene proteſtants pelagians pelagians held noneceſſitie baptiſme becauſe thought grace nature graceleſſe pelagians 6 next ſymptome indiſcretion proceedeth partialitie affection whileſt inſiſt vpon teſtimonies ſome father proofe child cannot ſaued without baptiſme yet contrarie onely iudgement ſubſcribebant ſtatim 〈◊〉 à temporibus apoſtolorum paulatim coeptum eſt degenerari ab illa veteri ſimplicitate diuini cultus anthropomorphites protestant appeale sect 1 great diſeaſe alſo cac •• thes aduerſaries call euerie reprehenſible thing name hereſie rather becauſe ancient father ſo accounted hereof epiphanius auguſtine publiſhed catalogue hereſies whē branded anthropomorphites proper hereſies would haue ſpared howſoeuer proteſtants acknowledged grant see aboue lib 2 cap 3 sect 1 although sacrament reſerued three day yet loſeth propertie sacrament may administred vnto p • rſons caſe extremitie romaniſts themſelues haue ibid sect 3 abrogated ſuppoſed ancient cuſtome reſeruation vpon pretence auoid irreuerence 2 theſe three obſeruations firſt denying reſeruation sacrament hereſie secondly proteſtants denie reſeruatiō thereof water font ſo long may conueni • ntly vſed thirdly romaniſts haue abrogated ancient cuſtome reſeruation argue aduerſaries vnwillingneſſe know either anthropomorphites proteſtants themſelues muſt put minde leaſt vulgar romaniſts guiltie proper hereſie anthropomorphitae miſvnderſtanding god sect 2 3 secunda haereſis eſt quae docet deum eſſe corporeum—hi haeretici à ſuo •• iore nomen 〈…〉 vocat • ſunt anthropomorphitae quia anthropos • rae •… idem eſt quod homo latinè alphonſus de caſtro cont haereſ lib 5 tit deus haereſ 2 anthropomorphitae ſo called becauſe miſconceiued god hath bodily ſhape like man haec ergo anthropomorphitarum ſententia apert▪ haereſeos conuincitur idem ibid see auguſtine tom 6 haereſ 50 ſaith alphonſus manifeſt hereſie see ſame author scripture father alſo learned see aboue lib 4 cap 27 romaniſts acknowledge 4 whoſoeuer ſhall ſaile ocean see rome behold people allowed pray image old man picture god father ſhall aske whether perſwaded god good man hath proportion ſhape man ſhall eaſily finde romiſh imagerie hath turned people image void true ſence vnderſtanding god 5 yet wrong ſhew chiefe reaſon haue picturing god likeneſſe man thus cardinall doth conclude homo eſt vera imago dei ſed hominis poteſt pingi imago ergo dei nam quae eſt imago imaginis eſt etiam exemplaris—licet homo ſit ad imaginem dei ratione intellectus voluntatis tamen ipſe totus homo intelligens volens rectè dicitur eſt imago dei nam gen 1 non ait deus faciamus animam ſed faciamus homin • ad imaginem dei—si autē ipſe totus homo eſt imago dei totus homo verè pingitur ergo imago dei verè pingitur bellar lib 2 de imag sanct cap 8 § quintò c man image god man may pictured ergo image god may pictured proteſtants anſwer man image god faculty ſoule cannot pictured ergo image god cānot pictured replieth although man image god reſpect reaſon yet whole man intelligent rightly called image god ſo whole man pictured image god may pictured 6 kind argument learned man could ſuggeſt without reſolued purpoſe ſophiſticate fallacie à figura dictionis eaſily diſcouered like thus although man compared vnto beaſt reſpect ſenſible bodily part yet whole man immortall ſenſible rightly compared vnto beaſt ſo whole man immortall beaſt may likewiſe called immortall knoweth although whole man may ſaid synechdochically pictured yet man called image god whole part reaſonable inuiſible ſoule cannot pictured 7 therefore cyrill condemned dicebant cùm scriptura ait hominem factum eſſe iuxta imaginem dei▪ credendum eſſe deum humanâ formâ praeditum eſſe quod omninò ſtultum eſt extremae impietatis—deus enim ſpiritus eſt—homo iuxta ſimilitudinem dei quatenus rationis particeps amans veritatis cyril alex tom 2 aduerſ anthropomorph praef anthropomorphites impious folly imagining god haue figure man becauſe written god made man owne image image ſignified ſaith cyrill meant man reaſon vertue caſſianus collat 10 de anthropomorphitarum haereſi diſſerens ait huius haereſis patronos ideò aſſerere deum eſſe corporeum quià scriptura dicit hominem eſſe ad dei imaginem factum—haec facilè meâ ſententiâ proſternitur nam ſi deus corporeus non eſt neque membra habet vt homo fieri non poteſt vt homo ſecundùm corpus dei imago dicatur alphonſus de caſtro contra haereſ l 8 tit imago haereſ 2 fol 184 cannot poſsibly ſaith owne caſtro man reſpect bodie ſhould called image god ex quibus colligimus haec omnia cùm agit ab anima vires ſuas ſumere cùm ergo ſola anima habeat intellectum memoriam voluntatem conſequens eſt vt ſecundum ſolam etiam animam dei imaginem homo portet—potuiſſem pro hac plura sanctorum teſtimonia coaceruare verùm nolui manifeſtiſſima nimia prolixitate grauare lectorem ibidem reſpect ſoule granteth might proued heap teſtimonies frō antiquity therfore ought cardinall haue rather leaned vnto right hand anciēt practiſe primitiue church neuer pictured god thā incline ſo much vnto left hand thus ſophiſtry foſter groſſe hereſy anthropomorphites among people 8 laſtly paucos ante annos edita eſt cyrilli epiſtola ad caloſyrium epiſcopum • ſenoiten aduerſus anthropomorphitas maſſalianos qui nequaquam manibus laborandum eſſe dicebant ſed ſemper orandum poſſeuinus ieſ apparat part 1 tit cyrillus alex pag 373 anthropomorphites thought ieſuite poſſeuine gathereth cyrill man ſhould neuer labour alwaies pray doth picture one ſide cheek ſome monk make praying onely labour chap ix vnmaried life prieſts romish apologie deniall ſingle vnmaried life prieſts hieron contra vigilantium cap 1 condemneth doctrine vigilantius ſaying hereof againſt quid faciunt orientis eccleſiae quid aegypti ſedis apoſtolicae quae aut virgines clericos accipiunt aut continentes aut ſi vxores habuerint mariti eſſe deſinunt vigilantius see hierom l 1 contra iouin c 19 14 ad pamachium apol c 8 iouinian epiphanius haet 59 ante med ſaith dice mihi omnino quibuſdam locu adhuc liberos gignere presbyteros diaconos hypodiaconos whereunto anſwereth 〈◊〉 non eſt iuxta canonem ſed iuxta hominum mentem c ſee syritius epiſt ad himerium tarraconenſem c 6 7 others protestant appeale sect 1 doctrine mariage cometh againe scene perſons vigilantius iouinian two noted hierome applied againſt protestant art romaniſts theſe actor require due diſtinct obſeruations 2 firſt vigilantius iouinian condemned hierome againſt whoſe iudgemēt caſe author excepted ſaying indice frobenij hieronymus matrimonium contumelioſus deleatur index expurg apud iunium pag 24 ierome ſpake baſely contumeliouſly mariage taxation romiſh cenſuriſts haue commanded blotted though exception againſt hierome either truth ignorantly falſhood malitiouſly deliuered elſe whether true falſe becauſe proteſtant hath ſpoken therefore muſt blotted wherefore preſent teſtimonies owne author among ieſuite salmeron ſaith etſi quidam inter veteres patres caſtitatis continentiae ſtudioſi paulò iniquiores acerbiores ſecundum co • iugium extiterint vt terrullianus hieronymus qui etſi veritatem apertè profiteatur teneat vbi tamen locus occurrit dehortandi ab hoc matrimonio acrior eſt atque feruentior salmeron ieſ tom 14 1 cor 7 diſp 14 § ad dubium hierome bitter hote dehorting ſecond mariages biſhop eſpencaeus addeth hierome ſeemeth haue bene leſſe equal euen caſe firſt mariage concerning point rhenanus noteth see aboue lib 2 cap 1 sect 3 hierome euill ſpoken rome yea hieronymus impendiò fauens virginitati ob id nuptijs iniquior quàm epiſcopi quidam eſſe volebant eraſmus arg hieron contra iouin biſhops ſaith eraſmus yet hierome brought ſole accuſer vigilantius iouinian cauſe wherein noted haue bene vehemently vnequall ſpeake defence errour iouinian vigilantius therefore adde c hieronymus aequus ſanè parùm videtur vel vnis nuptijs eſpencaeus lib 3 de continent cap 11 initio proteſtants iuſtified obiected errour vigilantius teſtimonies aduerſaries sect 2 3 requiſite direct triall cauſes require may performed viz heare accuſation firſt may receiue mouth cardinall bellarmine vigilantius docuit eccleſiaſticos debere eſſe vxoratos—eadem omnia nunc docent sectarij lutherus c bellar de notis eccleſ c 9 § 13 vigilantius vigilantius taught eccleſiaſticall perſons ought maried ſo doth luther ſaith ſpeaking proteſtants sectariſts vnderſtand caſe aright vigilantius taught eccleſiaſticall perſons ought maried ieſuite coſter ſheweth plainly hierome ex hieronymo conſtat vigilantium haereticum docuiſſe non eſſe diaconos ab epiſcopis ordinandos niſi prius duxiſſent vxores ceſter ieſ enchirid cap 17 pag 522 vigilantius taught euen deacon ſhould ordained except firſt maried 4 cardinall giue faith ſo proteſtants namely thinke vnlawfull one take order maried ſome aduerſaries haue ſometime feined owne biſhop eſpencaeus therefore ſuſpected haue bene quid hac faciant germani helue • ij alij nuperi rom eccleſiae deſe • tore neſcio ſed vereor vt haec illis coactio ſpeaking ſame point falſò imponatur epiſc eſpencaeus lib 1 de cont cap 1 pag 3 ſlanderous beyond ſuſpition proued moſt falſe experience many miniſters liue vnmaried yet becauſe sauiour hath ſhewne v beſt conuiction aduerſarie ex ore tuo proteſtants may caſe appeale vnto accuſer cardinall bellarmine iuſtification diſtinguiſheth calleth duo ſunt refutandi errores vnus graecorū alter lutheranorum prior error eſt oportere clericos antequam ordines ſacros ſuſcipiant vxores ducere quia poſt ſacros ordines ſuſceptos non licet id facere—poſterior error longè grauior eſt non ſolùm licere ante ordinationem ſed etiam poſt ordinationem vxorem ducere bellar lib 1 de cler cap 19 initio two error one greek teach cleargiemen ought maried enter order ſecond lutheran ſay ſaith lawfull marie ordination 5 marke good reader maruell confeſſed difference greek taught oportere eccleſiaſticall perſons ought marie doctrine vigilantius teſtimonie hierome alledged apologiſts ſheweth wherein vigilantius charged haue ſuffered ſo much proh nefas epiſcopos ſui ſceleris dicitu • habere conſortes ſi tamen epiſcopi nominandi ſunt qui non ordinant diaconos niſi prius vxores duxerint nulli coelibi credentes pudicitiam imò oſtendentes quàm ſanctè viuant qui malè de omnibus ſuſpicantur niſi praegnantes viderint vxores clericorum infanteſue de vlnis matrum vagientes chriſti sacramenta non tribuunt quid facient orient •• eccleſiae c hieron tom 2 lib contra vigilant pag 121 obiected orientis eccleſiae euer ſince otherwiſe greeke church hath bene confeſſed see aboue lib 1 cap 2 sect 33 34 deacon conſecrated ſo manifeſtly maried wiues appeare bigbellied oportere ieſuite coſter iudgement hierome hath confeſſed haue bene doctrine vigilantius cardinall bellarmine alſo acknowledgeth yet could obiect vnto proteſtants nothing onely licere hold lawfull vigilantius holding vnlawfull maried proteſtants onely lawfulneſſe marie theſe may muſt one ſide defending onely libertie mariage neceſsitie could proteſtants coached vigilantius diſputers secondly protestant iustified guilt iouinianiſme sect 3 6 luther principall one againſt point compariſon virginitie wedlocke romaniſts enforce troups ieſuite valentia accuſing iouinianiſme cuius erro • viz non licere ante poſt ordinationem matrimoniū inite fundamentum quoddam iecit iouinianns hoc ipſo quòd praetulit matrimonium virginitati nam ſi matrimonium quiddam praeſtantius eſt deo gratius nihil eſt cur ſacrati miniſtri cauſa ſanctitatis religionis debeant à coniugio abſtinere valent ieſ tom 4 diſp 9 q 5 punct 5 § 3 preferring maried ſtate virginitie coccius onely iouinianus virginitatem ſanctimonialiū coniugiorum meritis adaequabat idem luther coccius theſaur tom 1 l 8 art 3 tit iouinianus equalling worthineſſe confeſſeth continency excellent noble gift secondly reſpect god ſo maketh equall thirdly ſame reſpect preferreth wedlocke virginitie fourthly comparing owne nature calleth maried ſtate heauenly ſingle god proportioning reward eternall bleſſedneſſe according vnto man work gift god grace plentifull virginitie well excellently ſhall rewarded bleſſedneſſe yet owne worth aquinas truly obſerueth perfectio vno modo conſideratur per ſe quidem eſſentialiter ſic conſiſtit perfectio chriſtianae vitae charitate altero modo ſecundariò accidentaliter— ſic conſiſtit inſtrumentaliter conſilijs quia omnia ſicut praecepta ordinantur ad charitatem—vnde dicit abbas moſes ieiunia vigiliae meditatio scriptura • um nuditas priuatio omnium facultatum non perfectio ſunt ſed perfectionis inſtrumenta quòd non conſiſtit illis diſciplinae finis ſed per illa peruenitut ad finem little conſilia ordinantur ad remouendū impedimenta actus charitatis quae tamen charitati non contrariantur aquinas 2 2 qu 184 ad 3 watching faſtings nakedneſſe relinquiſhment rich perfection themſelues apply vnto continēcy inſtrumēts vnto perfectiō neither theſe reſpects aduācing virginity aboue mariage offēd aduerſaries 10 thirdly abaſed reſpect diſproportionate ſubiects double compariſon auguſtine doth firſt minore maiore genere boni although ſtate continencie owne nature deſtinate vnto accompliſhment ſome chriſtian action condition wedlock yet perſons continent maried alwaies accordingly diſpoſed ſometime happeneth clemens alexandrinus noteth coniugal party ouermatch virginal profeſſion qui enim perfectus fuerit exempla habet apoſtolos reuera vir oſtenditur non • quòd vitam elegerit monaſticam ſed ille viros vincit qui matrimonio liberorum procreatione domus curâ ac prouidenti • citra voluptatem dolorem ſe exercet cum domus curatione eſt indiuulſus à dei charitate inſurgens aduerſus omnē tentationem quae affertur per filios vxorem famulos ei autem qui haec non habet euenit magna ex parte vt non tentetur clemens alex strom lib 7 cap 6 perfectiō godlineſſe reſpect auguſtine concludeth obed • entior coniugata minus obedienti virgini praeponenda eſt auguſt lib • bono coniugali eſteeming nicolaus clemangius conterraneus meus campanus pariſien theologus ſodalis nauarricus inter eccleſiaſticos ſcriptores à trithemio valdè laudatus collegit inquam eccleſiae ſui temporis ſcandala libro quem ſcripſit de corrupto eccleſiae ſtat • ſed non ſibi cauit à ſcandalis exceſſit enim multis eius medicina modum nam quo cap 36 agit de ſanctimonialibus nihil diſtinguit inter ſui temporis virginum monaſteria meretricum lupanaria inter ancillarum dei ſanctuaria veneris victimarum proſtibula iuuenumue ad libidines explendas receptacula denique inter puellam velare publicè ad ſcortandum exponere eſpencaeus de continent lib 2 cap 12 pag 217 nunnery better ſlewes place ordained ſanctuaries virginitie differ nothing brothel venus theſe two general abuſes ſuch admit remedy spirit god hath preſcribed ſo many owne doctor haue iudged viz better mary notwithſtāding ſtomach loatheth 17 next direct patronage vncleanneſſe priuiledging stewes whereof see confeſſed aboue lib 1 ca 2 sect 36 principall one builded pope sixtus proteſtant ſhall need declaime againſt wickedneſſe owne biſhop eſpencaeus ſo large argument deſirous poſſeſſe scene alone facere non potuimus qum de earundem turpitudine palam permiſſâ nonnihil adderemus huius euim permiſſionis no non ſemel puduit chriſtianam ſcil remp eo carere nō poſſe quod tamdiu hoc eſt annis plus 1500 non admiſit moſaica eſpencaeus de contin lib 3 c 4 pag 236 cannot bluſh ſaith hereat thinke chriſtian commonwealth cannot auoid commonwealth iewes want thouſand fiue hundred yeares together nam è contrario mer • tricum euangelijs publicarū peccatricū mentio mat 21 luc 7 impumtatem per ea tempora non legalem ſed phariſaicam arguit vt tum legitima pleraque alia peſſum abierant quo minus autem hanc foeditatem lex vetus impunitam tulerit obeſt etiam praeter ſuperiora hodiernum vſque diem ſudaeorum vbiuis inter quoſuis degant praxis ſuas meretricium facere non permittentium dici nequit quàm incredibili chriſtianorum tum pudore tum etiam corum q •• verè tale ſunt cordolio vt ludae filiae ſcortari non liceat dei filiae heeat imò iſraelis filiae meretricari non alitèr ante poſſit qu • facta per ſanctum baptiſmum chriſti ſoror filia nam quae iudaea puella prae vel inopia vel libidme proſtare ſtatuit quoniam inter populares ſuos non ſineretur ad chriſtianiſmum ſcil conueititur ungitur inter chriſtianos cum chriſtianis proſeda futura re non coelis tantùm vti propheta deplorat ler 2 ſed omnibus ſuperis inferis miranda ſtupenda lugenda sed adhuc peius proficientes malumus imperatorem peſſ caligulam quàm optimum alexandrum imitari ille suetonio teſtante nouum inauditum vectigal impoſuit ex captur •• proſtiturarum vt tenerentur publico quae meretricium aut lenocinium feciſſent hunc tale meretricum lenonum que vectigal vetuiſſe ſacrum aerarium inſe •• ſed id ad circi theatri amphitheatri inſtaurationem deputáſſe refert lampridius eſpencaeus quo ſupra pag 241 could adulterie finde therein impunitie ſect phariſees rule yet filthineſſe ſpeaking profeſſed whoredome neuer left vnpuniſhed vnto day nay may vnto heauen earth astoniſhment iewiſh maide renounced religion become chriſtian end ſhe might licence practiſe art ribaldrie rather follow caligula alexander heathen man would ſuffer tribute cuſtome receiued ſuch brothellers brought treaſurie 18 romae verò hoc eſt totius chriſtianiſmi metropoli quid adhuc hac refactum aut non factum anno 1538 paulo 3 • lecti pro emendanda eccleſia reuerendiſſ cardinales alijue viri graues ſic inter alia conſuluerunt cotrigendum hunc turpem abuſum quò illic meretrices vt matronae incedunt aut mulâ veliuntur aſſ • ctantibus ea de medium die nobilibus • • lia • ibuſ que cardinalium atque clericis habitant etiam inſignes aedes nulla vibe hanc aiunt corruptionem vidimus praeter quam hac omnium exemplari et hanc tamen turpitudmem corruptela • ue ne ille quidem ex conſiliarijs vnus paulus poſtea 4 ſuſtulit quod vt mihi benè ſum conſcius eo quo colloquio dignatus eſt quâ potui ac debui modeſti • priuatim ſuaſeram mirum certè tale tantoſue viros conſuluiſſe minuedum modò ſcortorum faſtum ac luxum non etiam caſewel eijcienda verò propter tam multos ibi coelibes neceſſariò retinenda rem horiendam mihi ſanè ſic eos ſenſiſſe dicere religio ſit no gallos ſtolidos ſcil ac ſimplices ſic enim no illi vocant homines ſcil ſubtiles ſapientes non poſſe non grauitèr offendi tot mille luparum eiſdem muris vnà vrbe ſub eodem propè quod aiunt tecto quotidiano conſpectu ac velimus nolimus occurſu non enim iam vt olim ſub moenibus habitant ant ſub menianis circenſibus martiali ob id ſubmaeuianae aut ſummaenianae dictae quaerit idem fabius • upanari cum aliena deprehenſus adulter ſit non quaeſiturus niſi certo tum loco diuerſatae fuiſſent sic romani quamlibet ethnici nunc verò ſub chriſti vicarijs petu succeſſoribus vt alius quidam cecinit—vrbs eſt iam tota lupanar eſpencaeus ibid pag 242 rome metropolis chriſtendome ſaw ſtrumpets ride vpon mule ſtreets haunted attended gallant cleargimen day pope paulus third anno 1538 perceiued greater corruptiō kind citie pope paulus fourth informed hereof remoue well cānot offended ſee ſo many thouſand ſtewes within wals one citie daily eye paſſengers inſomuch may almoſt ſaid rome chriſtian rome ethnicke—now whole citie ſtewes honeſt nunc non occurtit vnde ſumptum thomas de regim principum l 4 c 14 id facit mundo meretrix quod naui ſentina palatio cloaca tolle haec illa foetore replebis—verùm nullus haec grauiora flagiti • euadendi niſi leurorum permiſſu aditus pateat adhuc quaeram hoc ad hominem quod aiunt argumento sublatis apud iudaeos per tot ſecula lupanarijs omnia protinùs libidinibus confuſa fuerint aut etiamnum ſint tu tu ſancte pater auguſtine quid verò terrenae ciuitati velut exprobras quòd ſcortorum vſum licitum fecerit vt quem nulla eius lex vindicet cum eadem turpitudo noſtra hoc eſt dei ciuitate neque minus permittatur neque magi puniatur— reaſon ſuch beaſtlineſſe clariſſimèſan • oceano hieronymus ſcripſit caeſarem non chriſtum papinianum non paulum viris impudicitiae fraena laxare lupanatia pe • mittere eſpenc de contin cardinall cremenſis pope legate coming london remoue maried prieſts cure receiuing hoaſt ad paſcha iohannes cremenſis cardinalis rom deſcendit angliam—celebrauit conc ſolenne apud londoniā—cùm igitur ſeueriſſimè conc de vxoribus sacerdotum tractaſſet dicens ſummum ſcelus eſſe à latere meretricis ad corpus chriſti conficiendum ſurgere cùm eadem die corpus chriſti confeciſſet cum meretrice poſt veſperam interceptus eſt re apertiſſima negari non potuit caelari non decuit henr huntingd hiſt l 7 anno 1120 polyd virg hiſt angl found ſame night committing follie whore fact ſo euident ſaith hiſtorian could denied chap x deniall enioyned time penance romish apologie deniall enioyned time penance heretikes called theodoret l 4 haer fab de audianis reproueth ſaying deinde confeſſis c giue remiſſion ſuch confeſſed without preſcribing tim • penance lawes church commaund audians protestant appeale freeing themſelues note hereſie point teſtimonie antiquitie sect 1 whatſoeuer almoſt cardinall haereſis audianorum ſuit vt ex theod l 4 de fabulis haeret intelligi poteſt confeſſionē peccatonim iubebat abſolutionem largiebatur ſed nullam iniungebat poenitentibus mulctam bellar l 3 de poenit c 1 initio bellarmine doth ſuggeſt theſe apologiſts vſually ſwallow without due digeſtion well vnderſtanding whereof affirme epiphanius noteth audiani onely haue bene ſeparatiſts church otherwiſe haue held et ſi videbant aliquem voluptatibus ac delicijs viuentem aut aliquem adulterantem eccleſiaſticam praedicationem ecolefiae ſtatuta non forebat hic vir ſed verbis veluti dixi reprehendebat et erat hoc graue adruodum qui vitam approbatam non habebant atque hac de cauſa contumelijs afficiebatur contradictionem ſuſtinebat odio habebatur—seipſum ab eccleſia ſeparat multiue ſimul cum ipſo diſcedunt et ſic diuiſionem fecit cùm nihil haberet fide diuerſum ſed rectiſſimé crederet ipſe ſodales ipſius etiamſi id dicere maximè oportet partio quodam ipſum contentioſè ferri itemue eius aſſeclas epiphan contra hoereſ tom 1 lib 3 cap 70 pag 240 doctrine different • trine church therefore opinion auguſtine quos epiphamus appellat ſchiſ • aticos potius quàm haereticos auguſt • 6 h • reſ 5 • ſaith rather ſchiſmaticks hereticks referred vnto theodoret chargeth performing lawes church enioyned time fast though breach euery eccleſiaſticall conſtitution make hereſic wel may ſay euerie tranſgreſſion ſtatutelaw properly rebellion 2 howſoeuer yet proteſtants cardinall hath acknowledged ipſi autem aduerſarij ſpea • ing pr • • ſtants licet ſatisfactiones 〈…〉 reijciunt tamen opera externa ſignum poenitentiae non reijciunt bellarm lib 1 de poeni • 〈◊〉 8 § ipſi autem reiect externall laborious work penance require ſignes men repentance neither indeed profeſſe admit ſcandalous offender haue expreſſed contrition ſome outward ſatisfiable token repentance ſuppoſe time wherein laborious work muſt done romaniſts thus taxing audiani haue made themſelues gutltie hereſies audiani sect 2 3 becauſe apologiſts labour conuince audiani proteſtants heretikes though euery point theodoret doth inſ • among error andiani deſerue ſtamped n • • hereſie deſire heare theàoret proſecuting audiani large hi autem iactant ſe peccata remittere poſtquam enim ſacros libros vnà cum adulterinis bipartitò diuiſetint co enim mirandum modum arcanos myſticos exiſtanant hinc illinc perve • ſus poſuerint iubent vnumquemque inter co tranſire quae à ſe peccata ſunt confiteri deinde con • eſſis donant remiſſionem non tempus ad poenitentiam vt iubent leges eccleſiae praeſcribentes led ſua poteſtate condonantes theod lib 3 haeret fab tit de audianis tom 2 theſe ſaith boaſt forgiue ſins haue diuided ſacred bookes adulterous iudge namely ſacred exceedingly darke myſticall haue put one verſe command diſciples paſſe conſeſſe ſinnes haue committed ſo giue remiſsion ſinnes without preſcribing time penance according lawes church command 4 thus farre theodoret demand aduerſaries point hereſie picke theſe particular wil call audiani heretikes boaſting could forgiue ſinnes calling ſacred bookes scripture ſuch ſeemeth mysticall exceeding darke commanding euery one confeſſe ſinnes guiltineſſe aduerſaries theſe permit giue cenſure yet theſe mingled article hath bene obiected yet furthermore romaniſts found partly guiltie ſame error haue ſo particularly obiected sect 3 5 onely errour faſten vpon tranſgreſſing lawes church preſcribing time penance see aboue lib 2 cap 15 § 4 aduerſaries haue confeſſed law ancient church first enioyne penance gaue remiſsion ſinnes godsmethode firſt bring forth fruit repentance church rome see ibidem aduerſaries haue confeſſed doth firs̄t abſolue enioyne penance thus ſtrict condemning audiani themſelues become heretikes ſome point obiected article prepoſterous catholicks chap xi difference merit romish apologie deniall diuerſitie merit auguſt de tempore ſerm 191 ſaith iouiniani damnamus errorem qui dicit gloria neque vllam eſſe coelis praemiorum differentiā quoniam nullam eſſe ait hac vita meritorum diſparitatem huius erroris dux magiſter iouinianus alphouſus de caſtro l 3 tit beatitudo haereſ 7 neuer nameth luther proteſtant equalitie men vertues life reward kingdome heauen thus iouinian proteſtants cardinall writeth thus lutherani ex co quod ſibi perſuadent iuſtificationis formalem cauſam non eſſe donum aliquod inſuſum à deo atque nobis adhaerens ſed ruſtitiam ſide chriſti apprehenſam—colligunt omnes non eſſe vnum alio iuſtiorem cùm omnium iuſtitia ſit ipſa chriſti iuſtitia fide de iuſtif cap 16 initio lutheran ſay ought know ſaith vertues equall ſins equall neither denie chriſtian may increaſe faith hope loue vertues although denie man iuſtified theſe neither vulgar though could ſhall bewray himſelfe ignorant b c generall doctrine proteſtants thus iuſtifiable deſcend accuſe one particular whoſe innocencie doth challenge v anſwer ſhewing ſentence luther obiect ſacrilegious moſt ſacred apostolicall concerning ſanctitie bleſſed virgine sect 4 9 quartus eſt lutheri de natali b mariae com 1 petri vbi dicit omnes chriſtianos eſſe aequè ſanctos ac iuſtos atq • e mater dei ex quo ſine • bio ſequitur fore omnes aequè beatos bellar cap 9 de eccleſ § quartus eſt luther ſaid ſaith accuſer chriſtians iuſt holy mother lord whereupon muſt certainly follow saint ſhall equally bleſſed luther readie anſwer quantumuis inter ſe corporis membra omnia imparia ſint officijs atque dignitate plurimum diſtent eo tamen paria ſunt quòd eiuſdem corporis membra exiſtunt neque poteſt oculus ſibi plus corpore iuris vindicare quàm contemptiſſimum quodque neque plus ſuum corpus eſſe affirmare quàm cuiuſſ • bet alterius ita habet re chriſtianorum qualeſcunque ſint ſiue firmi fide ſiue infirmi ſiue conſummati moribus ſiue morbis grauati tantum quilibet chriſto chriſtianiſmo poſſidet quantum alij vnde equidem non minus poſſum de chriſto gloriari quàm petrus aut virgo deipara perplacet ſanè petrum nobilius eſſe chriſti corpore membrum quàm ſim ego ille rurſus non contemnit quòd ſim humilis abiectus quandoquidem ciuſdem corporis membrum ſum lutherus lect rom 12 2 domin ab epiphan although ſaith luther member bodie vnequall compared together yet equall member ſame bodie eye member body moſt meane contemptible part neither hath prerogatiue ſay part body semblable ſtate chriſtians whether ſome firme ſaith perfect life others yet euery one hath good intereſt chriſt chriſtianity another ſelfe may glorie chriſt well peter bleſſed virgine mother chriſt moſt willingly grant peter noble member myſticall bodie chriſt yet doth deſpiſe euen becauſe member ſame bodie 10 compariſon diuerſe member part body themſelues bodie luther learned paul ſaith 1 cor 12 ver 12 according rhemiſh tranſlation bodie one hath many member member body whereas many yet one body ſo alſo chriſt verſ 14 foote ſhall ſay becauſe hand body therefore bodie verſ 22 think baſe anſwer vnto accuſation concerning equalitie ſinnes iudgement romiſh aduerſaries sect 5 13 iouinianus dicebat omnia peccata eſſe paria—sic • utherus nullum eſſe peccatum veniale ſed omnia damnabilia coccius theſaur cath tom 1 lib 8 art 3 iouinian taught ſaith coccius ſinnes equall doctrine luther ſaith ſinne nature veniall damnable mortal hardly ſhould haue thought aduerſarie reputed learned could haue bene ſo vulgarly witted make ſuch conſequence ſinnes nature mortall ergo equall therfore ſend coccius catechized rule common ſenſe according owne ieſuite informe ſhewing iudiciall lawes iewes many ſinnes equally reſpondeo gradus quidem diſtinguere non genus nam vtrobique capitalem ſed iudicio leuiorem concilio grauiorem iudices poe • conſtituebant quemadmodum grauiores ad concilium quàm ad iudicium cauſae deferebantur scitum eſt quatuor apud iudaeos capitalium poenarum fuiſſe genus ſtrangulationem gladiū lapidationem combuſtionē vt libro sanedrini notatum eſt sic etiā chriſtus eum qui iraſeitur eum q • u fratrē ſuum leuem eum qui ſtultum appellat eâdem inferni poenâ non eâdē poenae grauitate dignum docet maldonat ieſ com matth 5 22 capitall notwithſtanding poſition ſelfe defineth euery ſinne owne nature mortall related approued owne see hereafter cap 22 sect 4 doctor 14 ſumme firſt according vnto imputatiue iuſtice equally iuſtified secondly reſpect inherent iuſtice men equally iuſt thirdly chriſtians compared whole bodie equally member compared one another equally holy fourthly although ſinnes nature aequè peccata mortall yet aequalitèr peccata equally heinous theſe principall point profeſſed proteſtants ſo plainly verified iuſtified owne author haue confirmed vnto v ſtrength truth quae magna eſt praeualet 15 furthermore vndoubted profeſſion proteſtants concerning difference holineſſe saint god ſchools book pulpit haue ſounded forth teaching although among worker harueſt receiue matth 20 9 one penie one eſſentiall eternitie bleſſedneſſe yet degree bleſſedneſſe ſhall imparted vnto proportion god mercifull iuſtice promiſed reward euery one 2 cor 5 10 ap • c 2 23 according work notwithſtanding doth inferre merit becauſe god crowneth ſaith auguſtine auguſtine gift merit euē grace grace crowning difference ſanctifying grace men life difference degree grace glory higheſt heauen ordaining ioh 14 2 diuerſe manſions predeſtinating 2 tim 1 20 diuerſe veſſels perpetuating 1 cor 15 41 diuerſe ſtarres fixed eternall firmament bliſſe yet ſhall greater leſſe veſſels honour equality euery one ioh 16 24 ioy ſhall full called another triall chap xii poſsibilitie keeping law romish apologie deniall commandements poſſible certaine hierom explanat ſymb ad damaſum ſaith execramur blaſphemiam eorum qui dicunt impoſſibile aliquid homini à deo praeceptum eſſe c ſame word hath auſtine de tempore ſerm 191 vide hieronymum ad cleantium concil 2 arauſican 25 heretikes thoſe time protestant appeale firſt laying downe ſtate question sect 1 firſt impoſsible word enuious therfore may ſuffred paſſe without ſlit diſtinguiſhing impoſsibility either abſolute though god could perfect creature hath made archāgels power domination onely hereſie alſo perfect blaſphemie otherwiſe taken ſuppoſitiuely reſpect vnto wil god ſay impoſsible man flie vp heauen god cannot enable man herunto ſtandeth god ordinance wil wiſdome grant man angelicall perfection ſence proper vnto queſtion according sciendum tamen eſt ex eodem auguſtino hanc tantam iuſtitiae perfectionem quantam praeter vnum chriſtum nemo hac vita vel aſſecutus ſit vel aſſecuturus non negandam eſte deo poſſibilem ſed fieri ab eo poſſe cuius hic exemplum deſit quia ei omnia facilia ſint nedum poſſibilia apud eum ac eius virtute cau • habet quá fieri poſſit eius ſapientia quare non factum ſit fieret autem ſi tanta voluntas adh beretur quantum ſufficit tantae rei eſſet autem tanta ſi nihil eorum quae ad iuſtitiam pertinent no lateret ea ſic animum delectarent vt quicquid aliud voluptas vel dolor impedit delectatio illa ſuperaret quod vt non ſit ad dei iudicium non ad impoſſibilitatem pertinet ſic ſine exemplo eſt hominibus perfecta iuſtitia nec tamen impoſſibilis eſpencaeus epiſc 2 tim 3 pag 126 biſhop hath obſerued auguſtine denieth ſimple impoſsbility though god could make man perfect life confeſſeth yet none perfect cauſe whereof reſerued vnto god iuſtice thus vnderſtand impoſsibilitie article 2 secondly man meant vnregenerate ſo might fight without aduerſarie becauſe romaniſts confeſſe aut certè exiſtimant poſſe hominem ſeruare propri • viribus omnia praecepta moralia innocentem vitam agere ſecundùm rationem hac ſanctitate morali prouocare deum ad auxilium ſpeciale ſibi donandum quo tandem ad fidem gratiamue peruemat ſed haec quoque eſt haereſis pelagiana lib ſuper ſatis ſuperue refutata vt omittam nullum eiuſmodi hominem ex hiſtorijs poſſe monſtrari catones enim socrates alijue horum ſimiles qui inter ethnicos ſanctiſſimi iudicati ſunt multis vitijs coopertos fuiſſe facilè demonſtrati po • ſit bellar lib 6 de grat lib arbit c 6 § sanè qui impoſsibility man owne naturall power keepe god commandements cenſu • ing contrary doctrine amongſt hereſies pelagians haue proper ſubiect queſtion man regenerate life predicate impoſsible keepe commandements end exhibite proofe proteſtants aſſertion confeſſed teſtimonies antiquitie sect 2 3 cardinall bellarmine relateth romiſh doctrine name catholici omnes ſumma contenſione contrarium docent fatentur enim 1 legem dei iuſtis hominibus abſolutè eſſe poſſibilem non quidem per ſolas vires liberi arbitrij—secundò opera iuſtorum ſimpliciter abſolutè iuſta ſuo etiam modo eſſe perfecta bellar lib 4 de iuſtif cap 10 § porrò catholick • ſaith teach full conſent iust man may abſolutely fulfill law god alſo work iuſt men abſolutely iuſt manner perfect marke abſolutely iuſt yet ſuo modo manner perfect though abſolutely perfect abſolutely iust • abſolutely iuſt manner perfect giue v ſuch 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 contradiction firſt entrance queſtion like aſtumbling threſhold ſomewhat ominous maine 4 saint ierome catholicke yet profeſſing ſpeake againſt new hereſy made old defence man perfection life refuteth certè nullum ſanctiorem puto leremia virgine prophetâ ſanctificato vtero—ſignificat omnem mundum dei indigere miſericordi • nullum quamuis ſanctum pergere ſecurum ad iudicem contra nouam ex veteri haereſin quae putat hoc ſ • culo omnes ſimul iuſtum implere poſſe virtutes—et pſal 114 dicit placebo domino non placeo hic enim quicquid facio non poſſum eſſe perfectus iuſtus quoniam praeſenti ſeculo perfectus iuſtus nemo eſſe poteſt nec dauid nec apoſtolus nec sanctorum aliquis nemo á peccato mundus nulli sancti auſi ſunt dicere vel sancti ſumus vel placeo ſed placebo deo vbi placebo regione viuorum haec enim mortuorum regio vt refert epiſc eſpencaeus 2 tim 4 § 18 pag 124 thinke ſaith holy man paſſeth life without feare vnto god tribunall therefore haue euery iuſt man accord vnto prophet dauids tune ſung placebo placeo pleaſe god ſaith region liuing ſaith hierome life heauen becauſe could ſay pleaſe god life region dead thinketh haue bene ſong apoſtles holy men thus much hierome relation owne biſhop whereupon gather hierome ſaying moſt iuſt cannot properly pleaſe god life doth fully diſſent aduerſaries ſay iust man may abſolutely fulfill law god life 5 saint auguſtine denied haue bene catholicke biſhop ſaith reigneth argument confeſſed ſay facere non poſſum quin ex auguſtino nonnihil ſubligam regnat hoc argumento—is lib 2 de pecc merit remiſl ca 13 poteſt fieri vt aliquis ſit perfectus—in eo quòd omnes homines diligat etiam inimicos non eatamen perfectione vt quos diligit tantum diligat quantū incommutabilis regula veritatis diligendos eſſe praeſcripſit nec ideo quiſquam prorſus ſine peccato eſſe intelligitur qui aliqua dicitur eſſe perfectus quan quam hoc ita dici poteſt vt non quia iam non eſt quo proficiat ſed quia maximâ ex parte profecit—et lib 4 cap 11 ex ambroſio videmus inquit impoſſibile eſſe vt perfectè quis immaculatus ſit hoc corpore conſtitutus et lib 2 contra iulianum vos feſtinatis praeſumptionem veſtram feſtinando praecipitatis hîc enim vnltis hominem perfici vtinam dei dono non libero ſed ſeruo potius arbitrio à qua perfectione longe vos eſſe ſentitis ſed dolus eſt ore veſtro ſiue peccatores vos eſſe dicatis iuſtos credi velitis ſiue profiteamini perfectionem iuſtitiae quam profectò vobis non eſſe ſentitis ex eſpencaeo quo ſupra pag 125 man cannot loue god much inuiolable rule truth doth preſcribe diuerſe ſentences ſame effect doubtleſſe long auguſtine reigneth argument proteſtants cannot poſſibly faile cauſe deſpaire perfection law teacheth euery one flie vnto perfection goſpell example iuſt et ſi eſt aliquod peccatum quod vitari non poſſit quo modo iuſtus deus dicitur ſi imputare cuiquam creditur quod vitari non poſſit reſpondemus iam olim contra ſuperbos eſſe clamatum beatus cui non imputauit dominus peccatum—peccatum eſt autem cùm vel non eſt charitas quae eſſe • bet vel minor eſt quàm debet ſiue hoc voluntate vitari poſſit ſ • ue non poſſit quia ſi poteſt praeſens voluntas hoc facit ſi autem non poteſt praeterita voluntas hoc fecit tamen vitari poteſt non quando voluntas ſuperba laudatur ſed quando humilis adiuuatur—quando autem poſſit per quem poſſit hoc quaeritur si enim modò eſt non omni animae fideli poſitae corpore mortis huius orandum eſt dicendum dimitte nobis debita noſtra cùm iam ſancto baptiſmo vniuerſa fuerint dimiſſa praeterita quiſquis autem membris fidelibus chriſti hoc non eſſe orandum perſuadere conatur nihil aliud quàm ſeipſum chriſtianum non eſſe profitetur auguſt tom 7 lib de perfectauſtit ad rat 15 16 dauid ſaying bleſſed man vnto lord imputeth ſinne 6 ambroſe catholike biſhop whoſe teſtimonie biſhop hath inſerted auguſtine viz see little letter c ſeee impoſsible ſaith ambroſe man liuing life perfect ſpotleſſe 7 saint bernard father later time appropriated theſe apologiſts abſolute romaniſt hold haue bene saint powerfull see aboue miracle ſo acknowledge haue bene compariſon generation among liued miraculous saint heare profeſſion saint nam affectu quis ita habet charitatem vt mandatur ergo illa mandatur ad meritum illa pramium datur cuius initium quidem profectumqm vitam quoque praeſentem experiri diuinâ poſſe gratiâ non negamus ſed planè conſummationem defendimus futurae foelicitatis quomodo ergo iubenda fuit quae implenda nullo modo erat aut ſi placet tibi magi de affectuali datum fuiſſe mandatum non inde contendo dummodo acquieſcas tu mihi quòd minimè vita iſta ab aliquo hominum poſſit vel potet • adimpleri quis enim ſibi arrogare id audeat quod paulus ipſe fatetur ſe non comprehendiſſe nec latuir praeceptorem praecepti pondus hominum excedere vires ſed iudicauit ille vtile ex ipſo ſuae illos inſufficientiae admoneri vt ſci • ent ſauè ad quem iuſtitiae finem niti pro viribus oporteret ergo mandando impoſſibilia non praeuaricatores homines fecit ſed humiles vt omne o obſtruatur ſubditus fiat omnis mundus deo quia ex operibus legis non iuſtificabitur omnis caro coram illo accipientes quippe mandatum ſentientes defectum clamabimus coelū miſerebitur noſtri deus ſciemus illa die quâ non ex operibus iuſtitiae quae fecimus no ſed ſecundū ſuā miſericordiā ſaluos no fecit bernar ſuper cant ſer 50 p 931 man ſaith bernard fulfill law god life preuenting obiection aduerſaries ordinarily vſe doth god command thing impoſsible granteth yet ſo god thereby doth make man tranſgreſſor humbleth intent man perceiuing owne defect might renouncing righteouſneſſe work flie vnto god mercie grace indeed law called impoſsible man à quo original ſinne came adam created perfection might haue poſſe non peccare reſpect man quo rebellious corruption doth dwell vntil diuorced death whereby hath one degree non poſſe non peccare vntill come vnto region liuing non poſſe peccare impoſsibility ſinning 8 forbeare accumulation teſtimonies theſe alreadie mentioned plainly ſhew farre true ancient catholickes differ newly pretended difference language ierome cannot pleaſe god life auguſtines cannot loue according preſcript law ambroſe impoſsible perfect bernard impoſsible fulfill law compared aboueſpecified romiſh article viz iuſt man may abſolutely fulfill law god heare furthermore proteſtants doctrine ratified ſome romaniſts sect 3 9 doctor stapleton although ſweate defending poſſibilitie keeping law yet though breath failed heare panting haec tamen impletio legis non intelligitur neceſſariò praeciſè omnibus mandatis legis toto tempore curſu iuſtitiae humanae ſed ille cenſetur implere legem ſatisfacere legi conſpectu dei iuſtus habetur qui voluntatem affectum habens implendi vniuerſa legis eatenus implet quatenus humana fragilitas reliqu j naturae corruptae per gratiam implere hac vita vel poteſt vel ſolet haec propoſitio manifeſtè confirmatur per celeberr illam eccleſiae doctrinam contra pelagianos olim definitam neminem etiam iuſtorum hac vita ſine peccato viuere stapleton de iuſtific lib 6 de perfect iuſtit c 3 initio yet fulfilling law ſaith vnderstood neceſſarily preciſely commandements law whole courſe man iuſtice may ſaid ſatisfie law iust ſight god hath affection fulfill commandements ſo farre infirmitie nature ſtrengthned grace permit end yeeldeth vnto doctrine church long ſince eſtabliſhed againſt pelagians teacheth man liueth without ſinne doctor preciſely fulfilling law god cannot fight againſt generall poſition abſolutely fulfilling law god 10 ferus frier order minorites commended senenſis see catalogue author booke tit ioh ferus man notably skilfull holy ſcriptures moſt ſingular preacher time germany writing many godly learned bookes accord catholicke doctrine diligently read almoſt preacher author cannot proue honourable witneſſe ſhall auerre comment vpon act printed paris anno 1568 cum priuilegio calleth morall law god importable burthen firſt becauſe cōmandeth onely hand action alſo heart affection ſecondly becauſe conuinceth v ſinne ſeeing againſt law according law good imperfectly performed confeſſed onely imperfectly done call veniall alſo working againſt law cannot agree abſolute fulfilling law 11 albertus pighius doctor ſelected albertus pigghius—è louanienſi doctor theologus colomae voijs renunciatus varia aduerſus lutherum melancthonem bucerum caluinum conſcripſit poſſeuinus ieſ apparat sac tom 1 tit albertus pigghius confute luther melancthon b tertia ratio quòd lex eſt iugum importabile neque enim no neque patres noſtri potuimus portare illud ex impoſſibile onus eſt quia non tantùm exigit manum ſed cor ſecundò quia conuincit no peccatores eſſe ſemper enim plus contrà legem quàm pro lege facimus ea quae facimus imperfectè quidem facimus ioh ferus com act 15 fol 164 b bucer caluine could paſſe among romaniſts ſingular catholike time yet proſecuting argument large doth reſolue thus duplex conſiderari poteſt iuſtitia ſicut du plex inuenitur regula cui conformari debeant altera quâ iuſti ſunt coram hominibus altera eſt iuſtitia quâ iuſti ſunt coram deo—quod tamen trifariam ferè intelligere poſſumus vel quòd noſtra iuſtitia cum diuina conferatur velut contentionem reuocetur iuſtitia—hoc ſanè pacto conſpectu deiſolus inuentus eſt iuſtus agnus ille ſine macula de quo apoc paulò poſt—vel intelligitur homo iuſtificari coram deo hoc eſt coram tribunali diuini iudicij dum regulae diuinae iuſtitiae quâ parte ipſum reſpicit exactè reſpondet regulam autem illam diuinam eſſe legem indubitatum eſt porrò illam dupliciter intelligere poſſumus vel ſua illa abſoluta perfectione ſecundùm quam hoc mortis corpus adhuc circumferentibus nobis velut ſcopus quidam quem collimare perpetuò debeamus ad quem ſemper conari no exercere q • accedamus viciniùs magi proponitur quàm ſub obligatione e • igitur—ipſe onim nouit figmentum noſtrum nec ignorat quoniam puluis ſumus proinde noſtrae fragilitati prorſus impoſſibilia à nobis non exigit pi • pater eſt miſerico • dominus non immitis ac rigidus exactor corū quae vires noſtras quas ab ipſo accepimus planè ſuperant vel prout illa ipſa diuinae iuſtitiae lex regula no reſpiciens noſtrae infirmitati aptata condeſcendit conuenit—primo modo conſpectu dei non iuſtificatur omnis viuens mortale adhuc corpus quod aggrauat animam circumferens • ò iuſtitiae noſtrae hoc pacto iniquitates inuenientur velut pannus menſtruatae omnes plurimumue deficere ab exacta illa abſoluta iuſtitia et paulò poſt—sed ſecundo modo ſi regulam illam diuinae iuſtitiae etiam quatenus noſtrae infirmitati attemperata eſt intelligas ex voluntatis humanae inconſtantia inclinatione quadam ad carnis ſui hoſpitis amica— quae ab illa lege diuinae iuſtitiae no deflectere—nunquam ceſſat adhuc inuenire non eſt iuſtum quenquam coram deo inter adae filios ſed verum reperietur etiam de hac ipſa quamuis imperfecta iuſtitia quòd non iuſtificabitur conſpectu dei omni • viuens ſiquidem iuſtitia haec eſt ad ſuam regulam etiam noſtrae infirmitati attemperatam exacta correſpondentia commenſuratio actionibus noſtris omnibus poſteà etiam—itaque cum ſuam nemo mortalium proferre poſſit iuſtitiam quâ rectitudini diuinae legis exactè reſpondeat ſed iniuſtitiae potius ab ea conuincatur proinde maledicto atque irae diuinae cui ſubiecti ſunt legis tranſgreſſores inueniatur obnoxius auerſatur enim ille omnem iniuſtitiam—et paulò poſt quidigitur hoc nempe quod auguſtinus vt liberâ ita veriſſimá voce pronunciat vae inquit hominum vitae quantumcunque laudabili ſi remotâ miſericordiâ iudicetur nam cùm nemo ſit quem ſi ad regulam diuinae iuſtitiae exigas etiam illam quam diximus imperfectiorem noſtrae fragilitati attemperatam ad quam exigimur merito non iniquus iniuſtus comprobetur nemo ſit cui ſua conſtet iuſtitia nemo qui non iniuſtitiae conuincatur quamuis iuſtiſſimus inter homines iniuſtitiae verò iuſta ſit merces exterminiū ſit mors ſtipendium actum ſanè de nobis omnibus fuerat niſi diūina nobis miſericordia ſuccurreret ignoſcens quotidiè quod ex parte noſtra minus eſt paulò poſt—nam quòd non operibus noſtris non iuſtitia noſtra ſed vna ignoſcente iniquitates noſtras miſericordia beneuolentiae e • ga no diuinae ſalutis à deo aſſequendae nobis ſpes ſit dauidis teſtimonio apoſtolus ad rom comprobans non aliâ iuſtitiâ niti no poſſe ni • quam imputat nobis abſque noſtris operibus affirmat beati inquit c pigghius de fide iuſtif controu 2 pag 45 46 47 double iuſtice one men deale vprightly men another god may conſidered either making compariſon god himſelfe reſpect angel vncleane ſo chriſt onely iuſt one elſe comparing life iuſtice god law vnto man law rule iuſtice againe law may vnderſtood either full perfection propounded vnto man ſcope ſtil aime rather bond obligation exacting anſwerable obedience becauſe god knowing infirmitie doth exact v impoſsible gracious father rigid exactor thoſe thing indeed exceed ſtrength 12 secondly ſaith ſame law may conſidered applied modified reſpect vnto infirmity determineth queſtion firſt reſpect law requireth perfection fleſh iuſtified man righteouſneſſe better menſtruous cloath ſecond conſideration law • tempered qualified vnto man infirmitie imperfect obedience yet man iustifiable god hereby briefe mortall man ſhew iuſtice anſwerable meaning • ither reſpect vnto direction god law ſtandeth conuicted iniustice thereby vnder god malediction due vnto ſinne periſheth except god mercie grant daily pardon offence witneſſe concludeth v whether law god taken rigour temper yet man fulfiller law therefore hope ſaued muſt according pigghius concluſion renounce iuſtification owne righteouſneſſe flie vnto iuſtification faith righteouſneſſe chriſt ieſus impu • ed vnto v 13 thus one greateſt aduerſaries proteſtants become one greateſt aduocates deſending iuſtification faith onely greateſt article religion proteſtants hath bene confirmed conſent diuerſe romaniſts notwithſtanding flatly contradict poſition abſolute fulfilling law yet leſt may thought haue ſome euaſion diſtinction ſinne referre reader vnto ample see hereafter cap 22 sect 4 confutation hereof preſent wiſh content ſee obiected place againſt proteſtants ſatisfied aduerſaries intangled sect 4 14 article impoſsibilitie keeping god command according difference conſtruction damnably blaſphemous infallibly true ſtate man threefold one firſt creation ſay impoſsible man haue kept commandement blaſphemie manichee ſecond fall bondage ſinne denie impoſsible man without grace keepe commandement blaſphemie pelagians third ſtation ſtate grace wherein man keeping commandement hath double aſpect firſt looketh vpon right ſide god mercy according fatherly acceptance chriſt vouchſafeth imperfect obedience child ſtill contend vnto perfection call keeping god commandement impoſsible father proteſtants iudge hereticall opinion secondly beholdeth god leſt ſide cying onely ſtrictneſſe iuſtice according exact rigour law beleeue man poſsibly keepe law ſo exactly pelagian hereſie condemned father 15 saint qua ratione poteſt eſſe quod vel • cum apoſtolus aſſerat ſe quod cupiat implere non poſſe cúmque ab eis quae • imu qui ſint illi quos ab • que peccato putent noua ſtropha eludere veritatem ſe nō co dicere qui ſint vel fuerint ſed qui eſſe poſſint egregij doctores dicunt eſſe poſſe quod nunquam fuiſſe demonſtrant hieron tom 2 aduerſus pelag ad c • eſiphon pag 251 obſerue although pelagians defended perfection naturall faculty yet hierome ſpeake perfection generall generall doth imply ſtate corrupted reſtored plaine inſtances vſed hierome sin difficilia cur auſus e facilia dicere quae nullus impleuerit non intelligis tuas inter ſe repugnare ſententias—zacharias tale iuſtificantur non quòd omni vitio careant ſed quòd maiore pa • te virtutum commendentur hieron ibid hierome argue • facilia ſo may poſſibilia ierome requireth profeſſed ſuch perfection obedience inſtance one man euer kept commandements anſwered although none keepe law yet might holdeth anſwer ridiculous ſhould ſay ſaith may done cannot ſhew euer done many romaniſts guiltie thi • hereſie kind owne biſhop complained sunt enim hodi • qui ſtatus homines perfectione iuſtitiae tantùm non aequent angelis nouae ſcilicet veteris eo immunde spiritus catechiſmus autem exorciſmus neophytorum ſunt praecedunt enim baptiſmum magi debent dici sacramentalia quàm sacramenta ad ſacramentum baptiſmi pertinentia vel praeludia noui baptiſmi ſine eis tamen poteſt eſſe baptiſmus durandus lib 6 rational cap 82 pag 687 num 8 exorciſme sacramentall adiunct sacrament baptiſme perfect without 2 hereſie iulianus pelagianiſt auguſtine whoſoeuer ſhall ceremony ſuch indifferencie exufflation wholy condemne heretikes either vſe diſuſe thereof ſuch one ſay meritò eſt exufflandus chap xiiii continuance viſible church romish apologie laſtly omit ſundrie deniall church continuing viſible condemned aug epiſt 170 ad seuerinum ſaith facile tibi eſt attendere videre ciuitatem ſupra montem conſtitutam de qua dominus ait euangelio quod abſcondi non poſſit ipſa eſt enim eccleſia catholica vnde catholice graece appellatur quod per totum orbem terrarum diffunditur hanc ignorare nulli licet ideo ſecundúm verbum domini abſcondi non poteſt vide aug de vnit eccleſ c 12 13 ep 48 ad vincentium rogatianum donatiſts hie • onymi dial aduerſus luciferianos paulo poſt medium cap 6 proſecuteth point large ſaying among much matter vbi ſunt iſ •• nimium prophani qui pluris ſynagogas aſſerunt quam eccleſias c ſi eccleſiam non habet chriſtus • ſi sardinia tantum habet nimium pauper factus eſt c anſwereth obiection ſaying quod ſi de illa quae euangelio ſcripta eſt ſententia ſibi blandiuntur putas ne cum venerit filius hominis inu ••• iet fidem ſuper terram ſciant illam ſidem nominari de qua dominus aiebat fides tua te ſaluum fecit luciferians done ſundrie writer liued next foreſaid 160 yeares queſtion protestant appeale firſt ſhewing doctrine donatiſts sect 1 truly haue aduerſaries obſerued auguſtine doctrine donatiſts conſiſted three point firſt perſons see bellarm▪ confeſſing section following thought church conſiſt iuſt men secōdly place si autem vniuerſos donatiſtas non audiuimus ſe pro eccleſia chriſti ſupponentes quia nullum pro ſe de diuinis libris teſtimonium proferunt quo id doceant quanto minus go te rogatiſtas audire debemus qui nec illud pro ſe interpretari conabuntur quod ſcriptum eſt vbi paſcis vbi cuba meridie cant 17 si enim hoc loco scripturarum meridies africa intelligenda eſt parte donati quae ſub coeli feruentiori plaga eſt omnes vos maximianiſtae ſuperabunt quorum ſchiſma bizantio tripoli exarſit sed confligant cum eis arzuges hoc magi ad ſe pertinere contendant mauritania tamen caeſarienſis occidentali quàm meridianae patti vicinior quando nec africam ſe vult dici quomodo de meridie gloriabitur non dico aduerſus orbem terrarum ſed aduerſus ipſam partem donati vnde par rogati breuiſl fruſtum de fruſto maiore praeciſum eſt quis autem non impudentiſſimè n • tatur aliquid allegoria poſitum pro ſe interpretari niſi habeat manifeſta teſtimonia quotum lumine illuſtrentur obſcura iuſtus calumus aliâs barontus de vnit rom eccleſ pag 116 117 ex epiſt 48 auguſtini onely profeſſed south africke among thēſelues auguſtine learnedly confute donatian hereſie ſee vnfolded diuerſe traducement vſed romaniſts againſt proteſtants bring guilt donatiſme sect 2 2 many romiſh aduerſaries looke vpon doctrine proteſtants ſome ſiniſterly others ſome ſuppoſing proteſtants teach abſolute apoſtaſie vniuerſall church chriſt haue bent force confute cardinall teſlifieth ſolis iuſtis conſtare volebant atque inde • ducebāt eccleſiam viſiſibilem perijſle de toto orbe terrarum ſola africa remanſiſſe vt auguſt docet lib de vnit eccleſ c 12—eand • eſſe doctrinam vitam caluiniſtarum certum eſt nam eccleſiam ex ſolis bonis conſtare docet caluinus lib 4 inſt c 1 § 7 quod etiam docet articulus 7 confeſſionis auguſtanae eccleſiam viſibilem à multis ſeculis perijſle nunc ſolùm inſeptentrionalibus eſſe vbi ipſi ſunt docent omnes praecipuè caluinus l 4 inſt c 2 § 2 bellar l 4 de notis eccleſ cap 9 § donatiſtae donatiſts ſaith taught church conſiſteth onely godly men thereupon gathered periſhed face earth remaining onely among themſelues africke caluine teacheth church conſisteth onely good men 4 caluine let v heare càluine ſpeake volume ſame booke fuerunt enim ſemper qui falſa abſolutae ſanctimoniae perſuaſione imbuti tanquam acrij quidam daemones iam facti eſſent omnium hominum conſortium aſpernarentur quibus humanum adhuc aliquid ſubeſſe cernerent tale enim erant cathari qui ad corum veſaniam accedebant donatiſtae certaine aërit diuels ſaith ſuch cathari donatiſts vpon preſumption owne ſanctitie ſeparate themſelues others little peccant illi—quia enim non putant eſſe eccleſiam vbi non eſt ſolida vitae puritas intcgritas ſcelcrum odio à legitima eccleſia diſcedunt dum à factione improborum declinare ſe putant allegant c caluinus inſtitut lib 4 cap 1 § 13 refelleth ground hereſie thinke chriſtian may continue church wherein integritie profeſſors ſame truth ſentence alledged againſt emmuerò de eccleſia viſibili quae ſub cognitionem noſtrā cadit quale iudicium facere conueniat ex ſuperioribus liquere iam exiſtimo diximus enim bifariam de eccleſia ſacras literas loqui interdum cùm eccleſiam nominant eam intelligunt quae vera eſtc orā deo quam nulli recipiuntu • niſi qui adoptionis gratiâ filij dei ſunt ſpiritus ſanctificatione vera chriſti membra tunc quidem non • antùm ſanctos qui terra habitant comprehendit ſed electos omnes qui ab origine mundi ſuerunt saep • autem ecclcſiae nomine vniuerlam hominum multitudinem • diſtuſam deſignat quae vnum ſe deum chriſtum colere profitctut baptiſmo initiatur eius ſidem coenae participatione vnitatem vera doctrina charitate teſtatur conſenſionem habet verbo domini atque ad eius praedicationem miniſterium conteruat à chriſto inſtitutum—quemadmodum ergo nobis inuiſibilem ſol • u dei oculis conſpicuam eccleſiam credere neceſſe eſt ita hanc quae reſpectu hominum eccleſia dicitur obſeruare • iuſue commumonem colere iubemur caluin lib 4 inſtit cap 1 § 7 diſtinguiſheth betweene church viſible inuiſible inuiſible haue conſiſt onely holy elect one accordeth article creed beleeuing holy catholike church viſible ſaith conſpicuous multitude participating ſame sacrament c among see calcuin ibid § 9 confeſſeth hypocrite wicked men although true member yet outward profeſſors ſame faith finally hath already condemned phrenſy donatiſts ſeparating thēſelues viſible church becauſe cōmixture tare wheat hereſie donatiſts acknowledging viſible church wherein outwardly holy iuſt neuer greater aduerſarie among father auguſtine ſo auguſtine euer zealous follower herein caluine third traducement sect 4 5 third place cardinall ſteppeth forth challengeth caluine auguſtane confeſſors donatiſme bellarmine see aboue sect 3 b teach ſaith church hath periſhed many age paſſed reſident onely thoſe northerne part inhabite iuſtice commandeth heare accuſed party ſpeake themſelues itaque quae ſit eccleſia qualis ſit vbi ſit haec deſcriptio indicat ſumpta ex manifeſtis ethnica idololatrica manifeſtum eſt defenſores corum non eſſe membra eccleſiae ſed dominari ſi • nt phariſaei sadducae dominabantur interea tamen ſuerunt ſunt erunt eccleſia dei homine retinentes fundamentum • tiamſi alij plus alij minuslucis habucrunt habent habebunt et interdum sanct • ctiam ſtipulas ext •• unt ſupra fundamentum c • im praeſertim hac temporum miſeria multis qui habent initia ſidcj non concedatur vt crudiri cum doctoribus colloqui poſſiot hi ſunt tamen eorum numero quibus iubet deus parci ezech 9 qui gemunt dolent proptereà quòd error • stabiliuntur eadem confeſſ ibid pag 136 § item diximus • tem deſcriptione eccleſiae multos hac viſibili eccleſia eſſe n • n ſanctos qui tamen externa profeſſione veram doctrinam amplectuntur quia donatiſtas improbamus qui ſixcrunt miniſterium corum qui non ſunt ſancti non eſſe efficax confeſſ auguſt ibid p 138 § diximus impreſſa arge itorati anno 1565 auguſtane confeſſors confeſſe firſt catholike church tied vnto goſpell secondly romiſh church chiefe biſhops paſtors idolatrous member church yet ſome profeſſors builded vpon true foundation ſau • thirdly euerie viſible church wicked profeſſors mixed godly fourthly donatiſts worthily condemned reiecling miniſterie men vngodly doctrine caluine likewiſe condemned furthermore taxeth romaniſts playing donatiſts challenging themſelues prerogatiue truth tying god church truth magnificé illi quidem ſuam nobis eccleſiam commendant nequa alia mundo eſſe videatut poſteà quaſi confecta omnes ſchiſmaticos eſſc conſtituunt qui ab cius quam pingunt eccleſiae obedientia ſubducere ſe omn shaereticos qui contra eius doctrinam mutire audent et paulò poſt si templum illud quod videb • tur per • ctuae dei habitationi conlcciatum derelinqui à deo prophaneſcere potuit non eſt quod nobis iſti ſingant deum ita perſonis au • • ocis alligatum affixum externis obſeruationibus vt manere apud co oporteat qui titulum modò ſpeciem eccleſiae habent caluinus inſtitut donatiſts held church viſible itremoueable africke proteſtants confute donatiſts taught church ſo properly peculiarly tyed vnto one place th • cannot poſſibly elſewhere true church protestant condemne hold church member may poſſeſſe whole world ſome without liuing corrupt church erre obſtinately may poſſibly ſaued yet cardinall preſume aſſociate donatist protestant ioyne polearticke antarticke together ſee peruerting good meaning haue turned wine water reſerued worſt vnto laſt 7 yet one ſcruple would remoued wit whether catholike viſible church may ſometimes drawne certaine part world muſt neceſſarily poſſeſſe alwaies coaſts thereof ieſuite coſter ſaith may thinke non enim ex co dicitur eccleſia catholica quòd eodem tempore totius orbis ditiones occupet hoc quippè ne hūc vſque diem fortaſſis contingit quando antarcticis hominibus qui extremas remotiſſimaſue americae oras incolunt ſides chriſti nunquā innotuit ſed potiſſimùm duabus de cauſis tum quia nulli nationi vt olim lex moyſi iudaeis ſit alligata nulloue loco concluſa ſicut donatiſtarum lutheranorū errores quorum hi extra germaniā nu • quā cele brantur nec illi extra africā reperiebantur coſter ieſ euchir tract
