thought good omit cannot perſwaded fauor proteſtants wil ſurceaſe preſſe ſting ſundrie true accuſations ſuch haue alreadie ſo greatly iniuried ſo ſundry falſe one omit deſire see aboue often auoid tediouſneſſe multiplicitie repetition haue bene ſtill continue ſo ſuperſtitiouſly ſuperfluous rather attribute vnto art rhetoricke whereby ſeeme paſſe ouer like error euidently proued others themſelues therefore omit becauſe cannot proue 2 therefore haue recalled parentheſis omit c backe againe becauſe engendreth blacke ſuſpition ſundrie hereſies might haue alledged cardinall bellarmine borrowed almoſt former exception haue ſpared relate large pleaſe apologiſts ſtand aſide litle giue place vnto fellowes ſuffer proſecute ſuch accuſations themſelues haue ſo artificially omitted firſt accuſation queſtion ſola fides example three kind ancient heretikes simonians eunomians nameleſſe third ancient romish accvsers firſt simoniani docebant ſaluari homines ſecundùm gratiā simonis quem deum faciebant non ſecundùm opera iuſtas inquit irenaeus lib 1 cap 20 simonian hereticks thought might ſaued grace simon magus without exerciſing good work secondly eunomiani ſimiliter docebant non poſſe homini vlla peccata nocere modò fidem habeat vt auguſtinus teſtatur lib de haereſ c 54 haec eadem eſt ſententia omnium sectariorum huius temporis dum dicunt opera bona eſſe neceſſaria tanquam effectus fidei tamen adhuc haerent codem errore nam etiam poſit • iſtâ neceſſitate docent opera non mereri vllo modo vitam aeternam etiamſi deus earequirat tanquam teſtimonia fidei haec autem erat impijſſima haereſis simonis qui dicebat hominem ſaluari per gratiam non per opera iuſtas bellar l 4 de eccleſ c 9 § simoniani annon hîc reuiuiſcere videtur luthero simonis haereſis hae • lindanus great vehement aduerſarie stapleton double difference acception word faith adiunct onely fidei nomine doctrinam fidei funomius intellexit lutherus verò ſpecialem fidem ſeu fiduciam vt poſtcá explicabitur deinde quia opera vniuerſum reieciſſe videtur lutherus verò non vult fidem ſuam eſſe ocioſam ſed hominem chriſtianum etſi omnibus legibus ſolutum tamen liberè omnia facere omnibus eſſe ſubiectum affinis quoque huic luther anae doctrinae erat illa vetuſtiſſ simonis magi haereſis qui ſuos docuit nec prophetas attendere nec legis mina pertimeſcere ſed tanquam liberos facere quae voluerunt non enim per bonas actiones ſed per gratiam co ſalutem conſequtituros vt con mem theodor hae • ct fab lib 1—quanquam ſanè hac haereſi duplex illa differentia ſupradicta locum fortaſſis grace may abound poyſonfull faith conceiueth purpoſe continuance ſinne thrice damned proteſtants teach ſuch faith yea vtterly condemne excuſable accuſers proue accuſation yea alſo diſproue acknowledge concerning proteſtants profeſſe onely ſuch iuſtifying faith denique omnes ad vnum proteſtantes docent fidem quae iuſtificat eſſe viuam operantem fidem per charitatem aliaue bona opera non ſom mamus ait caluinus ſidem bonis operibus vacuam aut iuſtificationem quae ſine ijs conſtet inſtit l 3 c 16 § 1 stapleton l 9 de certitud grat c 7 pag 335 liuing working loue although act iohannes caluinus antidoto conc ad 11 seſſ 6 sola inquit fides eſt quae iuſtificat fides tamen quae iuſtificat non ſola eſt ſicut calor solis ſolus eſt qui terrā calefacit ipſe tamē calor non eſt ſolus sole ſed cum ſplendore idem docent philippus tum locis tum apologia confeſſ brentius catechiſ kemnitius exam conc alij bellar l 1 de iuſtif c 14 § ioh • nn • aduerſarij eligunt illud ſecundum earitatem viz ideo inſeparabilem eſſe à fide quòd neceſſariò ſequitur fidem ſ • exemplis perſuadere nituntur quod ſolidis rationibus probate non poſlunt lutherus enim praeſ ep ad rom dicit fidem ſimilem eſſe igni qui ſi non luceat ardeat non eſt ignis ita fidem rem eſſe viuam actuoſam efficacem quae ſemper neceſſariò operatur idem ibid c 15 § aduerſarij iuſtifieth alone yet alone heate sunne alone warmeth earth ſeuered light caluinus l 3 inſt c 2 § 9 comparat fidem charitatem cum chriſto spiritu ſancto nam quomodo fieri nequit vt chriſtus ſeparetur à spiritu ſancto ita fieri non poſſe dicit vt fides ſeparetur â dilectione quoniam fides intuetur recipit chriſtum ſed cùm ſpiritu iuſtificationis dilectionis idem ibid § calumus chriſt diſioyned ſpirit lutherus ait ſe ſcire fidem ſine ſpe dilectione non exiſtere nec vnquam eſſe ſolam vult fidem ſolam tanquam manum admoueri ad promiſſiones accipiendas sanderus de iuſtif lib 4 cap 4 pag 469 hand alone apprehendeth thing ſeparated bodie ſo faith onely facultie ſoule taking hold promiſe god chriſt cannot diuorced loue haec ſimilia teſtimonia mani • eſtè ſignificant requiri aliquid nobis vt iuſtificemur neque aduerſarij hoc negare poſſunt qui tametſi dicant remiſſionem non pendere à conditione operum neque poenitentiam aut fidem aut vllum actum noſtrum eſſe cauſam aut meritum iuſtificationis tamen non negant requiri ſidem poenitentiam fidem viuam poenitentiam ſeriam ſine neminem iuſtificari bellar l 3 de iuſtif c 6 § haec require confeſſed liuing faith ſerious repentance without man iustified romiſh accuſers oppugning profeſſed chap xvii ſecond third romiſh accuſations concerning author ſinne one florini romish accvsers florini haereſis fuit deum eſſe cauſam pec catorum—eandem ſine vllo pudore docet caluinus inſt l 1 c 18 c 2 non ſolùm permiſſu inquit ſed etiam voluntate dei homines peccant ita vt nihil ipſi deliberando agitent niſi quod deu • apud ſe decreuerit arcanâ directione conſtituit et l 3 c 23 § 24 bellar l 4 • notis eccleſ c 9 § deinde eandem reſtaurârunt caluiniani lutherani feuardent com iac 1 campian ieſ rat 8 pag 59 coccius theſaur cath tom 1 lib 8 art 3 hereſie florini make god cauſe ſinne doctrine proteſtants teaching god onely permit ſinne ongenis haereſis fuit perdidiſſe adamum imaginem dei ad quam creatus fuerat teſtis eſt epiphanius haereſ 64 idem docet caluinus lib 2 inſtit cap 1 § 5 per peccatum inquit primo hominis obliterata eſt coeleſtis imago bellar de notis eccleſ c 9 § origenis de homine quid imago dei penitus homine deleta eſt nullâ boni ſcintillà ſuperſtite campianus ieſ rat 8 pag 59 origen taught man loſt image god wherein created hereſie caluine taught ſaying image god blotted man ſinne protestant appeale testimony romiſh aduerſaries sect 1 saint auguſtine hath ſet downe expreſſe hereſie florini dicebant deum creâſſe mala contra quod ſcriptum eſt fecit deus omnia ecce valdè bona aug de hareſ tom 6 hareſ 66 florini ſaid ſaith god created euill contrary vnto scripture written god ſaw made behold good euer proteſtant deliuer ſuch blaſphemie ſo much dreame 2 maſter caluine moſt impugned point teacheth reader auoid iniquitie thoſe men iacobus peccatorum authorem meritò deum eſſe negat admonitio neceſſaria ne no deum loco noſtro ſubſtituamus acſi no ipſe ad peccandum impelleret summa eſt fruſtra tergiuerſari homines qui vitiorum ſuorum culpam reijciunt deū quia non ex alio fonte proueniunt mala quàm ex mala cuinſque cordis concupiſcentia caluinus comm iac 1 deus tentat neminem iac 1 loq • itur de internis tentationibus quae nihil aliud ſunt quàm inordinati appetitus illorum authorem meritò deum eſſe negat quoniam ex carnis noſtrae corruptione manant idem com iac 1 13 make god cauſe ſinnes ſeeing iames teacheth fountaine ſinne man except euill concupiſcence owne heart obdurare corda multi ad permiſſionem reijciunt caluinus loco citato opinion induration heart vngodly permiſsion god iuſt power prouidence see aboue lib 3 cap 6 hath bene iuſtified iudgement auguſtine teſtimonies owne ieſuits pererius suarez neither doctrine eternall decree ſuch iuſtly preiudice god iuſtice concluſion whereof sed no qui nouimus cunctos homines tot nominibus dei tribunali obnoxios vt de mille interrogati ne vno quidem ſatisfacere poſſint confitemur nihil pati reprobos quod non iuſtiſſimo dei iudicio conueniat caluinus inſtit l 3 c 24 § 14 confeſſe reprobate ſuffer nothing agreeable conſonant vnto iuſt iudgement god might manifeſted section would admit large diſpute ſufficient preſent diſcharge know theſe moſt fierce oppoſite accuſers could produce one proteſtant abhorre impute cauſe ſinne vnto god vnto whoſe iudgement referre accuſation author thereof adioyne anſwer vnto third accuſation iuſtifying origen teſtimonies romaniſts sect 2 3 ſaying origen altogether ſo hereticall owne alphonſus reconcile catholicke truth imprimis illud mihi dubiū eſt origenes ſenſerit hominē per peceatum aliquid de ſua ſubſtantia perdidiſſe ſolùm qualitates animae aliquas vel vt ſub al • verbis dicam imaginem perdiderit ſolam ſimilitudiuem nam victorinus afer—ait aliud igitur eſt juxta imaginem eſſe quod quidem ſubſtantia eſt aliud autem iuxta ſimilitudinem eſſe quod non eſt ſubſtantia ſed ſubſtantia nomen qualitatis declaratiuū alphonſus de caſtro cont haereſ lib 2 tit adam pag 43 si ergo origenes dicat adam poſt peccatum perdidiſſe dei imaginem accepto imaginis nomine iuxta • quam praediximus ſignificationem vt imago natura conſiſtat manifeſtus eſt error iuſteue eum ob hanc cauſam accuſat • piphanius ibidem quodſi fort ita origenes cepit imaginis nomen vt imaginem pro ſimilitudine vſurpauerit quis non videt ibi nullam eſſe haereſis ſuſpicionem idem quo ſupra pag 45 image ſaith may taken either eſſentiall propertie ſome qualitie firſt acception word image doctrine origen manifeſtly erroneous ſecond ſence free ſuſpition hereſie origen might poſſibly haue orthodoxall meaning ieſuite vaſquez doth reſolue directly leſt auguſtine might incurre ſame condemnation origen doth acquit diſtinguiſhing image god man verùm quia ex hoc loco auguſtini videtur ſaltem colligi aliquid illius imaginis amiſſum fuiſſe reſpondeo ſimilitudinem imaginem dei aliam eſſe naturaliter impreſſam intellectu nempe memoriam voluntatem huius nihil minui intrinſece ſed tantùm extrinſecè ideo nunquam omninò deleri quantumuis extrinſecè minuatur aliam verò eſſe ſimilitudinem imaginem dei homini per gratiam caritatem expreſſam enim qualitatibus ſimiles deo efficimur quia iuſti etiam apud ipſum conſtituimu • haec omninò amittitur per peccatum de hac intelligendi ſunt origenes auguſtinus lib illo 6 vaſquez ieſ tom 1 thom diſp 137 cap 4 pag 897 num 14 may ſignifie ſaith either naturall impreſsion god made intellectuall part man namely memorie cannot altogether extinguiſhed elſe ſome ſpirituall qualitie grace loue iuſtice whereby man hath likeneſſe god mage god man vtterly loſt ſinne according ſence ſaith expound auguſtine origen 4 beſides witneſſe ieſuite maldonate hath obſerued et ibi diſſipauit ſubſtantiam ſuam viuendo luxurioſè neque hic quae rendum eſſe puto quae ſit illa ſubſtantia quam iſte adoleſcens intemperanter viuendo diſſipauit eſt enim deſcriptio vt ſaepè diximus maximè perditi nepotis adoleſcentis qui nihil aliud quàm hominem ſignificat maxiniè peccatorem▪ solent plerique ſubſtantiam quam diſſipauit liberum arbitrium caeteraſue naturales ſacultates interpretari sic auguſt beda euthym bernardus ſerm▪ de diuerſ aſtect animae quod e • ſi • ano ab illis ſenſu dictum eſt nolim equidem dicere ne quis exiſtimet per peccatum perire liberum arbitrium quod noui dicunt haeretici auguſtine bede euthymius bernard ſay man ſinne loſt free naturall faculty ſpeeches granteth might ſpoken ſound iudgemēt vnto waſting image god anſwereth alij per eam ſubſtantiae partem quam accepit quamue diſſipauit imaginem ac ſimilitudinem dei ſignari putant ambroſ comment—quodſi imaginem dei non naturam ipſam ſed morum conformationem appellant quemadmodum multi veteres authores paulus appellare ſolet c 1 cor 15 maldonat ieſ com luc 15 13 pag 296 image meant nature ſelfe man conformitie vnto godlineſſe many ancient author amongſt nameth ambroſe vnderstood may allowed followeth iuſtification caluine teſtimonies romiſh aduerſaries sect 3 5 ſo exact diſcuſſing ſentences ſo many ſo anciēt father learned aduerſaries may vouchſafe caluine audience partie haue cited name anſwer long poſtqu • ergo co obliterata fuit coeleſtis imago • ſolus ſuſtinuit hanc poenam vt locum ſapientiae virtutis ſanctitatis veritatis iuſtitiae quibus ornamentis veſtitus fuerat teterrimae ſuccederent peſtes caecitas impotē tia impuritas vanitas iniuſtitia caluin inſt l 2 c 1 § • heauenly image god ſaith quite blotted place wiſedome vertue truth iuſtice ſuch like ornament ſucceeded blindneſſe impotencie iniuſtice vanitie thus ſee image god vnderſtandeth onely vertuous quality whileſt ſaith image god blotted elſewhere taking image god naturall eſſentiall property vno ergo verbo poenitentiam interpretor regenerationem cuius non eſt alius ſcopus niſi vt imago dei quae per adae tranſgreſſionem foedata tantùm non obliterata fuerat nobis reformetur caluini • inſt lib 3 cap 3 § 9 image god ſaith blemiſhed blotted extinguiſhed 6 marke origen ſpake doubtfully ieſuits acquit interpreting image meant eſſentiall propertie vertuous quality caluine ſpeaketh doubtfully expreſly interpreting himſelfe image god man meant onely vertuous quality remaineth cenſure condemned either muſt caluine iuſtified elſe ancient father ſuch auguſtine ambroſe bede euthymius bernard father together alphonſus vaſques maldonate romiſh doctor moderator cauſe muſt together caluine ioyntly condemned happie caluins caſe hath accuſers ſuch conſcience acquit miſerable thoſe accuſers whoſe accuſation thus inexcuſable chap xviii fourth fift accuſations firſt matter woman eccleſiaſticall function example peputian heretikes romish accvsers firſt peputiani haeretici vt • auguſt de haereſ c 27 tantum dant mulieribu • principatum vt sacerdotio quoque apud eos honorentur lutherus art 13 ex ijs quos leo 10 damnauit dicit sacramento poenitentiae aequè abſoluere poſſe mulierem vel puerum atque epiſcopum vel papam et iam ipſâ caluiniſtis anglia mulier quaedam eſt ſummus pontifex bellar lib 4 de notis eccleſ c 9 § 4 peputiani latter alſo ſlander sander de clauibus dauid lib 6 heretikes called peputians gaue vnto woman gouernment onely might honoured office prieſtdome ſuch like article luther taught woman boy might abſolue well biſhop pope himſelfe caluiniſts england vnlike among reigneth woman pope protestant appeale confeſsions aduerſaries sect 1 lvther meaning rightly conceiued owne biſhop roffenſis wit either man woman ſhall comfort penitēt ſoule word goſpel contrite party beleeueth findeth remiſſiō ſins huius aſſertionis lutherus ſumit anſam quòd ex proximè ſuperiori ſe collegiſſe putat totam vim delendae culpae non miniſtro ſed fide credentis ſitam eſſe non poteſtati miniſtrorum ſed fidei qua dei verbum credimus remiſſionis effectum eſſe tribuendum quamobrem iam adijcit quòd etiamſi mulier aut puer haec verba proferat peccator haec audiens credens protinùs abſolutus eſt roffenſis epiſc art 13 fol 134 power man woman vertue goſpell power god vnto ſaluation begetteth confuſion miniſtery ſhall happen man diſeaſe woman doth tell herbe ſhe hath foūd ſoueraigne remedy diſeaſe party doth vſe ſucceſſe ſhe thereby made phyſitian accordingly faithful deuout penitent word grace may receiue comfort hope remiſſion cuen mouth chriſtian notwithſtanding doth acknowledge profeſſed miniſter officiall abſoluer 2 ladyqueene elizabeth queene lady prieſtly function ſhe euer exerciſe onely ſhe commaunded tribe leui performe office faithfulneſſe according charge whereof ſhe giue account vnto god regall duty meerely eccleſiaſtical preaching word miniſtring sacrament ſhe abſolutely prieſt renowmed ſiſter queene mary romiſh alwaies honoured title catholike happie therefore memorie queene verie malignance rancorous ſlanderers doth daily make glorious see accuſation returned vpon romanists sect 2 3 theſe accuſers call woman miniſtery hereticall whēce againſt whōdo ſo bitterly inueigh firſt contend againſt proteſtants thēſelues condemned ſame ancient hereſie teſtimonie epiphanius tertullian permitting alſo commanding nouam enim baereſin caluinus excogitauit lib 4 inſt c 15 § 20 21 22 vbi docet nec extremum quidé neceſſitate licere baptizare ijs qui non ſunt ordinarij eccleſiae miniſtri ad hoc ipſum vocati ordinati bellar lib 1 de bapt c 7 initio quratò obijcit tertullianum epiphanium quorum ille lib de virgimbus velandis non permittitur inquit mulier eccleſia loqui▪ ſed nec docere nec tingere nec offerre c bellar ibid § quartò obijcit woman baptize secondly theſe excuſe ſaying mulieres apud no baptizate caſu neceſſitatis ex permiſſione non ex officio bellar l 1 de sacram ingenere cap 25 § alterum done office caſe neceſsitie whereas two eccleſiaſtical keyes church one apud omnes illud ratum indubitatum habetur ex ipſo iure diuino foeminam clauis ordinis eſſe prorſus incapacem claui iuriſdict oni haeſitant stephanus daluin de abbat abbatiſſ cap 2 num 2 pag 5 order iuriſdiction theſe yeeld ergo ex iure huius capitis abbatiſſa iuriſdictionem eccleſiaſti • habere poteſt cui obedientiam reuerentiam exhiberi deſerri praecepit vnde meritò panormitanus notat ex citato textu quòd abbatiſſa eſt capax iuriſdictionis ſpiritualis quòd iuriſdictionem ipſam exercere poteſt ſuas moniales idem ibid cap 2 num 3 p 6 key eccleſiaſtical ſpiritual iuriſdic̄tiō vnto abbatiſſes womē ſay may ex erciſe ſame iuriſdic̄tion ouer nun owne couents clericos autem ſeculares non ſimplicitèr ſed de iure ſpeciali vt nimirum ſi habeat eccleſias aut capella ex priuilegio exemptionis apoſtol co vel praeſcriptione pleno iure ſubiectas ibid num 4 ſpiritual priuiledge frō pope ouer ſome clergy men alſo euen ſo farre excommunicatio ait non eſt actus clauis directè ſed magi exterioris iudicij—secundùm hoc à quibu • dam diſtinguitur quòd eſt clauis ordinis quam habent omnes sacerdotes clauis iuriſdictionis foro iudiciali quam habent ſoli iudices exterioris fori vtrumque chriſtus contulit petro proindè omnis habens iuriſdictionem eccleſiaſticam etſi non habeat clauem ordinis poteſt excommunicare ex diuo thomâ ibid cap 3 num 12 pag 15 16 ob praedicta ex thoma collecta concludit nauarrus foeminam ex priuilegio poſſe etiam excommunicate stephanus daluin ibid cap 3 num 13 pag 16 iudicially excōmunicate ſome party exterior court thirdly theſe accuſers frō rome ſomtime confeſſed ſome indeed muliet vocata lohannes octauus—duos annos rexit ſedem apoſtolicam—ſacros ordines contulit epiſcopos promouit miniſtrauit sacramenta eaetera pontificum rom munera exercuit c agrippa de vani • ſcient cap 62 de ſectis monaſt romaniſts ſeeke elude ſtory eſpecially cardinall bellarm oppoſe anſwer whittaker teſtimonies martinus polonus pope confeſſor beſides marianus scotus sigebert sabellicus antoninus chronica chronicorum matthaeus palmerius theodoricus niemus ſingular accuſers obiect vnto others error vpon due examination redoundeth vnto owne double ſhame miſconſtruction others owne tranſgreſſion followeth ſecond accuſation concerning ſinne regenerate per fidem▪ quod idem • oſteà docuerunt meſſaliam haeretici apud theod l 4 de haeret fab haec eſt ipſiſſima ſententia lutheri art 2 31 atque aſſertiombus corundem articulorum item philippi loc commumb meſſaliani verie doctrine luther caluine melancthon ivstification protestant euidence alledged author testimony romiſh aduerſaries sect 3 4 queſtion epiphanius whether concupiſcence ſinne abſolutely whether liue regenerate whether liue life 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 king long doth dominere ſaid mortified liue word word proculus proclus theſe peccatum nobis viuit againe ne haberet homo malum immortale peccatum praedominans apud epiphan haereſ 64 • thodius confuting ſaith proclus anſwer si talis eſt natura carnis vt legi dei ſubijci nequeat quomodo paulus hortatur non regnet peccatū c—non paret ſcortationi delicijs omne enim peccati ſtudium per carnem intelligit corpus conſummationem acquirit—lex ſpiritus vitae per chriſtum penitùs peccatum regnans carne vicit apud epiphan ibid methodius confutation plainly ſhew arguing thus nature fleſh cannot ſubiected vnto ſpirit doth apoſtle thus exhort 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 c let ſinne reigne mortall body bring forth luſts thereof againe ſpirit life chriſt hath altogether ouercome reigning ſinne know apoſtle haue ſinne king rom 6 reigne doth notwithſtanding acknowledge remaine rebell regenerate rom 7 23 cording rhemiſts tranſt 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 rebelling againſt law mind therefore may thinke accuſer hierome ſpeaketh oculus ſinè pupilla read hereſie proculus miſtooke ſtate queſtion 5 hereſie thus couet know firſt ſinne may ſaid reigne whether proteſtants hold hereticall opinion deſire better author guie v ſatisfaction profeſſed accuſer non regnet peccatum c rom 6 nomine peccati omnium conſenu concupiſcentia accipienda eſt quae quidem tum metaphoricè regna • e imperare dicitur▪ cum ardentiùs incitata conſenſum voluntatis extorouet bellar l 5 de amiſſ grat cap 3 § simlis tropus rom 6 non ergo regnet peccatum c itaque deponere peccatum eſt non acquieſcere concupiſcentijs eius non obedite illi ita enim illud vincimus indie minu •• nu ribera icſ com heb c 12 3 pag 603 sinne ſaith ſaid reigne draweth man conſent vnto euill proteſtants namely luther caluine melancthon obijciunt luther caluin melancthon alij rom 6 non regnet peccatum veſtro mortali corpore non ait apoſtolus non ſit peccatum veſtro mortall corpore ſed non regnet vt notauit etiam auguſtinus tract 41 loh igitur ſemper eſt nobis peccatum licet non ſemper regnet loquitur etiam apoſtolus de concupiſcentia vt pater ex ſeqq ad obediendum concupiſceutijs eius concupiſcentia igitur ſemper nobis ſemper peccatum eſt bellar l 5 de amiſſ grat c 10 § prima obiect ſaith apoſtle ſheweth concupiſcence ſinne regenerate yet reigneth thus proteſtants deliuered hereſie proclus next place proue concupiſcence ſinne regenerate sect 4 6 aduerſaries cannot offended heare concupiſcence doth liue regenerate call hereſie affirme concupiſcence ſinne perſons regenerate ſay hereſie either proclus haue heard meſſalians proclus dicunt maſſiliani baptiſma nihil iuuare eos qui ad eos acce dunt theodan place obiected proteſtants haue bene acknowledged con •• ſſe 〈◊〉 bapti • grace conferred • r radere peccato non tollere vnderſtood ſinne materially aduerſa • y leſſe heretiks haue granted concupiſcence materially taken ſtill ſinne regenerate ſinne meant guilt obligation deb • proteſtants maſſilianiſts grant imputed vnto regenerate meſſalians neither yet indeed hereſie either word ſence 1 firſt 7 apoſtle ſaid rom 6 let ſinne reigne mortall body see aboue letter ſinne ſaith cardinall bellarmine men vnderſtand concupiſcence auguſtine obſerueth see ibid letter e apoſtle exhort ſinne ſhould thē ſhould reigne againe ſame apoſtle ſaith heb 12 caſting ſin compaſſeth v c deponens circumſtans peccatum heb 12 hoc etiam non praetereundum non ſimpliciter dixit peccatum ſed cum articulo 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 quia concupi • c • ntiam carnis aduerſus ſpiritum intelligit quam cum articulo appellare peccatum ſolet rom 7 8 multis locis hoc ergo nunc dicere arbitror paulum quod alijs verbis dixit rom 6 non regnet c ribera ieſ comment heb 12 3 pag▪ 603 noted ſaith ieſuite ribera ſinne apoſtle vnderſtandeth concupiſcence calling ſo article 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſin note ſingularitie word hereticall apoſtolicall come ſence 8 sinne taken either materially formally romaniſts hold concupiſcence ſinne firſt meaning becauſe voluntarie proteſtants hold ſecond becauſe ſtill tranſgreſſion commandement thus proued firſt reaſon fatemur concupiſcentiam eſſe quandam iniquitatem obliquitatem non ſolùm contra dominatum nientis ſed etiam contra legem dei stapleton l 3 de iuſtificat cap 2 confeſſe ſaith stapleton concupiſcence kind iniquitie obliquitie onely againſt donanion mind alſo againſt law god well proper definition ſinne tranſgreſsion god law ſhal conceine ſia againe grant formally ſinne man vnregenerate becauſe commandement thou ſhalt luſt muſt ſinne regenerate becauſe commandement continueth ſame therefore cannot ethiope concupiſcence poſſibly change colour muſt formally ſinne ſinne euen vnregenerate man may ſometimes vnuoluntarie 9 secondly authoritie conferre ita concupiſcentia carnis aduerſus quam bonus concupiſcit ſpiritus peccatum eſt quia ineſt illi inobedi • ntia contra dominatum mentis quia reddita eſt meritis inobedientis cauſa poena peccati eſt defectione conſentientis vcl contagione naſc • ntis auguſt contra iulian pelag l 5 c 3 col 1066 auguſtine calleth ſinne becauſe rebelleth againſt dominion mind haue among aduerſaries cardinall caietane calling haec enim par appellatur peccatum multiplici ratione tum cauſaliter vel quia eſt cauſa peccati vel quia eſt effectus peccati primo parentis tum formaliter pro quanto eſt par peccati originalis caietan com rom 7 pag 40 formally ſinne ſtand vpon firſt motion concupiſcence viues noteth called tam penitiſſimè viſccribus noſtris haeret veneteae rei cupiditas tam ingenitus eſt à natura nobis ille appetitus quem ſubtiliſſimè magna illa artifex omnium antium pectorious indidit quo vel aliud agentes ſtirpem propagaremus vt ne cogitare quidem de explenda cupiditate illa poſſimus qum voluptate neſcio quâ occult â tangamur quam plerique nimium veniale peccatum eſſe volunt viues aug de ciuit dei l 1 c 9 p 20 iov veniall quae ab apoſtolo eum ſequuto auguſtino pecatum nonnunquam appellatur non modò quia peccato facta eſt ſed quòd ſomes ſit incentiuum peccati dominationi mentis reſiſtit si igitur peccati rationem vitio illo iniquitate languore infirmitate ac morbo conſtituas cui ſpiritu reſiſtendum ſit ne actus illicitus gignat non inepte peccatum dicitur certè inſign • quidam theologus apertè aſſerit etiam regeneratis manere peccatum tametſi non imputetur si • peccati rationem ipſa offenſa dei reatu cui ex aduerſo poena damnatio reſpondet ſitam intelligas certum eſt regeneratis non eſſe peccatum vtpote quibus facta eſt remiſſio peccatorum reatus omnis ſolutus caſſander conſult art 2 tit de concup •• c pag 4 caſſander doth endeuour determine point conſidering concupiſcence contradictorie vnto ſpirit mind thinketh auguſtine may call ſinne conſider reſpect offence god guilt ſubiect vnto damnation ſaith ſinne regenerate determination allow part 10 briefe▪ concluſion concupiſcence reſpect owne nature ſinne reſpect perſon partie regenerate guilt pardoned ſinne tenet proteſtants held ſome owne notable diuines ſaying eſt communis ſententia apud sectarios meaning proteſtants concupiſcentiam poſt iuſtificatiouem eſſe verè acpropriè peccatum quamuis credentibus non imputetur bellar l 5 de amiſſ grat c 5 initio concupiſcence remaineth ſinne regenerate although imputed vnto well hereſie proclus taught proteſtants hold proteſtants hold hereſie chap xix ſixt ſeuenth romiſh accuſations former hereſies sabellian trinitie romish accvsers sabellius docuit vnam tantùm eſſe perſonam deo nontres teſtis epiphanius haer 57 idem docuit noſtro tempore michael seru • tus lib 1 de trinit ſine vlhs ambagibus bellar de eccleſ c 9 § 7 sabellius sabellius taught one perſon god ſame doctrine seruetus protestant appeale iudgement romiſh aduerſaries sect 1 one 20 hereſies whereby accuſer would proue nameth calainiſts lutheran heretikes wherewith chargeth seruetus though could ſuſpect proteſtants guilty hereſie thē ſelues confeſſe ſaying cochlaeus diſcuſſione articuli primo auguſtanae confeſſionis namely trinitie palam ſcripſerit de hoc articulo inter no proteſtantes nulla eſt controuerſia neque confeſſione neque apologia proindè eo per oninia conſentimus teſte noſtro pelargo ieſuitiſ 2 loc de dco mitio pag 5 controuerſie betweene v proteſtants article trinitie hereſie seruetus might laid charge proteſtants aduerſarie ieſuite primus hac aetate • nium peſtilentiſſimus ſanctiſſimae trinitatis hoſtis fuit michael seru • tus qui vt hiſtoria noſtrorum temporum tradit caluino aemulo magiſtratum inſtigante geneuae ante annos 30 eſt combuſtus gregor de valent ieſ l 1 de vnit trin c 7 § primus valentia seru • tus hiſpanus geneua authore caluino dignum ſuo ſcelere ſupplicium pertulit nominatum cur enim eum tu facis potiùs noſtrum • quibus indicatus confutatus damnatus eſt quàm veſtrum à quibus nunquam dum v • xit vel verbo violatus eſt daniel chamierus epiſt ad ignat armandum ieſ veteris vt abraham sampſonem saram ſimiles vt auguſt teſtatu • l 22 contra fauſt duobus libris contra aduerſar legis proph idem caluinus dixit saram multis modis peccâſſe rebeccam varijs fraudibus vſam abraham idololatram fuiſſe sephoram ſtultam mulierem filium circumcidiſſe bellar de notis l 4 c 9 § manichaei praetereà manichaean accuſe father old teſtament caluine ſaid abraham bene idolater rebecca guilefull like protestant appeale teſtimonies romiſh aduerſaries sect 2 2 senenſis author venerable eſteeme among romaniſts relateth refuteth hereſie manichee auguſtine thus paulus quampl •• veteris inſtrument • di • ta factaue •• praeſc • tim illas hiſtori • quas man • chaei derident authoritate ſua confirmauit quanquam verò patriarcharum anſwering obiection manichee v • teri teſtamento grauia crimina conce dantur nō propterea scripturae minuitur authoritas imò nobis magi commendatur—vt fidem conſequamur quia—scriptura excipit nullius adulandam perſonam • uaedam vituperabilibus laudand • quaedam laudabilibus vituperanda non tacens senenſis bibl lib 8 pag 621 625 auguſtine manichee deriding scripture old teſtament therefore contumeliouſly inueigh againſt liues patriarch although grant ſaith patriarch grieuous offender liues yet ſo farre frō diſabling hiſtorie doth rather confirme truth thereof becauſe doth conceale either reprehenſible good men commendable wicked caluine doth ſcorne scripture old teſtament manichee profeſſedly manichaei reiecto veteri teſtamento legem prophetas ludibrio habentes deum crudelitatis nimij rigoris accuſabant c condemneth libertine caluin inſtruct aduerſ libertin ca 3 abhorreth manichee contempt scripture 3 true caluine noted vice old patriarch cenſure alſo true whether generall particular firſt generall auguſtine maketh matter commendation holy scripture auguſt c • ntra fauſt l 22 c 65 quaedam laudabilibus vituperanda non tacens becauſe reuealeth ſaults good men conſequence ſinceritie scripture ieſuite cur moſes narrauit ebrietatem noah primò vt ex hoc appareat ſimplicitas ſinceritas hiſtoriae omnia incorruptè narrantis perer ieſ • om gen • ver 21 〈◊〉 128 sed inquiunt manichaei ille iudas qui cum nuru ſua concubuit inter patriarchas computatur quaſi vero iſte iudas qui chriſtum prodidit non inter duodecim apoſtolos numeretur sic auguſtinus pererius ieſ com gen 35 verſ 19 diſp 4 num 24 pererius enforceth againſt manichee related drunkenneſſe noah ambroſe making triacle ſins patriarch holy men applieth vnto double vſe owne patriarcharū vitia scriptura expoſuit vt qui fortis tibi videris inquit ambroſius caueas ne cadas idem gen 19 etiā sanctorum lapſus vtilis eſt inquit ambroſ nihil mihi nocuit quòd negauit petius profuit quod emendauit mal donat ieſ comm matth 26 verſ vlt ieſuites witneſſe one caution vnto yet ſtand ſecond vnto ſinners ſpeedie ſerious conuerſion 4 particular exception offend cardinall eſpecially zealous defend reputation abrahā whileſt liued vr god called chaldaea therfore abraham ſeemed vnto caluine call haue bene idolater principall matter cardinall bellarmine vrgeth conuince caluine blaſphemons hereſie ala blindneſſe malignitie owne learned chronologer fuiſſe quidem abrahamum aliquando ſuperſtitionis idololatriae infectum docet genebrard ex ſententia duorū nobiliſſ rabbinorum—in hanc ſertentiam videtur propeaſior fuiſſe andreas mazius qui aetate noſtra comment edidit ioſhua non minus catholicos quàm eruditos atque diſertos verbis—non poſſum eos audi • e qui magno •• namine abrahamum ab hoc idololatriae ſcelere impuriſſimo vindicare neſcio quibus argutijs ſtudent quaſi verò non tantò illuſtrio • ſit gratia dei quâ illum eſt complexus quanto erat ille ſceleratior minuſue dignus fauore • anc opinionem apertiſſimis verbis confirmare videtur philo ex eo quòd deus dicitur appa • uiſſe abrahae cúm primùm profectus eſt ex chal • aea pererius ieſ com gen 11 lib 16 diſp 17 num • 55 256 c alth •• gh himſelfe diſſent opinion genebrard maintained ſamepoint directed iudgement two excellent rabbins doctor among • wes whoſe opinion ſeconded maſius ieſuite hath commended catholike writing confirmed iudgemēt philo abrahae vocatio inſtitutio nobis ethnicis veris abrahae filijs planè ſymbolum fuit atque typus nam quemadmodum ille credentium omniū pater chaldaeus cùm eſſet idololatra—veſtae cultor ab idololatria ad veram dei latriam eſt conuerſus—ita no c quodſi hoc cuipiam inſolens paradoxum videatur—is ſi hominis graeci diligentiſſimi probatiſſimiue teſtimonio suidam dico • eſt contentus certè non poteſt nobiſcum non ſentire latini authoris teſtimonio locupletiſſimè inſtructus nimirum auguſtini l 10 de ciuit dei cap vlt lindanus panopl lib 1 cap 11 pag 16 teſtimony auguſtine plaine iuſſus eſt abraham diſcedere de terra ſua de cognatione ſua de domo pattis ſui tunc ipſe primitus â chaldaeo • um ſuperſtitionibus liberatus vnum verum deum ſequendo coluit auguſt loco citato lindane ieſuite acknowledgeth gulielmus lindanus—haereſe •• expugnator poſſeuin ieſ appara • tit gulielmus expeller hereſies whoſe iudgemēt grounded vpon suidas augustine teach abraham bene idolater wherunto added one abraham might type men conuerſion grace▪ 2 magniſying grace god chuſing one ſtate idolatrie 3 becauſe god firſt manifeſted himſelfe abraham abraham ſaw god reaſons ſee among greek one suidas among latines auguſtine among iewes philo others among romaniſts genebrard maſius lindane opinion accuſer catholikes defending ſame doctrine true caluine without delay condemned contumelious heretike yet cannot otherwiſe whileſt accuſers meaſure thing leaden rule concerning particularity deſireth may conſult eſt quidem opinio nec paucorum nec ignobilium doctorum • acobum dicendo illa verba ego ſum eſau c mendacium officioſum dixiſſe pererius ieſ com gen • 7 diſp 4 initio see hereof cai • gen 27 simeō leui pererius gen 34 diſp 2 c grauiſſimè peccâſſe gen 37 diſp 2 theodoret ioſephus fratres accuſat non de vno aliquo certo crimine ſed vniuerſum indicâuit eos flagitioſâ vitâ fuiſſe romaniſts chap xx eight ninth romiſh accuſations romish accvsers firſt ariani docebant filium dei eſſe patre minorem vt eſt apud epiphan hae • 69—eundem errorem aperté docent hoc tempore multi qui trithei • ae 〈…〉 § 10 ariani arians taught son inferior vnto father ſo tritheits day protestant appeale teſtimonie aduerſaries sect 1 tritheits true vnto proteſtants vnto luther caluine melancthon quos nouo • arianos meaning tritheits lutherus caluinus philippus ſimiles vt haereticos impugnàrunt bellarm ibid § primum errorē witneſſeth aduerſarie impugned thoſe tritheits therefore might accuſer haue kept tritheits catalogue hereſies framed purpoſely againſt proteſtants ſeeing tritheits proteſtants romaniſts tritheits ſo romish accvsers caluinus dicit patrem eſſe deū per excellentiā quandam bellar praef controu de chriſt • § sed iam caluine ſaid father god kind excellency iure caluinum ponimus eorum haereticorum numero qui filij diuinitatem inficiati ſunt etenim ſenſit caluinus nomen dei 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 per excellentiam ſoli patri tribui valent ieſ lib 1 • vnit trinit c 9 initio therefore iuſtly reckon caluine among thoſe heretikes denied diuinitie chriſt scitè ſanè bozius aufers caluine inquit aequalitatem filio cum patre reſpectu naturae perſonae voluntatis generationis etiam nominis armandus ieſ epiſt ad chamierum parte altera pag 11 certainly caluine taught eſt hi • caluini atheiſmus poſſeuinus ieſ de notis diuini verbi l 3 pag 78 atheiſme protestant appeale according iudgement aduerſaries sect 2 2 thus haue bellarmine valentia armandus poſſeuinus foure ieſuites charged caluine blaſphemy poſſibly eſcape ſi pater eſt per excellentiā deus quomodo non eſt maior filio bellar quo ſuprà father excellency god greater sonne maine onely obiection accuſer doth enforce aſſoyled caluine muſt immediatly abſolued well let v firſt heare cardinall tolet hath ſomething purpoſe ioh 14 pater maior eſt aliqui ration • diuinitatis haec dictum eſſe cenſent vt nomen maioris non ſubſtantiae inaequalitatem—ſed originem dicat quia ab ipſo filius eſt non à filio pater hanc expoſitionem illuſtres doctores ſequuntur inter quos athanaſ orat 2 contrà arian baſil lib 4 contrà eunom greg nazianz orat 4 contrà arianos hilar l 9 de trinit orig 2 diuerſos tolet ieſ com ioh 14 28 pater eſt maior flio etiam quatenus filius deus erat non quidem reipſa ſed hoc ipſo quod ille pater hic filius erat patri • enim nomen honori • icentius eſt nomine filij quia principium vt graeci loquntur cauſam filij ſignificat sic exponunt athanaſius hilarius epiphaniu • greg nazianzenus cyrillus leontius chryſoſtomus theophylactus euthymius maldenat ieſ com ioh 14 28 ſaith occaſion ſaying chriſt iohn 14 father greater thought theſe word ſpoken chriſt reſpect diuinitie word greater vnderſtood inequalitie ſubſtantiall eſſence diuinitie originall begetting onely reſpect sonne father father sonne expoſition hath bene followed famous doctor namely athanaſius baſil gregory nazianzene hilary origen epiphanius cyrill leontius theophylact euthymius reſpect father obſerued biſhop bouius haue conſtit clementis cap 17 pater ſuper omnia deus—quòd ſic patrem appellauerit authoritas principij ſiue vt antiqui patres loquuntur excellentia cauſae effecit vt priſci illi omnem eminentiam ſoli deo patri tribuerint non quòd illa verbo ſpiritui detrahere voluerint longe enim abeſt talis ab corum pietate ſententia ſed quia hanc authoritatis praeſtantiam patri qui eſt fons origo diuinitatis tribuendam cenſueiunt quod nonnullis teſtimonijs confirmabo ignatij epiſt ad philipp epiphanij baſilij hilarij c bouius epiſcop schol lib 3 clement conſtit▪ apud suriū tō 1 conc fol 126 giuen eeminencie vnto father amongſt others recounteth clemens pretended pope rome alſo ignatius 3 ſentence heretikes called tritheits father ſame word viz father excellencie god contradictorie ſence caluine muſt neceſſarily acknowledged haue followed interpretation orthodoxall father haue bene confeſſed accuſer himſelfe haue sea aboue § 1 letter b impugned thoſe heretikes calleth tritheits greater dignitie could aduerſaries haue done vnto memorie caluine thus ſending foure ieſuits accuſe ſpeech excellencie father bring twelue father acquit among may make pope clement chiefe inqueſt next romish accvsation queſtion tradition ariani non recipiebant vllo modo traditiones non ſcriptas vt docet maximinus epiſcopus arianorum apud auguſt l 1 c 2 vlt contra maximin bellar c 9 de notis eccleſ § 10 ariani alterum errorem docent omnes huius temporis haeretici sectarij enim huius temporis omnes traditiones reijciunt ibidem § deinde alſo coccius theſaur cath tom 1 lib 8 art 3 arians allow vnwritten tradition teach sectariſts age reiecting tradition protestant appeale testimony aduerſaries sect 3 4 anſwer firſt accuſer ſhould haue ſhewed auguſtine cenſured arian heretikes depending altogether vpon scripture could auguſtine conflict ſame maximinus doth challenge leaue contention councels admit deciſion whole cauſe arianiſme nec ego nicenum nec tu debes ariminenſe c—scripturarum authoritatibus non quorumcun que proprijs ſed vtriuſque communibus teſtibus re cum r • cauſa cum cauſa ratio cum ratione concertet auguſt lib 3 contra maxim cap 14 scripture secondly arians relied wholy vpon scripture ſought defence doctrine confeſſed aboue lib 2 cap 25 lit bookes origen hermes laſtly secundò diſſidemus quòd illi exiſtimant apoſtolos quidem quaedam inſtituiſſe praeter scripturam quae ad ritus ordinem eccleſiae pertinent quae tamen non ſunt neceſſaria nec praecepta ſed libera nihil autem tradidiſſe praeter scripturam ad ſidem aut more neceſſariò pertinens bellarm l 4▪ de verbo dei cap 3 § secundò accuſer confeſſeth proteſtants vtterly reiect tradition therefore hath accuſer roued wide three mark arians auguſtine proteſtants article tradition haue intreated ſufficiently see aboue lib 2 cap 25 heretofore chap xxi romish accvsation concerning bleſſed virgine mary iouinianus • ſſeruit b mariam partu carnis virginitatem amiſiſſe ita referunt hieron l 1 2 contra iouin aug lib de haereſ cap 82 bellarm cap 9 de •• ti § • 2 iouinianus iouinian affirmed bleſſed virgine bearing loſe virginitie quartus error buceri ac molinaei eſt hic enim bucero authore tertia vnionis euangelicae parte affirmat ieſum naſcentem adape • uiſſe vuluam bellar ibid § quartus error bucer molinaeus ſaying bearing chriſt aperuit vuluam inter alias innumerabiles caluiniſtarum haereſes haec vna eſt quòd matrem chriſti partu virginem fuiſſe negent maldon ieſ com luc 2 23 greg valent ieſ tom 4 diſp 2 q 2 punct 2 caluiniſts herein heretikes protestant appeale teſtimonies romiſh aduerſaries sect 1 gabriel prateolus pariſian diuine booke profeſſedly written diſcouerie ancient hereſies interpreteth meaning auguſtine cenſuring iouiniā haue taught diuus quoque auguſtinus lib de haereſ illi impingit quòd dixerit b dei genitricē fuiſſe viro ſuo ioſeph carnaliter cognitam poſt chriſtum natū quod tamen illi non aſcribit b hieronymus qui contra eum duo • libros cō poſuit prateolus de ſect dogm hereſ lib 9 de iouinianis num 6 pag 241 pariendo corruptam vſed auguſtine interpreteth pariendo ſuppoſeth cognoſcere virum per coitum virilem indeed onely doth corrupt virginitie error heluidius whether iouinian prateolus ſeemeth doubt becauſe hierome writing two bookes againſt iouinian would haue paſſed ſuch blot bleſſed virgin birth chriſt knowne ioſeph accuſation lieth thus proteſtants ſaying bleſſed virgine bare chriſt sauiour manner woman aperiendo vuluam therefore teach bleſſed virgine birth chriſt know husband ioſeph manner wife bare child hereſie ſay iouinian doubtleſſe auguſt tom 6 haereſ 84 hereſie coccius freeth luther non probat c chargeth proteſtant coccius theſaur tom 1 lib 8 art 3 heluidius need exemplifie cruditie kinde logicke 2 yet loath proteſtants ſhould thus eſcape therefore condemne ſaying bleſſed virgine bearing chriſt vuluam aperire romaniſts haue one virginitatem corrumpere therefore loud ſhoot crie vpon proteſtants vpon curſed heretikes notwithſtanding proteſtants directed phraſe holy ghoſt luc 2 23 according rhemiſh tranſlation caried vnto ieruſalem preſent vnto lord written law euery male opening matrice ſhall called holy vnto lord whereupon diuerſe father wit theophylact ambroſe origen doubt ſay alij contrà hanc legem proprié ad chriſtum pertinuiſſe aſſerunt eò quòd ipſe ſolus aperuit vuluam matris ſuae cum alijs aperiat vir vterum quae eſt ſententia theophylacti ſuper hoc loco ſimiliter ambrofij ſi • ſcribentis non enim vitilis coitus vuluae virginalis ſecreta reſerauit ſed immaculatum ſemen inuiolabili vtero ſpiritus ſanctus infudit hic ergo ſolus aperuit ſibi vuluam nec mirum qui enim dixerat ad prophetam priuſquam te formarem vtero noui te vulua matris ſanctificam te qui ergo vuluam ſanctificauerat alienam vt naſceretur propreta hic eſt qui aperuit matris ſuae vuluam vt immaculatus exiret similia habet origenes hom 14 ſuper luc sacratum inquit quippiam ſonat quem cunque enim de vtero effuſum marem dixeris non ſic aperit matris ſuae vuluam vt ieſus quia omnium mulierum non partus infantis ſed coitus viri vuluam reſerat vt ſecundùm ambrofiū chriſto proprium eſt aperire vterum matris ita etiam quod ſequitur lege ſanctum vocari domino solus en • ipſe verè ſanctus inter primogenitos cum multi alioqui eſſent ſceleratiſſimi ianſenius concord euang cap 10 pag 74 col 1 chriſt immaculate one alone without preceding act man matris ſuae vuluam aperuit witneſſeth owne biſhop ianſenius therefore aſſertion proteſtants yet appeareth propheticall euangelicall 3 accuſers ſhall longer vrge act maner thereof ſome proteſtants haue deſcribed manner childbirth claustra virginalis vuluae reſerare manner indeed denied ſome father yet hereticall though implied proper corruption virginitie elder b rhenanus doth deliuer v expreſſe teſtimony ancient tertulliā ſaying deinde quòd dicit tertull mariam patefacti corporis lege peperiſſe cùm omnes hodie theologorum centuriae chriſtum clauſo virginis vtero prodijſſe velint—sed haec ſunt boni conſulenda tam vetuſto ſcriptore quo vix alium chriſtianus orbis antiquiorem habet nam qui diuinare potuit quid ſubtiles iſt • theologi tot poſt ipſum ſeculis eſſent definituri b rhenanus arg lib tert de chriſti carne pag 13 mariam patefacti corporis lege peperiſſe neuer imputed vnto hereſie inſomuch forenamed rhenanus reuerence memory father doth ſcorne new contrary ſubtiltie romiſh schoole therefore haue late romaniſts taken order whole teſtimonie ſhould deleantur ſequentia b rhenano arg libri de carne chriſti quod officit ſingulari perfectioni virginis matris index expurg apud iunium pag 78 blotted 4 wiſe men generation albeit herein leſſe wiſe blotting old author yet bolting new effect ſhall iuſtifie former aſſertion clauſtra virginalis vuluae perfringere non eſt virginitatem corrumpere ieſuite pererius ſaith intelligendum eſt quòd corruptio tria dicit 1 clauſtrorum muliebrium apertionem poenalem paſſ foedam delectationem quorum primum naturae eſt alterum poenae tertium corruptionis vitioſae quae medium tenet inter culpam poenam si igitur vir vxorem cognouiſſet tempore inſtitutae naturae fuiſſet ibi clauſtorum apertio non tamen poenalis paſſio nec foeda delectatio bonauent 2 sent diſt 20 qu 4 quae quidem ſententia mihi perplacet pererius ieſ gen 2 ver 27 l 4 num 236 clauſtrorum apertio might haue bene time man innocency ieſuit cardinall notandum eſt quòd foemina quamuis ab alio ſupereretur ſi non conſentiat interiùs actu turpi non peccat nec virginitatem amittit tolet ieſ inſtruct sacerd l 5 c 6 § quartus caſus tolet booke caſes conſcience framed generall inſtruction prieſts doubted ſet downe maxim woman violently abuſed non amittit virginitatem iudging virginitie morally naturally diuine philoſopher due vnderſtanding theſe premiſed teſtimonies doth yeeld v inſight maladie romiſh accuſers make proteſtants heretikes haue created ſaid rhenanus new becauſe ſo ſome naturall diſeaſe onely maide might ſayd virginitatem amiſiſſe vnlearned hereſie viz clauſtra virginalia reſerare eſt virginitatem corrumpere chap xxii xi xii romish accvsations firſt concerning originall ſinne pelagiani docebant non eſſe hominibus peccatum originale praecipuè filijs fidelium ita refert auguſt lib 6 contra iulian cap 2 3 lib 4 ad bonifac c 2 4 hoc diſerte docent bucerus calumus solùm filijs fidelium negant peccatum originale quos dicunt ſanctos naſci ſaluari etiam ſine baptiſmo bellar l 4 c 9 de notis § 14 pelagiani pelagianam haereſin calumus renouat cùm c lindanus panopl lib 4 cap 15 pelagians ſaid originall ſinne men eſpecially child faithfull doctrine bucer caluine protestant appeale teſtimonies romiſh aduerſaries sect 1 cardinall bellarmine lindane two greateſt panopliſts armorer church rome hath bent againſt proteſtants bring within compaſſe damnable hereſie caluine ſay teacheth originall ſinne eſpecially child faithfull ſo gregory de valentia ieſuite publike reader schooles contrarily affirmeth lutherus caluinus caeteri nouatores adeò non negauerunt peccatum originale vt magna etiam contentione illud aſſerant prodigioſis etiā loquendi formulis neque minus falſis ac impijs illud ſupra modum exaggerauerint greg valent ieſ de orig pecc c 2 initio luther caluine nouellers ſo calleth ſo farre denying originall ſinne vehemently prodigious maner ſpeech falſely impiouſly exaggerate aboue meaſure vnto adioyne ieſuite vaſquez likewiſe inueigheth againſt caluine luther alter error eſt aliorum noſtri temporis qui affirmant eſſentiam peccati originalis eſſe concupiſcentiā fomitem qui no ad malum inclinat—ita expreſſè tradiderunt lutherani— caluinus quare confeſſione auguſtana hoc peccatum appellârunt maximum vaſquez ieſan thom tom 1 diſp 132 cap 1 num 2 affirming concupiſcence part originall ſinne greateſt ſinnes 2 counterpoiſe owne witneſſes two ſay proteſtants denie originall ſinne child vnbaptized two ſay affirme originall ſinne yea party baptized theſe kind witneſſes conſpire againſt proteſtants proue heretikes elder proue suzanna adultereſſe daniel teacheth put witneſſes aſunder falſhood found contrarietie forenamed elder theſe two aſſertions proteſtants denie originall ſinne proteſtants denie originall ſinne rather extremely affirme fall vpon text marc 14 56 bare falſe witneſſe teſtimonies agree iuſtification proteſtants confeſsion aduerſaries sect 2 3 may proteſtants abſolued hath bene confeſſed either denie originall ſinne ſo better pelagian heretikes elſe much affirme exaggerate thus falſe impious nouellers whether therefore thus ſo proteſtants muſt condemned doctrine concerning originall ſinne old new error skilleth decreed muſt condemned 4 seuere iudges precipitate doctrine proteſtants concerning nature originall ſinne hath receiued better approbation owne extreme aduerſarie ecchius romaniſts haue named see catalogue beginning appeale word ecchius onely challenger time defence catholike faith diſputation holden wormes acknowledge ex hac explicatione magi apparet notio peccati originis quod carentia illius originalis iuſtitiae conſiſtit addita vitioſa concupiſcentia quae legi mentis repugnat ad illicitos motus actus perpetuò inclinat haec itaque definitio peccati originis doctrinae veterum recentiorum magi eſt conſentanea sed de hoc articulo agnoſcit ipſe ecchius nullam eſſe controuerſiā vt qui colloquio wormatienſi planè conciliatus concordatus fuerit▪ hanc quam diximus ſententiam caſſander conſult art 2 de pecc orig pag 3 article concerning nature originall ſinne difference betweene aduerſaries plainely vega extolled caniſius ieſuite one see catalogue word vega principall diuines preſent councell trent et probauit haec ſancta ſynodus confirmauit per omnia vtrumque iſtorum canonum decreto de pecc originali et hac tota doctrina nihil quod ſciam à nobis diſſentiunt lutherani conſtanter vbique ſatis nobiſcum conſentaneè illam docent proteſtantes ſuis confeſſionibus apologijs libellis alijs damnati verò ſunt hac patrum definitione pelagiani armeni albanenſes alij ſi qui fuerunt qui negârunt peccatum originale vega de natura legis imbecill lib 2 cap 6 § et probauit lutheranes ſaith differ v ſo farre know point concerning doctrine originall ſinne proteſtants teach confeſsions apology bookes doctrine originall ſinne constantly conſonantly v thoſe condemned councell trent pelagians armenian albanenſes others denied originall ſinne ſeeth prauitie theſe accuſers might haue become paſſe proteſtants maner exaggeration originall ſinne making greateſt ſinne rather haue controlled ſome owne men diminution making taperus tom 1 pag 36 dixit pecca • um originale non eſſe propriè ſed abuſiuè p • ccatū— coſterus euchirid dicimus peccatum hoc originis omniū peccatorum reatu minimum quia minimū habet ex voluntate quae eſt fons origo peccati—andrad lib 3 aduerſ refut conc trid poenitentia verò quae propriam operationem neceſſariò exigit etſi originali peccato adniberi poſſit qui tamen neceſſariam eſſe du • originalis peccati nomen non ſatis perpendit teſte pelarg ieſuitiſ loco ſexto leaſt ſinne yea alſo properly ſinne next romish accvsation pelagianiſme concerning nature ſinne whether euery ſinne ſelfe mortall secundò pelagiani dicuot omne peccatū eſſe mortale ita refert hieron l 2 contra pelag bellarm cap 9 de notis § 14 pelagiani hunc errorem docent omnes sectarij lutherus caluinus c ibid pelagians ſay euery ſinne mortall hierome relateth error proteſtants protestant appeale according teſtimonies romiſh aduerſaries sect 3 5 place hierome onely witneſſe brought proue pelagians guiltie hereſie article appeareth nothing purpoſe auguſtine called malleus haereticorum mallet againſt heretikes beateth pelagians vnto duſt yet neuer layeth ſuch thing charge nay owne romiſh relators hereſies namely alphonſ haereſ castro prateolus elench sect prateolus thoſe later citeth lindane staphylus hoſius diſcouering pelagian doctrine deſtinately bent intitle proteſtants hereſie haue bene point altogether ſilent take ſufficient conuiction accuſer feining old hereſy alſo hereſie orthodoxal truth moſt owne author haue see aboue alreadie auouched according promiſe returne vnto romiſh application distinction mortall veniall ſinnes confuted sect 4 6 seeing romaniſts called catholikes confeſſing man liue without ſinne life ſhall brand proteſtants name heretikes ſaying impoſsible keepe law onely anſwer quòd autem auguſtinus ſem per loquatur de ſolis venialibus quoties fine peccato neminem iuſtorum eſſe docet perpetua eius doctrina oſtendit toto ferè 2 lib de pecc merit remiſſ toto lib 3—ex hac ergo diſtinctione diligenter notandum eſt neminem quidem ſic poſſe legem adimplere quin venialiter peccet quàm ſaepiſſimè stapleton doctr prin l 6 de perfect iuſt cap 5 stapleton vſeth would haue v marke diligently none fulfill law god without veniall ſinnes ſay muſt confeſſe together proteſtants impoſsibilitie abſolute performance law ſaith cardinall et quia quod non eſt perfectè voluntarium hoc ipſo etiam non eſt perfectè contra legem niſi materialiter proptereà rect • dicunt▪ theologi peccata veniala euiuſcunque tandem generis • ▪ ſint non eſſe contra legem ſed praeter legē quod totum etian hac ratione confirmari poteſt si peccatum veniale perfecte ac propriè eſſet contra legem ſequeretur hominem iuſtum ſtatim atque vnum peccatum veniale commiſit eſſe verè ac perfect • legis praeuaricatorem per hoc reum omnium coeleſtium praeceptorum iuxta illud apoſtol • lacobi qui offendit vno factus eſt omniū reus bellar l 1 de amiſſ grat cap 11 § denique becauſe veniniall ſinnes perfectly voluntarie therefore onely praeter legem beſides law formally contra legem contrary vnto law confeſſing call veniall ſinne nature properly mortall offending one veniall doth make man guiltie tranſgreſsion whole law conſequently doth inferre impoſsibilitie keeping law 7 wherefore concerneth v onely proue veniall ſinne praeter beſides euen contrà contrarie vnto law god yet neede proue owne doctor confeſſe namely ieſuite dicendum verò eſt vt docuerunt durandus caietanus vega veniale peccatum eſſe quidem contra legem azor ieſ inſtit moral part 1 l 4 c 8 § dicendum azorius guarded conſent durand caietane vega might haue ad • ed stapleton teach muſt ſay veniall contrary vnto god law opinion diſtinguunt alij peccata venialia à mortalibus quòd haec contra mandata ſint illa verò leues quaedam culpae duntaxat praeter ipſa commiſſae—verùm hanc ſenten • iam pe •• ulti scholaſtici impugnant contra mandata illa eſſe affirmant eorumue ſentententia communior nunc videtur scholis vega de iuſtif l 14 c 13 initio vega liued time councell trent actor therein called common iudgement schoolemen ſtandeth vpon inuincible reaſon ieſuite valentia acknowledgeth wit nam vbi lex non eſt neque praeuaricatio legis inquit apoſtolus et id dauid praeuaricantes reputauit omnes peccatores terrae quoniam ne intelligi quidem peccatū poteſt quod non ſit legis alicuius tran • greſſio greg val ieſ de diff vet nouae legis part 2 c 2 § denique man conceiue ſinne tranſgreſsion law proper tranſgreſſion law formally contrary vnto law therefore doth vega wiſh men et decet vbique vt noſtros ſermone scripturis ſanctorū patrum verbis attemperemus idque vt faciamus imprimis ſtatuendum eſt peccata venialia eſſe proprie ſimpliciter peccata sunt namque actus mali ſimpliciter quippe qui voluntarij circa materiam indebitam à rectum • atione deuiant ac diſſentiunt poena reprehenſione digni • ure apud omnes cenſentur et abſolutè concedendum eſt non ſolùm propter ea non amari deum neque placere no deo ſed étiam quicquid quidam magnus doctor incauté dixc • diſplicere illa deo propter ea verè deum offendi vega quoſuprà § et decet frame ſpeeches according vnto scripture word magn • tudine aut multitudine virtutum ſuarum▪ ſuperbiam extollantur nam cum barba quae vitilis ſexus aetatis eſt index fortitudinem prudentiam aliaſue virtutes ſignificet perfecto viro dignis idcirco eam ſancti viti abſcindere vel abradere iubentur vt ex hoc intelligant oportere eos omnem propriae virtutis conſidentiam abijcere meminiſſe virtutes ſuas quamtum libet magnas multas vitijs christi paſſa est diuinity chriſt ſuffred impaſsibly nailed vnto croſſe certaine ſaith vigilius diuinitie godhead meane god likewiſe auguſtine doubted ſay diuine nature borne humane nature ieſuite suarez eaſily diſcerneth diuine truth ſpeech ſaying dicit auguſtinus natura aeterna atque diuina non naſcitur ex humana natura niſi ſecundum veritatem naturae humanae ex quo effici videtur diuinam montani ex ea agnitione pacem eccleſi • aſiae phrygiae inferentem à praxea fuiſſe perſuaſum hteras pacis reuocare quas iam emiſerat—quare rhenanus annot ad tertull ponit hoc loco margine epiſcopus meaning zepherinus montamzat et paulò p • ſt zepherinus liued yeare 198 noted tertulli • n haue acknowledged prophecy montanus rhenanus expoundeth montaniſt aduerſaries profeſſe reſpondeo non eſſe ninò fidem habendam tertulliano hac parte quandoquidem ipſe montaniſta erat—credibile eſt zepher num perſuaſum fuiſſe—falſ • de illis erroribus accuſatos fuiſſe montaniſtas—hoc autem non eſt e rare circa fidem nec montanizare vt mentitur rhenanus ſed errare circa perſonā id quod multis alijs ſanctis v • ri accidit bellar l 1 de rom pont c 8 § sextò c credit tertullian herein rhenanus diſcredit ſlatly giue lic whoſe teſtimonie notwithſtanding may ſeeme credible becauſe aduerſaries haue nothing coniecturall credibilitie oppoſe againſt 3 pope marcellinus liued anno 296 recorded ancient hiſtories haue committed idolatrie fatemur ſiquidem fieri poſſe vt petri ſucceſſor idola colat quod b marcellinum ſeciſſe aiunt apud ſe fortè de fide non rectè ſentiat adeó que dia • olicis artibus operam nauet—ſed id conſtanter negamus vica • io chriſti petriue ſucceſſores romanos pontifex vel haereſin docere alios poſſe vel errorem proponere •• ſ • erus • ſ • nchirid cap 3 pag 137 § fatemur ieſuite granteth might happen vnto pope yet pope could euer teach others hereſie ſaith conſtantly denie though publike practiſe idolatry ſelfe profeſſion moſt diuelliſh hereſie therfore cardinall bellarmine ſhew although leſſe conſtancie yet policie conceſſimus marcellinum idolis ſac • ificaſſe sed non videtur • vnino certum bellar recog lib de ſumin • pont pag 20 § eodem confeſſed idolatrous fact marcellinus afterwards call truth ſtorie queſtion 4 pope liberius liued 350 yeare concerning whoſe hereſie haue teſtimonie theſe ancient • athanaſias verò hieronymus locis citatis ap •• tè dicunt eum taedio exilij inflexum tandem fuiſſe ad ſubſcriptionem haereſeos quibus addi poteſt hilarius qui lib aduerſus conſtant ita loquitur vertiſti deinde vſque ad romam bellum tuum eripuiſh illine epiſcopum ô te nuſerum qui neſe •• virum maiori impretate relegaueris quàm remiſeris anſwereth—athanal hilar hicron authores ſunt tum • iq •• • e tum grauiores caeteris rem non dubiam ſed vt certam exploratam narrant praeterea legi ipſe epiſtolas •• berij manuſcriptas ex vaticana •• bliotheca quae partim ad imperatorem partim ad epiſcopos orientales ſcriptae eraut quibus ſatis apertè ſignificabat ſe tandem imperatoris voluntati acquieſcere voluiſſe ad haec niſi fateamur liberium aliquo tempore defeciſſe à conſtantia fide tuenda cogimu • • elicem 2 qui liberio viuente pontificatum g • ſſit à numero pontificum excludere cùm tamen hunc ipſum felicem vt papam • rtyrem eccleſia catholica veneretur bella • l 4 •• rom pont c 9 § athanaſius qualifieth ſaying ſu • ſcribe vnto hereſie interpretatiuè ſubſcribing condemnation athanaſius father wit athanaſius hierome hilary noting haue ſubſcribed vnto hereſy arians aduerſaries would haue v thinke directly ſubſcribe outward communion arians conſenting perſecuting athanaſius athanaſius columna eccleſiae aduerſus haereticos poſſeuinus 〈◊〉 apparat tit athanaſius pillar catholike church principall aduerſarie againſt thoſe heretikes cauſed men thinke giuen ſubſcriptiō vnto hereſie inſomuch fame went thē currāt secundum igitur eam famam de liberio longè latèque ſparſam hieronymus tradidit ipſum haereſi ſubſcripſiſſe baron anno 357 num • 5 • 3 euery liberius ſubſcribed vnto arianiſme thē romane catholicks tamen quòd adeò turpiter conſtantio conceſſiſſet pl • imùm ab ſe animos abalienatos inuenit ſicue qui felicem antea abhorrebant vitataue eius communione inhaerentes erant liberio audita ab eo deficientes felici catholicae fider vexillum extollenti ſeſe iunxerunt à quo tempore coepit felix ante ſchiſmaticus haberi iam ab illis legitimus rom eccleſiae pontifex exiſtimatuſue liberius ob manfeſtam cum haereticis communicationem ex epiſtolis ab eo ſcriptis de conniuentia cum arianis à communicatione catholicorum prorſus extorris impoſſibile eſſe iudicantibus cunctis eundem liberium communicare poſſe haereticis atque catholicis cùm igitur adeò manifeſtè conſtaret de eius communione inita sirinij cum haereticis ex eo ipſo neceſſariò videbatur excluſus communione catholica atque ob id etiam à pontificatus functione penitus alienus baron ibid num 57 renoūced liberius adhered vnto felix vnto lawfull pope tametſi enim liberius haereticus non erat tamen habebatur propter pacem cum atianis factam haereticus ex ea praeſumptione meritò potuit •• pontificatus abrogari non enim homines tenentur aut poſſunt corda ſcrutari ſed quē externis operibus haereticum eſſe vident ſimpliciter haereticum iudicant ac vt haereticum damuant bellar l 4 de rom pon c 9 § poſt becauſe examining onely according outward behauiour ſimply iudge heretike beſt fauourableſt anſwer either bellarmine baronius chiefe aduocates liberius could returne v behalf ſay actiuely heretike euince ſentence father hierome ſaying et hoc habebatur deteſtabilis fortunatianus quòd liberium rom vrbis epiſcopū pro fide ad exilium pergentē primus ſolicitauit ac fregit ad ſubſcriptionem haereſeos compulit hieron catalog eccleſ tit fortunatianus tom 1 ſubſcribe see obiect aboue letter c hilarie see confeſſion cuſanus letter auguſtine intimate exiled arians reſiſting arian hereſie ſo recalled againe freed becauſe ſubſcribed vnto
